text: I had Harami Miso. Korean Prime Kalbi. Bulgogi. Pork belly. and mushroom medley. They're tasty and fresh. Service is good as well.

We are from out of town and came due to the number of reviews and ratings. I'm not sure if I like this... despite this I was not disappointed. We just ordered the 5 different meat platters for 6 people. We came in on a Monday afternoon and had to wait for 30min...due to limited large table seating. We just asked to sit in a small booth and squeeze in, which they allowed. Service was okay.
Come to this place! You get to grill your own beef (which is a lot of fun) and the staff is very friendly and attentive. They also have lit music
The wait wasn't that long and the dwen jang jjigae was pretty good! With the exception of being charged extra for lettuce, was a great experience!

Very nice food and service! 
First time here, I visited here when I am traveling. Good location and easy to park.
Food here is nice and with reasonable price. You should come and check out.
I really enjoyed my time at gangnam bbq,they have a great happy hour special that I recommend to my friends.

BEST.FOOD.EVER.
Cheap,good food that everyone likes.The meat is heaven food.Would definately come again.
Just visited this restaurant and the quality and variety of beef options are wide. Love their Korean premium Kalbi beef, their Beef Toro and bulgogi

Updated review:  We celebrated my sister-in-law's birthday here last night.  None of us have tried this place.  We were really impressed with the food.  We loved the side dishes, especially the squid. Right behind our booth, someone else was celebrating their birthday and the staff sang a  birthday song and gave him/her a complimentary dessert.  So we had to tell them it was my sister-in-law's birthday also.  Our waiter assured us she would get a dessert too.  On the corner of our booth, I was excited to see that they give a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp  at the time of the visit.  It was a limited time offer so I wanted to take advantage of that. I showed the pictures to my 4 year old nephew and as soon as he saw the colorful macaron ice cream, which he called "ice cream burger", he asked for it right away.  I had to coax him to finish his food first  before we  get him the free ice cream.  He agreed and waited so patiently for it.  While everyone's eating, I downloaded the Yelp app so I could rate the restaurant and get the macaron ice cream for my nephew.  I followed the instructions and gave them a really good rating based on the food itself which was a 5 star for everyone.  I got up to use the restroom and asked my husband to show the review to them (as required). However, when I returned, my sister-in-law's complimentary dessert  was already there.   They didn't sing her a song either. It, unfortunately,  wasn't what my nephew had been waiting for. Our server told us that they would only honor one.  I'm not upset about not getting the free dessert cause we could have bought him one right there instead.  For one, it was already late. I just  didn't want to see my nephew disappointed.  We'll just buy him one in the morning from somewhere else.
We ordered the gangnam combo and the meat was perfect. The kalbi was the best one I've had so far. Very cute interior decor.
Fast becoming one of our local favorites. Quality Korean BBQ at very reasonable prices!

I was very puzzled at how this place can get a 4.5 stars until I saw on the ad on the dining table that you get free desserts if you review on Yelp. That explained the rating well for me.

I would have given it a 2 star if it was located in LA. But I believe different city should have different standards especially with Asian food. 

The food itself wasn't that bad , it was random. The brisket definitely was the worst I ever had in any k bbq place. It was thick and watery.  Steam egg = 1/10.  Fried yakisoba = 2/10 - the noodle was edible , but the beef was not.  However to be fair, the other meat plates were good, especially the prime rib - one of the best I ever had in kbbq. 

Now the service. There was no service. Never refilled our soda, never attempted to change our grill plate despite it being totally unusable, and I saw they saw how dirty it was, but they just passed by! If it was back in LA, the plate would have at least been changed 3-4 times. 
 
So all in all, will never go back , and won't recommend to anyone who truly enjoys kbbq.
Good S@!t...liked the meal a lot. A good experience for the taste buds. Macaroon ice cream for dessert is not to be missed.
Very delicious high quality meats! I loved the Kobe ssam topped with uni, perfect combination of flavors. Also got the beef tongue, kalbi, and duck breast which were also good!
Bomb.com.  BBQ place that doesn't make you smell like BBQ.  Servers are all awesome.   Toto beef is sooo good.  Nice clean atmosphere.
Very nice bbq. Everything is super. Kobe beef was indeed very good and worth the price! Servers are great too.
My date and I went with the Gangnam Grill for 2 and is was more than enough food! The food was excellent and service was A++. Can't wait to come back!!

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. It is not all you can eat which always means better quality of food. All the meat choices we had were very good and high quality. 

The soups and and all the side dishes are very authentic and had great flavors. The honey toast as dessert was amazing. 

All the staff was very nice and professional service was amazing as well.
This is the best Korean BBQ in Vegas!!!!!!! I would advise everyone to eat here when they come to Vegas. It's a 6 star restaurant and a definite 10/10 and would eat here every time.

Excellent.  I ordered way too much, as they give you the complimentary side dishes too (of which I wasn't aware).  The steak, pork and chicken were all excellent, probably the garlic steak the best, and the side dishes interesting.

Great food and ambiance!! We took a lyft from The Aria to get here and the location is very easy to find although it's away from the strip. Their serving size is big compared to others. It's worth your money. Definitely coming back!
This was an excellent meal! Besides the wait.. The food and service is totally worth it, everyone is so happy and friendly. Definitely see myself coming back here again!

Good food, particularly the spicy tuna kimbap and the house salad. However, service during happy hour starting 10 pm needs a lot of improvement. First, 2 servers are not enough for 10 tables and a line of people waiting to be seated. The staff was working hard, but I must suggest a major improvement on friendliness and appreciating their customers (instead of tossing our bill on the table).
Great food and service! Make sure to try poppers and bulgogi. Fun to cook your own food too.

Good Korean flavors. Meats are good and relatively priced ok. May need to up their ban chan cups a little so people don't have to keep asking for Kim chee . Service has been good to average the three times I've been. Overall a good spot for good Korean food. My lady friend loved the free macaroon with the yelp check in.
Yummy Korean BBQ! Best I have ever had. First time here and I love it I will be back once I come to Vegas again

Delicious food! Pretty good service too. But a little expensive considering it wasn't all you can eat. It was my first time at Korean BBQ so I wasn't familiar with all the foods. But I liked almost everything.

Very disappointed with our experience at Gangnam last night.  We were a party of seven and before our six and seven were seated the waitstaff were already trying to take our order.  We were then persuaded by the waitstaff to order the 'Meat Lovers' combo for six which they informed us comes with three servings of each meat.  Two servings of meat later our grills were turned off and the dessert menu placed in our hand.  We informed the waitstaff that we were expecting another serving of meat but we were quickly shrugged off and informed that we received our three servings and that they were split among the trays on either side of our table.  Problem is they never brought the second tray with our third serving of meat.

Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere that does all you can eat with better pricing and doesn't try to swindle their customers.

Intrigued by all these yelp reviews, I decided to come forward and see what the hype was all about. I love korean bbq, I love japenese bbq, but I've never tried both at the same time. Where to start?

Staff was nice, only took about 7 1/2 minutes in between to refill my water from when it was empty and full. Ordered that $70 combo meal with a side of pork belly.

Sauces came out and dropped off with no description, but thank god for having taste buds I were able to figure out what each sauce was.

Meats came out before all the appetizers, and I guess raw oysters were to serve as my dessert? Lol.. The filet mignon did not go well with my raw oysters, as well as my super sweet and sauced up bibimbap. Teriyaki sauce galore I guess.

Meat quality was probably close to tofu hut which would of been nice if they had a $10 AYCE.


House salad was meh, soup was meh meh, everything meh. Granite the staff was nice and lagged on getting stuff for us, like water, dropped chopsticks, and napkins and all that. No biggie I'm asian, I'm use to eating with my hands.

I normally don't like to bash on businesses but I feel like this place has gotten way more love than they should. All the 4 or 5 star ratings might have come from drunks or people with no taste buds. Best of luck to this place, yelp you failed me.
Food here is great.  It's hard to find good Korean BBQ  places in Las Vegas.  Definitely must try
Definitely an experience!  The food was so good and you got such a variety of delicious food!  Well worth every dollar.  The service was great and quick!
This is the second Korean bbq restaurant that we've been too and this one by far is one of the best ones here in Las Vegas! Portions are just right it even made my husband full!
Looks so great , love it so much , must try this one . We order beef and chicken , taste really good .great
Very good quality K-BBQ.  Ordered "Meat Lover for 2" and was more than enough food to feed the family with a teen Alger and a toddler.  Will definitely visit again the next time in Las Vegas
Fantastic service and the food is the best Korean BBQ around! Kids and adults loved the pork and beef.  The spicy Ramen was also the bomb!
Amazing food!!!! Fast service great meat loved the Korean Kalbi and bulgogi. Nice atmosphere and pretty good bathroom. One of the best Korean places I've ever been to.  A treasure of Vegas!
A great new hidden find in vegas! Their lunch happy hour is amazing prices and food is actually better than most in china town. Dynamite shrimp is a hit!
Nice authentic Korean BBQ. We, a group of five, visited this store on Monday night and it was as busy as weekend's night. The food was really good and stuffs were very nice.
So much yummy food!! Wait is very long, but worth it~ their most popular the gangnam style.

Came to celebrate double birthdays.  Good food... Lots of food.  We ordered two of the premium sets of food.  They allowed appetizer substitution  That was nice.  Great friendly service! Wasnt that hard to get to even with NFR right next door.  Free dessert birthday!! Will definitely recommend and come back.

I came in at around 7 and they told us we had about an hour of waiting. There is a bench area where you can wait and the play music videos for entertainment. The wait didn't feel too long and if you're wondering if it's worth the wait, let me tell you : it's worth it.

I'd recommend beef tongue, which they serve with a lemony sauce which was my favorite among the meat dishes. All the must try juicy cuts are also very good if you're just getting into Korean barbecue. Also don't forget to order the Sanchu lettuce wrap because it's a must with Korean barbecue. 

At first I thought they were too busy to help us but they're nice and if you ask them for anything, they'll tend to you. It would be a nicer experience if you know at least a bit about Korean barbecue and how to eat it because the waiters and waitresses are a bit busy. But overall worth the experience!
First Korean yakiniku spot that we hit up and it's an easy 10/10!!! Quality meat and service that will most definitely put you to sleep.  Coming back, with friends, is most definitely happening.
Awesom Korean BBQ for a great price! We initially went because it was within walking distance to HRH but went back again during our stay because we couldn't get enough.

I've been to many korean bbq's in town and I have to say this is probably my favorite place.  Their Premium package for two people was enough to fill up a party of three. Its a good thing my girlfriend and I eat like cows! A MUST for kbbq eaters out there!

Great  food. Good service. We did lunch menu and we are stuffed!!!!
Gotta try this place.
I gave 4 stars because I still need to try the all you can eat.
Bulgogi is very tasty.

I ate here for the first time with my Dad. Our waiter explained everything and we ordered several random dishes to cook ourselves.
Friendly service, great food and a truly unique dining experience!

This place is so so so so good! Great service and fantastic prices, good music and great vibes!
We finished all our food and are gonna attack some deeeeeeesserts!

Really great food, here, and I'm not really a big "Korean food" guy. I've never had such tasty raw oysters, and I'm from the south! The bibimbap was also really good, usually very bland at restaurants. Only knocking a star off for the K-Pop-wannabe server guys, all trying to act cool and barely acknowledging our existence. Also, the weird knock-off rap videos on a projector (the songs were real, but I don't think it was really the artists...looked like some celebrity look-alikes); just didn't get how this fit in a place like this. The food made me forget all that, though!

Solid service and good quality food, will visit again.

The food selection was good and the equipments are new.

Salad was very impressive. One of the pepper was extremely hot, every other one was normal.

Meat was good quality.
First time here, but start to loving this place! The food was so yum and service was good too!

This place is a bit tucked away in an unexpected plaza away from Korea town but it worth the trip! Great quality meat, delicious sides, great ambiance, and amazing customer service. Definitely worth the drive & must try restaurant.
Food is soo good and the portions are just enough for everyone! Def recommendable and we'll be back again!
Very good Korean BBQ, highly recommend! This is the third time we ate here.Almost tried all kind of the meat, I love the beef toro and Korean prime rib best!!!
We ordered Las Vegas set. Beef is delicious and small sides are very nice! Enjoyed a great dinner!

We were there having lunch while in Vegas for our cousin's wedding. Food was amazing and our server BACK was very sweet and friendly, and really made the difference on our experience. MUST VISIT!!!! 
Save room for dessert, cause macaroon Ice Cream is a MUST :)
Best Korean BBQ I've had in Las Vegas.  Order dessert early as takes 20 minutes but awesome.  Kalbi and bulgolgi were best.  Service was great.

I was very nervous about the "grill your own meat at the table" situation. I am a horrible cook and was terrified I would burn it. However, the quality of meat and marinade on it far surpassed my cooking novice. It tasted amazing! We ordered a few meats and shared. We also had the seaweed salad, chicken chile dumplings, and mushroom medley (came at happy hour and stuck to the special menu mainly). Everything tastes great. We love all the tiny bowls of... garnishes? They gave us and the waiter was patient and explained what each of them were. Delicious and definitely worth the money, especially during happy hour.
As a first timer to Korean bbq I was thoroughly pleased with the food and also our waiter mr back was awesome!

Nice place and food. Ordered meat lover for 2 and 4 more additional dishes for four people. Like the beef tongue, pork belly, and beef toro a lot. Good place for family dinner. Just the waiting time is a little bit too long.
The food is good, but the service is tooooo slow!!! Not recommend if you are not free for a 2 hour dinner!

Really cool atmosphere with good music. The service was excellent and they were pretty friendly. We got the 2 person combo for 55. Must have was the spicy pork! Also the strawberry mochi was super delish at the end and a great pallete cleanser

I gave this experience five stars. 
It is A really good restaurant. 
The service here is very decent. 
Their location is very close to the hotel area. 
Overall

Trendy korean Bbq place off the strip, Jin our server was super friendly and smart to put the water in a plastic to go cups for my 3 boys(spill proof) Smart!!! Food came within minutes to our table. Totally recommend!
The miso soup is on point. The soft tofu soup looks like melted cheese. Yum. So good. Get the yuzu soju.

Excellent food, excellent service. The waiters were handsome to boot  We came during the rush on Thanksgiving and even then the wait was only 15 minutes. I never had to wait for my drink to be refilled and we weren't harassed by the staff at all. My mom is a born and raised Korean and she has nothing but great things to say about the quality of the food. The location is walking distance from UNLV and only a 5 minute drive from the strip, check it out!
We have tried many Korean bbq in California but we believe this the best one we ever have.

This place is great but the service is horrible. My table wasn't cleared once and I had 8 empty plates and ran out of water for at least 20min. Train your staff about service and cleanliness. Never coming back to this establishment again. Honey pig or DJK is way better. Save your time and money and go somewhere else besides here.

Really enjoyed the visit here! Got the meat lover combo for 6 and everyone of us came out absolutely stuffed! Our favorite was the filet mignon cut! Super tender and flavorful! Its a pretty good deal for $140 for the 6 of us...definitely worth trying!
Great food! It's not AYCE but you honestly don't need to stuff yourself to the point where you can't breath. We split the Gangnam meal for 2 across 4 people and it filled us up!

Great place to get you fix of Korean BBQ. Only down side was the music was a bit loud and did not complete the experience. It was a mix of rap/hip and pop. Besides the music being a bit much the food was very good. Purchased Bulgogi/Ramen/dynamite shrimp. The staff was helpful in ordering their best dishes. There will definitely be a second trip here.

Maybe because I live in NoVA and we have a slew of great Korean BBQ. My gripe with this place is not the food per se. It can be considered above average. I think we ordered the premium combo with a few a la carte.  I can't remember what meat was what, but I can tell you that some were good and some were ok. The biggest problem with this place is service. 

The only time they stopped off at our table is to take our order, drop off the food, and give us the check. Never came by to pick up empty plates. Had to scream at them to get their attention for ordering more drinks and water. Never came to refill the side dishes. Never checked on our sauce. You get the picture. They didn't even pretend to care and help start cooking.
Great variety of meat with good service. I would recommend trying the macaroon ice cream it's better than regular macaroons.
Delicious!  The Yelp reviews don't do this restaurant justice.  We decided to order the Meat Lovers and it was a great choice.  We're definitely coming back again!
Went there a second time..service was great, and we got a lot of side dishes. We ended up getting the same thing...soondubu and galbi.

This was my first experience with Korean BBQ. I was in Vegas last June and tried this place out based on Yelp reviews.  It was outstanding.  I've had Korean BBQ at several places since then, but no one can match Gangnam.  Still chasing the dragon of that first time.....
This is a pretty good Korean bbq restaurant. The food and beef are very fresh and good quality.
The best bibimbom ever! I had the gangnan for 2 people! So Satisfying! However, I waited for 2 hrs to get seated;(
It's a very nice and clean Korean BBQ restaurant. Foods are delicious and we will definitely come back again!
Delicious food, beautiful decor, great service, affordable prices, what more can you ask for? Big thumbs up!!!
Best Korean BBQ I've had. Great service and great food. Highly recommend the Gangnam meal. Good way to try the food.

So much fun! So much food! We had 6 hungry people, and the amount of food brought to our table (we ordered the Premium combo) was enough to feed 10 of us! Everything was delicious. Service was great. It is in a strip mall, so we were hesitant that we were missing out on the typical touristy Vegas experience by choosing this instead. We had a great time and would absolutely recommend it!

Food was delicious, lots of side dishes and great quality meat. Made it to late night happy hour from 10 p.m. to close where they have $3, and $4 specials and 50% off drinks

I am visiting from San Diego, and no this is not your traditional all-you-can-eat BBQ, as  they strive on quality and excellent service which I both received period recommended to anyone of any ethnic background

Ryan was also terrific and presented himself with excellent service and expertise.  If y'all haven't tried it you need to!

Just ate at Gangnam BBQ and it was amazing. Had a reservation. Sat inmediately. Service was friendly. Andrew was great. The food came out quickly and all cooked food had great flavors. The beef was perfect and so fun to cook. Would totally recommend getting off the strip and going here.

Loved it! High quality meat and sides. Puts my home Korean BBQ to shame. Attentive service and a great meal. Well worth a stop. 

First meal this trip to Vegas. Won't be the last time we are here.

Foods are great. You pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Foods are just great that my gf and I came back for the second time. The lunch special is a great deal. We tried really hard to finish everything on the table. The Korean prime beef and the Korean chicken are just delicious. Must try!

Food is great. Meats are fresh and service is good. 
The only reason I give 4 start is because the wait time is over an hour.

We had to wait for our seats despite having had made a reservation. This is a big deal to us because we have two young children. We ordered the pork belly, kalbi, skirt steak and bacon wrapped asparagus. It would have been a better deal to get the combos but we were not that hungry. The portions were pretty small (4-6 pieces each; 4 ozs) but were quite tasty. The panchangs were pretty good but you have to order two bbq dishes each person to get them for free. Nice atmosphere.
The bulgogi was good, the kalbi was a little plain. The ambiance was very good and the staff was very friendly. The have pretty good lunch specials as well.
Pretty place & yummy food!    Doesn't look like much on the outside but opens up when you go inside.  Very nice environment!
This place is awesome! Good value for the price. I shared the meat lover package with 3 friends and there was more than enough food. Would definitely come back again.
One of my favorite places to visit while in Vegas!!!! Happy hour after a day of shopping!!
The korean prime kalbi was delicious and you can never go wrong with anything wrapped in bacon!

My fianc√© and I came here for dinner the night he proposed to me. It was late about midnight and there were only a few other people there. This place is fun and romantic, definitely setting the mood for the amazon night ahead of us. We had the premium combo with Kobe beef, need tongue, shrimp rice bumpy bop or something, among other yummy things. This was my first taste of Kobe beef and I certainly fell in love. The meat is fresh and well as the veggies. I love how you can cook your food perfectly the way you want it.

The staff was very friendly and not very invasive. Always refilling our drinks and occasionally checking on us, making sure we were enjoying our experience. 

The price is a little steep, but what do you expect when you order Kobe beef. I would have paid more. I'm sure there are less expensive places in china town but this was close to home. 

Over all we had a very good experience, the food was delicious and the staff was very nice. I will be going back.
Great food, reasonable price, authentic Korean BBQ. It is about 30 min walking from the strip, but it is definitely worth it.
My wife and I really enjoy the foods here! The soup is so delicious! We will come again next time!
Place was pretty good for the price point! Went during happy hour and got a bunch of brisket, pork belly, and bulgogi for $4 each plate. Definitely worth!
Best Korean bbq in Vegas. I eat here all the time, great service. A la carte style but way better than the ayce places in town.
Had a good time here. Food came promptly. Loved their bibimbap and cream cheese wonton.
Come here every time we go to Vegas.  Best Korean food we have had.  Good service will be back here again next trip
The Korean Prime Kalbi was amazing! Also enjoyed the Bulgogi and Bacon wrapped Enoki...all were delish! Kobe Beef was good, but definitely would take 2 Kalbi first!
This place was truly an oasis in the desert. The bbq was so flavorful! The servers were really nice and patient. I would come back again!

The meat was delicious, fresh and tender. The sides were also good.  We had the Meat Lovers set and loved everything on it. Wish we had one of these in Toledo. Highly recommend, cool experience cooking the meat ourselves and eating it sizzling straight from the grill.
The side dishes are awesome! I love squid and fish cake. The spicy tofu soup is great. BBQ meat is tender and delicious, cold noodles very crunchy.

With the various appetizers and meat, it was an amazing experience for me, especially on my first time. We ordered fried calamari, cream cheese wontons, mixed tempura, etc. for our appetizers. The pork belly and bulgogi are to die for. The servers were super friendly and were there when we needed their service. There a specific server that I took a liking who constantly checked on us and he made my stay more pleasing! Hope to stop by when I'm in the area again!

I never really liked bibimbap, I find it basic, just rice, meat, veggies all mixed together, I can totally make this at home, however the uni bibimbap stood out to me. I ordered it. I loved it. I liked the flavors and how the rice at the bottom was crisp.
This place is very good. The people are very professional and the meat lovers combo was delicious. Be sure to check it out!

This place is definitely one of the best Korean BBQs in Vegas. We have tried quite a few and the quality here has been on par and consistent from visit to visit. Unique options of tapas are available as well and the service is impeccable!

Will definitely come back here at least once every time I visit Lost Wages!!

Best korean BBQ place in Vegas. After working at the trade show we were pretty hungry around 3pm. So not like the reviews we didn't had to wait for the table. Prime galbi was amazing and the kobe uni was my first time trying and it melt in. Gotta try for sure. They are on top of seaweed paper, sweet galbi with Uni on top.
Trip to Las vegas. Came for the happy hour. Can say that it was the best meal I had here!

Happy hour specials all week!! We came on a Sunday and ordered from the happy hour menu.  Favorites were Bulgogi and Beef toro!  Sides were delicious too!  Clean and great atmosphere! Will definitely be visiting again.
Wow this place is so great, I can't get enough of their meat! Great service, constantly checked, and even changed our grill! Will definitely come again. A must go for UNLV students!

My friends and I heard about this place for the first time last night. The line up was two hours long so we came back the next day at 11:30am when they opened. We were disappointed. The miso beef was tender, grilled to perfection. The price is very affordable too! Yum!
This place blew my mind! Every item was excellent and the portions are huge. Definitely a good choice for dinner!
kimchi chigae non-standard but very good. seaweed salad, bibimbap, bbq all exceptional.

Best and hip Korean bbq

Happy is the bomb.  Love the per plate price and extensive menu

Great service..... Cute guys according to my daughters
Totally fun!  The meat was the star. Yummy pickled goodness filled out the table. Worth venturing off the strip.

Great bbq place near the strip. Good quality meat of an a la carte place and huge quantity given for the price. We got the Gangnam for 2 and it was more than enough to feed the 3 of us. Would definitely come back again!

Plenty of food with reasonable prices!!!! I would recommend ordering the set first, so you can have a taste of variety of dishes, then if they are not enough, order the main ones. We went as 3 but only ordered the Las Vegas set for 3, but took us a while to finish this!!! Friendly and helpful staff! Awesome place. Might be a but noisy though
Definitely one of my top Korean BBQ experiences - including in Korea Town in LA. Hugely recommend bulgogi and short rib!

Very good! The staff made sure to double check when they weren't sure if one of the sauces was vegetarian before my vegetarian husband ate it. Some places would just say that it was, but staff here made sure to ask if fish was okay. Atmosphere was fun and modern. Definitely worth the trek from the MGM Grand
Great Value. Great service. Everything taste great.  A must go if you're in Vegas and want to save money and eat off the strip.
meatlover package are the best package ever. Though it costs over $150 for 6 persons, it worths to eat.
Best Korean  BBQ in Las Vegas. The meat lover combo is really worth, the meat is fresh and environment is good as well!!!!! Best place ever.
Excellent service. Everyone here was so attentive and courteous. The food portions were perfect for the price. I highly recommend the Meat Lovers course! I would definitely go back.
Service here is amazing. The drinks are so cheap. They use high quality meat. This place heaven for meat lovers. Highly recommened!
This place is fantastic.  We ordered the Premium cuts for the table and I am in heaven.  I've been to korean bbq in several places around the U.S.  and this place is easily the best.
It was very good! Especially I like Korean chicken cheese fondueI wanna come back again!!
First time having Korean BBQ and what a treat! Great food, great service, and the portions are plentiful. You won't be disappointed!

Good food but too busy restaurant 
Great meat. Clean environment 
Fair priced 
Very friendly staff.
Here with family, enjoying great kbbq.  We ordered 4 people bbq set for the 5 of us.  Server was kind and considerate. Food tasted great and the portion was adequate.

Today is the second time I have come to Gangnam Asian BBQ, and I absolutely love this place. Granted, both times have been during a week day and lunchtime, but, the service was prompt and friendly. The food is amazing! The decor is lovely. I like the low key music video playing on the large screen you can choose to ignore or enjoy. 

As for the food, the Tuna Poki was fantastic - not fishy at all and the combo of tuna, seaweed and radish was fab. The spicy edamame - awesome. Lastly, the Fire Cracker Shrimp was no joke. It is not for the faint of heart, but if you love spicy food like I do, you will love the combination of crunch, spice and a bit of sweet. It was really tasty.

Would definitely come back again,
Quick service, attentive. Hands down best Korean bbq in the states that I've had. And I've had bbq in Honolulu, Nyc, la, Portland.
Soondubu and meat on point. Portions are kinda small but food was very good. Line and wait times are pretty long, but it was WORTH
This is an awesome Korean bbq place affordable and the food is really good! I'll definitely  come back!

It's ok. Nothing to write home about. Service was ok.they dropped off the meat and didn't come back. Still don't know what I ate. Nice K-pop music in the background though.  Tip was already included on Bill no wonder service is mediocre.
My favorite local spot; food is great! Awesome place for hanging out with friends and family. The prices are reasonable. Opens until 1am.

It wasn't bad at all. I had kimchi soup and there were 3 pork meats in it. Food is eatable but nothing special. Their side dishes are VERY EFFORTLESS and Flavorless. For Korean, if you are craving spicy korean food, that will be the only reason you will go to this place.

Great service and food. 
Bbq is amazing and they have great service.
I visited Vegas and was craving for Korean food badly. They have a shuttle direct from the strip.
Food is awesome! I love the Spicy Tuna Fried sushi! Service and environment are also good!

One of my favorite places for korean BBQ in Vegas. The best friendly workers there with great customer service and the food is AMAZING. Price is fair not too expensive. Also I would recommend getting the macaroons they're the best to end dinner with.

It took a long time to get seated but it was well worth it. Server explained everything, it was our first time at this specific restaurant. Very accommodating with the little ones. We got Gangnam package for two and it was way too much food for my husband and I plus our 2 toddlers.

Food was okay.  It needed little more seasoning.  We got pork belly and it was thin. Nangmyun and soft tofu soup was good. Here you cook your own meat. Service was good and deco was good. I would still go back if I'm in town. But if I want some good korean, this wouldn't be my first choice.

Outstanding food, service, and value.
Our waiter was very helpful He suggested perfect amount and very tasty food.
Food was outstanding and plenty.
Price was so reasonable.
Highly recommended.
Amazing Korean BBQ here. Make sure to try the ramen also. Quality meat and seafood! Definitely coming back.
The service was great and the meat lovers order for 4 people was the perfect portion size for our group with enough variety and sides to satisfy us all.
Exceptional food, service and ambiance. I recommend all the meats as they are melt in the mouth tender!
Fast service. Food came within 5 minutes about 20 dishes.  Cheap prices and great quality food. Also free macaroons if you order $15 or more and redeem on yelp
Excellent food and service. They use high quality meat and complinentary side dishes are delicious. Two thumbs up!

I really love BBQ and i tried to find the best BBQ so far. Indeed, Gangnam is one of my top 5. My friend and I ordered Gangnam set and Meat lover, and we found that the quality of the food is perfectly satisfy us. Moreover, the quantity of the food is sufficient for 10 people.
Good food...authentic stews...rather small portions...but if you are in the mood for good Korean BBQ in Vegas this is a good place.

Amazing fun and a very nice atmosphere. Enjoyed the food and staff was excellent :)

Would definitely go here again..... And recommend it. Even if you can't cook, still a great experience.
fantAstic experience. Meats are very juicy and the service is great. Beef tongue is a must try, extremely tender and in good size.
Loved this place! Modern Korean BBQ joint. Second time I've come in one week! Good portion size and quality meat. Desserts were yummy too, especially the macaroon ice cream!
We booked almost one month ago . When we come to the restaurant, the waiter tell us they cannot find our reservation! It is thx giving!! Bad reception,suck!!!!
Best Korean bbq I've ever been to! Tofu hut doesn't even compare. Ask for Jin! He goes out of his way to make your experience amazing!

Our favorite spot for Korean BBQ! We come every time we are in Vegas. The food is excellent. We always get Korean Kalbi, Bulgogi and pork belly plus a tone of sides. The broccoli and cheese is a must. Don't forget the miso soup. Best I've ever had?

Macaron ice cream is good 
Good food
Poor customer service
Food comes so late
The grills are not clean
They need to clean the grills thoroughly 
The tongs are not clean left some food marks in the claw part of the tongs
Great comfort food, wonderful services and all the server was prompt with our request.
It is my first time here and i definitely come again. Oyster is not so fresh but overall is excellent. Tofu chigea is a bit spicy. Taste is so Korean. Love it!
I am vegetarian and was skeptical of going to a Korean BBQ restaurant, but there were a lot of good vegetarian options! The service was also excellent.

We went to Gangnam because the reviews were great and it was open late. I'm so glad we went. Their food was delicious and there was no wait. Even tho it was 10 pm, the servers were very friendly and attentive. The plates of meat were smaller than most places I have been, but the prices were great and smaller plates meant we could try more things. Everything was wonderful and we will definitely be back whenever we visit Vegas.
Always great food and the staff is amazing! Every time we have friends or family in town we always make it a point to bring them here.

Went there for family dining and I was happy I found here in Vegas. We didn't order the combo but ordered individual meat including steamed beef rib stew which was great and spicy garlic beef. We definitely wanted to visit here when we go to Vegas. The price was reasonable. The interior was great and the restroom was clean.
Fantastic service, and variety! 4 thumbs up! Showed up with a party of three and we were greeted with a welcoming sense of hospitality

Came by for lunch while on a work conference here in Las Vegas. The service was wonderful and the food was absolutely delicious! I had the Korean Pork, chili wontons, edame, and the house salad. The salad dressing was very light and satisfying. I definitely recommend it for anyone in the area!
Long wait of 90 min on Thanksgiving night!  Good food that is well seasoned!  Don't miss it!

It's a nice Korean BBQ food restaurant . Very Great food!
But there are so many people, to have better dining experience, it would be perfect to reserve a table beforehand.
Very delicious. Please coming and taste it. The Bbq is so great! The Bbq is from Korean and I like it very much. It is traditional Korean style and better that others. Great taste if you come here.
Good service. Good environment. The food quality and taste was excellent. The quantity of food was satisfying.

Actually the food was much better than I expected. I eat Korean food a lot since there are so many choices around NJ/NY area. So I wasn't expecting to get something as good as that. We had a BBQ set for two people and then ordered couple more dishes. Everything was really good. The rice and noodle dishes which are usually just normal stuff but they were tasty here. We also like the best two appetizers on their menu, one uni and one beef thing. BBQ are good.
The best Korean BBQ. Stopped here twice in a week. I loved it with my small family we were totally full off 55$
Great Korean BBQ place, very clean! Not all you can eat but very worth it. You don't feel like you're about to explode after because you're trying to get your money's worth.

Great food and good services! 
The tofu soup and meat lover for 2 ppl are especially good. 
Definitely recommend going!

My bestfriend and I came to this BBQ place after we've gone to a Korean Spa. We thought it would be good bec. of how good the reviews seem to be... however, just like most Yelp Reviews... it was all hype. (I'm starting to think that the reviews are mostly fake). 

First off, the host told us that we had about 35-45 min. of wait. So, my bestfriend and I decided we could wait for it. An hour passed, after checking in with the host, he now tells us that reservations come in first, before we get to sit. Since we've already waited for so long... my bestfriend didn't want to leave. So we waited another hour, for a total of TWO HOURS! 

When we were finally sat on our table, we thought, Finally!!! Guess what? We had to wait an extra 30 min for a waiter/waitress to take our order and we weren't even in a hidden area!!! The person who were in line  five people after us even got their food first!!! 

So I finally asked the host for help and he took our order and checked up on us. I don't know who our designated waiter/waitress was but there was this girl waitress who was giving us an attitude, slamming the lettuce order we've ordered on the table. We were just too hungry and to even bother paying attention to her. 

The food was just like any other BBQ place. You cook your own food. As usual, they didn't marinate the shrimp and squid long enough for the flavor to cling when barbequed. The food wasn't worth the inconveniece. 

I understand the long wait in line to be seated. I also would have understood if it would take a few minutes for food to get ready. However, it is absolutely not understandable when the waiter/waitress would ignore you completely; taking 30 minutes to take your order... when you were sat first. Then, needing to flag someone to take your order.

I actually felt bad for the host because he took our orders and was acting like our waiter... when that's really not his job to do. So we decided to give him the tip. (HOWEVER, upon giving him the tip he said he was actually the manager). Thus, I felt irritated all the way home.

As the manager it was his responsibility to ensure that guests are all attended to. I will never go back to this place again and I will advise other family members, group of friends, other government co-workers to completely skip this one. It's not worth the wait. Not worth the trouble. Food places are meant to be fun, relaxing, not troublesome.

All the meats had great flavor and came in great portions.  All so succulent and juicy.  My mom also had the spicu seafood soup, and it was some of the best soup she's ever had.  I was also greatly impressed by their stellar bibimbap.  Delicious all around - a must eat restaurant when in Vegas.

This place is very unique. If you are in Vegas and you can eat here you will be glad you did. We did the premium beef for two and it was awesome. Proportion of food was perfect not too filling you don't want to be out in Vegas eating a huge meal feeling stuffed. I like being able to cook my own food the way I like it. And I was thoroughly entertained by the projection screen weather day was dropping damn fat be all up in the house.
Fav spot in Vegas for some Asian bbq. My favorite is the spicy pork and dynamite shrimp
Food is delicious. Portion for 2 is enough for 4 person. We order a BBQ set for 2 but end up we have 8 person eating it with 2 more tofu soup. Yummy.

Took a taxi all the way from the hotel. Ordered spicy seafood noodle and korean bean soup, first the bean soup is really salty. After they took it back and recoil seems a bit better. I recommend the spicy seafood noodle if you like spicy food, but no the bean soup, only few onion, cucumber, and tofu. There are 7 different side dishes, taste average. But the happy hour fried calamari is pretty good with the happy hour price.

The place is well decorated and crowded even at late hours. Beef tongue is my favorite, Korean beef kalbi is also great. 

However, the plate is small, around 4 pieces per plate. So for more than 3 people, you might consider ordering 10+ plates.

Excellent~ especially for two people. The Carpaccio is delicious, and prime beef is also outstanding. However I don't recommend the duck. And I have to recommend the vegetables! They steamed the vegetable first and you can bake it by yourself~ It's so good!

We got the Gangnam dinner which was a lot of food and all very delicious.

Good diversity of different meats, and the sides were also very good.

Hands down to this place! The crew, the manager (John) and the owner are the best! The quality of food is exquisite. I have been to a lot of Korean place in town but so far my experience in this place is remarkable! You can never get wrong with the quality of food and service! Btw, we had the Gangnam type of bbq and it was amazing! I totally would recommend to anyone!!!

So delicious! The food here phenomenal. The best kbbq I've had. Had the premium dinner package, best cut of meat ever! So many see dishes with unlimited refill. Will definitely be back and I'm from San Diego.
This is the greatest Korean BBQ we have in Las Vegas! The meat lover combo can satisfy any need of you. The beef steak and pork belly are so yummy and juicy
It's hard finding good food that's reasonably priced in many places, especially in Vegas, this place hits the mark on both!!

It's my first time here and the reviews said it all, definitely coming back here. Try the spicy tuna kimbap and the cream cheese wonton.  The restaurant also gives you an option to cook your bbq or to have the kitchen grill it for you.
Beef toro is amazing! Whats more, u must come here at HAPPY HOUR! the beer is only half price.
Food was amazing but the wait was a little long but definitely worth the wait. Food was fresh and well priced. Also the ambience was well set and good for a date.

This place is amazing, service is great and the food is fresh and delicious. My favorite is the bibimbap because the overall taste and texture us phenomenal. The cream cheese wonton is crunchy on the outside and smooth and creamy on the inside.

Slow service. This is around 2pm non rush hour 
Ordered an Udon Tempura the comment is it's coming. It's coming. More like oops we forgot
Edit: showed them this review to get free dessert (promo). I hope they didn't spit on it
One of my favorite places. Good food and good service. Fun place to come with your friends. Lots of ban chan- bean sprouts are my fave. Try the Kalbi. Thinly cut, marinaded perfectly.
Great food and great service. Strongly recommend! They have happy hour in the late night. Cheap and delicious!
The food is yummy and the side dishes are good.  Good place of enjoy.u can come here to eat.But u need to wait for a long long time!
Best Korean BBQ I've had. Food is great, very clean place and arrive is top notch!! It's a must do in Vegas.

Great Japanese Korean bbq place! Atmosphere is great and the service was excellent! Great price for how much meat there was when we ordered the meal lover combination plater! Definite will come back again to this place!

The Harami Miso is really really good, definitely enjoyed it. 
Pay attention to your temperature when grilling!  Very tasty at higher temperature! Wrapping with lettuces is a great and healthy way to eat too. 
Was on a conference in Vegas, I am glad that we walked into this restaurant tonight.
Best Korean food in Las Vegas! Fresh, clean and presented beautifully. Our waiter was absolutely fabulous! You won't be disappointed!
I went here for lunch with my friends, and the meal was just awesome!! One of the best Korean BBQ I've ever had!! Highly recommended!!

I heard from a friend about it and when my family came to visit I brought them here. We all like the food very much. The quality of the meat is very good. It's easy to find and the servers are friendly. I'd come again if I'd like to have asian bbq in Las Vegas
This restaurant was really good. It made me feel very cultured. I liked the spicy chicken it was delicious. The service was good too.

Amazing food.  I had a fun time with family and friends for my birthday! 
The service was great and quick.  I recommend it if you would like to try new things.
The gangnam restaurant is very good and tasty. the side dishes are really good and I enjoyed the barbeque
Great bbq. Happy hour is the real deal. $4 for pork belly, bulgogi or beef toro. $3 for veggies. And $9 pitcher of Sapporo.
Amazing food. First visit ever and didn't think it would be this good. Make sure to try the Kobe beef
Really good food, best BBQ forever,  really like the beef its so good , hope can come this place again.
Found this on Yelp when we flew into Las Vegas. Lord of positive reviews and was worth the wait!!!  Meat was fresh and tasty!
BEST EVER! Can't wait to come here when we are in town. It's a must try! Tuna Kimbop. Yum!! Prime Kalbi. Bulgogi ibis rice thing. Oh man!

The food is so great and the service is perfect.
I really recommend others come to this place when they are in las vegas.
This place is awesome !!! Happy hour is the beez neez! Awesome service and food. Best experience I have had at a Korean grill!!

Food was delicious and the staff were friendly and helpful!

I got the bogogi and the chicken fondu
Really really good korea foods and value for money. The spicy soup?beef?is my favorite?so delicious.

The food is not bad.  They give a large bowl of rice with the entrees.   I like that they let you grill your meats even with the lunch specials. I had Japanese noodles and some bulgogie bibimbab, and yoogaejang.
Best BBQ ever, must try their pork belly and beef tongue!  They have a variety selection for dessert! And happy hours! Great deal!

First time here.  Got my usual fave dish, Prime Kalbi.  Great service!  Our server "Donkey" was awesome!!  Food flavors and tastes are incredible!!  We're from Dallas.  But we will definitely be back if we're ever back in town!

Really fun Korean BBQ place with a grill inset into the table. Tender well-marinated beef will lots of flavor. We got the Gangnam set meal for two and loved every of bit. Just seared the meat a little bit and ate it all up!
Fantastic. Loved everything. Definitely would recommend the bacon scallops and the filet mignon.

This restaurant is reasonable priced and also has good tasting food on the menu. You can also have the choice to cook your own food or have them cook it for you. I recommend that you cook it yourself just to have the full experience of the restaurant.
We come here everytime we come to Vegas. Best Asian food here! The spicy tuna kimbab is a must try!
Enjoyed the feature of cooking our choice of food right at the table. I would recommend everyone try this at least one time.
Great service,  great prices and delicious food!  Coming from LA, tried many different Korean bbq places but I must say this place is one of the best.

I think my life will never be the same. After eating here I feel like I can take over the world. The food was legit and the staff was awesome. I've had Korean bbq at other place and I can honestly say this is one that is pretty amazing. Only thing is if big group like I went with, need 2 sets of sides. But yuuuuuummmy
This place is a must eat BBQ place in Las Vegas. We ordered Gangnam course menu and it was delicious! We loved the happy hour after 10pm and the Sapporo pitcher was 50%off. I highly recommend it!
Great place to try. Perfect customer service and food. Worth the wait. Will be here every time I'll be back to Las Vegas.

We were in Vegas for our annual family vacation and almost at the end of our stay so everyone is pretty much Buffeted-out.  We turn to Yelp for suggestions and Gangnam Asian Bbq came up. Now mind you.. I'm not much of a fan of having to cook my food when I go out to eat but I'm game. I like to just stuff my face with dinner I ordered and the only effort I want to put in is to slice and lift-to-mouth but again, I'll go with the flow.

The place is in a small strip mall so parking was good. We get there and there was already a line. Personally, it seems small.. I look at the "Maximum Occupancy" and it states 75. Remember, I'm still hung-over from the buffets where you see hundreds of people so I had to remind myself that 75 is a good size restaurant. There's a bar in the back of the restaurant where I saw a couple seat themselves because they didn't want to wait the 30mins for a table. While waiting, there's a constant stream of people coming in. This place must be good then.. but we have to wait for our table to see.

We get seated after about 30mins as stated and get a table where the grill looks totally brand new (or got one heck of a cleaning).  Around it are the condiments where we got 2 of each.. kimchi, pickled bean sprouts, baby cucumbers, radish, squid??, fish cake.. you have to pardon me but I don't know what they were called so I listed them as I saw them. We ordered pork belly (lots of it), Beef Toro, and Korean Prime Kalbi. The kids (they're actually adults now but they will always be my kids)  proceed to grill with earnest and the meats cooked fairly quick. Each one of us were given dipping sauces (3) to dip the meats and they turned out very tasty. Again, I'm not a fan of having to cook my food before eating it, but since I wasn't cooking.. it turned out well. Perhaps if my pockets were deeper, we would have swung for the Kobe beef also or more marinated meats, but what we quite full and satisfied from what we ordered.

Overall experience was great.. but why 4 stars and not 5? The service was good but not great. We had to ask to refill our waters and had to flag them down for other requests. It wasn't too much of an effort and the restaurant was very busy but the servers didn't come around often enough to check. The food was good but I had to cook it and season it myself so I can't say great.  The final bill came out and for a party of 6.. it was very good! A lot of food for the price and everyone seems very satisfied. And for the experience of non-buffet.. this was a win.

This was my first experience with Korean BBQ & this place did not disappoint. The customer service was great. The waiters were very helpful and patient. The food was amazing. My wife had Shrimp garlic and I had Harami miso beef. Both were very juicy and flavorful. "Must try appetizer's". We will come back for sure.

I came with my sister for a Sunday lunch and we were quickly seated. We each ordered a bowl of noodle, they came out sizzling and flavorful. We also ordered the meat to grill as we ate, yum yum. My only request is if they could think out the meat a little, it was cut a little thick. but overall a great experience.
Good and lots of food. very good service as well.  got the meat lover and came with 6 different meats, all the sides, salad, miso and rice.
???? ?????? ?????  come with friends for lunch, food is ok

It was our first time and we had great time here. The servers were very friendly and attentive, and foods were at a reasonable price. The oysters were so fresh, filet mignon, calamari garlic and pork belly were the must try. However, the salmon was not so fresh but it wasn't my thing anyway. We'll be back here again soon :).

Great service and meat! Came here on a Saturday afternoon within a reservation and was seated fairly quickly. Our group of 5 ordered a meat lover for 2 and a gangnam for 2 and it was the perfect amount of food for a hungry party.
Super amazing food and it is great, they have amazing service. Been to some of the others. And the service here is amazing. Got the belly full and leaving happy.
?????????????????????????????????????????????? It's a awesome Korean BBQ place to go, I highly recommended, food is awesome and service is awesome. Everything is superb!!
Great food! Great service! My husband and I was really satisfied.. Must visit the place whenever you come to Las Vegas.
I love this place, very comfortable environment and very pleasant service. I would recommend the bacon, beef, soup, and dessert.

Great dishes. Great portion
 Very reasonable price. Great stop before shenanigans. Great customer service as well

Great spot! Of everything we bbqed, I liked the bulgogi the best. Great selection of delicious meat and seafood to grill. It was also nice to wander away from the Strip for a break from bright flashing lights. The free dessert for posting this review was delicious- macaroon ice cream sandwich! And the 5 stars are genuine.
The food is good. The services is fast. All the staff is very kind and nice. The atmosphere also great. Try the Vegas set here if you wanna try many kind of food.

Awesome experience! This place was recommended to me by my friend, and she was spot on. Definitely try the spicy tuna kimbap! Super tasty and filling. The harami miso was tender and seasoned right. Grill changes in between are always a good thing. Come after 10pm and you can get Happy Hour!! We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

Very different styles than what we have in nj, but the food is abundant and very tasty. We had to wait over 40 minutes for our table, but we were offered a free dish for our long wait. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

This is my 3rd time here. Food quality is the same, but service is better. We decided to come later tonight, so no line to be seated, no wait for food. Service is lighting fast this time. Plus I just find out that after 10 pm is happy hours, so every dishes are a bit cheaper.
The food is great, and the combo comes with a large amount of enjoyable food. Every order comes with a great amount of side dishes.
Service was excellent and the food was orgasmically delicious ! Must try chicken cheese fondue and Kobe beef carpaccio .

We are here in vacation and decided to try this restaurant.  The Spicy pork was well marinated.  The filet mignon was tender.  The garlic beef had a wonderful garlic flavor.  We also had pork belly and it tasted like what we ate when in South Korea. We will definitely return to this restaurant.

Tried this place when we were in town for a night. Ordered WAY TOO MUCH food. If you get one of their platters it is enough food without adding any apps. Would have given this place 5 stars because the food was great but the service wasn't as helpful as I would have liked. But I would have ordered the Tuna Poki and Cream Cheese Rangoon even knowing that we had too much food. They were both amazing!!!  It was out first time there and with Korean BBQ and we didn't really know what we were doing. The waitress we had disappeared for a while and didn't explain very well what was going on. If you are familiar with self-grilled Korean BBQ I'm sure you'd love it. A heads up if you've never had Soju, it tasted like vodka to me, not Sake. Sake is much easy to sip, I had to drink the Soju like a shot.
The food is great here! This is by far the best experience I've had at a Korean BBQ restaurant. One problem was the quickness of the food getting to the table.  Otherwise I would go here again.
Good food and great service. The meat is seasoned great. Will definitely come back.  Venue is great as well.
Great food, comfortable atmosphere and very friendly staff - kudos to "Back" and "Frank" who were very friendly and kind!  Highly recommend this restaurant!
Good place to eat Korean bbq! Bad for 3-6pm happy hours you get 50% drinks! Meat lover combo seems great!

I came here Sunday night and the servers were awesome. Same for the food. 
Due to having such an awesome time we came back for lunch on Wednesday. 
That was a big mistake. Horrible service! One waitress actually smiles and the other one acted like we Are there to eat without paying.
We had to ask for refill / new drinks. The server wasn't attentive at all. Throughout the stay, she came by maybe 4 times and that's just to drop off food. We constantly have to ask for her to bring us stuff (drinks, napkins, bill, and change). 
 I work at a restaurant so I know how gratuity work. 
Restaurants usually charge gratuity for table of 6 or more. And I'm pretty sure my group isn't a table of 6. 
I usually don't care if you add gratuity to my check because that save me the time of calculating. But with this service, our waitress clearly did not deserves $25 tip considering how horrible of a service it was. 
We could have complaint but we're not about to missed our flight. Thanks for the food gangnam and we will tell our friends to never come here due to your rude server.
This is the best Korean bbq spot in Vegas, great staff, clean and modern feel. One of my favorites. Been here many times, nothing but positive experience and a full stomach...
Great food especially the filet minion steaks.  Good calamari too.  Best to come during happy hour.
Great quality meat selections. We selected the Gangnam package and it was plenty for both of us but we devour every bit. Love the mushrooms. Definitely recommended!

Always good food and service whenever we are in Vegas and stop by for our Korean BBQ fix.  Just wish they had more tables as it can be popular on the weekends.   Really enjoy the variety of gogi and other options.

This spot is so good! Everything I've tried was so delicious!  I definitely recommend their salmon jalape√±o poppers and their bacon wrapped asparagus! They have a wide variety of  delicious meats and their happy hour menu is def worth checking out! The servers are friendly and the the vibe is real laid back and my overall experience was such a delight! I'm coming back for sure! :)
First time coming here. Highly recommended. Good food, reasonbly priced. Will totally come back here again!!

Pretty delicious and great service. Food arrived very quickly after we were seated. The four of us got the meat lovers for two, and each ordered a main. It was just the right amount of food. Wish they gave some complimentary vegetables to go with the grilled meat (garlic, peppers, lettace). Would recommend!

Brought my 95yr old Grandmother, who loves meat, to try something new! I was worried if she would turn up her nose since she's used to her good ol steak, but she was very happy with the food. Good meat, yummy flavors for affordable price. Service was very timely too! Away from the busy strip with plenty of parking. Dinner was a success!

We decided to try Gangnam for the first time, and we are not disappointed. We ordered the Vegas grill and it's a good assortment of yummy food, very fast service! Staff friendly, and always on the go. Will definitely come back
Very fun meal! The meat was the best part - tender, succulent, and flavorful. Sides were good but I've had better elsewhere. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas!
Just visiting and came across this place. Service was great considering they were closing soon but we still got great service and yummy food
We love it here!! The marinades make the dishes stand out from other BBQ places. Definitely gotta try the Garlic Flatiron Beef and the garlic shrimp!!
Fantastic Korean BBQ.  The food quality is among the best of the best that I've had.
I've never been to this place before. Amazing service! Food was delicious ! The vibe is super chill!

This was our first time at a Korean BBQ restaurant and it was fantastic. We came with a large group, ordered a variety of things off the menu, and were pleased with it all. I would definitely recommend coming here and will be back!
Best Korean food in Las Vegas! High quality meats! So many options and so delicious!!!!! Yummmmm!!!!!!!
Good ambiance, great food.. We had the meat lover's combo and enjoyed every juicy bite. The servers are all attentive and efficient. Definitely worth a try if you love Korean/ Japanese BBQ!

This has been most peasant experience at GangNam. If you have large party you better come (more than 2ppl) here not only this place is very good price but also it will fill all of your people. Food is great and amazing.

We ordered everything....
Prime Kalbi
Filet mignon
Beef Toro
Bulgogi
Pork belly
Premium tongue
Bottle of Reisling
And a bottle of Soju
Great time!!! Reminded me of S. Korea. Great service, great prices, overall the best so far stateside!
Thank u!!!

Went here based on the reviews on yelp. Very different and good. It's a pretty small restaurant across the street from Hard Rock. Customer service was on point. Lots of people there to serve you. Food is served to you raw and you cook on a gas grill in your table. They different items you can choose from Al la carte or as a group special. The specials are for parties of 2 or 4, we had a party of 3 and ordered the Premium and that was plenty of food for us. defiantly worth try.

The environment is very nice and modern. Our waiter was attentive to us. The Korean prime kalbi was delicious as well as the flat iron garlic beef. The spicy edamame was very satisfying.  The restaurant is kept very clean. 

We are happy customers.

I was in town on a business and found this place by accident....am I happy with the food we had! The jalape√±o poppers was excellent, the kobe beef was very tasty, and the bulgogi was full of flavor. I am not Korean but I  think  the food is pretty authentic based on the amount of the Korean clientele they have. I always love the little dishes they have for the accompaniment to the entr√©e. On top of it all the price is very reasonable!! My friend and I will definitely come back next year.
Great place to dine and good quality meat selection! Definitely a place to visit in Las Vegas.

I surprised this place got 4.5 stars! Got here last night had to wait for an hour. I chose to stay because of the 4.5 stars. Got the seat and immediately order the $65 package for 2 person. Banchan were not fresh. Almost all the meat choices were chewy and tough. At least the salad was fresh. In LA Japanese and Korean bbq that has 4.5 - 5 stars they use imported charcoal and really careful with the meat. Overall experience: disappointed. Not worth the money.

It started off slow but only improved from there. The food was very good.

We ordered the beef tongue with green onions and were impressed. A good start.

From there we also got harame miso skirt steak, beef and pork toro, more beef tongue and stuff called veggies including the mushroom medley, tofu, kabocha squash and Zucchini.

Everything was good to very good. Hit the spot perfectly!
I love this place! Second visit. Favorite is Kobe beef. Good price with good quality.

Was greeted right away upon entering. Seated within 5 minutes on a friday night. Ordered from the happy hour menu. Prices were decent and bill came to 50$ for two people which is reasonable given the amount of food we ordered. Food also came very quickly and was able to get refill on the side dishes. Overall great experience and food. Would def come back again!

Great place to eat. Lots of selection. Noce staff.
They brought us the food quickly.
Very attentive.
Korean BBQ at midnight on a weekday! Everything we had was fantastic! Really great service too! It's amazing to find such great late night food in a strip mall.

Great service! My family and I were greeted by a server and were seated at a table with the open stove in front of us. My kids enjoy watching their food being made so this was a good thing and one way to keep them calm around the stove/bbq pit. My husband and I got a drink or two and it was the great 50% off deal during happy hour so we had quite a fun time. We got the bugolgi BBQ and everything was quite tasty and delicious. The service was dandy, the staff is friendly. Good place for lunch with friends or family.
Had the Kalbi and bulgogi and it was delicious. Plenty of sides. Great dessert selection. Macaron ice cream, lava cake, and Mochi ice cream.

Seems family owned. Not very attentive wait staff. Came here late for dinner. I wasn't impressed with how little meat they provided. Mainly rice... I found that to be cheap. My biblogi or whatever was too sweet and as I mentioned lacking on the steak/meat that I wanted. Just a bunch of sweet rice. Will not be returning.
Enjoyed a lunch here. Liked the meat here very much! Located near the university, convenient place to have a meal.

I actually did not understand why it has so many 5 star ratings..It is just ok..Not that perfect. The food is delicious as well as the sources they provided. However, comparing to Japanese style BBQ, the meats were not that fresh.
Amazing!!!! Better than grandma made and she cooked traditional Korean food for me growing up. I want to come here everyday. Happy Hour is totally worth it

We just LOVE Gangnam. Excellent food and Amazing Atmosphere.
Whole family can enjoy dinner. AWESOME :0)
This was my first visit to Las Vegas and first meal at a restuarant and thid place exerted our expectations. I love korean bbq but this was definitely the best one I've ever had.
Excellent BBQ.... Long waiting but worth to^^ . Pork and beef are great!!! Not too expensive. We ordered a set of meat lover which is enough for three of us!

Had a chance this past weekend to visit this KBBQ location. Although it was not all you can eat the amount of food that was received was more than enough. I went with two of my buddies and it was our first time there. We were greeted and seated promptly. Little did we know but we arrived during happy hour. 50% off pitchers and some of the dishes were priced at or around $4.00.

We advised the waitress that this was our first time and she recommended that we do the special for two people(+15% off for happy hour) and if we wanted to order some additional sides. I believe we ended up ordering the #1 with all the different beef options and also two sides of toro. The amount of food that came out was really overwhelming. As with any KBBQ spot the side dishes arrived (kimchi, Mac salad, salad, and some other items) along with the sides came 4 oysters, bibimap(fried rice), mushrooms and I believe that was all. If you have a chance definitely stop in because the food was great. With the three of us the bill came out to around $34/ea.
The beef is so tasty. Was kinda bummed out about the long wait before getting our food though.

My husband and I have had korean bbq many times before but this place is by far my favorite! Best korean food I've ever had!!! Great atmosphere and service was great!!! Definitely will comeback again.
Great food and experience. Would definitely recommend it.  We ordered the gangnam style for 2 and it was plenty of food for 3.

It was really good. I took the Las Vegas bbq. It costs $20 per person.

Take the Las Vegas bbq combo

We tried meat lover set menu and it was great!
The complimentary side dishes were very tasty as well.

Good food and service indeed. We decided to get the meat lovers for two and it was superb. It came with a lot of sides and it satisfied our meat craving for sure. will definitely coming back to this place. If your in town make sure to stop by!
When looking for great Korean BBQ in Vegas, this is the place. Great food, great environment. Always a crowd pleaser!
Great service and food.  Spicy pork, ribeye and sweet n chicken very good. If you looking to eat at reasonable price near the Vegas strip this is the place to eat .

Best Korean in LV! The best time to go is at 10pm -midnight for happy hour! It is the best value, especially for how much food we got. The food was high quality and the servers were attentive but not too invasive. PLUS THE BANANA TEMPURA WAS REALLY DELICIOUS.

Soooooo bomb! First time here, we were fiendin some Asian food and this place was straight fire! You might as well call it, a body sesh. Couldn't even kill it all they gave us so much food! Def hittin this next time we're in Vegas!!!

Visiting Vegas from Chicago. Was looking for a place to hit my hunger-spot away from the strip since all I've ever done when visiting is eat at the casinos. Having said that, I'm super glad that I was able to try this place out. I've eaten at my fair share of Korean BBQ joints in Chicago and this was, by far, the best one that I've eaten at. The meat was flavorful, the side dishes tasted great and the price was incredibly cheap compared to what I'm used to. This will now be a regular destination of mine when returning to Vegas.

Good price but some of the food was so so. I sampled a friends bbibimbap (sp?) and enjoyed that the most. The marinated prime rib was good as well. Beef tongue was not as enjoyable and the quality was not as good.
Got a bunch of bbq dishes and the bibimbop. Kalbi was very good meat quality and bibimbop was yummy. Would recommend to anyone who wants good Korean food.
Was looking for a good place to eat in Vegas and found this place. It was super solid, we got the meat lovers combo and we were happily stuffed by the end of it, would recommend!
This is a fantastic place for bbq and amazing Korean food.Taste good and price is also reasonable.  We love it.

My first Korean bbq experience and it was fantastic! Everything was delicious and the service was impressively prompt. Tried a lot of things I've never had before and loved it all. I wish we had a place like this in my home town.
Side dishes and sauces are on point. Highly recommend the marinated Kalbi and bacon wrapped scallops! Nice atmosphere for a group or couple.

This was my first Korean BBQ experience, and I have to say, yum! In love with the concept of cooking your own food at the table. Not to mention the happy hour is amazing! Bulgogi is a must try. So satisfied.
Awesome food with big portions! Loved the white peach sake.. Pleasant atmosphere and great, attentive service..
Money!!! Best Korean BBQ I ever had. Meat was tender and flavorful. Service was excellent.
Authentic korean restaurant. Love their kimchi! Their bbq shrimp is very fresh and the marinated korean kalbi is very tender. Would recommend this restaurant to korean food lovers.

Just came in with a group of friends and quickly seated. Their service is quick and friendly. Hands down the best place in vegas area. I recommend the kalbi and the bulgogi . I can eat here every week. I recommend this place!
I love korean bbq and I'm so happy I found this place. thanks to yelp. :) this place is awesome and price is great specially during happy hour.
Quick service and great quality for the price, especially during happy hour. Among the best deals of any kbbq place I've been!
Really good quality meat for the price. Place looks nice and happy hour is awesome. Probably the best kbbq place in vegas. They also have a good variety of drinks.

First Korean dining experience. I had Bulgogi and Gyoza. They give you a lot of sides, but only 4 oz of meat per entr√©e. The service was not terribly friendly, but the food was good. The water was good. I'm doing this for the free dessert.

Had lunch Pork Belly. Kimchee was perfect.  Everything was just like Korean Style.  Price was reasonable and service top notch!  Sides made us happy. We're definitely going back here since we're locals.

Came here for an early dinner and was also able to catch HH! Tried their spicy garlic edamame, which had a great kick to it - good appetizer. Also got spicy pork, beef toro, and bulgogi from their HH menu. Great deals $3/$4 tapa plates, so you get to try a lot of different dishes. Definitely recommend getting the Korean prime Kalbi!! Would definitely come back again!!

Awesome service. Good Ambiance. I dropped my tongs on accident and had a new pair before they even hit the ground. All the food tasted great. This place lives up to all the reviews on here. The dessert as you enter draw you in like a moth to a flame. The Beef Sukiyaki in the hot stone bowl tasted very good. I definitely recommend it.

Pretty positive experience overall. Great ambiance, relatively private dining area with tall dividers in between booths along the wall. Always enjoyed the concept of korean BBQ and this place did not disappoint
Our first time at an Asian BBQ restaurant and it was great! We got the meat lovers for two which was more than enough food. All the meat was very well flavored and tasty. Recommended!

I ordered the 4 people combo. The food is good. 
 Then they brought out the panchan (the assorted sides), plus brought two other sides I wanted for free.So good!
 And such friendly staff!

Came here in a shitty mood. So hungry! Ran 6 miles today and hate my thighs. Little wait about 9th. Seated in 30 min while mom was complaining the whole time. Sat down got a meal and drink quickly with wonderful service and my craptastic mood started to disappear. The staff here is amazing and I will be back on my next trip. BTW mom is new to Korean Fusion and she LOVED it, said it was the best meal she's had out here.
Awesome food at moderate prices! We had everyone's favorites: Harami miso, prime kalbi.  However, the Pork Toro is a must try - it's amazing!
So I came here for dinner with my Frds, we didn't have to wait too long before we are seated. It is really tasty Korean bbq in Las Vegas. Happy thanks giving

The meat lover set is great but the side dish is the best. I really love kimchi. Good korean BBQ in vegas. Very good option out of the strip. Combo for 2 is good for 3. Banana tempura for dessert was my favorite. I would definitely come back.  The service fast and the staff is very nice.
Food is delicious, meat lovers combo is excellent. Prompt and timely service and we were served within minutes of being seated. Must try, especially after a couple of Yards on the Strip!

At first we were intimidated by the ala carte pricing. $1.95 for rice and $1.00 for dipping sauce (salt & sesame oil), but it comes out to less then other Korean BBQ places and we left just as full. The portions were generous and service was great! We got cooking pointers and sauce recommendations. Atmosphere was trendy and clean. Would definately eat here again!

Comming in on a bad day i guess. Restaurant does not have people to server everyone. People were cutting in front of us and got themselves seated. Waited a very long time for food. 40 min or more. One star so owner hire more people.

Free desert for honest review.

They were a little reluctant to give me by myself a table but once I insisted it was awesome. All the fun of coming here is cooking the meat in my opinion, like at a yakiniku place in Japan that I often miss. It's very reasonably priced too and everything is great. I didn't really like the sides that came with it, but that's personal preference (not a fan of cold pickled bleh kimchi and vegetables). But nonetheless, I definitely will return.

I read about such things before, but this was the first time it happened to me. Dined at this place twice during my business trip to Vegas and I did enjoy the food. Until I saw the amount on my bill and realized they altered my receipt. This is a business trip so I did keep all the receipts and took pictures.

Wow! A must in Las Vegas. Best Asian BBQ I have ever eaten! Service is amazing and super friendly as well.
Thank you to our server Back and the host Jin.
I can not give this place enough stars.
High quality food and service. Would come back next time I'm in town. Good music with the projector as well. Got full off the meat lovers combo for 3 of us
The food is very very good and the price is reasonable?best Korean BBQ I ever been in Las Vegas

After looking at all the good reviews, we finally decided to come to Gungnam Asian BBQ.
The overall environment was great. Service was wonderful.
For appetizer, we ordered chicken karage and tobiko. The spicy mayo with the chicken karage was an amazing combination with lots of flavor. The tobiko was cooked to the right texture.
For our entree, we ordered beef tongue, beef toro, beef Kali, pork belly and mushroom medley. All the meats were really fresh and delicious.
To add a little extra onto your meal, they offer 7 really good side dishes of the day as well.

This is my favorite Korean restaurant. I used to come here every Monday while attending UNLV. 
The food is excellent and so is the service. I can't say what is the best dish because everything is delicious.
We came here for my birthday last year and it feels good to be back
