Wow...it was really good...highly recommend it ..try it you won't be disappointed .....

Simply put: great staff. Good food. Not the best meat per se, and a bit too fatty otherwise good selection of Korean bbq.. minus is that you come out smelling like bbq as system to absorb air doesn't exist

Top quality bbq, great selection, good service.  Very popular, white guy wait long time.  We had the meat lovers and all cuts were good, if not necessarily asian flavored.  Sides included kim chi (nice) and macaroni salad (wtf).

I really enjoy this place and used to go every Tuesday for lunch. The servers are great and friendly and they are very attentive.  I love the calamari here it always is crispy, flavorful,  and doesn't have too much batter.

Best Korean food in Vegas....PSY would agree!!!
My brother and I ordered the Meat Lover and a side of romain lettuce...we are both big eaters and still had food left over!!  Free dessert was a bonus!!  Make rezzies as we waited 1.5 hours on a Wednesday!  Worth the wait though!!

Wonderful food and service. There was more than enough food for our entire party of 3 with the Gangnam meal. We also ordered some extras and the bibimbap was a standout. The marinated meats were also exceptional and everything was really fresh. Go and enjoy!
Excellent meal and a great break from the usual stuff on the strip. Delicious bimbimbap and bbq.

Omg to die for!  Everything that my family and i tried was phenomenal! This is such a fun happy atmosphere!  Plus the waiters and waitresses are super nice! FIVE STARS! GO HERE PEOPLE! I promise You won't regret it!
Very good food love the meat lover special they have an assortment of berf and pork meats. Grrat customer service.
Nice place, family style food.  My children love grilling on the table. Food is really good.
Excellent place especially for late night value, go for happy hour apps.  Bi bin bap, calamari,  chicken karage, cream cheese wonton

This is a really good korean bbq place.
I recommend coming during lunch because there is almost no wait! Gotta try the korean prime galbi, that is the best dish in here!
Also better know a little about korean bbq because you will do almost everything by yourselves.
Got the "Las Vegas" and loved it with the Kimchi Chigae Best lunch break before class
Good beef and fried rice! Although we waited for like two hours, it was one of the best dishes we had in Las Vegas!
This place is so big and huge!! I love the deco and the menu selection!! Will defiantly bring more friends back!!
Great Korean food! Wait was long since the restaurant is small. Being from seoul and having eaten at many places i can say this place holds up to the bbq restaurants there.

As soon as I found this restaurant I wanted to try it but don't be fooled by all these reviews and stars on Yelp. The restaurant was freezing cold, the service was awful, the food wasn't very good, and to top it off the server gave us some other person's credit card and ran away before we could tell her it wasn't ours! In no way is that ok. I will never go back to this restaurant again. 

When we got there we were greeted with the most unfriendliest server I have ever seen. She made us feel very unwelcome and as if we did something wrong by coming into the restaurant. 

After we were seated we were ignored for a bit. She never asked us if we had been there before or explained anything to us. After we ordered she gave us some kind of sauce and some side dishes. There was no explanation as to what any of it was. We tried 5 of the 7 side dishes and only one of them tasted like anything and that was cucumber. They were not good and the 2 we didn't try looked really unappetizing. 

When the meat came out again no explanation about how to handle and cook the raw meat so that there is no cross contamination or cooking times to make sure the meat is cooked properly so that we don get food poisoning. Ever other restaurant that has you cook your own meat that I have been to tells you these things. The meat was alright. It was nothing special. For the amount of stars and reviews this restaurant has I expected something better than mediocre.  

When we were finished we had to wait at least 15 minutes to get the check. We noticed that the server kept looking at us but was trying to ignore us. The table next to us who sat down while we were eating got their check before we did. We finally got the check and gave them our card. The sever then brought back the card and basically threw it on the corner of the table and ran away. She had actually  given us the wrong credit card. She ran away so fast we couldn't give it back. Luckily a tall skinny male server came an took it and brought our card.

If al the KBBQ places I've visited, the customer service here is the best yet... We didn't have to ask for anything bc they brought everything out timely... As we know customer service is not really prevalent with KBBQ. Meats were tender and not overly salty. We had the gangnam dinner and it was a great assortment of tastiness. Only downside is the lettuce is not a part of the meal and we had to order in addition to...

The wait was reasonable especially considering how many customers they have. And it's no wonder why they have such a large clientele, their food is great at a nice pricing. And the portions they give is generous. Such a good experience.
The food was great. The bulgogi bibimbap was delicious. And the ice cream sandwiches are amazing.
This place is great! Service was really nice and the food quality was really fresh. We order the meat lover for 6 and there were 7 of us which was more than enough. We had leftovers to take home too.
Meat quality is good, also the service! Highly recommended :) we tried the BBQ meat of best seller 1 and best seller 2, also the tofu soup and Japanese ramen.
Its our first time here so far: it has Nice atmosphere, accomodating staff & smells good inside lol
Food was really good. Got the Mongolian beef and the meat was not over cooked, which was nice. Not bad.

Love this place. They were very quick to get everyone seated and the food is absolutely delicious! For two of us we got the Las Vegas which was a variety of different apps and meats. It was delicious! Highly recommend checking this place out.
Great Korean BBQ.  Hit the spot for the whole family.  Ordered different meats and cheese fondue.  Nice decor.
Very disappointing! I think this restaurant is both over-rated and over-priced. Soup they serve is full of msg, not taste from natural ingredients. Not worth to visit again.

Not AYCE but the combos gave a great, delicious variety. My family got the Gangnam combo special with the bulgogi bimbimbap (which was AMAZING). It came with various side dishes (which you can request more if you'd like), miso soup, oysters, soft tofu kimchi, salad, and 6 bbq dishes; all of which were great. It's a little on the pricier side but for what you get, it's worth it! Will be coming back for sure!!
Be prepared to eat lots of food! The specials come with lots of sides. You get your moneys worth and everything is very tasty.
Excellent meat. Tender juicy. Highly recommend the harami miso and the spicy tofu. For bbq wise sweet corn is also not bad
Had high quality food, friendly service, and a beautiful display. Great family restaurant that can be enjoyed by both with relatives and with friends. Overall just a great restaurant
The food is delicious. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. Thanks for a great, authentic meal.

First time here & it was amazing, we ordered the Gagnum premium special for 2 but there was enough food for 4 people & got here in time for Happy hour & got pitcher of Sapporro on draft for jist $8.50. My new Korean BBQ place! Great servers also!!!

Great food. Enjoyed the meal during the trip out to vegas. Menus were simple to read especially with pictures. Had my doubts for Korean food in Vegas but it turned out to be great. Definitely worth the trip off the strip.
Bomb ass Asian BBQ! We ordered the 4 people meat lover  and an extra side of rice for 5 or us and it was more than enough food! We struggled to finish all of it.

I really liked eating here! The food was really good and plentiful. Only problems I had was the wait time :( We waited for an hour and 40 minutes before finally sitting down and ordering. Otherwise this place is worth it if you have the time :)

Pretty good food, excellent service!
Good ambience but construction going on near by.
Great place! They brought us everything on time and had good customer service! The Las Vegas for four people was plenty food with all sides included
Everything was amazing!!! The food is delicious, service is great and the prices are really good! Will defiantly come back!!!

The food here is delicious, high quality but the service is horrible. They didn't check that often to see if we needed to order more food. They almost charged us for some Kalbi ribs we never got. Food is very good but the service is bad.

It was my first time trying out this restaurant. Food was amazing. My boyfriend and I ordered the "Las Vegas" bundle and it was more than enough. Service was quick and friendly. The food was brought out right away. There will definitely be a second time.. a third, and a fourth ;)
We had beck as a server and he was absolutely great. This is my third Korean bbq experience in Las Vegas and so far this is my favorite
Food was great. Great prices. Good location. Sangria drink with real fruit was awesome.

Went here based on yelp reviews and was not disappointed!

I ordered the Korean style kalbi, duck breast, grilled onion, and broccoli. Then they brought out the panchan (the assorted sides), plus brought two other sides I wanted for free. So good! And such friendly staff!
Totally amazing dinner tonight.  This is my favorite Vegas restaurant.  Great meal.   Outstanding meats.   Great flavors.  Awesome!

Nice place, good food. Free desert with a review. I didn't like that they messed up my order for dumplings. I ordered veggie dumplings and got dumplings with meat. That's the only reason why they are getting 4 stars. Other than that, the food is great and the icecream too!

Pretty impressed with the food here! In Vegas on vacation and craving some Asian food. Definitely satisfied my craving :) it was on par with some bomb Japanese bbq places I go to in SoCal. The service was great too even though I came really late! Plus free dessert with a Yelp review :D
Awesome food!! Absolutely loved the uni bibimbap and beef tongue! I've never seen uni bibimbap anywhere. The meat portion is extra generous!

Big portions, tasty food, you get to cook your own food. Great attentive service. Would recommend to my friends interested in eating a delicious Korean BBQ meal while visiting Las Vegas. 

Among four people, we got the meat lovers combo package, which was just a little bit more than we needed. The sides of preserved vegetables, rice, soup, and other dishes were a good addition.
Nice Korean BBQ??? And free Macaron ice cream????????????? The beef strip was pretty good and I also like the shrimp!! I will recommend my friends to choose this BBQ in the future!

The female servers were so friendly. The male server who took our order was lazy. We got there at 11:30 when they opened and didnt leave until 1. We ordered veggie bibimbap, scallops, calamari, shrimp, mushrooms, onions, dynamite shrimp appetizer, asparagus, and king oyster mushroom. Also, hirami steak for me. Mainly seafood & veg bc my husband doesn't eat meat. The dynamite shrimp didnt come out until halfway through our meal. It was supposed to be appetizer. I think the server forgot to put it in bc he didnt write our order down. I think he got offended that I asked if he was going to write anything down. Oh well. Food was ok. I prefer gyu kaku. Faster service & better taste imo. We ordered the honey toast & it took fooorreever. Literally 20 min. The girl asked us twice what flavor icecream and she still gave us the wrong ones. If you've had honey toast in Hawaii, you know that the bread inside is usually hollowed out, cut into cubes & toasted with butter & drizzled with honey. This place did neither of those things. They left the bread inside whole & scooped icream on top. It was so hard to eat. We tried cutting it but it became a disaster & was so messy. We took a few bites & left it. The lazy male server was busy talking to another female server and left another female to clean off 2 of his tables & ours. He just kept yapping & didnt lift one finger to help clean off his own table. Unbelievable. The tip should go to the girls who helped us & kept checking on us but im sure they share tips. Would not come again.
Best Korean bbq in Vegas. We ordered the Kangnam combo for 2, really a lot of food for two people, great quality and great price! We'll definitely come back next time when we are in town:-)
This is the best BBQ place at LV.  Good environment, price is fair, waitress is nice.  I love the small dishes.  We ordered the $65 combo, nice try.... We will come back definitely.

Gangnam Asian BBQ is great! I have been to many Korean restaurants, this one is now my favorite! It is a great concept. You can tell they cared about every aspect of the restaurant. They have amazing food, great ambience, and superb service. I  love the music videos. I will defiantly return!
their chicken is very good?? server are very nice  too. this is second time come here and sure gonna come back soon??
Very good food. We got the Gangnam combo for 4 of us. Delicious. Would definitely come back again.

It's so delicious ~ I feel happy and excited. .
This is so amazing services. .I prefer  choosing bibmbap and kalbi.
went there 3 weeks ago... good food... good place to hang out .. try out all that fresh sushi..!!! little expensive but got to pay what you you get
Yahoo!! I found a great Korean BBQ place in Vegas.  This place beats many LA Korean Town BBQs.
This place is perfect for a late night get together for two or more!!! Food is always fresh and ready to eat upon ordering, not to mention a happy hour early and late that kicks ass!!!!

Pros:
Good place to sample decent Korea BBQs. Think of it like Korean food served in Japanese portions. 

Con:
It's a popular place and that means you wait...and wait...

Honestly, If you're looking for more authentic Korean taste and variety, there are other Korean restaurants near by.  The menu price seems a bit lower than other Korean restaurant price, but when you get your typical fill of meat, you do end up paying about the same.

My first time visit was good. This Korean BBQ is not CA style. This is more to cater to Vegas visitors but not bad at all. Meat portions seem smaller than CA style, but meat quality is good. Restaurant is smoky but not overpowering. Decor is pleasant modern. Place is clean and staff is friendly. Happy hour is currently 3-6 PM and some items are discounted up to 50%. I'm about to enjoy a free macaron ice cream courtesy of a Yelp check-in
Great service, delicious food, and all at a good price, highly recommend!! We got the bbq meats, bibimbap, and dessert and all was so so good!!
It's great for chill out with family when you wanna try to eat some korean foods. Reasonable prices

Super friendly staff, ambiance is warm and hip. Chicken Karage was perfect, ordered marinated spare ribs, pork belly, beef toro and bulgogi. All was amazing!! They play music videos on a big screen on the wall and it's just the right volume and a great choice of music. 

Happy hour is 3pm-6pm and 10pm- close. Ordered broccoli, asparagus, and sweet corn. Perfect amount for 4 people. 

Would definitely eat here again when we come back to visit from the Bay!!
Excellent quality and experience. Great atmosphere and a variety of side dishes!! The customer service is really nice too. Definitely coming back.

Delicious food. 

Decent prices.

Will come back next time in Vegas.

Make sure to try the appetizer with the Spicy Tuna.

Excellent BBQ.   3 guys and the food just keeps coming.    We ordered the 2 person meal and 2 extras - this was plenty of the 3 of us.  Topped it off with the honey cake - again shared between 3 of us - plenty of dessert.   

Enjoy!
Yummy !   Good customer service and great food.   Cannot get enough of this place.

Great potstickers!  Quality meat and clean atmosphere. Place was packed.  Pricing was fairly affordable. Had kpop playing on the wall. Only thing was there could have been more waiters and waitresses.
First time coming to this place and the Oysters is a must!! Beef very tender. Big portions. Definitely will come back!! Will definitely recommend this place to my friends!
Nice Korean BBQ restaurant. Great value and service. Would go back next time when I'm in town. :)
Good portions for the package combos. And the side dishes were great too. Recommend for anyone itching for some Asian now!!

Wow. Happy hour 52$ for 3 of us. Mo
re food than we could eat. 2.50$ Sapporo. Try everything. Loved it.

Simply Awesome. You will not be disappointed.  The bbq was fresh and well marinated. I had the bulgogi and pork belly. Also i had the tukbokki-this was the best ive had, very similar to ones i had in Korea Priced very fairly.
Theres a nice variety of korean dishes!The athmosphere is very cozy.Make sure you try their banana tempura for dessert!!
Came here twice during my trip in Vegas. Love the food?and it's value for money. I also like the service!
My first time ever having korean bbq and it was amazing. Staff is friendly and service is fast and delicious. I'll be coming back.
Went here on a family trip to Vegas. We all enjoyed the meal. Fresh ingredients and friendly staff. Definitely recommend.
Fun experience and great food. Attentive service. We will be back in April for sure! Don't be afraid to try everything.
Best Korean food I have ever eaten. Wait staff was excellent. The place was very clean.

Love it  

  best bbq ever. 

 Love the kobe and the kimchi


Great customer  service and can hear the screaming from outside. Haha
The waiters are very nice.  Happy hour is awesome. We do enjoy dining here. We have a party of 8 ppl.

Best korean BBQ I've ever had in Vegas. First time trying the calamari not fried. The beef brisket is awesome as usual. The chef was excellent at looking after at table and so as the other 2 servers. Would recommend this to friends.
Delicious fresh food and plenty of it! Close to the strip! Clean and well maintained dining area. Great ventilation!  Recommend to all!

Combination portion is perfect for two, if not too much. Kobe beef is a must try; kalbi is very good too.  Filet mignon is so-so, so is the shrimp.  Kobe beef carpaccio and tuna poki are both very good.  

Also ordered a separate steamed egg and the uni Kobe appetizer.  Uni is great.  Steamed egg is the worst I have ever had; way overcooked that I can't even tell it was egg.
Very good. Had the Las Vegas and meat lovers between 4  people. Plenty of food. Wait staff was great.
this place is absolutely amazing!! Staff is very friendly. The food is really good as well.
Great food and amazing service.  The staff is very friendly we will be coming back the next time we visit Vegas!
Delicious,good service,food come fast, hot enough ~I like original bibim,bbq also good!!this restaurant is good value !!
We just had lunch here, the meats tasty and tender and the banchan were terrific. Everything was well prepared. Expect a wait as it seems to be busy any time of day.

We ordered the most popular combo for 4 people. The meat is very fresh and tasty. The portion is huge and we could not finish it with 5 people. The service is prompt. We spent about 1/3 of what we spent at a Spanish restaurant in Aria but the food here is much better. I definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Great food and service, I came here several times already. The food is always fresh. The appetizers are must tries, my favorite one is the fried wontons. The tofu soup here is also a must try. The only improvement I would prefer is to serve the appetizers first rather than serve them at the last, everything else is perfect.

First impressions: the quality of the food was amazing & the service was excellent!

Would definitely recommend to family & friends

Enjoyable evening.  Limited choices of meat vs other KB we've been too.  Limited sides.  Ask for one of the sides to be replenished was told no longer available.  Staff attentive but staunch.  It was good but I've had better.  Not sure I'll be back.
Great food, friendly service, great happy hour, fun environment. We especially liked the calamari and bulging for grilling. Highly recommend!

Everything was bomb! Good quality meat and the restaurant is clean. The pork belly and the bulgogi were my faves. My daughter loved the miso soup, the seaweed salad and the pot stickers. Can't wait to come back!

We came here to escape the strip and boy  was it worth it!  The prices were on point and the food was unbelievable!  Definitely a place to return to on our next trip to Vegas.

Came to Vegas for my birthday and I just had to hit this place up again!  And bonus we came during happy hour which is the best deal ever!  Seriously ditch the strip and make this your go to spot!
Great food and service. Especially, one of their staff name back. I would recommend here if you love bbq. I will come back next time!
Me and a party of 8 came here to eat during happy hour. Everything was amazing! Definitely will be back. They also had macaroon ice creams with variety of flavors that I loved!

Love this place! The food was amazing and I got amazing and fast service for my first time there. Definitely will be coming back.

The appetizers were very delicious and filling before the actual meat even came out.

P.S. You get a discount if you are a student at UNLV. :)

We were visiting Vegas for the weekend and we couldn't find any restaurants on the strip that had authentic Korean food + BBQ. We decided to take a Uber here and the trip was definitely worth it. The food was amazing, the staff was nice and friendly!

Try the Beef Toro here. It was seasoned with Salt, Pepper and Sesame oil and it tasted amazing. 

If you are also looking for an side soup, get the Kimchi soup - it's the real deal.
very good taste. I got really full when I finished. And they offer free deserts with a good rate on google Yelp.  So you know what to do.

Delicious food! Loved the Salmon Carpaccio, it was succulent and tasty! We enjoyed a wide range of meat and vegetables from the menu.  The kimchi and other salads provided complimented the meat chosen.  The staff was quick, efficient and very helpful.  I would definitely return for dinner or lunch!
Nice atmosphere,  contemporary. Reasonably good food and price. Look out for daily happy hour deals.

Service was great. Ordered kobe beef, pork cheek, pork belly, and kalbi... i would skip the pork belly next time and double the pork cheek cause it was BOMB! and the kobe beef just melted loke butter. Good side dishes also.

So one might say Korean BBQ isn't the best EDC-recovery food but we were around the area and decided to check this place out due to the raving reviews (and also because we were tired of paying $$$ for mediocre Asian food on the strip).

The wait was around 15 minutes at 1:30pm on a Monday (although the lady on the phone gave us an hour wait on the phone just 10 minutes before we arrived). We ordered spicy ramen with Japanese sausages, marinated Kalbi, Bulgogi, and thinly sliced toro. All were super delicious!

Overall, very impressed by the quality of this Las Vegas Korean restaurant, I think we'll definitely be back if we're staying on the strip again. My only complaint was that it was 110 degrees outside and either the AC was broken or wasn't on strong enough but we were sweating through the meal ):

We went to Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. We had dinner reservations in a lot of different restaurant in different hotels. But what came out as our favorite meal, that we had to come back for seconds before our flight, is Gangnam. Service is great. Never had to ask servers to refill our water. Food service was quick. We ordered the premium set, and we wanted to substitute other items on the set, and they were easy to talk to and was able to change things no problem. (With a little extra $$ if the substitute's price is more). Every single thing on the set that we got was really good. We really liked the Uni bulgogi. The dish was very buttery and they don't skim on the uni pieces. And if I have to go back to Vegas, a trip to Gangnam asian bbq is a must! Totally loved the free macaron ice cream when you check in on Yelp!
super good. you guys have to visit here, and taste high quality korean bbq. I'll give you five stars

The food was good. The Kalbi meat was my favorite. I also like the bulgogi cut. The pork belly tasted like bacon. The karage chicken was delicious. The meat portions to grill were small. You did get free Korean side dishes though. We came during happy hour, so some meats were half off. The food came fast and the service was fairly good. Just be prepared to smell like barbecue after you leave. Airing out my coat now.

Well... it was like good i guess ..yeah. IT WASNT BAD SO I GAVE IT A FOUR . So anyways, the oysterd were so good...like soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good like very very very very very very very very very very very very very very good....speactacular like oh eme hay ....OMG OH MY HAY ZEUS. By the way.. i dont even like writing reviews because....you know... its not really fun..HONESTLY IM JUST DOING THIS BC U TOTALLY GET A FREE DESSERT BY DOING THIS. SO GO THERE N WRITE A YELP TEVIEW OKAY PPL.... YEAH MY JOBS DONE... I GET A LAVA CAKE YEEE....

They should be honest about the waiting time. We were told the waiting time is 20-25min when we came in, but in reality we have been seating here waiting for an hour, and there are still several groups in front of us. If they have told us we need to wait for more than 1 hr we would choose a different restaurant to eat.
The food was so good, the meat was melting in my mouth.!!! I recommend this place to everyone

OMG! OFF THE HOOK DELICIOUS AND FUN! I love love love this place and if anyone tries to convince me that there's a better Japanese BBQ restaurant around town they are fooling themselves! I've been 3 times since June 24th of this year....and I am ready to go back again....prices are great....the sides they bring you are slamm'n....music is on point,  and staff is always friendly....this is a must try!

Im in love. The food here was so delicious. So many things to try. I recomend the sukiyaki noodles and the spicy chicken with lemon sauce. For dessert tey the honey bread. Its so f¬∑¬∑¬∑en good. A bit pricey but its worth it. The staff is so friendly, so nice. A must try if your craving korean bbq.
Amazingly simple yet delicious and unique. A must try for lovers of meat and flavor. Don't forget to order a bottle of Soju or a soju cocktail. Will be here every time I visit.
Great Korean bbq in Vegas with a very good happy hour for food and drinks. The Toro and bulgogy were really tasty and the complementary sides are great.

Just awesome!  the best KOREAN BBQ Japanese style.  
the course for 4 serves enough more than 6 ppl, so tasty.

This was a fun place to visit just off the strip in Vegas while we rented a car for a day trip. We made it during their happy hour which provided a good deal on some of the cuts of meat, some sides, and some drinks including beer and sake. The restaurant was quite busy even at this off hour and I have to imagine it's really busy during peak times. The food was really tasty though we didn't care for either the sake or soju that we tried. Overall would recommend for an interactive dining experience that comes at a much lower cost compared to restaurants on the strip.

The spicy tuna kimbab was probably what life is supposed to be (i loved it) the service was quick and the selection while not massive, is still accommodating beer selection is quick and to the point and gives you the best selections from a few different regions all in all a great experience.
Good food and plenty of it. The cuts were great and service was good. No complaints definitely recommend to try.

This place is as good as it gets when it comes to Korean BBQ!  I have been here 4 times now and they never disappoint!  Top quality meats, friendly service and a good atmosphere.  This is definitely my go to place when I am in LAS!  Can't wait to go back!

Great quality of meat, great service, great side dishes
Really felt like home food away from home
Definitely hidden gem

Best Korean BBQ in town. 
Super good meat!
 Price is reasonable and the service was good.
I will definitely come back again :-)

Just had an awesome meal at this place! Highly recommend and the prices are great!! Smells so good in here while your eating. Make sure you have the server Back serving you. He is awesome!! Definitely coming back here soon!
Was in Vegas for work and did some research on where to get a dinner without spending a fortune. Food was really good. Service was greet. Would for sure come back when I'm in town.

We ordered the Las Vegas meal ($45 for two people) and there was plenty of food. As a matter of fact, it was too much food for two people. I don't know how they stay in business with a deal like that. Either way, we'll be coming back here whenever we're back in Vegas.
We asked for marinated meat but regretted it. All the meat was too sweet. It tasted like all the meat was marinated with the same sauce. The service was good though.

This is our first time here. Honestly, I've tried pretty much 90% of the Korean restaurants in Las Vegas. This is definitely among one of the best despite the price is a bit higher compare to others. I guess it is worth every dollar with the taste. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a new place for dinning around campus.

An annual pilgrimage and just as good as ever.  Server very helpful and happy for us to split the 2 person Gangnam Special amongst the three of us.

We will be back again next year, a pleasure as always.
great place for lunch! service is great. I loved the flavor of the beef and you must try the sweet corn with cheese.

Great varieties of choices! Definitely try the Meat lover combo, if you are into different kinds of meats!
Service is also great! 

Updates 6/7
---------------
Return couple weeks later, good as always!
Tried the Calamari, it was unexpected awesome! :)
Definitely will be back again!

We arrive about 10-15 minutes before happy hour at 3. Server wasn't to pleasant when we asked about tree happy hour menu.

Atmosphere: Nice ambient place with booths for groups up to 6 and provides plenty of privacy.

Service: Slow and not very observant.

Food: Quality of food was pretty good. Unfortunately they don't give a lot of ban chan after the first round even after asking multiple times. We got the meat lover for 4. Hey a free dessert for making this post.

Would give a better rating if service was better and the person meeting us at the door was nicer. Waited quite a while for the check to arrive and then after paying, still had to wait.
Place gave me way more food than I expected. A little pricey but it was definitely worth the visit.

Surprises to find good Korean food in Vegas. 
Good decoration and clean. 
Number 1, 2, 3 meat are must try.
Love the small dishes and 
all little complimentary dishes are tasty~~
Banana tempura is great!!
Very nice food!!!! Definitely worth the money. I highly recommend this restaurant.with the free ice cream,  for desert , it's an incentive to give the review.
Great Korean BBQ! All the meats are good, especially the duck breast garlic and Korean prime kalbi. Glad we found this place and will be on our list to come back to when we come to Vegas again.
The food was excellent. Fast service, great customer  service, very friendly abd helpful.  You get more than  what you paid for.

Omg me and my partner loved this place! The service was excellent as well! The staff knows how to treat the customer! I recommend this place to all who love Korean BBQ! This place is perfect for a date or with a group of friends! Very pleasurable dining experience. Would definitely come again when visiting Vegas! Kudos to the staff

Best Korean BBQ in LV. The Kobe beef was so good. My kids loved it. We had a coupon for a free ice cream macaroon and the staff gave us 2, so my kids would not fight over it.   Great place for family dinner or a romantic date. Come early, the wait gets a little long during dinner time.
clean, great service and delicious food.  we enjoyed the meat lovers BBQ, it's cook your own to!
Really good. Great meat and sides. Helpful staff. They also give you a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp so definitely do that

We dined on all the recommended dishes such as the Kobe beef, premium tongue, Kalbi, bulgobi, fatty briskets, pork toro, etc. All the meats were very tender and flavorful. Additionally they offer a great selection of alcohols during the happy hour specials. We'll definitely come back another time.

Great place for Korean BBQ.  They were busy so had to wait to be seated but the wait was worth it.  Loved the beef toro and bulgogi.  Bibimbop was really good and enough to feed 2.  Really good service.  We're from out of town but will definitely make this our togo place to eat.
Great service and most of all, extremely tasty food! We've been to a lot of Asian BBQ places and this has to be one of the best. We're staying in Vegas for a while, will definitely come back!

This is the best Korean BBQ restaurant.  The servers are nice. They give you plenty of side dishes. Their fast and waiting tone is not bad at all.  Highly recommended always packed. Try it and and you'll always want to come back.
The food and service was great but it was weird we had to cook the BBQ. Every other one I've been at they cooked it in front of you.

Tried this place for the first time today! Hands down my favorite Korean restaurant in Vegas! So glad I followed the reviews and came here! Very delicious and well priced! The service is outstanding and the ambiance modern with clean lines. Will definitely be coming in again. Especially to be served by Back! It's so refreshing to eat somewhere that has such tasty food complimented by great friendly servers!
Definitely hit up the place again when I visit Vegas next time. It's a decent place with good service and nice Korean food. I would say it can be in the top 5 Asian food restaurant list of mine.
Best Korean BBQ I have had in a long time!! Excellent service and very friendly.  For the amount of food the price is very reasonable...plus the free macaron with yelp check in was legit!

The meats here were delicious. We had the cream cheese wontons, the tempora udon, the mixed tempora, the dumplings, the beef toro, the Korean beef short rib - it was all good. The wait was a bit long but after eating here you can see why - delicious food all around.

And if you write a review for the place, you get a free dessert! 5 stars.
One of the best KBBQ that we've visit! Kimchi and bolgogi bibimbap is a must! Staffs are great we really enjoyed our time eating here! We'll be coming back for sure!
Amazing! Delicious! Meat lovers is the best. Macaroons, um yes!! Service was great. Will definitely return and try again
Great experience and great food. Good portion sizes and quite worth the money (I felt it was a great value). If you get a chance try the Tteokbokki. Reminded me of the street food in Seoul.

....well i would not even give it "one star"...this place sucks one girl a desk and two guys trying to get people done....sat in the coner...7 of us and they would not even wait on us for 15 mins we got up and left...!!!!

So good! First time! Will return! Best happy hour! Great deals! Love it!!! Try the bulgogi and the spicy pork. Honestly everything on HH is a steal. The fried rice is good, not great that is honestly my only complaint. Bacon wrapped asparagus so good!

We tried Gangnam for the first time for a late lunch/early dinner, after we swam for 50-minutes at the UNLV SRWC's lap pool. Needless to say, my hubby and I were famished, since all we had the entire day were coffee & one Kind bar, lol! 

We ordered the "Gangnam" BBQ package for two for $65.00, which came w/ five different cuts of marinated beef (i.e., filet mignon, Kobe, etc.) with the following accompaniment:  

two bowls of white rice, one big bowl of spring-mixed salad w/ light vinaigrette dressing, four pieces of quartered sweet corn (raw; to be cooked on the Korean table-top grill), mushroom medley, fresh slivers of garlic, and jalape√±o slices, SIX Korean side dishes (i.e., Kimchi, spicy pickled cucumber, macaroni salad, spicy pickled bean sprouts, etc.), and two bowls of miso soup.  All of the aforementioned accompaniment were flavorful, fresh, and DELICIOUS. :D 

The price was stupendous for all of the foods that came with the package, not to the mention the 10% discount we received for showing my UNLV student ID (GO REBELS!). Albeit, the amount of food seemed superfluous, but there is always the to-go box for the next day.

Super cheap, really tasty, extremely clean KBBQ. I will be coming back, this is a new favorite and is close to home. The other ones in Las Vegas has noticeable crud in places near where you eat. GangNam is CLEAN!

They served us a bunch of sides once we were seated. They tasted were delicious esp. the Fish Cake. We went there in a large party, so we ordered a lot of entrees. I would say they were all good.

But the best part was the desserts. The Ice Cream Macaroon was really yummy.

I would really recommend this restaurant for the location and the price.

The best kbbq I've ever had in my life! 

For my entire life until now, I thought the Korean food in Toronto was already the best outside of Korea, but this restaurant surprisingly exceeds the Korean food in Toronto! The prices are very decent and the portions are huge! 

We ordered the Las Vegas set for 2 and it was more than enough for 2 people! The bbq also came with some side dishes from kimchi to macaroni salad to deep fried cheese dumplings! 

We tried the mango and strawberry macaron ice cream for dessert (free with Yelp check-in). I love macarons and ice cream, so this dessert satisfies both my cravings at once!

Not only is the food very good, but the service is also excellent! Never in my life did I have the server mix the bibimbap for us! 

Usually, after eating kbbq in a restaurant, my entire outfit and myself smells like the food, but here, there is no smell at all! There is a ventilation right above the grill that captures all the smell.

I'm for sure coming back before I leave and for my many Vegas trips to come!
This place is so bomb! Go here! Your tummy will b so happy. I'm def coming back! I love Asian bbq!
The bugolgi is awesome here, super tender, amazing along with the kim chi soup. I also tried the sukiyaki noodle and the noodle were al dente.
We got the "Las Vegas", it's for two people ! This is the BEST place in town! ! It's close to the strip for the tourist
We did it up gangnam style!! Thanks so much for the awesome service!! This was the best food I've had in a while.

Update: came back for happy hour and the prices were great. Service was great too. Would highly recommend for others to try!!


The food was amazing! It definitely is quality you can taste!! The servers were attentive and demonstrated teamwork. The 1.5 hour wait was worth it and we will definitely return next time we visit Vegas!! The only improvements I can recommend are the seats (really hard and uncomfortable) and the waitlist protocol. They should have a buzzer or take down phone number to send a text. We had to wait even longer because they supposedly called out our name four times and we went for a stroll since there were still 6 parties in ahead of us.
Food is not bad and when I paid with cash, the server told me they do not accept old version of $100 bills without the strip!!!
We had bbq combo. It comes lots food all over the table.We definitely will come again this bbq place. It's so yummy

Oh my G!  One of the best so far!  Travelled all the way from SoCal to have fun here in Vegas and found this great restaurant!  Meat is tender and flavorful!  Definitely going to come back and recommend to family and friends!  Music is not bad at all!

Came here yesterday, and the waiting hour was 3 hours! So we decided to come back the next day during happy hour. The wait is a little bit shorter.
Loves the harami miso, it melt in ur mouth. Not too salty or too sweet. Just perfect!
Their sauce is also good. 
The cons is that the waiting for the food to come out is kinda slow. 
But we'll come back again for sure when we visit Vegas!

one of the best korean bbq place we have been. portions are enough, side dishes were great. place is kinda small and could get really crowded. i little bit expensive but its worth it. we got free dessert just by checking in.i wish the serves would be more friendly and attentive. meat has good quality. 

will definitely come back.

This place is a little out of the way locals but I think it's pretty good. First of all they give a bunch of side dishes that were all pretty good except for the macaroni, it tasted like it was full of butter. 

We got prime Kalbi, both marinated and not marinated. The not marinated one was the best thing I had this meal. The beef tongue was aight. If it was sliced a bit thinner or a bit thicker it would've been great. Pork belly was typical pork belly. We cooked it to crispy. The filet mignon was meh. Would skip. We also got the king oyster mushroom. It was aight. 

Get the prime kalbi. So good. So fat. So worth. 

Also get the sesame oil with sea salt. It's well worth the one dollar. Adds a lot of flavor to the meats. 


Also free dessert if you do Yelp reviews rn. ;D

Happy hour 3-6pm beats the crowd with half price drinks and $3-4 plates. Hot sake fragrance starts the meal of delicious tender marinated Bulgogi, spicy pork, chicken in lemon and even unique Korean chicken with cheese fondue (interesting, but not quite match K flavors). Reasonable prices, nice decor good for 2-4 dining. For large group, private room for 8 can be reserved.
We are very satisfied with our experience here! The bugolgi especially is very delicious and flavourful, and so is the salmon bacon! This place is a must try! We will definitely be back!

Thus far my favorite go to kbbq place in town. It is not AYCE, but the food is much fresher compared to other kbbq places. It has abnice red toned ambience. Music is on point. Very clean. The service is excellent. The staff is attentive. If you make a review on yelp, then you get a free dessert! There is also a happy hour menu from 3 pm to 6 pm and 10 pm to close.

We saw this place on the food network and had such high expectations. I was displeased with the service and the food was just okay. We ordered the Las Vegas, which is a meal for two. The meal consisted of five different meats and five different sides. We also ordered some ribs. Additionally, we tried the apple green Yuzu souju cooler. The drink was refreshing and pretty good. This place was a miss for me. I wouldn't give it a second chance.

Looking for serious MEAT? This is your place. You get all the little dishes of mystery treats PLUS the tastiest protein you've ever stuffed in your face hole. 

Come with friends and impress them with your ability to consume vast quantities of kimchee.
Great meal, best Korean bbq in Vegas, - got the meat lovers, highly recommended. Generous portions and quick service.
Amazing!!!!! My best friend and I are here from Miami and we need this place to come to Miami asap it's good quality food at an amazing price!!!!
Superb food, great atmosphere, affordable prices. It is small inside though so be prepared to wait if you're heading there around dinner. Try and call for a reservation.

Very close to the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, so it's good for students that are craving for Korean barbecue. But the price is kind of expensive for the amount of meat given. The servers don't really check up on your table so you have to go chasing for the servers to get what you want. Also, when I ordered the fried calamari, you can't really taste or feel the calamari inside. It's more of batter than the squid itself. Lastly, I'm more on the shorter side, so the chairs were kind of too far so I kept having to move forward to reach the table. Since the service we received was not good, we did not leave a tip so while we were waiting for our uber, one of the servers, came outside and asked if service was bad, and we responded by saying "it was alright" and he was like "I was just asking because you guys didn't leave a tip". How rude of him to chase us for a tip when service was bad. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN.

Great find! Place is super clean, decor is modern and atmosphere was really good. The ribeye, kobe and chicken  were delicious. Bonus for us was when the waiter told us the chicken was organic!  My 10 yr old loves to grill at the table so we frequent gyo-kaku grill at home BUT this place has better food and prices.
Food, price, portion was all great.  Service could be better.
this is the best korean restaurant in town....must try. They have delicious food, desserts, service and venue is fantastic...will take family here every week.

It was our first time in Vegas, and the food was great! You get to cook the meet on the grill right in front of you, and there's nothing quite like the sizziling of meat to get your appetite started. The drink special are also great. Good food, good drinks, I would definitely come back the next time I visit Vegas!

If you are hungry at night and looking for a place to come eat, then this is your place. The environment is seen very excellent. Must come for the Chicken Karaage. My first time here I had a sensational experience. The sever are very kind and you don't feel rushed at all, even though it was 12am. Recommend for a crew hang out.
Omg so delicious food is great. We love coming here. Service is ok needs a lil work but still worth it. Everything about this place is great!!! Always a good spot for some bomb ass Korean food!!!!
Great customer service awesome meat ! Went here with a friend and we had a blast (: can't wait to come back with more people the server was super nice
Experience with this BBQ place is excellent! The beef are very tender. The appetizers are very good.
This place is delicious!! The only thing that I recommend is to have rice paper and radishes for the meats. Great experience for the whole family.

highly recommend this restutant because of the nice service?I love the miso soup.
The beef and spicy pork is great???

This is the best korean BBQ we've been to! 
The Kobe beef is awesome and melts in your mouth.

This place is amazing!  It's clean and stylish, unlike some of the BBQ I have been.  Now keep in mind they do not have AYCE, which is good because you don't have meat just lying out until it is all gone; quality control is what I would say about their meat!

Now for beginners or people who never been to a Asian BBQ style restaurant like this, I would suggest ordering al la carte first.  I know they offer combo meal but it's a lot of food and you may be gambling with what you "may" like or not like.  You can always order as you cook.  Service is excellent and they check up on you in timely manners.  That was a big plus for me...we all know that server at that restaurant where the server just keeps coming back and interrupting...well that is not the case here.  

As for location, it is situated in a shopping center that offers multiple eatery places, sushi, mexican, etc.  The only thing I would be caution on is that it is located across the street from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.  I can only imagine just how busy they may be during the weekend.  If you don't want to wait or be in a crowded situation, I would suggest going during the week days.  

The thought of them now while writing this review makes my mouth water again!  Hahaha!
Great service, amazing stuff and the most important thing: fabulous food! They tought us how to cook lol

the food here is pretty good. the pork belly literally melts in your mouth. the only reason why I'm getting three stars is the shit service. my boyfriend and I were visiting Vegas out of town, but didn't wanna splurge on a hotel buffet. we walked in on a WEDNESDAY afternoon, no rush or anything. our waiter was extremely rude, nonchalant, and looked as if we were graced with his presence, lmao. it took forever 20-30 minutes to get his attention, he never checked on us. too bad they didn't wear name tags here. i was appalled! ive never EVER received such terrible service. 

if you'd still like to eat here, i would order a lot of food in advanced and double up on your banchan.

Great food, good portions, attentive service and very reasonable prices. I recommend ordering the sesame oil & sea salt for added flavor, regardless the BBQ you order. From the Bulgogi to the Bibimbap, it's one of the best meals I've had in Las Vegas.

Highly recommend - it's a great experience! We chose the "Las Vegas" option - so much variety and so much food!  We might have been better off choosing individual items but we wouldn't have gotten to try everything we did!  The miso soup was one of the best I've had, very flavorful.  The cream cheese wontons and edamame were good, as expected.  The 8 side dishes were a nice touch.  The shrimp were excellent, as was the korean chicken; the spicy chicken was too spicy for me so husband had that to himself.  Alternatively, I had the beef toro to myself; it was very fatty, in fact tasted like the fat on a grilled steak which I love but husband doesn't eat fat on purpose...(!) Get the bulgogi bibimbap instead of white rice; it's a more interesting rice dish with beef in it. Only had 1 piece of the broccoli cheese fondue, was just so much food something had to give!  The salad we didn't even touch until the end of the meal; we were pretty full but it had a nice light dressing that was a good ending.
Ordered the Las Vegas combo. Such a variety. Enough to feed 3-4 people. Staff was fine and the atmosphere was great. Worth checking it out.

Our first time here was two days and today is our second time! We found this place from Yelp and was skeptical how a restaurant with 3k+ reviews got so good ratings. The food is 10 stars and also the service. All of the staff were super nice and friendly. The meat is high quality and reasonably priced. The only bad thing about it is we live in LA so we couldn't come here very often. Keep up with the good work guys. We'll be back soon :)
First time here and random to find this place. The service was great but meat was just ok.  The food mostly tasted too sweet. The better thing is get a free dessert if we write the review for them.

Really good stuff.  We had the meat lover special for 4 people and they were helpful enough to change us the spicy pork for a chicken.

Great ambiance.  A bit far from the strip, but totally worth it!
This place rocks! Plenty of choices, good meat quality, good service and casual ambiance. Will definitely come back here again when we come back to Vegas.
Had lunch here a couple of times. Great meat, kimchi and the service was excellent. Will return for sure.

Portions VERY small and wait is long even during off hours.  Meat is okay, the same hot-water dough that becomes cream puffs and eclairs -- and the straight cylinders therefore have a lighter texture than their potato-based counterparts. These were classic iterations; lightly herbed, they had been gently browned on one side for a contrast to their pillowy interiors, and served with crunchy celery root, velvety sauteed black-trumpet mushrooms, soft and earthy goat cheese and a silken garlic cream for a very successful dish.

Great service! great food! totally will come back.
ambiance is pretty nice nice outlet for a date or family night! it made my night for me and my family. they also made sure everything is well taken care of

I wasn't too impressed with the quality of the food here. It's reasonably priced, but I wasn't feeling the selection of the food. We ordered the Kobe beef and it didn't taste like the Kobe beef I've ordered in other restaurants. The meats didn't really have much flavor and the dipping sauce was also bland. Its average Korean BBQ at best.

5 stars for the foods and services & decent price! I love both the marinate and raw beef. The oyster is worth to try. There is nothing to complain and remember to check in to get the creative macaron ice-cream

This place is so amazing. We found it through Yelp and have come twice within 3 days.
They are super clean and their food is the best

Just be ready to wait because it gets packed!!
Bulgolgi is the shaz and the music selection is out of this world. The decore is nice and the people are welcoming. The only problem i had was small food size.
This is the best Korean BBQ place in town it's food is amazing and the service is great!!!

Really good korean bbq!
The food was awesome and the service is very friendly and  helpfull.

I try to expand my horizon when it comes to food and asian bbq is one reason why. Finding a delicious place is hard and finding good service is harder. I found this place to be above average in both. It is perfect for families and short groups. Not good for take out obviously atleast with the things I ordered.
Coooool place! Near school and greatly recommend!!!!!! Order a premium combo and some extra things during the happy hour. The happy hour is between 3 to 6 pm and after 10pm. Will come back.

This place was actually really good. You get ALOT of food as well. I couldn't finish everything they placed at our table. The wait staff did take a little long to get to our table and take our order though and refill our drinks throughout the course of the meal but other than that I thought the food was great.

Visiting from California and saw this place on yelp! It lived up to its hype! Excellent food and excellent service.  The lunch special is alot of food and you leave filling full! The spicy chicken is superb and the wontons the best ive ever tasted.  I definaltely will come back here when visiting again.

One of the bet Korean food places around, my gf and I ate here and prefer coming here instead of Tofu Hut or Honey Pig... Food quality is great and the atmosphere is amazing... The servers are very attentive and made sure everything was going well. Highly recommend giving this place a try, and enjoy yourself...

**Vegetarian Review**

Good food! Servers were able to accomodate vegetarian needs. 

We ordered kambucha tempura, veggie dumplings, vegetarian noodles, and bibimbap.
Great service! I keep on coming back here when im in las vegas. We always get the gangnam set.

This place is amazing. Every bite was DELICIOUS. We got the combo with the Kobe beef, capriccio, and kalbi for $89. It said it feeds 2 but we had 3 ppl and still couldn't finish it! Great place. Will def come back.

I was looking to go at a good restaurant in Vegas that wasnt typical and not too expensive. It was a really nice surprise! My friend and I ordered The Vegas combo for two and it was incredible. The quantity was huge and there was a lot of vegetables and different of meat. The drinks were really good too. The service was perfect. The people that are working there are polite, sweet and sympathic. The price was amazing for the quantity of food we had. I highly recommend that restaurant. Its a must try if you are in Vegas. The restaurant isnt on the Strip but that really worth it.

Amazing k-bbq.
We loved it.
Meat is tender& juicy.
Really ,Really delicious.
Great customer service.
I Iwill be back here on my next trip to LV.

Great place! We were craving something really good in Vegas that was off the strip, so we saw that this was one of the highest rated restaurants in the area. It was surprisingly pretty empty when we arrived (around 1pm). My boyfriend and I were super impressed because they had a great lunch menu and a huge variety. 

We ended up getting a lot of items a la carte because there were some specific items that we knew we wanted to try. The menu ranged from a lot of items that we didn't normally see on a KBBQ menu, so we were pretty excited to try a lot of them. The side dishes were pretty great, but the waiters didn't offer complimentary refills, which is usually the norm in Dallas. 

We ordered enoki with bacon, scallop with bacon, pork belly, Korean prime kalbi, steamed egg, beef toro, and fatty ribs. The enoki and scallop were probably one of the favorites. The meats were all well-seasoned and very fresh. The kalbi was excellent and had good marbling. Overall, very good quality and price for the amount of food that we ordered. 

Also, you get a free ice cream macaroon when you check in. It's the same ones that they used to have from Boiling Point, so we were pleasantly surprised to find that it was a great quality one!
Great fast service, delicious food and great atmosphere! 10/10 would come back! Also, you get a free dessert for posting a review!
Woooo! After a night of party party party, Gangnam BBQ is the way to go. Great selection of meat & great service. My belly is all ready for EdC Day 2!

Our first time and from start to finish great customer service !!!! Love how spacey it is for everyone to eat and food space while cooking. My favorite has to be the beef tongue, super soft and not chewy. They are generous amounts of food portions doe everything. The tagu was super good, a little spicy but perfect! The desert is so yummy! I had the coffee macaroon ice cream .. Should come here and give it a try. Hawaii portions aren't this generous.

One of the best Korean BBQ places in Vegas. It is honestly hard to beat this place. From the friendly staff, to the amazing food, this place is awesome. So Much Juice On That meat. 

I went here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and we truly enjoyed ourselves.  There was a minimal wait, but this allows you to take in the scenery.  You can watch TV as well as watch k pop and pop videos. It has a nice soft red tone to the restaurant. We honestly couldn't wait to sit and eat .

The best Korean bbq I've ever been too. 
They don't have all you can eat but they do have good specials during their happy hour 10pm-12am. 
Also love the check in deal! Free ice cream macaroon! Yumm!!
Stopped in for a quick bite and let me tell you.... this place is the bomb.com, I loved it
Variety of food options. Large table with space to cook and have other dishes. Will come back to bring visitors.
This place is amazing! Best Korean BBQ this side of the Galaxy. And trust me, I know. I get the bibimbap every time. The macaroon ice cream sandwiches are equally delicious.
First time here.  Food was great!.  Good service. Very nice location. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.

Over 4,300 reviews at 4.5 stars?!? We have got to try this before heading home to Daygo. 

The wait: none, we were seated immediately

I'm going to try and remember everything we ordered:

Appetizers:
-2 steamed eggs: so fluffy!
-1 Kobe beef carpaccio: yum!
-1 Tuna poki: this was alright
-1 shishito peepers: just like anywhere else
-1 house salad: nothing special 

For the grill:
-1 Harami Miso: thinner than expected 
-1 Pork Belly: inconsistent meat to fat ratio where some were almost all fat whereas some didn't have enough fat. 
-2 Prime Kalbi: this was the best out of all the meats. So freakin tender and buttery. It was beautifully marbleized. 
-2 Beef Toro: just good
-1 Korean Prime Rib: had a good marinate to it
-1 scallop with bacon: it has bacon- nuff said
-1 enoki with bacon: love these little mushrooms
-2 kabocha squash: it was cut too thin, just a tad bit thicker would've made it more enjoyable 
-1 Japanese peppers: no kick to it 

Just because:
-1 mushroom medley: already cooked, meh
-1 bibimbap: I didn't try but everyone that did liked it
-1 spicy ramen: the broth was flavorful but needed a kick to it, it is called "spicy" ramen after all. 

Overall experience:
Good food, great company, and friendly service
It's really tasty and delicious for the bbq meat and appetizer! Also love the attitude and service here
Satisfied with serviced. Second time coming here in 3 days. Food is probably the best here for value.

Soooo.. I was looking for a nice spot to have Valentine's Day dinner & happened across Gangnam. It might be off the beaten path, but it's definitely a diamond in the rough. Got here for happy hour & waited about a half hour to be seated. Ordered pork belly, chadulbegi, bulgogi, chicken fondue & a few other things. Bulgogi was not exciting, but everything else.. Wow. Simmered to perfection. Topped it off with a refreshing Sapporo & dinner was complete. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

This is different from what I'm used to back home but it was good nonetheless. Good food, they have three different combos to choose from. We chose Las Vegas and ordered more meats on the side. Very clean establishment but only downside is that we didn't get water until halfway through our meal. Go before 6 pm because it got busy as we were leaving at 7 pm.
First time at a Korean BBQ and it was a great experience! I'm vegetarian and there were still plenty of options for me. It was a fun and enjoyable meal.

This was your average Korean bbq experience, nothing really special. We ordered the combo for 2 with shrimp,fiet mignon, pork(total of 6 meats). The spicy pork belly was amazing the rest of the food was a little above average. Overall the service here was average nothing to write home about!

It was just ok.  If you wanna spend around the same money go to Hobak for a much better experience.

If you want ayce I suggest hwaro or gen both for under 25 bucks.
Enjoyed!  Got the Gangnam dinner for 4.  Good meats and tasty side dishes.  Great lunch deals! ^^

Coming from LA where KBBQ is everywhere and amazing, this was a disappointment. 

My friends and I came in late on a Friday night after a long drive to Vegas. We were stoked to find a KBBQ so close to the strip! Got there around 11pm as they close around 1am. The restaurant was pretty empty. We were seated quickly and told it was happy hour! Score! Here's what we ordered: 

- fried calamari, 2/5
- chicken karaage, 4/5
- beef toro, 3/5
- pork belly, 3/5
- beef bulgogi, 3/5

Everything was mediocre. Nothing out of the ordinary and pricey for the size of the portions. We ended up ordering 3 orders of the beef toro! What really gave this place low stars was the service. They were nice and all but seriously nowhere to be found whenever we needed anything. Our orders took forever to come out and after the long drive, we just wanted to eat! Also, our grill was literally on fire until someone casually came out and changed it. Our server also made weird, awkward, borderline inappropriate jokes and just gave the whole experience a weird vibe. 

Don't think I'll be back. So many other places to hit up that's ten times better!
Efficient but friendly! It not only tasted great, but it was a great and fun experience. Highly recommend if you want something new!
Very good place. Nice service & great tasty! Cheap price! There are good interior. The foods were very fresh! I like there so much~!

I came here on a Friday night with my mom when we were in town. We didn't want to eat buffet two days in a row so we decided to check this place out. It's off the strip btw so you'll need to drive or take taxi/uber/lyft. We got there around 7:30pm and we put our names down. We waited roughly 45 minutes to hour. It didn't seem that packed when we got there but I guess people put their names and came back to walk around. I was getting super hungry and the smell of the food made even hungrier. We got seated in the back room and it was some-what quiet which was nice but the one thing that kind of sucked was that it was hard to get the waiters attention since not many come by so I had to get up and find someone. Anyways, this place is NOT an AYCE but they have set menus that you can pick from and we ordered the Gangam set. For two people, it is a lot of food so it is almost like an AYCE to me. There was tons of meat (kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly, toro and veggies). All meats were very juicy and marinated well so you don't really need to use the sauces that they provide. The sauces all tasted a bit salty to me so I don't recommend the sauces to be honest. Other than, the food was amazing, service wasn't bad and pricing wasn't too bad ($60 for two people). I'll try some other menu next time I'm in town!

We chose the Gangnam special for two. It was WAY too much for two people! It was like 6 kinds of meat, three side dishes, and about 6 little sample-sized bowls of seasoned veggies. It also came with a large salad. The environment was fun, you get to cook your food on a grill at the table. I'd say the amount of food for two would be better for 4! We are not from Vegas but I would definitely go back again, but if we did we would probably order off the a la carte menu and pick the meats we really enjoyed like the filet, or the seasoned flank steaks.

Great deal for Happy Hour ! Discounted prices for appetizers and meats. Its like $3 for an order of pork belly or beef toro (brisket). 

Came here for "dinner" before an event i had to go to, with a friend. She had been here before and was on the way, so had me order (before it hit the end of Happy Hour time). She liked the Pork Belly and Pork Toro. 

Service by this young korean waitress was superb. Very friendly and funny. 

We had ordered 3 pork belly, 1 pork toro, 2 toro beef, and 1 prime kalbi. 

The pork toro (pork cheek) isn't discounted. - $5.95 - As the "toro" name suggests, it is highly marbleized with some thick areas of fat on the edges. This isn't the first time i've had pork cheek (similar to pork neck meat as well). When cooked properly, and a good quality meat, it should have a super tender texture, and "crispy". Not like a hard crispy but like crisp to bite through. I cooked it in a way where it seared the fat giving it a nice crisp in the fat. The pork toro is NOT marinated or seasoned in any way. Quality, to me, seems not up to what i had imagined. Overall still not bad, but could be better. But pork cheek/neck meat is quite expensive. somewhere along $10-15/lb, wholesale. X_x 

Prime kalbi - $8.45 - quality wise, wasnt that good either. For them to put the "prime" name, id expect a high quality cut of meat, flavorful and tender. Not to the point of aged meats, but you know what i mean. The prime kalbi is seasoned with some slight marinade topped with some finely minced garlic? Pieces are a fair thickness. Cooks nicely. Not as tender as i hoped, nor was it as marbleized as i have had this cut in other places. 

Toro Beef - $3.45 - otherwise quoted as "Beef Brisket". By no means it is the Toro i was thinking of. It is straight up brisket, similar to that of what you get any where else. Misleading name, but i guess it was my fault for believing it may be more towards to the Toro name vs the quoted brisket name. Thin slices of meat. Cooks fast. Simple as that. 

Pork belly - $2.95 - surprisingly, this was probably the best of the 4 items we had ordered. Even compared to the pork toro or prime kalbi. sad but surprising. Lol. Simple pork belly cuts. 

Overall, not bad experience. Priced fair during happy hour. Pretty sure i wouldn't be ordering the meats not during happy hour though. Nice place to try if you are in the area. 

They have a lot of appetizers discounted during Happy Hour as well. Didn't try any though.
Food was good and the service was great! Enjoyed the Gangnam for 6 people even though we had 7. I would recommend this place if you're looking for a Korean BBQ place in Vegas.
this was my first Korean BBQ experience and it was amazing. I visited the restaurant during lunch; thewaiter was extremely helpfu to me for my first time visit and the food was incredibly good.

Been here twice and don't like the service but food was ok, a little on the sweet side and way too much ponzu sauce with every dish. It wasn't a wow factor for me. I was just disappointed at the service mostly. They don't come by to check on us and most of the time we needed water to be filled, and see lots useless of waiters standing around. When we ordered food, they all came out at once which was overwhelming. Salad or appetizers should come first but all in awkward order...I am not liking the way this restaurant runs...will not be back!

The restaurant is located about 10 minutes from the strip.The price is really reasonable and the food is nice and decent. If you want some decent Asian food in Vegas I highly recommend the restaurant.
Just landed in Vegas and we decided to eat here for lunch. I didn't know what to try but decided on bulgogi.  It was very good!!!

3 stars just for the food. Horrible service, no checking on our table, no water refill, no clearing table and added 18% on our bill (maybe she knew she certainly has that tip amount on a table of 6 so didn't care anymore)  Shame!
Ended up getting the vegas combo. The food was amazing as well as the service. I definitely recommend this place to anyone!
Had a business lunch here. Food was awesome. Service was a little slow. I'd definitely go again.

This place is worthy of 5 stars! It is so fun to grill and cook your own meat. Besides the 45 min wait time, the food came out so fast. The meats are so flavorful. Loved the ability to rate on yelp to get s free DELICIOUS coffee flavored macaron! Gangnam is definitely worth visiting!

Great Korean food in Las Vegas! I got the 2 person Gangnam meal with my teenage son, who was starving! Thus the food better be plentiful and spectacular. It came with an assortment of meats and appetizers. All the meats were tender, flavorful and the filet mignon was melt-in-your mouth good! The miso soup that came with the food package was too salty and the bulgulgi bib bim pap was too sweet for my palate. So I got the plain white rice. 

The service was decent, but they were very rushed around because of the flood of people that came in. They could have used one or two more service people. 

We'll be back!

This place is so delicious!! We ordered 4 different types of meat. The miso harami was my favorite! We also ordered the Korean short rib, bulgogi, and brisket which were also really good. The quality of the meat is on point! Plus, they give you macaroni salad and fish cake among other sides, but those 2 were definitely my favorite. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone not looking for ayce!

This place is freaking legit!  Coming from California, this place is easily one of the best I've had. The wait was a bit long but that's expected for any Korean spot that's this good. We had the Premium dinner set. I wanted to try their best cuts and you actually save some money by going with the preset meal rather then ordering them individually; trust me I did the calculations.  They also said that the portions were the same whether you order through the set meal for the individual dishes. I don't think any place has authentic Kobe beef in America but this place has the Kobe style beef which was really really good here. If you haven't tried that type of beef you should definitely try it once in your lifetime.  All four of the different meats that came with the meal were all really good so I would recommend you try the filet mignon first otherwise if you eat that last you will be disappointed. The tuna pokey was also really good and so was the beef carpaccio. The meal also came with different dipping sauces to go with the meat and all of them were very good. My wife also said that the salad was really good, I ate a little and I would agree. Even the asparagus came out really well, not overcooked. They put it in foil and cook it in butter and you can taste it. The side dishes are just OK. The bibimbap wasn't that great, the rice wasn't that crispy. All in all, one of the better Asian places in Las Vegas. Service was very good as should be expected in any Korean joint.

For a non all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ, you get a TON of bang for your buck. We opted on a la carte options for happy hour and got beef toro, Korean prime kalbi, pork belly and bulgogi for our meat options. All were delicious and almost as good as my moms! (Just don't tell her.) The banchan (side dishes) are delish, as well! Will definitely be back!
Was surprised at how good the food was here. Wasn't expecting much but was blown away by the food. Definitely recommend it here!
This is first restaurant I stopped in Las Vegas because the review was 4.5 and all staff were very friendly, but the foods are not good as much as I thought...
great koren bbq food. We travel to Las Vegas a lot and we will visit it every time. The meat is very fresh, especially the Kobe beef, my favorite!

Patrick went above and beyond for me. I had a small reception after a ceremony at the Hard Rock Hotel. Our party of 20 walked over as it is across the street. 

I started communicating with Patrick several months before the ceremony. He was very attentive and helpful even when I started to forget about the food as the wedding got closer. 

Patrick and I facebooked and texted as the date came closer. He confirmed with me the day before and the day of. When we walked over, they were ready for us, all set up and immediately began bringing food out. Everything was delicious and we were all very full walking back to the hotel. It was an overall amazing experience.

* Setting? Typ. BBQ Korean place
* Prices reasonable? YES
* Nice service? YES
* Yummm? YES
* Place was quiet? Moderate
* Would I go back? YES
* Restrooms clean? YES
* Tips? FREE DESSERT! Check in on Yelp app

This place was really really delicious! A must try and you will fill up with the amount of food they give you. I was happy with everything except the sides. They really didnt go well with the food and they were just all spicy sides. Ive have some great sides with these BBQ places like the pickled onions. But other than that. The service and food was great!

This is the best Korean Bbq of all the Bbq places i have been. Yummy side dishes!!! I ordered vegetarian version of Japche ,Original  Bibimbap  and Everything tasted pretty good. Don't miss the macaroon ice-cream .
The Food was really super duper delicious, the best marinated beef I've ever had at a Korean spot , great service, good music

Went to this restaurant with a group of 12 co-workers and I must say the atmosphere is pretty relaxed but definitely has an upscale feel to it.  All of the meats were of very high quality and flavorful.  The fried rice is also very delicious and enough for two people to easily share.  The staff was very accommodating.  I look forward to going back again when I go to Vegas in March.
Best meal I've had in a long time... the amount of food they give you is a lot you will not finish it.. will be back next time I am in Vegas I will be back

My 21st Bday dinner couldn't have been any better. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. Shout out to Daniel, Joseph, Donggi, and David for making my experience wonderful!! They were attentive to our needs and gave us awesome recommendations too. 

We ordered the Gangnam combo with another order of pork belly and a couple of drinks. Every meat in the Gangnam combo was marinated, high quality and made it a sexual foodgasm experience to the max. I wasn't blown away by the pork belly, it was meh. 
And as for drinks, The peach soju is the bomb dot com!!! Delicious and easy to down. 

Hopefully you get the same awesome servers / experience as I do!! 

Tip, happy hour for drinks are from 10pm to close!!
Great food, great service! The korean prime kalbi, premium tongue, pork toro and spicy soft tofu are really good. Will be back here for sure;)

Amazing Korean BBQ! Meat was so tender!
I do not normally eat beef but when I do, I have high expectation. The meat quality and taste is definitely delicious and perfect! We enjoyed it so much, although far from home, we will come back the next time we visit Las Vegas!
Hit the spot!  Good portions, gahlbi was amazing.  Very juicy and tender.  Nice chill atmosphere, attentive servers and great food deliver an all around great experience.

Just worked a 16 hour shift and I broke my fast by grabbing some Korean food. I was in town from California to Vegas. Ordered bibimbap and I was super happy, they mixed it in front of us on a hot stone plate I was surprised because it was so different than eating in Korean food in NY home town of garden grove. I was impressed with the quick service definitely good food for a long day at a late night
Absolutely amazing. Never been more happy with a Korean bbq place. Prices were great and the food was excellent. Go with confidence
Meat was tasty. Establishment was clean. Service was fantastic! I dont know why I haven't been here before. The pork belly and beef brisket were the best. Im definitely coming here again.

High quality meat, extremely rich in flavor, great service, & a cute ambience. What more can you ask for? Our server suggested we try the gangnam style BBQ for our first time. From the starters to the dishes, you will not be disappointed! At the end of our meal, we still managed to squeeze in dessert, which was just as good. From the mochi ice cream to the lava cake to honey toast, everything here was on point. Definitely set the standards for Korean BBQ for me.
There's a lot of peoole on Sunday afternoon but it's really worth waiting. Food is awesome!
Try the beef cheeks. They rock! I enjoyed the rice as well. My family really enjoyed it! We will come back soon.

My husband and I walked over to Revolt Tattoo from the strip and everyone recommended this place. We went and weren't disappointed at all. The food was a great value. We had a ton of sides before our meat came out for us to cook at the table. The food came out quick too. We cooed our meat right at the table and enjoyed the great taste of everything. We would definitely recommend and return when we're on Vegas.

This is my first time at this Korean bbq.  I have to say that it was delicious!!!!  A lot of food for the money but well worth every penny.  I will definitely be coming back to this place the next time I'm in Vegas.

The price wasn't so bad, we went during happy hour. We did not opt for any of the group packages and it came out to $100 for 4. We ordered so much food, a soup and drink. Definitely a must visit for social gathering. A few of our favorite meats were the spicy pork, bulgogi and beef toro. The filet mignon and prime meat was just meh to us. Don't forget to try the sweet corn with cheese! That was tasty. 

The wait time was not long at all, we got here at 3:30 on a Friday, Labor Day weekend. We were seated straight away.

Food was good, but service was reaaallllllly bad. We ordered more bulgogi, and after about 15 minutes, we learned it was delivered to another table. The server took it off their table and tried to give it to us... Seriously?

We arrived and were promptly seated and given menus. We decided on the Meat Lovers but substituted spicy garlic edamame for the seaweed salad that was standard. Our sides arrived quickly.  I noticed that we were the minority and the clientele was primarily Asian so I took that as a good sign.  

Having never had Korean BBQ before it would have been nice to get some instruction on what to do with everything.
