As an example, we cooked our meat on the sides instead of in the middle and it kept sticking to the grill. When there was just a little meat left on one plate, the server placed it on the grill for us and that's when we realized our placement error. 
Another thing that might be helpful is some type of labeling on all of the different items so we would know what we were eating.  
Everything we had was delicious.  I think the standout for me with regards to main dishes was the marinated pork.  All the appetizers were amazing.  The miso soup was so rich and flavorful.  The dressing on the salad was delicious and just the right amount of sweet.  The chili dumplings had a really tasty sauce and I thoroughly enjoyed the spicy garlic edamame.  
We discovered why they have so many reviews, too! Free dessert for posting a review.
Overall, I really enjoyed my experience and would like to try it again, maybe someplace else to see if the experience is the same.

Me and my husband came for date night and it was so delicious! We got the "las Vegas" options and we had tons of food. All the sides that came with it were amazing and we had no idea what some of them were. It was our first time at Korean BBQ and it was great. I also got the peach martini as well as the Apple cooler, both were so good and dangerous because you can't taste the alcohol. The one thing I wish the server would have done is explain the process a bit, as I said it was our first time so I wasn't sure how the meat needed to be cooked and etc. also didn't know what the sides were. I saw so many delicious looking things coming out of the kitchen to guests next to us and wish I would've gotten a bit deeper into the menu. However, the host told us when we come back he would order for us, which we are extremely excited about! We will be back.
The food was awesome and the selection of side dishes was great! Best meal in Vegas! No issues finding parking as well.

Service and food was excellent. I love the music videos playing in the waiting room, that was neat. The prices were fair since the quality of food was good. We did not have to wait long on a Saturday night. I highly recommend this Gangnam Asian BBQ!
Great bbq. The oysters left something to be desired. The korean waitresses do not cook the meat for you but they mix the bimbimbap.

Amazing service & delicious food!!! Definitely a fun spot. Went with my family and we really enjoyed the atmosphere here. There are many things to choose from. They also give complimentary appetizers that are delicious!

Wanted to have a family dinner for our last night in Vegas and this place obviously had great reviews so we went for it. The wait time for a table wasn't that bad for a Saturday night. Maybe 30 mins? The staff was so friendly. Refilled our drinks whenever it was low and of course the food was delicious!
Great place for Korean bbq :) filet minion is amazing and selections are great... Service is great and just a nice clean and cozy place to eat

The meat was very soft and tender. All of our family members enjoyed it so much!! When the meat sizzled as it was cooking, it sounded like music to our ears. I believe this time, it was the best music of all. The kimchi was well flavored and I enjoyed the pickled radish. Overall, the meat is delicious to be eaten in any way and the side dishes and salad is fresh and yummy!!

New to this style of Asian food, nevertheless the wait staff were extremely patient with all of our questions. They also made suggestions that enabled us to try more dishes for less money, which was TREMENDOUSLY appreciated!  The food was fresh and delicious. A few items were too spicy for me, but they were still flavorful. Service was excellent! Prices quite reasonable.

Came here with my brothers and sister-in-law during a trip to vegas, and was more than impressed. We had our own private room in the back (even though we were just a party of 5) and the waitress was very attentive, and explained the menu well. The paradise A combo i split with my brother, and we got more than enough food for even 3 people.  The Harami Miso, prime kalbi, and calimari were all top notch. The meat and veggies were brought out quickly and you could cook them to whatever liking you choose. I'd come back here on future vegas trips.
We ordered the meat lover for lunch and it was great. Delicious, good service, and good portion. Also free dessert for writing a review haha.

Wow... Bomb.com

Best KBBQ I've had in a long time. Seriously delicious. You might need to bring a change of shorts when you come. You'll bust over the taste.

We went here on our first night in Vegas and really enjoyed it. The meat quality is pretty good, and the price is very reasonable. 

They have great family dinner value.

Hmm, probably not the best korean BBQ ever, felt like overpriced. The portions are tiny. But hey, we've got a complimentary ice cream.
But it was fresh I'd say. Servers are pretty good!

I was craving Korean BBQ and found this restaurant. We ordered the original bibimpbap, steamed chili dumplings, spicy chicken, bulgogi, duck breast, and kimchi chigae soup. The original bibimbap was my favorite, but everything was delicious and definitely satisfied my craving. I highly recommend this restaurant for any Korean BBQ lovers.
I got the Spicy Ramen with Sausage and it was to die for! I loved the spices in it. Perfect spice not too hot but delicious!! Our server Back was great, made the visit a pleasant one!
Great food. Easy for a group. Really good vibe. Only a few tables for big parties, so plan for that if you've got more than 4.

The Kalbi was so delicious and the bulgogi was also savor I also liked the chow rice
Great service too!
This will be go to korean bbq for us in vegas !
This place is great. Food great. Service great. Price is good too. Very affordable. Fed a family of four for under $70. Will come again
Good amount of food~ it's clean and nice atmosphere. Definitely try the spicy tuna kimbap
The food is very good and the staff is very friendly. Try their macaroon and taste sonething delicious.

The meat was very exquisite but the side dishes could be better. I do love that if we check in we get free macaron Ice . The waiters were great definitely was there when we needed them. The price is definitely average for the type of meat you get
This place had good Korean barbecue that was in Las Vegas. I liked the food and meat that was served here.

I was visiting from Austin and decided to dine in here. I write this interview while sitting at the dining table because I could just not wait. Daniel was my waiter. Joseph and David were also involved in our experience. They all deserve a raise. They were the best kind of restaurant staff you could ever ask for. Hands down must come here!

We enjoy coming here . Better then gen Ayce buffet . We usually stop by here just before we head home . Today i had a good service. Better then last time and I enjoyed talking to one of the waiter . He helped me check in and I got a free ice cream . All the servers were nice and attentive. Thank you and i would definitely recommend this place .
We ordered KALBI and SOONDUBU and it was delicious. Portions are relatively small and the wait was long but the food was worth the wait.
Awesome food and fun for the kids!  Wait staff was friendly.   We would definitely recommend and will come again!
A great selection of meats and dishes. I'm so glad we stumbled onto this place. Great service.

I've been here wayyyy too many times to count.  Every time I stop by LV, it's the first stop right after getting off our plane.  On this trip, we came here 3 times out of the 4 days we were here.  It's insane how much we like this place!

For one, the food is delicioso!  The meat seems high quality.  I'd recommend sticking to the bulgogi and steaks.  I found their chicken, shrimp and anything meat wise to be ok. I like getting extra lettuce to wrap meat in, mushroom medley and broccoli fondue if you want a different kick in eating broccoli.  The other things that were ok was the macaroon (too old in that freezer so it was a bit stiff and way too sugary) and sauteed shishito peppers (we can make it better).

Overall, definitely a place we keep coming back to.  Service is a mix between ehh and decent depending on how tired or disgruntled the waitor/-ress is that day.  The price makes up for it and a really great deal for what you get!

Great food, I especially loved the grilled beef and broccoli cheese fondue! This was our first time here and we will be coming back when we visit Vegas. Although the restaurant is not located centrally on the Strip, it's worth making the trip (by cab) out to Paradise Road just to go to Gangnam Korean BBQ.  If you're looking for authentic food instead of your typical chain restaurants located on the Strip, eat here!
Great place during happy hour!! Loved the $4 Bulgogi :D so nice with some rice! Pretty cheap with happy hour when wanting that late night dinner!! Recommend!
We went with the $89 meat option and everything was absolutely amazing!!!!! The meat was good the starters were just delicious! We cannot wait to come back!

I used to only go to all you can eat bbq places. However, these days I prefer quality over quantity and Gangnam is just that. I absolutely LOVE this place!! 

Good vibe, good music, and I like all the Kpop music videos they play on the screen. I like how they treat you as you are walking in and very friendly servers! 

Hint: Happy hour specials!! Seems like the owner is re-inventing the menu every so often for the better!

This is my second time coming here. Highly recommend the the combos for two people. It is more than enough food for two people. I ordered the Premium the first time and the Meat Lover this time. The Premium consists of meat and seafood as the Meat Lover is all red meat and pork. Both are Great, just depends on what you preference is.

I should give this place 5 stars just for the service. The service here is one of a kind, all the servers are helping each other and it makes it so easy for the costumer. 

As for the food, we ordered a lot of things and everything was delicious. It didn't feel 100% authentic Korean but this will do to satisfy my Korean craving while in Vegas!
Lived in Vegas 2 years now and this place is up the road from me. Second time here in a month and it is so good!!
The serving sizes are quite large and the Korean bbq was absolutely amazing! The side dishes were also great and really added to the experience!

The food is wonderful! Got the Kobe beef, bulgogi, Korean galbi w/ broccoli, corn, & bulgogi bibimbap. Comes w/ 6 banchan, all delicious! 7 minute Lyft ride off the strip, but well worth it! Free macaron ice cream if you check in through Yelp!

great food, great price, great service :)
never have authentic korean before but this one is awesome!
Had a fantastic dinner here tonight.  We ordered the set dinner with extra meat.  The meat tasted good and sweat.  I will come again next time.

Excellent BBQ Korean restaurant.   Must try.

Went with 3 other families,  and everyone enjoyed it.

Best beef, very tender.
Super pretty cozy quiet place, well decorated. Love the service! The food was very good and authentic. The price is very reasonable especially the set menus. Highly recommend this !

Third time here and I have to say -- the food, service and atmosphere are at least a notch or two above the 4-5 Korean BBQ spots I've been to here in Vegas. Had a GREAT lunch special first time today - portions were generous and the price was very fair for all the food you get. Reminds me of the more upscale Korean BBQ places in LA's ktown. Check this place out and Spring Mountain will be a distant memory.

We made a reservation here for our wedding rehearsal dinner on a Friday @ 6pm for about 45 people. Patrick (the owner) was easy to work with and very accommodating. When guests started arriving, all the tables were together, available, and set with place setting and sides. As soon as guests started sitting down, our preselected Meat Lover Combination meat plates started coming out. All our guests raved about the BBQ and the service was excellent. We're so glad we listened to our fellow Yelpers on this one!
the staff is great & so is the food great atmosphere, definitely a place i would recomend if you're ever around the area

First time having Korean BBQ and I must say that my wife and I truly had a great experience here. We came in during happy hour and our drinks were 50% off which was a big bonus. Meat and veggies tasted and looked really fresh. Would recommend this place to anyone.

First, we did not realize this was all you can eat korean bbq. I don't believe I saw that advertised on their website? I might of miss it. There are three options. Option A- Lunch special, from Monday - Friday. And option B- seafood options and option C- higher dollar option, which have the Galbi. For the last option C, you get to choose from all of other option A-C. Plus it come with appetizers, two soups and rice. Fairly priced for all of the options you can choose from. Service was great and fast. Our waiter helped us cook our BBQ. They do play some top 20 music videos on TV. I did appreciate that they play all of Beyonc√©. I would go back when I visit Vegas.
Great price for the amount of food they serve. $99 for four people, comes with various good meats, salads, soups and rice!!!!
Meats had good flavor and the banchan were delicious. Definitely, going to try more dishes.
Food was great, price was reasonable quality of meat was very good. No need for a AYCE this fill will still fill you up. Services was attentive and great.

My friends and I always come here for happy hour and absolutely love it! To simply put it, a great place with delicious and quality Korean BBQ meat, popping vibes, and quick service. Will definitely go again and again.

Really cool experience. The staff was very friendly and made sure we were comfortable. It was also our first time coming to a Korean BBQ and they made sure we were knowledgeable on all the items and cooking the food properly.

Korean BBQ is always fun and a great option if you want to get away from the strip. We had a group of 8 and called about 30 min ahead and our table was ready for us when we arrived (around 830pm on a Friday). Service was super fast and most of our dishes came out within 5 min of ordering. Our fave dishes were the steamed chili dumplings, dynamite shrimp, spicy chicken with lemon sauce, bulgogi, kobe and the filet mignon. Everything was perfectly seasoned and gobbled up immediately. Honestly the veg options were delicious too--particularly the sweet corn (which you can grill) and the broccoli and cheese fondu (already cooked.) The best part though was that all the complimentary sides (and there are a ton) are brought to you immediately so you can start snacking away while perusing the large menu. Cool place to check out and especially fun with a large group. Also don't forget the Yelp check-in offer for a free dessert macaron! Not amazing, but hey it's dessert and its free.

Very good food , and amazing service. Typically Korean bbq spots have horrible customer service. The " Las Vegas " for two had tasteful meats. Will be in my ext thoughts for Kbbq in the foreseeable future !
Great, quick service. Excellent food. Really good prices. This place definitely does not disappoint!
GreAt atmosphere!! Wonderful staff. Fast food and very warm! Love the food cant get enough of the seaweed salad!!!

Very tasty Korean BBQ with large portions and reasonable prices. The place was also nicely decorated and the service was friendly and professional so we will go back for sure the next time we are in Vegas. We went for lunch and the place was pretty busy.

This is a great place to step away from the LV strip.  Our party of 3 was able to beat the dinner rush, we arrived about 5:45pm.  The service was spot on and our glasses were never empty and any request was addressed right away.  The food quality and taste was great.  I personally thought the quantity was not bad at all too.  Some may believe that this place is overpriced, but I have been to many Korean restaurants, and this is not the case.  I would come back again.
So good! Off the beaten bath, but we are grateful to have found this hidden gem! So much food, come hungry!
We like the food (Bibimbaps, fried Rice's, and the six complimentary appetizers), the service (food comes out from the kitchen quickly) and the ambience.

Went there for happy hour. Their happy hour menu offers very good choices. The environment is good and comfortable. The waitresses and waiters are friendly and welcoming. I had a great time dining there!

This is my favorite Korean BBQ place. It is too bad I live in the Bay Area so I can't go there often. The meat was flavorful and the hot sauce was a good complement. The bibimbap was sweet and very flavorful. The dynamite shrimp, bomb! Overall, loved everything there. A must try.

Their Galbi Tang (Short Rib Soup) is so damn good!  Their Galbi Jim (Braised Short Rib) is perfectly seasoned and soft/tender.

The price is outstanding... especially for Vegas.

I'd put this place up against any of my favorites in K-Town LA.
Very close to the strip, worth giving a try! The meats are extremely tender. Restaurant is very clean and well ventilated.

Wow... Just flabbergasted by this place! Truly a wonderful experience with over 3,000 Yelp users writing this place five stars I could see why. The service is just impeccable with prompt, caring & warm service... super fast! There wasn't a minute where our drinks were  empty her food wasn't on the table ready to be cooked ! If you're ever in the Las Vegas area would highly recommend this place if you're into Korean BBQ
The service was excellent....the kalbi was even better! If you're passing through Vegas and tired of the buffet....come get some BBQ here.

This place is amazing!!!  The meat is fresh and the portions are great for the price.  They have a lot of options so you can choose what you like or you can go with a combo.  They also have ice cream macaroons!!!
I liked it here! It is better than Sura's by spring mountain. We got the meat lovers for two and it was a decent amount in there and we are pretty big eaters. Servers were great!
Was here for my brothers birthday diner. Food was delicious. We ordered the meat combo for 4 people. Enough food for everyone. Finished the whole entire combo. We will be back!!!
Had the prime kalbi! The best kbbq place I've been to so far in town. The kimchi is to die for!
Lots of great selection in Korean food. Perfect to pair with beer! Come early during happy hour as it can get very busy!

The location was understaffed however the food was delicious! 

They have great lunch specials and even offer free desert for a yelp review!

If going during the lunch hours is a great place to save some cash while getting great food.
Great place with friendly servers and awesome food!
Sweet service?fantastic foods!!!A wonderful restaurant!! I love original bibalap rice
Just got into town and had to try this place. The ambiance is really nice and the food was amazing. Definitely would recommend to friends and family!

Glad I took my husband's lead and try this new place out despite my craving for Chinese food. The 3k ++ reviews are not a hype and this place is indeed worth the try. Food quality (both meat, sides and apps) exceed expectation. We had:

Chicken Fondue
Calamari (nothing extraordinary but the dipping sauce is good)
Beef Toro
Pork Belly
Steamed Chili Dumplings
Sweet Corn
Chili Garlic Wings
Mushroom Medley

None of them did disappoint.
Came here for the first time, we got the Gangnam bbq meal for 2 people, it was delicious and tasty, will come back again! Great service and not far away from the Vegas strip!

Everything is just perfect! I've never tried any Korean food as good as these. We almost gave up while waiting. Thankfully we returned and enjoyed our meal. The mix tempura and the prime kalbi taste so good!
Super friendly staff, decent meat and you get free dessert for a yelp review! Definitely recommend for a visit :D

I've had some amazing kbbq on my travels across the US and abroad in Asia, but sadly there is nothing great in my current city. I was SO looking forward to this meal and it was the first stop after leaving the airport to kick off the weekend in Vegas. We arrived at 3pm, so the restaurant was really empty (it can get packed!). The service and the timing for the food was perfect due to the slower time of day we dined. I believe that dining at 3pm def allowed us to have a better experience. 

Each table is set up with it's own grill and has a hood vent. Although the hood helps, be prepared to still smell like grill when you leave the establishment. We settled on one of the pre-selected bundles 'meat lover' 
 at $56 for 2 people-which had 6 proteins and an array of salad, soup, and apps. Of course the bonchon side dishes were complimentary and delicious. The best meats in the meat lover set were the beef toro and the flat iron garlic. Both were melt in your mouth delicious. 

I think the sets are a good way to try more of the menu if you're new to the establishment but when I go back I'll be likely to just order cuts that I love.

Been coming to this spot since it opened a few years ago , and haven't stopped coming back weekly because it's the best Korean BBQ in the city , and the cleanest ... and it's open till 1 am for those late drunk nights ..
We always come late night for the happy hour. Tapas style let's you custom order and this place just gets better and better the better you order and cook!

It's more like a 3.5 but I'll round it up to a 4. 

Their set meals(and they have a few you can pick from) are really awesome. We had 10-11 people and they gave a huge portion that was able to fill us up with only $20-22? each. THe reason why it's more like a 3.5 is because the quality meat is only okay. It really could be better but of course it's still better than your typical AYCE bbq. I actually think the meal went from great to good. Their appetizers( the little small dishes that korean places serve were great and we got soup, bibimbap(which I thought was really good and flavorful). They also had their happy hour from like 9-close? or something like that but i have to say the meat(pork belly + beef toro) weren't great all even though it was the happy hour price. 

Regardless, I think for a bbq place like this, they give you a great portion for a good price is the reason why I gave it a 4. It's not the best non-AYCE place but their set meals are nice and worth it.

I read other's review before choose restaurant for lunch with family.   Great service and great food.  Three of us ordered two items from protein menu, rice, salad and dumpling appetizer.   Also we ordered one egg spicy ramen to share.  Our tummy is so happy.   It is my favorite Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas!
Great food. Perfect for hanging out. Even ran into an old buddy from my military days in Korea!

Wow. 
Wow.
Wow.
Gangham is a culinary delight not to be missed. To come to Vegas and not experience a meal here is to miss a true jewel. Words cannot do it justice; you must come and experience it for yourself!
One of the best Korean BBQ in Vegas. Service was great. The staff was very helpful. If you are in the area check them out. Happy Hour was a plus and a bargain. Nice decor too.
Delicious Korean BBQ. One of the better Korean restaurants in Vegas. Meat was good and well marinated. Side dishes were also great. Good service.
My husband took me here for my birthday and I couldn't have asked for a better birthday dinner! The service was fast and friendly and the food filled us up.

good place to have a late dinner. fresh food and nice stuff. good to try. the kobe beef is very juicy. the appetizer is a lot. i like the calamari. always seafood go first to me. every kind of beef has its own taste. thats very nice.
Overall the food is good,we ordered 4 ppl meat killer meal, the meat are pretty fresh. I like the desert. However, the Side dishes are not that good comparing to other Korean BBQ.
Wonderful food, great service, and great drinks. If you are craving Korean bbq in Vegas, this is def the place to be.

The food was okay but the service left a lot to be desired.  They serviced another table about 6 times more often than ours. Maybe I'm used to gyu-kaku and their excellent service but this was really bad. No one explained what any of the sides given were. No one ever turned off our grill (my boyfriend).

Update* a new server just asked about our experience and I told him about the service. He's really nice and even offered us complimentary ice cream.

I don't think I'll return but the food was good. It was just the service.

The host was very nice in updating me how many tables were ahead of me, even though it really did not shorten my wait.  It took them about 5 minutes to take our order since it was a rather busy night.  The server brought us the side dishes right away.  When I asked a passing waitress for water several minutes later, she told me that MY server will bring me water later..........the water came 3 minutes later but with quite a bit of attitude.  Just placed it on the table without saying a word and with a rather annoyed look about her.  My experience with the service so far has been average., although may be typical for a Korean restaurant.  Now on to the wait for the food.........(the longer the dots....the longer the wait)..........is 10 minutes a long wait?........3 of the 6 items ordered came at the 11 minute mark........5 more minutes later 1 more item came.......3 minutes more and my fifth item came......I don't get how long it takes to cook udon for my little daughter.....anyway, 3 more minutes later and my daughter finally has her udon.  The food was actually very tasty and worth the walk from the strip but I am not entirely happy with the service.  Would I come back again ($64K question)...probably as long as I can tolerate the wait and service.  Time to hit the slots and win me back some money.

I stumbled upon this place after leaving the Hard Rock. I was hungry so did a quick check on Yelp and walked across. I had some trouble finding it so I called to ask for directions. 

Let me just say, I happened to arrive during happy hour and I couldn't be happier. The food was scrumptious. Everything was full of flavor and the dipping sauce served with the crispy chicken was to die for. Plus I got several free samplers. I paid about $11 for all the food that I got. Plus I got a free ice cream macaroon for checking in on Yelp. The macaroon was just ok but I'm not complaining, it was free

over all food is mediocre and very over priced. Service was also mediocre at best. They never came around unless we seeked them out even though we had a large group. Meat quality was below average. Meat was very tough to chew. And they charge for each side items. Tvs are also small and it's non HD. Even for Las Vegas standards the meet quality was sub par. Compared to LA/oc, this was a 1 star.

Great service upon entering right up until the very end. It wasn't too busy and we were given a huge table for only the 2 of use pretty soon, the entire table was covered with the complimentary dishes and the rest of our order of:

x SUN DU BU ($9.95 with rice) The best I've ever had and I've had a lot. The calamari was so soft too although there ended up being too much calamari to soup ratio.
x STEAMED EGG ($4.95) this was not very good as it was over-steamed and not silky as it usually is at other restaurants. 
x HARAMI MISO ($8.95) This was really succulent and tasty. Must order!
x KOREAN PRIME KALBI ($8.95) This was tasty although a bit too fatty for my liking. 

The lettuce is $2 but it is so fresh and crispy, it is a must for complimenting the bbq meat.

Rate them on Yelp and you get a free dessert. We got the Mocchi which was OMG.

We were so full at the end but the prices were so reasonable. I would definitely be here more often if I wasn't a tourist.

Meat selections were alright, nothing that was going to knock your socks off. 
Service took a long time, the macron ice cream sandwich however was delicious, not worth the $4. Yelp offers a free macron ice cream sandwich if you check in, offer is good for 3 hours.

This was my first Asian BBQ experience and what a great introduction. We ordered the pork belly, Korean Prime Kalbi, Korean chicken cheese fondue, vegetarian dumplings. Most everything was very tasty and overall a fun experience! Happy hour from 10-close was a nice surprise too.

The food here is fantastic. Despite being awful at using chopsticks/generally not having any sort of understanding of Korean food, I split the meat lovers for two with two other guys and left feeling stuffed. It's absolutely a spot I would come back to if I visit Vegas again.

First and it was so good..... Must try if your in vegas!!!! Bomb.com
We got lad Vegas for the first time!!!

First time here and was very impressed with the food, ambience and service. The interior is nicely designed to allow for a very pleasant dining experience. And the servers are very attentive and friendly. 

The food here is delicious. This is what we ordered: 
-spicy tuna kimbap
-spicy soft tofu
-Harami miso
-Korean prime kalbi
-Beef toro 
-Salmon 
-Korean chicken with cheese fondue 
-bibimbap

The beef is very tender and soft. It just melts in your mouth! The beef toro wasn't as tender as if anticipated. The   Korean prime kalbi was delicious but I would have to say that the Harami Miso was my favorite. The spicy tuna kimbap is good but it's very heavy. It'd be wise to take it slow with that!
The chicken was very soft and tender surprisingly, but the cheese part really wasn't for me. The spicy tofu soup was very flavorful and delicious. It definitely helps settle all the bbq that you just ate. 

Overall, quality and and atmosphere are on point here. I would definitely come back here in the future. 

***the amount of food was for a party of 3 and it was more than enough.

This place blew my mind.   So much food and the meat quality was excellent.  There were combo and al a carte options.  We chose the Gangnam combo for two which was $65.   The oysters were some of the best I have had.  Come hungry.

So we were on a drive to vegas for a work related convention... Of course we were behind schedule so we decided we wanted something Asian/Korean late at night.  It was good for us to be here at 10 PM because we caught the place during happy hour. 

We ordered a lot small plates for the four of us. A few stood out so much we reordered or contemplated reordering them. Among those were the calamari, sweet corn, jalape√±o popper, beef toro and pork belly.

It helps to take the kimchi and put it on the grill and then eat with the pieces of meat. Needless to say this place will be on the vegas rotation for food for me.

A Korean / Japanese barbecue mix. Gangnam is trying to be both, however Korean Influence is stronger - K-pop was constantly streamed through the TVs.

Their barbecue items were decent, but when I ordered bulgogi bibimbap for lunch, it didn't come with a bunch of side dishes like most Korean restaurants. None, in fact. That made me feel like they are a cheapskate and the prices started to feel pricier.

They should research on what Yagyu offers for lunch... Yagyu is much better in all aspects - food quality, portion and prices. While what Gangnam offers is decent, I fail to find a reason to go back. Also, Gyu-kaku is getting ready for lunch... watch out!
Kobe Sam is so yummm. fantastic?the first time here with frds and we all think the food is amazing???definetely wanna come next time

If I could give this place more than 5 stars,  I would!!!  
I'm so grateful for Yelp and all of your reviews! Without it, we would never have known of this gem hidden in a little shopping center.
We decided to go with one if the dinners for 2 (The Las Vegas) and honestly, we were blown away with the amount of food that was served. Numerous little side dishes typical of Korean dining, but....cream cheese wontons, miso soup, edamame, salad, rice or bibimbap, steamed broccoli with cheese fondue AND 4 plates of meat......for $46.00 ???????????? ARE YOU KIDDING ME? There are so many combinations or a la carte items to choose from and all very reasonable.
Plus....if you "check in" on Yelp, you get an ice cream macaroon for free...omg!
From the amount if food, to the mouth watering flavors, and fabulous service...this place MUST be on your 'go to' list for dinner.
You will not be disappointed!!!
We did go on a weekday around 5 pm and it was quiet. Not sure how crowded a weekend would be so might want to prepare & call ahead.
A wonderful assortment of Asian meats cooked to perfection by our resident chef. Delicious fish, great service, and a ton of good food made this dining experience exceptional.

Fun place! Good food, complimentary sides, and free dessert! Got the steamed chili dumplings, which are made in house and are very good. Then the asparagus with bacon which was amazing. The prime Kalbi was delicious. The pork belly was good, though I thought it could have been better. Overall all the food was excellent, it's a fun experience, and you can check in on yelp for a free ice cream macaron!

This restaurant was amazing. The food was delicious. I loved the idea of Japanese and Korean food on the menu. My boyfriend and I ordered the meat lovers meal. We loved the variety of meat and appetizers that came with it. We would definitely come back again.

Really enjoyed his restaurant! I think we ordered about 7-8 dishes for my husband, 3 and 1 year old and myself. It was the perfect amount of food because they're small portions. Price was really good as it came out to just under $100 including tip. 

Servers were attentive, decor was nice, and the food was solid. Would recommend if you want a change from buffets or hotel restauran while visiting Vegas!

Was a long wait on a Monday night. Was our first time and told the waiter but we got no instructions. I asked for an explanation of the combination meals and all he said was "the meat lovers is our most popular" even though the menu says the Gangnam is the most popular. I inquired about the Gangnam meal and again he said the meat lovers is what we should get. So we ordered the meat lovers for four.

When the food arrived he put it on the table and started to walk away. I asked him what we do with the food and he pointed out the beef and pork dishes and the only instruction was "cook the pork well done" and he walked away.

We each started taking a piece of meat and cooking it and eating it which took a long time. After watching some other tables it was clear we should have cooked lots of food at one time.

While they do have vents, we left not really satisfied and smelling like grilled meat.

Was not bad but definitely not something we'll do again in Vegas.
Great food!!!We eat here eveytime in town
Service just sucks, food is nothing close to any of the newer KBBQ in town, I really don't understand the hype and how they got so many reviews. Awesome.

THEY WERE FANTASTIC! 

My best friend and I were in town on business. We got in late and wanted something to eat that was REALLY GOOD but not far from our hotel! 

This place was literally a block from our hotel. 

We were greeted immediately and seated. 

Everything we ordered was so good! We had the Marinated Beef Kolbi, Spicy Tofu Soup, Pork Belly and the Seafood Pancakes.

I love this place, not only because the food was AMAZING but also because it was very cheap! 

KUDOS!!!
This is such a cool place, it has a grill at each table. The happy hour prices are reasonable and well worth it. Service was amazing and we come here every time we come to Vegas!!

We were looking for something good , yet close to our hotel, that wasn't going to also break the bank. Gangnam hit a bases loaded home run ! Having had some REALLY. Good KBBQ in the past , i was prepared to be disappointed. Def NOT the case.. The food was outstanding , the service sterling , and the ambience was top notch. The staff went above and beyond for us,  when a member of our party became ill shortly after we arrived, they were simply anazing...

This place was tasty and fun! The food was fresh and we loved the spacious tables. There was plenty of food for all four of us and it just kept coming! Saki was great. The music was a little loud but the service was great. Wonderful dining experience.

So good! Its a fun way to have dinner and tastes amazing. I always wish I could marinate my meat like they do. Bonus, it's not super pricey- so we don't feel like we need to hold back. We always get the spicy pork, mixed tempura, and double of my favorite: Bulgogi!

We love Korean food and found this great place to enjoy a good korean bbq.  It's a nice restaurant with a bbq in the middle of the table for cooking the meat or you can opt to have them cook it in the kitchen.  Our favorite meats were the Harami Miso, and Spicy pork.  The bibimbap is also delicious although smaller than other korean rest. I've been.  Bulgogi bibimbap was really flavorful too.  Nice atmosphere.
Came by Yelp Reviews. The food is phenomenal. Service was great and fast. The wait was not long for the food. A nice place to have a wonderful family dinner.

It was a first time trying Korean barbecue, but definitely it was a great one. They have those meals that comes with several different types of side dishes and meat. It's a great deal, we tried the meat lovers and it was awesome! Don't fool yourself, it's a lot of food. you will end up opening up your pants' button. I will definitely go back there next time I'm in town.

This is the must eat for my family every time we come to Vegas. Bulgogi is our favorite! Love the side dishes. Service is decent. The only thing is we have to ask for lunch menu when we come in weekday lunch. That's the season I gave only 4 star.

Great Asian restaurant, I recommend strongly recommended it!
Love the kimchi and the meat!

Best solo lunch date to date. I ate like royalty for $13. Ban chans were perfect, the meat was marinated straight from the gods, the service was a little slow but acceptable given the time of day. Seriously one of the better KBQ I've had in a long time.

One of the worker will stop by to get your name on a list when you walk in. The wait was about 20 mins for 2 of us (There were 4 parties ahead of us) We got sat on a huge table towers the back. We decided to order individual items since I didn't like everything I saw in the combos. It was a great choice because we got to try everything we wanted. Nothing went to waste. 
Our favorites: beef bulgogi, spicy pork, enoki bacon.
The flat iron garlic was good, meat was very tender but lack in flavor. They do give you 3 dipping sauces for your meats. 
We also got the Korean marinated short rib. Flavor is similar to the beef bulgogi, meat was tender. 
For the price difference I would just stick with beef bulgogi at $3.95 instead of the other two mentioned above that cost $8.95. 
Sides included: cucumber, Kim chi, sweet onion/daikon, weird spicy noodle dish (not our fave), Mac and cheese salad.
Husband ordered the steamed egg, it looks really big but not as fluffy and airy like the one from Tofu Hut. 
I ordered the house salad. I liked the variety of mixed greens and cherry tomatoes, Lao came with an egg cut in half. The dressing sauce had a hint of orange citrus flavor, yummy. 
Service was decent. They switched the grill out as soon as it was black. 

Stick with the marinated items if you like flavor in your meats. 

Our total came out to be $58. 

Will definitely return.
$50 for lunch.  Tons of food.  Cook your own meat at the table.  If you have a rental car go here
Great food, great service and great experience! It's one of my Las Vegas staples when I visit.

My goodness, this is the best Korean BBQ restaurant I've ever been!  We happened to drop in during happy hour (3-6 pm) on Saturday.  We ordered 4 happy hour menus, Fried calamari ($4), Chicken Karage($4), Spicy Chicken BBQ with Lemon Source($3), Korean Chicken BBQ Cheese Fondue($3) and Filet Mignon ($8.5) and Sukiyaki, all delicious! Every menu was much bigger portion than we expected, plus endless refillable free 8 side dishes come with meal!  We were sooooo stuffed.  They give you 3 kinds of dipping sauce for the meat besides lemon sauce and cheese we ordered, all tasted excellent. Beer was a half price during happy hour. For all the above tasty meal plus beer, the total was only $37 including tax. Unbelievable!!! We'll come back again!
??????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????3-6??????????????????????????????????????????37?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????

Not my cup of tea. I think they prefer Asian customers  Wait staff was curt, brusque, and not helpful. Food was fair at best. Went here based on all the other rave reviews and was sorely disappointed. Would not go back.

We got the 2 person bbq meat lover portion for three ppl. We are all girls and it fed us well. But we had to order one more bowl of rice.

This place is not like other Korean places in the US or maybe just anywhere I've been. They serve chicken to bbq... I thought it was weird and didn't taste so great. Their slices of meat is not......... great quality. 

They don't serve side dishes. Everything else you have to pay for like lettuce and other stuff. Usually are Korean places side dishes are a must and have. But this place charges you for everything. the only side dish that came with it was kinchi and spicy pickled radish. Both was nasty, salty and weird.

I've had amazing kimchi before and this on was not worth touching.

Price st 59.90 ... waste of my money... I could of gotten BOMB Korean bbq with awesome service in chicago for way less.

Awesome service as I went in! The waiters are funny with great recommendations. I mean free dessert at the end so why not? They didn't change the grill that often. We ordered some green tea and it seemed like they didn't want  to give us water. I guess it depends on the waiter. I got really after two dishes so order accordingly.
Awesome k-bbq and bomb bulgogi. Really good happy hour, got a pitcher of Sapporo for 8 bux. Definitely worth the 20 min drive from my house
Great food! Had the premium combo with a friend, and it was so good. Highly recommended if you're looking for some good Asian food while visiting Vegas.

Efficient, friendly service. Clean and extremely well ventilated (so you don't smell of BBQ after) and quality cuts of meat that make for a good value meal. We opted for the individual dishes and were exceedingly satisfied with our meal and the whole experience. Two people- beef tongue, pork toro, garlic flat iron, Korean prime kalbi, mushroom medley, squash and a bowl of cold noodles. Their kim chi is bomb too.
Ive tried many Korean BBQ places and this place ranks up there with the best. Customer service is spot on as well.  Rather than me ranting about this and that i suggest giving it a try.

Recommended by an uber driver~ tried today, really like the place! 
For 2, we ordered the meat lover's set, and got overwhelmed in the end~ the food was so good and the price is really reasonable! 
Highly recommend anything beef related!
The waiting time is a little crazy, we waited around 1.5 hours, but it turned out totally worth it!

Nice out of the way Korean bbq, it's worth a date night or family dinner, friendly service, quick on delivering the food to table, gam sa hap nee da, gangnam gangnamp ps, salmon wrap in bacon is the bomb
Amazing Food and even more amazing staff!!!! They've got a Great happy hour as well!!! Highly recommended!!! Best Korean I've ever had!
Always great food and service. I've been going here since it opened. Always recommend and bring my tourist friends.

I love korean food; and this is absolutely delicious ! It's a cute little place yet so elegant. The staff is courteous and attentive; and the food; yum! I recommend any one who is in the downtown Las Vegas area to stop by . Either to grill the meat; or just have some yummy tofu soup!
This is the best Korean bbq place in Vegas. I come here twice and will come again. Delicious food, good service, clean space.

Been to many Korean BBQ places in vegas~ this has got to be the best one. Unlike the all you can eat places; the quality of meat is fresh. We ordered the premium package for 2 people and we had 4 in our party and was still unable to finish the order!

good taste and a lot of choice for meat meat.
I like the beef tongue a lot. But all the sauces are sweet

being a Korean from Atlanta, I've had my share of Korean food. however, even when I'm traveling I have to have it! I'll say that the food here is top notch- both taste and quality. even the atmosphere is pleasant, which can't always be found for an authentic Korean food experience. the best thing by far though is the service. all the waiters and waitresses are extremely attentive and generous. the price comparatively is steep but probably not by Vegas standards. overall, a total must try! definitely making it back here someday soon.

This is our first meal in Vegas and it does not disappoint. We ordered the Gangnam set for two people with a side of fried chicken, dubokki and Kobe saam. Everything was delicious. There's was a lot of food. The bulgogi was delicious because it was in a stone pot so the rice was pretty crunchy and crispy. I liked everything except for the dubokki, it was a little too sweet. Service was good and portion was generous. Price was pretty decent. We got the macaron ice cream through Yelp check in and it was just ok, nothing special. Overall, it was a very good meal and would come back

Stop reading, grab your wallet and keys and start driving. This place is a GEM. It seems pricey at first but the amount of food you get (not monster proportions but a variety of food) and the dining experience is unforgettable. The place was packed when we walked in Saturday night, but we didn't wait long. 10 minutes max. Our waitress' answered so many questions with a smile on their faces  (real ones). They explained dishes to us when we blanked stared them at options we had no clue we had. Multiple people checked on us to make sure we were chugging along okay, but not in an annoying way. Like kind table clearing ninjas on a mission. It wasn't overwhelming at all. The food all came out very quickly and it was SOOOOO.GOOD. I was nervous about cooking our own meat but it was sliced in such manageable pieces once we got started it was like we were pros. We had the Gangnam for two and we ate everything... Except the fish cakes. They had good flavor but I'm allergic. I would love to go again with friends. I know it would be so much fun, and more kind on the wallet. Seriously if you're still reading, go. Just try it. You'll thumbs up me later.

I love it here. Expensive but worth it. Service is awesome and quality is amazing. They even gave us ice cream macarons which are heavenly. I would definitely come back and tell all my friends. I was really happy when i left because it was a great experience for us!

I have to say the food is not as good as the rating says. Spicy pork is not spicy at all and too sweet. Korean bean soup tastes like fermented beans? I really dislike its taste. And filet mignon is the most surprising. It's just so average and kinda weird, not marinated at all. After putting it on heat for a while, it came out dry and tasteless. 

Side dishes are also terrible, this is absolutely the worst Korean bbq place I've been too.

This place is soooo yummy !!! Oh my gosh truly fantastic and lights up your taste buds without lighting up your wallet. We HAD to come again before our trip ended. Our first night was beyond expectations with great service. Quick and without flaw. Our second day was "eh". Our drinks weren't refilled. She didn't come to our table for half an hour to even check on us. She brought us the wrong foods and overcharged our bills. Our waiter from the first day ended up having to pick up her slack. If it weren't for the good food and price or the staff trying to fix her mistakes and such great service our first night,I would have given it 3 stars for today's  crap service.

My buddies and I came here a random Wednesday night where it was dead. They ordered several combos while I had to look elsewhere on the menu since I was a vegetarian. Despite being envious of the sights and smells that came afterwards, I was happy with my order of veggie ramen and bimbimbap.

When the ramen first came, the noodles looked like they came from an instant ramen package. When I taste the salty sour broth though, I was happy and let the noodles continue soaking the broth and focus on my Sapporo. Once the noodles were completely hydrated, it was delicious.

So was my bimbimbap. I didn't notice any tofu and it didn't have an egg either but still flavourful without any obvious protein. Not only was my meal filling. It was cheap. My large ramen noodle bowl was about 6 dollars while my rice bowl was 8. I can't say no to large cheap portions of tasty food.
Good Ambience delicious food and good service. Definitely in the top two of barbecue places I've eaten at.

My favorite Korean BBQ place in Vegas! Whenever I visit Vegas, I make sure to come here. Their Kobe Beef and filet Mignon are good. We had the Premium set which is $89.95 for two people. It is so worth it. You get Tuna Poki, fresh oysters, salad, and more appetizers. Nice decor, good service, and tasty food. What more do you want after a tiring day in Vegas?!
The food was very good and the service was great as well. My stomach was very satisfied
Went for happy hour and it was all very yummy!! The staff were all great and very helpful, brining everything to the table super fast.

They told us that this was a 20 minute wait... we waited more than an hour. It was not that crowded, it was a Monday night. Their staff is just super inept and inefficient. The food itself was so so and the meat very salty. I think most of these reviews are made up or paid for. It also took them like 15-20 minutes to get us our change... I had to walk up to the counter to request the change because they were taking ridiculously long and I had called a uber thinking it would take 5 minutes tops to get the change. Considering it was not too busy, this is ridiculous.

Plus the Asian cashier guy looks like a stereotypical Korean tool with the tool haircut and tool vibe. Plus he lies about the wait time.

Also, this place is literally a rip off of Gyukaku. This part is kind of funny... I think that they may have used to been a gyukaku since they still have the gyukaku logo on the front of the restaurant. Perhaps they just changed the name so they don't have to pay the franchise fees... but at the same time the service and food is a lot worse than a gyukaku
Stop by here after a ski trip from Utah and was delicious.  Quality and flavorful meats.  Try it and you won't be disappointed.

Modern Korean bbq with a great selection of meats and appetizers. It's a mix between Korean and Japanese and the quality of the meat is much better than all you can eat. I recommend both the marinated and non marinated Kalbi for beef. Spicy garlic and calamari and spicy pork are also great. Close to the strip is well and much better than anything close by.
Definitely my new favorite KBBQ spot in Vegas! Staff was very tentative and quick. Great location right near the strip.

It was ok. We were in Vegas for the long weekend and thought we can try this place since reviews are good. We chose Gangnam grill, it came with bunch of side dishes, big bowl of salad, 2 soups, beef bulgogi, mushrooms, corns and variety of grill meats. Definitely a lot of foods for 2 adults. However I feel like the meats were rather bland, not marinated enough. Price is on a higher range, but service was great and the place is clean. Not sure if we are going back next time, maybe I'll compare it to Hobak next.
Great restaurant !! You get a lot of food for your money !! Will def come here again.

I walked in by myself and without reservations and I got seated right away at the bar area. The welcome was courteous, so good start. The bar is not equipped to cook your own BBQ but the service is so fantastic that it make up for this small letdown.
The quality of the appetizers was top, every dish was savory and I was served 7 small bowl of "starters" as well.
Prices are decent unlike the Strip prizes.
Again, the service was excellent as they work in teams,
very efficient and therefore food was served hot.
This place is great! Great food. Service, awesome employees! Tasty meat and is a must go to! I highly recommend the beef toro. Great meat quality!
Great food great service and great environment. I have nothing but delight for  their presentation. Fresh hot and delicious!
Second time dining and once again blew my mind! Love the bulgogi and garlic edamame! Price is spectacular during happy hour and great customer service! Good vibes all around, love this place
Took us 30 minutes to get a table despite having a reservation. Other than that the service was good after we got the table and the food was very good
Great customer service!!! Wasn't a long wait. Love their Korean bbq and spicy tuna shrimp kimbap. Also their fried calamari was good. Definitely coming back again. And again

This is a great place for a group! The food come right out to be able to start grilling. The servers are very attentive, answer any questions, and help you with what you need. Will be coming back no doubt!!!

The atmosphere itself was cozy. It has a great ambiance for its location. When we came in we were told that there were other groups, 3 groups before us but they were so quick on seating us. 

We decided to order from menu that's marked "Must try".. the spicy tuna kimbap and calamari garlic. The kimbap was really good, it was melting in my mouth. The calamari was just a blah. Nothing special - I cannot taste the garlic. 

We also had the prime kalbi which was very tasty and the dumpling soup. 

Please avoid ordering the ramen. The quality and texture tastes like instant maruchan. 

Overall the service was good even they forgot my soju but delivered attention after that.
What else can I say that hasn't been said? A-ma-zing! Get one of the combos to share with a friend.
Absolutely love this place! Whenever I have friends in town we go here. You can cook the food yourself or they will.
Great food. Great service. Food came out in less then 10 min and the service was excellent. Definitely new go to Korean BBQ hang out.
Lots of food, high quality, worth. Came here with a party of 3 and the premium meant for 2 served us well!
Great menu! The food was delicious. We chose the family portion which was perfect, even comes with soup

Decent Korean food and awesome deal with the combo. The Las Vegas combo is $46 and (though for two people) it can definitely feed 3. It comes with tons of meat (best of which is the beef toro), broccoli cheese fondue (amazing combination), bugolgi bimbimbap, house salad and a bunch of small Korean appetizers (fish cake is delicious). The meat came in raw and unlike other Korean bbq places, you gotta do BBQ yourself and it's definitely the fun part. If you can't finish all, you can get it to go. Came on a Sat noon for lunch and the place wasn't super crowded. The service was decent and food came really really fast. Don't forget to check in here as you get a free macaron ice cream sandwich.

I have never been to a Korean BBQ that wasn't one of those counter-serve buffet lines, so I didn't know what to expect. And I wasn't expecting much when I found it was in a strip-mall. This turned out to be a great meal and a great experience! The server explained how it worked, and we picked a combo-package for about $55 for 2 people. They brought all our meats, fish, and veggies (and sauces, salad & miso soup) to the table, where we cooked it on the grill in the middle of the table with tongs. Terrific & delicious!

Delicious Korean BBQ!!! 

The Gangnam set for four was perfect for 5 people. This place did not disappoint at all. The meat was super tender and nicely marinated. The service was great and super  quick. I highly recommend this place.

If you come with a big group make sure to call in advance.

This is the best Korean BBQ that I always love to go when I am in Vegas :)
Coming to try them by yourself and hope you will agree with me about their 
delicious food and friendly services!

Enjoy!


Annie
Great food, great service! Would deff come back if we were local. Our server was quick and helpful.
Very yummy Korean BBQ restaurant even if you put this one in Korea! High recommended! Especially Miso, kimchi!

This was my first time here! Happy hour is worth it! Bulgogi and the brisket was ONLY $3  I was definitely happy with my choice of the garlic edamame. They play music videos inside which can be very entertaining and a great distraction if you don't have anything to talk about to your date. 

Service was welcoming and friendly. I will be back here very soon!

Loved this place! Best Korean BBQ I've had. 

Spicy chicken with lemon sauce and the beef toro were my favorite meats. 

For veggies, the thinly sliced squash left on the grill to char was great, along with the broccoli with cheese fondue. 

The one feedback I'd give the management is to develop a cocktail menu.

Best BBQ ever! Try the gangnam set!!!
Great night with the family!!!
Lots of beer too
Great service - always checking to see if you need anything else. Must get the Harami Miso bbq!

Been here a few times. Great Korean BBQ joint. Lots of variety of meats. You don't have to grill anything on the table if you don't want to as there's cooked food ready to order too. Yummy place and highly recommended.

It was so good oh my god the cheesy corn was like the best thing ever, I thought it was going to be much more expensive than it actually was but I think that's only if you end up going with a deluxe order. All the smaller dishes individually are super cheap, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a korean bbq

Yummy food! The meal sets are large so consider that when ordering. We ordered the Meat Lover set for 6 and we were a party of 10. The restaurant is clean and the employees were polite! Thanks for the quick and attentive service!
Great portions and great food would like to be able to do susitutions since me and my faily do not eat beef but other than that it was great

So, we came here on a whim, having resolved to try all the various places in the area.  We walked in at 6:30 PM on a Saturday, and the place was a ghost town.  One other couple at a table.  The cheerful staff seated us promptly, and equipped us with menus.  

The usual suspects on the beer list, plus a few oddballs which made for nice variety, and also a choice of sakes and other asian alcoholic beverages.

For those of you unfamiliar with the asian BBQ style of dining (as I was) each table has a small gas grill set in its center (and exhaust hoods with fire extinguisers set above them).  Each place setting comes equipped with a pair of tongs.  You order off the menus small (4 oz) batches of raw meat, and then grill them at the table.  It is not quite like Benihana, in that 1) there is not a chef doing entertainment-cooking in front of you, and 2) you are not in a mixed party.  Our waitress did come by from time to time to flip the meat , and to cut it with scissors so that it could be eaten with chopsticks.

The service was quite prompt and pleasant.  The interior of the restaurant was nicely finished, although the 2-person bench seats on each side of the table are so heavy that it makes it difficult to manhandle them into a comfortable position.  

The grilled dumplings were tasty; but oddly my girlfriend's less expensive beef tasted markedly superior to my pricer order.  

One thing that was irksome were the televisions.  They were showing women's college softball on ESPN 8 or something, and it was just annoying and distracting, cheapening the feel of what was otherwise a refined restaurant.  Why anyone installs TV's in restaurants other than sports bars is beyond me.  

The food was ok without being great.  Nothing that made me say "we HAVE to come here again!"  Prices seemed fair ($50 for the 2 of us, including tip, and we ate pretty well).  I admit I am terrible at using chopsticks, and so getting food into my mouth without making a mess is a challenge.  I didn't ask if they had forks, knives, spoons, but I was thinking about it.

When we left, we were the only patrons.  I wonder if Gangnam BBQ will be able to dial up their food to match the good service and beautiful interior.  I will be rooting for them, but don't know how soon I will be rushing back.

No wait for lunch. Happy hour 50% off alchy. 
Beef tongue, Kalbi, uni bimbimbap!!! Hella
Bomb! 
Free dessert with check in :)

Gangnam is not AYCE and I'm used to AYCE bbq so i get worried that these type of places won't satisfy me. Having that said, the meat lover's dinner for 2 and a side of Pork Toro for myself and my wife was MORE than enough. We could have easily done without the extra dish. The quality of meat was really good and we were very pleased with everything. The restaurant is clean and we didn't wait long.
Great place in the middle of las vegas. We were craving for asian food here and suddenly this place pops up. It was a lot better than expected.

Ordered a Meat Lovers special for 4 and a Bulgogi bimbimbap, fed enough for 6 people. Service was for the most part good, a little slow due to the Christmas Day lunch rush. But most importantly, food was delicious! I would recommend this place for Korean BBQ around Vegas. 

P.s. Ask for Jin, he's very nice and kind.

Gangnam Asian BBQ is absolutely delicious!! Their service is great and the waiters are very friendly. Very clean and had a positive atmosphere. The place is also aesthetically pleasing. I would definitely come back again!
Quality, price, service, everything is really good! Dont compare the meat quality with any other AYCE bbq place. Recommend Gangnam special.
Great food. Fantastic happy hour and nice atmosphere. Beef choice:bulgogi . aswell as edemame and gyoza. Has a really cool projector that shows the music videos of the songs that are playing

This place is awesome ! The flavoring taste just right , and the customer service is just as good ! Must try. The food is extremely well flavored and the environment is also welcoming , it's not your typical Korean restaurant, the design is pretty modern and clean. Pretty roomy , grilling also has ventilation so you don't have to worry about the steam rising up, overall I love this place and would come back.

Randomly found this place off the strip while on an adventure for a good lunch. It's no AYCE, but the meat quality here is really superb, and it was nice because I didn't feel pressured to stuff myself till I explode (like every avid AYCE KBBQ eater does). Check in on Yelp for a free ice cream macaron. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is their corn cheese - it had wayyyyy too much mayo. I'd recommend going during lunch hours to take advantage of their happy hour specials which helped us cut our bill a lot. We will be back the next time we are in Vegas!

Pros: great taste, quality. Good variety, covers all the main korean BBQ favorites that I know. 
Cons: portion size too small for the heavy eater. 

Overall, this place is great! The atmosphere is cool, is not too busy, no reservations needed, and customer service is great! Very quick and responsive refilling water. Also, I mistakenly ordered the regular prime kalbi instead of the Korean kalbi (korean has the sawce) and they swapped it for the Korean one! Only con is the serving size. If they had an all you can eat option, this place would be perfect. Still 5 stars because of everything else.
This place is amazingly good and the service is just amazing! Coming here for the second time never amazes me! Will be coming back again and again in the future!

Came in for a late lunch to a fairly quiet restaurant, with only one server who was hustling his few tables and doing an excellent job juggling them. 

We ordered Bibimbap ($12) and spicy Sukiyaki Noodles ($9), our server tossed the dishes for us on their sizzling hot plates, brought us hot tea and let us eat our enormous portions in quiet recovery (this IS Vegas after all, who isn't having breakfast at early dinner time, and nursing some form of hang over?). 

As the restaurant got busier, our solo server got some help as a new guy started his shift, and we weren't forgotten in the hustle.

The interior of the restaurant is soothing, Asian minimalism, a nice balance between Japanese and Korean stylings, as is the food. I love trying restaurants off the strip in Vegas, as they are SO much better quality and pricing than anything near the touristy parts. 

Gangnam was so much more appetizing than anything we could have hoped for on a post-EDC weekend  ;D

Located in the corner of a mini-mall, if you love legit, delicious, fine Asian dining, you MUST come here!

Nothing special the food is good just your standard kBbq. I'm from LA so I'm spoiled by amazing kBbq. 4 stars for price and quality. 

Kinda pricy for 3 people when It's limited food

It's a little on the pricier side but if you get their combos they are very filling for an average eater but if you eat a lot I'd recommend go to a cheaper All you can eat kbbq. They have good quality meat here though which was definitely a plus.

This is one of my favorite spots for eating with the family! There's no comparison. The happy hour menu is the best.. Best food and best prices. We eat here once a week and love the vibe, music and decor. The staff is nice and really helpful. I recommend his place to everyone. If you like Korean BBQ... Look no further!
Food tasted amazing!  Meat was fresh, tender, and well flavored.  Place wasn't smoky.

Great happy hour deals! Service was attentive, food was good. Beef tongue was exceptional. Hope that the grill was not too sticky (GyuKaku has better grill). You get a free dessert when posting a review on Yelp.
Awesome good food but the wait was a bit long so be prepared to wait. Meat was tasty and the kimchee and soybean soup was good.  Side dishes were typical but also tasty.

This is the first place my husband and I tried upon arriving at Las Vegas and it was . We ordered the Gangnam combo for 2 and it was definitely more than enough food: side dishes, oysters, corn, salad, two miso soups, bibimbop and 5 types of meat. Everything was very good! We checked in on Yelp and got some free macaron ice cream sandwich. We got the green tea one and that was yummy too (but nothing spectacular). We would definitely recommend this place!

I have to say... One of my favorite Korean restuarant here in vegas. I addicted to their seafood pancakes for the spicy tofu soup I always get but everything else on the menu is amazing. Highly recommend! And the macaroon ice cream ! Oh, plus the service is awesome as well!

Went to Vegas for a vacation, our flight was really late about 12am in the morning. After arrived, we searched any asian restaurant are still open at midnight, first one pop up was Gangnam. I love BBQ, but never had Korean BBQ, lay on the Yelp review we decided to give a shot. Food was Awesome!!!!!! You can tell all meats are fresh, are good quality food. Server are really friendly, tough us how to eat and how to order. Also I did check-in, they gave us a free ice cream for the table. Nice experience!

Although the service was quick and attentive, the food is really overpriced when compared to other Korean BBQ restaurants in town.  I guess that's to be expected when located in close proximity to the tourists.

It's a great place with so many choices , from appetizer, side dish, sundae, many choices of meat, seafood, pork, chicken, beef. Delicious. 
We came here with family and very satisfied with the food. Friendly waitress. 
Highly recommended.

The food,service and atmosphere... all are great. 
Meat lover set was big enough for 2 people. Free refills for Side dishes too.
It's really good, very interesting place for American ppl because there's no much place like this in here.. Very nice visit and experience, nice service, friendly employees.

We were craving Korean BBQ and stumbled across this place on Yelp. Decided to try it out since we saw good reviews. Don't regret it at all. The meat here is really good and prices are fairly reasonable! Great service and food came out pretty quickly. Would definitely come back here next time I'm in the area!

This place was fantastic!! Our waiter gave us great service and was friendly and nice! My friends and I went during happy hour and the prices were very affordable!! You get a lot of bang for your buck here compared to other places on the strip. i like how they price meat by plates so you can order a variety of them for cheap! Overall my favorite place to eat while I was in Vegas! Also we got free macaron icecream sandwiches when we checked into yelp!! 

Great tasting, quality food worth every penny!! Can't say enough great things about Gangnam!

And and my friend went here for dinner and were very Impressed. It was delicious and the wait staff is super helpful and answered any questions we had about the menu. All the food is amazing. And the prices are very reasonable. The atmosphere is beautiful. Will be returning soon.

Complicated and unusual. No indication of oils or additives.

This place really is for locals or people that are really into this kind of food. I was a victim of the advertising and i spent too much and left hungry.
Delicious food and good service. The beef is fresh and high quality. Side dishes are very good also, especially the cucumber one.

I think this is a great find on Yelp.  The place was very inviting and and immediately got serviced. Food menu is different from most of these types of Korean venues.  A little touch of personalization with the menu items.  
Definitely worth the price you pay.  Staff sometimes are a little more focused on themselves than the customers BUT are always ready upon request and very accommodating.
Love love love love love love love cheap fun good food for cheap fun and good love the people and place dearly yessssss !!!!

Checked into this place to see what the deal. I had to cook my own meat!? What!? Ok, I knew that. I got the meat lover combination which was a lot of food but I was paying a lot of money. Fair is fair.
I couldn't complain. Everything came out pretty fast after you order. The side dishes were a good compliment. But I was busy eating all the meat and rice with the 3 types of dipping sauces provided. Yum, I am a carnivore by the way. The cuts of meat were fresh in color and no smell. The marinated meats had lots of flavor.
The service was just there when you need them, otherwise, they just came and did their thing.
Overall, I am happy with the food quality and taste.
We get meat lover and beef tongue today. Those are really good, I really recommend to come here for Korean bbq.
Excellent Korean and Japanese menu! Really enjoyed my dinner here! I had the spicy tofu soup in a hot pot and it was delicious! Love the side dishes that came with it! Yummy! Will come here again!

I didn't know there was a Korean BBQ this close to UNLV until I found this place on Yelp ! 

Their menu is very similar to Gyu-Kaku. Meats are a la carte. They have combination sets , lunch specials (before 3 pm) , and happy hour (3 pm - 6 pm & 10 pm - closing). 

We settled with their lunch special which is a really good value since it comes w/ banchan , rice , house salad (or miso soup) , one or two meats and an appetizer. I ordered the bulgogi & the meats we grilled were well marinated and tender. I tend to skip bulgogi at AYCE places because they're usually not marinated that good but here you can really taste the quality. Prime kalbi is not included in lunch specials but ordered it anyways since we were dining here already and I wanted to see how it compared to other places. Their kalbi was excellent and had good marbling. Servings aren't necessarily huge , but it's an ample amount of meat. You would get pretty full off eating just one or two.

Love that they offer a lot on their dessert menu ! They have the Brick macaron ice creams (same ones they have at Gen KBBQ and No. 1 Boba Tea) , honey toast , ice cream mochi , banana tempura , etc. If you spend over 15$ and check-in on Yelp , you get a free macaron ice cream of your choice.

Interior is very sleek and modern. Ventilation is good , the restaurant didn't smell smokey at all. The tables are kinda too wide , there is quite a distance between customers sitting across from each other. Music isn't super loud though so it wasn't a problem having a conversation. They have a nice playlist going on too.

This place is a nice alternative to AYCE KBBQ. Staff is very attentive and friendly ! Most definitely a 5 star place :)

Delicious Korean BBQ in a beautiful place. Service is good and food is plenty and tasteful. We had the filet mignon, short beef and pork belly. All super good. For appetizers we had the cream cheese wonton (I loved it, my husband didn't because it was too creamy for him) and the spicy tuna. The tuna came was like a tempura with a sauce on top. Delicious but a little too spicy for me. For my husband, it was he best dish we had. For sides, we had asparagus and zucchini. Simple but good.
Amazing service and high quality meat, this place will be my "go to" while I'm in town everytime. Special shout out to Jin for providing the best service I've had in Vegas yet!

First time here. This place has good quality meat. I especially like the short ribs. Also got the japchae and bibimbap and both were quite good as well. I recommend this place for groups. It's reasonably priced and sadly not all you can eat but I left feeling full and satisfied. My friend got kimchi tofu soup and she seemed to like it. 

Recommended!
amazing dinner at an incredible price. $100 feeds 4 people you will for sure leave full. Bond with you loved ones over a sizzling grill . Make sure u get the fried rice it's so good .
Super good.  Best asian bbq in town.  Great service, full belly. Go gor the bulgogi, spicy pork and duck.  Pork belly if your feeling piggy. ;)

After reading such amazing reviews about this place my husband and I decided to stop by for a late dinner. We arrived around midnight and the place was still packed with people. We had to wait about 15 minutes to get seated at a table. The place was clean, dimly lit and had the ambience of a club. There was music and music videos playing on the big screen. On to the food -- my husband really wanted to try the Kobe style beef since he's been craving it ever since he got back from his trip to Japan. We ordered a plate of the Kobe style beef, a plate of the flat iron garlic beef and a plate of the pork belly. The pork belly and garlic beef were good but nothing that we can't get back home. The Kobe style beef was a huge disappointment! They cut the slices extra thick which is not how Kobe should be served. The texture was really rough and hard to chew. Normally I would be craving more after only one plate of beef but their Kobe beef made me not want to eat meat ever again. Needless to say, we ended up only eating 2 pieces and leaving the rest to be thrown away... there goes $20 into the garbage. I ended up just eating the side dishes for the rest of my meal. Other than the food, the service was good. The guy who checked us out was friendly and accommodating. For dessert we tried the mango macron which ended up being the best part of the meal. The macron was super crunchy and soft and melted in your mouth and the ice cream was easy to bite into and didn't melt in your hands. I would only go back for the macron ice cream.

Really wanted to like it,  but it fell short of expectation. About 3 stars short. The food was average,  service was not consistent. 

It's not a large restaurant, so it's not the place to get a quick bite.

Yelp, you have disappointed me. 

Will not be returning, you have lost a foodie costumer.
Fantastic Korean BBQ here. Great ambiance here, with good service. Terrific spot for groups as well. My favorite place to eat in Vegas, by far and away.

Got a call from a friend whose birthday venue turned out to be overbooked. She was frantic to find a place that served Asian food, was affordable, but great enough for the dozen of us to enjoy--in  a couple of short hours from her call!  Of course, I turned to Yelpers and the fact that Gangnam had over 2,500 reviews with an average rating of 4.5 stars convinced me this was a safe place to recommend. My friend immediately booked their private room for 7pm.

While the restaurant appeared small from the storefront, it was surprisingly well laid out for groups, couples, and we saw singles dining, too. So don't hesitate to stop in if you're dining solo.  We were seated in a private room toward the back, large enough, yet cozy for 12.

As soon as most of the group were seated, the ban chan was brought in. Large variety of appetizer were laid out, including the requisite kimchi mixes, sprouts, taegu, and more. Our friendly server guided us to the combination selections.  It was unanimous that the Gangnam combo would be the way to go as the more people you have, the better the price per person. The ban chan had the requisite various kimchi, sprouts, and much more.

Onion miso soup, large salad to share, fresh oysters on the  half shell, grilled shishito peppers, mushroom medley, choice of steamed rice or bulgogi bibimbap rice, and beef ... lots and lots of beef ... kalbi, bulgogi,  etc. Food seemed to just keep coming until we were overwhelmed and finally tapped out!

We enjoyed the experience and the food so much, we're planning on heading back with another group of family coming to town in a few weeks.

gangnam is very good.  good food, friendly staff and great options to the bbq style korean meals.  my wife loves the side dishes and i love the spicy chicken!!!  i really recommend and kin is our server very great server.
Great service and good size portions.  I wish they would make the bulgogi with shaved beef as it is a much better texture.
Love the food here! The servers are so nice. I even got a beer on the house from my server. He was awesome. Definitely recommend this place. 10/10!
After a round of golf in 100plus degree weather decided to dine off the the strip.  What a pleasant surprise. Great food and authentic Korean recipes.

Wonderful food! I really like the kalbi! It is so delicious. You should try the spicy tuna it is so good! The food is just great. Great service! They play music while eating and I love it they even have a music video monitor on the wall! How cool is that? It stays open until 1am. Great for late dinner. Wait isn't long! 10-15 min and we were in.

I live in LA, so I'm been to my fair share of Korean BBQ restaurants and tasted some great Asian food. This place went beyond my expectations, for flavor, quality, value, and service. Came here for the late night happy hour and I had the most delicious feast, with many BBQ dishes for only 3-4 dollars! Highly recommend.
I loved there food and athmosphere food was delicious. The bannana. Desert was my favorite. The meat was tender the Best food ever.
