We had the premium and it was amazing... the meat was melt in your mouth delicious!!! Service was great and it was so good that it made us angry that we can't come here everyday! Lol

Good food and efficient service for the price you will pay.  Worth the money.  You will need to wait a bit- 20-30 min.  We went at 8:30pm and had to wait 20 min.  It was worth the wait.  Kalbi Prime Beef and Kobe Style Beef was fabulous.  Pork belly was good.  Portion sizes are large for the chicken salad and bibimbap.  Definitely to share.  Parking is easy in the lot.  
A great place to get your fix on Asian food.  Nice atmosphere.
Service was great. Food was great! Definitely would come back! Price is right, no complaints!
Best Korean food by far! Great selection and left happily fulfilled! Brought the parents here and they loved it!
Their meat looks very set was fulfilling! Love the beef tongue and the salad is a great combination with meat to help it make it less oily.

Good place. Not too expensive.  They have 2 happy hours everyday, 1/2 price drinks and appetizers. 
Meat was good quality and lots of sides.

YUM!!!!  Soooo good!!  Can I give it more stars?  So good I woke up craving for more!

Japchae & Bulgolgi are the best I've ever ate.  It worked out to be cheaper than All you can eat for our group of 8.  Well worth the over an hour wait.  

8 people = $20 each!
2 Japchae
4 Prime Kalbi
5 Bulgolgi
1 Filet Mignon
1 Chicken
Sodas & Beer

Travel here, yelped and came. Very disappointed. The food is not fresh and not tasty at all. The waitress here is very impolite. I don't understand how they get this good rating. I would give it zero star if I could.
Great experience. I was expecting buffet but it didn't matter that it's not buffet because the combo meals come w a lot of food. Our whole table was full. Everything was flavorful.
Good experience overall we tried the prime kalbi,flat iron garlic, Kobe style beef and the best was the Korean prime kalbi. Good vibe and service by all staff.

This was a great dining experience. Great quality cuts of meat and plenty of side dishes to go around.

My fiancee and I came to Vegas for my birthday and we love Korean BBQ.  This was on par if not better than many other KBBQ restaurants we have been to. The portions are heavy as we decided for the meat lovers for 2 dinner. Food coma here we come. Thank you Gangnam Asian BBQ for a pleasurable dining experience.

Love this place! The atmosphere is great, love the decor. The BBQ at the table is so fun! All the food they bring out is really fresh and they give you lots of sides and sauces to mix it all with. Really great place for a date or going with friends. It's fun and interactive and the food is delicious! Can't wait to come back!!
Best bulgogi outside of San Diego. The meat was flavorful and so tender. We were craving Korean bbq and this place did not dissapoint.  A must try while in Vegas.

Who knew Korean BBQ on 4th of July would be the thing I did.  I was glad I did it nevertheless.  The food was pretty good and cost reasonable.  Portions were enough even for a food whore like myself.  

Glad I came and will be going here again.

And the KPop playing on the big screen kept the kids (and wife pretty entertained).
Good food. Much better than expected. Liked the rice and noodle and sticky rice cake especially.

Great location, the ambiance is perfect, the food was amazing, and the service was great!! Extremely accommodating toward our party and very friendly!! I would highly recommend to anyone and can't wait to come again!!
We love this place every we come to Vegas we come here with our kids and they love cooking on the grill.

Super busy today and has been every time I've been! Always love the Bulgogi! This is my 3rd time coming here and really enjoy it! 

Great experience for the family to dine.
One of the best meals I've eaten in my entire 41 years of life! So worth the walk or drive!!! I will never come to Vegas without coming here again!

What a great find in Vegas!  I've never had Korean BBQ in Vegas before, thinking that it can't beat LA K-town, but our family of 5 including my Mom loved the meat quality here, and the variety of dishes they offered.  Coming from spending 1hr wait time & $$$ on Bacchanal's the night before, I had a glimpse of thought that we should have come straight here instead for half the price.  As we bit into the first bites of our meal, we thought that it actually may be better than Ktown LA BBQ.  We ordered few extra dishes along with the premium meat combos.  All great, but next time, we'll eat the uni rice bowl without having it mixed for us by the waiter.  It would be much better if it's not thoroughly mixed in the hot pot, so that we can savor the uni.  They gave us free macaroon ice creams for each of us that checked in on yelp as well.  Either way, service was also excellent!

Excellent place to have a nice dinner.  If you like to cook your own food this is for you.  The price was very reasonable and the food quantity was quite good.  The waitstaff needs a bit more personality but that was the only flaw as all aspects would be recommended!
Amazing place! Delicious food. One of the best spots in Vegas. Waiters are always super nice. Must check it out.
The atmosphere is nice. The meat is a little salty. The pork belly is probably the best

I was wondering why this restaurant has over 3000+ reviews. Turns out they offer a free macaron ice cream sandwich if you write one. What a brilliant marketing scheme! Every restaurant should implement this Yelp hack. Food-wise their dishes were quite good and varied, independent of the free dessert offering. Came out very fast and efficiently. The uni bib bim bap was quite delicious, but be sure to specify that you do not want them to mix it. Unfortunately they mixed mine before I had a chance to protest but were nice enough to bring me extra uni on the side to compensate.
This place was highly rated.. but I am not sure why. The food was too expensive and just okay.
Very good! Good prices and great portions for sharing many different dishes. Def recommend this place instead of going to ayce bbq

This restaurant really satisfied my craving for Korean BBQ. It is more than just BBQ place! My sister also went crazy about how good looking the waiter(s) here. Definitely worth a visit if u want a good korean (asian) bbq experience in Las Vegas!
Great food! Wait staff was attentive, and taught our table about each food and the best way to cook.

Fantastic KBBBQ. Great flavor, the grill is perfectly designed and the rates are decent. Expect to spend 20 per person at the  least. You enter to a nice aroma of the food and you leave with a great taste of meat in your mouth. If you've never tried Korean BBQ before, you owe yourself to experience this self grilling experience!!

Really delicious food, fun experience. Easy menu, we ordered filet migon and garlic shrimp you get to cook to your liking which is a plus, most restaurants never cook my steak the right way. They give you a bunch of sides which were interesting, my favorite was the fried squid. Chicken fried rice was really good, really big portion good for two people. The sangria was awesome !! If I ever come back to Vegas we would definitely come back. Wish New York had something like this it would do really well!

This place is legit! Great customer service (THANK YOU BRENT - you are an amazing fun and super fast server!!! ^^ ), food, atmosphere, etc.. There wasn't one thing we ordered that was not good. A great place to come for lunch, dinner, and even after hours. Come and get some!!! Ask for Brent!

This place is awesome!!!!  Y'all have to try the fried dumplings. They are delicious. I had the spicy seafood ramen and it's just the best ramen I ever had. Definetly coming back. Oh and is super close to UNLV :)
This is one of the best BBQ I have ever tried. The food is delicious and it is not expensive. PLZ try Uni Bibibamp!
Place is great, it was our first time visiting and the staff was very friendly and energetic. The environment is nice and the food is as good as it can be. Keep up the great work GangNam!

Meat is seasoned to perfection! Sweet and attentive waiters! Came during happy hour and prices are way good. Very cheap actually. Ordered the toro beef, bulgogi, and chicken cheese fondue. They offer three different dipping sauces, all were tasty. Free dessert with each review, ice cream macaroon or banana tempura. We got both since the boyfriend and I each wrote one. Both were delicious. If you're looking to share, the banana tempura portion is large.

We ordered Gangnam style for 2 and a Meat lovers special for 2, It was the perfect size for 5 people. The waiter seemed to be constantly forgetful after being called over for assistance multiple times. Food was good but the review loses a star for the hostess who was rude to our party checking in and had to have a waiter stop her from speaking with our table.

Delicious!! Be ready to wait a bit though if you go in the evening hours! But it's so worth it. All the meat is super flavorful and tender. Probably some of the best KBBQ I've had. Two people can fill their bellies with 50$. We didn't do a special, we just picked 6 or 7 meats and some rice and were very happy!
Awesome. Must try. Definitely worth a try. Korean BBQ!!! Must I say more. If you live for korean food and not go here you're missing out big timeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

??????????????!
Taste good and price resonable, sure will come again.

This place is the korean version of Gyu Kaku. We got the meatlovers set and it was all pretty tasty! Their beef dishes were super tender which is a plus. Def try the beef toro and garlic flat iron if you were to order individually. Its better than gyu kaku because there's ban chan. The service was friendly and they were super attentive. Our waiter in particular was super sweet and funny. We'll be back Gangnam, Thanks!
Really good food, nice atmosphere and a great waitstaff, friendly and attentive but not intrusive.  Very good quality meats and sides.
Sooooooo good!! The employees were all incredibly nice, and the food was delicious. Eating here is absolutely worth while, I recommend it any day!
Delicious spicy pork and Kalbi was good. Good quality meat. Definitely worth a visit in Vegas.
Great place to for Korean BBQ !!! The service and food quality are the best !! Try the sangria !!

Second time coming here and quality and value still as good as the first. We were a group of 5 people. We got the gangnam for two people and added extra meat to it and it was enough for all of us.  

Service is awesome and fast. Servers were attentive and friendly. Never felt bad to stop anyone and ask for a favor. Willing to come back!
My friend and I went down here to try out their Korean BBQ, it was great! We got the Las Vegas for two and couldn't finish it! Very yummy and filling

Excellent service and food. I can't believe we didn't know about this place..Good quality and affordable.   See you again soon..It turns out we went during their 2nd Happy hour, so i was amazed how inexpensive our total bill was.  John and Rebeca.

Tired of spending excessive amounts of money eating in Las Vegas? Well you have found a goldmine in this place. We came for the happy hour and we definitely left happy and full. The food is delicious, reasonably priced, and varied. We definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Las Vegas and need a break from the strip.
First tine here and food taste great and excellent service. I highly recomment to everyone to try...
I was so disappointed that they don't even offer seafood, not worth the one hour wait for sure, way overrated...

Pretty good food, the environment is nice, but honestly just a little overpriced for me. I moved here from Washington were usually Korean BBQ is all you can eat and includes all the great little appetizers and it was 20 bucks per person, so do me it was just a little over priced for what I'm used to. The food and service were good though.
Recommended: seafood pancakes, Harami beef, beef toro, garlic calamari, and mushrooms medley. For the best deal come during Happy hours. Drinks are 50% off. We got a pitcher of Sapporo for $8.50

This is the most bland food I have ever had at any restaurant of any type. I've eaten at several Asian BBQ types of places in the Los Angeles area, and we're glad that this wasn't our first experience because we never would've eaten at this style restaurant again. We chose this restaurant (driving through the state from LA to Utah) because of all the positive Yelp! comments, and we were just so surprised at how flavorless the food was. In addition, one member of our party ordered the beef gyoza appetizer that comes with the lunch menu,  and it was ice cold. We had to ask the server if it should've been served hot, which it was. We waited quite a bit for the appetizer to be prepared properly. 

There are six mini appetizers that come with your lunch menu and after the gyoza experience, we weren't sure which of the items should've been hot or cold, and they were mostly unappetizing.

Service was also slow, could have been far more attentive, and the restaurant was not busy. It took an hour and a half for our lunch. 

I hesitate to post this comment because obviously so many people think differently and really seem to love this restaurant. However, that said, I read reviews to get an idea of everyone's experience so this post is to reflect our experience. It could just be a matter of taste!

In A Nutshell:

-We had an urge for Korean food after watching Anthony Bourdain eat galbi jim on TV in the hotel the previous night and Yelped "korean" spots in Vegas (surprisingly there were A LOT of choices)
-As you guessed it correctly Gangnam Asian BBQ was our pick.
-We came at lunch and it was easy to find.  It's located in a shopping plaza next to a tattoo parlor.
-They have a nice selection of combos and tapas.  We went w/ the Gangnam combo which in the end was too much food (and I hate wasting food, but didnt want to walk around with a backpack smelling of KBBQ).  I think the bill came out to around $75 including the tip.

Overall, its a nice restaurant with nice servers and you definitely will be full :)

You really can't beat the awesome deal this place has on meat dishes like the spicy chicken or spicy chicken with all the sides for just $3.25 total for their 2 happy hours (mid afternoon and late night) daily!  Always delicious and never fails to satisfy my appetite each time I visit Vegas.  HIGHLY recommend!
If you visit las vegas and want to try real korean food. This is the place that you would want to visit during your vacation. Dont forget to try macaron icecream
I love all the options here. My wife and I tried the Happy hour. We were impressed! The staff was very helpful!. We will be back A+ Service here.
The guy is very helpful in giving us information about the food information  & it is delicious.

So much food and so much fun.  We've made this a go to spot to bring out of town family and friends.  Wait staff is always fast and friendly and the restaurant is always clean and comfortable plus the prices are great.
Ordered the bulgogi bimbimpap (sp) and it was so good! Also had a side of the mixed tempura and it was cooked to perfection. So awesome. 5 stars.
Great food and service really hits the mark. Amazing prices especially if you come for happy hour.

Good service! Nice food!
My friend and I waited in line for half an hour so we were going to be late for the show we booked. They arranged our order and set the table right away.

When looking for a very well deserved alternative to the wondrous world of ayce joints in Vegas, we opted to try this highly rated and mega reviewed spot.

And guess what?
it was hella good.

Not that you really had to guess since my four star rating clearly indicates I liked it.
Oh Dan B, your redundancies grow more and more with each passing day.
Anyways.

First of all, what looks to be a fairly standard strip mall restaurant from the outside takes on a very unexpected turn once you step inside and behold a very sleek, modern, and spacious layout.  What really got my attention was the absence of the billowing smoke wafting around tables when people are grilling - it's something I both fondly and annoyingly associate with most Asian BBQ places.

The staff was super attentive from the get go and really helpful when it came to best deciphering which combination of set menus and a la cart items would yield the best sampling of what Gangnam had to offer.

And I have to tell you the selection, quality, and flavor of the meats we grilled were impressive: tender, well seasoned, and fresh.  The servings aren't necessarily huge, but it needn't be when it's that good and so reasonably priced that ordering extra isn't too exorbitant.

Overall, Gangnam has to be one of the best BBQ experiences I've had in awhile: great food and drink, stylish decor, and somewhere my little one would enjoy going. It's also helps reminds me how nice / necessary it is to take a break from buffets every once in awhile.

Went here with my brother and sister, it was really good. They had good kimchi and short ribs. The service was really quick and nice. All of the employees where really nice and friendly. I really like the shrimps that I had. Another good thing about this place is that they open later so around midnight and you feel like some Korean bbq, then definitely come here.
Love this place definitely worth coming back!! Great service and great ambience, they even keep an eye on your food to make sure you don't burn it lol!!

Such a nice atmosphere! The meets are great quality and filled with flavor. I love how they also give the customers different sauces as well since I love full flavors and sauces. Hehe, definitely coming back. The happy hour is great. Their drink menu is awesome as well, you MUST try the lychee martini, so yumzz! :)
A good Korean bbq restaurant. The service is good and fast. The food is delicious, and I like the beef very much . I would highly recommend this restaurant if you go for a tour in Las Vegas.

Brought my hungry husband here for a birthday dinner. It didn't disappoint. Ordered the Gangham combo for two and the waitress helped us through the ordering process. Enjoyed cooking on the grill. The wooden benches could use some padding but other than that, it's an excellent choice for a unique meal when you're hungry.
Very delicious!  I would definitely recommend this place! Especially the fried calamari
Very good. Service was great, food was cooked to perfection, obviously cause I cooked it myself. Great little place to swing by for lunch.

Great food with an authentic Korean taste. Any of their combo meals are a great amount of food for the reccommended servings. You will end up spending about 25 to 35 a person if you purchase around the middle of the price range. They keep your empty dishes cleared and glasses full. Its a delicious meal and lots of fun with a social group for a competitive price. The nature of the meal does make it a bit loud though, so keep that in mind. Location is just 5 minutes from the strip so that's a huge plus

Wow what a hidden gem. Do yourself a favor and get off the strip for some really good food. Do not mistake this place for one of those cheap all you can eat Korean buffets. This place has set menus based on number of people or a la carte if you want to make your own combination.
The must have appetizer is Uni and pork belly. It's low carb, fatty and creamy. All kinds of yummy goodness. Seriously. One order has two wraps so order accordingly. 
The meat is such good quality. Trimmed and perfectly marbled. You can choose marinated or natural. I recommend natural since the quality of meat was excellent it doesn't need much. This is how you know the place is good when you grill the meat simply and dip it in a bit of sesame oil, salt and pepper. 
This is now my new must go to place when I come to Vegas. One of the best Korean restaurants in Nevada and I highly recommend it.

Worth the hype and the wait.  Extremely high quality and tasty BBQ at unbeatable prices!  Menu does stray a bit at times (eg cream cheese wantons and spicy tuna served on top fried rice balls), but the core meats (kalbi, bulgogi) and bibimbop (particularly the bulgogi bibimbop!) are all awesome.  Make sure to order a large Hite and do some Korean Soju bombs as well!
Very good restaurant! Orderrd the meat combo for 4 people. Small dishesb are good. Yelp??????????

Great Korean food, great experience with a group, lots of meets and very filling. Bulgogi was delicious and the servers were very attentive. The special is a good deal esp for Vegas. Oysters were aiiiiiite, but other than that everything was #DANK

Good portions sizes and the meat quality was good.  It's not L.A. Kbbq but it has its own flair.  Service was good even though we were a party of 11.  The only shortcomming was that the sides needed some work.

My husband and I are in Vegas and we have a craving for Korean food.  This place has a lot of great reviews and we thought to give it a try.  It was absolutely awesome!  Well worth it!  The staff is attentive and very friendly.  Definitely a place that we will visit again when we come back to Vegas.

Checked in on a Saturday, June 16, 2018.  Ordered a set by recommendation of staff.   The premium had something for everyone in our party of 20 to enjoy.   We enjoyed each and every dish, plus sides.  Went during early happy hour.   Men drank by the pitchers.   Wine, sake, soju for women.
The staffs are very friendly. Good food served at a timely manner! Enjoyed my time here very much!

The food tasted just okay. Service was poor. 
Ordered the marinated beef and kimchi spicy soup. The marinate tasted a bit too strong and sweet and soup was alright. 
The service was not good at all. The server didn't even greet us when she approached our table and did not look at our eyes or smile the every time she came to our table. Server was too busy (the place wasn't even packed) to check up on us and when we called her, she was not happy. It would have been nice to have more a friendly atmosphere. Maybe it's a good thing we don't live in Vegas.

I think that the food is not at all authentic Korean food because everything tasted like a Fast Food version of Korean Food. Not only the food to complain about is that the service was horrible. The staff members seemed obedient at first but when we ordered, the food came out super slowly and the staff members seemed like they just forgot what we asked them. I think that this is the worst Korean BBQ restaurant ever cause of their service and horrid quality of food.

Amazing food amazing flavor highly recommend.
The quality is extremely good. My favorite is the beef bulgogi bibimbap
Decent price. Meat was pretty good quality. The service could be better as far as attentiveness but overall a great experience.

This place is cool but I wish they could pay more attention to the customer. I understand they are busy, but we had to constantly ask for attention. The food was pretty good and there was a wide variety of different meats. The prices were higher than expected for food we had to cook ourselves. Good place overall.
Amazing food, outstanding service,  friendly and helpful people, large potions, not a long wait, we'll worth it!!! Will definitely be back!!! Thank you Ryan

Excellent service, delicious food, all at a reasonable price. The only negative was the long wait times, but after something like that it's quite understandable. 5/5 would visit again. Also enjoyed happy hour food.
Best choice after bug winning!!! Love this place so much!!! Nice service nice environment nice food!!!!!! Most importantly nice price !!!!
Great service! We ordered the Meat Lovers and it was worth the price! Will definitely come back!

I got here at 9pm on a Saturday and the wait for 2 people was only 15 minutes. Super cute place with a great authentic Korean atmosphere! 
We ordered the harami miso, the Korean prime kalbi, the beef toro, and the bulgogi. Everything was great but my absolute favorites were the Korean kalbi and beef toro!!! Next time I want to order two of these! Haha. The portions were decent and the food came out fast! The service was good and very attentive, the waiters all spoke English super well so there wasn't a language barrier like other Korean places. And I love that this place wasn't ayce since I usually don't go to ayce bc I can't eat that much and it's not worth the cost hahaha but here you can order as you please! :) I left here feeling full & satisfied but not stuffed and gross like I do after ayce!

P.S. i'm use to eating kbbq back in ktown in LA and this hands down is wayyyyy better than any other place (including non-AYCE places). I wish this was closer to home, i would be going here every weekend! This is as good as it gets!

Very very good. Very traditional food.
The beef and shrimp are the best.
I like it very much
First time trying kbbq in Vegas and it's so good. Their hirami miso is so tender. They brought out the food pretty quickly. Our server is attentive as well. Will definitely come back!

It was great we had spicy chicken Korean chicken and beef brisket ribeye short ribs and some other beef with rice salad dumplings and broccoli it was all pretty tasty cheese was a little bit sweet wasn't a big fan of that they came in traded our grill out numerous times frequent refills great service the wait was kind of wild but it was the Thursday evening w/o reservation and upside with a yelp check in I got a free macaroon ice cream sandwich yasssssss btw I left so crazy full I was super
There was a lot of food, we ordered the meat lovers dish for four people. We had enough for six! I love this food!

We came here during our brief stay in Vegas to celebrate my brother's birthday. We all love KBBQ and were not disappointed. The food was great, service was great, and the price for four people wasn't bad either!

Booked a reservation through Open Table, and found out they didn't accept any reservations after 8pm. However, they were so accommodating and still sat us within the time frame.

We ordered the premium for 4 and the food was delicious!! A must try when youre in Vegas. 

The customer service was on point from the beginning to end. Definitely will recommend this place to anybody visiting Vegas.

Cooked to perfection because well, I cooked it. :). And if it wasn't than there is no one to blame but myself. 

All the meet was great. The sides were wonderful. Always love the Steamed eggs and sweet corn cheese.
I really love it here the food and service is amazing "!  there's so many different kind of foods , I really love the rib eye , and the rice and also bacon wrapped scallops"'
I love this place!! Its so good i drive pretty far to go to this korean Bbq !  I try to go at least once a week to satisfy my craving!

We came here on Friday after Thanksgiving and place was crazy packed! Wait time was over 1 hour. Reason why I deducted 1 star. 

After we were seated, appetizers and food came out pretty quick and service was good. The spicy tuna kimbap was really yummy, with crunchy rice rolls underneath the spicy tuna. 

The meat was very fresh and well seasoned too, just need to make sure you watch the meat so it doesn't burn.

Only downside with Korean bbq is you always end up smelling like the bbq lol. But the food here was great! Probably try to come earlier to avoid the long wait though.
Deliciously tasty food. We went with the meat lovers for 2 people and it was so much food! We left so happy.

Drinks are definitely worth the trip off the strip...cool vibe nice and attentive staff.  Jay was awesome best Service we had our whole trip. Food is delicious and man do you get a lot of good stuff to go along with it. Very fun and recommend it very highly
The side dishes is so good! And we ordered the Meat Lover for 2 people! The Bulgogi in this set is my favorite. Five stars for the nice service and great food. By the way, I love the Kpop music here!

Easily one of the best KBBQ places I've ever eaten in!  To begin with,  the staff and the service are fantastic...extra courteous, fast and always smiling!! Then there's the restaurant itself...very clean, well kept and really cool...the music video really adds to the ambiance!! Then there was the food...plain and simply...WOW!! Excellent quality and flavors!! Totally earned the 5 stars!!  Thank Gangnam!!
Yummy! The cow tounge and green onions  was great! Spicy seafood ramen was yummy after adding all the sauces. Nice ambience, friend

I wish this flavor in my mouth would never end. After this meal, I'm literally going to spit in a cup to preserve the flavor and then drink it tomorrow just so I can have a taste of this restaurant again.  In fact,  I am going to soak up the meat juices off my plate with a napkin so I can smell it later and reminisce about how great this restaurant is.

Excellent food. Fantastic service. Great for family or a date. Try the meals on the back of the menu. It's a lot of food but a great value.

We will gladly return.

We came in on New Year's Day and thus had a wait of about 40 mins but the food and efficiency of the servers made it totally worth it. This is one of the best Korean bbq's that I have been to in the US! We ordered the 2 most popular  bbq dishes along with several sides including the Korean pancakes, miso soup, edamame, etc. It was all spot on delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant to even the pickiest eater!
Its a great korean BBQ restaurant?the meat and the oyster are really fresh. There are many different choices for 2 people or more? and the price is not high.
The food is great! Definitely one of the better Korean restaurants in town! The price is a bit more expensive but it's make up for in quality
Food is really good. Meats are really tender and juicy. Great service too. Will definitely come back for more..

Great experience! First Asian bbq style dinner for us. The staff were more then helpful getting us on the right track, taking their time to explain everything and answering my questions. Went with the premium selection and was not disappointed

Its a very nice restaurant a little away from  vegas strip. Food are delicious. They have a fast service. Very clean
 Servers are very fast. Very accomodating. Very professional. I like their icecream , the free one that they give whenever tou check in yelp. You must try that!. The ambiance are like zen, its so relaxing.
It's the first time I came to Las Vegas, and this is the right choice. The food is delicious and all the waiters are very nice! I'm very satisfied.

If you have time in Vegas, come by here during there happy hour. This place is a must try if you're near it. The meat quality is really good during happy hour too. I recommend the beef carpaccio ! None of the items that we got there was bad, so if you want to explore on food items, this is the place to do so.

Generous portions 
Good service 
Great quality food 
Music and atmosphere is great :)

Great happy hour value. 
Location is near Hard Rock Casino which is not far off the strip. Portions are large and the self cooking is fun. The quality of the meats was outstanding for the price. Will return. Total bill for two people ordering way to much food was under $40.00.
Awesome service, amazing happy hour and great variety of healthy choices!  My favorites are the steak toro, broccoli, corn, mushrooms and free sides!
Must come and check out its delicious!!! If it's your first time or even second time to Vegas you must come before you leave and get some Korean BBQ!!
Great environment to eat. Great customer service. This will be a great place for a date too.

Now one of my favorite places in Vegas! Authentic, fun. The food was perfect. The service was more than excellent. And the atmosphere in there was very nice. I love the k-pop videos going into the background, the striking colors. I had a Somek to drink, ask for that it's fun and tasty. We also had the Yuzu, which was excellent. Then we had Kobe beef, Japanese peppers (shishito), asparagus, cheese fondue chicken, and a variety of other things. It was tasty and filling!
Really had a good lunch. They offer a lot meat and other dishes. We drove just from Zion and really need a good lunch.
A very nice and fun restaurant. The food tastes great. We trusted the waiter's recommendations and were not disappointed, or maybe we were too hungry around the midnight. :)
Reservation was good as we didn't need to wait. The food was good. Ordered the lemon soju, true picture was deceiving as it looked like a jug but when it came out was a small cup. Sheesh

kevin.... you are SO RIGHT BRO!!!!!!! gotta get me that pork toro... my friends and i call it "PORO" Chicken was amazing.. and make sure to get the brisckot of beef its wicked frickin tender.  Got a free mackaroon for checkin in on yelp.
One of the best dining experiences. More than just food and service. This place does it all right!

Came here for the reviews and stayed for the amazing food! Everything meet expectations in flavor and service. They play music and portray the music video on the wall. The grill isn't like other typical Korean BBQ which gets dirty quickly and provides a nice even hot plate for the food to cook. Loved the side dishes. The salmon poppers were great. Scallops were tasty and the meat was succulent.
Yummy food, the steak was the best with the sauces and sides. The combos have the best value, also the kimchi was very good.

My first time having Korean short ribs. Waiter was nice and offered to show us how to cook the first round. I know it is marked as $$, but for what you get it is worth it, food was delicious. The staff should great service and we got our free ice cream by checking in. Definitely coming back when visiting again.
Great tasting food.  Able to cook on your own to your preference.  We ordered food for 2 and is enough for 3 of us.  Good service.  Unlike other places, the BBQ here is not smoky.
Super delicious! Get the gangnam plate for 2 or more! Loved the mushrooms and delicious meats in this combo.
Amazing food!  Service was good too.  I was a little worried because of a few reviews about poor service but I had no issues.  Defiantly going back when I'm in Vegas
First time here, after the strip buffet here is a good place to try. Really good meat, we love it!
Nice place for hanging out with meat lover friends????????????????????????
First time trying koren bbq. Service was ok. The girl jus keep putting all the food out little by little, was very confusing with a big group. But the food was bomb!! Def wood come back

Great food, nice service. 
Awesome happy hour.  Get try the Korean prime Kalbi! So good!!!!!!!!!'
Great quality meat! Hidden gem in Vegas! Always enjoy the food especially my favorite Shrimp Bibimbap! Service is great!!
Delicious and the price is great too! Definitely try the Macaroon Ice Cream Sandwiches!

This is an amazing restaurant! The staff is amazing and the food has been excellent the two times I have been here for lunch. I never have to wait and they serve great complimentary appetizers. Everything about this place is superb!
Solid food and service. The side dishes were a lot better than most Korean restaurants I've been to. Got extra noodles and veggies for only $2!

We ordered the 4 person meat lovers meal. There were 5 of us...adults! There were left overs!!! Excellent food, great atmosphere, and wonderful service. We would definitely come back next time we visit.
This place is awesome. All the food was really good. The Kobe Ssam actually comes with real wasabi - first time I ever tried that. Be careful with it! Stuff is stronger than you would believe.

Great first experience. Everything was fresh & delicious. As an appetizer the spicy dynamite shrimp was the best I ever tried . Definitely recommending & definitely coming again . The waiter was very friendly and easy going . The atmosphere is very hip and oriental .

The best Korean BBQ place in town!!! I will never go to another BBQ place ever. Bulgogi was my favorite dish. I am definitely going to go back and try all of the other food that they offer! Good place to go for dates, or with a group of people. Service is very fast, and the quality of the food is really good! Ask for John, he is very helpful!
Food was good! We ordered the Las Vegas for 2 and we were a Party of 3 and we still didn't finish everything. Lots of yummy sides... Meats were good
The food and atmosphere here are absolutely top notch. Its a fun place to eat while tasting delicious. And the servers were extremely nice and keep the dri ks full!

This is a great place to have Korean BBQ and my experience here was great! It has a nice and pleasant atmosphere inside. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. As for the food, it was amazing! The meats were of great quality. The kobe beef and the steak tartare, they were really great and the taste really just melted in my mouth. Would definitely come back here again!
Came here for family dinner. We chose meat lover: $140 for 6 ppl. Good portion for everyone, love the prime Kalibi.

The interior of this restaurant is really nice! I love how it's red and black, gives it a really chill environment. 
As a huge kbbq fan, I would have to say that the meat isn't as great as it could be. Some of the cuts were thicker than they usually are at other places which is why I docked one star. 
Despite that, I find myself coming back here frequently. I enjoy the food and I like the service! 

Thank you guys for another great experience!
Food is very good but service not good. Maybe needed more help. Example we asked for lemon, we had to asked 3 times .

Outstanding place! The food, the service and environment are just great! And it's cheap. If you love korean or seafood then you must go to the place. It's only 5min from the Strip street by car. Unfortunately, there is no affordable Korean restaurants on the main street. Good place for 4-6 people.

Food was good , limited choices then other Korean BBQ places , but the lady at night was really rude , we walked in from a urban club next door and she instantly frowned her face up ! She judged us before we could even sit down , (three black people).
One of our friends was really drunk and couldn't even lift her head up to eat , she rested while another friend and I ate the food , our friend that was resting didn't even touch any food and the lady still charged us full price for her basically sitting there ,
She was really rude and not very welcoming , will not get any business from my friends and I ever again ..
This place was super yummy! Kinda reminded me of gyu kaku but the flavor is much better than theirs!! And the macaroon ice cream was yummy in my tummy!!
best Korean BBQ ever. I went here with my friends. We ordered meat lovers combo. It was delicious. The macaroons were really good.
First time here and the food was delicious, great service too. Highly recommended. We will be back again soon!

A must visit when you're in Vegas. We got the gangnam style platter, their cheese corn and spicy Kim bop. Everything is delicious and the meat and seafood were of the highest quality. The raw oysters didn't have the seafood after taste at all and went down smooth. The appetizers came out quickly and they keep giving you more if you ask for it.

Service was excellent. The staff is attentive and friendly. 

Ambiance is chill. It's like most of the other Korean restaurants I've been to with kpop music in the background and they're willing to turn on sports for you if you request it. Overall a satisfying meal and experience.

One word. Uggghhhhh . . . Spotted this joint after leaving Revolt. Wait wasn't too bad, and other Yelpers had rated it 4.5 stars. Yelpers, you've never lead me astray! My husband and I ordered the Gangnam. How this generally ONLY feeds 2 people blew our minds, and we can put away food! It came with: fresh oyster, fried calamari, shishito pepper yuzu, green salad, bulgogi bibimbap, miso soup, harami miso beef, Korean prime kalbi beef, flat iron garlic beef, filet mignon, bulgogi, and mushroom medley. Needless to say, we went home with 2 meals worth of leftovers. There was not a single dish we didn't like. Favors were all perfect. Staff was super nice and had just the right amount of attentiveness. Once our food triplets digest, we will be back.

The place is not all you can eat. The portion sizes are fair for the price. Between three people we split the gangnam set. We also were not very hungry though. So keep that in mind if you're really hungry. Service was diligent and kind. Thank you!
One of my favorite resturant. Delicious food, yummy salad and good desert. But long waiting time around 30 mins with very very good services. Will come to have lunch next time

This is my new favorite spot in town! They have a great selection on the menu, and the price is right. Service is spot on, and i love having the grill right at the table to cook my own! Definitely a great date night, or change of pace to the usual watering hole.

This was a highlight to my Vegas trip.  Never have tried KBBQ, so my boyfriend and I thought it would be a great time to. We got the meat lovers deal and it was ALOT of food! Plus, it was very affordable! Such a great experience. If only we lived closer!
The food was amazing! Really nice lunch special that will leave you full! Easy parking and great prices. Also a very large desert menu.

This is the kind of Korean BBQ that let you cook right at the table.  The quality of the meat was great so you can't really go wrong.  The selection was massive too -- much more so than any other Korean BBQ that I've frequented.  The beef tongue was my favorite, but then again, all things beef were great.  The seafood was decent, then again I didn't go there for the seafood.  You order ala carte, but the price is still very reasonable. The staff was friendly and attentive -- perhaps too friendly.  We had the back-room booked for a party of 10, but the previous party was taking way longer than expected.  The staff would not hurry them up so they had to sit us elsewhere.  Still, if you are looking to gorge yourself in some quality meat, you will not be disappointed in this place.

This place is great and its not too far from the strip only about a 10 minute ride or so which is not too bad for good quality food. It does get busy during lunch times so keep that in mind and maybe get there early. You can also sit at the bar and order which is nice. And I love that they have the traditional Korean BBQ grill. 

As for the food its all pretty traditional I go there often and I especially like their fried calamari and the beef toro. For dessert I really like the cheesecake its perfect. Overall great place with great service.

Okay guys, discard my last review. Since that REVIEW WAS FAKE just for some free dessert and so is everyone else review that is to here. I had to delete it because it was so untrue about this place.

This place sucks balls. I'm not comparing it to LA at all. They charge for sesame oil and salt and salad? $4.75 for a steamed egg? You got to be kidding me. Plus they're portions are so small and expensive, I couldn't even get full! Oh and rice was $2 for a small bowl...

So literally each place of meat only has 6 small pieces for $9. So we pretty much ordered everything in the meat section and some bacon wrapped scallops snd salmon. Those were honestly okay. 

We decided to try something new by getting cheese fondue with broccoli. BIG MISTAKE. It was literally Kraft single cheese with oil? It didn't even melt right over the fire and wouldn't even stick on the broccoli. 

SERVICE? Okay they were attentive when it came to ordering... But when we tried to refill our bachan they never came of course . We tried refilling twice on radish and bean sprouts! They said yes and then never return with it! 

Plus when we received our bill they didn't put our drinks on HH and we had to tell them. *eye rolls* 

Overall, I regret coming here based off fake reviews. I should of when to Gyu-Kaku.  Don't waste your money here.

Meat lovers is a must! Best thing ever. This is our second time here and our friends first and they love it. Definitely try some of the dried squid and the Macaroons are  awesome. Will continue to come here.

The service was fast and I had not one complaint about any of the food.

My friend that I was with is usually particularly picky about chicken and had no complaints. He ended up ordering four portions of it.

Being a vegetarian obviously my options are limited but everything else about the restaurant was right on point to me.

For omnivores this is a must visit spot for 2-4 people to fill their stomachs!

Pretty good, but not nearly as good as the Korean BBQ places in Los Angeles. The meat was okay taste wise, but you really needed to dip them in the sauce, even the marinated meats like bulgogi and kalbi. Quantity wise, portions were also very small for side dishes and meats. Not sure why they have such fantastic reviews. They're okay, but not "as good as it gets." The free macaron ice cream with a yelp check-in gets them an extra star.

Nice interior
Kind service
Good foods
Safe location

Korean bbq here are very right choice

Above all, the side dishes are served. As requested free of charge.

If you want good deal, here is the place

This place is not as flexible when it comes to AYCE and the seating was very tight. The food was mediocre and the staff was slow. I don't want to go into much detail but the prices are pretty high for the amount of set food served. I will give them 2 stars for trying though and I believe that is pretty generous.
Bomb! bomb food great happy hour prices great service and flavorful dishes. Perfect for late night or an evening with friends. Bulgogi and gimshi is delicious

This place has a nice modern ambience.  They have music videos playing on a giant screen, but not to loudly, to give a slight party feel without intruding into your dinner conversation. 

 The menu is a la carte but the food quality is extraordinary. I've been to many KBBQs in Vegas, and this is by far my favorite. I've been here maybe 4-5 times. 

Their spicy tuna appetizer is really good. The beef carpaccio is average, I ordered it once and never again. 

The skirt steak, galbi, toro, bulgogi and filet are all excellent. Their beef tongue is the best in Vegas. The chicken here is okay, but I always get the chicken cheese fondue because I love cheese.

Overall, a great ambience, location, never any wait and great food quality. I will be back!

Service is terrible. Took forever to bring us water and took forever to come and take our order. We asked for a scissor before we start eating and it never came even after 2 times reminding them. The foods are fine. Mostly likely would not come again.
Excellent service. Plenty to eat if u get the combo. Plus  u get a free desert if u leave a review

First time at KBBQ in years but I loved this experience. We got the meat lovers for 4 even though there was 5 of us. It was enough food and the other 4 were all men. I loved the filet mignon! I also ordered the chili chicken and it comes with a side of lemon juice that you can use on the other meat.

Really great Korean BBQ restaurant. We came here for the happy hour from 3-6 and the happy hour special was amazing. The quality of the meats were good and the service was attentive. If you check in you get a macaroon ice cream as a free desert.
Great value on their bbq sets! For the price you get an abundant amount of food and side dishes! So full!
The side dishes arent exactly traditional korean but the meat is decent. They charge for lettuce wraps and korean sauces which all come with a meal at all Korean bbq places.

Not AYCE?! Meh. I'm over stuffing my face with as much food as possible to make it with my money. I'm glad they didn't have the AYCE option. 

For the price, which is quite reasonable, the portions are a good size. We had three meat plates (beef toro, pork belly, prime kalbi) and a few sides (oysters, dumplings, calamari, seaweed salad) , shared between three people. I was stuffed! We also ended up getting banana tempura for dessert. All in all, it was a good meal. My least favorite item probably wouldve been the calamari. But there are so many other items to order, it's not a big deal. It wasn't bad, I just have a high expectation for my calamari. 

As far as service, they were on top of their stuff. Never had to ask for water. They checked on us just enough to not be annoying. 

We went around 530, and we were the only people there, which worried me a bit. But by the time we left, about hour and a half later, the place was packed. So if you don't want to wait, be sure to go early. 

All in all, I definitely will be back.
One of the best Korean restaurants I've been to in the US, close to what I had in Korea. Definitely recommended!

Love this place ! Nice people and bibimbap was so tasty. Will definitely come back. 
Thanks again

That was the best meal we have had since being in Las Vegas by far!  Strip mall off of the Strip!  The meal for two is way more than two!  It was the best BBQ west of Texas!  Awesome Awesome!  Will be back next time we visit Vegas!
Great service and awesome food! Coming back again :) the Kobe carpaccio is my favorite and the Korean prime kalbi is delicious!

Everything we tried is pretty good. Our entire party was vegetarian but we had plenty of dishes to choose from. They were able to remove the meat and seafood from many of the dishes we ordered. They also have a pretty extensive selections of vegetables to grill. The corn, zuchinni, and enoki mushroom were particularly good.

Best KBBQ I've been to. Harami miso and Korean prime kalbi were the best pieces of meat I've had. Dancing flavors and fresh. Carpaccio was excellent! Duck was solid. Bacon wrapped scallops - as good as it sounds - was just alright actually. Maybe they were just outshined by the 10/10 harami and kalbi. Sides were also solid, egg dish was great! Service was great and place looks good. They deserve their high rating.

Really great food and a fun experience! We've never done Korean BBQ before and they didn't really explain how to do it, but it was easy enough to catch on watching others around us. 
We got the Gangnam and it was great! It even comes with oysters on the half shell! 
Tip: wear a shirt you can throw in the laundry because you will walk out smelling like bbq!
Love eating here.  Super yummy Korean BBQ without the super expensive price tag.  If you like Korean BBQ you will not be disappointed.

10/10 maybe even higher This is my first Korean BBQ dining experience. The service was extremely quick, scary quick. Meals were out in under 5 minutes for us to cook. Service staff was happy and helpful! Beef was EXTREMELY juicy and succulent. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. Straight off a direct flight from FLL to LAS VEGAS and this was the best place to head to first, even before the hotel.

My company and I was in town for a convention and decided to eat Kbbq and chose this restaurant. Well this restaurant was an absolute shame. The quality of meats and the service from our server was horrendous. I just don't understand what all the fellow yelpers are praising. Coming from all the great Kbbq LA has to provide this place was such a disappointment. 
On top of the horrible service they charged us an automatic 18% surcharge. We Complained to the manager and nothing was done. Never again am i eating korean food in Las Vegas.
I love the Marcoon but perphas it is only because of free marcoon they can have this review rate. The meet and BBQ itself is just so so compared to other places' Korean bbq

A really cool, fun and unique dinning experience. Vary flavorful marinades on the meats, great sides, and very attentive staff. I would recommend the Kalbi beef and spicy chicken. Price was also very affordable for the quality.

Loved the environment, food, and service! I ordered the miso soup, dumplings, bulgolgi, Korean prime rib, edamame, and the harami miso. Everything was delicious and well worth the 15 minute wait. Must try if your looking for something other than American food!

This was such a pleasant surprise after a long day! The food at Gangnam as fresh and delicious! I ordered the Prime Kalbi, Cheese Won Tons, also the sweet corn cheese and filet mignon. Outstanding! I have a new Vegas favorite!

Visited this awesome place again, And it was as great this time as the last two. I had the fillet mignon this time with a sweet corn cheese and wontons, paired with a good cab. Everything tasted fresh and hot and well seasoned. Each time I come here, the staff has treated me well and been very attentive. Still my favorite place in Las Vegas!  *Can't forget to talk about the green tea macaroon ice cream sandwich. Awesome!

Stopped in for a late night dinner after work and so happy we did. We are often hesitant about Korean bbq places but we have finally found our favorite! We got the most popular dinner set option "gangnam" which consisted of a variety of appetizers and meats. Of the appetizers my personal favorite was the house salad, which had an amazing dressing and different veggies and an egg. My boyfriends favorite was the miso soup! It also came with fresh oyster which had a great sauce! The meats were AMAZING great quality and awesome marinade. My personal favorite of the meat was the filet mignon! Everything was so good, and well worth the money. We will definitely be coming back..
Our first time here and oh wow..... Everything is on point! The servers were all very nice, friendly and very attentive. We'll definitely return on our future trips back to Vegas.
After taking our order, we waited for more than 30 minutes. The food is fine. Delicious beef and pork. The chicken wings are so so.

I am totally not just reviewing this place for the free dessert.   

But seriously this place is great.  Cool atmosphere, great service, and incredible food.

This was my first time here, and it was so good! We ordered the beef toro, the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, bacon wrapped asparagus, zucchini and sweet onion to put on the grill. It was bomb. We also ordered the kimchi soup. Loved it. Great friendly service, hot waiter. Sounds good to me :)
One of the best spots for korean BBQ.  When we visit vegas this is the SPOT.  meats are premium and service is awesome.

This place is really close to UNLV.
It's my first time here, and I already love the place so much!
The waiters are not only handsome, but are really friendly to customers. 
Although the menu hee is really similar to Gyu-kaku, their cheese wonton and toro beef is definitely better!

It's a clean contemporary restaurant.  Service is good and the food is really good. Good selections with a large amount of food. It's my second time coming here, and both times were an excellent experience.

The goods
1. Set menus for BBQ give you a lot of variety, can try a lot of different options and comes with various side dishes 
2. The beef toro usually tastes tough, I am mainly a kalbi guy
3. Shrimp was plump
4. Sauces are offered but not sure what is what, one is spicy two of them taste tangy
5. Macaron ice cream by brick, check in to get one on the house 

Service
1. Adequate but could be better 
2. You get help from all the staff
3. Happy hour from 3-6 and 10 to close last call 12ish (double check times) for reduced price select dishes and beer/sake

Ambiance
1. Clean and slightly dim
2. Ample parking
3. CC accepted

MoJo
1. The bibimbap bulgogi is yum, also does cream cheese wontons and toppeuki (delish)

Sooooo good. The Gangum for two is enough to easily fill three. Excellent variety on their combos. We were in-town and in the mood for shabu/hot pot, but this blew away our other options.

Just do it!

One of the best Korean restaurants I've been to. Good in pricing and the food was so flavorful and delicious. My favorites were the BBQ beef ribs and spicy rice cakes! I wish we could've ate more but it was just me and my husband so we wasted a lot of the food since we were leaving to the airport right after our meal. Will definitely come again !
Food was great. Happy hour was awesome! The short rib  and spicy pork were great. However the bulgogi was amazing.

Amazing restaurant! Everyone is very nice and helpful! My friends can't stop talking about this great Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas. So we went everywhere till we found the place and "super worth the wait"... Nice to treat your whole family.

This place is amazing. It's located off the strip in a quiet plaza. We went here on our last night and we are so glad we did! 

The food is fresh and very good. You sit at a table with a grill in the middle so you can cook everything you order yourself, or if you would like you can ask them to cook it in the kitchen out back. However, I recommend cooking it yourself, that's all part of the fun! 

The staff was friendly and attentive. And if you get distracted like I did and over cook some of the meat, no worries, they come and replace your grill cover with a clean one! 

My husband started with the fried calamari (cooked outback) and I had miso soup (also cooked out back) and then we ended up sharing some spicy chicken, pork, and two different beefs! 

Total worth it and highly recommended. This is great food, for a great price compared to the strip.

Ordered the Gangnam combo and pretty much ate everything that had come out. 

 Pros
My favorite was the Fried calamari and marinated peppers.  

Cons
Food took a bit longer than expected.  Fresh oysters were not as fresh as I had wanted...keeping fingers crossed for now.

Overall this is Vegas and met my standards.
The chicken fried rice is amazing! Also I recommend the sweet corn as a side. They also bring you several little appetizers that are interesting and tasty.

Great lunch, amazing cuts of meats, and very friendly service! I would get the meat lovers combo---6 cuts of really tender meat. My party also ordered a variety of noodle dishes, chicken sukiyaki being the best!
Our first time having Korean BBQ. We loved it. We had no idea What to order so we got the Gangnam dinner for two. It was amazing.

We were looking for something not in the casino but good and stumbled across this place on Yelp and with the amount of reviews and the high remarks we jumped in an uber and headed here. It is delicious we are not disappointed, we did the meat lovers and it is so much food. So happy we discovered this gem.

Great service and great food. Came here right at the lunch hour and we got our seats right away. The best part, to avoid smelling like Korean BBQ all day, they can cook the meat for you. No lunch special menu during the weekends tho.

Reasonably priced for a non-AYCE dinner. You do still get good portion. Below are the items we've ordered/gotten:

Mango Saketini and Peach Saketini - alcoholic drinks, they taste like what their names are: mango and peach. LOL.

Appetizers: 
Steamed Dumplings
Fried Dumplings
Miso Soup
Seaweed Salad with shredded radish

Post appetizer/pre main course:
Fried calamari w/spicy sauce
Fresh oysters

Main course:
Prime Kalbi
Beef Toro
Kobe Style Beef

Desert:
Green tea cheesecake
Fried Banana with Ice Cream

Service was good. Checked up on us one in a while to make sure everything was okay. 

This establishment is near the strip and UNLV. So if you're around the area, a must stop!

Would come back here and try out their HH.

Fancy and clean place but not for Japanese food and also original Korean food. This place is only for Korean fusion food and BBQ. The BBQ is really good but not Korean people because of fusion style.  So many black pepper with meats and salty side dishes. Additionally,  the small quantity lettuce (kind of romaine) is truly more expensive than single order of pork belly. If you are rich, you can go there and enjoy their great foods. I hope they would be considered price such as volume sales at a low unit margin of profit.
Ask for the bulgogi fried rice instead of white rice. Omg it is so frickin good. We really really love this place.
Very very good! First time having Korean bbq! It was great, I really enjoyed it ! Had the toro and bolgogi!
Great food & great service! The food comes in large portions and is worth the price. Joseph was a great server.

clean area good portion of food. Very close to UNLV campus. will come again.
This was my first time here, and it was so good! We ordered the beef toro, the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, bacon wrapped asparagus, and premium combo. It was bomb. We also ordered the kimchi soup. Loved it. Great friendly service, hot waiter. Sounds good to me :)

This is a Korean BBQ place that is trendy and fun. The servers have a funky, friendly attitude that translates well with the interesting cuisine and atmosphere. There is high energy music playing and even if it's your first time, they make you feel like a regular. 

The best part by far is the food. This is the best Korean food I've had in the Valley. My goodness, we ordered a lot and we finished every last bite. I think my husband's beef stole the show. It was delicate and flavorful. We both agreed we had to come back soon. What a grand experience!
Seated quickly and the food arrived shortly after. Great selection of proteins and drinks. We ordered a la carte and everything was delicious. Great service. I would come back!

Awesome flavor and very spicy!! Always a good meal here. Good place to bring a group of to bbq or just to get noodles. I love the spicy tuna kimbapp but maybe it has a bit too much mayonnaise in the sauce.

It's really a 4.5 stars.  We've been to soo many Korean BBQ places and this place is top notched.

The restaurant is large and spacious not too smoky.  The service is on point.  They are very attentive but do not cook the meat for you.

We came for happy hour and got the pork toro. Pork belly and bolgolgi.  The toro is such a thick cut it's so delicious.  The pork belly is very lean which I appreciate so much.  The bulgogi is well marinated but when you cook it kinda falls apart into very small pieces.

The mushroom medley is precooked and brought out later.  It is drizzled in butter so it's very soft and tons of umami flavors.

Overall we had an excellent experience.  Even though it wasn't all you can eat we were so full and the bill was so reasonable given quality of the meats.

I have been here a few times for happy hour. Food is okay but you do cook your own meat. They have unlimited sides, however, there are only a couple that were worth having and they really avoid allowing you to refill those. You can eat under $10 during happy hour and it's a good location  but I do feel like you need to be Familiar with the restaurant's culture  to truly enjoy this place .

Good stuff and nicely marinated meat. Meat here was dankity-dank-dank . Also free dessert for reviewing. Now I gotta go, ate so much kimchi, it's coming out of me like lava.

Now for being serious... Service was great and and quick. Waiter served well and presented appropriate manners. Meat also cooked quick and efficient. Own private family room was a nice experience and seemed cool. Recommend this to everyone. Also served really good desserts and presented a nice unexpected birthday dessert for my sister's birthday.
Visited LV and looking for a good Korean meal.....we were not disappointed!  Great service, good quality. Will return!!

This is my go-to Korean BBQ place. It may not be all-you-can-eat, but it is most definitely worth the money.

I treated my parents and my sister the last time I came here. We got the Premium for 4 people for $160, and it was absolutely delightful. The wagyu beef virtually melted away in our mouths, the beef carpacchio was marinated just right, and the oysters were fresh and slippery. You can tell the meat here is of the highest quality. 

The service was flawless. Our servers were quick to bring our food and refill our drinks and took an extra effort to take pictures of our family on my request.
Loved their package deals!!! The tofu is amazing!!! Even their miso soup was flavorful. The environment is cozy and the tables are large. Will definitely be back.
The happy hour is always on point at this place.. Definitely my go-to kbbq spot in town..

Very good selection beyond traditional Korean barbecue here. Very fresh food and very clean place. Good energy.  

We had the premium meal for two. The food comes real fast and before you know it, you're done. But with plenty of leftovers. Wagyu was nicely fresh and marbled, but tough.  The salad was awesome and fresh.  Shrimp was so so, kimchis were also so so.  Very Americanized meal.

Seating in the booths was very uncomfortable. So if there is an other option, I suggest you choose a table. Booths have very hard wooden seats with semi soft backing that was also WAY too far away from the table. Awkward seating situation that made us squirm through the meal.

They promote that you get a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp, which I think, contributes to the ratings here. They don't require a high rating, but would you eat a dessert after you show them that you just gave them a bad review? Nope.
The food and service is outstanding!  Every time we visit Vegas we always come to Gangnam and they never fail to meet our expectations!  I highly recommend Gangnam for anyone who enjoy's Korean BBQ.
Yum! Everything was delicious and waiters were attentive. Not too much seating so the wait can be long but it's worth it!

Great service, Delicious food. 
Best Korean restaurant in Las Vegas.
Especially galbitang is so good.
One of my favorite places in Vegas.  Great food and great service! Definetely give this place a shot!

Came here to eat some Korean food and I was just blown away by how good it was. We ordered many different types of meat and all of them were very tender and good. This place uses real good quality meat. 

Another awesome thing about this place is the service. The staff here are A+++++ when it comes to service. Jin was awesome in giving us the best service possible. 

I am definitely coming here everytime i come to vegas.

If you like grilling your food at your table in a modern atmosphere with nice staff to take your order and bring you drinks (and help you use the grill), this is a decent place to eat right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel behind CVS. Priced kind of like tapas, it's not extemely cheap but we thought it was yummy and worth it!  Thanks for a great meal!  :-)

Pork cheeks. Not the butt cheeks turned into pasty ham. Pork cheeks off of the pig's head. Deliciously fatty, marbled meat. Like bacon on crack. Grill it. Eat it. Rinse it with a pitcher of Sapporo beer. Repeat.
Place is delicious.  Korean bbq is as good as anywhere.  The environment is like a traditional korean bbq joint got remodeled for millenial families.  Dig it.
Great price for the amount of food you receive if you get their dinner for 2. The amount of food was just asinine and the meats were very flavorful and each had a different and delicious seasoning.
The food is delicious. The service is terrible. It took forever to try and get anyone's attention and half the time we were ignored.

My boyfriend's brother and sister-in-law told us that when we visit they wanted to go to Korean BBQ with us. So we gathered up the family and checked out this place. Pretty decent sized menu with a lot of good options. There were 8 of us and we were all pretty hungry. We ordered a ton of food. Of the banchan was ok. The favorite was surprisingly the fish cakes. I ordered the bulgogi bibimbab and the cream cheese wontons (really just cream cheese inside
...) while almost everyone else ordered BBQ. The two least excited about it got fried rice and tried everyone's dishes. The bulgogi bibimbab was delicious. Perfectly cooked and flavored bulgogi. The rice was nice and crispy like it should be and the spicy sauce for it was a little sweet and a little spicy. Perfect dish! Everyone really enjoyed their first Korean BBQ experience. Would love to go back next time we visit
I love this place, definitely for happy hour. Not the most choices but cheaper & provide a good mix with their regular menu! The atmosphere is very fun!

Omg! Bomb.com I really enjoyed everything.

Starters

Calamari
Spicy tuna 

Sides 

Sweet Corn 
Asparagus 
Fried rice with shrimp 
House salad 

Meats 

Haramani miso-
Korean chicken without cheese 
Shrimp garlic 
Filet mignon

Extras

Garlic butter 
Thinly sliced onion

Great Korean BBQ / yakiniku in the strip mall across the street from the Hard Rock.  We ordered the Premium Combo for six ($270) and were stuffed!  All the meats were of excellent quality -- we much preferred this over Magal in Chinatown, but it was also about 40% more expensive.   Really liked the beef carpaccio too, though the poke was skippable since it was over sauced.  We were a bit worried by the cheesy name but were glad we went!
Absolutely the best Korean bbq in town. Nice food low price and many choices! Will come back for more food.
Great value, great quality, lots of food. Will come here whenever visiting Vegas. Get off the strip and check it out.

I left my heart in Seoul and this was a trip down memory lane. 

Awesome kimchi. Fantastic quality meat. Banchan off the hook! 

I highly recommend this place, the service is excellent. A Legit Korean waiter entertained my fondness for korea. It's a great place to bring a client or your family.  The music isn't too loud and conversations can be had.
This was my first time here  and the food was amazing. The bulgogi was my favorite. The service was quick and very friendly.
Best Korean BBQ I have ever tried. I from sd, and this place is way better than the ones in sd.

great place to enjoy a great dinner . they serve alot of food when you order the package for 2 for 45 dolars ,, had 2 people eat and still had food left over ! i like that its open late and the fact that even tho its late it stays very busy!

My boyfriend and I stopped here when we were passing through Vegas on our cross country road trip. We made it with 10 minutes to spare to get happy hour prices and I have to agree with other reviews that you really do get a good amount of food for the price here. We ordered 2 types of kalbi, happy hour pork belly and bulgogi and happy hour edamame and seaweed salad. Our total was only $46 including tip (which is a great deal for 2 people when you're used to LA prices). The food was good quality and they give you plenty of side dishes. We didn't even really need the edamame and seaweed salad so we probably could have gotten away with spending under $40 for 2 people. Granted, this obviously isn't the best BBQ I've had, but it is a great value. I would come back here if I was ever in Vegas with a car again.

The atmosphere, to the quality of food here is awesome at Gangnam! I would recommend this restaurant to any of my friends and family. My favorite thing to get here is their Beef Toro at happy hour for $4 and Banana Tempura!

Our meal was very good and the service fast however the atmosphere was noisy with very loud music playing and a large screen playing the accompanying music videos. There was a particular song with video that was about the rap group chasing down and killing cops.  I brought it to the attention of the waitress that it was very offensive and extremely distasteful. I hope the management takes a closer look at what they are promoting in their restaurant.  Don't think violence and murder has any place. We wouldn't go back for that reason alone.

We were 2 adults and 3 kids and ordered the Gangnam for 2, our waitress recommended it to us and it filled all of us up! We were also able to sub some of the starters for dumplings instead which the kids loved! The food was delicious and the banchan were average but good! ur family really enjoyed dining here for lunch.The staff was very friendly and accommodating and our lunch was affordable. Our family really enjoyed eating here we will definitely come back.

This place is just ok.. I can't say it was the best korean bbq that I've eaten. I'm surprised that it got such great reviews since it's not that great. The rice wasn't the same as most korean place it tasted like they mixed other rice in it. The service was great and the ice cream was awesome but beside that it was just ok.

Very nice ambiance, large table seating just perfect for the restaurant's set menus. We ordered the premium set for 2ppl, $89.95 but it was really worth it. Good meat quality, we are normal size eaters but the portion is enough to serve 3ppl. Definitely will come back and try other items on the menu, a highly recommend new eat out.
Great Korean BBQ , everything taste great! Will definitely come again. Long drive coming from Riverside Ca......

Place was great. Good portions. Service was excellent. Our server was Jennifer and she was fantastic. She was friendly and bery attentive. Im from LA, and this place is far better than the LA location.

Hanging out with friends very late at 10pm the first time in Vegas. Found this place on Yelp and decided to check this out since its on the top of the list. We had the love meater for 4 people. The meat is decent and the prime rib and filet are my fav. Might be coming for my second time for my next Vegas trip!
Luv'd there food it was fantastic! Just wish it was all u can eat but other than that the service was great & the set up of the restaurant was good too:)) I also like that they're open very late!!!

I was craving for KBBQ and came across this place after looking for highly rated locations. We came right when it opened-- there was a line waiting for the restaurant to begin serving and certainly im Glad I came here. 

Here is the breakdown:

FOOD

You can order a la carte or go for the set menu, and they came in a couple of different tiers. My friend and I went for the most expensive one and it did not disappoint.

Good quality meat, good selections and it is very generous portioning for the price. Definitely felt that my money was well spent and was getting what I paid for.

SERVICE

The food came at a reasonable time and definitely appreciate when they let us have the experience, cook at our pace and enjoy each meat nicely without feeling rushed. 

The waiter was very nice and had a nice small talk with him while he offered to cook for us.

DECOR/ AMBIAnCE

Definitely a casual environment but a nice casual environment. 

OVERALL

Good experience and make sure to check in for the free dessert.
Service was great very attentive staff. Food was amazing. I will recommend to all my friends and family .
Came here twice in a week. High quality juicy meats and very tasty. You can't go wrong with flat iron garlic, beef tongue and marinated kalbi.

Great food!! Quality and service is great. Music is not too loud. Tables are large so you may feel a bit distant from the person sitting in front of you, but that allows for more table room and comfortable eating. Can't complain about that! They serve a lot of food for the price, we could not finish all the meat served.
The food was great. The serving of the food was a lot. I went here together with my family. We ordered the Meat lovers and it was so delicious. I recommend this place.
OMG amazing cuts of meats. One of the best KBBQ places of all time!  Decent pricing, good service, long waits & you smell like food when you're done which is indicative for all KBBQ places.
Grymt trevlig personal, och bra och f√§rsk Mat. Jag ger detta en 5a rakt av d√• du f√•r mycket mat och du f√•r verkligen valuta f√∂r pengarna.

We came on Father's Day so I'd understand the delays and misunderstandings 
Any way... We walked in and was told to wait since we had a 7 people party which meant our wait was going to be longer than the shorter parties 
After what seemed for a eternity (40mins) we were finally sat down and ordered our food 
Everything tastes great and was priced very reasonable the servers kept coming in with our orders and taking our requests for water.

All in all the only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars was the fact that the front seems to have a AC issue since is pretty warm in the front which can get annoying and it you have to wait it might incline you to walk out. But if you stick through it you'll enjoy your time here

Service: friendly and attentive. Our server was very patient and answered all of our questions.

Food: ordered the meat lover for 2 people, which was enough for our party of 4. The bulgogi meat was one of the best I've tried, and the banchans were delish! We also ordered the seafood tofu soup which was pretty average. 

Overall a pretty good experience!

This is our 3rd time here and by far is one of the most delicious restaurants in Las Vegas we truly recommend this place. The food taste so good at a reasonable price. The staff is also friendly. Their combo dishes are worth the price. Come on in and try it you won't regret it is too good to pass up

A Japanese restaurant in Korean BBQ clothing. First off all the 5 star ratings are rigged as they "Bribe" you with free dessert for a review and must see it. I will pay for my own dessert thank you very much(Best thing on the menu btw).

I live in OC and close to Ktown so I guess you can say I'm spoiled but when you ask for Korean radish and they have no idea what you're taking about and everything is in Japanese something is a miss. In looking around it was brilliant as there are many sushi restaurants in LV and 2 in the same shopping center as Gangnam (btw really I should have known better) so the owner thought hey we can serve Korean and then bribe yelpers with free dessert for the 2k worth of reviews. For all you yelpers that sold out for dessert SHAME.....ding ding.......SHAME!!!!!

It's not the worst place if you don't know better and could get 3 stars tops but I feel duped as I fell for the 2 thousand plus reviews. 

Anyway do your homework and look for authentic KBBQ .

What a great Korean restaurant! They give you a ton of food and it is all delicious. The service was really good, and they were ready to help whether you were a new or experienced Korean food eater. Great place to come in a group, order one of the specials and try a wide range of meats. Also there were some wonderful vegetarian choices even though this place is a meat eaters paradise. 

Quick tip: there is a lot of parking but if you are a Las Vegas visitor without a car there is a hotel very close by where you could pick up a taxi.
Very delicious, it's a little pricy, but very worth it, we ordered for 4 people, it will at least feed 8.  All food are really fresh.  It's so far the best Korean restaurant i had in vegas.
Very good meat quality, good protion size, not all you can eat, but definitely enough food per order.

The amount of raving reviews is what brought me to Gangnam the other night. It felt like it was meant to be by the way that we found parking right up front and once inside the wait didn't seem as long as I imagined it would be on a summer night.

Sadly to say I can't write a review about how great the food was or comment on the attentive service like everyone else. I really wanted to stuff my face with KBBQ but as we were waiting for a table, a giant cockroach ( I mean, that thing was huge! That's what she said) blessed us with his presence in the waiting area and so our party decided to find somewhere else to have dinner.

Sure, I know that this is the desert and there are bugs everywhere but how appetizing is that? 
I guess it just wasn't meant to be after all.
