Food was good. Service great. Had the Las Vegas for 2, dumplings, & tempura. It fed 1 vegetarian, 1 adult and 2 teen boys.
Amazing food!! We ordered the MEAT LOVERS for two. It was well worth it for the price. I'll definitely come back here with more people next time.

Very trendy place to eat Korean bbq. We ordered the gangnam setting for 2 people. Couldn't finish all of it. The meat was good. I really liked the bi-bim-bap. There was a variety of vegetables. They ran out of oysters but I had a choice to pick something else. I got the salmon.  Bruno Mars was playing on the big screen in the back. I'd def come back here again. Very good!
My first time with the full experience. Great food, great service. The server was helpful in finding me the best options. I would definitely come back when in town again.

The quality of the meats is average. Compared to the Korean BBQ restaurants in LA. 
Service was nice and the side dishes were decent. 
The lunch special is a good deal that comes with 2 sides of meats, soup or salad, rice and appetizer for $12.
Just for the quality of meat I am giving 4 stars. But good service and clean interior!

Meat here are rough and not at all tender. 
Dduk bok ki is not at all Korean style. Taste weird and the color definitely doesn't look right. 
Yook gae jang, however was surprisingly good. 
Would I go here again?? Absolutely not. Never! 
Time to find a different Korean BBQ restaurant.

Amazing food and great service! We have a friend that works here and recommended trying it out. We usually go to hwaro or hobak, but this is our new favorite kbbq spot :) delicious quality meat and the variety of appetizers and side dishes are incomparable :)
Good Korean BBQ ever! Had Gangnam set and every thing was so good. The meat was perfectly tender, friendly staffs as well. Highly recommended!

We were a party of 5 and ordered the meat lovers combo for 4. Thinking that the portions would not be sufficient for us, we additionally ordered 2 orders of the  chicken wings and the seafood pancake. 
Our server proceeded to bring what seems like an endless array of meats. Everything was good quality ,except for maybe the pork belly(bacon), it lacked taste and flavor. They were attentive to our needs until at the very end when it was time for us to get our check, it took to long, you would think that they would want to get you out ASAP so the table could be turned to awaiting. customers.

Delicious Japanese BBQ! Quality meat and great service, but we ordered too much though so just forewarning we had a table of 7 and we got the dinner for six plus ramen, japchae, and soft tofu soup and it was way too much food for us. The meat they give are really reasonable portion so I would say order the meat combo that they put together since it's a really great deal for what you get. You get soup, appetizer, and the meat along with rice. What some other reviews were saying about how this place is a less expensive version of Gyu-Kaku, I would agree. You'll be super satisfied so it's a must-try if you're ever in Vegas!

I had this joint on my list of spots to try while in Vegas this time. I saw this on Food Network and coupled with some Yelp reviews I thought it was a good idea. Right before we left the hotel to go to the restaurant I read Yelper Betty N's review and was hoping her review was off a lil in relation to the majority of Yelp reviews. As the evening wore on I quickly realized Betty N was on point with her review and the rest were skewed and off kilter. We ordered the Las Vegas which is a meal for two, and added the ribs. The ribs were ok but for me this was the most flavorless meal the whole trip. I was sorely disappointed. I have nothing more to say about this.  Oh wait...the drinks were ok.

Good happy hour. We got the nice big table in the back but needed to be out by a certain time. Service was good but one of our party members got his cashmere sweater burnt by one is the guys bringing out one of the hot grills. They gave free Mochi dessert for apologies.

When the wife wanted to come here for dinner, I was a little hesitant. After all, we're from LA right? 
 Well needless to say, she was right about Gangnam. The meat selection was perfect and not having to overeat because it was an AYCE was a plus.
There are not enough words to describe the transcendence of flavors we experienced. THE best Korean BBQ we have ever had. The kimchee is spot on!
Ugh so amazing and so awesome for a date I got the meat lovers and it was the perfect amount of food I've been wanting to go back her ever since the last time I went

We visited during Sunday noon time. Not crazy line, waited about 15 mins. We ordered prime Kaibi, beef tongue, beef toro and bulgogi. Pretty good for all, meet the 4 stars expectation. Sweet corn is the only vegi we order. 4 small pieces as showed in menu, only enough for 1 person. 
Overall, it's nice meet our expectation.

Best Korean barbecue place in Las Vegas!!!!! The beef toro and bulgogi were delightful. Garlic edamame were spicy but tasted really good. 
The service here is quick and the staff is friendly. The only problem is that there is a long wait and they do not take reservations. So be prepared to wait for a while before you get to the yummy food. Trust me, its worth the wait!!! 
I would definitely visit this place again!
Really great kalbi and beef toro, but I wish they served japchae as a side dish. Loved the steamed egg and mushroom medley too.

Just walking by to see what Gangnam had to offer when the friendly hostess popped outside and talked us into coming in for dinner. I'm so glad that she did. Second day of being open, and they are killing it! Really fresh decor, SUPER friendly staff, neat concept for dinner. We tried the stir fried sukiyaki veggie udon noodles, spicy garlic edamame, mushroom medley, BBQ rib eye, and the Korean honeyeyed pancake with ice cream.  Everything was so incredibly tasty. The sauce on the udon noodles was so delicious and the veggies were fresh and cooked to perfection. The edamame was the perfect appetizer. I would definitely recommend to give this place a try.   I really hope that they do well- I can't wait to go back!

I came on a Saturday night, and it was pretty busy. I had a party of 5 and only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table, and it was well worth it. You have to try the spicy pork and the bulgogi beef! I would recommend this to anyone!

Omg. The food was delicious! 
Our group was 4 people.
We got the butterfly and firecracker shrimp. Bulgogi bimpap and bbq the following meats: grade a kalbi, kurobuta sausage and shrimp. Most delicious yall! Im coming again tomorrow night. Love how they stay open late and offer delicious food with awesome service. The apple sake was yum as well, just keep it nicely chilled. Going back tomorrow for the lychee sake (:

Decided to come here on a whim with some friends for lunch, and I'm so glad we did!  We ordered the meat lover's set and a couple of noodle dishes.  The meat was delicious and tender and the spicy seafood ramen was amazing.  Will definitely be back when I'm in the area again!

Oh my. This place is hidden gem in Las Vegas. I love Asian dining esp Korean. I love the side dishes. I ordered steamed dumpling and bulgogi I bibimbap. It was served on a sizzling plate and it was warm for the rest of the meal. So worth it and def coming back.
Meat quality is good. Nice and modern place . Won't smell anything after BBQ . Good service and full bar here . Will definitely be back soon.

First of all, the staff is super friendly. We ordered the gangnam meal for two and it was a lot of food and delicious. I particularly enjoyed the fresh oysters which is surprising because I'm not usually a fan of oysters, but whatever they topped them with made them delicious. The marinated beef was tasty and tender. The price was not too bad for two, considering all of the food that comes with it.

Excellent service
Great food, great value, really tasty
We ordered Las Vegas set and it is really valuable!!! Highly recommend

The wait time was ridiculous, we called ahead and were told that by the time we got there our wait time should be no longer than 40 mins and that she would write our name down for a table... When we got there she told us we were next to get a table so it would probably be 30 minutes or less. We had a party of 11 and we told them that we wouldn't mind splitting our table but they said to just wait for the table in the back. It's understandable that you can't control how long a customer takes but 2 hours later, we're still waiting and are watching for the table the reserved for us. By the time the family that had finished at that table, only one waiter came in to go clean it.. And he didn't even finish cleaning.. It wasn't until another 15 mins later the others realized they needed to finish cleaning it, lol. 

The food came out quickly so it wasn't that bad, but we didn't get our appetizers until after all our food came out.. And the waiter didn't seem really happy and looked mad the whole time, when we asked for somethings he would miss it until we reminded him a couple times. It doesn't kill to fake a smile at the least... They didn't really check on us as much either, we needed a new grill and had to wait until nearly the end as we were finishing our food for it to be replaced.

But overall, the food was good, I'd give it 4 stars if the service was much better. We ordered the gangnam and Las Vegas pack, they were both filling and the cream cheese wonton appetizers were so good! Made me want more. 

Overall I would come back next time, but with a smaller party or splitted party lol
Taste good. No staff helped doing barbecue. People will not ensure where to start if they never try Korean BBQ before.
Amazing! Great food, atmosphere, and the menu prices are very reasonable for the insane amount of food they give you
First time here and I love it. The service was good with good food at a good price. And I got a free green tea macaroon ice cream!
First time here and we loved it!!! Everything is delicious. Marinated beef with miso is a must have. We liked the kimchi pancakes too. Will definitely come back to next time in Vegas.

We were so hungry we almost passed on this place due to our doubts in our abilities to cook fast enough... we were wrong. They bring it out fast and the meats are delicious. It is also fun... and we all need more of that in our lives.
We gave this place a try because it was close to the Hard Rock Hotel where we were staying. Everything was reasonable and good without any complaints. The icecream mochi is a must try.
Awesome place!  The meats were delightful, the Kobe beef was amazing, and the Kobe Ssam was awesome! The service was just right . We will be coming back!

Pretty good! Not too far from the strip, modern interior and friendly staff. We tried the Gang Nam combo ($65 for two)- you get five different cuts of beef. We liked the short ribs the best (un-marinated one). Mostly Korean food with a little flare of Japanese. Would be revisiting next time we are in town.
Both food and service was excellent!  Went during happy hour discount on a few menu items. The regular price is already very reasonable.

Best Korean BBQ hands down. Really friendly staff and a trendy atmosphere. Really good quality meats and all side dishes were very fresh! Miso paste soup was to die for. The menu is huge with a really nice selection. I love that you can order a al carte style. If ever in the mood for Korean I'll definitely come back.

We were craving Korean BBQ and this place did not disappoint! There's so much to choose from and we choose a gangnam platter for 2. It was a great deal and included a variety of meat and sides. The miso was the best as well. I'm not a big fan of miso soup but theirs was amazing. The food was overall delicious and service was great! We will definitely come back!
Much tasty.  Such yum. Quick service, and friendly faces.  Got the meat lovers platter for four, and it was yum.
This is a beautiful place to enjoy the best tofu house in Las Vegas. I confused about choosing a Korean food and GangNam is the best Korean in town.

Takes a while to get seated but that's because the food is so good. Had the Gangman special. Tons of food and the meat is exceptionally high quality and very tender. This is a wonderful place for a family or group.
Very good place dynamite shrimp was very good and lettuce wraps are a must :) server was the bomb & very sweet come see him Andrew ...come with the family, nice environment :)
This is the best Korean BBQ that I've had in Las Vegas to date.  The servers were very attentive and the food excellent; and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.
Fun atmosphere and great food. Felt a little pricey for what you got though. Definitely take advantage of the happy hour special (3-6, 10-1am) if possible.
Lots of fun for a group or just dinner. Good happy hour prices and the grilling is enjoyable. I've had bbq Korean in Korea and this is just as good...but understandably without charcoal.

Solid, not especially great but gets the job done.  

Banchan was meh, bean sprouts in particular tasted like dishwater. But hey, you're at a table with your friends, being served by friendly kids, in front of open fire with a plate of kobe beef, scarfing it down with romaine, sesame oil and salt for $21.. add a large bottle of Chamisul Soju for a few more, so.. there's THAT!  Life is good..
Delious food and really reasonable price! Recommend the beef and steamed eggs, both my friend and I love this place!
Preaching to the choir; the be-bim-bap is pretty good!

Just best of the best. Outstanding service and excellent food. I've tried many korean bbq places but this one left me only one impression "WoW". If you're ever in town and are craving for Korean+Japanese bbq, this place is perfect for yall. I'll definitely come back if I'm ever in town. ~ from Houston, Tx.
Great food, excellent service and beautiful staff! Won't be disappointed near the Strip.

Waited for over 20 mins and the seat was given to the other group who came after us... The girl at  the cashier was very rude and careless. We were too hungry after the show otherwise we would have left!

Went straight to this place from the airport, and it did not disappoint! Quick service and pretty much everything from the small dishes to each item in the Gangnam package is exceptionally good. Will come back again in future.

Wow!  Wasn't expecting such an amazing meal right as I got into Las Vegas. Always good to eat off the strip. 

The meats were perfectly marinated and good cuts. Cooked at the right temperature the meat tastes were tender and flavorful.  Order the salt and sesame oil as a side!  The bulgogi bibimbap was exactly what I was looking for. We ordered the Gangam for two and extra left over. It was the best deal!

The oysters, calamari apps and sides were just that sides. 

You come to a Korean BBQ house for the meat and that was phenomenal.
I love the food and service. I ordered tofu soap and different kinds of meat. Everything tastes delicious.

I love this place, steam egg is really good, good quality of meat!!!
And their service is really nice, the server is friendly
Great atmosphere!  The Gangnam special was awesome, got the meal for 2 with 3 people and added a couple tapas it was perfect.  The beef bulgogi was delicious.  Highly recommended

The food taste better than most of more expensive korean restaurants ive been to. 
You do have to wait 15-20min during dinner time but the servers work fast and visit quiet often.
One thing I care alot about eating out at restaurants is bathroom cleanliness. Gangnam's bathroom is clean.
Would defonitely be back when i come back to vegas and would recommend to friends and family.

One thing I would recommend to them would be to improve their sound system for the background music. Its so bad it almost hurts my ears.
Must try Korean Restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything is delicious. We ordered Gang Nam combo, Kimchi tofu soup, spicy tuna.

The food here was amazing. We ordered the Las Vegas platter for 4 and there was a ton of food. For 4 adults it is a really good amount. Make sure you come hungry. I also recommend the bulgogi bibimbap. It was so tasty. Really, there was nothing we did not enjoy. The sides were good and plentiful and the meats were seasoned very well. The only thing we regret is not being able to finish it all because we got so full.

We have 3 people and ordered the Gangnam Combo for 2 (as recommended by the waitress). It was a lot of food, the meat is tasty, and so are the side dishes. We ordered a few bottles of Korean hite beer and they  went well with the food. We love the Kimchi!
Had some amazing food and great service here. Ryan (our server) was amazing! Will be returning and definitely recommend it.

We four girls ordered Gangnam 4ppl menu and it was totally enough for us. We couldnt even finish the starters. Besides, I like the salad too. The meat were good and bulgogi was tasty. (Btw my friend is wondering why dont they play Got7 s music lol hahaha) In a word, good place to go for korean bbq.
Cute little place with huge tables and spacious seating! Great price and an even better happy hour :)

We went back again for the happy hour and wondered why we don't come more often. Half price beer and hot saki.. of course. The service was fantastic and we had interactions with multiple employees through the meal. This time we ordered apps from happy hour including the edamame and jalape√±o poppers. So good and such a value!  On the grill we bbq'd the ribeye with Their own sweet Korean sauce first (on happy hour)!  That toasted the grill up with some flavor before adding filet, duck, scallops, and bacon wrapped Udon mushrooms. Everything caramelized and cooked perfectly. All we added was some garlic butter which toasted nicely on the grill in very thin slices. Topped the night off with a macaroon to share. Strawberry was very good. Such a great value and experience!!

My husband and I decided to go with the Gangnam combo. It was way overpriced! I feel like a fat ass for saying this but it was not enough meat. I'm spoiled by the generous portions from the other KBBQ places I've been to. The vegetables included in the combo were random and awkward too. The combo does not come with your traditional banchan (Korean side dishes). No kimchi, no lettuce, none of the usual Korean sauces for your meat. We did get three sauces-ponzu, glazed sauce, and a somewhat spicy sauce. It wasn't terrible but without my banchan, there was something lacking for sure. Yes, I realize it's not a traditional KBBQ restaurant-some Korean/Japanese BBQ fusion. The service was good though. The restaurant is modern, clean, and trendy but that's not enough for me to come back.

Love their HH 3-6pm.  Wait is only 5 min.   Ordered their #1 BBQ package for two.  Generous portion.   Deliciously marinated Korean prime kalbi, other beef dishes were also great quality meat.  Along with that is Bulgogi Bimbimbop, salad, half off soju and more.  Definitely filled us up with great satisfaction!   Highly recommended!
Great staff and workers. The food is even better. The prime rib is very flavorful. I would recommend this to all my peers.

The food is amazing and made up for the long wait. This place definitely needs to expand given the high demand. The beef is very well marinated. I will definitely return when I'm back in Vegas visiting.

Come from LA and have been to basically all the Korean BBQ over there and the quality of meat over here is one of the best I've had, especially for the price. It's nice and cozy and the service was great too, I'll be back fshhooooooooooooooooooooo

It's Asian/fusion style now where you can pick what kind of meats and dishes you want.  It's not terrible, but I want daenjang jigae not miso soup with my kalbi.  The fried rice thing sounded fun but I wasn't a fan.  Not bad, but definitely disappointing if you want Korean barbeque.
The meats here has good quality and they have a lot of premium options. definitely recommend this place if you like Korean BBQ.

We got the Gangnam Combo and added one order of Harami Miso after deciding it was the best of the meats we had already sampled.  Everything was delicious and nothing was over seasoned.  Quality was top notch and all of the side dishes and appetizers were great as well.  A must if you are a local or even just visiting from out of town.

We got the gangnam combo and it was a bit too saucy for my tastes. But if you like it saucy, you'll like it here.

Service was attentive. Made sure we had enough food and water and such.

I thought they were generous portions. I'm stuffed.

This place is the best. They treated my wife like a queen on her birthday and the food is always amazing.  I tried beef tongue for the first time and it was really good. Also, banana tempura for dessert is a must. Thanks for providing awesome food and service!

This was my first time here and it did not disappoint me at all. We ordered the spicy tuna kimbap which was my favorite and for meats bulgogi, brisket, harami miso and the flat iron steak. The meats were very flavorful. Will definitely come here again(:

For Korean bbq, I usually frequent all you can eat places but here you pay by the order. A little more pricier but the food is well worth it. I really enjoyed the Korean Prime Kalbi, it was so juicy and perfect-- exactly what I want from korean bbq. I would definitely come here again!
Great food! Server forgot a few things but it was quickly remedied. KPop videos on the big screen. Delicious side dishes.

great service, better food.  They didn't have the egg custard left so they made a bebimbap that was to die for for our side.
   This is my third visit here and consistently good.   Coming here every time we are in Vegas.
Friendly helpful service. Great food! Open til 1am. Love the brisket, chicken lettuce wraps, noodles & the broccoli! Always come here when I'm in Vegas!

Happy hour + hot sake + different food choices = bomb a$$ bbq!!!
Fast and friendly service as well.

Great food, decent price and a lot of meat! Great fusion of Japanese and Korean food. All Meat cuts were delicious. Only thing I would add is a couple more side dishes that would go well with the meats. Other than that everything tasted good and fresh. As well as their dumplings were awesome as well.

In Vegas on vacation and wanted a local favorite off strip.  After checking trusty ol Yelp, I found this place with 2800 reviews and an avg 4.5 stars...pretty easy decision to come here.

EDIT:** I now know why this place has 2800 reviews, if you tell them you are reviewing them on Yelp they will offer you free dessert. **

Right away, you notice this small restaurant has limited tables due to the nature of the way you prepare the food.  What an awesome time.  Come here with a group, sit around a table and order one of the packages.  They come with a feast!! Appetizers, kimchis, salads, rice and tons of meat.

Everything we tried was great...the bulgogi and the pork were my absolute favorite meats.  I also loved the seaweed salad and the different Kimchi.

The music, was an interesting choice to say the least...not sure it fits the atmosphere.  We came on a Sunday night and it was gangster rap...it made us literally laugh out loud because of how out of place it was in a place like this.


The price was also not bad at all.  It ended up after tax and tip being about $40 a person for the 3rd package option..I don't remember the name.  You can get it down to as low as $20 per person on the package if you wanted to leave a few things out.

I would absolutely come back here again.  We all had a great time!

Pretty good Korean BBQ. Not a fan of many of the sides but did enjoy the radish, fish cakes, and Mac salad. Meats were really good and flavorful! Definitely a place to try while in Vegas. A far walk from where we stayed but took uber to this place. So fairly close to the strip. 

EDITED: 

Service is not so great. Definitely HELLA slow!!!! We wanted the check and our desserts but they did not bring that out right away. We finally got up and told a waitress but she was slow too. The place was not even packed to have this kind of service at this kind of speed....
Great food at great prices! Come during happy hour for half price drinks and food. Really loved the bulgogi and green apple soju! Staff was really friendly and helpful.
This was the best Korean bbq I have been to! Great customer service and good food. The ambience was perfect.
Great food, comes out super fast. Service was good too. Would come here all the time if I lived in Vegas. So much better than all the buffets at the casinos.

So glad we found this place off the strip but close to the airport!

We came for an early preflight dinner, just in time for happy hour. The deals here were much better than expected - besides beer being 50% off (pitchers included!), bbq items were also eligible including corn, broccoli, spicy garlic edemame, bulgogi, spicy pork, and maybe some others i'm forgetting.

The staff were attentive and refilled our waters, and they were very understanding when we got our bill but wanted to order more food. Overall it was a great value for the money we paid. We also used the check-in to get one free macaron ice cream sandwich which was delicious and refreshing! If i were from the area I would come here more often.

Oh. My. Gawd.

This place is worth a trip to Vegas... just to eat here.

I don't even know where to begin with Gangnam... everything here is delicious.
We prefer to get the Gangnam combination (it is on their menu as an option).  This option allows you to get a serving of multiple items on the menu at a great price point.  I like it because this allows us to find out what we really like before we go again next time :)

Our favorites are the Kobe beef, bulgogi, all of the sides, house salad, fried calamari and miso soup.

I could go on for days about how delicious this food is, but the more I type the more I want to book a flight to Vegas and go eat one of those delicious bites of food.

Oh, and don't miss the check-in offer for a FREE MACAROON!!!! Who could be mad at a free adorable (not to mention delicious!) cookie and ice cream sandwich?!

Hurry, come eat here!!!!

I love this place!!! We were immediately greeted upon entering and was welcomed into the restaurant. Service was very fast as well. We had happy hour and I tried the beef toro and bulgogi. Both were extremely delicious! Highly recommended kbbq! Amazing!!
This place is excellent. Generous amount of food along with delicious side dishes. Would come again and gladly recommend to friends.

We went off the strip for our final meal before leaving Las Vegas on Thanksgiving weekend.  This Korean BBQ restaurant is on Paradise Road just behind the northern strip hotels.  

Although the strip mall it is located in seemed busy, the restaurant itself was pretty vacant for a Sunday night at 6:30PM.  

They gave us a menu with "happy hour" pricing on most of the food packages, which I'm not sure if that is given at all times or not.

Anyway, 4 stars.  The decor is really nice, the service is very attentive, the food was great.  They bring all the food to you. The Miso Soup was delicious. The meats were brought to our table, and they ask if you want assistance in cooking them at your table; however, we declined and cooked them ourselves.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  

Minus one star for one reason only.  I thought the prices were a bit high with the "happy hour" pricing.  If the prices are truly higher during peak hours, I would definitely not come back.  At the "happy hour" prices, I would consider a return, although it is still a bit expensive for what it is.

Great food and great fun. The staff is helpful and polite. The quality and authenticity of the cuisine is exquisite and always fresh. The great quality and service makes this a popular destination and therefore one can expect a wait around 30 minutes but the wait is well worth it!

I always come to this place because it's location happens to be near my house and the food is yummy. U order the food a la carte but still fills me up and is kept in my budget. I like to come here with my girlfriend because the booths make me feel like I'm in a private place. The restaurant looks like it is brand new and I enjoy the music videos that they play on their projection which is a mix of Korean, American Pop, and some funny ones like Boy Dance Party from SNL. If you get Kristin as a server, you're in great hands! She is very helpful at suggesting food items and checks on our table at a consistent rate. She actually looks like she enjoys her job and enjoys serving you . The staff has always been attentive with my water also as I am a fast drinker. Their servers speak fluent English too 

My usual order consists of brown rice, kimchi (free), salmon jalape√±o poppers (sooo good), 2 orders of toro beef and 2 orders of pork belly. The owner is friendly, and willing to help out with anything . 

This is my favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas , check it out!

First time having Korean BBQ and definitely won't be my last! My wife and I ordered the Las Vegas combo which was plenty of food and delicious. We also ordered the spicy tuna kimbap which I highly recommend. Service was great and they had no issues explaining how to cook everything since it was our first time. Looking forward to going back soon!
Delicious! Can't believe we never ate here until today. Very unique dishes, great portions at affordable prices. The drinks are well made and you can't beat a free dessert for leaving a review!
This place is awesome.  Reminded me of home while visiting in Vegas. I would recommended grilling the meats definitely a bonding experience and even great for first dates.

I had never had Korean BBQ before, and was in Vegas for a conference, so when a co-worker suggested it, I jumped at the chance. Gangnam did not disappoint. The decor was lovely; dark (and blessedly cool!) and nicely appointed. Seats were very comfortable. I had never seen the bbq trays on the table before. 
Fortunately, my co-worker knew what to order, and she made some recommendations that were just fantastic. I had bulgogi (pork) with a mushroom medley that was absolutely delicious. The portions were very generous, too. It was fun cooking the food on the little bbqs.
Service was a bit slow, but the poor waitress was having problems with their cash register; she apologized and explained what the issue was, so we were forgiving of the situation.
The lunch special was very reasonable, considering the amount of food we received and the quality of it. We were extremely happy campers when we left and went back to the conference. I told myself that next time I go to Vegas, I will *definitely* be back to eat here.

BUT.... the REAL gem of this experience occurred two weeks later, when I got back to work and submitted my receipts. I had misplaced the credit card receipt (still had the itemized one) and my work was on my back bugging me for the credit card receipt. I contacted the restaurant with my pathetic request and the gentleman who answered the phone was very understanding, and sent me a reprint that satisfied the dragons in Accounting. So... GREAT food, outstanding portions, good value for the money - and EXCEPTIONAL customer service. Gangnam, I hope you open a restaurant in Ventura, California someday!! I will definitely be back to visit!!

We sat down and then didnt see a server for 30 min. If we werent so hungry we would have leave left. We put in the whole order as soon as he came over... He then had to be reminded to bring out each individual item, He was so busy Drinking sake with the cute 21 year olds at the other table. Then when we asked to split the check he just charged one person double and not the other... *FacePalm*  The Food was ok. The music was very offensive rap music (I wouldnt mind in a club) Dont bring your children here.
Awesome service, awesome food. Brought out food quickly.  The Beef was fresh and juicy!!!

First time here and it was amazing! I will definitely come back here every single time I am in Vegas. The food was fresh, tasty, and plentiful! The service was friendly and fast. Try this place when you're in town!

This is the first japanese-Korean BBQ that I've eaten at. At first I was skeptical cause you don't normally mix two different types of asian style foods (for those who don't know the difference between Japanese and Koreans). To my surprise however, they found a harmonic balance between the two. It's like GyuKaku Japanese BBQ with free Korean sides and additional korean meat options. The bill could add up cause all their shit is delicious, but it's worth it to be adventurous on the menu.

We got korean Chicken with cheese fondue, Spicy Chicken with lemon sauce,sweet corn cheese , Squid and mushroom medley. Like every korean place we started with banchan. Some were good some were ok. The meats were ok the mushroom medley was just meh. The sweet corn thing was also just ok. All in all not bad but not great either.

here is amazing and wonderful 
It is by far the best Korean restaurant I have ever been to.
I recommend a restaurant that is cheap, delicious and perfect for service.
Food was good, but more importantly the setting and the friendly staff were great. Our group had great fun cooking and eating there. Must try
It's hard to beat Korean food in L.A., and this was a quick stopover on a long trip. Great quality meat and fantastic service!
Really good bulgogi! Awesome Korean Bbq place. Highly Recommended! Love their seaweed salad

Went here for the 3-5 pm happy hour. They have pretty good choices on the menu so we opted for...pretty much everything on it lol. It was delicious. Flavorful and definitely fulfilling. We also ordered fried rice and the sukiyaki noodles that were not on the HH menu. Both were very good, but the noodles were amazing. So rich and they don't short you on the chicken either (in both the noodles and rice). The honey bread dessert was probably the best honey bread I've had. 

My only problem was the service. Our waitress was really rude. We felt rushed when we were trying to order, and while I was still clearly looking at the menu, she asked me to give it back to her. We wanted to order more food but she never came back so decided against it. We waited approximately 15-20 minutes to order dessert and then another 10 for the check. She was doing side work and looking at us but chose not to come over while we sat there waiting. So two other waiters came to help. It was really off-putting. 

Nevertheless, I'll probably be back because the food was delicious. If the bad service continues however, I'm not sure it'll be worth it.
It's a really good restaurant! Meats all delicious ?thanks for my best friend told me this place ?I will go there again next time to visit Las Vegas
Big portions, lots of flavour. Options include raw meat, applies, soups, rice and noodles. The spicy chicken with lemon sauce is a must.

First time visit!

Quick and efficient service...great meats - tender and flavorful. Went with the Gangnam combo. Our favorites were the Kalbi Korean marinated meat and the miso meat. 

Banchan was yummy - especially loved the fish cake, cuttlefish and kimchi.
Went there for happy hour.  Chicken was tender, beef toro was chewy as leather.. But chicken was a good deal and good too.

12/20/2015 Update: just came back tonight and got the Gangnam Menu for 4 persons. Well worth the money, lots of food that came out fast. 


Best Korean BBQ! Love the harami miso beef, the beef carpaccio and spicy tuna kimpbap. Excellent service.
I was in for a quick lunch.  Food is great!  I've never done bbq like this, but I figured it out.  It is fun!

Probably the best and most authentic Korean BBQ place I have eaten at since coming back from South Korea 8 years ago!  There was a wide variety of food and everything was great. The side dishes were perfect for two people. I will definitely come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas!

I came to this restaurant for the simple reason that I had to get out of the hard rock hotel. This was right across the street and I figured anything was better than spending more time at the smoky trashy hotel that was trying too hard.

My first reaction upon seeing the menu was to be a bit taken aback by the printed discount signs on the menu. Made me think of "regular price 9.95 but just for you it's 7,50--- maybe because the food is old or no one wants to go there."

I worried too much. The food was reasonably good. Tasty Korean BBQ at an affordable price. Service was pretty indifferent. "Yes we have a smaller table but it isn't set up: why don't you sit at the bar."  And I had to wait for a fair amount of time before getting any attention to place my order. The indifferent service might account for my bulgogi being a bit on the cold side. But the food did taste good and was a good value for the money.

I
Great bulgogi and kalbi. It also has the extra advantage of being a little off the strip and allow for beating the traffic.. free deserts for honest yelp reviews help too :-)

Was looking for some good American barbecue but stumbled upon this on yelp instead. The boyfriend loves Korean barbecue so so we decided to try it.

We didn't realize it was one of those places where you cook your own food at a grill and your table. It was such a pleasant surprise. The food was great, staff was friendly, place is clean and not too expensive. A fun and tasty experience!
By far,  the best Korean food I've had to date.  Everything was excellent!   The staff was courteous, attentive and the atmosphere was great.  Definitely coming back!!!

Meh was pretty good, marinated meats are sweet which we liked

You get a free dessert if you rate at the end 

The meals for two are enough for 3 people.
Still bomb. Yummy meats, sides and extras. Still have a great happy hour 3-6 and Back's service is A++.
Ordered a spicy tofu soup. Tastes great! The side dishes before entree are also great! Staff are friendly! Definitely recommend!
This place seems nice, very dimly lit but flattering light, You get to choose ur own meats to cook at the table, and servers are friendly. Kind of expensive for lunch.

Best Korean food I think I've ever had! The flavors were spot on for EVERYTHING (and I mean everything!). We ordered 6 different cuts of meat (spicy chicken, spicy pork, harami miso, kalbi, bulgogi, and regular pork). It was deliciously marinated and juicy and easy to cook yourself. I didn't even need the side sauces. The kimchi was perfectly spicy and the cucumber side dish was nicely sweet. The miso soup had the perfect temperature and flavor. Rice was perfectly cooked as well and service was extremely friendly and very attentive. Best part of it was all that came out to a price that was very affordable and reasonable for lunch (because you're off the strip). Highly highly recommend!!

Edit 3/1/17: came here again by myself and sat at the bar. I ordered several cuts of meat and the rock shrimp. When you sit at the bar you don't get to cook the meat yourself which I didn't realize. Honestly I was kind of happy about that because it takes so long to cook everything that sometimes it's just nice to sit back and relax and eat instead lol. They brought everything out quickly and it was just as tasty as before, as far as the flavors go. The cuts of meat were a little on the chewier side compared to last time (although ever so slightly it wasn't a big deal) but maybe also thicker and bigger from what I remember? ... maybe lunch vs dinner portion? Not sure. But still a great meal overall and this time I tried the side sauces which were really nice. Wait staff was on point again as well. Funny enough, they saw me on yelp adding this edit and my mochi ended up being on the house. Again, lots of great food for a great price with great service (why I always prefer to eat off the strip) Woo!
Good barbecue, poor service. Appetizers were alright. Bulgogi was average, good short rib and brisket as well as the filet mignon.
First time to come here. Very good experience. If u r meat lovers, u will like it very much.
GREAT FOOD , Great service . Love this Place . I dealt  recommend the prime beef Kalbi !!!

We got the Premium and it was incredibly delicious. The meat was tender and perfectly marinated. We also got the tempura kobocha which was probably my favorite thing. Our server was super nice and everyone was very friendly.
Gangnam combo for 4 people plus 1 pitcher of beer =$156. Kinda pricey but good quality meats and plenty of side dishes. Overall, very good and will come back again.

In the middle of a convention me and my friends went here for a lunch. We had a great time with exceptional  service with people checking on us every couple of seconds!

The only thing keeping this place from the fifth star is we had to ask for our appetizer after we had finished with our meal and we got some food we didn't order! Keep it up Gangam
Super delicious with that variety. My kids love the broker leaving soon! Service was friendly and the place was clean. We will deathly come here again.
Everything was top notch. Most satisfying Korean dining experience I've had in a long time. Got the Premium package for 4 and it was just right-plenty of deliciousness at a reasonable price.
Excellent restaurant. We got the Las Vegas packaged for 6 and it was more than enough for 7 people. We had plenty left over. It was good quality food and great service
Very good Korean food for 45 bucks including free dessert! Even comparable to the Bay Area . Service is top notch and for the amount of food two people cannot finish it. Keep up the good work!
Very good food for the price. Definitely a place to check out if you are on the strip. Frequent Korean BBQ visitor and I'm very pleased with their selection of food.
Good food, nice friendly servers. The veggie fried dumplings were pretty delicious. We ordered the gangam package and it was plenty of food to go around
Loved it so much that I came back with the fam the second time on our first night for dinner. Take advantage of the happy Hour!

Husband and I were reluctant to try this bc we had no idea what Asian BBQ was.  The staff was top notch.  Answered our many questions and was very patient.  We ordered two types of noodles fried rice and dumplings.  It was the best Asian food I have ever had.  Impeccable service and it didn't cost us a fortune.  Walking distance Right down from the Hard Rock Hotel.  We're only in Vegas three days, but I bet we will be back before it's over.

I highly recommend this place. The food was really good and the service excellent. We ordered the Gangnam meal for 2, but it fed 4 people nicely (although you probably want to try some other things too). It gives you a sample of many different meats. Plus, if you write a review, you get a free desert! The price is a little on the higher end, but definitely worth it.

I m from New York City and Korean bbq is very common in my city so I've had many. I didn't have high expectations with Gangnam but boy was I wrong. This place was actually really good being the fact that's in Las Vegas. I am shock how good the food was especially the Korean prime kalbi and the bulgogi. Highly recommend this place if you are just like me coming to Vegas for an adventure and just simply got so tired with the food around you (casino restaurants) and want to try something new then you must give Gangnam Asian BBQ dining a try.

We saw the reviews on this place, so we decided to have lunch here. We came on a Saturday afternoon, around 2-3pm. The menu was easy to read, the staff were friendly and accommodating, and the prices weren't bad. The food was great. We chose the "meat lover's"  package and ate everything. We will definitely be making this our regular stop whenever we visit Vegas.

Had  an all around good experience on a Thursday night at 8 pm. Sat right down  in a mostly full dining room.The menus are either a la carte or fixed menus of various meats and seafood. The service  was attentive and prompt , we ended up ordering 2  good apps seafood pancake and  fried dumplings. Then went in for 5 meat dishes of various cuts including the pork belly. Kalbi, Toro, Briskit, Bulgogi (recommended) .Most  had really good seasoning but also they included great condiments, 3 different sauces  and their kimchi was real tasty. It's a fun place with a clean interior, you can linger and enjoy relaxed dinner here. There was a lot of other tasty looking seafood dishes to return for.
This is a great place to eat.  I wasn't turned over the idea of me cooking my own food, but it worked out.  I loved it and we we went again.

Such a fun atmosphere! Great place great food! We ordered the Las Vegas for two and there was plenty of food to spare! Loved the beef and the shrimp in particular. The boibob rice was to die for! So flavorful and delicious! Highly recommend if you've got some time! Yumm!

We ordered the gangnam family entree and it was very fulfilling for the 4 of us. $120 and it came when 4 meat dishes, dual orders of raw oysters, shishito peppers, fried tofu appetizer, full salad, grilled mushrooms. Meat was very tender and moist. Flavorful, I must say that it was worth the price. Overall would recommend. Happy Hour on the weekends start at 10pm till close. They're usual happy hours start at 8pm. Servers were attentive and always clearing up our plates as we finish up plates.

Usually I really don't like Korean bbq, but this place is amazing! We ate some filet mignon, spicy soft tofu, and pork belly. Along with these delicious dishes we got some surprisingly new sauces and sides. I will definitely come back on my family's next visit to Vegas!!!
This is my favorite BBQ restaurant. The beef is fresh with a good price. Definitely a good place to go again.
All I can say is this Gangnam Asian BBQ is the best Korean food. I'm one happy customer, however, they can work on bettering the customer service but overall I give thumbs up.
Really good BBQ and Bimbimbap I recommend the brisket and the marinated shortrib :-) pretty good value too.

We had a party of four and order two "las Vegas" meals. I think we could have gotten away with ordering one for the four of us because it was a lot of food and much of it went uneaten. But it was very good. Kimchi was the only thing that was bleh.
I know Korean food really well after having lived and worked there for a number of years.  The Korean cuisine at this spot is second to none.  Didn't try any of the Japanese while I was there.

This place is so much fun and whenever we are in town and want KBBQ this is our spot. Our last couple visits to Vegas we've made it a point to come here. Both times we came for the late night happy hour. The meat and veggies are really good, the staff are friendly and the prices are right. The combos are a good value, we opted to add to it with a couple dishes from the happy hour menu. The side dishes are good and have a good variety. I haven't been to any other KKBQ's in town, but I don't think we need to. They have everything we want and more. Some day we will hopefully be able to bring a few more people with us and really get more meat and veggies so the two of us can try more items. Definitely a must try and fun for the entire family, away from the craziness of the strip if you need that. (Yelp LA Challenge #44 of 100)

This place is tremendous. As someone who has lived in South Korea for a year I can say this restaurant is truly authentic Korean BBQ. The staff is very generous and willing to help in any way. Highly recommended!

Stopped here for lunch on a Saturday.  Located across the street from Hard Rock Casino and Hofbrauhaus and only about a $5-6$ uber/lyft from mid-strip hotels.  Ordered one of the combos but definitely could have just ordered individually off the menu.  Food was really good and you get a lot of it when ordering the combo.  Servers were friendly and attentive.  Checked in and got a free ice cream!
If you're in Vegas and you like Korea Bbq; you should definitely try this place! The food is good, the staffs is nice and it's affordable! They deserve 5 stars in my opinion. :)

Great food, great prices. Portions are good. Staff are friendly and attentive!

Meats are tender, never chewy. Their happy hour is great, there's an earlier happy hour or a late night one. Half off some alcoholic drinks too, along with half off food items

I try first time Korean food in Las Vegas and it was awesome. Everything is fresh n best thing is u can grill it by ur self. It was plenty of verity in very less prize. Service also very nice. Server is alway active and taking care of ur needs. I highly recommend this place. Not even single thing witch will disappoint u. 100 % 5star.

Great Korean BBQ ever! Meat lover with Macaron ice cream is soooo good. The seafood, especially shrimp, is fresh and delicious. If you are in Las Vegas and a BBQ lover, you should go and taste. The service attitude is also great.

My co-workers and I stopped here after visiting a museum nearby. We tried a variety of meats and seafood on the menu and everything was delicious. I'm not used to having to cook my own food at a restaurant, but this was a really cool experience that I would recommend to others. Also, friendly staff, clean tables, and great prices.
Pretty good, good banchan. We ordered the Las Vegas meal with the mushroom medley instead of broccoli which was really tasty and a good call. Was a little pricey but the environment was pretty.

Great Korean food. We ordered the bbq that was for two. We LOVE to eat and that was a lot of food  for us. The meat is of good quality. The spicy chicken, I think, was my favorite. It was perfectly spiced. The other meats, chicken, pork, beef and shrimp were also very good. They also generous on all the traditional Korean sides, such as salads, Kimchi, dried scuttle fish, tofu, etc. Overall, it's a great little place away from the strip. The servers are very friendly. Tip:  Come very hungry and grill your own food.  I will always come back to this place anytime we're in Las Vegas.
Great service, good food, awesome ambience. Ate and drank so much, we're leaving happy. Will come back!

I came here because i was staying at vegas for 4 days and i have to eat korean food at least every other day :D They have really good quality korean food and all the banchans were good! I would definitly come back!
My first visit to Korean Bbq. Was interesting and tasty. I would have liked more input from the waiter since we really didn't know how or what to order!

I'm going to tell you something... I lived in Koreatown for a year before they raised my rent and was forced to move to a gentrified neighborhood. Having said that, my standards for Korean BBQ are pretty high. I'll say Gangnam does the trick and will satisfy your cravings, but nothing blew us away. 

Service was good. Beer was cold. And we didn't get sick that night. So if your fixin for some meat then go no further OR go a little further to Koreatown, Los Angeles because that's the real standard.

WOW!! Great service, great meat, great sauces... MUST EAT!! With our family of four, we ordered the Gangnam style for two and switched some appetizers and added some meat for our self- proclaimed pescaporkian (she only eats fish and pork). The Gangnam for two gave us enough portions for our nine and twelve year old to share with us. Their house-made dipping sauces were divine!! The quality of the meat was CAB or better! The service was excellent and the atmosphere was great! Our table was large enough for all of the small plates and bowls we would be acquiring throughout our meal. They did a great job checking in, clearing off empty dishes and keeping our drinks filled!! 

A (9 yo): Filet Mignon was really good! 
J (12 yo): Delicious salmon! 
B: Yummy salad and filet mignon. All the beef was great!! 
N: Sauces were the winner!! 

We will be back next time we are in Vegas again!!
Gangnam has clean and valuable atmosphere and especially they have some specials we can join. Most of all, their service is really attentive, of course the meats they serve is maximal!!

Not only is the food outstanding, the work ethic in here is impeccable- the team work shows from the moment you step in the door- they are attentive and hands full always ! Fresh friendly and efficient !

Yummmmmy!!!! Lots of delicious fresh Japanese/Korean food!! And great service. You get A LOT of food when you order they give you lots of side dishes so you will definitely leave here happy and full :)
First time here and I love it! Food was delicious! Amazing! Hubby and I will return. Tried the premium for 2 that it was just enough.
Great place love it will diffidently come back, came for my brothers birthday and as soon as we landed to Vegas we decided to come eat here party of 10 very nice.

Excellent spot with excellent service. Lots of meat choices that are fresh, tender and tasty. The short rib and filet are delicious. Also ordered the squash and karaage, which were also pretty good. Nice ambiance and they got a TV at the bar. Even got a free dessert after posting this! Will come back!

The ambiance, atmosphere, and overall cuisine was amazing! Loved the hands on approach and vibe of the restaurant! I got a little lost on what everything was but everything tasted really delicious! Definitely a great Thursday night dinner spot.
Great fresh food and good service.   Recommend the BBQ shrimp and uni rice.  And you get free desert for a yelp review

Sadly, one of the worst kbbq spots I've dined at in a very long time. Do take into account that my palate has been spoiled from dining at all the kbbq spots in LA.

I've had this place bookmarked for a long time now, but never actually got to going because of the mixed reviews I was getting. Four and a half stars on yelp and a visiting friend from New York finally got me to pay this spot a visit. We ordered the gangnam combo for a party of three which was more than enough food. This combo is meant to feed two people for $66. The combo came with five kinds of meats, fresh oysters, quartered sweet corn on the cob, bibimbap or side of white rice, miso soup, and mushroom medley. All cuts were subpar in my opinion. Bulgogi was too sweet and chunks were not cut up. The filet mignon was my least favorite. The chunks were rather large. Putting in work for something tasty was worthwhile, but for meats that did not taste at all fresh, that's just asking for too much. The bibimbap was simply sweet rice and beef. Not much veggies and hot sauce mixed in like the typical bibimbap dish. My favorite part of he meal was probably the soon tofu we ordered in addition to the gangnam combo. Soup was tasty and the seafood bits aroused surprise with each bite. This place also does not cook your meat for you. So roll up your sleeves, tie back you hair, and get cooking!

Would I come again? Definitely not. Not worth the money. You might as well go elsewhere that will cook your meat for you for cheaper with better quality meat.

Free dessert with yelp review post.

It was messy the order they brought in the food. I paid fu%#^*+ $66.00 for the 2 person Gangnam special and they brought out the bi bim Bab(item with rice) last! You don't bring that when the meat is all done eating. We didn't get our drinks til half way through dinner. Other waiters kept coming by and asking if we got so and so. They basically don't have a tracking system of what you got. I will never waste money here again. Overpriced for what you get. It's not all you can eat. The meat trays are so small.
Great place serves well and fast. We didn't have to wait a long time and we got free dessert!!!!!

Excellent food just off the strip. First time trying Korean BBQ and really enjoyed the experience and the food. My wife and I came here for my birthday after reading other positive reviews. Had some hot sake and split the Gangnam platter. Way more food than we could handle! Would highly recommend.
Great Korean BBQ place!!!! I had Meat Lover, and all the food was delicious. Portion was enough.

Great place and massive portions for the price. The set for two could easily feed three or even four I would think. Don't forget to ask for the sesame oil/salt or gochujang sauces if you prefer those since it's not provided by default.

The biggest problem with Gangnam is the the portions are bigger than they look!  The highlights were the kalbi and the mushroom pack.  The bulgogi was good value.  Stay away from the squash.  Very good overall.
My fav is Kobe style beef. Love it!!! Always order this one when I come over. Love their small Korean style side dishes too! And u get complimentary house salad for dinner.

Wow, these people need to get their butts to the east coast because MAN WILL I MISS THIS.

For Asian BBQ, yes, it looks daunting and overpriced when you first look at the menu. 4oz for 7$ is like paying 7$ for nothing. But when you order the combos for 2 people, you're actually getting enough for 3 or 4. Get one of those and a la carte the few selections you really enjoyed and you're bill will be about 100$ total for 6 people! Not bad, right?  When they ask what kind of rice you want - normal or bulgogi mixed - definitely get the bulgogi. That stuff was the bombbbbbbbbbbbbb. Perfectly sweet to go along with the savory meat!

We really enjoyed ourselves, the quality of the ingredients was super! Fresh, well cut and delivered. This is the cleanest well engineered Korean BBQ You can find, great venting, ands grille that was changed with a clean fresh one bout half way through the meal. Not cheap but you get what you pay for, this IS a great "Splurge" meal.
We come here all the time when we visit las vegas. The quality of meat is always top quality and we always visit several times if we stay for a week. One of the best korean bbq in town.
One of the best BBQ spots around the strip. I got the Premium and everything is delicious! Especially the Kobe beef and Filet Mignon

Food is delicious. The set of 4 fed our party of 4 adults and 3 kids well. They are generous w their serving and side dishes. To top it all, the people are very honest and understanding. I left a great amount of money on the table in a a bag. Only discovered it an hour later, yet the whole amount was intact. Good job. U have won a faithful customer.

Great good and service! Portions are just right. No rice paper though :(

They also add 18% gratuity for large parties

Went here tonight, and really enjoyed it. I loved how the wait staff explained everything to us. We've been to other Korean places where they don't explain a thing. However, in those places they end up cooking the food for you, whereas here you're left to do your own thing. The miso soup was by far the best miso soup either my husband or I had ever had. The meat selections were good, but we were left craving some other cuts we've had at other places. Not their fault, maybe ours for not knowing. Would recommend this place to others, but the one down side is that their exhaust fans aren't as strong, so you'll leave with the smell.

My favorite place to eat when I come to Vegas!!! I gotta come at least twice when I'm on my annual Edc trip!!! Good service , delicious food great atmosphere. I think this might be my favorite restaurant in general even better than Hawaii!!!! I'll always come back plenty of food and can I tell you how good the bulgogi is ?!! To die for.

I've eaten a lot of Korean BBQ throughout my life and this was by far my top 3 places I've tried. Great service easy menu to order if you go out with a group of people. Quality of the meat was excellent, food tasted great good options and nice setting. I would of have loved more authentic side dishes brought out but that's about the only thing that kept me from giving it a 5 star;)

A belly busting, jolly good time! 

We cruised over on a sunny Sunday for happy hour. My party of 3 was famished so we went to town on the happy hour menu; available everyday 3pm-6pm and again at 10pm-12:45am) - the HH menu isn't huge, but it had a good variety so we stuck to it. 

They only offer complimentary side dishes (banchan) with a minimum of 2 BBQ dishes per person, but we had no problem meeting that quota. All of the sides offered were fresh and flavorful - we also enjoyed extra rounds. Also, they offered 3 dipping sauces light, medium, and a dark one. They were all tasty but my favorite was definitely the darkest one - it was salty, sweet and a bit spicy. 

HH items we tried:
Cream cheese wontons - 4/5
Sweet corn - 5/5 (very sweet and buttery but tiny)
Mushroom medley with butter - 4/5
Garlic in butter - 5/5
Jalapeno poppers - 5/5 (delicious)
Korean chicken cheese fondue - 3/5
Spicy pork - 4/5
Pork belly - 5/5 (we loved this the most!)
Bulgogi - 3/5

When dining outside of happy hour, the regular menu is massive so I'm sure you will be able to find something, even for the the pickiest of eaters. Also, pricing seemed fairly competitive with Gyu-Kaku (their direct competitor.) The grill tops and ventilation setup at each table worked very well; they conveniently changed out our charred grill per our request and the restaurant wasn't smokey or smelly.

After the feast you know we all needed a cup of caffeine to snap us out of the food coma.

Good times!

I can't believe how great this restaurant is.  It is a gem.  We come to LV every year and my husband found this on the web and we decided to try it.  What a deal for the price.  We had lunch there.  For less than $13, you have two selections of meats, one salad or soup with one appetizer.  On top of that, we get 7 side dishes.  The portion of the salad and appetizer is huge.  How I wish they can open one in San Francisco.  I would eat there every week. You have to try it to believe it!
overall The beef are very soft and have a good taste. They gave so many delicious appetizer. So very recommended.
Super good! I would totally go back!! It was a little different then what I'm used too, but the sauces were really good to dip the meat in to. And the poke was
great food and Service. will come back Again great enviorment and staff great happy hour specials and drinks has full bar recommended to any one from in and out of town  stop

Found this place based off all the 5 star reviews found on Yelp. I'm sorry, yes I have to give this place 3 stars and not the shiny bright 5 stars that everyone else has provided. Don't get me wrong, the food was absolutely delicious. The pitcher of sangria was absolutely amazing. The price for the amount of food you get when you order off of their combos was definitely decently priced, but the service... my visit was at 1:00PM on a Friday and there was 1 table  with guests dining there. We walked in and kind of stood by the door waiting for someone to come greet us. It seems like the entire staff was on their break or something. Perhaps I am not with the Vegas lifestyle, and people don't come in to eat at 1:00 PM? Maybe we missed the lunch rush? Was no one working? It took a bit for someone to seat us. After we sat down, it was like they forgot we were there. We had to get up and find someone to explain the menu, take our order, change our grill, and re-fill our water. This place is definitely delicious, but service at 1:00 PM was not the fast and friendly service I had read in all these reviews.

We ordered marinated prime ribs which were great !!! The food was expensive though :(
However, overall, loved the food. A really great place to go out and eat.

We stay at alexis park, whoch is really close to the restaurant! Pretty much diagonally across the street. This servic is great and the food is awesome. We got the las vegas package, and got happy hour bulgolgi and pork belly, for three girls! Great portion and variety. Definitely a great find!
Second time here and love it every time I'm in town. On this occasion brought my family and my parents and we all enjoyed it!
Yum!! The food was amazing! It was a good start to Vegas.. The customer service was really good!! I totally recommend this place.. Yay!!

Just came here for lunch. Mediocre at best compared to all the great KBBQ joints springing up around town! Food and service were so-so. We ordered beef tongue, skirt steak, bulgogi, and kalbi beef... Plus a salad and a miso soup. They had the traditional sides available. We ended up paying $50 for two of us. I would have rather gone to Hobak or Magal. The happy hour may be something to check out. Other than that, probably won't be making this a go-to spot for KBBQ.

Great meal and service.  Would come again.  Whether it's cold noodle or bbq, it is very good quality.  This is my second visit and this restaurant is the best I've been to in Vegas.  Make sure you stop by this place if you plan on visiting las Vegas.

I always love the  weekday 3-6pm happy hour on select beer and drinks at this spot. I usually order the brisket and bulgogi as well as the calamari. The restaurant is always clean and staff is friendly. I've had the other items on the menu before and they are on the pricy side but good. My bill during happy hour or getting the $49 meal for two is usually  the same as an all you can eat with a little bit less but higher quality food.

A Japanese Korean BBQ place worth going to if you're in Vegas. I've been to many Korean BBQ and this place is up there. Order the Gangnam special for 6 and you'll get more than enough food to keep you full all night. The meat quality is good, but the brisket isn't very good since it's cut way too thick. The appetizers and dishes were reasonably priced. Just make sure to leave your jackets in the car or else your clothes will smell like BBQ the entire trip. There's plenty of #Thinsulin approved food choices here for you to choose from. I would definitely come back here.

My first review ever on Yelp is dedicated to Gangnam Asian BBQ. We ordered the Gangnam Grill for 2 people and had more than enough for my parents and myself. Fair price and great service! Our waiter checked in with us often and made sure everything was going well. For next time, I will be ordering what I like individually. I only really cared for the bulgogi within the entire order. Leaving the restaurant with a full happy tummy!

I always wanted to try a Korean BBQ and so I found this place on yelp and food was great, it's was opened late too so definitely another plus. Servers were friendly but hard to get their attention. Also checked in on yelp so free macaroon ice which was perfect.
The food and service are always excellent. And the price is great. The spicy pork is a must have!

This is the place to go if you're looking for an authentic Korean BBQ experience! Everything from the food, down to the service is outstanding. You won't regret. I promise. I come here anytime I'm in Vegas!
Great food and an awesome atmosphere! Staff was quick to help with any questions and always stopping by to see if we needed anything.
Great restaurant and friendly staff. The meat is really flavorful and tender! Love it and will come back again

It was our 1st time at a Korean Bbq.  The food quality was awesome and fresh. We really didn't know what we were doing,  so a little more information about how to cook our food lol... otherwise the experience was awesome.
This is one of the best Korean bbq I've tried. It is not all you can eat but it's definitely fulfilling!!! A must try

I've been to many Korean bbq in seattle washington, but this one cuts the butter. 
There are more selections, the quality is superb, and the service is outstanding !
Pretty authentic Asian bbq! Everything that we ordered tasted great. The 2 mile walk from our hotel was definitely worth it. Still loaded with people after 12am Christmas Eve...

Right off the bat the food is DELICIOUS! They served a variety of traditional Korean side dishes (kimchi, daikon, cucumber, etc.) and offer different meal sets for 2-6 people. With lots of choices of meats, appetizers, soups, and vegetables. 

My family and I are from Hawaii and we were dying for some Korean food. We came around 8 pm and the waited around 30 minutes. The wait was supposed to be longer but lots of people left because they were waiting longer than is. Hence why we got to sit down pretty fast. The ambiance is nice, modern and up to date (as far as furniture and music). Booths against the wall can easily sit up to 6 people, tables in the middle 4, and they also have one private room/section that can fit a big party. 

The guy who sat us was very nice and welcoming. But I feel like the servers, I wouldn't say rude but the tone in their voice and the way they talked to us didn't seemed nice. For example: I asked "what kind of sauce is this?" While oiling the grill, our waiter quickly cut me off at the end of my question and said "yeah hold on, let me do this first and I'll explain it." In a sort of rude tone. Even when my dad asked about the yelp offer the waiter cuts him off mid sentence, "oh yeah the yelp thing, we'll do that later" in that same rude tone. 

I gave this place 4 stars because the wait time and food was great, better than most places in Hawaii (Hawaii has lots of great Korean BBQ, hence why I was so impressed) I would defiantly come back here, just needs improvements on the way waiters talk to their guest. 

Tip: make sure to check in so you can get a free macaron ice cream sandwich, super good!
This was my first proper Korean cuisine. It had me wishing there was a Gangnam hotel near my city as well. Food was spicy as it should be. Service was good.

Wow, really good. Stopped in for lunch and got the 2 Person BBQ platter of meat, chicken and seafood and sides plus a pitcher of cold beer and we were set. Cooking was quick and easy
The staff is really attentive and made sure we were covered, I was impressed.
We had the ice cream macaroons for dessert.
The place is off the strip so we took Uber for 4 dollars from our hotel.

From beginning to end this place was great! The food and service both did not disappoint. We came right before lunch time so thankfully no wait (by the time we left there were lots of people waiting). Ordered the premium combo and nengmyun (korean noodles). Each meat was delicious but my favorite was the kobe style beef. It melts in your mouth! Topped off with free macaron ice cream through yelp check in, it was the perfect meal.

We ordered #1 combo, the food was average. The small dishes were below average, not many can eat, fish cake was hard and cold. Only kimchi was fine.
The waitress was inpatient, I asked what were the differences between Korean prime kalbi and prime kalbi? She answered "one is Korean prime kalbi, the other is prime kalbi" was I blind??? I couldn't read??? 
During our dinner, there was no one asking if we needed anything or if we were doing ok. No sauce refill, no water refill, no plate replacement (even after they saw the whole plate became burned/black). 
In summary, average food+awful service = 1 star.
Awesome food and a friendly staff! Great place to take kids to try something new. Their happy hour is a great value.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, great Korean barbecue, awesome service, 
very friendly staff!!
Delicious! Everything was perfect! Good meat with great flavor, nice atmosphere and a couple of attentive servers who took care of us well. I would definitely come back here.

This place was great for the price. The prices are not too steep and the food is actually pretty good for the amount that you pay. The service was a little slow but it was very busy when we were here. It is a family friendly restaurant and I recommend this place for families with children

This was my first time trying Gangnam Asian BBQ in Las Vegas. I have had Korean BBQ or Japanese BBQ in different restaurants and cities. I have to say this is the best Asian BBQ I have had. The Staff members were tentative and sincere. They made sure your needs are addressed quickly and efficiently. 

You have to get the Kobe Beef Carpaccio. The Gangnam combo was more than enough for two. If you have three people or even four; the Gangnam combo for two will suffice. Additional the macaroon ice cream is to die for. 

This is definitely a destination every time I revisit Las Vegas
Must try the bulgogi beef here!! Macron ice cream taste good too! Price is reasonable. Nice place to come!

Stumbled across this place on my last day in Vegas. This is a go-to place if you're looking for good Korean food at an affordable price (much cheaper than restaurants on The Strip). I liked everything I ordered (beef toro, pork belly, bulgogi, kobe style beef, tongue). Keep in mind, you will definitely leave here with a strong odor on your clothes and belongings.

The sizes of the servings were excellent! Meat was very well marinated and the grills are changed frequently to avoid the burnt BBQ accumulation. Price is very fair, however the service is relatively poor.
Beef toro is good, especially for kids. And, definitely, we love the free desert. All beef meat are good.

This is one of the best Korean BBQ joints in Las Vegas. Quality food. Great services. 10/10

(PS: You also get a free dessert for rating it on Yelp.)

Really accessible from the strip, perhaps a 10 minute ride. Busy during lunch times so remember to come early! Format is very similar to gyukaku except the grill is the Korean BBQ grill. 

Ordered the Gangnam set for 4 when there were five of us girls - more than enough food! Came with miso soup, sweet corn, oysters, shishito peppers, mushroom medley, bibimbaps, and a crap ton of meat!!! Everything was really tasty, definitely a good cure for a long weekend out in Vegas!

Service is also awesome :)!

On a Saturday night, this back of the strip mall restaurant provided an enjoyable time and good food (that you cook at your own pace). The place was 50% full when we went there round 8pm. However, I think this place draws a late crowd as it is open until 2 am. Attractive staff and modern style furnished the space. 

Be aware when sitting down. Check for water from the exhaust hood above. As Korean BBQ gets hot and the ac runs cold to keep it cool, condensation builds and can drip on to the table or seat. The underside of my shorts got wet when I slid into the bench style seat. (-1 star).

This place is good for 2-4, and larger tables of 8 are in the back. Super fast service! Don't be shy to flag the servers down. 3 people ran the front of the house. All 3 were at out table at some point.

We ordered a set combination of things and every bit was great. They prepared bibimbap table side and opened our mushroom foil pouch too. The grill didn't get too hot but would try this place in the winter time.

The good was of high quality and at some point, thought it may be too much. Food, 4 beers, house sake = $85 before tip. Not bad!

Brought my sis and best friend here for the first time, they have never done a Korean BBQ and they loved it!!!  Can't wait to be back!!! So good food service and price! I think it's the only Korean BBQ in vegas I would go to...just right benone the strip!
I tried numerous things on the menu and I have several favorites. some are great and some and just okay. Overall, I recommend this place.

I was picking my husband up from the airport around midnight and we were looking for something we could sit down to enjoy, we were very impressed with the food and service. Can't wait for our next visit.

My sister, cousin and I swung into Gangnam on a Friday around 7pm, famished and ready for meat in our mouths. After being promptly seated and minor hemming and hawing over the menu, we decided to order the meat lover's combo for 2, a hot sake, and beer for sake bombs to start our weekend. Between 3 people, we opted for the combo for 2 because we figured we could always order more and didn't want to get too gluttonous by ordering the combo for 4. 

First came the booze, then the side dishes, then all of the meat. The grill heats up very quickly, however it is only hot in the middle and burns the meat rather quickly. Also, don't bother with the onions and assorted sliced veggies; they will burn too. Those aside, my favorite was the spicy pork. Everything else was decent, but not standout. The side dishes are standard and decent too, but the waiters did not come to refill them until we flagged them down.

Their sound system is not very good. They alternated between old school hip hop/R&B and Kpop, which are both my jam but the low sound quality actually irked me a bit. 

Given the many options for dining in Vegas, I likely wouldn't come back here unless I had a huge hankering for kbbq when in town.

If you like high quality Korean BBQ with great flavor and an awesome wait staff come to Gangnam Asian BBQ!  My wife and I were in town for the weekend and searched Yelp for a good Korean BBQ place and I'm glad we found this one!  It was only about a 7 minute rideshare from the MGM Grand where we were staying.  The Kobe beef was tender and full of flavor!  I highly suggest the bulgogi bibambop as well!  All of the side dishes were on point and the sweet corn was truly sweet!  I highly suggest this restaurant!

Authentic Korean food! My family loved the food and atmosphere so much we are there 2 nights in a row! If I could give 10 stars I would! I travel all over the world, and aside from Korea itself, this is one of the best Korean BBQ restaurants in the US! Thank you all for such great service!
Food was delicious. Portions were generous (we did 4 for 85$) and we got free dessert. Recommend the spicy chicken and pork belly it was fantastic!

The food here was great. It was definitely one of the better Korean foods that I have had so far. The customer service was top notch and were very friendly. I would definitely recommend people to come try this place out!!
My favorite Korean BBQ in Vegas and the best steaming egg , Kimchi is yummy not too sour.it's the good place for hang out with friends and family. The quality of meat is very good also.

I came here cause of all the great reviews! 
Services is great 
Food is Good 
Side dishes was Good 
Will be back when I'm in town
So impressed! Everything was very fresh. Try every kimchi! All were so good. I now love kimchi! I can't find one complaint. Eat here!

After reading all the reviews on here we decided to gave it a try and it was awesome!!! The food was very yummy and the services was super great (shes was a cute little korean girl).  We did the happy hr  menu so for less then $35 for total 3 ppl and we all walked out very happy. I'd definitely coming back as matter of fact we all ready planning on coming back tmo night.

Great BBQ. Super tender beef, perfect with beer. 
We ordered meat lover for 4, we were all super full, didn't expect they have this much food.
100% worth to visit. Quick seat, but recommend to make a reservation first.
Excellent all round. The waitresses very friendly. The wait was a little long . The meat was well seasoned and the atmosphere was excellent

FOOD:  overall tasty and fresh with most of the basic side dishes as standard.

SERVICE:  is friendly and professional.  They check in fairly regularly and are responsive to requests.
Good meat quality, reasonable prices. Plates are small, two people will spend over $50 easily. Side dishes can use more variety and better flavor.

Great place off the strip! Literally only 5 minute drive from PH. We came here before our flight leaving Vegas based on yelp reviews.
