It was such a good decision to come here as we were just in time for happy hour! Happy hour on a Sunday (bomb!!!) after a long night out = pure happiness!!!!! The servers were friendly, food was delicious. Everything is small plates only, similar to Gyu Kaku.

We tried pretty much everything from the HH menu, the spicy pork & beef toro & pork belly were our favorites for the meats. Steamed dumplings, seaweed salad were also good too. This place is definitely worth the try if you don't want AYCE bbq. Can't wait to come back again if I'm in the area!
Great food for a good price. The best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. Definitely recommending to friends.

AHHHHH it reminds me of Gyukaku (for those of you who know the place) 
I love korean bbq as well as japanese yakiniku, so we had to stop by while we were in vegas after new years. 
Wait time was spot on as the waiter told us it would be 45min. 45 min later we get to our seat. 
Really clean place and the ventilation system was Awesome! i was really impressed because I've been to a lot of yakiniku and korean bbq places in japan, korea, and hawaii and have notices some places being really smoky and smelly and some other places really good too. But This place probably had the best system i've seen around.
After leaving the place my clothes barely smelled like BBQ and that itself should be given 5 stars.
Meat prices were decent and the side plates were really good.

Service was A+ and everyone was helping each other out which was nice so that we didnt have to wait for "our" waiter like you have to do in basically all other american restaurants.

Anyways short review: Food was amazing, Service amazing. Gonna eat here again when i pass by again.

Haven't had Korean BBQ since I've moved to Vegas but this is by far my favorite restaurant for the moment! Dave was an excellent server/ bartender and made sure we were satisfied throughout our entire experience and even pointed out a free macron ice cream sandwich was super delicious! I'm coming back here for date night at least a few times a month!

Came here to eat since we saw all the good reviews. It's a Sunday night at 5:30 so there was a 5-10 minutes wait. 

My husband and I got the Gangnam set. The meat all tasted the same except the galbi. Overall, the meat was all a bit tough to eat. Definitely did not have the other experience people had. The meats all came out really oily and fatty. It might be that they just didn't have a good batch of meat or it might be that I've been spoiled by kbbq and jbbq in socal. 

The service was okay. 

The portion with the set was pretty big. Even though we got the set for 2, it could have easily fed 3 or 4 people. 

The free macaron ice cream was the only highlight to my dinner.

The food here is incredible! Such good quality of meat and the service was great. 

Would totally recommend to anyone who loves Korean BBQ! Can't go wrong, try the Bulgogi
Good Korean fusion food.  There was a wide variety of dishes offered.  We ordered the premium combination.
Great food, great service, and very accommodating to my large family with a stroller and an active toddler. We will definitely be back!
Great food with great service! Really enjoyed my time here with my girlfriend. Love this place!
I love this restaurant so much. Their beef BBQ and kimji were awesome. I will be back again for sure.

Pretty good kbbq spot we discovered today due to my reservation at an Italian restaurant was cancelled last minute!

The selection is meats really makes this place stand out from traditional kbnq spots in Chinatown!

We ordered the Gangnam combo with included bulgogi bibimpab, 5 different meats, and side dishes (even oyster).

They also have happy hours from 3 to 6pm and then 10pm to CL.

Definitely a place to check out :)
Such a great end of my long work day.. Great service and bomb ass food! Decent price and free desserts if you rate then.. Hence why I am writing a review!

A good Korean BBQ place. Nothing special about the restaurant. Their BBQ was pretty decent! Would've gave it 7/10. Their family portions are much more cost worthy than buying single dishes. We got the Gangnam special for 6 people. I came with a party a party of 9 and got 3 extra plates of meat and multiple appetizers along with the Gangnam family special. Happy hour starts at 3 and has a few selection of appetizers, plates of meat, and half off drinks such as Soju and Beers!

TL;DR: Worth the cost if split among groups since most of the deals are family sized servings.

Best Korean BBQ we have ever eaten!!!
All of the best seller and suggested beef are tasty!
Service is perfect
Definitely worth it!
160 for 7 people with 8 dishes of meat and 4-5 appertizers. Super cheap compared to all of the Bbq in the bay ea 
100% must try

Came here for New Year's Day dinner. The wait wasn't bad and service was good for it being busy. We ordered the premium for 2 people. Plenty of food and sides but we added pork belly as well. Kobe beef stole the show but the premium galbi was good as well. We ordered a side of lettuce to wrap the pork belly. We'll be back when we're in town again.

We ordered the meat lovers combo. Lots of food for 5 adults and 3 kids. Fun experience. The desserts were not impressive. The lava cake was not worth paying $5 and the banana tempura was way too hard. One of the severs was not very nice to us, so that's why I gave them 3 stars.
Went here the second time and service still great! Staff are super friendly! Answer questions! Would recommend this place for some Korean food in Vegas !!!

They offer free dessert for a review which is, I believe, why it is so highly rated. 

Depends what you are looking for; reasonably priced, tasty food, this is an option. 

Fine dining with ambience; probably not the right place. 

The food was good, the service was good and the pricing was also good; but I would definitely not say it was great.  The decor was ok. 

My wife and I went, based on the reviews; it is located in a nondescript strip mall, thankfully my wife noticed it. 

We arrived during happy hour. 

We ordered a few items from the happy hour menu and a few off the regular menu.   We also had one of their specialty cocktails. 

The food was good, some better than others. 

We had the calamari, while tasty, it was a little dry and perhaps overcooked. 

We also had some beef items based on the reviews and they were good. 

The veggies were delicious. 

I have been to Korean BBQ before, and I had enjoyed it. For our meal, I think we needed some sauces for the meat dishes.
I loved their meat, the sides are also good. Overall thia is my current fave korean bbq in town. A bit expensive but for me its kinda worth it.

Came in here for lunch on a Tuesday. Was a little worries when I walked in for lack of people but was quickly greeted and sat. 

This is a very trendy place with good Japanese pop music to go with the theme of this restaurant. 

I ordered beef with a side of broccoli with the add on soup and salad for lunch. Everything I had was amazing. The beef so tender and steamed broccoli right on the grill was great. 

Highly recommend this place.  For the excellent service and phenomenal food.  The only reason for not 5 stars is I want to come back for a second visit soon and make sure today wasn't just a fluke. Once I do that I can hopefully upgrade my rating.
Delicious and affordable! Make sure to get there earlier than you wanna eat ~40 min wait!

Great quality meat and a variety of side dishes. The spicy lemon chicken was excellent. Meat was not fatty like other Korean bbq places. The kalbi was excellent. Tofu soup is one of the best in Vegas. Go for happy hour or reverse happy hour.

Absolutely a hit in our trip to Las Vegas!!! Amazing indoor decoration style! The service is nice and quick!!! The food is AMAZING!!!!!! Food per portion is small so you need order at least 3 dishes for one person accepting to the server. However small proportion prevent waste from happening. The combos looks great as well!(gonna try next time!!!) My family is so satisfied here(even my picky brother looool) definitely will be back!!!
Korean bbq, looks good, smell great. Maybe the best you can find at LV. It takes a little bit time to get the table.

Everything was excellent. I got the Filet Minion, Garlic Shrimp, Fried Calamari, and everything was cooked perfectly, and tasted clean. There were 7 small traditional sides included and I liked a few, I don't like spicy things but they had a variety of options for me.
Good food good environment. trendy music great for me and my teen sis. Good portion sizes and great deals for happy hour. Also super clean.

Wow!!!this restaurant is on my top five best, the food was amazing the service was also great and you get a free Ice cream macaron with checking in. The most reasonable price I have seen from this type of restaurant.
Yummy and fun concept! Highly recommend. The chicken with cheese fondue was excellent. We came around 1:30 pm on a Thursday and there was no wait.
Customer service was great! Food is delicious! Love the free dessert! We'll definitely come back!
Excellent food, the service was super fast, it took us longer to decide what to order then for it to come out of the kitchen. Would highly recommend to anyone that is in Las Vegas!
My favorite kbbq in Vegas. Service is always friendly and food is on point. Atmosphere is trendy, just a great place to have dinner with friends or even a date.
Best bbq ever!! Price is reasonable! If you wanna get some korean food, I recomand Gangdam as Korean

I came here for happy hour (3-6pm, 10pm- close) based on all the great reviews. We called ahead to try to make a reservation, and were told that they don't take same day reservations but they weren't busy at the time so we came in anyways. 

We ordered beef toro, bulgogi, pork belly, and mushroom medley. We also had the chicken wings, fried calamari, and jalape√±o poppers for apps. Each dish was $4 with the exception of the mushrooms ($2). The meats were really good quality, and my favorite was the bulgogi which was really tender and had a great marinade. The chicken wings were average, crispy but pretty bland. The poppers were filled with cream cheese and salmon with a tempura batter. The calamari were okay as well, but the breading was disappointingly flavorless, much like the chicken wings. The dipping sauce that came with it added some much needed flavor to the dish.

The service was relatively spotty. We were seated immediately and our waiter took our order quickly. Afterwards however it was kind of difficult to get anyone's attention as the restaurant became more busy, so we had to flag down someone each time we needed something. Our appetizers also came out way after the meats, so we were pretty much done with our food by the time our last appetizer came out.

Also keep in mind rice is not included when you order dishes a la cartel for happy hour. It's $2 for a bowl and 1 bowl is enough for 2 to share.

I must admit though that I think the reviews for this place are somewhat inflated because they give you a free desert if you write and show them a posted Yelp review. To avoid the inevitable awkwardness associated with showing your server an low or average review and the fact that you are getting a free desert, I feel like people naturally give this place a higher review than they normally would. Definitely wouldn't expect this place to be averaging 4.5 stars.

Overall Gangnam Asian BBQ is a solid restaurant for your Asian BBQ fix while in Vegas.
This was really good and happy hour prices can't be beat. Our favorite of the meats was the bulgogi and Korean prime kolbi.  Would definitely come again if we lived in the area.

Came here on a Sunday night fairly late.  It was almost 10pm and they were still busy.  We were greeted at the door and the gentleman was very pleasant.  He explained there was abother party in front of us but they just finished a rush and alot of tables should be opening up.  We were seated after about 10 min which was not bad at all.  The server came over promptly.  We ordered the 2 person upgraded meal for about $89.  There was so much food.  It was an awesome value.  Everything tasted awesome!  The server was incredibly attentive as was the rest of the staff that helped us.  We had a check in deal for macaroon ice cream.  I had mango it was delish!  Going back and recommending to friends!

My first visits to Gangnam Asian BBQ dining. The place is easily accessible and the Korean food is authentic. Highly recommended for the Las Vegas set meal and also like the spicy seafood noodles. Highly recommended!!!

We stop by here last July for dinner! We were starving and they sit us promptly. The wait takes a while but it worth it. Service was great! They are friendly and answer whatever question you have. We came back here again after that trip! Even with our flights in two hours!!!!
Great customer service and the meats are fresh. We ordered the meat lover packet for four at $99. The price is reasonable for the amount of food we got (a lot).

I don't usually give reviews unless it's absolutely bad. This place has horrible service. Asked how long is the wait, the waitress said she has no idea. Very rude. Looked at the food people are eating, average Korean BBQ. Noting fancy. Not worth going.
So much good beef!  We split a 2 person package amongst 4 people and were still stuffed.  You can tell how much better the quality is here, since they are not AYCE. Service is also really good.

The lunch special was great! Salad was tasty and fresh. The dumplings were soft and chewy. The sauces for the meat enhanced flavor and tenderness of the meat. We had filet mignon and bulgogi. With a review on Yelp, you get a free dessert. Excellent meal for the right price.

This Korean BBQ place has the tastiest food I've had at a Korean BBQ. You do have to cook the meats yourself but that's actually fun and you make it how you want it. The bolgogi in the rice was so flavorful. The side dishes are so delicious. The combination plate for 2 is a lot of food for 2 people but the variety was perfect. You even get broccoli with cheese fondue. The service is  very attentive and clean up quickly. The atmosphere was very upbeat yet relaxing.

Eh...

I'm from OC where Korean/Japanese BBQ is abundant.  I decided to come in for a late dinner on a Thursday night with one other person.  I had tried to called earlier that day to make reservations but they didn't take any.  There was no wait when we arrived thankfully.  Once seated, we decided to go with the Gangnam Dinner ($60) out of the six options.  It included a house salad, fried dumplings, oysters, seaweed salad, miso, bibimbap, kalbi, bulgogi, choice cut, pork belly, toro, and veggies.  We also ordered extra toro and beef belly.  The best meat surprisingly was the pork belly, although it was the only one not flavored.  I also enjoyed the bulgogi.  The other cuts were average.  The bibimbap was really nothing special.  The sides were all pretty good.  The 4 oysters were gross and didn't taste that fresh.  The veggies they provided was mushrooms and bell peppers.  We also got free macaron ice creams for checking in.  

We left stuffed.  You get a lot for what you pay for.  The menu and look of the place reminds me a hell lot of Gyu Kaku.  It's very very similar.  As for service, the guy waiting on us wasn't really friendly.  It was our first time and he didn't really go over the menu with us.  We also didn't get our waters refilled and kept having to ask.  For such high reviews I am really quite disappointed.  Not sure if we will ever be back.

Loved the free ice cream with check in! Typical Korean BBQ. I enjoyed everything and the kind service. I wish they were more attentive in aiding with the cooking. Even though I've been before, some of the meats were new to me and it would've been nice to get some help.

Came in from Miami and stopped in. The food smells amazing as you walk in, K-pop music playing, and the food is fantastic. I will definitely come back next time I visit Vegas again. You can't go wrong with grilled meats!

We went on a Friday night around 7. There was almost no wait and we were seated within 10 minutes. We ordered the meat lovers set for 4 people and it was very filling. The starter and meats came out quickly. The meats were seasoned well and came with three different dipping sauces. I especially loved the bulgogi and the spicy pork! Be sure to check in to get the free ice cream sandwich!
Happy hour 3-6pm...pitcher of Sapporo $8.50, beef toro $4, bulgogi $4, & free ice cream macaroon with Yelp check-in...this place ROCKS!!!
I get take out from here atleast once a month and the food is always fresh and amazing..always tastes the same which I love. Pretty big portions too.

everything from the food to the service was AMAZING! definitely a better alternative to ayce bbq. 

my boyfriend and I ordered a lot of food but our favorites were the pork belly and the Korean prime kalbi. the complimentary sides were so yummy too, I would be ok just eating that! haha

all in all, this place is great. I would definitely come again

We came during happy hour, and surprisingly, there wasn't a long line. We ordered beef toro, pork belly, fried calamari, and daengjang jigae (soybean paste soup). I don't recommend the beef toro because the tough texture. However, the quality of the pork belly was pleasing since it had minimal fat in it. Also, fried calamari was wonderful! The sauce that came with the calamari was very delicious! Lastly, the daengjang jigae was tasty. TBH you can never go wrong with daengjang jigae lol 

I would honestly give this rating a 3 star, but a particular waiter bumped it up to a 4 star. I definitely have to give a shoutout to Joseph! There was a waitress who seemed annoyed and very impatient with us from the start, but luckily, we had a change in service halfway through our meal. Joseph was nice and actually cared about the customers! Thanks again for your kind gestures! We really appreciated it! :)

Best Korean food in Las Vegas.  Great prices during.  happy hour.

Going to be my new must eat at stop for future Vegas trips.
This was so much fun.  We came with another couple,  got a couple of things from the happy hour menu and then got the Las Vegas for 4. We were so full but it was all great we will be back!
Amazing service from our waitress/hostess Kristan!! The quality of food is great and for a reasonable price. It is worth the wait!!
They have great lunch specials. The spicy pork is delicious and grilling your own  meat is easy. Will return again!
Really good place, it's like tapas style, lots of options and lots of sides. Very good place for Korean bbq. And the price was not bad at all, especially during happy hour deals

One review for free desert! So why not lol~~~ happy hour after 10, and you can order a lot of good meat on the menu! We had pork belly, spicy pork, Korean chicken and mushroom. Gotta add a lettuce wrap for pork belly! love the steamed egg.

Food is phenomenal.  Reminds me of past visits to Korea.   I'd highly recommend this to anyone visiting Las Vegas.  Staff was courteous and very helpful.   You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Sooo loved!! From the ambiance to the food..def be back. It had a fun atmosphere/feel to it. Music vids playing while ESPN highlights (for the bf) played! And the food was amazing. Got the paradise meal and it came with everything..appetizers, soup, rice (bulgogie rice was super good), and meats & veggies! Can't wait to go back!!
If you love Korean BBQ, this is the place! Huge portions and great variety. Don't forgot to leave room for the ice cream macarons!

Excellent Korean BBQ!  

In fact, the best I've ever had--and I've had quite a bit all over the US and Asia.  First off, the location is convenient and not too far off the strip right across from the Hard Rock Hotel.  

The strip mall. It's in is clean and the interior of the restaurant is modern and tastefully decorated--and again; CLEAN.  It is open until 1 am and we arrived about 11:45 pm.  Although it was late and near closing, we still received excellent and friendly service without ever feeling like being rushed.

We ordered the most popular meal package: The Gangnam which came with a variety of meat cuts and marinades, rice bimibap and assorted dishes like Kim chee and what have you.  They also brought out fresh oysters as well as steamed mushrooms.  Again, everything was super fresh and absolutely delicious!

Highly recommended!
The quality of the meats here is amazing! I have been here three times and each time I enjoyed the meat lovers combo. There was plenty of food and I definitely left satisfied!
Really good food :-).  The food is authentic and very good. I ordered the spicy yuke jang and it really is spicy! I want to come back and try the soon doo boo chigae.

Seriously, one of the best Asian BBQ houses I've ever been to! Wonderful staff, extremely knowledgable, and honestly a valuable steal of a happy hour menu. I ate like a king on a working man's budget IN VEGAS. Think about that for a second  Get here now and leave those other places alone. My recommendation: The Korean Bulgogi is thinly sliced, perfectly seasoned and you get to cook it YOURSELF for only $4. Can cook and burn water? No problem...your wait staff will help you out. 

This definitely receives 10 BGLS (black girl lip smacks) for me

We came here after reading the reviews and it was amazing! The place is clean. Service was good and quick. But most of all, the food was so flavorful!!! You've got to try this place! Amazing food with a huge menu which we can't wait to try next time.

Service was great and we were glad we can early on. Saturday as the place started to fill up.

Definitely recommended and now a favorite going forward when in Vegas!

Stopped by here during an airport layover. We had 2 orders of kalbi as an appetizer...a little pricey but delicious.  Frank was our server and kept up with all of our particulars. Very good service. I had the Dumpling Soup...enough for 2 people.  My wife had the Basic Bip Bim Bop: lotsa food and again, delicious. The chicken salad had fabulous dressing.  And the Bilgogi Bim Bim Bap had only meat and no veggies...FYI.  Basics:  Clean and friendly.  Restrooms even have hot water.  This is our new Korean restaurant in Vegas...a great lunch.
My first time here, everything was very good. The rib eye steak with uni melts in your mouth. We will definitely come back. I give it 5 stars, very very satisfied!

This was my first time at a Korean bbq restaurant. So I'm new to what portions to expect and this was my only complaint. It was about 8.95 for 1/4 lb of meat to cook for yourself. We got three orders of meat, an appetizer of wontons, and some veggie fried rice. Taste wise everything was excellent. I just left a little hungry. Now the service was more than excellent and I can't think of more attentive and friendly service at any other restaurant I've been to. Great atmosphere. I will definitely go again.

Hello, meats! 

- Menu was straight to the point and the bundled offers made it easy to make a decision.
- Quick Uber from the strip! 
- At the time (January 2017), their check-in offer via Yelp was for a free ice cream macaroon...oh.so.good.
Solid cuts of meat. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you are near Hard Rock you should stop in here. Group tables and a small bar area.
Super good! I celebrated my birthday here.  we got a free macaroon. Just go to help and post some pictures and you'll get a free one!
This was my 1st Korean bbq experience and I really enjoyed it! The jalapeno poppers were delish and loved the macaroon ice cream sandwich! Definitely want to come back and try some other menu items.
Atmosphere is amazing. They had a Korean pop music video playing in the background. Korean pancake and original bibambap were amazing. Waiter was cheeky and funny. 5 stars

Great food ,, great atmosphere and I love that they let you take the food home ! I am from California and the bbq places I have been to never let you take the food home so that is a plus in my book! The 2 for 45 package could actually feed 3 people ,, it's a lot of food they give you! Very nice staff and very good service
Excellent choice a few blocks from the strip. Spicy Tofu Soup is my fave at every Korean restaurant and it was exceptional here!! In town from Pearland Texas :)
Great foods and services!!! The capacious is amazingly delicious! My daughter loves the lemon sauce!
The BBQ is yummy, and the soup is delicious. BTW the waiter and waitress are friendly. I'll definitely come again.

This place is one if not the best in Vegas. My friends and I had the following: Kalbi steak, garlic steak, shrimp and calamari -  all very good. The sides we chose were: seafood pancake, tempura, spicy tuna Kim bap, edamame & chap-chae - all wonderful except the tempura was average. They have macaroon ice cream sandwich which were fresh & yummy 
They also had other desserts that most Korean restaurants typically don't have. 
We will definitely be coming back here.

Very Good best Bbq in town I order the meat lover substitute spicy pork with garlic shrimp I also order asparagus with bacon so good and salmon jalape√±o popper definitely recommend this place service was also good

This Korean barbecue spot is a good place to satisfy carniverous cravings, if you can find parking. On weekends their lot can get pretty busy but, the hunt for a parking spot is worth it once you start grilling. My favorite item is the spicy pork. Leave it on the grill to get it extra crispy. Those charred edges give it a wonderfully crunchy texture to go with a moderately spicy profile. The prime kalbi was my second favorite. I loved the sweetness of the marinade that paired nicely with the natural savoriness of the marbled meat. Other items tried included tender chunks of filet, four decent sized garlic shrimp, and assorted vegetables (corn, mushrooms, peppers, onions, zucchini, and more). Portions run a little small, so it's best to order two or three items per person.

With a clean, intimate, dark interior it's great for casual date nights or just hanging out with friends or family. Tables are spaced rather far apart giving all plenty of privacy.
We totally love this place. People care a lot about the food there making and it shows

The best asian bbq we've ever tasted. Tried the korean prime kalbi and steamed eggs both two thumbs up. Our bbq inclusive of side dishes that were too yummy. My husband said the best cream cheese wonton he ever tasted.

the boyfriend and i got the runaround in the downtown vegas restaurants and the one we really wanted to go to after reviewing options was closed for a private event and after walking around everywhere and checking other places out (overpriced, not what we wanted) we were starving and annoyed.  We were in the mood for kbbq and this place was barely a cab ride away.  

we had to wait so, SO long for a table.  Our fault - last minute planning, saturday night, super busy.  They aren't exactly set up for people waiting but got us drinks (yuzu soju was CRAZY good and so was the ginger soju cooler if not a little sweet).  We waited forever.  and ever.  and ever.  

The we finally sat and ate the best freaking korean bbq ever.  The pickles, the appetizers (spicy tuna kimbap) totally unnecessary but SO tasty.  We got the meat lover package deal and it did not disappoint.  Everything was amazing - pork belly, bulgogi, we were FIGHTING over the last pieces of spicy pork.  Just so crazy good.  It took hours but we were so stuffed and happy and barely rolled ourselves back to the hotel.  Totally recommend.

MUST MUST MUST FOR KBBQ! I was with four girls (and we can EAT) and we shared the Gangnam. It was a lot, it was able to be taken to go and it fed us again. The meats were not overly salty, very fresh. Kimchi was fantastic. My favorite part was the bimbimbap. The staff was all weirdly attractive and very accommodating. Best KBBQ place I've ever had.

Amazing.
The food was delicious and service was awesome. Ordered the premium deal for 4 people and the portions were very generous. Had way more than enough to go around. The meat were marinated to perfection and ready in a matter of a few minutes. Amazing. Amazing. Amazing! To top it off we were there during happy hour and paid $8.50 for a pitcher of sapporo draft. All in all, great food and service. Thanks for a great experience.

That squid side dish is amazing. I could eat it over rice as a whole meal. The spicy pork was very tasty, and the happy hour specials were legit. We got the green apple soju cooler and it hit the spot. The end.
Amazing food. The kobe beef is so marbled and the banchan are perfect. They have teokbokki which i'm obsessed with. Perfect dinner!
Good food, quality meats. It would be awesome if they had all you can eat KBBQ because we don't really have that in the Las Vegas Valley.

So, I genuinely enjoy korean bbq. I don't go often, but when I do, 9/10 I enjoy it. So now, this restaurant had good food. The meat was good, the pricing wasn't too bad for the quality, and they had a lot of options. Why I give this restaurant a 3 star is because of their service. Honestly, if their food was bad too, I would have given it a 1 star, but it wasn't so thank god. It wasn't all the servers, but this one korean server with glasses and kinda tall. God, he destroyed my groups experience. His demeanor was terrible, and he kept talking about extra charges, instead of just bringing us the extra bowl of rice like we asked. He even forgot about it after we ordered it. I really wanted to come back and like this place, but unless they fix that guys attitude, this place is going to lose a lot of customers

One word....OVERHYPE

Saw all the extraordinary yelp reviews made me super hype. What a big let down.

We had a party of 5. Arrived 7pm. Place was pack. We got on the waiting list. 2 other partys ahead. Got seated 30 mins later. 

Went ahead and order the Gangnam package for 4. $120. Spicy tofu soup $9.95. The server took our drink orders. 3 waters and 2 thai tea. Waters came out first. Thai tea came out late. When the thai tea came out with was in the smallest cup I ever seen served thai tea and it was just okay. Anyways the raw meats, sides and such came all different times. The server just drop off the mear to us and didn't help us throw the meat on the grill. All self service I guess. 

Service was bad. I clearly needed water refill badly. Empty cup on the edge of table. Servers walking past me over and over. I had to flagged one down to get a refill. Also we ask for extra rice and received it at the end. Everything seem rush. We ask for to go boxes and the server even forgot about that. 

We never got refills on the complimentary side dishes like other koream bbq spots. Their side dishes were good tho. As well as the meats we ordered. But the service totally killed it. Never again I'll go to this spot

Overhype. Overpriced. Just head down to other korean bbq in chinatown.
Food was delicious at a great price. I'm from NYC and the food was way better than NY Korean bbq

If you like Korean BBQ you will certainly appreciate this place. What I like about Gangnam is that it's not only Korean but also Japanese and Chinese as well. They feature a wide variety of items. I luv the duck breast here!! It is amazing! I have to get it every time. Service is quick, we had a small issue here one time but the staff was very quick to fix it, which I appreciate. Very good happy hour menu as well!
Good food. Just wish there was an all you can eat. Great for happy hour 3-4 dollars per meat.
I think this is one of the best Korean BBQ spots. Granted it's not All You Can eat. This place is all about quality. They best brisket out there. Quality over quantity.

5 stars 5 stars.  This place was delicious.  They have a nice grill in the middle to grill some yummy meat and tons of sides.  Everything we tried was good and large portions.  If I lived in vegas I would come here every Sunday and eat like a pig!

We ate there late last night, around 12.15am. The food was good for the price we paid. The host was nice. The only complaint we had was our server's attitude. He was not friendly at all. He didn't smile, greet us at all, he only took our order, as if he was doing us a favor. He never apologized when he forgot to bring sugar for my tea. His response to that was just "oh yeah." He never checked if our table was ok, or even come by to refill our water or tea. Other servers  who delivered some of the dishes were way friendly and nicer.
Good price for what you get in Las Vegas, the atmosphere is nice and the stuffs are nice.
Saturday night & we beat the crowd so we were seated right away. Fast service. Great food in a great atmosphere. Bulgogi bibimbap is BOMB!
We waited for a while to get a table but it was all worth it. Waiters are very attentive, good meat selection, everything was tasty. Will definitely come back for more.
We love this place we came here for 6 ppl first time and server were so helpful! I came back for the second time! Price are reasonable !
The kalbi & bulgogi were as good as any I had during the year I lived in Seoul, Korea
Ive been in vegas for 5 years..by far the best k bbq spot in sin city!so satisfying.....the gangnam portion is soooo bomb!great atmosphere and great employees...thank u
It is good place to eat Korean BBQ. It could be expensive if you order the better meat, but it is very delicious, I will be back again soon.
Food was great, but service lacked. They did not explain anything, and this was my first time to a Korean bbq. Still recommend.

So I picked this place on our weekend getaway with the family. This place didn't make any fake reviews after dining here.  Our server Andrew was awesome! It didn't take long for us to be served. He explained the menu clearly. Kids loved the food. Complimentary side of squid was pretty tasty. I just wish they had the rice paper available. All in all it was a nice dining experience.
Food was amazing!! Service was out of this world. Atmosphere was very relaxing. My company was not too shabby too! :) Really... This is a must do in Vegas.

I would rate this place higher but the service was so bad.  

Our server came by once to take our order and  again after we were done eating.  

In between, we sat with empty plates of meat and needing to order more.  Our water glass was empty and our banchans were empty.  We tried to get several servers' attention and they all ignored us.  They stood around most of the time and avoided eye contact.  There was only one other server there, a girl who ended up getting all of our orders promptly. 

We put in our egg order with 1 male server.  It was over 40 minutes and we still didn't get the egg.  We had to remind them again and they said it would take another 10 minutes.  By that time, we were done eating.

The meat is good.  The banchans are okay.  
I would not return due to the terrible service, not worth it.

Good for Vegas , wish they had Pori-cha and rice paper. Jap Che was oily - waitress was super cool and took care of it. Pa - chan decent. Still a little hungry , meat size could be bigger. Kalbi was great , loved the tuna appetizer , over all good experience. Skip the macaroon deserts

Mmmm. Very filling & delicious meal before Day 2 of EDC! My group had 5 people, and surprisingly... a 4 person set was almost too much food! Very awesome selection of meats + sides. Highly recommended. :)

Chose this Korean BBQ based on the review as our first meal in Las Vegas. Damn good.  Fair price, high quality meat and good service. And I love the music of Jpark kk. We have tried Gyu-kak uin Chicago several times. I have to say these two are pretty similar. However you can't have a good meal in Gyu-kaku with this price. 
Recommendation:
1) meat: prime kalbi ; pork belly; beef toro
2) all sides are good
3) seaweed salad and miso soup
4) bibim nangmyun 
5) Tteokbokki (my fav)
Japche seems good too, maybe try next time. 
In words, you must try this. Love it.
Great food! Like being in Seoul!  The meat was juicy and flavorful.  They're was plenty of food, too!

We came in during happy hour and tried salmon jalape√±o poppers and seafood pancake appetizers.  The poppers were awesome!! The pancakes were good.  Be sure to have the shrimp along with the bulgogi it was the our fave of the beef.  We also had the toro and kalbi.  Happy hour prices are definitely worth the trip!

I'm a believer. This place was just perfect. Incredible meats, great appetizers, and a delicious dessert. And an awesome server. All in, this was a great down to earth place to spend my dinner in Vegas.
Such good food! Ive been craving it everyday since we ate here! And if you check in you get a free dessert! I wish we had this in Utah!
Hate to write the review the first time visit but this place is outstanding. Food taste delicious. We love the spicy tofu soup and the bbq is awesome. Waiter are nice.

Hello, Yelpers, 

I've only gone for the lunch special (crazy-good deal). I love the Bulgogi! It's a decent amount of food for what you're paying for.

I picked up my friend from the airport and we were pretty hungry. He wanted korean bbq so we chose the place closest to us, which was gangnam kbbq.  This isn't an ayce kbbq place, but i was pretty full from the amount of food that we ordered. 

We ordered the 2 person kbbq set, which came with 5 cuts of meat, oysters, corn, grilled mushrooms, unlimited banchan, and bulgolgi bibimbap. 

The service here is really friendly and welcoming. They help you to cut your meat and cook it if you want.  I prefer my meat to barely touch the grill so i prefer cooking my meat myself. 

The cuts were on the smaller side, so if you have a huge appetite or are super hungry you should probabaly order more.  I really liked the side salad they had, the dressing was really refreshing and light.  The bulgolgi bibimbap was too sweet for me, and i dont think i would order it again . 

Good place to come,  if you are near the strip /airport, otherwise there are alot more affordable ayce kbbq places in vegas.

Very ordinary with enormous amounts of food for those looking for a budget and who want variety. It caters to a non-Asian/non-Korean crowd who are beginners to Korean BBQ. We had the "Gangnam Special" for two that could have easily fed four. Too long of a wait for an average restaurant. If you're willing to travel away from the strip a little further you will find more authentic, nicer Korean BBQ restaurants. The service was nice and very quick. I would have given it a 2.5 if they had half stars because it's friendly and clean.
Very fun cooking over the grill. Loved the zucchini grilled. Kalbe also excellent, as well as brisket.
We ordered the meat lovers for 2 people. Tons of food for a great price. Great restaurant off of the busy strip. The service is great and very helpful.

We came during Happy Hour but ordered some regular items as well.  The fried happy hour items were terrible and greasy, like they were cooked an hour ago.  The Kal bi, brisket and bulgogi is still our favorite but there wasn't anything really special.  We get this kind of fare all over LA and Orange county in CA.  This still beats eating on the overpriced strip hotels.
Decent atmosphere, reasonable price and great meat! This will be a great place to escape from "expensive" buffet in strip. :p

I have been here twice, and will definitely be back.  Best K-BBQ I've had.

Everthing has such great flavor, and is a really fun night out with friends or family.

See ya next time!
Food was good except the curled meat in the photo. It was supposed to be beef but tasted like pork that was in the freezer too long. This was the set menu called Las Vegas

This place is my girlfriend's and I favorite Korean BBQ spot in town right now. Everytht we have is always delicious! . The way the meat is prepared is on point. I really like the large tables even for a party of two. The staff is incredibly helpful and always checking in on us. 
Only downside is that the price can be a little high.

All around 5 stars

Service was timely and accommodating. Especially when it came time for the check even with a full dining room. Nothing ruins my meal more than a laggy check. A plus plus. 

Food is a decent price for the variety and quality of meats, appetizers and sides. No all you can eat. But I definitely left full and satisfied with what I paid for. I feel like you can't go wrong with anything you choose. But something def worth mentioning are the desserts. The green tea cheesecake is fire. I would also suggest getting the yuzu sorbet to accompany it. 

Haven't been for happy hour yet. But totally seems worth it based on my experience with dinner.

This place is not on the strip. It's about a 6 minute drive and hidden in the corner next to the foot spa. I'm an out of towner from Dallas, Tx and we have our fair share of Korean barbecue places. But this place has a meat selection very different from the ones back home. They have Kobe meat (super soft and melts in your mouth), scallops, and even duck breast. The meat here is so much more succulent, flavorful, and different from the regular short ribs and brisket.  

My boyfriend and I got the premium meats and it was really worth it! It comes with appetizers like the tuna poke, oysters, miso soup, and beef carpaccio. The oysters were good but left a weird aftertaste. The beef carpaccio was a little on the sour side and the tuna poke was super fresh. This deal also comes with the  best cut meats in the restaurant. The table will be full of your regular Korean BBQ sides like kimchi, bean sprouts, and fish cake. When they bring the meats, it may seem like a small portion but it's actually really filling for 2 people. I really appreciate that their presentation of the meats are sliced and placed carefully on decorated plates as opposed to the meats back home are slapped onto a dingy plate and cut in front of you with scissors. 

The only thing I don't like is that they don't give you advice on how to cook the meats like the Kobe beef. Service here is quick and polite. We were seated within 2 minutes and food came out in 10 minutes.

Great place for cusine BBQ
Fresh meats awesome atmosphere and more than enough helpful service.

Oppa..  Every time we come here it is an excellent experience.  The cuts are mastered perfect.  I learned to appreciate tongue here, not talking about making out either.  The pork belly  is fatteningly addicting.  Although theres no AYCE we have tried almost every tier of the menu.  Service is quick and pleasant and really makes dining here enjoyable.  As far as Korean bbq goes they all have the same basic ingredients.  The way it is done here makes us keep returning.  Just the way it is served and the intricacy of the cuts pertaining to the grain of the meat.  Also the Japanese fusion appetizers are good as well.  Sometimes in life you learn quality over quantity.
The flavor is never less than amazing great job! Ask for Dillan when you come in great service!

Non-stop k-pop baby... If you're into that kind of thing. Despite being Asian, I happen to not like it, but I am mesmerized by it very much the same way sirens draws in weary sailors lost at sea. 

That's literally all I can remember, while Ryan recalls some deliciousness that fails to stick in my mind. I have the impression that the food isn't bad and very reasonably priced. I would go back again.
Been here a couple times now and I have never left disappointed. Great selection and good quality meat with a cold beer to wash it down makes this gal very happy!
The food and service are great, but not a completely authentic Korean experience. Would have liked to see the Korean food names on the menu.
First time eating Korean bbq and I have to say it was delicious. The meat was marinated very well.

Open late and away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Two thumbs up for late night happy hour. Lots of choices & really good quality meat. They also have soup, bibimbap, appetizer, and vegetable choices. 

Try: 

Meat items: harami miso, rib eye, beef bulgogi, spicy pork, toro beef, & bacon wrapped scallops! 

Appetizers: poke, spicy tuna kimbap


The servers are all really friendly & accommodating. We were the only party there around 11pm but it worked out since our party had 15 people.

Well you know, I had great things to say about this place but I find out today that they're dishonest! I just reviewed my credit card statement and see that they added more to the tip amount I gave them. Apparently they want more tips, so they just add to the charge slip - even though I clearly wrote in the tip amount and accurately added the tip to the total bill due.

So people, beware of this activity here. Keep your receipts and check your credit card statements. I do this diligently every month, so this is how I identify fraud. I have contacted American Express about this fraudulent charge.
Food is always delicious! I always leave stuffed and content. Not to mention service is always wonderful. Thanks again!

This place is amazing. So much to choose from and everything was delicious. The noodles and the marinated kalbi was my favorite. The staff was super friendly and I'll definitely be coming back. Btw try the banana tempura and the strawberry macaroon!
Visiting from SF Bay Area and the food was delicious. Enjoyed from the Happy Hour menu, as well as the regular menu. Staff was great & accommodating.

The food is amazing at this place, coupled with courteous and fast service. The portions are large and you can have as much side dishes refill as you would like. If you check in on yelp, you even get a free ice cream dessert.
Thought that I wouldn't find anything cause I'm a vegetarian,  but  there was plenty of choices. The food was amazing.
This place is the bomb! Very good prices and good customer service. Not to mention they have good Thai Tea! Come here and eat if you can!
Fantastic food, good service and an amazing ambience! Especially love having music videos to view while dining. Chicken with cheese fondue is a must try!!
Good service, nice portions.. but honestly, the meat isn't the best. It's ok.. just not top notch.

Amazing experience at this place.  The service was great. I found this place by looking for great happy hour spots. They have a late happy hour with great deals. This was first time at a Korean Japanese bbq. The idea of cooking my own food at a restaurant may not appeal to everyone but i loved it. The prices at happy hour was low enough to be able to try a little bit of everything.  After they tske your order. They turn on the grills amd bring out an assortment of sauces and sides....most of which i had no idea what they were but they were good.  We ordered broccoli , chicken cheese fondue, bulgogi, pork belly, spicy chicken, shrimp. Everything was delicious and fun. I can't wait until a place like this comes to my town.  Great food, great time.

Probably 4.5 stars food-wise, but we fell into this place because it was late-night, and the happy hour prices were hard to beat.  My girlfriend had never had Korean BBQ so we got the basic proteins.  The help wanted us out of there, but snobby service is expected.
Best Korean bbq I've had! We got one of the platters while staying in Vegas and picked up an order to go on our way home.
We came here immediately after landing at the airport. The food was phenomenal. I'd highly recommend the chicken karaage, seafood pancake, and chigae. All were so flavorful and delicious!

Awesome food !!! We swung by during their late night happy hours, the food was delicious! Great flavor and absolutely worth every penny. The happy hours were extremely easy on the wallet for a Korean bbq and lots to chose from!

Do try their Matcha Green Tea ice cream sandwich, highly recommend it. 

TIP: Since the happy hour menu seemed cheap, we ended up over ordering ! Their portion sizes are pretty good.
This place has a great atmosphere.  Our server is very nice. We ordered the vegas combo.  The food is great!
I enjoyed this place a lot. Lots of great sides and good quality food we went during happy hour and I enjoyed the kalbi the most

It took me a while to come around and this is specifically a review for their happy hour. The rating makes sense. Especially compared to gyu Kaku, their lunch deal is great but gangnam happy hour is better. And I like that their meats actually come unmarinated. The portion sizes are large for a single person and they actually include the side dishes. So if you somehow are making a choice between here happy hour and gyu Kaku lunch, pick here. Geography might make that a bit of a challenge though.

Freaking amazing food and great prices !!!! Fast service, they don't make you wait incredibly long like other Korean BBQ places. I always come during happy hour and always satisfied. Two of us is no more than 25$  great places for dates or just hanging out 

Happy hour is from 10 pm to closing everyday I believe and if you check in you can get a free macaroon

Arrived in Vegas around 8-9 PM so we decided to come here since it was open late. Started out with Spicy Tuna Kimbap which was pretty tasty. If you never had it before it was just tempura fried sushi rolled topped with spicy tuna. We also had the fried calamari, I thought their tempura batter was one of the best I've had in a long time. We didn't pick any of their packages since there were some items we did not want. We had prime Kalbi (decent but I've had much better in KC and LA), pork belly, beef Toro, Tongue, and mushroom medley (this comes out cooked already for you). All in all the service was excellent, food was great but I think we had better in LA and Kansas City. I thought the best cut of meats was way better in Kansas City. Maybe the mid-west have better cuts of meat??? Since we got there after 10 PM it was happy hour so a lot of our items were priced lower than usual so that was a big plus. We both had all the food for about $40. For the price and great service,  I would still recommend this place and I would come back again soon.

Food is great. When i visited the place it was busy night at Gangnam restaurant. If you are coming during the dinner time you might want to check the waiting time. Another way to look at it, people really love the food at here. You wont regret it. If this is first time of trying Korean food make sure you ask your server. All the servers were really nice.
Excellent meat marination and portions. We had 2 meat BBQ's between two of us. Recommend the Korean prime kalbi and spicy lemon chicken

Efficient is how id describe this place. The service was competent and friendly. 

The food was fresh and delicious.  I did tapas style and never looked back!!

Definitely a good spot for lunch. The garlic calimari was awesome!

This is one of the better korean bbq restaurant in las vegas.  I would give this a 3.5 stars based on all the korean bbq ive tried. We ordered the premium beef combo and added a bunch of meat. The kobe style beef was pretty good, and over all marinations in general was decent.  If your in vegas I would go here over the other ones
Food was really good. Me and my friend ordered the meat lover set and we loved everything on the set. Great service too. If you are in Las Vegas I highly recommend this place.
Best korean bbq in town!!! 6 stars if possible. Large portions, reasonable price, friendly people. Highly recommended!!!!!
This is our first time here, and the people here are really nice. The small dishes and the dipping sauce are super good
Delicious! Did the Gangman for 2. With Bimbibap and marinated meats. All the meats were tender, delicious.

Solid BBQ experience, but has some serious flaws which, if fixed, could make this resraraunt truly great. When we had the attention of a server, our service was excellent. However that attention was hard to come by and many staff appeared distracted by the Olympics. We ordered the premium for four, which was certainly enough food for five people. The beef carpacio was stand out, and some of the meats for the grill were excellent, but it seemed like the quality of some of the marinated meats was a bit low, and careful chewing was required. The flavor, overall, was excellent, and for what we got, the price was very reasonable. Would recommend.
Great BBQ dining experience. I highly recommend this place. The food and service was awesome.

Maybe it's because I'm use to Dallas Korean bbq restaurants. But this one is pretty good, I think it's funny they charge for dipping sauce, but hustling is the name of the game in any business. I would go back again if I was in Vegas.

The food was great! The quality of meat was beyond expectation even in lower end meat.
Our server Dong-gi fantastic, very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely recommended

Amazing food, neat atmosphere and fantastic service. Unfortunently the prices are expensive, but i guess thats to be expected in vegas so no fault of the resturant. The 2 person meals could of easily fed 3, and maybe even 4. The service was amazing and helpful, and very quick. I was very impressed by how quickly they turned a table around.

Excellent customer service. The place is super busy, but the staff is amazing at keeping up with the speed and getting things moving. Everyone is nice, friendly, and helpful! Huge portion. Maybe it's a west coast thing, but you get so much food for the price that you pay. Best Korean BBQ I've had so far. Come with an empty stomach; otherwise, you'll be walking away with some to-go boxes. The group options are great. They come with a bunch of starters, sides, and several different kinds of meat. 

Also - If you check in using Yelp, you also get a free macaron ice cream. I had the coffee flavor and it was good. Tried the green tea one and it was just decent. 

Highly recommend this place!
Good food.  Long wait though. Comfy seating inside as it is not crowded.  Meat was good quality.

Excellent food, the meal for two can actually feed four.
We WILL return next time in Vegas.

Came here one time with my friends that is in town from NY. Was not very impressed with the food here. There are a few other places in town that is def better. The restaurant is a lil run down and the tables and chairs seem a lil sticky
Awesome food, great selection of meats. Second time here and I plan to come every time we visit Vegas!

this place has the best bulgogi I've had since I was stationed in Korea.  The staff was super nice to me and the family since this was our first time and we had to use forks..lol  We will be back for the food and the waitstaff.  Thanks

I've been to Vegas many many times in the last 5 years and never knew about this place. It's off the strip but only about 1.2 mi away (26 min walk). We made it just in time for Happy Hour and was surprised how good their HH menu was. 50% off appetizers/meat/beer/soju/sale! We ordered so much food for two and only spent about half of what we would've back home in San Jose!! 

The food quality was really good and the service was even better. Everyone was super friendly and very attentive. Someone came around every few mins to see if we needed anything. They didn't try to rush us out even though there were people waiting to eat. This was probably the best experience/service/quality I had for Korean bbq in a long time.
Authentic Korean BBQ. I do recommend this place for anyone who loves Korean food. We have tried the original Bimbimbap; it is really good.

It's my first time dine here, and I am not familiar with the food and how's the serving . A good place to dine in  if you love  to chit-chat with a friend while you  grill your own bbq. It's pretty cool. Foods are in small portion and price is cheaper. 

I gave three stars  because of their  restroom,toilet papers are all over the floor and their trash can was full. They should check the restroom and keep it clean since it is restaurant.
Best meat NA. Faker ain't got shit on this place. Happy hour deals are really really awesomely good. Will come back again.

Came here on Saturday for happy hour, there were a lot of people waiting for a seat.  The hostess was nice and honoured our happy hour even though we got seated a little after six.  They were accommodating which made our party very happy. 

We ordered and tried all the dishes on the happy hour. The beef Toro and pork belly were one of our favourite.  The fondue cheese was interesting to dip the meat in. 

I liked how we each had our own individual sauces, 3 different type.  One was like a pretty ponzu, one was like a teriyaki, and another a spicy teriyaki. 

We tried the premium prime Kalbi and it was really tender.  We had to order another plate so we could each get another bite. 

The waiters are friendly and always around to take orders. 

And best of all, for being a great yelper and doing a review, we got a free macaron.
This was my first experience with Korean bbq.  I cant imagine it getting much better.  I definitely recommend the toro.

Late lunch/ early dinner on a Saturday. Excellent quality, fast service, good prices. What's not to like?  Enjoyed the Meat Lover combination. Next time will likely order BBQ meat items a la carte as I definitely had favorites here. Did Yelp Check-in for free ice cream sandwich dessert. Will definitely come back.

We order Gangnam meat combo for two. So much delicious food and dessert!!! BBQ here is great!  Meat tender and flavor, great start to our Las Vegas vacation.   Ugh, i will be daydreaming about this meal as we hike Death Valley!

Oysters fresh, mushroom tender, and squid so QQ tender

Will definitely recommend this!

Fast service and great atmosphere. We had more than 8 with us and we got a room to ourselves. Food choices were of a great range. The top picks include A5 kobe. So good. Must do and prices aren't bad.

Pretty good.

Pros:
Food quality is pretty good. We got the meat lovers amongst four and it was filling. Service was good but a bit disjointed.

Cons:
Background music is terrible quality. Extremely distorted. The value for the food is not good. High prices for the atmosphere. Finally, they give you a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp. I'm not sure I like this since this inflates the reviews.
Best Korean bbq in town, highly recommended,very friendly service, will definitely come back again
the food was so delicious... our servers was cute and really nice.... I been going to all you can eat restaurant and you can taste the different with their meats... I will be back soon
Food was great. Very tasty, especially the meat dishes. However, some of the waiters were not polite to answer the guests asks. I was ignored 3 times, and I had to ask another waitor.
The ramen here is delicious and the atmosphere is good. Really enjoy eating here. I really hope I could live here. Only cons might be food is a little small in quantity

I came with my roommates for my birthday. I love the decor and selection of food on the menu. There was 3 of us and we ordered the meatlover package, it was plenty of food for us! The quality of meat was excellent and and the side dishes were delicious. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu!
Service was fast and friendly. Our waters were never dry. Food tastes great for a good price. This place is a must try if you like Korean bbq.

Ordered the gangnam combo for 2, and it was amazing! Great variety and great cuts of meat. Couldn't even finish it all in one sitting. Appetizers were also plentiful in terms of variety and even got free refills from one of the awesome waiters.

Great food, great service, I highly recommend this place!
Great place, good food and beer. Took my girl here and she enjoyed it as much as I did.

Lots of options! They have sooooo many different types of meat and veggie dishes that you can grill up.

I came with a large party and 5 of us shared the Meal for 6 which proved to be more food than we could eat. Others at the table ordered a meat plate with a side of rice and it was sufficient and well priced. 
The wait staff was very nice and I enjoyed the atmosphere and casual demeanor.

I recommend this restraint right off the strip.

Not AYCE but definitely delicious. Gangnam offers a great lunch special which was the perfect portion to finish cooking and eating within my hour lunch break.

The two of us both opted-in for the lunch special:
One with bulgogi and the other with pork belly. The lunch special also came with rice & a soup or salad, and an appetizer (I got the edamame) We also agreed on an ala carte order of the Korean Prime Kalbi.

All 3 meats were delicious. The Korean Prime Kalbi was definitely my favorite. The meat was marinated perfectly and turned out to be juicy & tender when cooked. The bulgogi & pork belly were good too, especially with the variation if dipping sauces.

This is the perfect little KBBQ spot for those who are pressed on time or simply do not want an AYCE menu.
This place is Awesome! Love the kalbi and the bulgogi. The staff are always checkin if everthing is good.. I would definitely come back.
Perfect food was delicious. Best Korean BBQ I've had!!! Like the pictures we finished everything

Went there last night, it was delicious! Few things I'd recommend staying away from that were pretty boring - the calamari, shrimp, asparagus, and pork belly just did nothing for me. However, the bulgogi and bibimbap were straight up amazing.  If you get the bibimbap don't order a side of rice, you don't need it.
Really great atmosphere, music, location, customer service, but best of all.... The food is spectacular!
I dont like coming to Las Vegas but when I have to go for work, I always look forward to eating here!! Such amazing Korean bbq and sides!! They give A LOT of food, so I suggest you bring an appetite!
It's sooo good here! Great flavor and great service honestly has to be the best KBBQ in Las Vegas

So so service
Good food but poor service....
Wine was not great and they only had one type of soju.
Would probably not come back again gor sub par food and service.

Check this place, it's so much fun grilling your beef at the table.

Very friendly staff and everything tasted greaat!

The service was really good and fast. The staff was friendly. We ordered the beef tongue, toro beef, pork belly, spicy tuna kimbap, and the seafood pancake and they were all pretty good. We had a good amount of sides compared to other Korean restaurants. I would come eat here again when I'm back in Vegas.
Amazing food and great service!   Enjoyed Korean prime rib kalbi.   A must try if you are in the Las Vegas area.

My family loved this place and we've definitely been around top-rated places in San Diego, Tokyo and Bangkok. This was the first bbq place that had duck breast and it was so fresh and flavorful. My parents were especially fans of the kalbi but I stuck with the half-priced brisket out of my ayce habits. Come during happy hour and they have good deals on drinks, appetizers and meats. Service was a little slow and we had to remind them of our order a couple times but it was probably because we were seated in a corner in the back. Nevertheless, this was one of our favorite meals in Vegas.

I loved it here....

I was staying across the street at Hardrock and wandered over....being a huge Yaki Niku fan I figured it was worth a try....I realized right away they were not Japanese but that's not important these days...the quality of the meat was good and the service was amazing...

I asked the waiter for atsukan....and he had no idea...so I told him it means hot sake...I was in one of those moods....I did send back a few pieces of the tongue they sent me, however the chef then replaced my tongue order and in addition made me another chefs special dish on the house....my friend and I left full of wagyu beef....happy...and maybe $60 lighter....which is a deal, given we were drinking...
Arguably the best Korean BBQ I've ever eaten!! Amazing food and great service, would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys Asian style bbq meals.

Probably one of the best Korean BBQ places in town . We paid about $80 dollars for 2 people and that's including desert . The meat was amazingly tasty and so was the rice . It's up there with habeak . I would for sure go back !

What a find.  We Yelped a place to eat near our hotel but we wanted something off the strip.  We found this Asian BBQ place and it was not only a lot of fun, it was great food.  Everything was fresh, tasty and well put together.  The wait staff was very helpful and quick on request.  If we come back to Vegas, we will be back.  Oh, and make sure you order one of their ice cream sandwiches, the were a true delight!

Went here on a whim because of the number of reviews. We had the Meat Lovers for 2 people, very good! You also get free dessert for giving a Yelp review! 

Went here for a 2nd time and they have reverse happy hour 11pm-1am. 2 meats per person comes with sides
Wonderful! Even the sides are delicious! They have happy hour from 3-6pm and it's total deals(:

I've been here twice; it was absolutely amazing both times. The second time I had to drag my friends along as they were dead-set on staying on the strip and eating overpriced food in a snooty environment. They were grumbling through the ordering process, but once they got their Soju and the food started arriving, they were all instantly converted! We had a fantastic experience - such a wonderful restaurant!

So I live on LA which has a lot korean bbq places but when I visit my friends in vegas we always go to gangnam which to me is the best korean bbq in veags. You don't have to wait long for a table and food is spectacular. If your in vegas you gotta eat at gangnam.

Good food. Completely made me ignore my diet plan. Have to get kids gym membership now as now the whole family has become morbidly obese after just 1 and a half hours due to the the godly amount of beef ordered. Can i has my snack now

So my wife and I come to this place all the time. It's by far the best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. The happy hour is awesome with 1/2 price drinks. The Korean Prime Kalbi and Flat Iron Garlic are faves. We love the dumplings (ask for them fried) in the spicy sauce. 

The service is friendly, the food is awesome. 

Be prepared to wait if you come at dinner time on Friday and Saturday. If you are still reading this review I will fill you in on a trick. Instead of waiting with the plebes in the waiting area, go sit at the bar and have a drink and appetizer. They encourage it.

Phenomenal. We got the premium meat package and it's a bunch of food. I will be coming back again for sure. I think I'm going to watch some videos on how to cook each thing and which things go with what but even with no knowledge everything was easy and paired well together.

While in Vegas for a conference I checked Yelp to find something delicious in the neighborhood and ended up here.

We came during happy hour and tried a variety of meats and appetizers.  Most of them were excellent with the harami miso being my favorite.  The happy hour prices were great.

I had never been an Asian BBQ before and it was a fun experience.  The racist in me noticed the place was filled mostly with what looked like Asian people so that was a good sign.

Great place, yummy food, nice atmosphere. Kids really liked it, plenty of food - the macaron ice cream made it a 5 star for the kids xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Really great service and high quality meats. Came here with 2 gfs and we were so full that we didn't eat the dumplings. The miso soup was a bit salty but I was surprised to see that there was quite a few small tofu pieces. Other places usually don't have tofu in their miso soup. 

We ordered the meat lovers ($55.95) which is supposed to be good for 2 people. It came with 6 different meats. I wasn't a huge fan of the bulgogi but the filet was amazing. It literally melted in my mouth! If I come back, I'll just order the filet. 

Side dishes were ok, nothing special. I wish they gave radish slices instead of tiny pieces of radish though.
Food was awesome, service was very attentive! Great late night dining spot too.  Get the Kobe beef!

One of the better restaurants I've been to, they actually have skirt steak, which is down right delicious and the best thing on the menu. And I'm an extremely picky eater. Bulgogi is also pretty good with a similar taste. Great choice, very fresh!
This place has one of the flamest happy hours in Vegas. Drinks and food are SUPER cheap with pretty decent quality. Great place to go before a night out.

We went to this place for a dinner at Thanksgiving time. The environment is nice and the food is very tasty, the waiters and waitresses are super friendly. My kids loves the ice-cream cookies. I would definitely visit it next time when I go to LV.

Pros:
   Easy parking
   Good service
   Usually no wait
   Soju beer and wine
   Good meats
   Nice smaller portion plates and lesser prices
   Nice ventilation

Cons:
   None
The food was amazing as well as the customer service. The wait was so worth it. I'd come back everyday if I could!

I stopped by this restaurant on the way to the airport. I was concerned that my clothes would later notify my entire plane that I ate KBBQ for dinner, but I was surprised to leave odorless! They take their ventilation fans here seriously, people. I even saw a guy standing on the chairs to wipe fans down after people left.

Anyways, we got Gangnam Style for four people at an affordable price ($120), which included tender meats and a plethora of side dishes. Service was impressively rapid; all the food was out within ten minutes after ordering. As for taste, maybe my expectations were too high, but I wasn't blown away by anything in particular. For me, this Americanized, trendy style of Korean BBQ is less satisfying than the AYCE style Korean BBQ places I can find in California. Their playlist was also a strange mix of kpop and American pop/rnb.

Bottom Line: I left with a full belly and a free macaron for checking in on Yelp, but I don't expect to be back anytime soon.

Friendly staffs, nice interior, good atmosphere but not the best bang for a buck. Decent place though. 

P.S.
Steamed Kalbi is waaaaaaay tooooo salty and sweet.. Ask them if they could make it any less sodium and sweetness.
I came here for lunch today the food was very good the staff was very nice place is really clean and the price for lunch is very affordable
Glad we found an Asian food, needed a break from the food from the strip. Great food and service.
I used to come here years ago when it was Santoki...now it is even better!! The food was delicious and inventive!! This is my new favorite Korean BBQ and I will be back with all my peeps.

Was just driving from CA to CO and found this great place on Yelp!  Omg amazing and fun!  You get to cook your meat at the table, yummy dipping sauces and a bunch of side dishes to try.  
Thank you for a great experience!
Great experience. Love the Korean BBQ with all styles of beef. Great wait staff. Try the Soju & Sake!
Great service, delicious food. My nail salon expert recommended it, I am so glad he did. I will definitely recommend it to others

Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. The meats are top tier and the marinated meats in particular are where the money's at. Some may find them a tad on the sweet side but it's perfect for me. Come during happy hour to get some small discounts on a few choices such as pork belly, beef toro, and bulgolgi. Also half off drinks during this time so not too shabby. 

The one minor annoyance is the extra suecharges for what I would consider standard at most Korean BBQ joints such as lettuce and sesame oil but servers are nice and sometimes willing to just throw them in so it doesn't feel too bad :)

Check it out and enjoy!
This place was amazing! We ordered the premium meat choice for a group a 6! It's a lot of meat,  but well worth money! You won't be disappointed!

I really wanted to give this place five stars. They were very friendly and efficient. Even though it was busy they got us a table in under  15 minutes. We ordered? the Gangham Special which is their most popular combo. It had a bunch of different appetizers including miso soup and salad. Then they brought out a serious assortment of choice meats and each was delicious in their own way. We didn't want it to end. However, the next morning we all had gurgle guts to varying degrees. My tummy was just a bit upset but another guy spent the morning in the little boys room. Seeing as how we were the ones cooking our own meat maybe we had no one to blame but ourselves. Or maybe the meat wasn't as fresh as it appeared. The world may never know.

We all liked that it closed late. We tried the corn, beef bulgogi, beef tongue, beef Korean prime rib, mushroom they were all very good. The calamari, fried chicken, and chicken fondue was ehh ok.

The servers were all very nice. The atmosphere was very inviting. Very clean and loved the music videos that was playing in the background.

It is off strip, but some of Vegas best foods are off strip. =)

Best Korean BBQ I've had in Vegas. The meat is well marinated and juicy. We had the Korean Prime Kalbi and it's awesome. We ordered a la carte as we like to have the Kalbi and with 5 type of meat, we came up cheaper than the package they offer. Mainly due to we don't like to have seaweed salad, dumpling and house salad. That's $10 savings there that can go toward the premium meat. We forgot to check in to get the free ice cream. Still regret till now.

We've been wanting to try this place for a long time already.we set our expectations pretty high due to all the great reviews we've seen and they didn't disappoint us at all! The food was amazing, the meat cuts were of good quality, they offered various foods it's not just your basic Korean bbq place.
They have this hot sauce that will numb your mouth but still gives your meat that right amount of spicy to kick it up a notch.
Spicy tuna bimbap is a must.  Kalbi is excellent.  Meat was tender and the flavors are all good.

After being told our wait would be around 30 minutes.. and then waiting almost 90.. my party of 8 was not happy with Gangnam Asian.  Really felt they could have handled the wait better.

However.. this was nearly forgotten when we started to EAT.  Wow.. the food was sincerely incredible.  Next level KBBQ.  Amazing.

Would have 100% been a 5 star review if they hadn't been so poor at estimating our wait time.  Avoid busy times like weekend evenings, but get here because the food is incredible.

4 stars.
The food here was amazing! The waiter was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this spot!

Korean BBQ at its finest! Me and my boyfriend came for a late valentines dinner, first thing is it is a beautiful atmosphere defintley romantic and intimate not overbearing like most places. We ordered the meat lovers and because It was happy hour we got a pitcher of beer for 8.50! Stealll! The quality of food here was amazing I felt at it was all top quality ! For two people and 56.00 you get a ton of food that you won't be able to finish! I love this place and I will b coming back with more people this is my new favorite spot! Spot on service and spot on food!

Coming from Hawaii... We hVe so many yakiniku places in our state but since we are sick of eating breakfast American food and buffets. We need to try something new and we found this place. Oh boy it was Amazing!!! Everything taste super good!! I am surprise of how good it is. All the meats is flavorful and delicious. We went on Christmas Day and they made all my family members super happy. My brother and sister are picky with there food. The wait was a little long because they are pack but the food is worth it.
Great place to eat. Had happy hour and dishes were definitely affordable. Just wish rice was free.

This is my very first Yelp review.  Yes, I found a restaurant bad enough to inspire me to write a review.  
We were drawn to this restaurant because of all of the positive reviews on Yelp.  I was surprised by the volume of reviews for such a small restaurant.  Because of this, I had high expectations for my meal and was extremely  disappointed.  The food was terrible and low quality.  Luckily, the food was so bad we only ate a small portion of the meal.  Yes, we were lucky because we returned home to stomach pains.
So how does the restaurant get so many good reviews? Each table has a sign that says you will get a free desert if you show your Yelp review to a server.  No, I did not get a free desert for writing this.  If the quality of their desserts matches the quality of the meal, I have no interest in trying anything else from the menu.  
I am writing this review from the comfort of my own home where I am recovering from my dinner and wishing that I had spent my money elsewhere.

Our first time try GangNam asian bbq . For all the meat and soup are delicious. We ordered spicy tuna for recommended starter, for the meat we had bacon scallops, pork toro ,spicy squid , beef tongue,beef toro . They are fresh and tasty . And all the side dish are good too .
Marinated beef Kalbi is delicious , flavorful, and tender. Must order this! Green tea maroon ice cream sandwich is very good.

We just finished the Gangnam special. WOW finished it all it was great and worth the wait.

We will be back for sure.
We came in and were seated right away. Everyone was nice and very helpful. It was my first time eating here and I enjoyed it. Very great food!! Great service! Fun environment!

They have a huge selection of
Appetizers! It's not all you can eat but they do have combinations so you don't have to order the meat individually. Overall, we really enjoyed our experience! Definitely recommend :)
Great spot in Vegas! Not too expensive and you get a ton of food! Service was superb!
The food is pretty good and the waiters and waitresses are pretty nice too! The price isn't  pricy! It is really worth it to go!

Loved this place! I was hesitant for years because it opened shortly after that Gangnam Style song came out, but moved to this side of town and I didn't want to go to Chinatown for Korean BBQ. This isn't all you can eat, but it's actually a lot more fun ordering and you get to be a little more selective. We ordered the spicy karaage, Kabocha squash tempura and the shishito peppers as appetizers. All delicious, especially the squash. We had reservations so all the complimentary side dishes were arranged around the grill upon arrival. For the grill we ordered two orders each of the scallops with bacon, bulgogi, harami miso, and Kalbi, along with an order of corn. We had five people in our party and we didn't finish it all, but got pretty close! It's a really fun experience and it doesn't feel as rushed or impersonal as other places. The decor is also really nice and it doesn't feel like your typical all you can eat/buffet place. Loved it and will definitely be back
Wow great food! Great price and good service! We had a spice tuna dish that was to die for.

4.5 for over all! 
Tasty meat great quality and huge quantities! Service was very good. Highly recommended!
too expensive and the portions are too small food was good though

I came here because I saw the high reviews on Yelp. I can be honest that the food was good but the service is just not good. We came in at 11:40 on a Sunday. We waited till 12:15 and our food finally arrived. Then, I asked for more side dishes to every server. They didn't bring refill of side dishes till the end of the meal.
