It was not pleasant experience. I liked the tall male server who took our order in the beginning. The rest of the ladies are idk. And the restaurant itself if u guys know you guys will be busy. Then it should be well prepared before opening. It was ridiculous how long we had to wait for uncooked food and we walked in when it opened.

The experience is probably heightened because of the crazy wait time. We showed up as a party of three at 4 in the afternoon and still had to wait over an hour to be seated. The experience is fairly authentic but the amount of food for the price is wanting. The side dishes are also underwhelming. The deokbokki was perfectly al dente though, and the kalbi was also super tender. The food comes out fairly quickly and the staff was very pleasant. The bill came out to be about $35 a person. However,  compared to other korean BBQ places I've been to for the same price the offering tends toward measly.

I have been coming here since its opening.  The food has always been awesome.  I have only ever had the beef for two so I cant speak to the pork.  The tea is very tasty and the sides are very well assembled and displayed.  The service has always been wanting.  I think it is hard to find experienced help in this area.  The head on shrimp cooked at the end of the meal is a real finisher.  I will be back.

This is the best Korean BBQ I've ever had. AMAZING. If you're in Vegas, do it. We got the Gangnam combo for 6 people and it fed 7 of us (4 girls and 3 guys.) Make sure you make it to this place. Just Uber/Lyft your butt over here!
Great food, great customer service. Alex took care of us. He was fast with everything always checking on our status. The environment of the restaurant was awesome! Will be going back soon!!
Brought here as a treat for our team holiday and I am already planning multiple repeat trips

We went out for a late dinner after our show. Eating a lot of meat at 9 pm did not sound too appealing so we ordered the Las Vegas set, which comes with the least amount of meat. I can't believe how much food we were served. This was supposed to be for 2 people, but even with the 3 of us we couldn't finish all of it.

This restaurant is very very efficient. We were asked if we wanted to be seated at the bar. We said yes and all of the sides and food were being handed to us at the speed of light. The only thing they didn't do is feed us so that we could get out sooner. I appreciate fast and efficient service!

I loved their spicy chicken and regular chicken!! The chicken was delicious and perfectly cooked. My friends worked on eating the beef. The restaurant gave us freshly made miso which was light and refreshing. I am so used to eating the crappy instant miso. This use of real miso paste was a welcome touch. Their sides are good, but nothing to write home about.

The amount of food and decent quality definitely justified the $45 cost.
This place is amazing!!!  I have never had Korean bbq before and they explained everything and was super helpful, and we got a free ice cream macaron for checking in!  Soooo good.
Man oh man! So good! So much great food for the price! Only down fall is it's a small establishment, so when there is a waiting list, you waaaiiittttt. But it's so worth it!
Awesome bbq. Very good spicy pork is the best. The service is great. The spicy chicken is very good too. Five stars

Very good cook at the table Korean BBQ. Meats were very flavorful and generous portions. Busy place so make a reservation. Service was nice but it does get busy at times. They were also very good about switching out the cooking grill so you always get a fresh one and not keep using a burnt one.

Our first Korean BBQ meal in Vegas, found it in Yelp rated almost five star. The place looks very clean, and the waitress is so nice! We ordered beef tongue, pork belly and other meat. The meat tasted awesome!!!!
Very unique cuts of meat. Top your typical Korean BBQ. We got the gangnam combo and it was delicious. Highly recommended
Very good food and great service!  A little bit pricy but worth the money.

I love this place! It is absolutely delicious and you get so much food. The meat lovers for 4 can really feed about 5 people. Everything from the miso soup to the seaweed salad was amazing! When you check in you get a free macaron ice cream that's super yummy. Our server was friendly as well.

Great location for Korean BBQ. It's not an all you can eat place but the portions are relatively large. I went with 3 other girls and we split a 2 portion meat lover option and got an appetizer per person. This was more than enough food!
My favorite place in Las Vegas. I really like the spicy seafood noodle. Yummy! A great place for friends and families. Definitely come again!

This place is good, but not great. Decor is beautiful. Big red tables for all your many dishes to come, however the grill itself is not the best like gyu-kaku because the meat we were grilling kept sticking on, even if you brushed oil on grill. We had to change grill twice and we didn't even cook a lot of meat. 

*SERVICE WAS GREAT, FRIENDLY STAFF 

Gangnam is Korean with some Japanese flavors. Located next to "get nailed" nail salon. Open til 1am! Bring all your friends. Food was average, kind of lacking in flavor. Our bibimbap that comes with the combo took forever to come out, we really wanted to enjoy it with our meats. I wish the beef brisket was sliced thin. We just the "LAS VEGAS" combo for 2 people. I love how they give you the korean side dishes (banchan) especially the cuttlefish!  

I couldn't wait to try it, now I did, and now I'll move on. I'll stick to my gyu-kaku and tofu hut. It wasn't bad, it was like I said average. Great to bring out of town guest. 

Oh btw don't forget to review here so you can get complimentary dessert! That was nice!

I told a friend of mine that I wanted to have my birthday celebration here. They give plenty of food but it's hard to flag down service when you need something. We had a party of 8. I'm also used to the servers giving tips and helping you cook at times. This was more of a 100% own and if you need help, like I said, you have to catch eye contact with one of the waiters that are standing around. I've had better Asian BBQ experiences in town.
Service was great! We ordered course for two and there were lots of food enough for two ppl. Meat quality was alright but bulgogi? And one of the steak was tender and delicious! Overall loved it! :)
We got the Gangnam meal and it was so worth! Meat was great and they were generous on the portions.

I came here for dinner due to missing home cooked food during a vacation in Las vegas. The service compared to New York wasn't great. We had to cook our own meat, and the fact that we heard the waiters talking about tips in the background was getting annoying. The side dishes were sort of blend, but the meat quality was better than new york.

Traveling from MD for climbing. Stopped after a day of climbing in Joshua Tree. Arrived around 9pm on a Friday. Waited about 15 minutes. Three of us, two males and one female, ordered meat lovers for 2 people and it was plenty of food!! The food came out really fast!

Soo worth leaving the strip. 

This was beyond my wildest meat dreams. We got the gangnam special (for 2). delicious af and perfect amount of food. Wish i lived in vegas i would become a regular here.
Great food and great atmosphere and ambiance. Server Andrew is friendly and on top of things. A must place to try.
We came here on New Years and he wait was oretty long but understandable. Amazing kimchi jjigae. Seriously perfectly balanced. Great Galbi. Sam gyup was alright. Overall everything was good.

Loved it.  We came with a group of business associates after a trade show.  We were starving and wanted plenty of food. 
This place gets rave reviews from me because it's not in the strip (so very easy to get to), as its in a strip mall.

This place is the real deal, you self-cook your meats on your hibachi table and eat it as it comes off the grill. 

We chose a meat lovers dinner for 2 which featured bulkogi, kalbi(ribs), thin sliced ribeye, pork belly(unsmoked bacon) and spicy pork. 

This also came with 10 side dishes, rice and 2 kinds of salad. SO MUCH FOOD!!

This place is as good as value as you'll find in Las Vegas.  Strongly recommend!!!

What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said? It was amazing and even the Korean BBQ virgins with us were very happy with their meals.

We got there right before 6:30pm and were seated fairly quickly. It's inside a shopping center that is a little difficult to see from the road. They had K pop playing on one of the walls from the projector which is always fun to watch. Service was good and very attentive.

The only thing that sucks is some of the items that usually come as part of the BBQ is charged a la carte here - like the sea salt and sesame oil dip. They charge $1 a pop for it. Not expensive but a little annoying. The drinks here were all really good and SO REFRESHING. I swear, they've made the best lychee martinis I've ever had and I wish I had their recipe. It was that good!

Down to the food - nearly all of it was nothing short of amazing. We ordered the Meat Lover's BBQ for 4 which was $99. Not a bad price for all you get. The meats were all flavorful and marinaded well. The pork belly was the only thing that could have been better - it was not as thick as some of the other places I've been. I also ordered the seafood soft tofu soup which was good but not the greatest. I still enjoyed it. 

I'm in Vegas about once a year and when I come back, I'm definitely going back!
Great food. Unfortunately no all you can eat option, but the happy hour plates are super reasonable :)

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. No matter you are in the middle of exploring the west or staying for the games, it's a perfect place to have an authentic retreat close to strip while avoiding the crowd and lines. Lucky locals to have this.
Best love is short rib!
Excellent service way above par. Enjoyed the premium kalbi. Bulgolgi was also great. Happy hour saki is da bomb.
Good service! Very attentive servers! Good quality cuts of meat.. definitely will come again when in Vegas !
Food is really good and prices are decent but boy that service is awful.  If you don't mind bad service as in forgetting things you ordered than this is good place.  But good is good and reasonable.

Awesome authetic Korean food with great price! Definitely coming back again.

Side dishes were a portion. 

I like how bbq has no minimum order given its so cheap per order.

This is my 3rd time being here and I plan to keep coming back. The meat here is prime, the sake is to die for. And the food is top. The prices are right, and it's fun! You cook it yourself on a BBQ in the middle of your table. I love this place

If you're in Vegas and you're looking for KBBQ, you ABSOLUTELY MUST come eat here! This is the best KBBQ I've ever eaten. Literally everything was really, really good. 

We ordered the Gangnam to split between 4, and subbed the miso soup for the kimchi chigae for no extra charge. It was enough food to provide us another meal. I really appreciated that the meats were fresh, had their own flavor, and were not overly salty. Food highlights/must haves: kimchi and bibimbap. 

Staff here are super nice and accommodating!
great Korean style bbq in Las Vegas?great beef with sauce and side dishes. Steamed egg is perfect! But the digging sources are a little bit salty.
Very good meat quality and side dishes. Also, they gave us a lot of food for good prices. The Kobe ssam is very interesting and a must-try.
We ordered combo meat lover, portion were generous, enough for three people. Food were so goood. Will come back if we were in Vegas.
Loved everything we ordered from the BBQ meats (harami, kalbi, spicy pork) to the appetizers (seafood pancakes, poki, tempura). Great atmosphere too!

Lunch special is an amazing price for the quality and quantity of food. bbqing the food was super entertaining. The Harami miso and spicy pork were tender, delicious, and marinated to perfection. Very friendly staff. Would definitely recommend!
This place is by far the best Korean in the LV area we've tried. The customer service is great. The atmosphere is very welcoming. The food is great, very flavorful.

Was a lovely surprise when they seated us 15 minutes after we arrived (on Christmas at 6pm!) with a party of 8 people. We ordered a bunch of plates at first and ordered more once we were done. The banchan tasted really good and the meats were good quality! We ordered two corn cheeses and they were to die forrr!! Didn't order rice cuz it was extra and didn't really end up needing it anyways. We kinda wished there was free salad to balance all the meats. Great service and great food. Would go back!

I haven't been able to try the food due to the overwhelming long line of 90 plus minute wait time.   Just not worth the wait in Vegas!  1 star for the long wait.  I would give it no star but that's not an option.

Off the strip, but worth the trip! So delicious! Our group ordered the gangnam share plate for two and it was more than enough for our party of four, along with a great happy hour appetizers (chicken and cheese plate was fantastic). Service was great, and food was yummy. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!
Great food! Very clean, and stylish restaurant. It's very spacious.  Not over priced. And you get appetizers! Highly recommend anyone who loves Asian food to stop by.
Great Korean bbq! So much fun on my dads birthday! Great selection of meat and lots of sides. Love the cheese dip! We will be back again. Lots of food for two people.
Had no idea what was in store when we came here. Pleasantly surprised at one of the coolest restaurants I've ever been to! Good food & amazing service
Really great selection and fun atmosphere, they have a projector playing K Pop and America pop music that keeps it interesting! Food is great
This was an awesome find for something other than the Vegas strip! I love Korean BBQ and this won't disappoint you.  Try the marinated meats they are tasty.

The absolute BEST KBBQ PLACE IVE EVER BEEN TOO!!! I'm so sad because I live in the Bay and now I will always want Gangnam!! I will have to come back every time I go to Vegas. 

*super clean, cute decor with music videos playing on a projector 
*friendly waitresses: explained the menu, refilled water without asking, took away empty plates promptly
*THE FOOD WAS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. SEASONED DELICIOUSLY. The meat was so flavorful & didn't need any extra sauce, vegis, or seasoning. Absolute perfection!!!

Gangnam BBQ, come to the Bay Area please please please!!
The food is amazing,and service is awesome! We ordered the best seller combo and the food are very enough for two person.

This place was recommended to us by our Airbnb host and I'm so glad we followed up and went! We went at 5pm on Sunday, so during happy and whoa was that an awesome surprise when we got the bill. We got three meats, sides, two rice, two veggies and an appetizer all for under $25 (not including tip). The meat was marinated and had plenty of flavor. The rice was a heaping portion. Our broccoli came ore cooked and a little burnt but whatever. Overall, food was great, staff attentive and we left with our bellies and wallets full.
Very clean atmosphere and clean food. Very pleased with the service and the food. My fianc√©e and I will definitely will be back.

Okay. So this place is pretty awesome ! 
You order what you want to eat , and pay only for that. The best thing is that it's not AYCE & whatever is left overs you can take home. 
The Korean prime Kalbi is so good! A must try. 
We also likes enoki with  bacon!

Our waitress was also very sweet, she even charged my phone for me. 

The sauces , you get three. And they all were great! 

Despite the menu saying you have to pay for the salt sauce, it's complimentary. 

Ill update more once this food coma passes!
Cook your own BBQ.  Options of 45, 55, 65 for 2 with preset menu or pick your own.  Amazing

Ok so this place was AMAZING. We did a preplanned meal (meat lovers) and were blown away!! There's tons of delicious appetizers and the meat. Omg THE MEAT was so so good. Music/atmosphere was nice. Good for a date or with friends. Only reason I didn't give 5 starts is because the service wasn't great. The waiter never properly greeted us and was super short with us whenever he did speak.

Lets start with the NOT SO GREAT.  Our server was terrible.  We came around 1pm for a late lunch, and the restaurant was full, so he asked us to have a seat in the waiting area.  It was a short wait, and about 2 minutes go by.  We hear someone yelling from across the restaurant to us, telling us to please be seated.  It was the original person that told us to have a seat in the waiting area......and he motioned his arm, with his palm up, towards the open table that had just been cleaned and set for 2.  I thought this was really rude that he couldn't even walk over (about 7 steps) and actually bring us over to our table.  We order, and my eyes are always bigger than my stomach, and he starts to tell me I have quite a bit of food, and that I can always order more if needed.  Nice of him to do that, since I don't know how big the portions are.  Our side dishes come out, then the uncooked meat comes out.  We start grilling, but he doesn't bring us anything else -- no rice, no salad, no appetizers.  Finally someone else brings the salad and our order of Jap Chae but no rice.  I'm a a Chinese dude that needs my rice, so to sit there with cooked meat that is getting cold is starting to add to my frustration with their lack of service (or common sense).  We get our rice, and then we have to remind them that they still have not brought our iced water.  So someone runs back there and gets our water and and appetizer and puts it down on the table.  We finally have everything we are supposed to get, and can now eat, but now, I'm really annoyed at how terrible the service has been.  In addition, the table next to me had to constantly ask the wait staff for stuff, as if they were brand new waiters or something.   I mean simple stuff like refill waters, bring extra napkins if the existing ones are completely dirty, etc.  Its not rocket science.  But about 5-6 times during lunch the next table had to ask for this simple stuff.  

Food:  Everything we ordered was really good.  In fact if service was half decent I would have even said the food was fantastic, but its really hard to enjoy a meal if you are pissed off at how shitty the service was.  One mistake is ok.....2 is forgivable, but it was like they were PURPOSELY trying to do a shitty job.  

We ordered the lunch special which came with white rice and either 1 or  2 Proteins -- we chose the Spicy Pork and Bulgogi.  Both were good.
I did the Jap Chae and 2 "a la carte" proteins -- Kobe Style and Korean Prime Kalbi (marinated).  Kobe was SUPER tender and just a great piece of meat.  Prime Kalbi was also a hit.  Sides were great, especially the pickled cucumbers and fish cake.   

After we finished our lunch, we realized that NO ONE had even checked up on us once during the entire meal.  Yes, they came to drop off new plates and take away empty ones, but not once did anyone say "How is everything going?" or "Do you need anything else?"  In fact, the only thing that was ever said to me was "Are you all done grilling?  If yes, I can turn off the grill."  I actually wanted to say "Everything was great, thanks for asking" just to be a smart ass, but I decided against it.  And then the next question was "Are you ready for your tab?"  I mean the waiter seriously didn't even offer us dessert, or anything else for that matter.  It brought me right back to being annoyed again, and I even debated not tipping them anything, but being a former restaurant worker, I always leave money because I know that a big portion of their pay comes from tips.  But geez man, it felt like you were intentionally working really hard to be this shitty, and it sure didnt feel like you deserved a tip, but you got one anyway.

In the end , the food is great, but just come with the expectation that your service will be somewhere between TERRIBLE and NON-EXISTENT and you will enjoy yourselves.  5 stars for the food and 2 stars for the service, so that's a total of 7.  Divide by 2 and you get 3.5.  I rounded up to 4.  You have been warned.....

I have found one of my new favourite spots in my travels! Holy cow. Great food, barring the asparagus yet the bar I've raised the asparagus to is super high. The asparagus I grill at home is crisp, tasty and fresh. In other words, it cannot be beat and I look for restaurants to come close. The asparagus was good but not great. However the rest of the food exceeded expectations. The service was OUTSTANDING! The servers work as a team and quietly came to pick up plates, bring food and stopped in often without interrupting my dinner. I can't say enough about what a great experience this was. Of note, I'm headed to the airport and was in and out within the hour. Great food, great service. I'll be back. PS. The prices are excellent. Reasonable and well worth every penny!

My husband and I were excited to try Korean BBQ during our recent trip to Vegas so we chose Gangnam over some other choices because of the plentiful and rave reviews. We did not have to wait, which was a plus, and we were given a large array of different sides (banchan) that we started sampling right away. We ordered way too much meat for just the two of us, but before we could even try to get our fill of the BBQ, we both started to feel nausea and stomach pain. We asked for our food to-go but never got around to eating it back at the hotel. We crawled into our hotel bed and slept away the pain. We never figured out what could have set off our stomach troubles. Our experience could have been a fluke and it should not be a reason to avoid visiting. The service was friendly and there seemed to be a lot of other happy diners!
Nice place, excellent service. This is first time in town and try this place. We order love combo 55$ good due and good food.
It is always good to have Japanese bbq in town Las Vegas. Side dishes are delicious ! Beef is must try . Pork is very tasty
Amazing food and great service! The ice cream macaroons are the best!! Very friendly and they play a variety of music that everyone can enjoy
Great place! The employees are very hard working so that we could be comfortable. The food is delish!!

Got the bacon-wrapped scallop and marinated Kalbi.  Also, most reviewers haven't mentioned the sodas are bottomless for only $2.75.

You have the option to grill at your table or in the kitchen, but table side is definitely the way to go to control your level of done-ness (and I hope you are getting at least one beef dish at Korean bbq).

WE WERE SURPRISED

**2016 Yelp 100 Challenge #9**

The place was empty & we were seated right away.  They have a PRIVATE dining area as well.  The place looked clean but I was a bit EH because I looked up & the filtration grills looked absolutely DISGUSTINGLY dusty & oily.  To the point I was scared that the dust might fall into my food....  I used to work at a  ASIAN BBQ joint so it literally looked like they haven't cleaned it for a month.  =[ 

The service was quick & fast but definitely would say they could work on smiling a bit?  Ahahahah our server was AWSOME though cuz we also knew her from the sushi resteraunt that we love so much in north Vegas!  (The second time we went the service was definitely slower even though there was no one in the place...  Like asking for water and side dishes multiple time from different people before receiving.  So maybe need a little work on the employees). 

The quality of the meat was SURPRISINGLY good! They are a Korean joint but they have the concept kind of like Japanese BBQ in style of serving.  You get a whole bunch of side dishes like any Korean resteraunt & the side dishes aren't bad at all.  They were a good amount & good quality for the amount of money you pay I would say.  I can't really say the other dishes were that great as for the NORMAL palate....  I would have to say it is a bit on the SALTIER side...  But I LOVED IT.

PRIME GALBI $8.95 - just straight up melts in your damn mouth! 

HARAMI MISO $8.95 - this is out skirt steak & loved the extra miso flavor. 

GARLIC SHRIMP W/ HEAD $5.95 - what a steal. On the price I personally think for jumbo shrimp at only $6 bux & it is lightly seasoned w/ garlic. 

ENOKI W/BACON $4.95 - no difference but you do get a lot of enoki mushrooms which is great & you get 4 pieces. 

ASPARAGUS W/ BACON $4.95
KABOCHA SQUASH $2.95 

BROCCOLI $3.95 - this comes inside a foil already steamed for you to finish off on the grill to give a little char. 

PORK TORO $5.95 - ummmmm my FAVORITE part of the pork & you get it at pretty much a $1 a slice!  Where as most places I have been to it is $2 a slice 

SPICY TUNA KIMBAP $6.95 - this is literally see weed wrapped rice & then tempura battered.  It has the PERFECT chewy texture like mochi & then stopped off w/ spicy Mayo tuna! 

CHILI SPICY WINGS $6.95 - this is what typical Korean wings taste like & I love it. 

SPICY SOFT TOFU SOUP $9.95 - I absolutely CRAVE this damn soup....  I'm sure there is some crack in it...  & doesn't really taste like your typical Korean spicy soft tofu soup but I loved it!

Food was great, beer was cold and service was good. This was our first time here so I wish the servers made more effort to explain everything. We ordered meat lover for 6 people and it was a lot of food. We did not touch salads and did bot cook all of the meat so we probably would have done better with the meal for 4 and add as needed. Pork belly was the least favorite. In order of preference filet mignon, pork, brisket, skirt and toro. Miso soup was great and the appetizers gave you the chance to try lots of different things. I will definitely be back the next time I am in Vegas.

I haven't been this satisfied with Asian BBQ before!
I've been to Sura BBQ and Tofu hut, but they don't even compare to Gangnam. Sura is too pricey and I am a little taken back by how they place the raw meat outside.

Anywhoo, Gangnam was a nice alternate to that, since they serve you your food like Tofu Hut. However the quality of the meat is far tastier. Everything that I had was delicious! 

We ordered the beef belly, BACON WRAPPED SCALLOPS, spicy garlic edamame, fried chicken karrage and the banana tempura with ice cream. This is definitely one of the rare occasions where i can honestly say i loved every bite. The service was phenomenal and we came during happy hour. They also have a Robata special after 10pm, must try!

The proportions were excellent and presentation was beautiful. (Especially the beef belly and banana tempura)

The exterior of the restaurant does not give it justice to the inside because i was pleasantly surprised by how pretty it was in there, and I did not expect a place like that to be so close to UNLV. 

The ambiance is appropriate for all types of parties from romantic to large parties. (:

I will definitely return & try the whole menu!

One of the best restaurants I have ever been to in my life. The waiters and waitresses are all very nice. The food is reasonable and worth the price. There is absolutely nothing that I regreted ordering. The interior design is very welcoming, traditional and the lights slightly dimmed. There is a proper waiting room and people are not just wandering around outside. 
This restaurant will definitely be one of my go to' s whenever I visit Las Vegas. I am very upset with myself for not discovering this place earlier.

Nothing special.. i ordered duck, brisket, pork and some dishes. Side dishes was good but meat wasn't fresh. brisket was too thick and tough duck was like chicken breast. I maybe come back for side dishes but not a bbq.

I can't say anything bad about this place. Went here two days in a row for their lunch special it was so good. Their Bulgogi is marinated perfectly. The staff is so friendly, make you feel welcome and that they appreciate your business. The number of great reviews on here is completely justified

The food was fantastic! We went in during happy hour and left with a full belly. The prices were reasonable compared to other Korean BBQ restaurants. I could really see and taste the quality of the meats. Everything from the appetizers to the entrees we ordered was pleasant. 
The waitress was very friendly and attentive.
Decent happy hour. Very good value. My favorite was the spicy chicken with lemon sauce. Complimentary sides are a bonus. Service is quick. I would come back.

Very satisfied!!!
Happy tummies
Great that it's open late. Portions were decent!
Didn't like that the mushrooms came late...

Will be back!
Great food, cool set up to grill up your own meal. Good lunch special, would definitely come here again!

When I go to a Korean barbecue place, I always go for all you can eat because I can get most of my money worth. Gangnam isn't all you can eat, but you are still getting your money worth.

Atmosphere is that of a high end restaurant. Dimly lit, fancy decorations, expensive looking grills, professional looking servers, & popularly hip music. What caught my attention the most was a projector showing music videos of not only well known recent English music, but they also have popular Korean groups also. I find myself dancing & singing along.

The servers are very helpful in recommending what to order. They're able to describe each dish or drink well enough to make a decision. They also give honest opinions on whether one thing is better than another thing.

The meats were served looking really fresh & presented really well on a plate. Of all the Korean barbecue places not one where I've seen the meat served already seasoned.

Not many Korean barbecue places I know have a Happy Hour or lunch special. This place has pretty good deals on their appetizers & meat. For the money you spend at all you can eat places, you'll have a better experience here compared to any other Korean barbecue place in Vegas. Drinks, meats, food, desserts - you can definitely taste the difference in quality & you can even make others jealous with a picture of a nice presentation too!

Took the lady and nana on a little trip for something new. We got in for happy hour and had us a feast. We had the toro, bulgogi, and pork belly; good meats to good eats was the call. We also tried the sweet corn, kabocha tempura, and cheese wontons. Overall, service and attention was to standard, and I will gladly come again.

Great service and great food. Good quality and selection of meats. A lot of different flavor profiles with a good selection of dipping sauces. Each well balanced and different enough to cover all bases. There's an acidic Yuzu based sauce, an sweet chili sauce, and a savory garlic sesame sauce. Fantastic all around.

So we were told that we have to wait for more than an hour when we arrived, but then it actually took only like 20 minutes to be seated. Side dishes are good:)
BBQ was awesome!!! Everything is wonderful..
It's a nice dinning spot! ;)
Amazing great food great atmosphere crappy service sometimes because I can't speak English
Really kind price and service. You can't complain about anything. Good for family, friends, and even lovers. Thank you. So much like it.
On my trip to Vegas on April 6th this place was next door to the hookah lounge we went to and decided to get some food here. The service was great. The food and pricing were amazing!!!

GANGNAM! My first time here and I'm counting the days til I get back here again... 

Happy hour fried Calamari and Bulgogi is BOMB. 

My spicy calamari was just right for my #preggocravings too.
The kalbi is so delicious, juicy, sweet, and tasty. I tried spicy seafood noodles, amount is enough, and seafood is fresh. I recommend this restaurant.

Service is a bit slow, but you just need to flag them down and they'll come to you. 

The food was good, fastly served. Located in a shopping center, it's small so you can miss it if you take the back way into the center.

I loved this place although, i have to say if you do not make reservatiom you will be waiting a very long time an hr or so but so worth the wait still rsvp!!! The hostess from the servers are running all over the place trying to mKe sure everyones doing great very attentive i was very impress with the hostess never in my life seen someone go over and above to do more than stand there!! Food is amazing def coming back.
Great Korean food!! A lot of variety and great service. Definitely coming back here the next time I'm in town!!!

A solid Korean BBQ near the Vegas Strip

TIP: In case you want 1 free dessert during your visit, you have to show a posted Yelp review to your server! Just SHOW it!

Location (4/5): The restaurant locates in a corner of a big plaza. Watch out for the big Gangnam sign! From the outside, the restaurant looks pretty dark but it becomes divey when you walk inside.

Services (5/5): We came at 7pm in a party of 7 and quickly get situated! Our server was very friendly. She was also quick at prepping for our BBQ and bringing out side dishes! Since we came in a large group, they also helped us to calculate 18% gratitude fee in the bill. 

Food (4/5): You have the choices of ordering individual dishes or order a set such as Las Vegas, Meat Lover, Gangnam (#1 bestseller) and Premium (best cuts). All sets come available for 2, 4 or 6 people with different prices. We ordered Meat Lover for 4 people for a party of 6 adults and 1 child. The portions were huge! It also came with complimentary side dishes, miso soups, rice bowls, salads and dumplings. It was more than enough for us! We also ordered the Kobe Beef Carpaccio ($9.95) and Salmon Carpaccio ($7.95). The Kobe beef was literally melting in my mouth! Soooooo sofffttt! The salmon, on the other hand, added a hint of freshness in a jungle of grilled meat! For dessert, we shared a vanilla macaron ice cream from Brick's! They have the macaron ice cream fridge right at the door, so give it a try if you need a togo dessert!  

I will definitely come back for more :)
Visiting from out of town and came upon this spot. Wish it was all you can eat but it was still pretty good. Pork belly and the seafood tofu soup was on point.

Outstanding, delicious Korean BBQ in Las Vegas!

Staff was friendly and accommodating to a group of 30 kids/adults, in town for a soccer tournament.  They were helpful, attentive and offered great suggestions for our food choices.

We loved the food...our favorites included:  filet mignon, marinated beef, side dishes and amazing dessert.  We enjoyed cooking at our own table and loved the entire experience!

Strongly recommend it for families, groups, etc.  

5-star Koren BBQ...worth a visit!

It's my first time here on Gangam and my family of four chose the "Gangnam" menu. And it is just amazing. Five types of marinated meat. Different side dishes. It was a fun experience. 

The Miso was a bit salty than expected but other than that, it will definitely fill you to the brim and it's much better than a buffet. I would definitely come back here! The place will not disappoint!!!!

We go to Vegas for memorial weekend and want to have some good food. This restaurant happen to be the first one showing, so we are excited to try this out.  

We arrive at around 5:30 pm and we are seated immediately.  We are party of five with 4 adults and 1 baby.  We ended up ordering the gangnam meat set.  Food is huge portion and very tasty, beef quality is excellent.  I never have that amount of meat in my life I would say.  Everyone is satisfied with the food they offered.  

I didn't give them five stars because I think their servers can do a better job in treating their customers.  I literally saw the girl roll her eyes in front of us when she takes our order.  

**They give you free dessert if you write a *good* review about their restaurant on Yelp**

With so many great places to eat in Vegas, Korean BBQ is like a comfort food when we're away from home. We had a table of 6 people and we're all from Denver. When I say this is the BEST Korean BBQ I've ever had, I'm not just pulling your leg. We ordered the Premium for 6 people and there was SO MUCH FOOD and it was all incredibly delicious! Unless you can eat a cow, you'll definitely be having a ton of left over food. You also get a free dessert if you check-in (one time use for first time check-in) and I suggest the green tea ice cream macaroon. We all agreed we'd be coming back to this restaurant whenever we visit Vegas. We're all wishing there was a place like this in Denver. Gangnam Korean BBQ is seriously killing the game.
Nice Korean BBQ in Las Vegas and everything on menu so good. And service very fast. I recommend for you If you wanna eat BBQ

We came here for my lovely gal's birthday dinner and I was overjoyed to learn that the place had a Japanese flair to their menu. And if anyone knows me, they know I have a sick addiction to edamame. Sick. This place didn't make that addiction any better whatsoever with their delicious garlic stuff, but it definitely hit the spot good. And that's just soybeans, I'm not even talking about the awesome meat! We chose the brisket, the filet mignon, the pork belly, just about anything and everything; all were delicious! All decently priced. They give you 3 different sauces to dip your protein in- there's like a ponzu tangy one, a house special one, and a spicier version of the house special- which I preferred- cause I loooove spicy. Only thing that was so-so for me was their steamed egg. It's one of my favorite things to eat when I go out to eat Korean BBQ and I was just a little disappointed considering everything else was so good. But if anything try some of their gyoza. Deeeeee freakin licious! Service was good and the room we got was pretty awesome. I'll be back for sure.

This is a very good hideout restaurant inside Vegas. The BBQ beef is awesome. Make sure you try the Korean Prime Kalbi. It is very good seasonging and tender. The Kimchi and fried squid on side dishes are perfect. It could be the best kimchi I have eaten in Korean Restaurants.

This is a paradise for meat lovers!   So many choice of meat and seafood and veggie to BBQ!  Everything is so well marinated and flavorful.  The two of us opted out of the set menu and chose our own selection of meat.  The spicy chicken and pork have a good kick of spices but not over-the-top spicy.  I especially recommended the Korean style prime and bulgogi....well seasoned and incredibly tender.  All the side dishes are delectable.  Come early!  We came at 6pm on Wednesday and we waited 40 mins!

This was my first time being at Gangnam. Had an awesome dinner with good company! Our host, Song, was very attentive to our party and extremely friendly. He came by often to help us cook our meat and made sure it didn't burn. I have to say considering the amount of food we ate, the meal was reasonably priced compared to other restaurants. We came during happy hour and ordered a la carte. We were given ban chan for ordering enough BBQ dishes - which were just okay; however, the BBQ and the rest of the tapas/appetizers were good quality and filling. Overall great dinner :)
Best bbq spot in Vegas, especially the deserts it's a must try if never been here before
Pants won't button after eating here. Get all the beef entrees, they are amazing. I loved the steamed egg, omg so good. The firecracker shrimp is not very good. Focus on the meat here.

This is a good restaurant!!!
Good staff and also delicious food!!!
It seems like real Korean food!
While I stayed in hard rock hotel, I went to here twice

Absolutely loved it here! We got the Gangnam combo for 2 people, and it was way more food than we could finish. It's like the amount of food you would feed 2 hungry men. The meats were tender and juicy, and the leftovers that we finished later that night tasted just as good, if not better. 

The service was excellent. Our food came within a blink of an eye. And the dishes just kept coming and coming. They definitely waste no time on keeping things running, since this place gets super busy.

This place reminds me of Gyu-kaku with the variety of appetizers they offer along with the different types of meat and seafood that you can order; even the layout of the menu is strikingly similar to Gyu. In terms of food, however, Gangnam is more Korean influenced, and the meat quality here is far better than Gyu's. They also provide banchan here, and the kimchi was really good! Kimchi Gangnam style!! 

My buddy and I ordered pork off the lunch set menu (looked like pork shoulder), and it was really chewy for me at first (even though it was fully cooked). But I started to enjoy the texture the more and more I ate it. It was better than the actual pork belly in my opinion. The beef toro was pretty good, and its cuts were thick. 

We also tried the chicken wings, steamed dumplings, and the spicy tuna kimbap. The chicken wings were tasty and flavorful. There was too much going on in the spicy tuna kimbap, and it was too sauce heavy. The steamed dumplings were just not very good, and even my buddy said that they tasted like packaged ones. 

Not sure if this place is worthy of their 4.5 star rating. I wasn't impressed by anything, but maybe I'll give it another shot if I'm in the area.

I wish I could find this place earlier. Compared to a lot overpriced restaurants on Strip. The food here is delicious with reasonable price.l though it is not all you can eat. The beef is tender the cut of beef tongue is a little thick but still good. The only real complaint is the veggie. I order the mushroom and asparagus but they are all ready to eat and they are cooked directly over fire. I would like to cook them by myself. Still it is a very nice place to visit. If you are not seeking for high-end dining experience on Strip yet still want some place better than Panda Express with reasonable price, this is the place you should visit.

Their kimchi complementary side dish was better than any other kbbq's. They serve a unique pickled cucumber that no other kbbq place serves. We ordered bulgolgi, prime koren kalbi, pork belly, spicy chicken with lemon sauce, spicy tuna, and kimchi pancakes. Everything was A1!! That lemon chicken hit the spot! And I've always wanted to try Korean pancakes, it was so worth it. Service was pretty good. This is the go to spot for Korean bbq in Vegas!!
Awesome food delicious for both their meat and veggie items that you put directly on the grill

fantastic !!!
i ate spicy tofu soup.
My GF ate spicy chicken with lemon sauce
Both taste very good.

I will definitely  come back this place again!!

We came during EDC weekend on a Sunday evening without a reservation and thought that we would have to wait long, but surprisingly, the wait was only about 15 minutes. 

We ordered a la carte because we wanted to try everything, and ended up getting mostly meat dishes. The meat dishes were good, but not as flavorful as I would have liked. However, they were still good. The beef carpaccio was AMAZING and highly suggested. The vegetable dishes were meh, and took forever to come. 

I like this place because of the value and the fact that the food was pretty good. Also, that it's an authentic Korean restaurant run by Korean people. The service was attentive and efficient. I recommend this place if you're looking to get your Korean bbq fix :)

One of the best Korean bbq places! and this is coming from a Korean who is from LA :) 
Def worth your money 

One slight downside is that they don't cook the meat for u. But it's all good, ambience and good made up for it all

Pretty good.  Two of us and we ordered 4 of their prime beef - tongue, filet mignon, prime kalbi, and toro - all good, except the mignon - it could be a better quality but it is priced appropriately.  A little skimpy on the mushroom medley but it also could have shrink during the cooking process.  The biggest con: we waited for 1.5 HR but it was during CES so it may not be typical.
Close to hard rock hotel and it's very good! The flavor is kind of sweet if you like it do try it!-

Me and the wife tried this place because she was craving korean appetizers.. we ordered the meat lovers and loved everyrhing... except the macaroni salad side. My favorite was the bulgogi and the kobi style beef.
Meat on meats!! A great experience here. $65 for two people is a great deal. Will come back again.

Really good Japanese/Korean BBQ fusion. The ambiance is nice and clean with a modern edge, well ventilated tables meant my hair didn't smell like smoke after, and servers are pleasant and eager to please.

We did NOT get a combo, but instead ordered a-la-carte, mostly premium meats with a simple bowl of rice, kimchi and pickles. We satisfied our hunger, enjoyed almost every meat dish, and cleansed our pallets with a dessert all for less than the combo price...the difference? We didn't fill-up or waist money on the appetizers (that come with the combos).
Awful.   0 stars.     Rude service and food tasted old, almost going bad.         Would not go back or recommend

We've been to LA Korean restaurants and this definitely is up there if not better! We had gangnam and the Meat lovers and they were great!

If we are ever in Vegas we would definitely come back here. Great place to have dinner with friends!

This is probably my favorite restaurant off the strip. Typically I only do KBBQ when I'm in LA so I wanted to try it here in Vegas  

Definitely worth it. We tried the Gangnam special for 6 with only 5 people and it was a ton of food. Price was definitely reasonable for the amount of food. I dig it. You should try it.

Food is great and service is awesome
We will. Come back again for sure
Love the Korean prime kalbi

I loves me some KBBQ and since my family from Korea and I were in Sin City, I decided to try this place out. I typically like to do the AYCE for KBBQ but this place had such high ratings, I felt it was worth my while. The flavor of the meat was great and the side dishes were pretty darn good. We got ribs and pork belly and the usual meats. I have to say that it's a bit costly since each order is kinda small. Would I come back? I think I most certainly would.

When I first saw this place on yelp, I was pretty ecstatic. Who can beat four thousand reviews and 4.5 star rating? 

The servers here seem to be pretty nice and the customer service is pretty good. I didn't have any issues with ordering food or having things come out too late. 

The meat quality is alright. I ordered the Korean Prime Kalbi, Prime Kalbi, and Harami Miso which looked amazing, but it was the ultimate blue ball. They were well marbled which I loved, but it was surprisingly tough... what a disappointment. The beef looked to be on par with that of Magal Korean BBQ, but when you bite into it, you can tell that there is a huge difference in quality. The banchan here was surprisingly good, but the bibim nangmyun was not quite where I wanted it to be. They need to put less chilled broth in it because it was almost indistinguishable from mul nangmyun. 

The only redeeming quality of this place is the price. I ordered 3 plates of beef and an order of Bibim Nangmyun and it came out to roughly $50 with tax and tip. If I were to order the same stuff at Magal, it would be roughly $80 to $90.

All in all, this is a so-so korean bbq spot that made me reminiscent of home, but it was nothing spectacular. The service is good, but the beef quality is forgettable. After my experience here, I was wondering how so many people could think this place is so damn amazing, but then I saw a little sign on our table. They offer free macaron ice cream for every review that is written. They pretty much bribe people into writing good reviews for a free dessert. 

If you come here looking for Korean BBQ nirvana, keep on looking. If you want a moderately priced and decent quality BBQ joint, this may be for you. Just don't expect amazing things from here.
Wow. The food was great, but the waiters rarely came back to our table. But when they did, they were extremely nice. Overall, great experience.
This place is amazing.  The meats are top notch and all the small complimentary dishes are great.  Very good friendly service too, highly recommend it if you are visiting Vegas!
Very authentic Korean food.  The staff was friendly and although they were extremely busy our experience was very good.  Great food

I came here to have lunch with my husband. We were considering the set menu, but the portion seemed too large. We ended up ordering 3 appetizers and 3 plates of beef, and the portion is just right. Food are delicious, love it.

Love this place!  Always seen this type of restaurant on the TV but never experienced it.  Was in Vegas with my wife and we wanted to try something new.  I pulled up the Yelp app on the phone and this was at the top and had massive good ratings from patrons.  We decided to try it and were not disappointed.  We chose the meat lovers option for two and were thoroughly happy with the choice.  It is pretty cool to sit there and cook your food and eat it straight off the grill.  All the side elements are great too, some are pretty hot, but even for this wuss I still enjoyed the spicy sides.  Since our first time here we have brought friends twice and they all experience the same enjoyment as we did.

Great food and service! The happy hour prices are awesome and our server was super chill. I loved the barbeque in the middle of the table - it was a really cool experience. You get a free ice cream sandwich with a check in too!

food is great, but the server that was assigned to us was not very attentive and was not very well informed with the food. We asked him if they have gobchang and he just shrug his shoulder. We asked him how come are side dishes are taking a while he said they are still making them. I ask another server and he had it for us right that moment and he apologize for forgetting to serve it to us, maybe he was new. Other than that, I recommend this place because of the quality of food there is great. I just wish they offer the AYCE there.
It was perfect. The stone rice was amazing, can't wait to visit Vegas again so I can eat here
got the meat combo for 2, very good!! alot of food and great service. it's always nice to go to a asian restaurant out of chinatown!

This is the best restaurant! Love the way the waiters and waitresses are so polite and nice. They are truly fantastic! I wish every restaurant was like this. One time I went to a place similar but it gave me a tummy ache but no bathroom accidents here! The end.
Came here for happy hour. Prices were pretty good. Try the beef kalbi, so tender. The service was great. Will definitely come back.
Prime meats and intuitive service. Gangnam combination is the best deal for your buck! :)
First time here and I'm impressed by the price, location, decor and especially the food in a positive way. Great side dishes and awesome early happy hour on drinks.

They had large portions but based on the previous reviews, I had high expectations.  The meat was average and do not provide the high level of quality that I have come to expect from Los Angeles K-town Korean BBQ restaurants.  They don't have to constantly attend to a table, but we literally had all courses in a meal when we bought the combo brought out within 10 minutes then the servers never returned.  I had to get up multiple times to ask for anything such as napkins, more drinks, etc.  I left full based on the quantity but was expecting the quality to be better. I guess I should've known when their ban-chan (korean side dishes) tasted average at best.

We come here because of my friend's recommendation and their over 2300 reviews on Yelp. Nice and clean. Good food. Serve very fast and the staffs are friendly. 
The reason why I don't give them 5 stars because squid and pork belly are not really fresh.

Nice place! Super cool that you cook by your own, and waitress helps you.
And very tasty meat! Melting in your mouth. Great for parties, dates and just tasty dinner. Stuff is very kind and smiling

Average food, abrupt service. I'm from La so I guess after eating Korean BBQ there our expectations were high after seeing how many ppl reviewed this place an average 4.5 star. But I guess when you bribe your customers with a free 3.50$ macaroon ice cream sandwich for each "check-in" you're bound to be high on the rating scale! All in all it was below average experience. Don't think we'll be coming back any time soon.
It was the best Korean BBQ I have ever had. The garlic steak was amazing. I highly recommend.

Food was average, but if service was even "okay" I would've rated this place higher. The service was an absolute mess. It first started with our extremely rude server who gave us attitude after we put in our order(???) Then we were completely neglected throughout the meal but they were so quick to pick up empty plates. Priorities right? Well, we then put our card out on the check and out of the 6 servers, 4 looked at it and walked right past us several times. 

I work at a korean bbq place and was expecting a little more attention because that's just how korean bbq works, but nope. They had about 6 servers on an (extremely) slow weekday afternoon and it still seemed like they weren't tending tables well.   
Definitely won't be recommending this place to my friends who are visiting anymore. 

(There was ONE server who was so so kind and he def was hulling everyone else's asses. Wish I could've gave all the tip only to him..)
Love this place!  It's a great value and it doesnt compromise on taste.  I've never had something bad here.  You should definitely try it.
This place is Great! Meat Lovers All Day!!! We had a great time for my friends birthday.  Great location right  off the strip!

This is by far one of the best Korean BBQ I've had. I live in LA and we have lots of good Korean food and this place tops them all. The staff is very friendly, courteous and they take the time to explain the food. I enjoyed the Gangnam special where you get to try a variety of meats and side dishes. Their Bi Bim Bap is 2nd to none. I throughly enjoyed my experience and will definitely come back. As a bonus, this great good is affordable.

A hidden gem off the strip.  Had to wait a bit for a party of 10 but well worth it since we got the private room in the back.  The group menus have all you need for a great meal.  Meats are prime cuts and well seasoned.  Sides were plentiful.  Good alcohol selection.  Macaroons are a MUST.  The green tea and mango macaroons are a perfect ending to a great dinner.

Terrific Happy Hour meal once again.  The wait was about 30 minutes at 10pm on a Friday which is honestly pretty good knowing the notoriety of Gangnam.  Once seated food and drinks started flowing quickly and the banchan was very good with the fish cake and dried squid the standouts.  The bulgogi and spicy lemon chicken were both very good with the bulgogi coming out on top.  The bulgogi had great marination while the chicken seemed a bit dry and tasteless, though the lemon dipping sauce was refreshing.  The corn is great once grilled as well and a perfect addition to the meal.  Add in the fact that flavored soju is half off, at only $6 per bottle that's almost market price in this city.  Ridiculous deal on drinks and fantastic options for food on the Happy Hour menu.  If you pay over $20 per person after getting full and drunk I'd be surprised.  One of the best deals in town and with great food to match.
First time here. The staff was supper helpful. You can't go wrong here. Really great!

Terrible customer service at this PDQ store . Will not be back .
Went in for the first time . Saw a posted sign at the register advertising a three peice tender combo meal for $5 bucks . 
I clearly pointed to the sign and told the cashier I would have the $5 combo special.  She rang up my order and charged me $7.46 . I took the food to my table and looked at the receipt thinking the combo special probably didn't include the soda . But why would soda be an extra $2. 46 ?   
I told the cashier I thought the combo was $5 dollars ? She said " oh that special starts at 7 pm . I asked her to tell me the time since I didn't wear a watch . It was 6:48 pm . I asked her if she could reimburse the difference . I had assumed it was already 7 pm (my fault ) . 
She went to get someone else . The manager ? Shift supervisor ? Obviously someone who was in charge .  I explained that it was my fault for not knowing the proper time . But since I had clearly pointed to the sign when placing the order , I should've been told that it was 12 minutes too early to receive that special .
In a not so friendly manner told me he was unable to refund the difference.
I asked him if I didn't like the taste of the food or if the food was too cold would he refund the entire price ? He said yes . So I then told him the food was cold and he gave me a very slow and drawn out refund for the entire amount . Plus then he took the plate of food which I had already handled and put it neatly back on the kitchen where I'm assuming he planned on re selling it . ( health code violation) .
So for the difference of $2 dollars and 12 minutes in time ... He would rather refund the Entire price of the meal , and also lose a customer forever ? No problem . This is Las Vegas and we have many different  choices on each block to choose from.  The reason I give ONE Star and will never come back is the poor customer service combined with him not throwing away the food I had already handled .

Amazing 

Beautiful place with mind blowing Korean BBQ

Friendly fast service 

Phenomenal good including side dishes

I had read all the Yelp reviews and had to check it out. It was everything I had hoped for and much more.

I have been to many a Korean BBQ in Los Angeles and this one was the best one hands down I have ever been.

Service was very attentive. They tried in a very friendly way to get the Bolgogi a little too quickly  -- I hadn't scraped out the crunchy delicious bits from the bottom of the bowl :)

The waiter and I had a good laugh over this and I quickly scraped the bottom and let him have the bowl.

This was our first time trying a Korean style BBQ place.  Fortunately, it was a great experience!  We chose the Gangnam Dinner and were greeted with various cuts of beef and pork marinated in different sauces.  While we put these on the grill to cook to our individual levels of preferred "doneness", we sampled our miso soup, our crab wontons, and our shishito peppers.  Everything was delicious, and when we finally got to start trying the stars of the meal, we were not disappointed.  Everything tasted amazing and would definitely come back to try again.  Make sure you check-in on Yelp, so you can get a free ice cream macaroon to try.

I LOVE this place.  Food is good.  Value is good (especially for Vegas) and the service is good.
Everytime im in town i go.  Its just good.

Great place second tine coming here service is fast and friendly. The wait staff is on point. The food fresh and delicious ..Will definitely recommend you coming even with a large group happy hour prices and food selection is 100. Happy hour doesn't even have a long wait time either. Definitely come during happy  hour 3pm - 6pm or 10pm to close great place after club or work...
Best Korean bbq in Nevada! Order premium dinner set! Legit quality juicy meat! We love the service too!
Great experience at Gangnam! Excellent food quality, and awesome service. Will definitely be returning!

Okay. Real talk. We're still at the restaurant while I'm writing this. I needed to write my review before we left the table because I'm currently trapped in this weird mystical place where everything is beautiful but everything also hurts. 

This food is so delicious that I'm questioning the physical limitations of my corporeal form. Every single meat we've tried has been tastier than the next, and every bite sends me to this agonizing happy place somewhere between "I love my friends for showing me this amazing restaurant" and "I hate my friends for putting this unreasonable amount of good food in front of me." 

We bought the Meat Lovers combo for 6. There are 5 of us. The meal comes with enough to feed probably 8. We finished most of it anyway. It was just so good that we wanted to try everything and I have so many regrets for not sampling instead of shoving endless amounts of meat in my face.

Please eat here, the food is ridiculously tasty, including all the sides. But tread lightly, friends. The grill won't be the only thing burnt out and covered in sauce by the end.

Service is real friendly and nice. Love their staff's attitude. 

Food is decent. We had Gangnam Combo. I prefer choosing bibimbap over white rice and korean (marinated) prime kalbi over prime kalbi. 

Pricing is reasonable and worth it. 

Be prepared for long lines. I heard they are often busy. However, it is worthy for the wait.

We got the premium for 6 ppl and it was sooo much food!! Great cuts of galbi! The seafood bibimbap was amazing!  Really wish I had more room to eat everything.  Asparagus was good too...oysters and poke were meh.

We went during happy hour. Got some cheese wontons, calamari, spicy pork, bulgogi. It was delicious and quick service. This place will definitely be on our list of restaurants to visit when we are vacationing here.
Another great lunch surrounded by great people and great food! Still mah favorite spot for prime kalbi ribs!!!!!

Amazing Korean BBQ. Excellent service. Kobe beef was super. Side dishes are fresh and awesome. Portions a bit on small side, but reflects the cost. You can try more meats this way! Top it off ... they have PSY music videos in the background. Truly a Korean experience. Next time we fly by ... will definitely stop by. Also the ice cream macaroons were awesome!
Cool design of the restaurant inside ,however,  the food was mediocre. Happy hour was worth the price of the food, but other than that not the best option to eat authentic Korean food .
had gangnam special, spicy calamari, pork belly and rice. way too much for 2 ppl but was definitely worth it. satisfied our korean food craving

Party of 2 on a dinner date visited on a Thursday night, first time we were there and were pleasantly surprised how nice it was.  The booth we had was cozy and our server was excellent at explaining the menu and made sure all our needs were met.  We shared the Paradise combo.  I like that you can get bimbimbap instead of steamed rice.  There was lot of food to split up between us and we left satisfied just like we just had AYCE korean bbq. Everything we tasted was very good and we'll be back again to try another combo because we enjoyed it so much.

So good! We got the Meat Lovers meal, $54.99 for a ton of panchan and meat dishes.  Food quantity and quality was excellent, our meal came with pot stickers, salad, rice and yummy sides. I recommend the pre-fixe meals if you are new to Korean BBQ or have a big party. Our Meal fed two adults and two small kids, and sent us away full and happy! Clean restaurant, nice staff, excellent location across from the Hard Rock (we stayed at a nearby hotel).

So I meet up the homie Mike C. at this place. Been wanting to try it for a minute now. It's eveningish and not busy at all.  It has a nice, dark, and clean ambiance. I'm not too sure on the dynamics of this establishment. We were the ones manning the grill, which I had no problem with. I've had places where an angry looking Korean lady snatches the tongs away and takes over. It wasn't the usual AYCE but I'll still pho'ks with it. 

The dishes we sampled was the carpaccio, pork belly, brisket, filet mignon, and prime kalbi.

I saw on Yelp that this place had beef carpaccio. Ever since Woonam Jung stopped serving carpaccio, I've been looking for another joint to replace that empty spot in my heart. Gangnam's carpaccio wasn't as extravagant as Woonam's, but just as good. Served on an oily sauce and some greens on top. Simple and delicious. This was my favorite during the feeding.

The pork belly and brisket. What can you say? It's always good. There is nothing special about these other than the pork belly being thick. Dip them things in the sesame -salt & pepper concoction and you got a happy customer. 

ALRIGHTY THEN!  Now to the beef. The filet mignon was good and tender. We cooked it quickly to a nice medium rare. It was perfect! Again, I'm glad we were manning the grill. These could have easily been over cooked and ruined. We actually got another order of the filet mignon. The server finally brings in the prime kalbi. He says that this is their signature dish. It was very tender and sweet, but it didn't leave an everlasting impression with my palate. Would I still pho'ks with it?  Sure. The first four orders is a definate though. So in the end, the crack that will have me on the come back is the carpaccio and the filet mignon. WINNER!

Yay!, I'm a fan!!!

After a packed day of wandering the Strip on a wedding trip to Vegas, we had worked up quite an appetite.  We had originally planned on going to Lotus of Siam, however upon arrival discovered that the wait was over an hour and they didn't have a liquor license - the combination of which, I am fairly certain, is a violation of the Geneva Convention.  We called an audible, wanted something close by, and stumbled upon Gangnam - which turned out to be a serendipitous find. 

The wait time for a table was quoted at ~35 minutes, so we bellied up to the bar for some pre-meal drinks and appetizers - the chili dumplings, shishito peppers, and (one of my personal favorite appetizers) the dynamite shrimp.  The three dishes were perfect amount to share among the three of us, and we all enjoyed each one - the dynamite shrimp was especially a hit as neither of my friends had ever had it before.

We were seated almost immediately after on round of appetizers were polished off. I didn't check the time, but it had to be pretty close to the quoted wait time - an impressive feat, given that Korean BBQ is more prone to people lingering at tables given its interactive and social nature.

The menu features options for pre-built combos (containing a mix of starters, meats, and sides), however we opted for ordering a la carte so that we could each try specific items (and we had already had a round of appetizers).  I ordered the spicy pork and the Korean Prime Kalbi, as well as a bowl of sukiyaki noodles (beef).  The Kalbi was flavorful, tender, and easy to cook.  The spicy pork had excellent flavor and a nice kick, but I'm a bit paranoid about cooking pork so I probably over-did it a bit.  The sukiyaki noodle bowl was a perfect way to fill out the meal - much needed after a long day of walking around the strip.

The atmosphere was upbeat and we had a great time. All three of us left stuffed to the gills and all-in (with 3 appetizers, 2 beers each, our various BBQ selections, and my noodles) our bill came to just over $100 - a pretty fantastic deal for a great social meal.  

I highly recommend Gangnam to cap your long Vegas day.

Excellent food. We got the premium for two people and paid $89.95. Cuts of meat are fresh and everything pretty much excellent.

It's not AYCE and the servers don't cook the meats for you. But, I didn't mind cooking it. There's a bit of a wait if you come later.
Great food, great price point, and always great service. The prix fixe menu is perfect if you want a little bit of everything. Always love coming here!!

Good stuff. Prepped raw food delivered to your table where you cook your own to your preference. Pricing is a la  carte or purchase in groups of 2,4, or 6 people. Quality ingredients, included free sides. Amazing. We will be back.
Love it. Don't order tofu. It sticks to the grill. But it tastes good. The portions of the spicy tofu soup is on the smaller side. The side dishes are good.
Seriously love this place.  Come here every time I'm in Vegas and it never disappoints.  If you are looking for good eats and a good atmosphere this is your spot.

Great food and nice ambience...
We ordered the meat lover...different types of meat such as filet mignon,bulgogi,
Pork belly, brisket and spicy beef.
It comes with lots of side dishes such as 
Been sprouts, kimchi,macaroni, dried squid,cucumber , fried gyoza and a big bowl of mixed salad. Everything was tasty and delicious....we will definitely come back when we visit vegas again...
Best restaurant .. I'm a meat lover .. Very reasonable prices .. Very generous with amounts and side dishes ... Courteous staff .. Very clean .. This will be my favorite restaurant in Vegas :)

Terrible service!
Too slow to prepare table!
It took 30minutes to complete the order.
It's unacceptable!!
Great meat, great service! Definitely, try next time! This is a really good korean barbecue place. It even plays music on a projector.

Great service. Great ambience. Clean. The meat is high quality and yummy. Prices are typical of most Korean BBQ's, which is a little pricey. The meats are separated in smaller quantities which give you the ability to order a nice variety of meats, without having to just stick to one or two or a packaged deal. It wasn't really crowded when I went, but I can see it getting crowded sometimes.

Although there was a 1.5 hour wait, it was totally worth! You get to choose meals or individual orders of the types of meat you want to grill, which was also pretty convenient. Everything was reasonably priced for the most part, and, as others have said, there is nonstop k-pop playing in the background :D

Visiting here for the first time. First non ayce kkbq I went to. Better than other ayce Korean BBQ around Vegas. The quality of the meat is what got me! So tender and juicy and oozing with flavor! Quality over quantity! It is kind of pricey compare to others, but you get what you pay for! Coming again with friends and during happy hour (:
Awesome food, great service! And the Las Vegas was so much food! It was a great dining experience. Overall everything was good, would highly recommend.

It was like eating a very delicious dinner. The service was great and the workers there are very kind. But the meat is the best!! Although some of them might be a little too spicy, it was great. The side dishes were so good!! Especially the kimchi. It is well flavored. Our children enjoyed it and overall, it was a very good and memorable meal.

Was highly impressed with this place. Super clean and nice, plus the food is amazing! Just wish the booth seats weren't so far from the tables, but besides that I loved it. Would definitely come again.
the food was amazing. meat love style. Yassssssss! Thank you. The filet mignon was the best mean and so was the flat iron steak. So come  in and have some Korean BBQ.

The food here is delicious! A great place to enjoy Korean BBQ. The service was attentive, friendly and helpful. The choice of meats was excellent as was the quality. I can say without a doubt that this is as good if not better than some of the places I have eaten at in Korea Town in NYC. The fact that this place is off the strip makes it even better as most people who frequent it are avid fans of Korean cuisine rather than a bunch of tourists.

I've been  to different  Korean restaurant  and so far this is the best one . it's  fast service nice costumer service and I like the presentation . Nice ambiance  highly recommended to my friends and family.
This place gets better and better. Happy hour gets lit haha. Definitely come check this place out. I honestly think the Kobe beef is a must, after all it is number one.

I would have given it a five star if they have slice pickle radish and rice paper noodle to go with the bbq. However, that's beside the point right. There is good choices of meat here. And their meats are fresh and well marinated. Server are on point and friendly. Give it a try!
First time to this restaurant and fall in love with it!!! Great food and services...really recommend their cheese sweet corn, Kobe beef and kalbi?
Love this place! Happy is amazing and the food is always ready fast. Highly recommend.

The food is great! I liked the side dishes and the meat is very good quality.
The beef bulgogi is great and the beef brisket is good. 
I like the look Olof the restaurant and the service is good!

**D-D-DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE**

Umm, how on Earth did this place get 4.5 stars?!

Took a taxi here from the Strip.

PARKING
=======
Packed strip mall.

AMBIANCE
=========
Videos of hip hop and K-pop.
Dark and limited booth seating.
Staff was friendly enough.

FOOD
=====
LUNCH FOR 2 - GANGNAM COMBO - $65
Yes, that's a lot of food and pricey for 2 people at lunch
(in East LV, more or less).

MEATS
Favorite was the prime kalbi - everything else was tough.
RATING: 3/5

Favorite was their BEEF CARPACCIO. 
RATING: 4/5

BANCHAN
Not super fresh (I'm spoiled in LA)
and underwhelming, except for the tofu and salad.
RATING: 3/5

RICE AND MEATS
Decent and delicious with fatty bits.
RATING: 4/5

BEVERAGE
=========
HOUSE SAKE (COLD)
OK, at best. Not smooth.
RATING: 3/5

SERVICE
=======
Felt somewhat rushed at times.
Never refilled any of our banchan.
The guy kept coming back and forth after we told him 
that we were hanging out for a bit and pacing ourselves.
There was no line, no people waiting, I didn't understand the rush.
RATING: 3/5

OVERALL
=========
Does not hold a candle to LA's KBBQ joints. #sorrynotsorry
CANNOT BELIEVE how many people gave this place 5 stars. 

NOT RECOMMEND, if you're that drunk, eat pho instead.
Cheaper and better.

This korean barbeque is by far the best in las vegas do far. Everything is reasonably priced and tastes so good! Great selection of food and drinks
Waited over an hour to be seated and definetly worth the wait!

The service here was exceptional for a korean restaurant!!!!  Definitely recommend to others. Try the pork toro and prime kalbi.. they were two of our favorites! For four people, we ordered the gangnam (for two), the seafood tofu soup, and two orders of pork...plenty of delicious food!

This was an excellent place - really delicious food and great service. It's family style which is pretty nice and you get to grill your own food. Definitely a great spot to go to if you're around Vegas - would highly recommend

The kobe beef here is good. Coming from LA, we usually go to jinseng and kimchi for kbbq, but we came here after seeing the reviews and rating. Ordered the meat lover combo for 6 with an extra order of kobe, and the amount and quality of the food is great for the price.

Great food and having fun with the know. Ordered the meat lovers special. Everything this high quality that offers you a little bit of everything. The service is friendly and explains what everything is and what order to cook in. Would come back again for sure.

This place was awesome as previous customers recommended. We ordered happy hour pork belly, bulgogi, beef toro plus vegetables. We ordered too much food, but it was so good. We left with so much food for the next day. It was well worth the lyft ride here. 
In addition, we had the free condiments Kimchi and other pickled vegetables.

After a long road trip through Utah on MDW, we needed some REAL food. After seeing the reviews on this place we knew we had to give it a try. 

We came here on a Sunday night on Memorial Day weekend around 8pm and waited exactly 45mins. That's not bad at all for a holiday weekend.. Not to mention their cool projector that plays music videos to pass time. 

Now onto the food, we went with the Gangnam combo, and little FYI, if you want to substitute something, as long as it's equal or lesser price.. YOU CAN!! We substituted our bulgogi for beef toro & yuzu for cream cheese wontons. 

Now onto the FOOD! I've been to many Kbbq and AYCE kbbq, I have to say,this place is pretty up there on my kbbq list! The meat quality here is very good, tender and tasty. I also like that it's NOT AYCE, the portions were more than enough and I was able to really enjoy the meats instead of stuff my face cause it's AYCE lol. 

As for service, everyone here moves fast! If I didn't live in CA, I'd definitely be back! 

*tip: write a review and get a free dessert! Win win for everyone!
Delicious. Forgot I was in Vegas and thought I was in ktown Los Angeles for a second (without the long wait). Just wish they had rice paper but over all good food and friendly service
Came here during a vacation and needed some Korean after horrible hotel food. Their beef is excellent!  Took the kiddos and they loved it! The spicy tuna kimbab was awesome too.

When just went there to try it out. Saw it in yelp. I wouldn't give it a star.  How the hell did he get his position as a manager. Soo fucking rude! If you guys want to charge gratitude cuz we 9 people (4 adult & 5 kids under 10y.) THEN HAVE IT WRITTEN I  THE MENU!!!. THERE SERVICE SUCKS. NOT FRIENDLY OR HELPFUL.
love it so much. I will come back this restaurant again if I come to Las Vegas once again
The food was great, and the lunch special is a great value! I had the Beef and the Chicken. The Cream Cheese Wontons are to die for!!
This place was exactly what we needed. Amazing food. Awesome atmosphere. We had great service and this really started our night off right. I will definitely be coming back.
Very good, delicious bulgogi! It was fun to cook the meat--great interactive. The service was very good as well. I would come back to this restaurant and would recommend it.

The food was great! This is one of the best Korean places in Vegas for sure! Definitely recommend the spicy chicken, it's the most tender chicken you'll ever have. Prices are pretty reasonable too for the portion size.

This place was really great. The service was fast, and the food was delicious. My roommate is from Korea, so I've eaten my fair share of authentic Korean BBQ, and I must say, this place sends pretty legit. Definately one of the better Korean BBQ restaurants I've been to.

Worst customer service I have ever had. The host does not how to work the waiting list. We were there for 2 hours when they told us it will be an hour waiting in line. There was like 10 people before us, left their name then went off somewhere while we were there for the entire time. They didn't even take out the name of whoever does not show up but keep waiting for that person to come. That is not how customer service work. You will lose more business it is how you decide to run it that way. The worst thing is to let customers who have been waited for a long time to see someone shows up, and claim that its their turn to be seated. It doesn't matter how good your food is, but if the customer has bad experience even before he or she can taste the food the business already fail.
Food was amazing, love the filet mignon and the spicy pork, overall good quality of meats, and staff was friendly, will definitely be returning!!

Gangam had good cuts of meat was clean and priced well. The service was a bit lacking however it took forever to get our meat cuts and drinks. The place wasn't even busy just 3 tables. I would probably go back if they made sure the service was quicker.
the food here is amazing!!!!!!!!! from the temperature of the food to the quality to the service... you can't go wrong. but if you do, you probably didn't want the free dessert.
