Amazing spot for dinner! Had the "Meat Lover" for 4. Lots of food. Ambience was good and trendy. Great place for Korean BBQ!

My team and I were starving from a 10 hour drive to Vegas. We wanted to find something different and good but with a lot of food. We hit the jackpot with Gangnam!!! It was such fast service and the food was amazing! Too fun to be able to cook the meat at the table and it was delicious! Thanks, Gangnam!

I am a flight attendant that comes here all the time whenever I have a layover here. I mean, everything about this place is awesome; food is cheap, hella good and the staff are super nice. The pork belly is to die for! The ice cream macarons are worth the calories. I made Gangnam a regular stop for me when I am here. I also have recommended them to my coworkers...love love love this place!

This was an exceptional good meal. Came here based off fantastic Yelp reviews and Yelpers didn't disappoint! I love the atmosphere and cook it yourself at the table. Ordered a few different things for table and had a blast. Everything was amazing. Cheese wontons and their sweet & sour was out of this world! 

Tried the chicken, beef, bacon asparagus. Fantastic. Worth a stop here if you're in the area.

The lemon chicken was my favorite. First time, so I was nervous. It was a lot of fun getting to cook the food ourselves. Especially because you could choose the pace you want to eat and it would always be hot. Yum
It was a nice experience for the time of night and money spent. There we a few happy hour food specials that were pretty good. Check it out.
Great KB! The sides were all great! And if you go during happy hour you really save money.
We liked the beef and the cold noodle. The free appetizers are great. Also the bibiban is good. I will recommend that. The combo is good for group.

The bulgolgi is my favorite of all meats. I have tried kalbi & flat iron garlic as well. For appetizers I found all of them to be just ok tried the sweet corn cheese, calamari, fried dumplings, cream cheese wonton, & squash tempura. I like that this place has an a la carte option. Meats are between $4-5 but not large portions. Overall, I like the vibe of the place.

Checked out this place with my friend while we were in vegas. He just returned from a trip to korea and loves Korean food. This place was good although it was missing the sides that generally come with korean bbq and we were surprised to find that the sake was more expensive than the soju. All and all, I'd try it again.
Great kabli, amazing steak. Fresh cold beer and free dessert with a  yelp review! Definitely recommend this spot to anyone visiting or to locals as well
This place smells so good it's making my mouth watery! The food is delicious! Love the seaweed salad. The staffs are very nice and helpful! I recommend trying this place out!
Put up a review and get a free macaron ice cream. Food was nothing that you couldn't get elsewhere. Portions were a bit on the small side
Good food and fun atmosphere.  The free dessert is awesome.  A bit off the strip but still worth the extra walk or short drive.

During my stay at the Rio on this trip I had the pleasure of eating dinner at Guy Fieis El Burro Borracho this dinner was a real pleasure I was waited on by Betty and Rose excellent service manager is Sal great guy his expertise has rubbed off on his employees cuz they are excellent the food was fabulous I had their hard shell tacos that have picadillo inside cheese and lettuce but it was so tasty and so enjoyable the beans and rice were also very well done not over served just the right amount that's why I gave this restaurant a five star I will go back try something different and I'm sure it'll be excellent I will more than likely go back the first chance I get my stay here at the Rio was my first stay I've played there before but I really enjoy the venue if you're ever at the Rio be sure and try this fabulous restaurant out I'm sure you'll not be sorry and you will enjoy it I've been to a lot of different restaurants critiquing The Fabulous foods that they have that's why I come to Vegas in any case it's a must-do !

Recommendation for meat lover or not! You will love this place. I came from Chicago for a 4 days stay in Vegas. Tried a lot Korean BBQ there. But I love this place even better. This is already the second time I having diner here. 

Pork belly, Kobe style beef, spicy calamari, enoki with bacon, etc are the favorite dishes! BTW, if you still have some space after, don't forget the macaron ice cream!
Easily one of my favorite Korean restaurants ever, and as my partner and I are particular affecionados, we've been to a LOT.  So tasty, so friendly.  A word of warning: the original bibambap is HUGE!

Wonderful food and service. This is about my 32 time here great value for your money 
I recommend this restaurant to everyone i know and meet
Awesome place! Friendly and fast staff specially Back. The food was delicious too. Definitely coming back :)

Arrived in Las Vegas from Los Angeles, got to our hotel and looked for a place to eat... They're the first one to pop up since our hotel is very close to this restaurant. Checked the reviews and decided right away to try the place... And guess what?! EXTREMELY SATISFIED!!! Especially that I am a big Korean Dish Lover!!! I enjoyed my Bulgogi Bibimbap! Really tasty! My family opted for some Bulgogi, Pork Belly and Brisket since they have a HAPPY HOUR SPECIAL!! This is such an awesome spot!! The meats are really tender and juicy! I loved the Pork Belly the most! The environment is really clean and the servers are really friendly and informative! They made sure that we know how the menu works. They also offer some Japanese dishes! But I recommend the Korean dishes more. The side dishes are also amazing, they are honestly to die for! I always go to Koreatown in LA and yes, it has the same quality as it is in KTown! Will definitely come back whenever I visit Las Vegas!!!
Greeeeat food! Quality meats! A bit pricy but well worth it. Come with big groups to get more bang for your bucks!
Great food. Fresh meats. Awesome side dishes (panchan) Excellent value! Come during happy hour for even more savings.

The wait is long but it is 100 and 10% worth it! I love how all their meats a juicy. Also if you get any of the marinated meats they are amazing! Also The service here is impeccable!! They always get great tips from me. One thing I recommend is either getting here early or getting a reservation because it's always packed.

Came here with a group of friends and ordered the Gangnam combo for 8 people. There was so much food that I was eating leftovers for the next 2 meals! The quality of the meat was really good though, and they even had oysters and carpaccio which I really enjoyed. Overall I felt like the price was worth it!
wonderful place in LV, a good choice except all buffets. I like the beef most. Since I have eaten so much bbq and Korean meals in NYC, this one is also wonderful!

Best korean bbq I've ever had! Way better than anything you can get from houston. Meat is high quality and very delicious. I would recommend the Korean prime kalbi and sukiyaki noodles and bulgolgi. Those were the best, but even then, the rest of the meats were really good too! Place to go to satisfy korean bbq cravings.
I love this place. It's the best I have tried. I would definitely come back. The service is perfect. The price is cheap compare to other korean bbq restaurants. Fish cake for side dish is delicious.

Best Korean BBQ restaurant I've been too. Happy hour is the best time to go as you get the most bang for your buck. I only give it 4 stars instead of 5 because their bar was far bit too limited, and their regular menu outside of happy hour seemed pricey. But great service and amazing food.
First time having KBBQ and I love this place! I would definitely come back and recommend. Food was delicious and service was fantastic.
Really good food. I love how they show Kpop MVs too!!!!! Their side dishes are also wonderful.

My daughter who's into BTS (korean boy band) is craving for Korean Food. Thank God for Yelp app we found this restaurant!! Curious for having 4 1/2 star, I thought this might worth a try. And I'm so glad that we did. The set menu ( called Vegas) for 2 people is just perfect servings for the three of us. It starts with soup, appetizers and salad. And then comes the shrimps and 3 more kind of meat. Plus the yummy bibimbap!! Fast service, clean and welcoming ambiance. And of course awesome korean food. We will definitely do this korean food tripping again

Loved this place! My aunt and uncle recommended this place to us so we decided to try it since we were in Vegas for the evening. I personally don't eat red meat, so instead I ordered the Dynamite Shrimp, calamari, and spicy tuna bimbap. I loved all of them! Really yummy food and great customer service.

I am so happy I found this place on yelp! I came here for happy hour on a Sunday evening around 1130pm and the restaurant was pretty full. We didn't have to wait at all though! I can imagine this place having ridiculously long waits during peak hours. 

We just ordered off the happy hour menu which is such a great deal. My favorites were the beef toro, pork belly, and chicken karage. I didn't really like the cheesy wontons. You also get a free macaron if you purchase at least $15 and check in on yelp!

This is located in a shopping plaza with plenty of free parking :)
This is my 1st time here and I love it! It is a nice environment and have friendly service. I will definitely next time I come back to Vegas!

Nice clean and good tasting food here.  We ordered the largest combo menu with lots of meat choices. The meat quality was good but a little lacking in quantity. Perhaps that is the trade off between good meat vs the bad stuff you get at AYCE joints.  Not sure.  The variety of banchans were sort of meh but you do get the nice oysters that come out in the combo selection. Other thing like clean cooking environment, good service and sanitary bathroom make it better than your average Korean BBQ place.  I'd go back here with family.  I'd rather go somewhere else with a bunch of guys since food quantity is somewhat on the skinny side.

They opened pretty recently so we were the only folks there for awhile. Their sauces (ponzu, sweet, or spicy) are yummy, but even if you're not a fan, their meat is perfectly marinated already (we got the bulgogi). All the waiters/esses are super cute and helpful, and they will notice if you are leaving your meat on the grill for a long time and adjust the fire level for you accordingly. The cheese wontons were delicious, and so was the honey pancake. Although, don't expect it to be textured like western pancakes- it is much sweeter, stickier and eggier.
Glad we stumbled across this on Yelp. Food was yummy and service was fast. Spicy Tuna Kimbap and Chicken Karage was our favorite but everything was really good.

I do really hope they take a reservation.  We came here with 25 people. I kept telling them it is ok to sit separately, but others who came after us taking seats while we are waiting.  I just don't know why...

Even food is good, some staff is nice, it is hard to come back.
One of the best kbbq around the Las Vegas area. Little bit pricey but definitely delicious

So I'm so used to all you can eat kbbq so I wasn't sure if the food was actually gonna fill me up. Especially since it's a bit on the pricey side for two people. But, I have to say I'm a extremely satisfied! Everything was delicious! I especially liked the filet migon and beef toro.
Not your typical all you can eat Korean joint but you will not be disappointed. Amazing meats and good sized portions. Must try!
First time here!!!! Service is is way better then other places!!!!!!we had plenty of food and the most important thing is relaxing.!!! Love it!!

My sister and I checked this place out a few months ago based on Yelp reviews. We were pretty pleased with the food. Atmosphere was modern and fun as was the d√©cor. Finding great Korean food is a challenge in and of itself but a place with good atmosphere, solid food, and pleasant service always makes for a great evening out. Happy to say that we will definitely be back. Thanks for helping these Korean girls get a little taste of home!

We ordered the Korean Prime Kalbi which was my favorite, because it had a lot of flavor. The Salmon with bacon and premium tongue which were equally as good. Then for vegetables we got the broccoli fondue and cheese which was pretty yummy. I would recommend this place.
Got the "Vegas" and it was just right filling for the two of us. The food was amazing and getting to cook the meats was quite a fun experience.
Fantastic Korean dishes indistinguishable from the meals I ate in South Korea.  Very friendly wait staff, reasonble prices and nice decor.  It's definitely worth getting off the strip!

This rating is based purely on customer service. Came here with several family members (party of 8). Once they served up the meat for us to cook I never heard from or saw our server again. They didn't even come once to clean the grill of all the marinade, didn't come fill drinks, didn't ask if we were okay....and then they charged 18% gratuity?! Added gratuity for large parities, I totally understand and will pay it, but added gratuity when we weren't serviced does not make sense. Asked for it to be removed and they did it but no apologizes, and no sense of customer service whatsoever. Prob won't be back. Didn't feel welcome since walking through the door.

I decided to try this place out just because of the high rating and sheer number of reviews and I have to say I was not disappointed. From the moment I entered the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. And the experience was amazing. The atmosphere was very inviting as well. And the food Mmm. I give this place a 5 out of 5.

We tried so many different Korean bbq restaurants here in Las Vegas.  Gangnam Asian BBQ is now our favorite.  My husband likes the Oi (cucumber kimchi) which most Korean restaurants do not serve.  Also, the place is pretty nice and service is excellent.
4 of us had the Gangnam for 2. We ordered a bit not al la caret and it worked out really well. Great food!

Great food great people definitely a place to go 
I ordered a set for 2 people. 
Great amount of meat and side dish. 
The fire on the grill is a little bit weak.
Well giving the review for free desert. With that being said food is decent. Side dishes are just ok but the meat is the highlight. We ordered the meat lover combo and there is no disappointment

This place has such a high number of reviews which is surprising that the score is really high. In my opinion the most that this place deserved is a three star. We came in around 7pm with a group of 11 people and was seated within 20 minutes. The place looks fairly clean and nicely decorated. The food was good but not great. The portion was really small. You would have to order a ridiculous amount to get full off of their portions. On top of that, they charge $2 for a small bowl of white rice. Their banchan was good and we were given a good amount. The waiter that we had were not very friendly. I couldn't get him to refill my Coke until the end of the meal. Over all this is not a place I would go back to again with a large group of people. I may revisit if it's me and another petite person who doesn't eat much. Don't go here if you want more bangs for your buck.
Good food and fun atmosphere. The tuna seaweed app was delicious. Wish the wine list had more options.

This is the BEST KOREAN FOOD in town! The food quality is superb! Awesome service! The servers are very attentive. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted and served with water. I will come back here again
Favorite korean bbq in Las Vegas, great service and atmosphere. The quality of meat, specially the kobe beef was to die for... I can't wait to go back

Cute Korean restaurant in strip plaza. The steamed kalbi is flavorful and fatty - I recommend that dish. The spicy tofu soup (with seafood) is good too, just enough spice to make you sweat. I'm docking off a star because sometimes it seems like the wait staff are annoyed of you when you need something.

Check in on Yelp and get free macaron ice cream (total of bill must be over $15 to qualify).

Wtf.. what a korean food. Very disappointed as korean.. restaurant with this will not acceptable..
Only reason 3000 over 5 star is free macaron with check in.. what a scam

My first non-AYCE BBQ I've been to...and I regret going...in a good way! This place ruined kbbq for me forever because NOTHING can ever be as good! I don't even want to go to AYCE bbq's anymore because it's just not the same!! T___T

Everyone who knows me knows that I have a very...unrefined palette. Everything is "good' to me. Something has to be extremely bad or extremely amazing for me to tell its "amazing". Basically, I cannot tell quality food (I have that whole...appreciate whatever food you have mentality). But this place blew me away! I've never tasted bbq meat sooo tender and perfectly seasoned before. 

I've tried one other bbq place since Gangnam (Manpuku in Los Angeles, Japanese bbq) and I just can't. Gangnam will always be a favorite for me.
This place is delicious and affordable. Loved how unique it was for us to cook our own food at the table. Must try!
Portion is really good! With a lot of free side dishes. The only thing is the sauce is all kinda too sweet for us.

Great food and great service! If you're from Hawaii it's like a Gyu-Kaku and Korean restaurant in one. Cheap prices and food is very very good!!! Had spicy seafood soondubu (soft tofu stew). Also ordered the fried vegetable gyoza. Overall, a great affordable and delicious meal! I wish they had this at home!

We found this place on yelp. We're so excited as this place has 4.5 stars from over 4000 reviews. Should be great, right? That's what I thought too.

When we walked in, there were so many people waiting inside. So I thought this is a great sign. This place must be good. We waited over an hour and finally got seated. We ordered some short ribs and balgogi, soft tofu soup, and a clear noodle dish. 

All the meat just taste like balgogi, pure sweet, has no kick at all. Soup was too salty. Calamari was blend, I don't understand why they mark it as "must try".  I have korean friends, and I visited bounch korean restaurants. Nothing were like this sweet. 

I am very disappointed, since I saw this place on yelp when I was at salt lake a week ago. 

The only thing that's okay was their kimchi.

This place is as good as it gets for Korean BBQ.  We had the Gangnam for 4 and it was the perfect amount of food.  The raw oysters that came with it was fresh, BBQ was so flavorful.  The bulgogi bi bim bap was yummy in my tummy.  It satisfied 4 hangry Asians and a definite try if you're in Vegas.
We arrived around 12 and waited about 30 min! The food is good the environment is great!
Best food we have had in Las Vegas. Servers are very friendly. The spicy pork and marinated Korean Kalbi are delicious.
Really good Korean BBQ and good service but you will leave smelling like smoke.
Great! Food. Yummy... Nom nom nom... Best bacon wrapped asparagus dipped in cheese fondue!!
Delicious! Enjoyed the food and the venue!! Everything tastes very good! I recommend this place ! I'm from Cali, first time here! You gotta come try this food!

Woohoo, I never knew there was a Korean BBQ place this close to UNLV. 

The interior is quite authentic with its red walls and wooden window frames. There are both booths and regular tables that fit up to 6 people. The tables are a little wide for my taste, since it puts a big distance between customers sitting across from each other, but over all, it is a comfortable setting. 

My friend and I came in during happy hour. We ordered $16 worth of food, which was more than enough for us. The meat was top-notch quality, and I actually liked all of the the sauces they have here. The side dishes were plentiful. As always, I loved the fish cake. 

The service was fast, attentive, and efficient. I will definitely be back here for Korean BBQ, even though they are not all-you-can-eat.
Phenomenal. That's all I can say. Great service, great drinks, wonderful food. There are so many fresh choices of BBQ stylea, and I guarantee you won't leave hungry.

Easy, fun and fabulous atmosphere. 

Great for a date night, working lunch or with the kids!!

Pick your meat and veggies and they arrive raw. You cook them on your table top grill. Fun way to get the kids cooking. And the prices are Great!!

Ill be back for sure. Good music as well as a tv playing sports!! Great selection of sake too!!

This Korean restaurant is fancy!  The decor is super contemporary with spacious seatings. Even the waiting area is spacious. 

I like the fact that the meat and veggies are tapas style. However, when we flipped over the menu, we quickly decided on the meat lover, $55.95 for two, and an order of pork toro. 

Everything was delicious, but if I had to chose, the pork cheeks were our favorite. So juicy and tender melt in your mouth! 

Service was wonderful as well.

There was a short wait when we came on a Saturday around 2pm. It was only 10-15mins so it was not too bad. I wanted to order from the lunch menu but they don't have that option for weekends. However, they have the happy hour menu from 3-6pm, look good but I already over ordered from the regular menu.
Onto the food, we got harami miso, Korean prime Kali, spicy tuna kimbap, fried calamari, bibimbap, and spicy tofu soup. Imo, everything was good, except the tofu soup. The meat cut was high quality, so tender and well seasoned. The appetizers are fried perfectly. Bibimbap was good, but at $12.99, i think I rather get another meat dish instead. The soup was just so so, not memorable. 
The service was okay, no smile when greetings, but otherwise attentive.
I would definitely visit again, with a reservation, since I don't like to wait an hour wait for any food.

Back here again and I had an awesome experience! Better than the last one so I had to update my review! Our server was there for everything and they cooked it and cut the meat up most of the time for us! 

The first two sauces are amazing for anti spice people!! The first was more vinegar-y and the second was more BBQ-y ! The third sauce is kinda spicy !!!

Their beef bulgogi and toro are THE BEST! They have happy hour from 3-6pm and 10-close where you can get them for 4 dollars each and it's very filling !  This place is amazing
Yum!  I love this place!  I've been here a few times already and great every time.  Love the spicy pork, bulgogi,  bulgogi bibimbop, cabbage kimchi.  Chicken dipped in cheese fondue was good as well.
Great service,  the food came out quickly and the favor was just perfect not too salty. Good portion as well, over all no complain.

So glad I tried this place for dinner!  You get a lot of food for what you pay and the service is prompt and courteous. We did the meat lovers for two, and it came with soup, salad, rice and dumplings to start. Then out came 6-7 different types of meat. The spicy pork and pork belly were my favorites!
Incredible place ! Kid friendly and the best macaron ice cream I ever had in my life.

Great flavor on the meat.  You can tell they definitely use good quality meat.  The Kobe carpaccio was awesome!  Service was spotty at first but then got better.   Ordered a la carte but the sets were definitely cheaper.  Would do that next time. 

They kinda nickel and dime you for stuff like sauces and things that typically go with stuff, but all in all.  Pretty decent.
Meat was delicious, sizable serving of rice, I demolished the soy bean paste,  and kimchi. Would come here again if in the area. My Korean friend says so-so, as a white person I thought it was great.
My first time here. Everything awesome. Pork toro is my favorite. I'm sure I'll go back.

We had the Gangnam grill that was rated #1 it has several starters including fresh oysters, calamari, green salad, etc. bbq dishes include Korean Prime Kalbi, filet mignon, Bulgogi, etc they had a big salad. everything was delicious and seasoned well. The food cooked pretty fast. The complimentary sides were great as well esp the dried squid, cucumber kimchi, & bean sprout. The decor is elegant and romantic. The service is great! You can write a review and get a free desert.

Every time we in Vegas we have to stop by at this place, super friendly fast service, food tasted great and fast . They take good care of you . The BEST Korean food in the world " Jeremy clarkson voice "
Great food and service! For sure coming back next time I'm in town! The short ribs and garlic shrimp were awesome!!!

Hit and miss.   :( We were really in the mood for Korean and had high hopes for this place. 

The good: The seafood tofu soup had great flavor but it was seriously the smallest portion I've ever seen in any Korean restaurant.  The original bibimbap was yummy (nothing extraordinary but solid and at least normal portion size).  The chocolate lava cake was delicious.  Warm and gooey. 

The not so good: side dishes were icky.  So sad because half the fun of Korean food are the yummy side dishes.  The seafood pancake was tiny and for $9.50, so not worth it.   We are normally huge fans of seafood pancake but just so tiny here (two small silver dollar pancake size ones and at most places you get one the size of a dinner plate).   The pork belly app was so so.  

Our waitress was really nice though it took a while to get seated and for someone to come and take our order.  

Overall: small portions, pretty good service... But there's gotta be better Korean places in Vegas!

Lots of food. It is a little pricey but worth it.
It tastes really good. The food tastes fresh . They clean all the cooking stations usually before you sit down. If you don't want to cook your food they will cook it upon request. Every meal I had was very good.

Five Stars all day long! A plethora of deliciousness and a freaking ice cream macaroon to top it off!!! 
Here's what I got:
Miso 10-10 
Salad w house dressing 10-10
Sweet corn with cheese 7-10 
Chili wontons 10-10
Edamame 10-10
Asparagus 10-10
Bulgogi (10-10
Prime Kalbi 72-10 (favorite)

I will definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas
great food , the staff seemed nice not as attentive as I would have liked but I will be back for a second chance for a better review

The food and service were extremely great. Pork belly is excellent. Filet mamignon is the best. Every super yummy.

Friendly and accommodating. 

Love it.
The atmosphere is nice and the staff is very attentive. They have great meat and the Kobe carpaccio is awesome.

Came here with a few friends and ordered the Gangnam package plus a few extras. The quality of meat is high and the flavor is good but there is nothing that makes this place really stand out from other KBBQ places in the area.  We ended up spending about $40 each which is more $ than a good AYCE KBBQ for less food. We had a nice dining experience, but we won't be back.
Good food, great service.... Second time but we will come back.   This will be our fav restaurant from now

Dinner. Table for 4.

Korean BBQ is great for dates, groups of friends or anyone who is NOT in a hurry and loves food. It really forces you to take your time, pace your eating and engage in conversation!

I like when my Korean BBQ spots are dimmed with spot lights at each table. The menu was easy to read and the service was very friendly. They were great with answering questions and once we ordered, food just steadily start coming out. You know it's going to be good when there is a struggle to find space on the table because there is sooooo much goodness.

Along with banchan, we got bibimbap, edamame, miso soup, house salad and dipping sauce. The meats were deliciously marinated and we had a great time.
Great place to eat! The waiter was very nice and smart. We got free ice cream for feedback on yelp!
This was a very positive experience. The food was good and the people were friendly. The meat lovers hit the spot.
What's great place to eat!!! The uni bibimbap was off the hook!!! The spicy tofu soup was great!!! I highly recommend this pace. A treasure off the strip!!!

Incredible...got the gagnam for two people. This included an insane amount of incredible food. The meats are cut perfectly and in a way that people afraid of grilling wont mess it up. All of the sides are awesome and the bibimbop is great. The value and quality of this plsce are some of the best in Vegas.

Beef bulgogi was an absolute must! Super tender and the glaze was amazing. Salmon was a little bland but still good. Would recommend the bulgogi for sure.
Only comments are that I wish the sizes were bigger and the BBQ sauces were labeled, but the sizes you get are what you pay for. Yum!

With close to 3K reviews it's easy to get carried away with the crowd. It's a good Korean restaurant but would not fall as best for me. They've updated their service and I can say their staff are very friendly and service oriented. They have fast service and their meats are great. However, the taste is somewhat so-so and came across as the same on their variety of meats - sweet.

Maybe we should have ordered the cooked bulgogi instead of the set menu Gangnam BBQ that we have to grill ourselves. I would probably return just to try out their cooked dishes, but will definitely check out other KBBQ resto first whenever we visit LV.
Love the food. This place is open late. The payout is very nice. I love the bimbibap.

We came here for happy hour and I was starving so I order everything on the hh menu and it was so delish and I'm so full I also order a soju cooler green apple flavor it was good also but I'm so full I couldn't even drink it. But this is a good place close by the strip I would definitely come back again.

This place was recommended by our first Uber driver in Las Vegas. We stopped her to eat after getting tattoos in the area. We are so glad the driver recommended this eatery as we would not have stopped here on our own. We had the premium meal for two and the meat choices were amazing. This was our first Korean BBQ experience and the wait staff walked us through the whole process. They cooked our meat for us and told us when to pull it off the grill. The sides were out immediately and they were amazing. The entire meal was great and the experience as fantastic. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great meal and great experience.
Excellent Korean BBQ.  Highly recommend Gangnam.  Well worth the 45 min wait at 9 PM.  Great value.

Was here with friend for late lunch, amazingly the food came out fast and .... very tasty. Variety of side dishes. Refill right after the side dishes half down. 
Our server was Beck ( if I remember it right ) - super nice, friendly, and anticipated. 
Definitely coming back next time.

If only South Florida had amazing Korean BBQ places like this one!! Gangnam Asian BBQ is located a bit off the strip but it's definitely worth visiting. This low-key restaurant has a great menu of assorted meats and also, there's plenty of Happy Hour deals on drinks as well as food. All the prices are very reasonable. It is clean, neat and well ventilated inside so you don't leave smelling like smoky BBQ. The service is good, they are attentive and can answer any questions you have.They have a tv on playing the latest Kpop hits as well as other genres of music. 

If this is your first time doing Korean BBQ, keep in mind, you have to cook the meat yourself. If the grill is getting too charred and sticky, you can ask them to change out the hot plate. Aside from meat dishes, there are plenty of vegetable platters you can order. I recommend trying a stew too. For food, I ordered beef toro, kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly and kabocha squash. The marinated kalbi was my favorite but the beef toro was the most unique. Nice fatty thin slices with delicious marbling. I loved their dipping sauces too. Nice generous portions of the side dishes as well. Check in on Yelp to receive a free dessert - maracon ice cream! Very sweet and a large portion too! If only I lived closer....

They have a nice atmosphere and good food for the price. We chose our own meats instead of doing the pre-set options. This allowed us to get more of why we wanted and less of what we didn't, as we didn't care for the soups or wontons.

They bait you to write a review on here to get free dessert (only 2 options).
I've been to several Korean BBQ places and this place is the best. Definitely recommend this place!

As a local half Korean, my Korean mother and I  frequently go to Korean restaurants while we are out shopping. We were in the area and decided to give this spot with over 4,000 reviews a try. We had big expectations! Perhaps this spot is a hit with tourists but we weren't impressed. First of all,  it irritates me as a culinary professional when restaurants use culinary terminology so loosely. I ordered Sukiyaki Noodle with Beef. If you know Japanese cuisine you know Sukiyaki. I was expecting noodles along with something that resembles Sukiyaki. After all that's what it's called, right? What I got was stir fried noodles with chunks of beef and sliced red peppers served in a stone pot. What is so Sukiyaki about this? Nothing in this dish is anything you would find in Sukiyaki. In Sukiyaki, the beef is thinly sliced rib eye and there is no red bell peppers in it but rather, spinach, shiitake mushrooms, onions, green onions, tofu, bamboo and yam noodles. More appropriately this should be called Yaki Noodle with Beef which simply is stir fried noodles. It looked nothing like the photo on the menu and the portion was very small. My mom had the bean paste soup and it was nothing special. The pickles were bland and lacking any flavor. We ate our lunch but knew we would not come back again. The service? My tea cup sat empty without any question if we would like more hot water.  I finally asked for more hot water since I was never offered it. For $2.50 for each hot tea? At other Korean restaurants in town, hot tea is complimentary.
love the food it's amazing....my husband is a big fan of Korean BBQ and he brought me here to try for the first time...i can say I'll be back for more!! :)

good food. good service, but some items are too salty.
i probably wont come back again.

Nice decor...loved the grills..not as smokey as the normal korean bbq places. The meats were good quality. Nice change of pace compared to the all you can korean bbq places. The waiters were very helpful and attentive. when I lived in the OC. I would have korean bbq once a week in Korea town. Gangnam reminds me of the good old days. The bulgogi was tasty. The fried calamari was perfect. The Kolbi is superb, but the filet mignon was orgasmic.

When I'm in Vegas, I don't typically leave the strip, but we did last time. We came mid-afternoon so there was no wait. I'd say this lives up to the hype! Everything we ordered was really good, and the portions were generous! We had 3 people, and we ordered ordered one of the Korean BBQ sets for two plus two extra meat orders, thinking the set for 2 wouldn't be enough. It would have been enough. :)

Ehhh... found this place mediocre for an Asian BBQ experience. I was really iffy on going here because it was a fusion of both Japanese and Korean. Off the bat, I already felt like it wasn't going to be an authentic food experience. But I got there at the time of happy hour that started at 10 pm so I said, why not?! To start off I got a salad and tried their tteokbokki. The salad looked very different from the one picture on the menu. It had bitter lettuce, which I try to avoid in a salad at all cost. As for the meats, we tried their brisket (Toro?), bulgogi, and pork belly. I found that the meat was cut too thick, which made it difficult to bite through. On the upside, the staff was really nice and accommodating. Oh! And if you check- in, you get a free ice cream, which was a nice treat!
Good food and great service. The ambience is modern and not as smelly as other Korean BBQ places. We ordered the miso beef and bulgugi. Must try the steam egg and enoki bacon.

The waiter was superb!!! Jihoon I believe according to the receipt. The food was excellent!!! We ordered the gangnam for 2 for a family of 3 with leftovers to box. Since we came out of town, we asked for a side of kimchi to take back to the hotel and they were more than welcome to do so. They gave us a tub of kimchi and extra utensils to use after. The meat was tender, juicy, and flavorful. They even had brown rice for our little one. But I would say the kimchi was the best part. It's sooooo hard to find authentic fermented kimchi that pairs well with meat. It was fermented to perfection and would've love to have a huge tub to buy to use at home for stews and other Korean recipes. We will come back every visit to LV!!!

My family used to live LA and there were so many great KBBQ places in KTown. With that being said, I enjoyed this place so much. They had excellent food and great service! The food is priced very well but the only reason why I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because we asked them to cook our food in the kitchen but they didn't because the kitchen is expected to be very busy. Other than that, I was very impressed with this restaurant!

Great place! My boss set up our office yearly dinner there and it was delicious. They were very accommodating and friendly. The food was fantastic, steak, shrimp and the spicy tuna was delicious! I look forward to visiting again.
We came here for late night happy hour and the BBQ meats and side veggies tasted great; spicy pork and bulgogi were my fave. Service was great and we got a free macaron ice cream for checking in. :)
This is probably one of the best korean BBQ restaurant in town! Highly recommended for Kobe and toro!!

One of my top 3 Korean BBQ spots in the Veg. Prime Korean Kalbi... Everything is fresh and quality. The ahi poke was delicious also. All of the usual accompaniments with Korean style BBQ came with lunch and dinner. The service is also great!

A mix of both Japanese & Korean BBQ which was perfect since I like Japanese and the fiance likes Korean. We came here on a Thursday night and waited about 20-30 mins. WORTH.

SERVICE - Very friendly and accommodating staff. We were able to substitute items in the pre-set menu and even customize my cocktail to the way I like it :)

AMBIENCE - Casual and cozy (especially sitting at a booth), very relaxed, great for couples or families

FOOD - We ordered the [PREMIUM SET - $89.95] for 2 which was a lot of food and variety with both Japanese & Korean BBQ. Even the appetizers were all amazing. Definitely get what you pay for. It was the perfect indulgence while visiting Vegas :) 

[KOBE SSAM] - Uni on top of a piece of kobe beef with fresh wasabi. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. SO GOOD.

[TUNA POKE] - A LOT of tuna pieces! Pretty good but the fish was not quite at room temperature. 

[MACAROON ICE CREAM SANDWICH - GREEN TEA] - Free with Check-in. YUM!

Nice place for a first date as the seats are fairly far apart in the booths to allow room for the bbq pit in the middle of the table. A good way to keeps hands busy as well throughout the meal (not a chance of awkward hand holding) but dimly lit enough to make it feel intimate. 

Being overly prepared we called in advance and made a reservation for two along with a toddler requiring a booster seat. Upon arrival right before the dinner rush around 2:45 pm Saturday we were promptly seated and greeted and drinks came out immediately afterwards. Seemed to be the best time to come because it was empty when we first got in and filled right up starting at 3:15. The ice tea was delicious, we had refills. I noticed that the booths basically were benches and were kind of uncomfortable, with a very utilitarian feel that assured me that men probably love flocking here for happy hour with their buddies. I was not wrong once I saw the happy hour menu as it was mostly geared towards beers. We dove right into the menu and ordered pork belly and marinated Kalbi strips to bbq with rice on the side ($1.95) and I ordered the Korean soft tofu soup with seafood. 

Our server was attentive, not overtly friendly but helpful. Since it was just us two girls and we don't eat much we didn't get any appetizers or dessert. The first thing to come out first were the sides, which you get complimentary if you order at least two bbq dishes. There was a variety of them, what I noticed was the pickled vegetables were good, the kimchi was great and the bean sprouts were bland, but that was fine with me. Throwing them in the marinade they provide for dipping might help. Then our meats and my soup arrived. Oh my, delicious. We threw the meats on and I dug into my stew and it was instant love. Although the stone pot it comes in may seem small, the portion was perfect for me. The chef made it perfectly spicy, with a kick of kimchi taste and an egg cracked right in. There was a respectable amount of seafood in there which I appreciated, and the meats, once seared with a nice crust, were super yummy. I only needed half of the large helping of rice that came with my soup before I was full. 

I then turned to the sangria which I order partway through my meal just to try. It was delicious, but made with a dry red wine I didn't love, with blueberries and raspberries floating within. Perfect sweetness though so no complaints, I'm just more of a non-dry white wine person. If you enjoy red, get the sangria. If not, the plum wine might be a better choice as I love Asian plum wines, plus it's cheaper. As a side note, the women's restrooms are well-kept and clean but no place to change your baby so not too friendly for families with babies. 

Overall, thoroughly satisfied with the experience we had there is go back again. The only reason for the one star deduction was that it was a great experience but didn't knock my socks off with value for the price. I would go back though. A definite must for Asian cuisine foodies visiting Vegas!
It is definitely great food, and awesome service.  We will be back soon..:D

This is my favorite Korean restaurant in Vegas! Definitely get the Korean Prime Kalbi you won't be disappointed! Great price for the amount of food we get! Service is fast & they have different things to entertain you while you eat !
Second time in a week at this place and everything was excellent all the food was delicious can't wait to come back here again!
Best place and it's next to UNLV which is a plus! Food is amazing and it has something for everyone!! 10 out 10
Great food. Worked better for us since we don't really eat much. The meat lover for two was more than enough for three of us.

I don't understand the over 3,500 reviews on Yelp and averaging 4 stars. The people were nice and efficient. The wait wasn't too long. We've tried to come before, but heard the wait was over an hour. I think we're spoiled by the amazingly authentic Korean food in the Bay Area where we live. We have a neighborhood in Santa Clara on El Camino filled with great Korean restaurants on both sides of the street. 

There were 4 of us, so we doubled up on the Gangnam dinner and we ordered the steamed egg. They delivered the meats promptly and it was plenty of food. I just didn't think the meat was well seasoned and high quality. It was just okay. We were almost done with cooking and eating the meat and the steamed egg still haven't arrived. We asked our server and a few minutes later, it came out. Unfortunately, the egg was completely overlooked. It was already deflated. The other ones we saw on the other tables seem way better than ours. Seems someone forgot to take it out. 

With all the awesome restaurants in Las Vegas, we have better options for dinner.

Food:3.5 stars little salty for authentic Korean BBQ. But decent overall. Very similar to Gyu-Kaku BBQ taste and menu. Set menus are great for people who are fairly new to Korean BBQ.

Interior: 4.5 stars. Fairly clean for Korean BBQ.
Price: 5 stars very good.
Service: 4.5 stars. 

3-6 pm Happy hour seems like a great deal.

We visited during happy hour and it was fantastic!
50% off Sapporo pitcher and foods were very good.
Also our server was very good:)
We definately come back here!

Ordered the meat lovers for two and a steamed egg and was very happy with everything. Had a great selection of meat and wasn't disappointed by anything- all was good quality. The bulgogi was my favorite. 
I recommend the steamed egg, it was one of the best I've had. The combination also comes with a large salad which was nice. Only thing I would improve is the cucumber kimchi, which was too sweet.

I discovered this place recently after walking the areas near unlv for good places to eat and I have to say I'm very satisfied with the food and the customer service and quality of this place. The food doesn't take long to be served once ordered, it tastes good and there are plenty of complementary side dishes served with any order. The quality and quantity of the food are good and reasonable and definitely a place I will be visiting for lunch and dinner. Also my first time trying Korean food was this restaurant and my first impression is definitely good . I'd like to try more different Korean food and possibly from here. Bonus: I got a macaron ice cream after doing a yelp check in and it was delicious!
Best Korean BBQ I have ever had!!! Everything we ordered was delicious. Furthermore the service was top notch as it was fast and all the servers were kind. Truly a great place to eat

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas! Good portion and reasonable price. I've had a lot of Korean bbq in New York k-town and I can tell you that this place has more varieties with cheaper price. Definitely will come back again.

Love this place. Always come back with my family to enjoy a nice night of chill music and yummy food!! Grilling the food to your own liking is especially dope I highly recommend this place for something new!!!
Open 24/7 perfect to eat whenever. Went in and got serviced right away.  Easy menu cause it's all you can eat. Most try if you're close.
Service is great and the food is on point. We love the Kalbi and bulgogi. Delicious as always.

We went to Gangnam on a Friday night  and the wait was too long (over an hour ). We went back on Saturday around 4:30 pm and had a 20 minute wait which was perfect considering when we were leaving the place was packed with people waiting again . 

 The reason this place is popular is because they serve small dish Korean BBQ so you can try a few more dishes which is especially great for 2 people eating at Korean BBQ . Service was really good and attentive although we didn't get our Korean sides until halfway through the dinner . The meats were good especially the duck breast . The cheesy corn was delicious and the enochi mushrooms were great . Overall one of my favorite KOBBQS in town and will be back !!

This place was a real let down.  I had dinner here with a couple friends and we were all of a similar opinion.  First off the prices are a bit over inflated as is evident by the constant "sale" prices on the menu, everything is apparently half off and it still is not worth it.  We ordered a combination that allowed us to try just about everything they had on the menu.  The only items that I would have given more than two stars were the bulgogi and some fried chicken bites in a spicy sauce.  The scallops we ordered were not cooked properly (almost raw) and had a bit of funky fishy taste to them (in an old scallop way).  The service was very poor and quite slow.  When we brought the quality of the scallops to our server's attention, he commented "well, that just how they are here."
As someone who enjoys good Korean BBQ, I had high hopes for this restaurant, but it simply failed to impress and for the money you would be much happier going somewhere else, like Honey Pig.
very great service and even better food. most definitely gonna return when we come back to Vegas
Great customer service.  Ordered way too much food but was worth it!  White rice was bomb too!

We came on a Saturday night and the restaurant was not busy at all. It has a cute asian decor and very nice ambiance. Patrick the server came and acknowledged us and seat us right away. Since nobody was there at that time he let us chose our own table. He was very friendly and answered all our questions about the menu. He recommended the bulgogi bibimbap to my husband and it was so good! I had the beef kalbi and beef belly. Loved the kalbi but not the belly. After dinner we had dessert. I ordered the friend banana tempura with strawberry ice cream and Man oh Man! Their banana tempura is the best of its kind! Better than PF Changs banana spring rolls. It's worth every calories! I'll probably come back just to order this. :)

Ths place is awesome! I went in with a group of 5 and we ordered the meat lovers dinner for 6 people. Warning though this meal can probably feed 8 maybe 10 people. Everything was delicious right down to sauces! Definitely recommend!
They have awesome food and Great service. The environment was quite lovely as well lovely. Highly recommend
Great place if you like Asian food! Miso soup was good, seaweed salad was good, pot stickers were good, meat was good! Staff was friendly and fast with service. Would defiantly come again!
Excellent Yakiniku style spot. Meat was super tender and well marinated. Service was fast and friendly. Gangnam style platter was plenty for four guys.

Very good Korean bbq. Much better quality, good serving size and more reasonably priced than eating on the strip. A bit odd that they charge separately for lettuce to wrap the meats - not common at a Korean restaurant. Anyway, good food and would definitely come back again.

First time here. we came a few minutes before the happy hour and the host graciously allow us to order from happy hour menu.
we ordered pork belly, salmon, mixed tempura and chicken tender in cheese.
it didn't disappointed :-)
i also like the side dishes.
definitely will visit when we go to LV :-)
Great kbbq place. We both felt it was worth the price and the food was great and delicious! You also grt a free dessert for posting a review afterward!!
ambience here is always amazing. service is great just like the food. lunch special is my favorite during the week.
I love this place! Amazing customer service great food:) great place for party dinners or just a date night!

Food was very good. I love it nice and clean no much smoke come out from grill. They give me a lot of potion set of Las Vegas for 2 people can't finish !# also happy hour a good deal 3pm-6pm so yummy food.

Cons: Been here yesterday and today and both times it was 1.5-2 hour wait. Yesterday we ended up leaving and eating else where since we were starving and we were 33 on the wait list :(  Agree with another poster that the meat can be more fresh. Oysters not all fresh either.
Pros: excellent service and food was good. Overall will come back again probably during happy hour when the wait isn't crazy long :)

The food was all around amazing and I there wasn't much that I particularly stuck out because it was bad. I'd say Im pretty culturally Korean and I know good kbbq when I eat it. The kbbq is a bit pricey and it isn't all you can eat, but it was a great experience. They were very generous and pleasant. Overall I'd come back again with friends and food coma here.

It's not your typical Korean restaurant, meaning it doesn't have the all you can eat Korean BBQ. But if you're looking for quality cut meats this is a great place to dine. Been here already multiple times and still haven't tried all their dishes. Hospitality is really nice and the set up of the place has a relaxing ambience.

Its a value and great deal.  That being said, a foursome (2 couples) with eats and drinks is going to be about $120.  $40 bucks a person, if you want to be like super stuffed.  Otherwise, you can probably get away with $30 a person (tip not included with that price).  Great food, great service, great AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas.   Been here 2x and still loving it.
Food was good and the location is good; many of students come to here. Servers respond quickly and service is pretty well above the average.
If you are sick of waiting in line for great food at the strip area, you should definitely come here. We were seated right away and the food was amazing. The service was quick and awesome!

This restaurant was recommended by locals... and I am so glad I asked about Korean BBQ! 
I am in a food coma...trying to absorb what I just indulged in...'!
Got the meat lovers starter...and a side of pork belly
Amazingly generous portions of meat... and Korean sides. Loved the kimchi!  So much food to taste, with great spicy sauces for dipping. Fun concept with cooking the meal yourself... enjoy the slower relaxed pace, will try it again, so many choices....

DELICIOUSNESS!!! I LOVED it here! Really good food here got the Premium selection in the meat and substituted some stuff we didn't want but everything we got was really good! Definitely will come back here 
It's not all you can eat, you just get the meats that's in your selection box.

They are still awesome as ever!!! Whenever my parents come to town they always request that we come here! It is so much fun cooking our food on the grill in front of us and they are also so knowledgeable about their food and are always willing to help those who are inexperienced with the cook times and their different sauces. They also have amazing appetizers! When I'm working I'll usually order a couple appetizers and make it a meal! Their Spicy Tuna Kimbap, Spicy Chili Dumplings, Cream Cheese Wontons, and Fried Carpaccio are only a few of my favorites!! Ohhh and don't let me forget the broccoli and cheese fondue!! Yes Please! I will forever be a loyal customer! They are great :)

Place is pretty hip. It is a KBQQ joint, and they sell their meats tapas style. I'd suggest to order their korean prime kalbi, brisket, premium beef tongue, kobe style beef, spicy pork, and their filet mignon for meats. They also offer happy hour in which some of the dishes come at a discount that ranges from $2.95-9.95 per tapa order depending on the meats. 

Mixxed veggies are a good choice for sides, kimchee, japanese pepper, mushroom, and asparagus. The stuff with the cheese sides aren't really worth it. I wasn't too fond of the whole cheese dipping thing, and didn't end up using it. 

For the combos, the first time we came, we ordered the Paradise combo. It says it's good for two people, but we split this with a family of four. We don't eat a lot, but it was still enough to fill us up! Well, we also ordered calamari (which was also good! especially their sauce!) and their fried dumplings (beware. it's really spicy).

This place is pretty hip, they also have a nice private room for a big party. They feature this big projector screen that plays a mixture of popular music videos from here and Korea. The Korean music videos are so fun to watch even if I don't understand the language. It's a good way to help the time pass. 

It's a fun hip place to go to, but every time I go it's barely full. Maybe one or two areas are taken.

Excellent Korean BBQ not far from the strip. Beef carpaccio and marinated spare ribs are stand out. Nice sides and good Thai iced tea. Friendly and helpful servers. If this is your thing, you can't go wrong.

Great BBQ. Service is fast and with a smile.  You get 3 unique sauces for your BBQ.  Set plates are plenty for the number of people you order for.  The place doesn't smoke up so there is good ventilation and a nice environment with plenty of space between tables.  Seats could be comfier though.

Very friendly and helpful staff.
The food was fresh, tender, tasty and it was FUN!
Overall it was a great experience. Although a little pricey.

Okay yelpers here's my review. We ordered the following:

1. Harami miso
2. Korean prime Kalbi 
3. Prime Kalbi
4. Kobe Ssam (Uni dish)
5. Uni Bibimbap
6. Spicy soft tofu soup
7. Side of white rice 

Total bill came out to $78.52 for 2 of us before tax  so $90ish after 15% tip. 

I would say the food was 3/4 Korean and 1/4 Japanese style bbq. Korean sides are free and unlimited and if u "volunteer" writing a yelp review u get a free dessert  not the reason I am writing one but hey free is free...

Overall value & price I would say 4.5 out of 5 but with the good customer service it bumps to a 5! Would come back here next time I'm in town! :)


2 days later:

I love the uni bibimbap so much I had to come back here again & get it to go for the road home lol. I had some left over from the 1st time here and  it was still delicious cold. The service person on the phone was pleasant  and helpful. He recommended the bulgolgi bibimbop for the hubby! Will keep u posted on how the food tastes in the car

So here we are in Vegas again May 2016 :)

We're about to drive back home but had to stop for my favorite uni bibimbap!! This dish is served in a stone hot pot so the rice has a nice toasty taste with good amount of uni. 

The quality of meat is pretty good for AYCE place but we usually order a la carte so we don't overeat before we get on the road lol. 

We refer all our families and friends who are in town visiting to eat here! ;)

Til next time...
Meat was very high quality. Side dishes were very good, especially the kimchi. The Kobe ssam was my favorite and a must-try.  The steamed egg was also good.
Love it! I ordered the meat lover. Really good Korean Bbq. Really like the sauce. Recommended.
We ordered both the meat lover and gangnam set and it was fantastic. Great service as well:)

Food was delicious and tasty. I highly recommend the meat lover combo deal.  It was plenty of food for 3 people although it is recommended for 2 people. 

Service was prompt.  We came after prime time.  If you go during prime time, then you can expect to wait a long time.

Having come to your place for a long time  and everything is still amazing. The meet is fresh good tasting the sides are amazing I highly recommend a bigger size of the macaroni salad. I always do ask him to bring me some bean sauce and oil with salt just to intensify the flavors. Good choice when my favorite in Vegas

We had the Las Vegas dinner for two! And boy was it quite a bit of food. Came with even with bimbibap and I was stuffed ! Come here if you are extremely hungry and order the last Vegas I'm not sure how people are able to eat the other orders which seems like more meat and food. Even their salads were exce
Unique place.  Must visit when in Vegas! A little confusing at first but friendly staff is nearby to help out.

Went here to try it out since it has a really good yelp review. For me, it is too expensive for the service that never came back even when our grill is black burnt. Raw food took 10 minutes when it is not even busy. Alot of korean bbq places out there thats better with average review. It is mediocore at its best. Oh well.

WOW. I can safely say we ordered everything on the menu and ATE EVERYTHING! Our favorites were the sukiyaki beef noodles, original bibimbap, spicy pork, squash tempura, and the free side of tofu. Amazing value, and this review got me a free macaroon dessert!

This place is so good! The staff there were really nice and the food was really good. I shared the GANGNAM combo and it was so much food. The meat was pretty good quality & was a well balanced meal. The side dishes were yummy too !

The GANGNAM combo came with 5 cuts of meat & lots of side dishes. Too bad salad wasn't refillable but it was good. There was also an kimchi tofu and bulgogi bibimbap. 

The meat was so good and we were so full after!
This place is amazing and they gave us so much food. We ordered a two people gangnam dinner and definitely fed the three of us and we were super full! We will come back again!

Excellent. ... the sides wowed me! Loved the oyster mushrooms.  Also had tge chili dumplings which were AWESOME. .. I visit LAS often and will be back for sure! Thanks to my BF for pointing me here tonight

Beat Korean bbq in Las Vegas at moderate prices. Lots of choices on a solid menu. 

I enjoyed this place so much I ate here 3 times during a recent 7 day trip to Vegas. 

My only suggestion is to offer guests the scissors at the beginning of the meal if they don't know to ask, especially if they are asking for assistance the entire meal. 

This place was so enjoyable and delicious that I've been looking for a similar place in Phoenix but they are not as reasonably priced.

Excellent service and food! Some of the best Korean BBQ I have had since moving back to America from Korea.

We just enjoyed an amazing lunch here. We ordered Kobe beef carpaccio to start, which really started the lunch off right. It was tender and flavorful... I would definitely recommend it. I would also recommend the pork belly and prime kalbi, but all the meats we tried were delicious!

Oh, and the interior is a plus too. I love the modern look and mix of American and Korean pop music played through music videos on a projector screen. Great place to go with friends!

This is my favorite place to eat and I come here at least twice a month. The sides are the best out of any bbq place I've been to and the quality of the meat is exceptional for the price.  I would suggest coming here for their happy hour!

Love this Asian BBQ cook your own place here. Their Kobe Beef was to die for. It was expensive but it was Da Bomb.com. I mean flavor mix of Japanese, Korean, and Thai. The marinade and Sauces both compliment each other. The Service was excellent, they were very attentive and cute. Lol. But fo' reals they were awesome. So stop in when you are in Vegas. The price was economically friendly for what you get.
Great food, nice service. Best Korean bbq at Vegas. There is waiting line so you have to get there early

We were holed up for too long at the Hard Rock. This place was the perfect place to come.  Great. Great. Great food. Space on the small side, but we only waited 10 minutes. 

Highly recommend. .
The coolest restaurant in Las Vegas. Perfect atmosphere, food and service. And discount for UNLV students!!!!(10%)
BEST Korean food I've ever had. We ordered different dishes and every dish was so delicious, well seasoned and tasty. They served lots of starters. We will definitely come back!!

Came here after a show and got here just in time for Happy Hour (after 10pm.) The food was really good. Marinaded chicken and beef were flavorful after the cook. Ordered 2 bulgogis, chicken w/cheese, seaweed salad, edamame, 2 bowls of rice, a soft drink, and a free macaroon for free check-in and all came out to be $25 and change for HH price. Left $35 cash and out. Friendly staff. Food was brought out quick. Started grilling within 5 mins or less. I'll be back in the future.

I really enjoyed this place!  The food is setup in good portions and the sides that come with it are both tasty and interesting!  I would definitely skip the strip restaurants and try this place instead. I got the filet with bacon wrapped asparagus a long with tempura veggies!

Great place. Tried the spicy ramen with Japanese sausage: Like!  Broth was flavorful and warm, appreciated how it didn't burn my tongue. The serving was hearty, would definitely order again. My partner ordered the BBQ lunch special: 1 item $9.99, 2 item $12.95. Hearty serving as it comes with salad, a few sides like kim chee, etc., and rice. Lots of flavor.

Ambience is awesome, there's 2 tv screens, music in the background, loud enough to hear and enjoy. The decor is hip, chill and clean. The workers are professional and friendly, a place you have to check out and worth the trip if you want to escape from the strip for a couple hours.

The best kbbq place I have had in a loooong time!!!

I came here hoping it would be remotely close to Gyu Kaku (I am a huge Gyu kaku fan and it's one of my favorite restaurants). So I came here with high expectations. 
Long story short, they exceeded all my expectations and more! They started exceeding expectations I didn't even know I had yet! The portions were a pretty big and they had a lot of good side dishes too. PLUS it came with a macaroon dessert!!! Omg as if it couldn't get any better, but it did! 
Anyways you need to try this place! And I'll most definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas!

This is a great restaurant to introduce you to Korean Food.
The grill in the middle of the table is so much fun to cook with your loved one.  We had the lunch special with the beef, rice and salad and some chilli dumplings with the most amazing dipping sauce.  You get about 3 sauces to dip with and all were very yummy.
Christine was our server and she is so sweet and attentive and very genuine, she added to our experience for sure.
I would have given the place 5 stars if it had a little more atmosphere.   But given the area I understand why.
Highly recommend!!!

Awesome, fresh food. Nice touch that you cook for yourself. Very reasonable prices. It's more of a Korean BBQ for those who know what that is. Being out of town I'm sad I can't have this close to my house! Expand into LA already!
Good food . Good service . I love the beef tounge here. Its hard to find places with the tounge. Nice decor fast service

I just order a sea food Ramen because I just need a quick lunch. The food is awesome for me , and service is also better then average. They refilled the sides promptly, so as the food, so I can have the food within 10 minutes.
This is by far the best korean place I've been to here in Vegas! Sue is sooo attentive.. Really good food.. Love this

My husband and I found this place while we were visiting Las Vegas. The reviews were very positive, and so we tried it. Never again. Very pricey compared to the quality that was prepared. The staff was nice and offered good service. The restaurant decor was great. The quality of meat was poor considering we paid a lot for a small amount. We walked in excited, but left disappointed.

Got food poising from the eating the raw oysters and was in bed for two days straight! Also, you will come out smelling disgusting like you were working in a kitchen all day. This place is all hype! Pay a high price to cook your own food, yea no thanks. I rather pay to have someone cook my food and not smell like I was working in the kitchen all day. But seriously, the food poising is the only reason I writing the review.
Awesome happy hour, I mean come on how can you beat 3 dollar bulgogi! Plus I've never seen cheese fondue offered at a kbbq but it was cool and a little different! Tasty dried squid!
Awesome, top notch quality meat, delicious. Would highly recommend to anyone who likes Korean barbeque.

So good!  Food is great, great for families and so many great dessert choices!  Remember that they don't take same day reservations and only take reservations for parties of 8 or more. If you are craving some really great Korean BBQ with some great ambiance... This is the spot on the strip!
Really great Korean BBQ!!! All the meat marked by the restaurant are worth to taste! Very delicious!!

Korean barbecue is my all time favorite food. This place is probably one of the best places I've ever eaten at. The meat is tender and service is exceptional. We got option #1 for $68. It came with fresh oysters, filet, prime Kalabi, bulgogi, and other items. I highly recommend!

First time here going off previous yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. Great customer service from sit down to check out. Food was amazing and not overpriced compared to the strip. Can't wait to go back again.

!!!have to check this place!!!
food - great [beef toro]
service - friendly
price - fair [5ppl $35]
 
8.5 / 10 pts

* all the beef are great

Best Korean BBQ I've ever been to. Great experience. Alot of food for a great price! There is alot of variety and deals to choose from. Definitely recommend this place. Will be coming back next time we're in town.

One of the best korean bbq experiences i've ever had. The quality of the ingredients was excellent. The kimchi was AMAZING. Seriously I could keep eating it. The short rib and spicy chicken was dank. Must try if you like bbq
Awesome place! Kalbi is really delicious. You definitely should get a Asahi with the meat!

Went here last night with my husband for dinner since we haven't had Korean BBQ in a few months and we saw this place had some good ratings. 
When we walked in we were greeted and seated immediately by the host/server. He was very polite and, thank goodness, spoke really good English! 
We already looked at some of the stuff on their menu before we got there so we had a pretty good idea of what to order. 
We ordered a few choice of meats: Bulgogi, flat iron garlic, beef toro, Korean prime rib kalbi, and the Harami Miso. The last two I mentioned were definitely a must have and it's also in the top two of their best sellers. The meat was really great quality and flavor was perfect. 
They also had three different meat sauces that they provide which is perfect for the other meats that may not already be seasoned. 
I love the little booths that they had as well. Only thing I probably would improve from this place is to have refillable hot tea and to have the sesame oil with salt side as something already provided for. I've never been to an Asian BBQ place that doesn't already do that so I guess that's why I mentioned that. 
But other than the last two things, the entire place was awesome and highly recommended. I would go back there again with friends for sure!
Extraordinary food. We came in at happy hour and the Sapporo from the tap was really good. Decent prices and service is very fast and friendly. Great place, definitely coming back!
I cannot say more good things about this place. The quality of food was really good and nice service. I strongly recommend this place for family meal

I visited this place because the review was quite good.
Yes, as other people mentioned, quite nice plce for casual dinner.
We ordered #1 appitizer Kobe Ssam.
For 2pieces are expensive than others.
But most of this kind of place is like this.
Not bad.

Steaned egg is quite nice.
Quite clean and new. 
Staffs are nice. 
But a bit noisy.
Meat was good, food was amazing, service was the best! I recommend it , everyone you should come here!

A party of six all really enjoyed Gangnam.  We even had  a few first timers to this type of dining and they both thoroughly immersed themselves.  The condiments sauces where on point.  I like a variety of dipping sauces to change up the meal and I was really surprised how good they where (we had five different ones.)

The meats where perfect and plentiful.  While nothing really stood out above the rest, they all were consistently good.  We ordered the meat lover combo and we were not disappointed.  

We were lucky to get the room in the back to ourselves which made it a very enjoyable experience with the loud personalities that were in attendance

I will be back!

the food is great and the service is amazing. the songs they played are really up to date. we ordered the gangnam combo for 6 and it is so much that it can feed up to 10 people. we'll definitely comeback!
It was good. the food tasted good especially the original bibimbap and yukgejang. You get free macaron ice cream when you leave a review.

Excellent service and I especially liked their variety within the menu!

I'm looking forward to coming back there with my wife

Got the prime combo meal for two. Came with much more than expected, all delicious. Service is great & comes often. Recommend coming for happy hour, 3-6 & 10-1, 50% off all drinks. Good stuff, more than enough for two.

I grew up in Korea for gd chunk of my life and I live in ktown in LA now. So I know what gd kbbq taste like. This place really treated me and my friends really well, especially server Sooyeon was just so awesome!!! (So thank you haha) Super friendly and great service. We'll definitely be back here again!

Stopped by here while in Vegas on a business trip, was impressed! Bibimbap was flavorful and all the bbq meats were fresh and well seasoned. Would recommend going during Happy Hours so you can grab some deals.
Omg best value in happy hour and nice service!! We had a group of five and our happy hour bill was under a bill and we had a huge table of food!! So yummy!!
Amazing good. One of the best spicy tofu soup yet. Very generous with the meat portion.

First time here...they explained everything and the food is so yummy!! We didn't order the two BBQ dishes required to get sides and she brought us sides anyways. The fish cake was good and the fried calamari was also good. We got the pork belly and beef toro....so yummy!
probably one of the best dining experiences I've had for my birthday.  thank you! The food is fantastic and the service even better.

Taste good, combo for two on the menu is worth the price! Environment is clear and feel comfortable! The Korean lady is very nice and always smiles to customers! The service are great! They refill the side dishes all the time!

Top notch ingredients, sauces, and marinades. Hip place with a projector playing music videos and a cool vibe. What's crazy is that it is actually a great value too, not including extra cheapness on the happy hour menu. Check it out!

First timer here!!! We flew into Vegas this am and wanted a good dinner! Found this on top restaurants and boy oh boy they did not disappoint! My husband and I got one of their combos for 2 and it's was plenty!! We surely thought it would be waaay to much food, but it was too delicious to stop eating! Trust me when I say this place was amazing!!! The ambiance, efficiency and freshness were just a name of the few things this great place had to offer! Yum, fun and cool! Wish we had this back home in Florida! Try it!!!

Enjoyed a fabulous meat lovers meal for two at the Ganham Asian BBQ restaurant with my hubby.  Succulent meat thinly sliced for cooking on the Hibachi grill. Customer service was above reproach. The ambiance set a mellow mood with music thumping to help the food digest nicely. Side dishes of  potato salad,Kim chi cucumbers,steamed mushrooms.

This is not an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ place.  However, the quality and service makes it a much better deal than the AYCE places.  Quality, customer service, and location makes this a highly recommend restaurant

I'm pretty sure that this is not the best Korean bbq place in town, but yelpers love it here! We came on a weekend and the restaurant didn't seem too busy on a Saturday night around 9p but we still had to wait for a table. 

The three of us ordered bulgogi, kalbi, japche, and dynamite shrimp. The food wasn't bad and I enjoyed it but the service was non-existent and the vents over our heads was leaking water, which kind of turned me off. A drop of water even hit my head so I moved spots. 

Our bill came to around $50 which is normal at a Korean restaurant. I'm not sure if I'll be back, but the food did hit the spot.
They were so friendly & food was great! I ordered a Bibimbap and it was really big & yummy. My friends got beef & noodle & soup, and we all enjoyed the food! Will come back soon
Good service,  nice menu selection,  good vibes! I  live in San Diego where there's a lot of BBQ and on top of that, Im married to a Korean.  Believe me, this place is Fire!

Only reason I am not giving five star is because of lack of service, otherwise this place is close to strip, price is right, quality meat, and good banchan. Usually Las Vegas kbbq doesn't have good banchan, but this place has all. Service need improve for sure, bunch of young kids serving
Good Korean bbq for very reasonable prices. The best is that this restaurant is right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel where I stayed, and opens until 1am.
The short ribs were very tasty and the experience was memorable.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.
Super yummy food!! Friends and I came for happy hour and your selections come with side dishes it was a lot kid fun to cook your own food. Nice environment; Back was our server he was awesome!

Place is visible right on the shopping center. We had a party of 7 people and waited roughly about an hour.

The service was decent and the food was great.

I gave this place four stars due to the accommodations. It was super hot inside and it felt like there was no AC inside the building. Our server didn't check on us often and we had to ask for water unfortunately. 

I'll recommend the Korean prime and miso. It's so tender and delicious!!

Would I recommend this place? Only if you have time to kill.

This place is pretty good. We got the meat lovers and split it three ways and it was just the right amount of food. (We did order extra beef brisket, though.) 

All of the cuts of meat were excellent, the side salad that came was the best side salad I have ever seen at a kbbq restaurant before, and the grill we had was perfect. (Usually you come across bad cold or hot spots on grills, but theirs was great.)

The only thing I didn't care for was the speed of service. Took a while to get our food, and desert took a long time. Service with expeditiousness aside was fine. Hostess and servers were very nice.

Would I recommend this place to others? Yes.
Would I come back here myself? Yes.
Awsome awsome place to eat highly recomend there banana deserve was delicious.  Loved the BBQ here I'm in love

Legit Korean BBQ style restaurant right by Thomas & Mack Center and off the strip! It's a trendy but intimate type place that kind of looks like the place in Rush Hour 2 where they're singing karaoke. But be different than me and order 1 of their 3 best sellers, I tried to order brisket and filet mignon like I was in Texas because they will cook that filet well done! But the short ribs are legit, and so is the flank steak! It comes with 6 authentic sides if you order two or more dishes and the cost are reasonable per dish! You can eat 2 or 3 by yourself or go with a large group and order the whole menu and share everything

The food here was fantastic but what took it from a 10/10 to the next level is the service. I want to give a huge thank you to Beck, Ashley and Andrew. Each of them was very personable, fun and added laughter and wonderful memories to our evening. I will definitely go back next time I visit and will recommend this restaurant to anyone that visits. Thanks again for a spectacular evening.

The portion size for two was perfect. By the end we were very full and had a hard time finishing up the last bits! The meat were flavorful and there was lots of sides! Would recommend!

-Edmund


We had a meat lovers plate for two and it was great for a first meal in Vegas. My favorite part was the green apple soju (tasted like a jolly rancher) and the spicy pork. The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very helpful! 

-Kristen

I am all about the Gangnam style at this delicious restaurant.  Why spend your money on some terrible buffet in Vegas that you will probably be regretting the next day?  Do yourself a favor....venture off the strip and have yourself a feast of grilled meats, fresh veggies and refreshing adult beverages.  Refuel and power up for your evening. You are gonna need the strength.

We timed our visit for the happy hour specials and spent a nice afternoon sampling so many tasty dishes.  It was not crowded at all at 3pm on a Saturday.  Plenty of parking in the lot outside.
