Check in on Yelp for a free macaroon ice cream sandwich for dessert!!

This was my first time that I was at a Korean restaurant that does not serve roasted corn tea.  Instead, they offered me black or green tea ... which was brought out as a cup of hot water with a tea bag in it.  Very disappointing.  Should have left right then and there.  Asian place that serves tea like that can't be good. 

We ordered three beef sides for our bbq.  Banchan included macaroni salad (?!?) and old, soft kimchi. The meats were tender and had good flavor, but the portion sizes were so small!  These were the smallest portion sizes I have ever had in a Korean bbq place. We also ordered lettuce and miso paste side ($2.50) to make bbq wraps, but what we got was celery sticks and romaine lettuce.  How do you wrap romaine lettuce?  In total, we spent ~$50 and left filled with mostly rice... 

Service: although served relatively fast, the waiter never stopped by to ask if we need a refill (water, sides) on anything.

Considering what you get for the money spent, I do not recommend this place.  And all the people giving this place five stars ... do yourself a favor, look for a better place.  There are better places.

Great food great service and great beer! 
All the the servers were very nice. 
Coming from LA, there aren't many others bow places compared to this one.

Good vibes, good music. Servers are awesome! The meat is good, considering it's in Vegas. The appetizers aren't as authentic but it's good if you don't look at it culturally. Take advantage of the happy hour and get drinks half off! Booze and fountain drinks are all half off~

Visiting vegas for the first time and read amazing reviews for this place and I can honestly say I'm not disappointed! Food and service was amazing and free desert! Premium for 6 people and it was more than enough food for everyone. Kobe beef and kalbi was amazing but was not a fan of the poke (still semi frozen) or the oysters. Overall very happy.

Every item we ordered was amazing! Our favorites were the jalapeno salmon poppers( best ever!), also the bacon wrapped salmon was super good!! The sweet cream corn was delicious!! And let's not forget the coffee macaroon for dessert!! We ordered a total of 10 items!!! and there was just two of us!! We're so happy, and can't wait to come back! Service is excellent and fast, so was the food!

A bit pricey and as with many Korean establishments in Vegas the service can be spotty. However, the cuts and general offerings are solid though they could give more portions considering the ala carte pricing (no AYCE option). Side dishes are nice too but it's quite jarring to see that they charge for free banjan like sauces, lettuce and rice.

VERDICT: Clean, newly renovated, but tough meats.

QUALIFIER: Came in right after happy hour and right before dinner rush on week night.

FOOD: Went with Gangnam package. Even the tender filet was relatively tough, but still softer than other served steak. Salad was refreshing and not too sour. Favorite was Harami Miso for the flavor.

SERVICE: Very attentive waiting staff, quick refilling drinks, coming by asking if food is ok and side dishes replaced.
Great place for Korean BBQ when visiting Las Vegas. Good value and price. Good service!
This korean restaurant was AHMazing. Best kk bbq in vegas! If your looking for delicious meat and good vibes here is the place.

Excellent food, service and experience! Honestly, a must go if you are in Vegas. The only reason it is not a 5 star is because of the wait. I'd suggest a text messaging system if waiting is longer than an hour. During our hour wait, we walked around CVS and they local shops, but kept running back every 15 minutes to make sure our name wasn't being called. Either way, it is worth the wait! Great quality food and extremely well priced!

Service: Always on point. There may be a wait when you come on a busy Friday or Saturday night, but they are always very nice and courteous. 

Atmosphere: Cozy and cute. Much better decorated than a lot of other KBBQ around town. 

Food: AMAZZZZING! Being a LA native, we are constantly being spoiled with $9.99 to $16.99 AYCE KBBQ so it was a change to get out of the cheap AYCE mentality, but this place is definitely worth it! The portions are good, it will definitely fill you up. I usually get the "Gangnam" meal. 

Price: It is a little bit on the pricey side compared to AYCE, but the meat quality makes it more than worth it. 

Highly Recommend!

Awesome tasting food. Marinated kalbi was flavorful. Didnt need the sauces but tried it & it was good. Kimchi was good. Got the kobe appetizer, pork belly & cold noodles.  Everything was good. Came here because of the good ratings & it did live up to the hype. Liked the clean facility & decor.
Awesome food and great service! Plenty of food in the portions the Spicy chicken with Lemon sauce was my favorite.
3rd time fab food excellent service. Food is fresh love the ribeye and asparagus. Definitely will be back locals eat here

Very authentic Korean bbq. The Kobe beef is awesome! The bibimbop is great too. 

It is close to the strip.
Amazing! Great experience, great food, great service. Lots of fun to cook the food and the sides were delicious.

This was the best Korean bbq that I've had in a very long time! The prices were very reasonable and the marinated Kalbi was excellent! This will be my regular stop when I'm in Vegas. This is a must try if you're in town. We came at about 4:30pm on a weekday to avoid the crowd. Yelpers were right about this place.

Worth the 45 min wait! Their Kobe beef was amazing. The service was fast and amazing. Between the four of us we got 7 tapas which cost less than the combo and we got to choose all the meat we wanted. We were so full from the tapas but if you check in you get free dessert. The meat was so tender, juicy and flavorful.

The marinated kalbee is good and the sidedishes as well. the place is nice and clean.  I didn't like the music videos in the front of the restaurant were playing with explicit language but they quickly accommodated us to a table where my kids can be seated far away from it. The service was quick and good too. The mulnyeng myun was bland and tuna kimchi had too much mayo. I would return for the kalbee though...

First time at Gangnam Asian BBQ, I have to say  its so delicious!! I love the fact that you can experience to cook your own food, the meat is full of flavor & so tasty, the servers r great and have great service
The best korean bbq restaurant ever...everything is very delicious...service very nice and fast...i like here the most

Came in on Saturday night and this place was totally empty. I was a party of 1 because I had been desperately craving Korean BBQ. The prices are pretty reasonable, although I know most of you will whine that they aren't AYCE. They have slightly lower prices on certain meats during lunch and happy hour. I started off with the typical pork belly, beef brisket and seaweed salad. I must say the quality of meats is a step above the other AYCE places on Spring Mtn. hence you get what you pay for. Both meats were very delicious and I was still a tad bit hungry so my server recommended to me pork toro. The meat was just okay and I actually prefer the pork belly instead of this, plus it's cheaper too. The service was good for the most part, but since the place was empty, at one point the server and host both disappeared on me, which delayed me from ordering my second round of meat. It wasn't too big a deal because someone eventually appeared again in the dinning room. I live really close to this place and I will probably be coming more often. This is a perfect option if you want Korean BBQ, but your waistline can't afford to do AYCE. Also a nice place for lunch, because if I would of stuck to the beef brisket, pork belly and rice my bill would of been around $10. Can't wait to come back especially since eating here won't break my budget.
Food was good, clean environment and friendly service. Side dishes were plain and meat portions were small. Pork belly was tough

Perfect portions. Great quality. Would come here again for sure. This place is awesome for my Paleo-ish diet. Happy hour after 10pm.. What??? Had to order a few more things. And how could you not go for that Macaroon ice cream sandwich they tease you with at the door.

I'm a big fan of happy hour so I decided to check it out here. Excellent choice! The food is fantastic and we received superb service the entire time. I will be back! My favorites are the bulgogi, spicy chicken, and ginger cocktail. Wonderful!

This place is so close to where I live so I was very excited to check it out with all the good reviews. Came here for their nightly happy hour after 10pm. Ordered cream cheese wonton, mushroom medly, jalape√±o poppers, calamari, pork belly, beef toro, spicy pork and Korean chicken cheese fondue.

Cream cheese wonton: All it was is wonton wrapper with literally only cream cheese inside, fried and served with sweet sauce. Pretty bland and disappointing. 1/5

Mushroom medly: Just different types of mushrooms that was mixed with melted butter. 2/5

Jalape√±o poppers: Pop of deliciousness! Jalape√±o sliced in half stuffed with cream cheese and crab and deep friend drizzle with sweet dressing. 5/5

Calamari: Crispy calamari with the spicy mayo dip sauce, average. 3/5

Pork belly: So good, you can never go wrong with pork belly. Slapped this on the grill and once crispy on both sides... With rice it's amazing. 5/5

Beef toro: Basically brisket... My friend enjoyed this very much. 4/5

Spicy pork: Meh 2/5

Chicken cheese fondue: Grilled the chicken and cheese however once dipped into cheese it was way chunky and not good. Aye the chicken alone. 1/5

Overall the food was ok, but I prefer Korean BBQ at tofu hut. The dipping sauces don't really stand out to me, one was sweet and one  is spicy... But I still love my sesame dipping sauce at tofu hut. The quality of meat is better but as far as the taste, tofu hut is way better. I didn't know during happy hour they don't give you rice? I had to ask for rice for both of us, but my server only came back with one bowl of rice... So we split the rice. 

Overall, this place is good... My first time trying Japanese BBQ.

Good food, good service, a little long a wait but worth it! We did show up on New Year's Eve at 6:30 pm and were only waiting for 20 minutes which wasn't too shabby. The food is super affordable and delicious so I highly suggest this restaurant!

Very solid kbbq for the strip area. Price is very reasonable. Could go for some more banchan (side dishes) and a bit much that rice does not come included with the minimum bbq meat order. Short ribs were the best out the meat we got, which included pork belly beef brisket. Sauces were also a little sweet for my taste, but overall a solid experience!

What can I say, this is the best Korean place I've gone to in LV ever and I've been to almost all of them. What makes this place good is that the service is attentive and the prices are affordable, especially during their happy hours that run from 3-6pm and 10pm-close. The HH is worth going to if you plan on eating a lot and drink alcohol. I don't drink that much alcohol anymore so when I'm in LV you can catch me here beyond HH.

The variety of the food items is pretty stellar also. I'll admit the value isn't as great as some AYCE Korean places like Gen but the quality is good and taste better than what I've had in LV before going here. The atmosphere is pretty cozy also. I like the hugeness of the booths and the quality of the grill that cooks my food. I highly recommend this place if you are looking to eat off the strip or away from Chinatown.

Plus, they give you a free dessert if you write a review of the place. No, I'm not being bought off my rating with a dessert it really is what I think of the place.  It doesn't hurt that they offer this for new reviews of the restaurant though...nice!

Oh my...I started writing in Yelp again for a dessert.

Not even open a week, this restaurant has problems with kitchen efficiency and with service. It's almost like they all just showed up and started doing things without any prior conversation or coordination.

They haven't got a liquor license yet and still they won't allow patrons to bring their own wine! 
Now that's just dumb. Virtually every other restaurant in town, and especially the ones with no liquor license will allow corkage.

I asked if they'll allow corkage once they DO get a license, and the answer was "we'll take it under advisement". 

Well, I've got news for these guys: I'll take it under advisement as to whether I ever return.

First things first - their kimchi was DELIGHTFUL. I ate two servings all on my own. Does anyone know where they buy it or if they make it in house? I straight up just had their kimchi and fried rice. 

Ordered the Premium set with a side order of pork belly. Everything came out great, except for the beef carpaccio (which was SOAKED and DRENCHED in sauce. I had to "wring" out the sauce to enjoy the meat) and their poke (couldn't even take a bite). 

The highlight was not even the harami kobe style beef, it was all the other parts. 

Left sufficiently full (despite not eating the poke) and like their banchan (their kimchi man....)

We were a little skeptical when we walked in because it wasn't too crowded. It started to fill in after awhile. We got the Gangnam set dinner and everything was really tasty.  Service was fast and friendly.  I wasn't sure it was going to be enough food for us, but we're going to leave with a happy, full tummy.

Service was very attentive and they worked well as a team. I dined solo, wait tonight for a table was about 50 minutes for groups. No wait at the bar and full food menu available at the bar counter that seats about 8.

The complimentary side dishes are plentiful and fresh. I ordered three appetizers and they were great. This is my second visit. Look forward to returning.

Is not one star but I'm tempted to give it.  Do not be fooled by the 4.5 stars.  They offer free desert for a good yelp review.  Hence the reviews.  The food was 3.5 stars at best.  Throw on atrocious service they deserve one or two.  

The bbq wasn't horrible but it certainly was no where near 4.5 stars.  It took 30'minutes to settle the check.  The bbq wasn't warm enough, they didn't provide scissors to cut meat, the seasoning was just ok.  They meat was not cut appropriately.  They brought 3 glasses of water to 5 person table. None of the little things went right.  The seasoning was meh as well.

This place is delicious! Our first night and very first trip to Vegas, I decided for the group that we would have Korean BBQ . This restaurant popped up and had almost 3,000 reviews?! You have got to be kidding me.. that is a lot of reviews, so of course.. we HAD to try it and let me tell you, it was not a disappointment. 

We got there around 7:10pm and there was a little wait.. maybe 20 or so minutes. Not too bad because they were filled. 

We ordered the Gangnam special but added spicy garlic fatty meat, japche, and bulgogi fried rice. We ordered calamari and fried dumplings for appetizers too. The food is absolutely delicious, but my only itty bitty complaint is the calamari was kind of bland... but everything else was soooo good!! All of the meats were flavorful and extremely tender. Everything was just on point and the service was great too. On yelp, there was also an option to get a free macaron ice cream with checking in and we were able to get 3 of them. We tried mango, coffee, and green tea. The coffee is the best in my opinion... real coffee flavors, so good!

You will not be disappointed! I want to come here again when I come back in August
Kimchi was alright. I tried their kimchi bibimbap and it was fairly good. Atmosphere is cool. They were quick to seat us and they give a free dessert for writing a review!!!

We always love to have the Korean foods wherever we go so, we went to this place while we were at Vegas but it was almost at midnight so, they were closing soon unfortunately. We just ordered the BBQ and went picked it up. It was still very good foods and the server there was very nice, polite and patience to us even though they are closing for the night. Just wish we had more time to experience at the restaurant but next time for sure. The BBQ was good flavor, easy to eat, right amount of rice and meat. Especially the dessert was A+ .

Server was named Back was a really great server, was visiting from San Diego and San Diego has some really great KBBQ places, so eating here made me feel like I was back in SD, great atmosphere, great food, and great customer service, would definitely come back

This is the perfect spot to take friends who are unfamiliar with Korean cuisine.

The menu covers appetizers, some fusion (Korean-Japanese) dishes as well as traditional Korean BBQ meats.

The restaurant is nice and clean and there is a grill in the center of each table to cook the meat.

We had a party of six and two of our guests had no previous Korean dining experience.
They liked the fact that we prepared our own food. They even had forks for these poor souls.

The outcome was that everyone had a great time and wanted to come back again when we return to Las Vegas for next year's convention.

All the items are per portion so I imagine it might take a visit or two to get the quantities right.

The server was very friendly and hip and ready to assist all the various levels of guests entering Gangnam.
The food here is absolutely delicious and the service was amazing. I love the a la carte setting and how you can try a little bit of everything.

I am not a big fan of Korean BBQ, but this place is amazing. It's a hidden gem across from Hard Rock and it's open late. The service is always quick and friendly. My favorite thing on the menu is the rock shrimp!

I like to come here whenever I am in town, it is conveniently located near the Red Roof Inn if you drive in from the back on Swenson.
 
Very yummy as always. The prices are reasonable as well. I had the bugolgi, beef toro, and harami miso.

On my previous visits I let them cook it for me. This time I cooked it myself.

UPDATED: updated after I ate my free yummy banana tempura. I got it free for posting a review.

Service was really slow.

Really fun place. Lots of food experiences available. We went during happy hour so took advantage of all the deals getting lots of choices then adding the sides they bring to everyone we had more than enough make sure you don't mind cooking as the meat is self prepared at the grill in your table. Fun!

Very long wait. Food is ok. I don't know what is with all the hype. Maybe because of the wire grill. Price is up there. Service is Nice. Place decor is really cool. Order their #1 combo. The meat was a bit chewy. The mushroom wasn't good. The oyster was good. Don't think I'll be coming back

After 100 minutes of wait, we finally got a table. Went for the #1 Gangnam beef dinner for 4 ppl, cuz we were starving. Food is very good. Meat is a surefire 5 stars. All the side dishes are good and full of flavor.  Service is good, but our server was so busy to the point of forgetfulness(but he was definitely cute), therefore, four stars for that. My biggest complaint would be the cold draft being let in constantly by the opening and closing door as our table was close to the door.  My kids will beg to come back here, so yes for another successful find on Yelp! Now I can enjoy my free dessert for posting a review
It's a great dining experience! The food is great, the music is great, and the atmosphere is very welcoming! Loved my entire experience!
The food is great and very well priced. My wife thought her filet was not the best quality but I thought it was fine. For the price you cant beat it. I would come back for sure.
Great BBQ, decent prices. Just do yourself a favor and do not order Kobe Beef- its really not worth the money. Every other meat on the menu is way better.
Great food! Love the kimchi bibimbap! Awesome bbq.. And lemonade soju!!! Great place to hang out..
This place is great! Warm atmosphere, friendly staff,  and great food, especially the bimbimbap with beef. I will definitely tell people about this place and I will definitely be back.

First time  trying Japanese BBQ and I gotta say it was fun and tasty! The atmosphere was nice and cozy. The help was really friendly. The food was amazing. I would recommend anyone to eat here. The only thing to watch out is the food servings. They give a lot! So you may want to share a meal
Good food. Great service! We walked in and they served us in minutes. Food came flying out. Will return.
Great food... great tasting beef, friendly staff. Clean restaurants great location. Would definitely recommend and come back again! For sure would come back when in Las Vegas.
Awesome place!  My son loves to cook his own steak. Celebrating my nieces birthday. Perfect portions and excellent service!!

So came here for Lunch on a Saturday. Food was okay. However, the service was absolutely horrendous.  They weren't very busy at all. It took 45 minutes to bring out our beef toro and we asked about it twice, and they said the kitchen is still slicing it. We ordered combo fried rice and specifically said only chicken and beef. They brought it out with shrimp too, and when we told them, our sever said he'll just take out the shrimp for us. Umm.. No.. The rice tastes like shrimp now. Overall service was horrible, has to request more water 3 times, request for the grill to be changed, request for my check after waiting 15 minutes.

The reviews on YELP are totally FAKE because they offer a free dessert if you review them. No body is going to show them a 1 star review to get a dessert.

Definitely do not recommend.

This place is phenomenal!!! Food is unbelievably good. Service impeccable. Best place we've eaten in America, hands down. Get off the strip and come here. Great value for money and again the food was awesome!!!
2nd time here! This place is by far becoming one of our favorites! Good food and Kristen and get crew are very attentive. Love it here. Our faves are the pork belly,kalbi and calamari. Happy tummy
Professional staff and great food, at affordable price.  Be prepared to be stuffed - the portion sizing is big+...
Great food food at a reasonable price. A good find not to far off the strip.
First time here. Everything was great. Came during happy hour and bulgogi was my fav !!

First time ever eating Korean BBQ and I must say, awesome experience!    Definitely a place to come and hang out, enjoy eating with family and friends and experience different flavors of multiple dishes.  Five plus stars all around!

Lovely place. Very authentic Korean meal. Probably one of the best Korean bbq places I've been. There was quite some people so the wait was pretty long but that's expected for pretty good restaurants. The atmosphere is also very nice too, although it's not big, the tables are spread out so it's very roomy. The waiter we had was super nice, 5 stars!!

Love this place! You would think in Vegas you can get a decent meal any time of the day but not so! This place is open until 1am and the food is delicious and extremely reasonable for Vegas. The service was fast and efficient! It is popular and wait was a bit long on the weekend (45min) and they don't take reservations. Full disclosure, restaurant offers free dessert in exchange for Yelp review.

This is my go-to restaurant whenever I'm in Las Vegas. My kids always beg me to take them here, and we are never disappointed. They are very considerate to my dietary restrictions, and they provide high quality meats and sides for a low price with a radiating ambiance. if you are in the area, make visiting this restaurant a priority.
This place was so amazing! The service was great and the food was delicious! They always refilled my drink so fast. The servers were super helpful!

Delicious! We had the meat lovers for two people and it fed our family of four.Excellent service, awesome atmosphere would prefer more k pop.But the side dish selection  is limited. The meat was delicious and tender.
Service and food were both really good! Would recommend for anyone looking for high quality kbbq in Las Vegas :)
This place is cool. The service was as amazing as the food. Awesome atmosphere and interior good! I recommend this place!

Love love love this place. I got the premium package (6people) for my family (10) order a few more beef tongue and couldn't finish it all. The portion is huge, even tho they wrote for 6 but if you're not one of those who's in food competition then you would have plenty for 6. From what I recall the package include 4 types of beef, shrimp, scallops, poke, prosciutto, salad and tons of banChan. I love how they gave my niece a chocolate lava cake for her bday as a gift then I checked in a got a free mango macaron icecream which both tasted super delicious. Food and serving wise are both wonderful. Will definitely come back if I visit Vegas next time.
I came this place a couple days ago and I came here today with my gf again. we are from NY and We really love this restaurant. I will miss this restaurant !!!!
Vriendelijk personeel, snelle service, eten was van goede kwaliteit en vooral erg lekker!
the bacon wrapped asparagus tho! they give you a lot of , so that's good. great service and free dessert with review huhu. bring a jacket! it's cold in here...

Hands down my fav Korean restaurant on earth... oh my!!!!!!! Their food and service are unbelievably fast. Food is tasty and meat is well marinated. I would come here every week if I'm around. Everything I've tasted so far is fantastic!

Great place! The line was long even at night, but it was worth the wait. Food was amazing. My favorites were the pork belly, miso beef, and bibimbap. 

Service was prompt and everything was very well-priced for the quality. I would definitely come back!
The food was so delicious. Definitely be back for the bulgogi, spicy pork and torso.  I also enjoyed their dessert the ice cream macaroons.  The service was great as well.

Pretty standard Korean bbq with Japanese influences... The wait staff is pretty nice. The liquor is cheap and so is happy hour.... Compared to LA OR NYC KBBQ... It's on the pricier side but the atmosphere and decor is ok.

After reading all the good review on yelp.  We decided to give it a try.  This place serve some good meat, especially love bulgogi.  On top of the good food they also have awsome service. Will be coming back next time in Vegas.
Super good & spicy ramen! Everything we ordered tasted amazing and the atmosphere was really chill, totally nice place to go. Service was awesome as well.

This Korean BBQ hit the spot. Great service and delicious food. We called In a Reservation the night prior since  we had a big party. Next day we called them to let them know we'd be running a little late  they kindly held our table for us. 

Not AYCE but the quality is great. The sides were complimentary if you order two meats per person. Overall great experience.
Fantastic food!! Everything was great,,recommend the Spicy Tuna Kimbap but loved everything we had.
Really good food and a fun experience. Make a reservation or prepare to wait a long time.
Really enjoyed the atmosphere.  The ordering system is easy. Not tons of meat per plate. Filet mignon was very tender. Jalape√±o poppers were great!

Awesome place....I recommend this place to bring on a date or with family and friends
Excellent service and our server Kristin was amazing! She was very attentive and genuine!

I would call this a hidden gem of Vegas!  I found Gangnam on Yelp and Yelp reviewers did not steer me wrong!  It's off of Paradise and Harmon, just across the way from the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino (in the same area as the CVS).  We had to call because we didn't see a sign  in the advertisement section, but it's there!  

When we arrived it was happy hour.  Their happy hour beer was INSANE!  We paid $8.50 for a pitcher of beer!  $8.50!!!  Our server was so awesome!  Since this was our first time here she helped us figure out what we wanted on the menu AND also helped with putting the meat on the grill and letting us know when it was ready.  This was probably one of the most reasonably priced and filling meals we had in Vegas!  They're meal for two combos are huge!  Don't be afraid to ask for their help (cooking or picking something to eat), everyone is really nice!  The ambiance is really good too! When we were on our way out there was a bit of a line, so I definitely recommend calling ahead and making some sort of reservation.

If you're trying to walk to this place from the strip and it's well over 100 degrees, reconsider!  There isn't much shade, the sidewalk is narrow and it isn't worth it!  I learned the hard way lol! 

We will definitely be back!
Found this gem after a FULL DAY OF SHOPPING... And thank god we did, we leave Vegas tomorrow and wanted to eat something good :))!!

What a treat. A fine Korean restaurant that I can walk to from home. Heaven. It has a terrific ambience without being overly expensive. I've met clients here twice and both were very appreciative. (I was glad for the access to WiFi as well as the great food, service and atmosphere)

I did miss getting the free banchan, but the Kimchee is free upon request. Don't forget to ask. And the price is less than I expected so you can still order little side dishes individually. 

Get the Bul-Go-Gi and grill it yourself. 

Oh and they'll play the Gangnam music video for you on the big screen if you ask. :)

Clean and chic Korean restaurant! Came here for lunch on a Friday.  This place serves quality meat you can taste. Service is very quick and friendly. The side dishes are all tasty. There are korean music videos playing inside, keeping patrons entertained and in the korean mood. The spicy tuna kim bap was the surprise of the meal - very tasty. The Kimbap  was fried with marinated spicy tuna in a bowl. Korean prime kalbi was excellent as well!

The only caution would be the meat portions are VERY small. For example, the prime galbi only comes out to be like 4 or 5 tiny pieces....bulgogi portion was also very small...I killed it in literally two bites.....if you want to get more meat, stick with samgyupsal because it looked like they give you more portion for pork meats.

Also, for limited time only, if you write a yelp review and show it to them, they will give you a free dessert! We got the fried banana tampura with green tea ice cream..it was really good!!
Food was great. Meat was tender and juicy. Portions of the meat were good too. If you rate them you get free dessert
Food was delicious! Best KBBQ in town! Bomb desserts. Must try!!!! Right by UNLV campus, super convenient after a long night studying!!!

Such an amazing place! Servers are super friendly and food was awesome!!! So much better than other Korean BBQ places around. I loved all the appetizers. Spicy tuna kimbap is a must try!!!!
I'm coming back tomorrow!!

Went here around 4:30pm for happy hour and waited over an hour for a table of 4, but so worth it.  We've tried a few Korean places, so far this was the best Korean place.  Reasonable priced.  The services are friendly and nice.  Overall, we all had a good time and definitely recommend to friends and family.

The happy hour is bomb.com!
The amount of quality food you get for the price is so worth it.
Ordered the bulgogi (duh), beef toro, stuffed wontons, corn (boring, but good after grilling and adding sauce), broccoli all from the happy hour menu. Also ordered the kimchi chiage (perfect noms for winter). PLUS they came out with the millions of/standard Korean side dishes. Everything was flavorful, and I am craving this place again as I write this post. 
I have also been thinking about the Banana Tempura dessert ever since I finished eating it. Will definitely be back.

Great place !! Would definitely come again! If they see that you're a yelper, they'll give you a macaroon ice cream sandwich in exchange for any Yelp review. Nevertheless the food was quite tasty & portion sizes per cost was quite worth it especially if you go during happy hour
We waited for one hour 10 minutes on Christmas Day and the experience was total worthwhile. I must say this is one of the best Korean BBQ I had.

Gangnam set was more than enough to for the two of us. Meat was very good quality and the side dishes was good too. They let us change the side dishes to a different one since we don't enjoy oysters. Would come again and recommend to a friend. Only downfall was that we needed to purchase garlic and lettuce.

This place is my favorite Korean bbq restaurant in Vegas, hands down. I'm local, so I don't always like to eat at the Asian restaurants in China town due to all the unsanitary reports on the news... Eww, Thank god for this place! Delicious food, great service, and inexpensive!!
Great food. Very good value. Not a tourist trap. Good service. Food tasted great. You can cook the meat yourself or have your server cook for you. The Korean beer was great also. Definitely worth it!

This place is hella bomb

I recommend ordering 4 for 3 people. It leaves enough food for other late night munchies post-dinner!
I like the atmosphere of this restaurant. Servers are nice. The food is also delicious. I love the spicy pork sooo much.

The first time we went here was with a Korean exchange student. It was a fun experience with the kids and we decided to go back a few months later with friends.  Every single one of us (3) got sick... and really sick.  food poisoning?  I think so.  Needless to say, I won't be going back.

We had a big table for two, the service is great and the food is fantastic! We loved it a lot! The soup has a lot content and the sauce are special and tasty, I would love to compare it with Gyu-Kaku, this one is less expensive but has better taste! Despite of the meat, the appetizers are delicious too! We ordered the Gangnam combo! It is only 65 fo?two people and it really worths the price! This place is really popular I recommend you come early.

Our party of three adults and two kids arrived on a Saturday evening just before the end of their happy hour, 6:00pm.  The place was already quite busy, but we were seated immediately. Staff was friendly and attentive, and the food was excellent.

One of the things we appreciated was that we were able to order the dinner for two, despite our larger party.  An AYCE-format restaurant would not have permitted this.  We added on a couple happy hour food items and the food quantity was more than enough.

One thing I missed from other korean BBQ places was the dipping oils with the salt at the bottom.  They gave each diner a three-sectioned dipping sauce variety bowl and the sauces in them were fine, just not the salted oils I was hoping for.

Our dinner experience here was very positive and we would gladly return.
we ordered the gangnam for two it was amazing but it was incredibly too much food for two people not very hungry. if you can put some food down its well worth the money.

Great service and food. They were nice enough to cook up my barbecue as I multi-tasked with studying for an exam. Everything I ordered was wonderful. The scallops wrapped with bacon, the Kobe sliced beef and the fried pot-stickers and brown rice option were the best. I flavor was great and so was the atmosphere.  I plan to return.
Very tasty and a great value when compared with the overpriced food at the casinos.  Lots of variety.  A good choice for a group of people.

I am visiting Vegas for New Year's... Got sick. Like had to go to the ER sick. Finally made it out of bed and looked for a Korean place that had soup. Came upon this gem. Funny how I just drove and pulled into this parking lot to make a Facebook post asking if anyone knew of any ramen or Korean places bc I needed Asian soup to help heal my ailing body. This parking lot was the same parking lot I was at a few trips ago when visiting Azusa Hookah Las Vegas and left my extra set of car keys. So I was destined to get in touch with my Korean roots. It is a perfectly sized place about 14 BBQ tables. I sat at the bar. I ordered the kimchi jigae. Soups are priced about $9.95 comes out in one of the Stone hot boiling pots. Before that came out you also get lucky  #7 banchans and the kimchi was perfectly fermented, stir fried fish cakes, cucumber kimchi, ojingeo muchim, spicy beans sprouts, pickled radish w/jalape√±os and the famous pasta salad (or potato salad at other Korean places). I am one happy salty half Asian clam. My body is in sodium hell.... But that is the perils of Korean eats... But that kimchi jigae broth with the pork was making live to every taste bud in my mouth.  I will come back again every time I visit.  and
Omg yum! Went on a Sunday night, had our food in front of us so quickly! Def recommend the bulgogi, hwayo soju, and jalape√±o poppers. Open late, and delicious.
This is our 2nd time here. The first time was great. We love the appetizer. The meat was really tender. My son love the steam egg. I like the dynamite shrimp.

Very pleased to report excellent experience here. We got the meat lover's spread and loved every bite. Also pleased when the check came and it was about half of what I expected. Will definitely return for more!
This place is wonderful. It was very fast service. They also brought us extra stuff. Please a relatively small place so expect a wait if you go during peak hours.
2nd time and love this rest.  Great ambience and awesome service.  The food is so yummy!

Who doesn't eat buffet while in Vegas? We don't! Hahaha Maybe it's the luxury of living so close to Vegas so it's not a must to stuff our faces in every time we're in town. We're from LA btw. So we obviously knows what's up with the authentic Korean BBQ! 

We decided to dine here based on all the Yelp reviews. This is NOT the traditional AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant. You can order individual orders of meat (about $9.95 per plate) or you can do the prefixed meal plans from $56+ per 2 people. We got the Gangnam style $65.95 (most popular) prefixed meal for 2. The meat quality was not bad, but the marinated bulgogi was a little too sweet. The raw oysters didn't tasted as fresh as expected. Which is why I took away 1 star. Customer service was great! They have many servers nearby so getting their attention was not a issue at all. 

Overall, we'll be returning in the future. The Meat Lover is the next prefixed meal for 2 we'll be trying.

Almost no wait! Yeah!!! The line last night was super long with a 2 hour wait! 
We tried our luck again today and waited maybe10 mins:) early dinner at 4:20pm tho!
We ordered the white peach sake. Wow! Do delist! Be prepared, it's the size of a wine bottle!
We love Korean BBQ. And have had the best at Parks in Los Angeles. We ordered the Las Vegas combo for 2. It's a lot of food! Perfect spicy chicken yum!!!
Loved the sides. Attentive staff. Great tasting food. No wonder the wait was 2 hours! We will be back!

Amazing food. Enjoyed everything. We ordered pork, spicy chicken, beef, bacon wrapped mushrooms. Plus so many  sides. My personal fav was tofu and marinated radish. Checkin at yelp and get free ice cream
Quiet simple, the best Korean BBQ in Vegas. Very popular place with great food so always a little bit of a wait but kind people, good service and good food.
One of the best Korean bbq I have been to.. delicious food and super friendly, fast staff.. highly recommended
The best Asian barbecue in Las Vegas. You should come here for lunch it's a very good deal, you get two entr√©es for under $12. Order the pitcher  of sangria

Super good!
Pretty damn pricey!
We got the gangnan combo for four, very fulfilling and satisfying!
Meat are so tender and well flavored. We ordered "meat lover" dinner set. There were tons of food and very yummy!!!! It's a good place to hang out with friends and families. We really enjoyed.

For our last night here in Vegas, we were in search of something filling and delicious - and this place easily delivered! 

The service here is awesome! We were warmly greeted at the door, and the servers here were very attentive. 

THE FOOD! There wasnt one thing we regreted ordering. If it wasnt for the awesome variety of food to choose from, I wouldve ordered the Harami Miso all night! So tender and tasty.. do yourself a favor and grab 2 (or 3) of these. 

Also, make your taste buds happy and grab the Spicy Tuna Kimbap. If i didnt love my wife, I wouldve hog cheese that thing and ate the whole thing. Im from Hawaii, so spicy tuna over cooked rice isnt uncommon, but there's were definitely the best i've ever had..

definitely one of the best cook your own food style of eating ive ever been too. great quality of food and awesome service. you cant go wrong by dining here!
Food and service awesome! Best Korean barbecue. Better than china town. Best kimchee and miso soup
Awesome food and service! Server recommended us what to do so we wouldn't order so much.

Definitely worth your time going off strip. We came for a late dinner and their happy hour menu was off the charts. We were able to get pork belly, bulgogi and beef toro for $4 each (amazing!) Drinks were also 50% off which was fantastic. From the happy hour menu, we also ordered all the veggies (broccoli, corn, mushroom medley were all $2, seaweed salad was $3) in an attempt to be healthy. Off the happy hour menu, we ordered beef tongue, skirt steak and kalbi. We also ordered peppers, ramen and bibim ngan myung. Lots of side dishes, really good bang for your buck!

Had dinner here last night. Not really the authentic Korean barbecue that I was expecting. We had one of their popular combination specials. Meat was good, but Kimchee wasn't too good.  Service was pretty good with an easy location to find. Next time I'll try one of the other barbecue places.
Amazing BBQ! Fresh and fast service! The meat is absolutely amazing and I can't recommend it enough!

Good service. Tender meats. Enjoy eating alone or with company here, just such a chill and friendly atmosphere. I've even come to study while my meat cooks. :) recommend the filet mignon! If you like squash definitely get the squash tempura mmmmm!

It was late and all of the good restaurants in our casino was closed.  We looked on Yelp and GangNam came highly rated and was open late.

There wasn't any wait and we were seated immediately.  The server as nice and friendly.  We order the GangNam #1 for 2.  The small sides were good.  I enjoyed the pickled cucumbers and the daikon.  We had 5 meats.  All of them were good.  The Bulgogi was a little too salty, but still decent.  The only downside was that they didn't change our grill.

Overall though, considering the cost, the quality of meat, and the amount of food you get, this is a solid recommendation if you are looking for korean bbq in Vegas.
My niece had 2nd thoughts. So so glad she/we did go. Really delicious. Fun. Do not miss out.

We got a bbq combo for two and a couple of extra vegetable trays and I have to say everything was delicious. Service was quick and friendly. 

The meat and oysters were fresh, the vegetables crunchy, and the marinades just right. The miso soup could have been better, but overall I'll come back again.

Everything tasted amazing. And we ordered some of everything! The bulgogi and spicy pork were spot on, and every meat was very flavorful and delicious. Finished the meal with an ice cream macaroon that hit the spot. Will come back when I'm in town. We need this place in Houston!

I love this place.

They have the best bibimpap. It is huge and delicious! 

They have great appetizers.

The servers are nice.

They have some BBQ meats a la carte.

I tend to find something I love at a place and always get it over and over again.

It's the bibimpap here.

If I want some pork belly and NOT AYCE KBBQ then this is where I come.
The portion of two for three girls lunch is definitely enough! Got a really good time there.
Pretty yummy place! My family and I are traveling back home, they were nice enough to let us store our luggage to the side.
The food here is really good. Especially the Bulgogi, it is a must get when you come here.
It's a new place to me and I'm impressed ! The service is great and the food was delish ! Love the jalapeno poppers with salmon. And the decor is great too , nice to bring ur date to. Super yummy !!

First time here, and I quite enjoyed it. Came here with a group of friends and shared the Meat Lovers for 4. There was more than enough food and they were cool about substituting one of the appetizers for another. We shared the meal between 2 girls and two pretty big guys. We all finished satisfied. The table we sat at had two grills which worked great for keeping one of them pork free. The service was above average with a good amount of visits from the servers. It's fun diy night out with friends.

Still a five star review, but as others have pointed out, they changed their menu slightly from what is pictured here. The platter I got the last time (and again tonight) is called the Gangnam.  Again, they were willing to substitute the appetizer; we traded the oysters for fried calamari. Ordered 4 extra items: two meats, the beef and enoki,  and the mushroom plate and easily fed three people. My boyfriend, and now our friend, is still raving about the bulgogi bibim bap.

We came here because our eldest child said it would be wonderful. She ordered it all getting steak, chicken and pork. It also included loads of other sides but no rice. 

I also noted that the place was packed with all kinds of locals too.

It was so enjoyable getting to cook our own food and socializing over it. 

Highly recommend and make sure you check in on Yelp for a free macro on ice cream sandwich!
Awesomeness! Great food, price, selection, and service. We have been to a lot of KBBQ places. Gagnam is one of the best!
Amazing foods. Really enjoyed staying on this restaurant. With all the marinated meats, vegetables and oyster, "DELICIOUS"...
This place is bomb! Right from the appetizers down to the meat selection. Good portions for a great price. Digging the modern setup and the playlist! Definitely gonna come back!
The beef is well marinated, the seafood is fresh. I would recommend kobe beef and bulgogi
Pretty good food. I've been to better Korean BBQ places. The mushroom medley and Kobe beef was really good if you come here I'd definitely try those.

awesome and friendly servers. great food and inexpensive. everything I had was good, the skirt steak, bulgogi bibimbap, filet mignon, spicy tuna kimbap and a large pitcher of Sapporo. I'd recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

This is probably the best restaurant we ate at on this trip. We came late one night and was able to order from the happy hour menu, which was great. Affordable and great portions. However, I'm docking a star because the servers didn't explain anything to us. I'm guessing they assumed we knew what to do? Other places I've tried like this would tell you how long to grill each meat for, what type of sauces were given and such but not here. Either way, we still enjoyed our meal. I'd definitely eat here again if we're in town. 

Oh, maybe skip on the spicy pork.

I decided to give this place a try after seeing many good reviews about it on Yelp. Overall, I like it. Great food and friendly environment here. I love how they have so many kind of macaron ice cream. 
P.S: You get a free macaron ice cream for rating and reviewing them.
Great service! By far the best Korean BBQ I have ever been to. Their premium meat selection was delicious and perfect for the  6 of us. Would highly recommend this restaurant!

Excellent meal! My friends and I shared a meat lovers bbq option which I definitely recommend for people looking to try a little bit of everything. Happy hour starts at 10pm with discounted meat options and half off drinks! Wonderful experience overall, will definitely be back!

Group of six, we got the kangnam combination and it was plentyyyy of food. The bibimbab was delish, the miso soup was really tasty, the meats were well marinated. The oysters were okay. The service is fantastic and attentive.
Loved this place! The food was huge portions, we ordered the meat lover for 4, and it could seriously feed 6. I would definitely recommend.

Came in for lunch we were the first ones there so we we're quickly seated. We both got the lunch set which comes with rice, miso soup and a salad. We chose to do the al la carte option because we weren't too hungry. We got the marinated Kali, bacon wrapped asparagus, the spicy tuna something appetizer and the spicy garlic sauce. We ordered the green tea mango cheese cake with mango ice cream for dessert. The portions we're small but we weren't very hungry and we're full. Our bill was $35. I liked that we had the option to either cook it ourselves on the grill or have the kitchen cook it. Everything was delicious will definitely come here again
Trying this restaurant for the first time! 7 ban chans offered. Lunch special is reasonable price for the amount you get.

Man, I've been thinking about this place since I left. Too bad it is thousands of miles away. I came here for my anniversary on a trip to Las Vegas. After being hit in the head eating on the Las Vegas Strip, we caught a Lyft to this place, guided by the Yelp reviews. We came early, so there was no wait. I could not believe the prices here. You can get so much for your money, compared to the Korean BBQ places we have in NC. But that's not the best part. The wonderfully marinated, juicy and tender meat is the star of the show. Mmm, mmm, mmm. The rice was cooked perfectly. I was finally in asian food Heaven. I will definitely return if I'm in Vegas!
This place is super friendly and everything is super yummy. A must try-uni bowl. All the meat items are tender and well seasoned.

Returned to eat here after the last time we were in town. We ordered the Gangnam setup for 6 people, well because we had 6 people. Mistake!! We had waaaay too much food, but really it was awesome and still a reasonable price per person. Tried the Apple Sodju and that went down real easy, everyone was pleasantly surprised at how smooth it was.  This is quickly becoming a favorite of ours for Korean BBQ.
Good food and great service. Recommend beef toro. It would be even better if the sides are refillable.
Amazing?It's my best ever in Las Vegas?The design?BBQ and service....... Oh,man everything is awesome!
The BBQ and everything here is just great!!! Awesome place , food very tasty, nice service , handsome korean guys!!!!!Don't miss this !!!
I had the Harami Miso and the shrimp garlic bbq. Sooooooo delicious! Great service, great food, great price! Highly recommended!!!

Amazing food choices. Not all you can eat but feel good after the choices of meats and seafood I made. Good quality and service. Room ambience is nice with new music and good decor/color. Just to share what I ate was beef toro, bulgogi, salmon wrapped in bacon and calamari as an appetizer! Thumbs up to this place

We are from out of town and we will definitely coming back. The food was delicious, plentiful, and reasonably priced. Plus the service was responsive and everyone was very helpful and sweet.  It's a young staff and the music was good...So it made for a relaxed and fun environment.

Service was excellent.

Meat quality was great.

Sides were good but not amazing.  Improve your sides a bit!  The salad was really good though.

Dinner can be a bit pricey ~$32+ a person.

Lunch can be from $15-20.

Recommended.

I've found my new favorite place. Basically, if you ever thought, "I could cook this myself!" well then, you are in heaven. Tons of options and only yourself to blame if it's not cooked right. 

Great appetizers, tons of meats to try, REVERSE HAPPY HOUR 10pm to close. Even if you got something you didn't like (or just messed up cooking it), the prices are great.

Spicy Tuna Kimbap:  awesome as an appetizer to start. The serving is HUGE. You won't feel shorted when you order. You may get scalp sweats, but that's a good thing. 

Chili Garlic Wings: These were fine, not the best wings you've ever had but pack plenty of meat and flavor.

Bulgogi: People seem to love this. It's not great. It's the meat I liked the least. Consistency is gummy. It's a sticky meat. Has a bit of a jerky taste to it. Impossible to really cook on the grill. It's a pass for me. 

Pork Belly: It was good. It wasn't as flavorful as I thought but it melts in your mouth. They do give you plenty of strips so it works out that way. Plenty of trays to dunk it in too.

Filet Mignon: How could you say no to this? Of course, the cuts are tender and succulent. Probably the thing that works against it is that they are THICK cuts. Eating it usually involves putting the WHOLE chunk in your mouth. But it's filet mignon, it is delicious.

Flat Iron Garlic: Great garlic flavor, thinner cuts make cooking and eating this a tad bit easier that the Filet. Plenty of meat to dip too.

But really everything we had was good. Even the Bulgogi wasn't that bad. Seems like you can't go wrong here. That's a sign of a great place to eat.
Super yummy BBQ! Good mix of Korean and Japanese BBQ flavored. Close proximity to Hard Rock Hotel, will be back on next trip!
The food is very good at GangNam, I really like their Korean Prime Kalbi, and the price is very valuable. I will totally recommend this place if you are looking to grab some Korean BBQ in Vegas!

Bad, waited for 45min to be seated. When they said half an hour wait. Sat down and ordered oolong tea and they gave us warmed tea. So they said they are still boiling the water....waited 30mins then asked for sugar waited another 30mins...the waitress was very rude!!!!! Then the gratuity is already included? For 4people,  1toddler and a baby? And cooked our own food?...when it was really really bad service! We couldn't find anybody to help us. Never ever coming back here again or will recommend this place!
The food here is delicious. The meats are of good quality and I will definitely be back here when I come visit Vegas. It's a good spot to get away from eating at the strip.

LOVE ITTTTTTTTT
A little small area you have to wait to be seated usually... buy worth it!!
Sever Back is a great sever. I loved foods and the service. I think this place is one of best restaurant in las vegas

I love food... I love KBBQ. We found this place on Yelp, and we're in love with it. Great food. Great prices. Great service.

If you need KBBQ when you're in Vegas, this is the spot. Although it is a bit off of the strip, it is so worth it. We used lfyt to get here, and it was only about $10 from our hotel room. We were considering going to a restaurant on the strip just so we didn't have to pay for lyft but this was definitely worth it! The food was delicious, I especially loved the spicy tuna dish! It was amazing! The bulgogi and the spicy chicken were tied for second place in my book.

This place is very clean and food's delicious. Definitely coming back when I come to Vegas! What an amazing restaurant!

Wir waren heute auf unserem Tripp nach Las Vegas hier beim Abendessen. Sehr freundliches Personal. Umfangreiches Men√º das Geschmacklich sehr umfangreich war. Falls wir mal wieder in der Ecke sind kommen wir gerne wieder. Sehr empfehlenswert.
Awesome service and great food! This is my second time here and I love it! I will definitely be returning for a third, fourth and fifth time :)
It was great for a group dinner! We had 5 people and shared the Las Vegas dinner. It was plenty and so delicious.

When we came the line is not long at all. There is only one group of ppl in front of us. We wait 30min. Maybe because they have too little tables.. And then finally we got table. When we follow the waiter walking to the table. He didn't let us sit down. We saw there are ppl chatting and standing right next to the table. But our waiter didn't say excuse me or anything. So I guess is that his boss?? And then the waiter just asked us to wait. And then he left. We were like standing middle of the restaurant don't know what the hack is going on... After a while, nobody is going to do anything for us. We asked the chatting ppl by ourselves if so we can sit. And then the order was fine. When the food come, the waitress needs to mix the food. And food jump out of the bowl right on my purse. I saw she saw it, but she did not say a word.. I am not sure how service here should be. I'm not quiet happy with it. 
For the food, it is just so so. I guess because I had too many good food in LA. Here doesn't taste like Asian food for me at all. But if ppl love American Asian food. Then here is the right place. Probably not coming back here.

I find it surprising how the reviews are so good. I ordered Gangnam combo with prime kalbi and bulgogi bibimbob. I additionally ordered calamari garlic and mul nangmyun. Their prime kalbi and Filet mignon were amazing. I would give 5 stars for that. Their mushroom medley was on point as well. Also, the servers were attentive and nice. However, their bulgogi bibimbob and bulgogi were too sweet and too salty. My mom and I had a spoon each and couldn't proceed with the rice. Maybe ordering white rice would have been a better option. Flat iron garlic and Harami miso were also too salty that it was hard to proceed. Their nangmyun is worth trying - one of the better ones I had in the US. 

Overall, if you happen to go to this place, order non-marinated meet. I was between 3 and 4 stars and decided on 3 because the rating is too high and wanted to give people an honest opinion that is different from the majority. I hope this review is helpful!

Oppa Gangnam Style! 

Oh, wait! that's PSY's line. Actually, Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining is Tapa Style and not all you can eat Korean BBQ, (keep in mind, AYCE KBBQ it's not big in Vegas than it is in Cali). 

We happened to come here during their Happy Hour menu offerings. So we paid for some of the meat choices at a really good price. For that we ended up doubling are orders of the: Toro Beef, Basil Chicken, Bulgogi Beef, Spicy Pork and Pork Belly. The portions we got were good for a party of three. 

- Toro Beef: Its marbleized beef brisket and very flavorful. Not as fatty as the ones that you"ll find at cheaper Korean BBQ places. It was my favorite out of our five choices. 

- Pork Belly: Standard cut pork. Not bad at all, they were seasoned. The quality of the pork was good, and had tastiness to it. 

- Spicy Pork: Tender cut pork. Smothered in spicy sweet marinade sauce makes this super delicious. 

- Chicken Tender Basil: Tender white pieces of chicken. With touch of lemon and basil. They were simple but delicious and it accommodated well with my white rice. 

- Bulgogi Beef: Beef was really tender and marinaded with a lot of flavor, very good! 
nuff said. 

The sauces that came with these were: Spicy Soy Sauce, Sweet Soy Sauce and Ponzu Sauce. The Spicy and the Sweet Soy were good. I even combined the sauces and it even adds for more taste to the tip of your tongue. The Ponzu, was the one I enjoyed dipping my meats in. It had that vinegar, sweet flavor to it.

Overall meat quality here, Excellent! The five choices we got didn't disappoint. Every meat was tender and easy too eat. Again, they were less fatty. We enjoyed every bite that came out of the mini-grill. 

We got friendly service here. Our server was very personable, and she turned out to be a cool chick. We even got some Kimchi's on the house. Atmosphere here is modern. There is a big screen TV in one side that would play random upbeat music videos. Also there appears to be space to lounge or dance for the late night vibes. 

Even though they don't offer all you can eat. They do combinations, but anything extra outside of that, can get pricey. That's why when they offered the Happy Hour menu, we chose meats with deeper discounts and for a party of three the portions were just right, for a tab around $35. 

Eh, sexy lady...nom,nom,nom,nom...Oppa NomNom Style!

Great food and reasonable prices- menu has a wide variety of options to please any palate. I definitely recommend beef toro. And while you wait for your order to cook, they bring out small side dishes for snacking. I definitely will be coming back!
Ate here on Valentine's Day with my fianc√© and we were amazed on the price and good quality of meats. Great food and great service. A hidden gem off the strip. Worth visiting again.
Great food and love the atmosphere. Staff is friendly and food is delicious. Not too fancy but also not super casual.

Alway love this place...my son enjoys the food.  Parking sucks but thats because their are other places in the mall that are also fantastic. 

Good quality KBB.  Enjoy it.!! My son does

Came here for dinner with my friends for a birthday. The food was amazing. The staff is friendly and very quick to bring out your side dishes and meats. The food was delicious and the restaurant was kept nice and clean. I had a great experience here and will definitely be back. Our most favorite item was the marinated short ribs. Also I am a big dumpling fan and let me tell you the steamed chili dumpling is a must !!! Also they were so nice  to keep the birthday cake in the fridge and brought it out lit with the candles I brought! Awesome customer service !
Great atmosphere, great food, and great service! What  more can you ask for? Traditional Korean cuisine at its best.

My boyfriend was craving Korean BBQ so we relied on Yelp to find us the best option in town, and we were not disappointed! I will say I was a bit hesitant at first since the location is practically on the UNLV campus, but it's pretty easy to get to and we had no trouble parking or getting seated. The bf was hungry so we tried nearly half the menu and all the meat and veggies were fresh (be sure to get the Korean Prime Kalbi & the Japanese Peppers), the sides were flavorful and our waitress was super fast & friendly. Oh and I cannot rave about the coffee macaroon enough!

Delicious!  Meat cuts are juicy, well-marinated and tender- one of the best korean bbq places in terms of flavor that we have ever tried!  A la carte prices are ok and worked well for us (2 parents with moderate+ appetites and 2 kids with small appetites). If you have a giant appetite, then the set combo packages for 2, 4, 6 people might work better.  We will definitely be back!

Food & service was decent. A bit pricey, also as a spoiled San Jose resident, I felt like it was a copy of Gyu-Kaku. Even the chili dumplings tasted the same. I like GyuKaku so I definitely like this place! Favorite is still harami!!!

So good suggest you get the premade combinations. They have so much good food! Kind and rapid service. Hold on to your butts! They run a tight ship and have keen business sense. Nothing related to the quality but I think the stereo speakers are blown out or not set right.
Food was awesome! Salmon wrapped bacon was the bomb dot com! Services was great too! Ambience was nice as well.

Very delicious. Will definitely visit it again when in town again!

We ordered the meat lover combo, which is more than enough for two persons. Also, we ordered some side dishes, for example, the original bibimbap and spicy seafood noodles, which are both very delicious.

my girl had to work NYE and we wanted to have a nice meal close to the Strip, but not too close.  a quick search on Yelp and decided on Gangnam.

Great decision Yelpers!  you can order everything a la carte or order one of their combo specials for two.  We did the Paradise A combo ($56 for two ppl).  our server said it was the most popular choice.

there was easily enough food for 3 people!  everything was tasty!  Five starters and five dishes to BBQ. I especially liked the spicy dumplings from the starters, and all the meat was top quality.

Service was very helpful and attentive, without being annoying.  Great place for date night (slightly romantic, but more hip and cool).  we will definitely be back!!
Delicious! All the meat and sides were great. We had the meat lovers for 6 and it more than enough feed 7.

This my jam! We always come here when we land in Vegas.

It has all of the elements of good KBBQ--lettuce, panjan, and meat!  Yet, it has a trendy feel. The meal includes the regular samjan and sesame oil, but also includes three dipping sauces. The meat is high quality. My tip is to get the boneless short rib over the Waygu--just as tasty, maybe better.

At first, the portions may seem small, but somehow it's adequate. Six of us ate here, had two rounds of soju and a plethora of meat and our bill was $160.

Additionally the Korean K-pop/R&B keeps you on beat while cooking.
Its really good! My fave was the bacon wrapped asparagus. I'll recommend it to my friends back home!

Came in for a late dinner during the week. The restaurant is in a strip center and parking was easy to secure.

The interior of the place is decorated modern and has 2 flat screens to watch your fave sporting event. Each table has a grill to cook your food. My Hawaiian waitress was friendly and sweet but for a Korean joint I was disappointed the only banchan you receive is Kim chi. I ordered shrimp with head on and sliced prime rib beef. My order  didn't include miso soup and steamed rice so there was an up charge. I did enjoy the three dipping sauces for the entrees which were ponzu, sweet and a spicy sauce. The beef was tender but it was a only 4 ounces for $11.95 The shrimp was decent but was priced at $5.95 for 4 pcs and were on the small side and I've had fresher.

Overall I thought the decor and service was solid, but the food fell short on value and quality and don't think I would return.
Great food and an experience. Fun and delicious! Highly recommend! Get the tteokbokki you won't regret it. After you're done with it you have a delicious sauce for your rice.

Dinner in Vegas! 

Ordered the meat lover set. It came with so much meat, and a lot of sides. This meal came with 5/6 types of different meat, salad, seaweed salad, soup, rice, and a lot of sides that I can't name them all. Throughout my entire Vegas trip, I'd say this was definitely my favorite place to eat at. The meal was perfect for two, and I'd come back to eat here if I lived in the area. This would definitely be one of my top favorite kbbq restaurants. Service was superb, and very attentive. I love their food, I don't have anything bad to say about this place. I loved everything about it, and it was my favorite place to eat! When I visit Vegas again, I'll come back.
Have been here for several times and the food is always so good. I like the kimchi bibimbap and soft tofu soup and sometimes I will try the BBQ with a big group. Recommend you to come!

if you are ever in vegas and want a real korean bbq this is the spot to go to. One at the strip is no good. highly recommend all meat . customer service is very good and somewhat attentive with water refill. . very tasty.

This restaurant has the best food! I think the portion size was too small if splitting it with multiple people but overall the taste quality of the food was delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.

My boyfriend and I have been here more than a few times here. We usually come here after work at night time. Always had a good experience and have nothing to complain. The food is always good. We love their Honey Bread the most for the dessert. The bbq grill options has good amount to share as well and very flavorful. The servers are nice as well. We definitely recommend this place.

Got to Vegas late and decided to Uber there based on the high Yelp reviews.  Got there close to 10pm and the place is rather empty.  Overall is a okay meal.  Nothing seems to be memorable.  The kimchi  rice is NOT kimchi fried rice at all.  It tastes more like teriyake fried rice.  My kids love it.  It's nothing compared to K-Town bbq down in LA.  I would think Vegas would have better Korean BBQ than this.  If you are close-by, it's worth for a meal.  But if you need to Uber there, it's not worth the trip.  There are plenty other options on the Strip.
Stopped here after 4 hours trip from Utah. We ordered harami miso, korean kalbi, tongue, pork belly, and pork cheek. Pork cheek and harami miso are recommended. Probably the best korean bbq in town.
This place is tasty and i had to go back a second time during my trip. Everyone is very friendly
Best Korean BBQ that I have eaten in Vegas.  We ordered the Gangnam #1 Package.  Highly recommended...
Yup I did it again!! Second time this Trip!! So Awesome and Great Service!! Until next time
Came to Vegas and really wanted some good Korean food, this place hit the spot! Everything tasted great and great atmosphere.

It's my first time in Las Vegas, and this place is the BOMB DOT COM. They have quality meat that is so savory and tender. The sides are very tasty and fresh as well, and all for a really good price! I wish I had come here earlier! Also, I got their macaron ice cream sandwich for free just for checking in! Whenever I come back city, I will definitely come back here!

Great place to visit while in vegas. Standouts were the chicken fried rice, Korean beef, marinated ribeye, and scallops. The lemon soju is also very good. Not too sweet like most others I have tried. Great value for vegas!

Great food... Quality of meat is Top notch. Service is fast and friendly. Great layout for hanging out with friends.  The ventilation is well done here and you won't leave smelling like bbq. 

The steam egg is spot on. And the sides are all good. Perfect way to end a night of drinking. Open late so there isn't an excuse to not come by and try it out. 

Pricing is very reasonable for the quality of food. Try it for yourself!
Late night Korean bbq cravings and happened to drop by during happy hour! Love their happy menu must try the chicken karaage and bulgogi!
One of the best kbbq around! Korean prime Kalbi was amazing!! Sides are great quality. And you can't beat their quick and fast service.

I'm a sucker for Korean. I always wanted to try this place since it was near UNLV and one day after work I was by myself and said what the heck, let's go here! The food was amazing. They had some Kpop music videos playing. It was a very neat place and was better than I expected. The waiters are pretty polite. I most definitely and likely be back.

We came here for the happy hour after 10pm. We loved Beef Toro, mushroom assortment and hot sake from happy hour menu! In addition, the place got a nice ambiance, cozy booths and friendly stuff! Will be back again.

First time trying this place. My friends loved it. It was an ok experience for me. The bulgogi was really amazing and well flavored. The other meat was ok. Overall if you love Korean BBQ with a bunch of different meats and vegetables this place is definitely for you.
Good food!!! Servers are nice! I reccomend the pork belly and the beef toro. Nice decor/atmosphere
The combo packages are surprisingly big!  Meat lovers for 4 was enough to leave 4 people VERY full.

Pricey. 

Meat was all tender and well flavored. Definitely recommend ordering some lettuce to cut some of the meat flavor. 

Ordered the harami miso, Korean prime kalbi, filet mignon (oh so tender), flat iron garlic, beef toro, enoki with bacon (interesting)

Service is kind of slow.
Awesome meat quality and great appetizers! Will come back next time when I'm at vegas again!
Excellent! ! All around!  Great FAST friendly service!  Recommend and will be back for more!
My favorite Korean Barbecue place in Vegas! Quality food and I was a fun experience cooking it yourself. Plus it's open late!
You can not make a bad choice! There are so many tasty sides and meats. Everyone was extremely nice and they maintain a really clean eating space. Love this spot! Kristen is the best server!

Came to Vegas for a weekend trip and really wanted to check out Korean BBQ. The food here was really good and the portion size was just right. We ordered the Meat Lovers and I'm pretty sure all 5 of us walked out of here completely satisfied. The service was excellent as well!
Love this place! I will come here every time I come out to Vegas even just for their dessert.
Omg the beef Toro is to die for! And you get a free dessert for writing a review.  That's why this is my first review ever ;)

Great selection of meats, veggies, and seafood here! We came here for late night happy hour and service was pretty good. The appetizers we order was the chili dumplings and steamed egg. Both were delicious! As for the grill meats everything was flavorable. My favorite was the pork belly and beef tongue. Would come back again next time!

This isn't your usual Korean BBQ place, no all-you-can-eat here.  But the portions are generous, the staff is courteous, and happy hour just makes everything better!

We happened to arrive during their happy hour, and we were greeted promptly.  Clean, classy atmosphere.  The music is a mix of top 40 and big Kpop hits.  Service is prompt and courteous.  Nothing really noteworthy up to this point.

Then the food arrives -- everything was well-seasoned and good quality.  The meat we ordered was never chewy, a welcome change from Tofu Hut.  Their prime kalbi was surprisingly marbled, definitely my top pick of the evening, followed by the green tea/mango cheesecake for dessert.

If you're looking for tapas-style Korean BBQ, Gangnam certainly makes the grade.
Great atmosphere, service and food!! All of the meat cuts are fresh and delicious! The banana tempura is amazing! Will definitely come back!!
Super good!! They have everything for real Korean BBQ. Highly recommend even for Korean! Best Korean bbq ever! Omg I love it (for Korean_ their Kimchi is just like my mom's one. Taste amazing!!)
Yum. Got the Las Vegas and it was plenty for the 2 if us. Meat and chicken were delicious. Definitely would go again.

Good. Affordable. Tasty especially top three juicy plates. My favorite was korean kalbi bbq tapas.side dishes were also delicious. 

Tapas are servers as quarter pound and each of those were very delicious.

Gangnam BBQ rocks and definitely lives up to the reviews posted. We have tried many high end restaurants while here in Vegas over the years and have found most are expensive, over rated and at times , leaving still hungry. This place is a gem. Due to reading about the waiting time being long in the early hours ( 6pm to 9pm ) , we waited to 10:30pm to show up and just walked in and were seated. What was even better was that it was reverse happy hour and the already great prices were even cheaper for food and drinks. As in most posts, found that the service was excellent and prompt. They have the team effort approach so the whole staff was either bring or picking up something regularly. The food was the bomb! Fresh and tasty. The flat iron garlic and bulgogi was great. We ordered the meat lovers combo and it was quite the spread for 2 people and you won't leave hungry. Also great place to go if you want to talk with your date, significant other and family and not have everyone on their phones looking at the internet constantly because their cooking , chatting and having fun!!! ?

I've come back to Gangham BBQ after a year because it's simply the best Korean BBQ I've ever had!  So much food for the money, and the meat is lean and tasty. I love the filet mignon, and the bulgogi surprised me with how tasty it was!

The beef tongue and prime kaibi are just AMAZING!  Everything else is pretty good too but these two meat are just so juicy.

Arrived at 5:30 for dinner (thanksgiving weekend).  Waited for 50min.

Just ate here the other day. I've been wanting to eat here a long time and when I finally did I was kicking myself for not coming sooner. The food was amazing, our waitress was smoking hot. Well done!!!

Pretty good food, generous serving sizes, good prices, and excellent service. Here are the foods I've tried:

Bulgogi: sweeter than authentic bulgogi
Original Bibimbap: AWESOME! Comes in a flat hot stone plate. Huge serving with lots of meat.
Soy bean paste stew: Yum!
Tempura udon: Noodles and tempura were good but I didn't care for the soup.
Shrimp Sukiyaki(?) Noodles: sweeter than expected.

Very good food and service! We ordered meat lover combo, we got a lot of meat indeed. The beef is really good. But some of the meat is too sweat for my taste. Dumplings are good, and I also liked the sea weed salad.

Honestly not sure why this place gets amazing reviews. Maybe I went too late at night but I wasn't impressed with the meat and taste of everything. I previously ate at another cook your own food and it was amazing so coming here I figured it would be great. It wasn't.

They didn't even explain how long to cook the meats like the other place.

Overall just very disappointed in my experience and would never try it again.

Waaaay better than the best Korean food I ever had in Nyc for three times the price of what it is here. The banchan are delicious. The meats are very good quality and very well flavored. The bibimbap wasn't the best I ever had, but it was good. The dipping sauces are spot on. Very flavorful. 16.95 for a pitcher of Sapporo isn't revolutionary, but it's a good deal. The lettuce wraps are better than pf changs, and that's saying something ;)
Saturday night and we didn't have to wait longer than 15 minutes
And they have macaron ice cream sandwiches for dessert. Can't complain about a single thing here.

A Korean BBQ that's not all you can eat but the quality of the meat, service, and other food items was exceptional. Big area and benches fits up to 6.

Pleasantly surprised by the customer service. Not alot of employee but somehow very attentive with every table. Since there was a wide variety of choices on the menu, the waiter was really informative of the sauces and questions we had about the menu.

Along with good service, the food quality was pretty good. The side dishes included fish cake, macaroni salad, red sauced squid, kimchi, bean sprouts, and pickled cucumber. Pretty standard. 

For a party of 5, we ordered:
-chicken salad: random but good, comes with a honey mustard dressing
-tempura udon: standard
-house salad: 
-kimchi chigae
As for meats
-Korean prime kalbi
-premium tounge
-bulgogi

Overall will be back next time im in town- perfect for family gatherings and a place to relax. I recommend the meats.

We eat Korean bbq at least once a week. Vacations are no exception. Found this through Yelp but really it's pretty popular on every food-suggestion site for Vegas. Food quality was excellent. Service was on the slow side, considering we were the 2nd patrons there (arriving 5 minutes after it opened), not to mention that we cook the food ourselves. Our usual time at other K BBQ places, from sitting down to walking out, is 40 mins max, and those places are always packed. This place did fill up quickly though, considering it was a Monday at 11:30am.

great place highly recommended for korean bbq!
bla bla bla bla its a great place, cheese was good, doing this for the free ice cream macaroon cos u need to review it hahaha so im using up the space, other than that this place is really great! smells awesome, kpop playing with HAWT gals and some lame dudes lol why cant everyone in korea look like that, oh wait they do its cos of plastic surgery ok im going off topic bottomline is the place is great for korean bbq
Got here in time for a great happy hour.  Food was great and fresh.  Highly reccomend.
