My boyfriend and I always come here when we vist. Love this place especially the Korean Prime Kalbi

This location is really convenient if you're done with class and want to settle for some good food and cheap beers. This is also located near the Kiss mini putt putt if you're trying to take someone on a cheap date. 

I definitely receive my money's worth here, especially for it being a non AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant. The service is fast and friendly. The food is consistently delicious and you really can't beat the happy hour deals. I actually spent less money here for two people than if we were to go to any other AYCE. The pork belly and bulgolgi are really tender and even with a slight char from the grill, they never got overcooked.
The food was absolutely delicious! We haven't ever had Korean/Asian food before so this was different from what we're used to. I would most definitely recommend this to anyone.
Great side dishes! The meat was ehhhh. Great and fast customer service. My server's name was Back and he's extremely nice.

I live in Orange County and have Korean and Japanese BBQ frequently. This ranks up there with the bbq in Orange County. The sides were good and the meat was delicious. The server answered all of our questions and provided recommendations. I did not expect to get amazing bbq in Las Vegas. Take a taxi, Uber or whatever mode of transportation you have to take to get here. It is worth the trip
Eat it, enjoy it, it's awesome. Check in for free ice cream. Get off the strip, the best food is not necessarily on the strip.

We ordered the meat lovers combo.

Omg tons of food! Great side dishes. I liked the macaroni salad and kimchi.

Meat: the spicy pork was my favorite. All of it was tasty and cooked well. I had the chefs cook the meat.

The salad and miso were also tasty.

I would come back and recommend this place. 

Now I'm writing this review and looking forward to my free dessert :)
First time to try Korean BBQ in LV. We ordered the Gangnam set and it is a lot for two ppl

Ate here for my birthday with my girlfriend, and we both enjoyed it thoroughly. 
We got the Gangnam. It was good, the oysters were definitely a first for both of us. 
Some of the meat could've used more seasoning, but hey meat is meat to me!
Service was good. I didn't use the bathroom so I'm not sure how that was. However, judging from the seating area, I wouldn't be surprised if it was just as clean.

The food was great. The service was fantastic. The server came in and out of our table to make sure we were doing okay. I would highly recommend this place to friends who come to Vegas for the weekend  

- Jay Dela Rea

It's probably been 20 years since I've dined at a Korean BBQ (that you grill yourself).  This place is a hole in the wall that you'd only find if looking for it.  They have happy-hour deals, where you can shave a dollar off numerous dishes, and half-price alcoholic beverages.  My wife and I ordered two appetizers (cream cheese triangles, mushroom medley), and four mains (pork, bulgogi, 2 beef), and a side of rice.  This was more than enough food!  The only item we didn't care for was the pork belly, everything else was very good.  Oh, they also give you 5-7 mini-starters (kimchi, cucumbers, fishcakes, etc.), which were very nice (we would have ordered slightly less had we known!).

This place was recommended by a friend, and did not disappoint. I've never been to Korean bbq, and the waiter thoroughly explained how the menu worked and what the tastiest items were. There was so much food and everything was delicious. I will be back next time in vegas
Food is tasty! Can be a little too loud because sound bounces off the walls and ceiling, and the hostess desk gets a bit crowded!
Just dined here for the first time visiting Vegas based on Yelp reviews. The Harami Miso had amazing flavor! Bulgogi was also on point. Definitely recommend!!!
Third timeback. each time we've come this place is on point. Really fun and enjoyable spot. Always cool to get the pickled appetizers. Beats the strip any day

Amazing food and wonderful service. Our server Ryan was awesome!!

The portions are really big. We went here after a week long hiking trip and ordered the Los Vegas dinner for two and it easily could have served four people. If you plan on going with two people order individually and if you go with four people order a meal for two- you won't be sorry.

Food was great 2nd time here but this time around the service was a joke. Never did I see my server  she literally cane to take my order and that's only cus I had to go get someone, I ended up ordering 2 waters that I never got I ended up having to ask a different server. I was never even asked how everything was. Service was better my first time around . Hopefully next time they improve

Does anyone want to eat dinner with me at 10pm? Because the reverse happy hour is amazing. 

Pork belly, filet mignon, and bulgogi--oh my. Just get a good group, fire up a table, and order a million little plates off the reverse happy hour menu. Even if something dissapoints you, I guarantee there is another little plate that could make you happy. Which is why you should come here with a small group. You can share the items and then cook it to your own preference. Because there are always those philistines that like meat cooked super well done. Or sometimes you just start talking and get distracted and over-cook your food. No matter what, you can't blame the cooks here for that. 

Service is always pretty good and beer is frosty. Definitely one of my favorite places.

I went in here for some BBQ, but rather for the yook gae jang (spicy beef soup) since I had a craving. I probably went wrong in walking in here for the purpose of eating this soup, since it's a meat specialty place. 

The menu, decor, and set-up totally reminded me of GYU-KAKU. Even the little details like the color of the plates and their logo. I got to try some meats off of a set menu, and the meat quality was quite impressive. They have good meats, if you're willing to shell out the price for it. 

As for the yook gae jang and soon tofu, it tasted like salt with no other flavor, and totally was ruined in my opinion. The side dishes however were good. 

Service was slow, despite the restaurant only being half full. I had to ask for water and certain side dishes multiple times to get it.

BEST KBBQ IN LAS VEGAS!!  we chose the premium grill meal for two  So much food!!  Our favorite was the Kobe Style Beef.  Everything was full of flavor from the meats down to the miso soup!  We will definitely be visiting again!

Prime kalbi bbq is so good!! 
Bean paste soup is also tasty. 
But kimchi soup is s a little bit sweeter than what I expect. 
If you want to taste real Korean beef bbq flavor, I highly recommend to try Prime kalbi bbq. 
Enjoy!
An awesome place for Korean BBQ. Took my fiend here n we both love it! We finished everything. The duck is really good! Recommended!

This is our fist time try this place. The food was really good as well as the service. We order the Las Vegas combo with 2 appetizers, almost forget to mention they have happy house between 4pm-6pm. There's a lot of food share, we cant even finish it, so we take some home. I would recommend this place to our friends, and we definitely will return.
Decent prices good food. The flat iron steak flavor was a little off putting but everything else very good! Time for dessert!
Great food! Music is bomb! Fast service. Must have spicy pork during happy hour. Freakin' dericious

My Asian friends did there research online, an found this place before we even left for vegas.
They where right this food was amazing after the long travels to vegas but in all reality it would be good anyday of the week.
Loved the place. Food is great, service was excellent and environment was very cool. Very clean and hip place to try Korean dishes.

What an amazing variety of delicious bbq meats, seafood, and vegetables to grill at your table.  The accompaning sauces and condiments enhanced our most memorable meal.  And the marinated meats were outstanding!  Bravo!

When I went there I had to wait for about 1.5 hours. We ordered the meat lover, the steamed egg, and seafood soup. The food took a while to come out even though the servers said it was coming out right now. The Kobe beef was good, but the rest was average. The servers weren't very nice, but they weren't particularly rude either. They did give us two miso soups on the house though, which was nice of them.

Had the package deal for 6 and we have 7 people in our group. Penlty of food good enough for party of 8. Meat was fresh and tender. The marinated meat was a little on the sweet side. Kobe beef excellent.

Not sure what the hype is on this place... especially if you have been to Korean BBQ restaurants in LA or NYC. 

Service: I was expecting better. The waitress didn't seem to know what she was talking about when she told us that we needed 3-4 BBQ tapas per person. We took that advice and ordered a lot of meat (more on that later). 

Food: Salty! Everything is made with extra sodium... the meat, soondubu, jap chae etc. the pork belly is full of fat. I get it's pork belly, but the cut was really cheap. We got the toro, marinated kalbi, and bulgogi and none were impressive. In fact, my party was going to ask if we can sell some meat back! The "compliment" dishes were all salty and doesn't seem fresh. It was kimchi, kimchi cucumber, mac, fish cake.

Disappointed and will not recommend.
Great place for Korean bbq.  Food is fresh and tasty.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Clean and pleasant atmosphere.

Awesome place for quality korean BBQ!
Lots of choices for grill and desert is great as well.
Second visit within 2 months. Really satisfied. Should definitely try the mango ice cream! (=
Was good!!! The waiter was very nice  in the food  was delicious  all take care of us tus for that
The noodle is great. The beef and corn is delicious. Moreover, the service here is good.
Great environment. Waiter and waitress are responsive, fast and friendly. Food is great. Recommend their Jalepeno Poppers.
Wonderful Korean barbecue we had a great lunch I would highly recommend coming here and I would come back again and I am a professional chef

We visited this restaurant while in Las Vegas, and it was one of the most memorable parts of our visit! The food was wonderful! The selection was great, and inexpensive. There is a little grill at your table, so you cook your own meat. This made for a fun environment for everyone, especially my teenage girls. Definitely give it a try! Get the macaroons! YUM!
Very delicious and not too expensive! Food taste very good too! I came here about 5 times and i thought it was pretty  cheap for meats.
Got the Meat combination 2 for 55$. It was good overall, the meats, the service and the atmosphere. This combination comes with a lot of sides
Great customer service! Food came very fast and The food was delicious! We will come back in the future.

Food was awesome- all the other positive yelp reviews were spot on. I wish we had another couple with us because the food for two  was about twice as much food as we could eat. We have decent appetites too!
First time dining here and it was worth the drive over. Great food, and a LOT of it! Service was excellent and we had fun working the grill. Will definitely come back!
They have really good selections with reasonable price! I would recommend trying their green tea ice cream!

Amazing BBQ experience!! We had the Gannam combo and it taste amazing!! For three people we had the two people combo and they gave us choices of white rice or hot stone bimbimbab. The  oysters are fresh too! Marinated beef taste like heaven!! Would definitely come back again!!!!

It was my first time having Korean bbq! 
This place was very yummy and a wonderful experience ! I'd highly recommend this for a first time visit.

This is my first time trying Korean BBQ and I gotta say this place exceeded my expectations! The staff was extremely friendly. The food was delicious, my wife and I tried the meat lovers. I'm usually pretty picky but there's nothing bad I can say about this place. I was beyond satisfied. Highly recommend it. My wife and I will come back.

The restaurant wasn't too busy when we arrived around 2pm so we were seated right away. The staff was quick and patient with us newcomers. 
The food also came out in less than 10 minutes and every dish was portioned perfectly. The steamed egg and spicy tofu soup were a little too salty but the meats were seasoned just right.

SO MUCH FOOD! All the little side dishes were really fun to try. The steak filet was my favorite. Our waiter was very helpful and even told us about getting the yelp app for a free ice cream mochi. A great hideaway amid hundreds of date spots in the city.
Execellent Kimbap. The bbq is not as good as other korean bbqs in vegas. They have very good authentic korean dishes. Would return but not for the bbq

Food was all around amazing. Filet mignon and spare ribs were delicious. The waiters were quick and attentive.  I would probably skip the kobacha squash tempura next time.  They were out of a lot of beers also.

They gave a lot of rice compared to other Korean BBQ places. They gave way more food then I would've expected and were really accommodating to our party of 7. The speed of the food was amazing the price was spot on and perfect for the amount of quality food 11/10 would come again!

Best customer service. Everyone is so polite and genuine. Besides great employees, the food is most definitely amazing and so tasteful.. A place to come back to over and over again multiple times in the same week as some of my friends do.

At first I just wanted to go to other all you can eat place but after having a dinner here, I just decided to put it in my favorite list in Vegas. The service was amazing. I was a very picky person but this restaurant changed my mind. 4 must-have are: Bulgogi, beef toro, harami miso, prime kalbi. FYI, the happy hour is from 10pm-1am
Best happy hour! Can't beat the prices for a late night bite. Spicy pork is a must order. The service is quick too.

super nice service. Food is ok like any other Korean's BBQ. love love their jalape√±o bacon poppers. They had salmon in it & mayo, it might be even more amazing if they had cream cheese with salmon in it. & if you xheck in now, you'll get a free macaroon ice cream...score!!!

We've always been looking for a good Korean restaurant, and finally found one of the best Korean dining restaurant. Very delicious food, pleasant server and nice ambiance. Would really recommend this place to my family and friends.

Outsider from out of town. Wanted Korean and pulled up Yelp and this Gangnam came up. The interior design of the place felt really modern with a touch of feng shui. They have updated music videos displayed. All the servers are very nice and build a rapport with you. The food is very balance opposed to all those you can eat buffet that try to overstuff you with side condiments so you can eat less meat. The menu gives you a whole variety of things that I never seen before on a Korean BBQ menu. Plus: PRIME MEAT. Overall I give it 5 out 5 because of professionalism and true balance of the variety of the food.

Love this place!! Great atmosphere, good drinks, and good service.  We've been to sura BBQ before, but it does not compare.  Clean place ands good location.  We will definitely be coming back and telling our friends and family about this place.  We ordered the gangnam special (which was more than enough food) and a bottle of soju.  The waiter was above and beyond.  When he served us the soju he noticed that the shot glass was not clean and came back with a new one.  This has been the best experience with the most friendly staff.
Loved the filet mignon, calamari, and mushrooms. K-pop music was an added bonus!! Service was excellent .  Highly recommend this place.

I come from Boston, where there are only a handful of Korean restaurants. Even in Boston, they do not charge extra for 'ssam/ lettuce wrap' for the meats and for the salt/ sesame oil dip. This place charges an extra $2 for the lettuce, another $1 for the sesame oil sauce, and about $1.5 each for a bowl of rice. My husband dines like a true Korean, so he had to order those sides for a complete Korean BBQ meal. I found these surcharges to be very unappealing for a Korean restaurant and won't be coming back to this restaurant for this reason. It comes off as cheap and not allowing patrons to get the full Korean BBQ dining experience. 

Quality of the meat is good, but portions are ridiculously small. The samgyupsal (pork belly) pieces are sliced very thin and contains much more fat than meat (not in an appealing way that typical pork belly fat to meat ratio contains). 

Due to their current promotion of getting a free dessert for writing a review, I believe that the ratings here are highly skewed. The waitress reads your review on the spot then gives you a dessert. I highly doubt these reviewers here are writing an honest and thoughtful review of this place.

Great service, good quality food! I had never had Korean BBQ before and was super scared! Thankfully I had a veteran with me and he ordered. Everything was super fresh and delish, I loved the entire experience. The best part was the meat of course and it was super tender. I would recommend this place to anyone new or old to the Korean BBQ game.

Ate here my first day in Vegas! Got the Meat Lover combo with my family of 4. The seaweed salad was really refreshing and delicious and the sauces were very flavorful! Something different to me was the sides because in SoCal I am used to having more potato salads but here they have fish cakes and more different types of sides! Overall great experience here, bit on the more pricey side since we got the combo for $100 because usually AYCE would be $25/person as well. Maybe next time would only get the combo for 2 people instead of 4 because we couldn't finish but was able to get some to-go! Also great customer service and would return again! 

Tip: Check in to yelp for a free macaroon ice cream!

One of the best if not the best Korean bbq I've eaten at! The sides are really good, especially the sweet kimchi cucumber! I had the bulgogi bibimbap and it was phenomenal! You can check in for an ice cream macaron, which is also really good. I will definitely come back here.

They were a little backed up because of so many bar orders, but they apologized and gave us some upgrades no charge. It's no wonder why they have so many 5 stars. Their staff can turn a 3 star experience and change it to a 5 with a simple apologize. Great service and awesome food!

I ate at a lot of fancy places in Vegas, but this was my favorite place of the trip. It's not fancy, but the food is great, the staff is nice, and they'll give good advice on what to order.
Go with friends--it'll make it fun. The BBQ is delicious.
This restaurant deserves more recognition because it's one of the best places I've ever eaten at. It has excellent food and the customer service is outstanding!
Love this place! Always come here when in Vegas! The food is flavorful and yummy! The service is friendly and accommodating.

This is a great restaurant. The plates are small but they're supposed to be which makes it easy for sharing. The kalbi and bulgogi were my favorites. Because it's supposed to be a Japanese fusion restaurant they don't offer the type of side dishes traditionally served with Korean BBQ however kimchi and rice are the available upon request. I found this restaurant to be relatively reasonably priced for Las Vegas standards.

We live on the other side of town and this is our favorite Korean bbq place to eat at. Our family from California came to town and we decided to take them here to have a good dinner. The servers are always consistent and friendly. We came in with a party of 12 and as soon as we walked in, Jin greeted us and sat us right away. He was very, very nice and kept checking up on us to make sure everything was alright. We love this place and don't mind driving across town to have a good dinner and great service.
Great food! Excellent customer service! Brought some friends here from new york and got the meat livers for 4 perople.. it was more than enough! We're all so full and there's still food to spare

Great service! Lots of good food ! With very reasonable price! Ordered the meat lover set for 2 and we are very satisfied. Nice atmosphere with the music, very cozy and quiet perfect for a lunch date. :)

Minus 1 star due to paying for rice. 2 bowls were almost $5.00. I've never paid for rice in the Bay Area. 

The banchan selection was good, 7 total and they will refill one time free of charge.
We had the Korean short rib, beef brisket and spicy pork for meat selections. For apps we had dukkboki and squash tempura. All were delicious. 

The service was prompt and pleasant. Unlike hobak and goong you have to grill your own meat. I rather liked grilling myself so you can pace the speed you eat.

Price was very reasonable. For the three meat choices it was under $20.00 which was plenty for two people. 

For free macaroon ice cream, complete a yelp check-in. The coffee flavor was awesome and it hit the spot.

Will definitely go back again.

The smell is really good here and you should DEFINITELY visit here! It smells like steak! :-) The place is great, too. If you rate on this app (yelp) you get FREE DESSERT! The waiters are really nice :-D

I was so pleased with their service and attentiveness. Wow! I will definitely come again and even invite my friends.   Let them know its your birthday and they will give you a free plate of prime slice.

I've been meaning to talk about this place but I live in the bay area and forgot.  It's awesome...and my daughter Danielle likes it so enough said ya'll.  Service is prompt and quality of food is on point!  Small meat portions is a great concept.  We order to our hunger when hungry and often left with food we cannot eat, no matter how good.  This concept, tapas concept, is becoming more familiar everywhere but it's truly perfected here...quality is fantastic!  My second time here and I am more impressed than my first visit.

Gangnam set is the best value!
They come with vary of delicious meats.
I recommend this set for economy meal ;)
This place is magnificent! You have to try the spicy tuna rolls! OMG to die for!!! The spicy rice cake??? Forget about it!! It's sooooo good!

First time here and I can see why there are so many reviews! The service was great and the quality of the meat were really good. Got the premium combo which included the kobe beef. Ambiance was good. Parking can be difficult though, but overall a great experience and I would definitely come again

Came here to try their happy hour. Food is delicious. I ordered the beef toro and bulgogi. Prices here are affordable and restaurant is clean. I like their design on the inside of the restaurant. Music choice playing was also great. Food came out great. Great customer service and I got side dishes with my order. Definitely will bring my friends to this place. Plus free dessert if you write a review for Yelp for a limited time. :-)
Food was amazing and staff was extremely friendly. I would recommend this to anyone! The Korean Prime Kalbi was my favorite. The food came out really quick and the staff was attentive to our needs.
It was a good meal, meat quality was really good, and they made the taste sweat and spicy. For me that's perfect, I will highly recommend this place!

It was "ok". I wouldn't go back. The service wasn't anything above average and there is way too much competition to subject myself to mediocre servers...especially when they're located in the hood. It's gotta be worth it to get food in a sketchy neighborhood, and this isn't it.
This place really awesome. Love it. 5 stars!!! I will come back when I come Las Vargas again.
The servers are very nice and the BBQ tastes very good. I love meat!! Very good eating atmosphere and best place for family get together!

We went here for lunch and got the lunch special. There were a variety of meats to choose from along with a huge variety of side dishes. The flavor and cuts of meat were very perfect. The customer service was on point and at no point did I have to look for a server. My water was always full and we were well taken care of. The menu selection is easy and not complicated. I have no issues granting a 5 star review for this restaurant.
A ton of food! This is Korean BBQ done right - definitely worth a stop if you're in Vegas and hungry.

ATMOSPHERE: Went in on a weeknight and there was a large party in the back and a few tables taken in the general area. The atmosphere reminded me of an upscale clean Korean BBQ restaurant that I had visited in California and you can't find that in most Las Vegas locations. It is well-ventilated, dimly-lit and the dark and red tones are romantic.

FOOD: my boyfriend and I ordered the Original Bibimbap $10 and the Korean Pancake with Thrifty's Vanilla Ice Cream $5-6. The Bibimbap was delicious and the stone pot was so hot it made the some of the rice crispy, cooked the vegetables and marinated beef well but kept the juices flowing and our stomachs satisfied! The Korean pancake was kind of small  but the ice cream was Thrifty's and that alone was a point.

SERVICE: accommodating and quick! Served us quickly and efficiently. The servers took time to talk to us and find how we were doing. 

Definitely a must try and the people working there are very nice. I say give it a try =)

My husband and I came here after choosing a random Asian restaurant in Las Vegas. We left fat and happy. It has to be one of our top all time meals. The atmosphere was fun, the food delicious, and we wish we had one near us at home!

We ordered the gangnam style for 2. The meat choices were perfect we also added on a few more meats to our order. The portions for 3 are more than enough,  very filling . Great ambiance,  good quality meats! my husband and I enjoyed our visit . We came for our anniversary.

First off I don't like how they make you write a review in exchange for free dessert. This will prob. explain the 4000+ reviews! I feel like its totally unethical, and defeats the purpose of yelp. Anyway, me and a bunch of my friends got the Meat Lovers option and it was really good--my favorite I believe was the Beef Toro and some of the marinated meats. Filet Mignon was a little tough prob. because of how its grilled. Lettuce salad wasn't that great, but I did enjoy the seaweed salad. And the dessert which was a ice cream macroon (mango flavored) was delicious--reminded me of the one's at Trader Joes which I do like. Main bad thing was the location--you have to drive to this location so it's not convenient unless you have a car. Overall, if your craving kkbbq in Vegas-check this place out.

Yum yum yum this place is so good I love everything on the menu and I love their happy hour from 3pm to 6pm service is pretty good and I love cooking the stuff myself or having them do it . Had to make this my first stop

Very reasonably priced. Great food and service. We came here with a group of 5 and ordered the meat lovers special for 4 people. It was enough for everyone in the group, and then some! The pork Bulgogi was a huge hit with everyone and the miso soup was very tasty! You get a ton of little side dishes as well that they bring out to the table as soon as you sit down. We took advantage of the happy hour specials, 50% off of hot sake and beers. We got 2 Apple sake's,  2 hot sake's,and beers. Our glasses never went empty. I highly recommend the apple sake. Also, If you check in on Yelp you get a free macaroon ice cream sandwich, a delightful way to finish off our great meal! Oh-& for all of that our bill was only around $35 per person! We will definitely come back here the next time we're in town.

Sometimes a simple service can affect an overall dining experience...This is the case of this restaurant.

Came in for lunch, the restaurant was about 70% full. A male server seated us, not a hi, welcome or any greeting.

Plates, water, and utensils was sliding on the table. Needed the flag down the staff to order when they were pretty much..Staring blankly and standing around.  

We finished the first round of the side dishes and flagged down a shxt face service for second round, he asked "which one" I said "all of them" he stood there for about 5 seconds silent then left without clearing out the empty plates then came back "sliding" the side dishes on our table...

Seriously, the food quality is just ok. You would expect it to be better when 6-8 thin slices of beef portion like appetizer that would cost $9+ per plate....
Needed BBQ fix while visting Las Vegas and did not disappoint. Hopefully we'll be back soon for more.
Food was amazing and the waiters is very accommodating .  A must go place for BBQ cravings.

Great place! Good food with excellent happy hour. Everything was fresh and tasty. Short Drive off the strip and make it down here you won't be disappointed. Short ribs were excellent and so was the filet. The music videos are a a little annoying playing in the background with some edgy rap playing  at times
Service was good. All proteins were good. The appetizers were a little lacking. Overall very nice experience!
Food and service are good with a fun friendly atmosphere. Portions are plentiful and the wait wasn't long for a Saturday night. I will definitely be coming back.
All kind of the BBQ food are really yummy. I would say here is the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas that I've known with the best prices.

Gangnam was INCREDIBLE!!! It was actually my first time at a Korean BBQ restaurant, and it was the best dining experience I've had in awhile. I came in very hungry and waited less than 25 mins on a Friday night with no reservation, and the food came extremely fast. My friend and I (him and I both eat big eaters) were overly full and the food was all amazing. We did the Las Vegas combo for $45, with a side of oysters for $7 and it was all crazy good! Can't wait to go back. The concept was awesome, service great, and food was all really yummy. Go here for sure!
The gangnam and bibimbap were good. But the ramen was like instant ramen (do not recommend). I would definitely come here again though!
Service is amazing, staff was very nice and their recommendations were spot on. Food was delivered promptly and was very delicious. Definitely a must come if visiting New Vegas.
I came with my family. Huge portions, food was tasty. Will come back again! I like the music video wall :)
We ordered the Meat Lovers set. It was a good amount of food. The meats had good flavor to it. The side dishes were very tasty too! Service was excellent.

I am so happy this gem is not on the strip, could you imagine how over priced it would be? Came here on a Saturday night for a 7PM dinner, and the place was dead. But that was okay because my party had an entire back room to ourselves.

The service was stellar, and i'm sure most readers understand the premise of the place. You get a lot of pre-marinated meats/veggies/etc brought out to you and you cook it yourself on the mini-grill. It's so easy a 7 year old could do it (or my older brother who hardly gets credit for cracking an egg).

I recommend you get one of the pre-designed samplers. We opted for The paradise A  and we got more than enough food for two.  The Harami Miso, prime kalbi, and calimari were all yummy.

I would recommend this to anyone who is staying in Las Vegas. It is located right across the street from the Hard Rock Casino, but worth the cab ride if you are staying on the strip and to lazy to walk.

Excellent Korean BBQ!  They offer a few cuts you don't normally see such as skirt steak and beef tongue.  The kalbi was particularly good.  I appreciate the small order "Korean tapas" style menu.  This way you get to try a little of everything.  Three dipping sauces are on the table, which is really nice.  The free ice cream sandwich was the perfect dessert.  I'm only knocking off a star due to the slow service.  It wasn't very busy and yet our waiter would vanish, and his replacement would also vanish.
Excellent assortment of delicious food. Great service too. Love the variety. Tasty meats and sides. The dessert macaroons are my favorite!

This is not an AYCE Korean bbq joint but they do have options where you can order per entree or do a package option for parties of 2 or more.  We ended up just picking what we wanted to try which was the better option for us. We really enjoyed all the meat options especially the waygu carpaccio, marinated galbi, filet mignon and more! The meats tasted fresh. The sides were typical of any other other Korean barbecue place but I really enjoyed the macaroni salad the most! 

The service was excellent and quick. Highly recommend! 

Tip: check in for a free macaroon ice cream sandwich!
Bring your appetite! Great food,  good service.  We just stumbled upon this place and we will be back!
Amazing meat and seafood selections. Great staff with happy friendly environment. Definitely recommend this place.
The beef bogogi is delicious!!!! The service was good even though there was only two servers. They did try their best to accompdate ten people

The food and atmosphere is great! I came here for my sister's Bachelorette party! The side dishes are amazing!

Note: If you give a Yelp review you can get free desserts, one dessert per one review per person! We all got delicious macaron ice cream! :)
Great experience eating here. The food was great ! I would recommend it to everybody. The service here was good too......

I love this place!! It's like they know me already! I always get my usual table and I love it. They're so sweet!! And so attentive!! I'm partial to their Happy Hour. I hands down highly recommend this place!!!

Excellent choice and quality of meats. I would have gladly given it 4-5 stars but the service was definitely lacking. The servers seem to try to avoid giving you service. I have asked multiple times for additional sides and all they did was ignore us. They were lucky I was in a good mood that night and didn't want to make a big fuss. I did enjoy the food and the fact that this was not AYCE. This definitely was above the norm KBBQ if the service was only better.

This place is great! This was my first Korean BBQ experience and I really enjoyed it. The food is amazing and there is a huge selection of items on the menu. It's perfect for groups and a fun dining experience. I definitely recommend checking this place out!

First time in Las Vegas. Yelp recommended I try this restaurant because of the many reviews and positive feedback. 

The server sat us down and automatically spoke to us in Korean assuming we were Korean. He was very short with his words and seemed very unhappy to be at work.. 

We ordered prime rib Kalbi and another Kalbi and pork belly. Holy crap.... Pork belly isn't worth .70cents a piece. Kalbi was okay. Meat was tough but marinade was good.

I am actually writing this review as we sit at this table and await our server to come by to ask if we need anything for once. Sat here for about 30 min without a single visit..... LOUSY SERVICE. 

I defintely won't be coming back to this place. Total rip off. Every thing you order on the side is extra so be careful!

Loved the spicy chicken option for BBQ. Cream cheese wontons were great. Didn't enjoy the shrimp and calamari as much- bit too bland for my taste. The biggest pro of this place is the free macaron sandwich with yelp check in

Amazing experiences with the bulgogi. The taste was fabulous. I love the broccoli with cheese, and the beef toro
The staffs were very nice and helpful.
My favorite is the bulgogi.

Came here on a Friday around 4PM with a group of 5 people and there was no wait considering we came during happy hour. The specials were reasonable, and so was the food. My fave was the beef toro and those pieces are pretty big so I had to cut them up! Only downside was that it was sometimes hard to get a waiter/waitress' attention and some of the things we ordered took a while to come out of the kitchen. Besides that I enjoyed my experience here. Would definitely recommend coming here, especially during happy hour!

Awesome KBBQ restaurant.  My group ordered the Gangnam special and it was one of the best meals I've had in Vegas.  It came with a salad, miso soup, raw oysters, bibimibap, corn and a selection of protein.  I have a big appetite and I was satisfied with the amount of food we had.  The meats were good quality and it's up to you to ensure they're not burnt.  We basically threw on plate after plate of meat.  You finished what you had on your plate and there's more in the grill!  

I called ahead since we had a group of 12.  They have a large room in the back and were very accommodating.  Service was good.  Definitely would come back to this restaurant.
Best Korean Bbq! Superb! Wait for 1 hour in line. But it was worth it. All the meats  were delicious

I love Korean food, especially Korean BBQ. Why you asked? Because of the variety of taste as you enjoy eating. I like to roll my meat in either rice paper or radish or both and clear my pallets with the condiments. This place, although the service was good, the food taste was not bad, but the lack of the essential Korean food restaurant experience was a turn down. For example, they don't have rice paper, radish, seaweed etc. Some of you might say that is not for you, understandable but it should be an option for some people. Anyway, if you like a relaxing experience and not picky about the food experience so much, this place maybe for you..
Would like to come back for happy hour. The beef carpaccio is very good. The beef toro, prime galbi, scallops were what we ordered.

Pretty damn good KBBQ!

Unlike other Korean spots I've been to, the vibe of this place is decorated nicely and really clean which made me feel even more comfortable with stopping by for some lunch munchies. 
 
Ordered the Meat Lovers meal for 4 people which was $99. They start you out with a nice salad topped with an Italian like dressing. Miso soup is served shortly after. The main entree consisted of Kalbi, Bulgogi, Pork belly, Spicy pork, and the only meat i was really craving on the menu, Filet mignon! Unfortunately it was also the only meat that turned out bad with whatever marinade they used. On the another note, we had reached our belly limits. The meal filled us all perfectly with a little desert room to spare.

Our server was great, and he was very consistent with checking up on us. Then again, there were only a few tables being occupied at the time Lol.

I left feeling so stuffed and satisfied. They had great service and they seated us faster than the hostess estimated. I also checked in using yelp and i got 1 free macaroon but our waiter offered one for each of my parents too! Hands down, one of the top korean restaurants i've ever been to. Their bibimbap and kimchi soup was amazing! I definitely want to go back because just thinking about it is making me hungry again

Five stars for the great food, service, ambiance, pricing and menu! The Harami Miso was tender and full of flavor, making it my favorite amongst the other meats we had. I enjoyed my Pear Martini but if you're a beer drinker, they've got plenty to choose from. They give you three sauces which were good but I also ordered a side of sesame oil and sea salt to dip my meats in. You'll also get seven side dishes just like you would at most Korean restaurants. I will definitely be back when visiting Las Vegas!
Best meat I've eaten in a while. Love the macarons as well. Totally recommend this place for any gambler in Las Vegas.
The restaurant was easy to find and the food  was great. Had the scallops, kalbi and pork belly. So yummy and the service excellent
First time eating this style of dining. Excellent experience both food and service :)

My wife and I recently had dinner at Gangnam and really enjoyed most everything.  We had the Premium selection and it was a ridiculous amount of food. 

I thought the ambiance was nice and it is always fun to grill your own food - adds a little entertainment factor to the meal.

The service was good, but I wish they explained things a little better.  I felt a bit like it was speed dating.  The dropped the food off and ran.  The three sauces were also indistinguishable and I didn't know which foods they paired with.

I would come here again.

Came here for the first time to eat off the strip. Pretty tasty, not the best as coming from Southern California where there's plentiful Korean BBQ everywhere our expectations are high. Not all-you-can-eat, could get a little pricy as we ordered al la carte instead of one of the combo packages because we didn't want everything in the package. Nice atmosphere, attentive servers. Overall, good.
Even though this is my 2nd time coming and my only Korean BBQ joint I've had a great experience

Hungry?! Want something different? This is the place!!!! Many different choices to choose from!!!! Go heavy on the veggies! Bring on the seafood! Want some steak?! Yup! They got it!!!!! Truly have to go to appreciate!!! Like having a backyard BBQ with none of the mess. Service is quick and friendly without ruining the cook it yourself fun!!!!!

We showed up at gangman and it was packed - an hour wait.  But they had 2 seats at the bar so we took those.  Food was great but the service was even better.  We found one of the four corn pieces was a bit burnt.  They replaced the dish and took it off the bill.  We will go back for sure.
Very good food, great price, great service. Good find among this city and much better value than a casino owned restaurant.

I came to Vegas with my girlfriend and came across this wonderful bbq place, definitely recommend the gangnam bbq set and the bacon with scallop, we barely finish the set...........and then we did ~delicious!

Best best best I've ever had!
Best price, best service, best food!
Totally coming back again when I'm in Vegas!
Drink price is very reasonable too!
Great quality food at a very reasonable price. Half the Prime Kalbi and it was great. All the sides were fresh and tasty. Located across from the Hard Rock, this place is a new favorite of mine.

Great service and a fun little find while chilling in Vegas after New year's. Got to cook my own meats and the kids had a variety to try, a little too spicy for my kids though. I loved it and so did the wife. Reasonable prices.
Fantastic high quality food and even better service, get the filet. Try the combo meals. Cook your food right at the table.  Better than any other place I've had in vegas. Yum!

This review is too long over due, this restaurant is how do you say Awesome!!! from the time you walk in and is greeted by the hostess which is a good looking, sexy , hot Filipino lady, the second thing that came to my mind was order your food,the Interior and ambiance was definitely up to par,there is a flat screen TV that was showing Asian news and a large projection screen  TV that was showing a Asian dance videos, teppan style tables,also a sushi bar area in the rear,you can have your photo taken and place on the wall with the others 50 plus there.I had the make your own lunch set, fire cracker chicken, spicy cucumber, chicken basil, rice, and miso soup,the food was season very well and delicious,buy one beer or sake you get one free (Sapporo, Asahi, Hite, Soju, Sake..cold or hot) happy hour is all day long the menu has a lot of tasty Item to offer,Hard Rock Hotel to the west and UNLV is the the east......Recommended.

Absolutely delicious. The garlic steak and filet was phenomenal. The noodles, sweet corn, awesome. I would highly recommend everyone coming if they get the chance. The staff is so friendly and quick. A great experience.

The meat was tender! Lawwwwwd. First time ever having Korean BBQ and my dad even said this place was better than Las Vegas strip buffet! We ordered the meat lovers and another 2 people combo and it was enough to feed 5 and more. Loved it all...

Food was pretty amazing. I ordered their bulgogi, spicy chicken, spicy pork, spicy squid, spicy chicken karage, fried calamari, and pork belly. The bulgogi and spicy pork had the best flavor and were my favorite, but everything was good. I suggest eating when they have happy hour. You get a ton of food for a decent price. Service was great as well. They were very friendly and always made sure everything was okay. I would definitely come back again.
Wonderful place for a late night dinner after a long exhausting flight. Love all the sides selection , highly recommend to try the wagu beef, very very good value for the cost.

Great traditional Korean bbq Kimchi Gigae was awesome! They have jinro soju that i haven't had in years!  Really good meats that were marinated well. Took me back to the days of living in the land of the morning calm!
We are here for our sister's birthday. It's our first time and we're all impressed. High quality meat & good service with a lot of alcohol choice.

Ordered 2 paradise meals for a group of 6 and had plenty for everyone.  Service was excellent.  Food was fantastic, loved everything.  Needless to say looking forward to coming back and would recommend especially if you are staying at Hard Rock.

Came here during my vacation. It was around 15-20 minutes wait but it was worth the wait. I got the bulgogi bibibamp and it was good and kept hot throughtout my visit. My friends got several different meats and soups. All were pretty good!
Great food, very taste, cool atmosphere. Definitely need to come here. Staff is very friendly, fast and willing to accommodate all your needs.

This place was fantastic.  We had the meat lovers package for 9 people. I thought it wasn't gonna be enough but we all left satisfied. YUM! The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was really nice. The musical selection was also on point. It's great a thing I work right across the street cause I'll definitely be here more often.

Inconspicuous little spot in a strip mall near the Las Vegas strip. The food was fantastic and the portion sizes were filling. Very reasonable priced entrees. The complimentary Kim chi sampler to start was a perfect way to begin the meal. The best part of this place is the service. The staff was attentive, courteous, and efficient. Overall one of my top 5 dining experiences in Vegas.
Wonderful food and great service. Reasonably priced and amazing find in Vegas! We had the bulgogi and the kalbi with white rice and sides and it was amazing. Would highly recommend.

The food was good and service was good. Came in a group of four for lunch and ordered tteokbokki, pork belly, kalbi, and beef brisket. The wait for dinner time was very long, which is why we ended up going for lunch instead.

I have never realized just how good we have it in DC as far as Korean food goes.  Our local KBBQ place isn't even the best in our area - but it FAR exceeds the food we had at Gangnam.  Most of the meat was TOUGH and chewy, and none of the sides was particularly exciting.  

It looked like some locals were enjoying bowls of soup, etc. that may be better...but as far as bbq goes, this really missed the mark for us.
Worst service ever... Came with a party of seven and didn't check up on us at all! Didn't even give us our complimentary kimchi!!! I would never go there again....

If you want real korean food, this place is not the place.  Service was poor and quality was poor.  Agree with some that other korean BBQ places wirh korean people there eating is a good sign of good korean food at a restuant.  No korean people present except myself at this place.

They charged us 18% tip atomic ally for 4 people. ?? A diet coke was $6 and one half Corn was $4 .  Not worth it at all.  Go to a real korean BBQ restaurant if u want authentic tic food and don't waste your time here.

Been to LA. New York and atlanta to name a few...and this was not even comparable to those restuarants.  

If you are ok with eating over priced non authentic korean food and being charged for $6 dollars for a diet coke and getting bad food and Service,  this is definitely your place.
We just got here from new york. The food tasted amazing and the service was great!! The waiter was really cool. Would love to come back here
Probably the best Korean food in Vegas. We ordered Gangnam set for 4 to feed 5 ppl and can barely finish.the kimchi tofu & bibimbap is extra tasty.

So this was my first (definitely NOT my last) Korean BBQ. It was actually subbing for a Wedding reception!

Where to start. Everything was great. Food quality was solid. Lots of meat of all types. Sirloin, flank, skirt, strip...it was all delicious! Service from Sue was solid as well. No complaints & will definitely eat at a Korean BBQ again!

Very good Korean BBQ with big varieties full of flavor and taste and served in nicely manner with reasonable price
We will comeback to this place for sure
Came down here from Phx,Az. Hands down thee best place to eat. Friendly service, awesome vibe & great prices. I recommend the Bulgogi Bimbimpap.

First time at this restaurant and the food is absolutely delicious. Full of flavor and lots of options. The wait staff are all very attentive. Our waiter's name is Joseph and he has been so great and helpful. Great experience and will be back next time I am in town!!

This was a really good KBBQ joint! The quality of meat and the side dishes were great. I am from the LA area, so you can trust me when it comes to KBBQ! It is not AYCE, but the gangnam special for 6 people was able to feed our group of 7. Great service as well!

We arrived around 5pm and the place was packed, but the wait time wasn't that bad. I recommend getting the prime rib and galbi soup if ever you check this place out. Ventilation of the place is also great compared to other bbq places. Friedly servers are also attentive and cheerful.
Great food and great service, would be a 5 star if there were refills for drinks and/or side dishes.

Great food here the BBQ is very tasty highly recommended. Plan ahead during the holiday hour. Waited about 1 hrs but totally worth it! They don't take reservations so you have to be there to take a number

Great food and environment! The prices are reasonable, especially happy hour. We loved the kalbi and bulgogi, and the service was excellent. The spicy sauce is also delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone!
Joseph is a really good server he is awesome! Attitude amazing customer service is just beyond good!

I really enjoyed the calamari side dish never had it like theirs and I was very surprised to find it was delicious. 
I ordered the spicy noodle bowl and it was very tasty, slightly spicy & sweet at the same time. I hope I can find the same dish in San Diego when I leave Vegas. 
Definitely worth stoping by if your in the mood for this food.

Uni bibimbap is awesome.
Also highly recommend Gangnam and meatlover combo. 
Oysters are great too.
Great food. Order a couple at a time as it's not AYCE. Great service!

I had high expectations due to yelp reviews, but wasn't impressed, as I've had better in Duluth, GA. We came in during a slow Friday afternoon and ordered individual items of assorted marinated meats of pork belly and galbi, and the bacon wrapped enoki (a new found love for enoki mushrooms). In my opinion, the meat portions were too small for the price you pay. I believe they were ranging $8-10 per plate with about 4-6 pieces of meats. The flavors were pretty decent, but the meat quality just wasn't there. The meat did not taste fresh, but rather like it's been a good few days (3-5) since it was fresh. The bacon wrapped enoki was delicious but was very hard to cook without everything falling apart because you have to rotate it to cook the bacon. We did end up getting rice, which is charged for (~$2 per bowl), unlike other kbbq places that provide them at no charge when requested. The banchan was meh, as I thought the options didn't complement the meal well. For desserts, my SO and I checked in on yelp for a free macaroon ice cream. We had green tea and mango. Both were decent, but we liked the mango better. In general, the macaroon seemed stale, but it was free so we can't complain. 

Overall, I'd tell you to lower your expectations and you might just really really enjoy your meal!

The gangnam meat combo was surprisingly filling and the quality of the meat was very lean and good.  the side dishes were diverse. the combo for 2 people was more than enough food.  Recommend  this place for people interested in higher quality korean bbq
My phone screen is covered with savory kalbi and bulgogi juice as it was sitting too close to the grill. I'll probably be licking the screen clean later this evening.  Awesome Korean BBQ!
Great lunch special. Large portions. Fantastic service. If your looking for a great Korean bbq spot. One of the best by far.

Wow...like wow...

We were treated to dinner here by a colleague during a recent convention...and wow...

Before we had gotten there, they had already ordered...some type of premium platter that feeds ~6 people...it could have fed 6 villages...

I am not sure if this is all in the platter, but this is what we had...

Salads that were, despite us not wanting to waste any stomach space on salad, we're surprisingly light, well dressed and well balanced--a very nice starter.

8 different kinds of Pan Chan...sprouts, fish cake, delicious cabbage Kim chee, perfectly crunchy cucumber Kim chee, and more..

Hawaiian Poke style ahi tuna--this was good, but there was too much other great stuff

Half shell oysters...probably the only imperfect part of the meal...not much flavor from the oysters or the toppings..

Beer

Kobe beef Carpaccio was a great way to open the main portion of the meal and was probably one of my favorites of all great things we ate

Kobe Style Beef that melts in your mouth like butter...to die for...the best part of the meal

Kal Bi perfectly marinated and as tasty as any Korean BBQ I have had

Beer

Filet mignon cubes...so tender!

Flank steak thinly sliced and delicious..

Beer

Scallops and Shrimp freshly prepared

Ice cream macaroons for dessert...strawberry, coffee, green tea, mango, maybe a few more, but by then, I was so far into food coma heaven, it didn't really matter.

There may have been some other things, but at this point, you either get what I am saying or not...one or two more dishes isn't going to make a difference :-P

Even living in the Bay Area with all the great Korean food, I would be hard-pressed to find a place to top this one...

A resounding 5 stars and I can't wait to go back!

VERY Happy Eating!

Great Service. Food was on point. This spot is hot

Must try the unmarinated meat, cheese corn, and steam egg!

Suddenly craving for Korean BBQ in Vegas, what should you do? You Yelp! Found this restaurant on Yelp and immediately decided to pay it a visit. I went on a Saturday lunch time, I expected there would be a line but the restaurant was pretty much empty.

I got the Gangnam set. It included soup, appetizers, salad, rice, and meat. The best part is it costs only 59.95! I especially love their fresh oyster, Korean Prime Kalbi, and Bulgogi Bibimbap. That Bibimbap was a bomb, it's the best I've ever had. I can now understand why this set is their number one best seller. It's a killer! I was so full that even breathing hurt my belly. Gonna enjoy my food coma now, see ya.

The food was great and I love the concept of cooking the meats on a small grill at the table, but I have never been as cold in a restaurant as I was tonight. I don't know if it's the elaborate ventilation above every grill, but this place is DRAFTY.

It took forever to get us seated. But the food was good. I really like the noodles and the fried rice. Didn't get to finish them because it was a large portion, which is good! I would probably come again.
Was exceptional! The seafood pancake was bomb!  Definitely a place to eat at while in Vegas

I was craving for some good Korean food while up in Vegas.  Thankfully through Yelp I was able to find Gangnam Asian BBQ which wasn't too far from our hotel by cab ride.  The place is located in a mall looking area next to a 24 hr nail salon.  I remember this because I was amazed that they had such thing as a 24 hr nail salon.

We came around 11 at night, a pretty late dinner for us.  But we're in Vegas so thankfully there are lots of late night places to eat.  The good thing about arriving here late is that we made it to the late night happy hour.  I definitely recommend ordering from the happy hour menu!  We literally almost ordered everything from it plus a tofu soup that wasn't on their happy hour menu.  I thought it wasn't going to be enough food but boy was I wrong.  It was too much food! Although my bf can eat a lot, we still had leftovers.  All the meats were good!  Also recommend the cheese wontons. We got 2 orders of those cause my bf liked it so much.  The tofu soup had big chunks of tofu sticking out from the soup and was filled with lots of kimchee and meat inside.  They also give a variety of ban chan.  All so yummy!  I was pleasantly surprised by this place and was even happier with the price.  I would compare this place to being like Gyu-kaku but better!  Service was good, fast and food was great.  No complaints here!

Solid food, free dessert. I really like the beef noodles.

They have a great atmosphere and nice food. Service was fast. Great selection of k-pop.

What a wonderful experience! Came in a little early than lunch hour to avoid crowd on Thanksgiving day.

For BBQ we had harumi miso, prime korean kalbi, beef tongue, and pork belly. BBQ was great. Kalbi and miso beef were all juicy. Beef tongue was a little on the tougher side, but not sure whether it's them or we overcooked it :p 

We also had the steamed egg and spicy tuna kimbap. Everything was amazing! The kimbap was really unique - not your ordinary kimbap - I enjoyed it SO MUCH!

Overall I highly recommend this place if you happen to be around the area!
Great food but way too much, food for two would easily feed three.would recommend if you are willing to try different things

So I'm giving this place a solid 4/5. One point off because the service was a little spotty near the end. I got the feeling that all the waiters were simply very fast paced and if they thought you didn't need them, they simply scurried about their business. 

We went to Happy Hour right when it started at 3p on a Sunday. The menu is overly large and exciting which made us very indecisive. So we started off ordering only a few things with the plan to order more from there. Here's all of what we ordered and what I thought. 

Bacon-Wrapped Asparagus - pretty simple and hard to mess up. But with all the other exciting options, I'd pass on it next time. 

Sweet Cheese Corn - one of my favorites! It was sweet, but not too sweet. And adding cheese never hurts. I would definitely order this again!

Fried Wontons - This is obviously of staple of just about every Asian menu. They were yummy as always, but not noticeably different from any other place. 

Filet Mignon - Again, very simple. But so enjoyable. Be responsible and don't over-cook it! The meat quality was great and is very tender and delicious when you keep it medium rare. I would order this again. 

Bulgogi - Very easy to over-cook due to the thin slices. But if you watch it, it comes out very tender and the marinade was everything I wanted! I would definitely order this again!

Cream Cheese Wontons - The wonton wrapper was super thin and delicate. It had the perfect light Crunch before breaking through to the cream Cheese. The sweet sauce it came with was great! I would order these again!

Chicken Karrage - I had never had this anywhere. So I was surprised to see that the pieces of fried chicken were cut in all different shapes and sizes. In fact, at first I thought the waiter had brought us the wrong thing. I thought it was fried calamari! The chicken itself didn't have much flavor. But the spicy dipping sauce it came with was great! Not sure I'd bother ordering it again, though....

Korean Chicken Cheese Fondue - I enjoyed this chicken even more than I expected! I loved the Crunch that developed from grilling! While the insides remained tender. The cheese came in a little foil bowl. It was shredded and cold and immediately put of the grill. It tasted like an American cheese. I would get this chicken again. 

Vanilla Ice Cream Macaron Sandwich - the Macaron was purple and I'm not sure what flavor it was meant to be - it simply tasted sweet to me. Even after being frozen, it still had that perfect Macaron chew. And the vanilla ice cream was so creamy and smooth!

We had a great time at this place and will definitely be back to try more!

Wow.  Wow!  Wow!!!
My friend took me here - she's been a few times, and thought I'd enjoy it because of the type of diet I am on for a while.
I think this restaurant is in my top 5 of all time.
Basically, you select your meats and seafoods and they bring them to your table - portions are similar to what you'd get at a Tapas place.  You grill the foods at your table.  Some of the dishes are cooked in the kitchen, but pretty much the meats are all grilled by you, at your table.
This food was absolutely some of the most delicious food I've ever eaten!  Anywhere!
The quality was outstanding.
I almost can't wait to get to Las Vegas a year from now, just to go back to this place.
:-)
The spicy yuke jang is the best! Servers are quick and have very nice attitude! Try beef toro, too!

Came around 10 on a Sunday. Had a wait for the booths on the side but nothing too serious. Had a good assortment: kalbi, bulgogi and pork belly. Also got the bibimbop. The bulgogi was some of the best I have ever had anywhere. The kalbi was actually disappointing, it wasn't bad it just wasn't great. Also the kimchi was too sweet for my taste. I assume that number of reviews comes from the fact they give you a free dessert for  a yelp review.

I took my baby here for his birthday. We both thoroughly enjoyed it. The meat was very fresh and was more than enough per order. My only complaint is that my side of the grill didn't work well, so I had to use his side to cook my food, which took longer than it needed to. Other than that, the service was good. We love Asian BBQ so I'm happy we came to enjoy lunch here.
Excellent food excellent service especially for happy hour cuz the food and beer is worth the price
Best gangnam style barbecue...this place rocks the meat is prime time! I'm going back baby!

Holy moly no wonder there are so many 5 star reviews of this place on Yelp!

If you have time while you're in Vegas and want to get KBBQ, come here! It's not AYCE but the portions for the set menus are more than enough. It's even numbers so 2 or 4 people (or 6). The tables aren't really meant for more than 6 people though it doesn't seem so don't go with too big a party unless you're willing to sit at different tables. 

Otherwise, just go here already. Don't bother reading my review or any of the other 4000+ reviews. Just go and order a set and any other extras you want. You'll be satisfied, guaranteed. Not only is it good, but the price is great considering you don't have to eat on the strip. Just do it.

This place is so delicious!  I love how helpful the staff is as well.  We ordered the Las Vegas Special which was 45.00 and served 2 people with all the wonderful sides and still had food left over. Looking forward to bringing my family and friends to come back.
It was really good food and a fun atmosphere! The meat was really tender and easy to cook. The waiters did a good job of coming back frequently to refill drinks. It was fun to use chopsticks too.

5 star food
4 star service 
And decent pricing. 
The traditional are all good.
The chicken with lime is good too.
Beef is best
The service was good! The food was also good! Also, take the picture for the free desert!

This is definitely my favorite BBQ restaurant. The food is amazing, and the staff are always helpful. The first time I ate here i really had no idea how to do anything so I'm glad i was with friends, but in the end i always wanted to come back here. I've been here so many times in each month, I've become a regular & i think some of the employees remember what i order.

Now this is my go-to for dinner, and being on yelp you get free macaroons with a check in.
Delicious food, lots of variety & excellent service!  The macaroon ice cream was the best!!!

Oh my god this was the best food I've ever had in my whole life. It was an endless trough of goodness. I especially like the bulgogi. I was amazed by the personable waitstaff. The drinks were bottomless and the green apples soju cooler was fucking amazing. If you don't come here while in Las Vegas you might as well say that you were never here. It's a great deal. Great value for the money. Great atmosphere.
Love this place, kimchi is just right and meat quality is Great!   This was my second visit and is just as good as the first.

The marinated meat has got to be one of the best Korean BBQ meats I've ever tried (and coming from the bay area, I've tried a LOT). The bibimbap was amazing as well - I'd recommend getting that instead of two white rice if you're going for the Gangnam bbq set. The macaron was really delicious too! Would def come back if I lived here (unfortunately it's an 8 hour drive for me)
Tried this place during a working trip to Vegas. I can't disagree wih the other reviewers: The meat is to die for! Great place for lunch and/or dinner.

Went with friends from California on our last night of our EDC vacation! Was super delicious, service was very nice, and atmosphere was young and fun!

Recommendations? Try out the spicy tuna kimbap if you like sushi, and for the meat get some bulgogi!
Nice vibe. Attentive service. I tried the vegetarian bibimbap and it was mediocre. However, the BBQ meat dishes other tables ordered looked pretty good.

Although this place isn't a AYCE KBBQ, but they do have some great selections.  I was in town with a group of friends and we ordered a few appetizers and the Gangnam. There was no wait on a Saturday afternoon, which was a plus.  We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!

Kobe Saam is the way to go! Super yum! Nice ambience at the venue, too!

Highly recommended if you are traveling to the sin city!

Came in for lunch with my family. We had a party of 10 and we were seated quickly. There is a large party room in the back to accommodate larger parties. The spicey chicken was amazing!! Lived the small plates. The beef short rib was very flavorful. Will cone back again.
Badass Korean bbq! Great service and food! Great happy hour! We got the combo menu which gives you a great sample of all the meats.
Wow, I am a fan of the place. The service was spectacular! And food was really cool. Different and very interesting menu. But very bad parking!
Best Korean food hands form . Amazing staff and environment defiantly recommend to tourist or locals . Fresh clean and good

Visiting from Chicago. Boyfriend wanted some Korean BBQ, this place was amazing. I liked the music they played in the background. The seating was roomy. Service was fast and food was delicious! Meat was high quality. We split the meat lovers meal for 2 people and it was more than enough food for a reasonable price. Go go go!
Food was good and moderately priced! Would definitely come again! The food was tasty and the general vibe was excellent. The location is great for a late night dinner!

Went to the place for the first time off the yelp reviews. The food is ok, but the customer service was the worst I have ever experienced in my life. Servers were very mean and inappropriate.  When I asked if I can take away the unfinished alcohol drink after we finish eating, the serve questioned me whether I know how much it cost for their alcohol license cost. Personally, I think he should approach me in a more appropriate and nicer way. Will definitely not recommend this place to anyone. Will never ever go back for the rest of my life. Worst service!!! I am giving one star cause there is no zero star opinion available.

Ok....so I come to Vegas once or twice a year....mainly for my nieces basketball tournaments...we stay away from the strip, I don't gamble or drink - but I am a foodie.....

The last couple visits I've notice some Korean food spots open up...being an army brat and having an aunt who is from Seoul...(we're talking growing up seeing clay pots of veggies go underground to ferment) I have a pretty set idea of what Korean food should taste like. This place has it down! When I tried the bulgogi my eyes lit up! It's saltier than Kalbi as it should be (some places make it super sweet, albeit delicious - it's not the way I remember it)

Fish cake on point, Kalbi just sweet enough and all pieces of meat were very tender and high quality.

This place isn't all you can eat, however the serving sizes and the portions are perfect! I went with a party of three and we ordered, prime kalbi, pork belly, filet mignon, bacon wrapped enoki, bulgogi, scallops, beef toro, spicy garlic edamame, oysters, spicy tuna kimbap, Kobe beef carpaccio, salmon carpaccio, seafood pancakes, and steamed egg. Yes all for 3 people and it was perfect. Every order we made, came out to an even split of meats for each of us. The quality of the menu items are superb as well! Great place for go-to KBBQ!

Liked how they were open late and also had happy hour specials after 10 pm. We really liked the bulgogi and Korean prime kalbi. They were marinated very flavorfully. The mushroom medley and sweet corn were also very good. Would definitely keep this place on my list of late night eats or when IIA just craving korean barbecue.

In town for a conference in Vegas and looked up the best Asian restaurants near the strip. Gangnam popped up at the top, so here we are!  We ordered the Gangnam platter and it was excellent. Quality of the meat was tender and bibimbop wa also flavorful. Very glad I found this place!
Literally the best meal of my life. The kimchi bibimbop is insane, and the filet mignon melts in your mouth. Come here if you want one of the best meals you have ever had
Nice atmosphere, friendly staffs & service, best of all yummy BBQ!  Well worth the wait! Would love to come back again.
I love the quality of meat, you know its not for the all you can eat korean bbq grill meat quality. I just wish they had combos.
Great Korean Bar-B-Q... the spicy pork is fantastic, dumplings are pretty damn good also...
Super awesome happy hour. Service was quick and very attentive. A bit of a walk from the strip but definitely worth the excursion. Can't really find anything wrong with this place. 5 stars.

Don't pay attention to the bad reviews. I suggest you go and take advantage of their happy hour/lunch specials; they have great quality meat. The interior is very clean, roomy, and low-lit (great place for a romantic meal). The tables are clean and it seems like they take real good care of the grills as well.

I have never heard of this restaurant since they opened and oh my god... I am so glad now that I have! First of all, as a student, I think the location is great! It is literally across the street from UNLV. On my first visit here (also my first time in an asian bbq style restaurant), I was quite confused with their menu, but my server, a lovely Filipino young lady, was very helpful. She took her time explaining the different combos that they offered. I ended up getting the Meat Lover combo, which came out looking very fresh. What I loved most is that it came with miso soup, a salad, a bowl of sticky rice, and 3 different sauces for my meat. On my second visit, I had the same Filipino server. It was also during their happy hour, so select dishes were up to 50% off. I had the Meat Lover again (I can't help it--I love my meat!).

If you are into asian bbq and are near the area, I would highly recommend trying out Gangnam.
Best Korean bbq I've tried.  The food is super filling, and our waiter was so nice and helpful!!! Definitely coming here again when in vegas.

I really wish that Yelp would have the option to rate restaurants with half star. This place is definitely better than average, however, not super great to be four stars. 
The atmosphere is hip and modern. They play current hits, have big screens and the decor is very nice.
In regards to the food, everything was good. The combos are the best way to go. The portion sizes are good for two people and you get to sample several types of meats. The side dishes are not like your typical Korean BBQ which made me a bit disappointed. They serve the combos with rice, miso soup and a plain salad! I really missed my side dishes!!!! Grrr


The service is good and the price is reasonable. If you cannot get to china town, this is a good Korean BBQ for the area!

In town for the weekend and decided to try this place out. Great choice! It was delicious! I we ended up ordering seconds because it was so good. The service was great as well! They were all friendly and very fast. If we are ever back in town, we will definitely be back!
Got here around 3pm. Got seated very fast. We got 2 combo for 5 people which was perfect amount. We were all very full. Good quality meat.  Woot.
Damned good, especially the spicy tuna kimbap! Plus they have this sweet deal where you get free desert if you write a review :)
For my first experience I really enjoyed it.. Happy hour pricing is great and if you go with dessert, try the tempura banana.. You will definitely enjoy it..

Lots of food and of great quality too. Staff was very kind and polite as well as informative. We came in a big group and ordered the meat lover special. They give you all of your food at once so you don't have to keep asking where your stuff is. The sides were especially good compared to other bbq places I've been. Meat was top notch. Overall a great experience! Definitely recommend!

From the Korean Snob again. Food quality was good. My male Korean server needs to be fired or re-trained. Never checked on us, didn't ask me if I wanted rice (dude, what Korean male doesn't eat rice?), no refills, and kept forgetting items we ordered (I can go on and on, but you get my point). Another individual who thinks minimum wage should be $15 per hour, but can't figure out why his tip is too low. 

This place is nothing special, when compared to other traditional Korean bbqs. However, I would give this place 3 1/2 Stars if Yelp would let me. 

I wish the ventilation was better here.

I was there last month for year end family trip. It's one WORD for taste was good. We didn't order BBQ that I don't have opinion. We ordered one pot dishes per each family members. The dishes were good tasty and quantity.
THe problem were all about service. The waitress and waiters were all annoying my request. ANd they even forgot the order for my mom(took 30 minutes serve dish). They looks unkind except only one woman who was in reception desk. I think the problem came from service system which was not designate table. That means they may share the tips. 
Frankly, I won't be there again even not quite super tasty. I don't want keep asking and waiting anymore. I will try other Korean restaurant.
The bulgogi bibimbap is delicious and reasonably priced. The service is really good too.
Perfect place for kalbi and sides. Will come here again. Delicious food! Will recommend to family n friends

The quality of food here is very good. I had a gangnam combo and there wasn't anything I disliked and for 2 people it was very filling. It is a good relieve from the numerous buffet options on the strip.

First of all, our experience here was iffy at first an hour wait was what we were told. We took the risk and are glad we didn't look back on the waiting time because it was worth it! Very friendly service and great food!  Staff members constantly checked up on our table. Also, the music here is POPPIN!

Came here after a 5hr drive from Page,AZ and was definitely looking for somewhere to fill up our hunger. So being from LA, first thing to do was look for somewhere like KBBQ. And this place definitely filled that gap of hunger. True, it's not like LA's but it has good taste. Service was great and the food was satisfying. My recommendation would be to get the meat lover :D

Awesome.  I'm from LA and transplanted out here, I have been looking for a comparable place having tried all the good stuff and this place happily delivered. 

The bolgogi was awesome me and my gf confirmed. Can also suggest calamari.  Korean prime was good but little chewy as its thicker and took longer to cook.  All in all very good and will def be back.

I wasn't so impressed with this spot. First of all, it's very crowded here. We came here for lunch and had to wait about 30 minutes. Secondly, the ventilation system isn't so great here and you can feel the humidity and grease in the air. Thirdly, service was slow. 

I feel like since they gained popularity and are close to the strip, they nickel and dime you. You need to order a minimum of 2 bbq dishes for complimentary ban chan. Ssam (lettuce) is an extra $2. The ban chan portions are small and there's not much variety. The meat quality was so-so. 

I do like how they offer a variety of menu items and even have HH which a lot of people seem to come here for. However, I feel like I can find better kbbq spots in Vegas.

A solid option if you are hungry and looking for good Asian bbq. It also helps that this place is open late at night! We came with a large party and were happily full after. We ordered a set meal, some small appetizers and drinks from the happy hour. My favorite dish here was the fried rice. The portion size was good for the price. I'd come back!

Yessssssssssssss
This was awesome we got the meat lovers for 4 ppl and it was an awesome experience

Good quality meat and a lot of food, but they need to tone down their use of sugar 

Got the Gangnam for 2:

4 out of 5 of the meats were marintated in so much sugar that I was done after eating one of them

The only non sweet meat was the miso steak, and I thought it was extremely salty.

Bulgogi rice - also too sweet

Come if you are hungry! Fun atmosphere. Won't come back though, unless I am craving sugar

Stopped here for lunch with the family on the way back home from Zion National Park. Double check the address as it took us to a nonexistent location at first. We found the correct location in a strip mall next to a tattoo shop.
The service was quick and attentive. Three or four servers regularly checking up on us and refilling drinks and ban chan dishes. 
The d√©cor is very modern (typical Vegas style) and comfortable.
The food was fantastic! We ordered the Gang Nam set for 2. The meat selection and quality was very good. There was enough food for at least three people. 
Value was fair. I thought the price point for the quality and quantity was a very good deal. To top things off, if you check in on Yelp, you get a free macaron. We were a party of five, two people checked in but they gave us five macarons, three on the house. 
Would definitely recommend this place.
very good Korean food and nice service. I love the prime kaibi best. Seafood pancake is just soak, but You should check it out !
