I love the a-la carte concept. It makes it so easy to order with your friends. The wait staff is so friendly and accommodating. I definitely recommend this place to all Korean food lovers.

Was here with my friends post basketball. Didnt know it was happy hour and the offer was so good to refuse. We ordered the porkbelly and bulgogi. Also the original bibimbap. Was a lot of food and serve it on a sizzling plate. Was very satisfied. Def coming back.

Good service and fresh food. A lot of the meat was very fatty and the portions are large. We had 7 people and normally eat a lot. We ordered enough for 6 people according to the menu and could only eat about 75% of it! The rest had to go back to the hotel room.

So much food. Definitely worth the value. Everything was excellent!! Will be back! Got the gangnam and the portion was so huge! All of the meat was perfectly tender. Staff was extremely fast and friendly. The oysters are fantastic!

Didn't expect good kbbq in vegas but this place delivered. 

Was it the best? Nope but it ranks pretty high up there.
I'm from LA & OC and have had a lot of good kbbq so I'm a bit spoiled.

Got the Gangnam combo to try everything.

Great Korean food off the strip in Vegas. I consider myself a Korean food connoisseur and this place did not disappoint! The choice of meats and seafood as well as the great service left a lasting impression. I'll definitely be back!
We ordered the Meat Lovers platter, and it was more than enough food for our party of 5. Portions were more than generous. The seafood soup it came with was a hit as well. Service was excellent!

I was disappointed with this restaurant. The idea of cooking our own Asian BBQ fusion seemed fun enough, but only if correctly executed. The meat came at least 15 minutes ahead of my broccoli fondu, then the fondue was overheated so half of the cheese was stuck to the container. Then they never brought our steamed rice either! After we asked about the rice, they asked us if we wanted to cancel the rice instead of taking it to go like we asked, because they were trying so hard to shove us out of the booth so they could give it to the next customer. To top off this poor dining experience, the waiter briskly dropped the check at the table without refilling my empty drink, or asking if we wanted dessert. I'm scared away from gimmick restaurants for life. Awful!!!

What a fun spot to have a dinner! 

It's a grill it yourself type of meal where you cgoose types of meats, veggies and sides and you cook it yourself at the table with a grill in the middle. 

They also have some noodle plates and soups, so everyone can find something!

Affordable and fun!
Very good authentic Korean BBQ restaurant. Tons of flavorful food. Service is very good. Staff is friendly and helps you with the cooking if needed. Prices are great!

Good food, good service, clean and reasonably priced. 
What more could I ask for!

Good quality very good. Seasoning distinct and flavorful. 

We grilled and we walked out not smelling of smoke. 

The banchan was diverse and wonderfully seasoned.
sheach on yelp is really worth five stat.don't say anything.everything is prefect.just go!
We got the Las Vegas special which was a good amount (shared with 3) we did order some extra meets but over all good taste! And great customer service!!

As a Korean person coming to a Korean restaurant in Vegas, I didn't expect much. But I was wrong, overall it was good food and big portions. Would recommend the Yuke Jang but not the Bibimpap. It was too sweet for what it should be. 

Overall, I had a super nice and friendly server and the experience was nice. Good lighting and music too.

Good quality meats and a fun experience. However, slightly slow service even during a less busy period.
I ordered the mushroom medley as a side and, despite enquiring as to its whereabouts twice, it turned up quite a while after I had already finished my meal without an apology from our server, Li.
My favourite dish was the Bulgogi sliced ribeye and I really enjoyed the fishtail complimentary side. The rest were not anything special but I liked that they were unlimited.
When we went, they were offering free dessert in exchange for a Yelp! review so it would have been rude not to. You get to choose between a free plate of banana tempura with ice cream or a macaron ice cream sandwich (only coffee flavour was left and I'm glad we never paid for it).
First time Korean bbq pretty good place! They are very attentive service is great I recommend the beef toro for beginners. The sides are good aswell

In exchange for a macaroon, I will give my review. Screw this place. They're so slow. It's been 20 minutes and they haven't taken the check yet. I want to LEAVE. I WANT TO GET OUT OF HERE. HELP ME. GOD DEMMIT LET ME FREE. FINALLY. SHE TOOK THE CHECK. I HAD TO GIVE IT TO HER. WTF. 

This is not all you can eat though. So be prepared. The food was really good.
This place is great. I brought many friends here. It's a lot of food so come hungry! All the sides are delicious.

First time I came here was with my cousin, and then they already got me hooked on their happy hour menu. Then just yesterday me and my boyfriend came in and we found out happy hour is all day PLUS buy one get one free beer?! Hell yeahhh! (:
We ordered the: salmon carpaccio, korean kalbi, karage, calamari. I highly recommend all of them. 
Owner is nice, server was nice and atmosphere was pretty upbeat. 
Definitely worth the 30 min drive from my house even tho I have a korean bbq 5mins away. 

my new favorite korean bbq
The best Korean restaurant in Las Vegas. Sure will come again on next  time. Highly recommend for who want to have good Korean food in Las Vegas.
Not just the best Asian BBQ I've ever had. The best meat I've ever had. Off the charts. Nothing else compares.

Brought the wife to Vegas for a birthday roadtrip and this place was first on our list of new places to try.  They did not disappoint!  Awesome flavors and textures. Plus the social experience of cooking our own meat.  Lunch special was more food than i eat at dinner.  Plus as the bonus free desert for reviewing. Good or bad.  It happens to be great come try this place.

We ordered the premium menu for 4, it was amazing the amount of side dishes and the quality of the meat is out of this world....the kobe beef and especially the filet mignon was the most tender juicy melt in your mouth meats that I have had except for the kobe beef I had in japan. You must try this place.

We were looking for a korean restaurant for my MIL's bday.  We didn't want to overpay for crappy food at Ginseng.  So I yelped around and found this gem.  I had no idea what to expect and trusted yelp (like I do most of the time).  I called and made a reservation for 13 on a Saturday night.  The dinner turned out great and I would definitely return. For Vegas standards, this is a good KBBQ place.
Restaurant/Ambiance:  Its located right off the strip (convenient) but towards the back of the lot.  Kinda hard to see.  Restaurant is not a hole-in-the-wall type of place.  Kind of dark with all tables having a BBQ grill top.  We were fortunate enough to be given the private room in the back.  I think it can comfortably seat 15 or so with 2 grills.  It worked out well since we had a couple of small kids.  My only knock was that the table height was kinda high for the chairs.  They had tons of pillows to supplement, but made it just a tad awkward.  The place was initially empty around 5:30pm, but quickly filled up and there was a wait by the time we left around 7pm.  
Service:  Service was ok.  Not up to LA standards but decent.  I thought we would get a dedicated server for our group, but through the evening, the servers would rotate to help us out.  Grills were switched out when asked.  Here they do not cater to you and cook your meat for you (like most of the LA BBQ places).  Food came out quite rapidly.  They didn't clear out our plates, but we had a table on the side that we just set all of the empty dishes.  The banchan was never refilled (we never asked).  Water was refilled when requested.  They had a really nice birthday comp (4-5 ice cream macaroons with candle).  All in all, service was decent.
Food:  In a large group, you have to go with the preset menu.  We opted for the Gangnam BBQ package for 6 (next to highest package).  This came with a lot of appetizers and side dishes and 5 cuts of meat.  The appetizers included: oysters (good size ones and pretty fresh in quality), shishito peppers (really good per one of the guests), fried calamari (crunchy and meaty.  Nice spicy mayo dipping sauce too), miso soup, salad, and bulgogi bibimpap.  I really liked the bulgogi pap.  Basically meat and rice.  The cuts of meat included: bulgogi, kalbi, unmarinated steak, marinated/unmarinated prime steak.  I wished they would have included chadol as one of the selections.  YOu couldn't really substitute anything.  The meat quality was pretty good.  Good amount.  They also included 3 different dipping sauces. 
Value:  If it wasn't for the combo package, I think it could have gotten a tad pricey.  You have to pay for the banchan.  I requested sahm and sahm jang, and they charged me for that.  We did the 6 person combo with 10 adults.  But we ordered a lot of other things on top (udon, 2 different soups, and more rice).

All in all, a great korean BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas.  I would def make reservations ahead of time.
Very good food and quality of food. Went with a party of 5, so we split the Gangnam meal meant for 6 people. It was A LOT of food! And definitely worth it. Would recommend to anybody!

Great place!!!! Best Korean BBQ!!!

I love this place....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Good.....

This place is bomb. This is my second time ever to try Korean BBQ, and this time blew the last place out of the water. Service was great, the food was top notch, and they have a great happy hour :) next time I'm in Vegas, I'm coming back here!
Services and food are great. It's worth your time and money here. Highly recommend this place.
Came with my parents. Food service and atmosphere everything was really good. Affordable price. Soontofu was really good

The kobe beef is awesome!!! 

I came here alone at 4 so I sat at the bar. All my items were cooked for me which was great! I didn't have to worry about charring my meat. 

I got the Kobe beef, spicy garlic short rib, bulgogi, and the beef toro. I pretty much liked everything except for the highly recommended beef toro. It was extremely dry. I'd probably opt for the brisket instead. 

Anyways I had a pretty good experience. The male server was extremely attractive and all the servers kept checking on me to see if everything was okay.
Best place ever for Korean barbecue and beer Kobe beef is awesome the service is awesome atmosphere is really good and thank you for the free ice cream

This is a total 5 star place!! So much food for the money. They give you a lot of side dishes right off the bat.

Among the best dishes I tried were the Bulgogi Bibimbap, steamed egg, Korean Beef Kalbi and Scallops. 

What tops the experience is the great service here. They are very attentive and the food comes out very quickly.

The Banana dessert...oh my goodness. Divine!
The pork belly and jalape√±o poppers are definitely worth trying! The macron ice cream cake are good too. Happy hour is fun!

Came here on "cheat day." Really good, we ordered the Gangnam for two, shared it between three people and it was more than enough food. Only reason for four stars is because we felt like there weren't enough vegetables in the combo and ordering veggies for $3-4 didn't feel justifiable. Overall great experience, everyone was super nice and so attentive. We'll definitely be back!!

By far the best Asian BBQ we have ever had. We had the Las Vegas for for 4 people and was more than enough. The food was fresh and super tasty. If you are ever visiting Vegas like us , this place is must.

One of the best Korean BBQ places I have ever been. The meat is delightfully delicious and chewy. When I entered the restaurant, the smell of BBQ was amazing. Side dishes are really well and tastefully prepared and staffs are very kind. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting Las Vegas. I also strongly recommend to go for Kangnam set menu - delicious dinner at affordable price!

This place serves high quality meat. We tried the most expensive course menu, and it was totally worth of money. The course includes small plates coming along with meats. I absolutely plan to come again and highly recommend Korean style BBQ lovers.
Great authentic Korean food just off the Las Vegas strip. Must try if in the area. Make reservations as it fills up quick.
There was an incredibly long wait likely due to the popularity, but the food was delicious! Good meat and lots of side dishes in our "#1 Gangnam order".
I'm try to eat Korean food and find this place on yelp all the food looks great. I will give it a try and see.

Very tasty food.
Don't like that they charge for salt and sesame oil.
Portions are good for the price.
Chicken Karaage very crispy and tasty 
Banchan were great, included dried squid. YUM!
Great food and excellent service! I especially love their tteokbokki and bulgogi. Plus, what can go better with a good ambiance and free dessert? Worth going back to when we visit Las Vegas again.

Good quality of meat. But the service is terrible. Doesnt give all the food listed in combo menu. Hard to grab servers. All marinated meat are extremely sweet. Even with the burn stains, doesnt change the grill at all. I asked it to be changed and the server was dumbfounded. 

Just order non marinated meat if you can handle their rip off price and terrible service.

Location is easy to find , close to the strip and near airport in a shopping mall . Our favorite dish was the bi bim bop which was large and served in a good sized round pan instead of a bowl shape so there was a lot of surface area for the rice to get crispy against the iron pan, just how we like it . The bbq at table has good ventilation.  We walked in without reservation and were seated promptly . We enjoyed our dinner here. Even got free dessert with Yelp review... Bonus.
Everything is amazing! Order the mushroom medley for sure hands the spicy pork BBQ. Great happy hour 3 to 6.
Nice environment, tasty food and delicious dessert. The 2 person combo is good for me and my friends, we love it!

After reading the reviews of Yelp, I decided to try this place. Not bad, just some things I wanted to point out. 

1) the menus posted outside the restaurant is old, Gangnam package shows calamari, they now replaced the sit down menus with corn (I've posted the new menu)

2) I got my miso soup and salad BEFORE my drinks. When I asked the waiter, he said he didn't work my table. 

3) the waiter who said he didn't work my table, was quick to take my money and ring me up after I was done eating.

This was good recommendation from the escape room CSR. Smokey, but that is to be expected somewhat in a cook your own place. Food was good, though seemed a little pricey. But alas in Vegas what isn't.
Nice, inexpensive, young Korean BBQ place. They cooked the BBQ in their kitchen for me so that I don't have to bear all the BBQ smell on my clothes. Very nice place.

Introduction:
Ok, so I am super picky when it comes to my Korean BBQ.  Which is why it took me so long to try one out until today.

Being new to Las Vegas with so many choices, I did not want to be disappointed and traumatized not wanting to try anywhere else if my first experience is bad.  However, thanks to my fellow yelpers, I uncovered the AMAZING Gangnam Asian BBQ.

Quality: 5/5
Omg! Five STARS hands down.  Everything we ordered were top quality and the marinating was perfection!  Probably one of the better Korean BBQ I've ever had.

Cleanliness: 5/5
Very clean and organize.

Price: 4/5
The price was actually good, the reason why I gave it a four and not five stars is because they charge you items that I don't feel should be charge for.  For example, you get charge for steam rice. Pretty much anything you order, you get charge, but steam rice? I am not sure about water, but I hope not. Anyhow, it's really not the fact that we get charge, just that it feels like you get that nickel and dime to death feeling. Especially when the food is so AMAZING, it's the principal. Steam rice is so darn cheap anyway.

I must say that I was expecting a charge on my refills, lemons, lime juice and sauces, but I wasn't, so it was a good surprise. The steam rice one really shocked me, I can see fried or even brown rice.  But again, it's not that big of a deal, just peculiar to me.

Customer Service: 4/5
The service was great initially and when you are about to leave.  However, during the time we were there, it was ok. The girls were not as attentive like we would like them to be. For instance, we have to flag them down regularly for refills, more sauce, new grill, etc. 

We're use to being checked on at Korean BBQ'S. Maybe that's how they role here in Las Vegas cause I remember reading a bunch of reviews at other places that has the same feedbacks.  We just have to suck it up I guess.

Tips:
Clearly, this is not an all you can eat type of Korean BBQ.  There were two of us and our bill came out to $60 with taxes, two drinks, a brown and steam rice.  But we don't eat that much, so if you are a big eater, expect to pay more.  For us, it was perfect!  

They have the BEST macaron ice cream and it's free if you check in on yelp.  We will definitely be back, the yummy food overrides the other hiccups.
Great design and menu. The only negative point is sweetness of the meats, they r mostly marinated in sweet marina sauce. Too much sweetness!
Our new favorite place to eat in Vegas!  Great food, great service, great prices, good ambiance! What more can you ask for! Definitely coming back again.

Excellent! Came here on a Saturday night during EDC weekend. Wait only took 10 minutes and our server was very responsive and polite! Yuuuuuup! (Seriously, his name was Yup!) He made great suggestions for us on the menu and they turned out fantastic! 

We were a group of 4 and we ordered a meat lovers for 2 and a gangnam for 2. Plenty of variety and certainly filling. Price was reasonable compared to other BBQ places. I would definitely come here again

great place. not AYCE, but it'll fill you up for about the same price. friendly staff, and they have a big screen that plays music videos. the food was great and I got a free macaron ice cream for checking in on my first visit.
First timer to a Korean grill.. Loved the experience.. The jalape√±os poppers with salmon was amazing!  If you are in Vegas definitely give it a try

Great Korean BBQ without the expensive price. Everything was great and the customer service was even better. If you are craving Korean BBQ and are in Vegas I definitely recommend this place. Also avoid the overpriced restaurants in the strip by driving a few miles away and enjoying this Korean BBQ experience.
Had a really great lunch with my husband, sister and brother in law. We loved cooking it all at our table!

I came here with two friends and we were starving. We saw that they had Kobe beef from the window menu and was excited to order that. We went for the Premium Cut package (which included the Kobe beef) but we also tagged on another extra order. 

The Premium Cut package features a lot of great dishes such as fresh shucked oysters, beef carpaccio in ponzu sauce, oven baked asparagus, and my personal favorite was the grilled shrimp fried rice in the clay pot (forgot the Korean name). The rice was so good that we ordered another one to share. 

The Kobe beef was pricey but well worth it - it practically melted in your mouth when cooked to a medium rare. 

The three dipping sauces they give you are nice (one was chili based, another had sesame oil and one was ponzu?) and complemented all the beef cuts really well. Overall it was an amazing BBQ from start to finish. Service was friendly and I will come here again when I'm in town.

PS: The reason why they have so many reviews is because you get a free dessert when you show them your Yelp review - however, I found the dessert to be below average (they are ice cream macarons and looked better than they taste) but that doesn't change how I feel about the awesome BBQ. Skip the dessert :)
Meat was really good and tender. Definitely worth your money. Macaron ice cream that came with check in had a range of flavours and tasted good.

Wanted to try out a new place before we left town. The wait was pretty long but we grabbed a few drinks at the bar. It can get pretty pricey since everything is a la carte unless you order the bigger dinners they have. Overall it was a great experience and it was really good.
Great food. We came for the happy hour and the food came early. They forgot our rice. But overall great experience

This is probably the best Korean bbq I've had in Vegas to date. Good prices, great variety of sides, good quality of meat. Service was a little slow but not terrible. They were just quick to leave before everyone could get a request in. A little hard to find off the strip. Overall good experience.
Friendly service, knowledgeable staff and great food! Must try their Gabi and steam egg! Our go to place for Korean food in Vegas and Kids approved

It's a very cute place and we had a lot of fun with the dinner. I got Skirt steak, fresh prime kalbi, marinated prime kalbi and pork belly. My honey got foudue chicken, shrimp and jalape√±o peppers. Very nice.

I just finished eating at this Korean restaurant and it was delicious! The moment I walked in it was very clean and eye opening. It is centrally located so it is perfect for anyone looking for a good BBQ place. Even though there were only two servers tonight they did a pretty good job overall. It started to get packed as the evening went on so I knew that this place was good. I tried a lot of things actually: prime kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly, oysters, miso soup, and even dessert. I wish I could have tried everything but I will save that for the next time I will be there. I even have a feeling that the owner/manager was out and about seating customers, smiling, and making people feel comfortable and right at home. To top it off, they have a projector screen on the wall to provide a little entertainment while you are cooking or enjoying your food. My server, Kristin, was very nice, polite, and outgoing. She really took care of me, always asked if everything was okay, and making sure I was never thirsty. How can you get better than that? I would recommend Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining to anyone who wishes to have great food, great service, and very reasonable prices.

Its hard to find a good Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas.  This place is definitely a good place to try. My favorite was the kalbi which was very tender and juicy. Lemon chicken was also good. Side dishes were great too. I'll be back very soon.

Excellent! Food was phenomenal! Every beef dish was well marinated and completely tender once cooked. The bulgogi rice was on the sweeter side, but so yummy.

The service was fantastic with friendly waiters who didn't skip a beat with the food service and getting tables ready for the next guest. 
 
The restaurant itself is very modern and clean with pop music playing in the background. Fairly easy to get to since it's just behind the Strip on Paradise. 

Definitely recommend the Gangnam Grill for 4-6. It's more than enough food.

Really delicious and very economical. A Wonderful surprise in my first meal in Vegas
.

Chose this restaurant for my husbands birthday. It was excellent. The service was great! Everyone was friendly. The quality and taste of the meat was great! The prices were good and they even had happy hour specials on meats veggies appetizers and beers. I will definitely return on my next visit to Vegas!
Great food. Ate at the bar and didn't have to wait. Walked back to the Flamingo to help with the digestion.

Delicious, fast, and fairly priced! My sister and I had a great meal here. Servings are huge! We ordered the meat lovers for two, it was absolutely delicious and very fresh. I would definitely go back.
Didn't live up to the hype. Slow service. Long wait. Nothing we got tasted great. Bathrooms were disgusting. Host was also a waiter so that really slowed things down
the service here is really great. everyone's super attentive and polite. also the food though  the meat is of superb quality and even the side dish are bomb !!!
The Service and Servers are awesome. Food was spot on. The KimChi was slightly under cook, but everything else was awesome.

Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas ! 
Meat quality 5/5
It didn't have a heavy BBQ smell after we were done :)
First time my mom actually said kbbq was good haha
Nice place to go and their price is reasonable. I ordered five dishes and all meat only spent twenty

The food & service is good, But they put too much MSG that made me allergy and thirsty. I'm still suffering w/ allergy now.
They have asked us to give them good rate to get free dessert. It's kind of cheating.  I think Yelp should stop them.  If I knew their food were added w/ MSG, then I won't go or try at all.
Excellent customer service! Great food! Went for early dinner on a Saturday night and the place was not that packed.

Very nice staff and food.
We've choose Gangnam set. We ate too much lol
I would recommend here.

Friendly staff. Great service. Pork belly was booomb!!! On the way out we saw that they had macaroon ice cream sandwiches so we went ahead and had to try all five flavors. They discounted us for checkin in on yelp and only charged us for three of the ice creams. Next day I realized I left my Michael Kors sunglasses there and was able to pick them up. Anyone could've easily said they didn't find anything so I appreciate their honesty as well. Definitely going back next time.

The portion size is reeeeeally generous. like, couldn't finish the 6 person Meat Lovers with 5 people and we are all big eaters. All the meats were fantastic, but the steak options were fantastic. The bulgogi too.  actually, it's all damn good. Great sides, with the kimchi, fish cake and squid standing out as favorites. 

Service was attentive and friendly. I thought it was pricey until seeing how much food is included... price and quality

OMG. I went with my boyfriend here and it was AMAZING!!! It was my first time ever having Korean BBQ, and I'm so glad I came here for my first time!!! David, our waiter, was so kind and very helpful. I will definitely come back!
Food was amazing and the prices are reasonable for a KBB spot. We ordered the meat lover and it was perfect for 5 people. I just wish they gave bigger straws !!

This place was pretty good! I went with one other person during lunch right before there was a rush of people coming in. By the time we left, there were big groups of people waiting for tables. 

We got seated at a grilling table, and ordered different kinds of meat. The portion sizes were fair for the prices, and the quality of the meat was decent. We also got galbi tang, which was fantastic, and a cheesy corn appetizer that smelled and tasted a bit like dirty feet. I ate one bite and left the rest alone. 

The service was good, not sure if that would be different for a non-Korean. They brought our food quickly, and replenished side dishes + got us a new grill plate when our first one got dirty. Also, you get this free ice cream macaroon sandwich thing if you show them you checked in on yelp.
Great appetizers, and good pescetarian options, nice value. Plus the deserts are super bomb. Service left something to be desired.
Very good food.  Good and attentive servers, had plates removed and drinks refilled almost right away.  Would recommend.
Best Korean BBQ place I've been to. Ordered the Gangnam combo for 4 and the meats were amazing quality!!
We ordered Gangnam. We should've ordered the bibimbap over rice but overall the food is great and the service is good.
This was my first time here and the service was awesome! I enjoyed the atmosphere and it was a nice casual place to go. I would come back in the future.

I am a fan of the place. It's near campus and the selection was really good. The quality of the meat and side dishes were standard and tasted pretty good. I liked the desert (honey bread I think), it was unique and it really ended my meal on a high note. The service was good, but not amazing, the facility was clean, only one person could use the restroom at a time which can be inconvenient if you visit during a rush.

Wait one hour to get seated on Christmas Eve. Food tastes really good, probably one of the best taste Korean BBQ I ever had. The only problem is that it seems to be short in hand given the popularity, and it is easy to get lost in dealing with the food even for a Chinese. Anyway definitely worth the money and highly recommended.

Great spot to get small bites since everything is a la carte. It adds up though. Ambiance is nice and reminds me of Gyu Kaku. The menu style is also similar to Gyu Kaku. 

Meats rated from 1-5
Premium tongue: 5
Filet mignon: 5
Prime kalbi: 5
Marinated kalbi: 3.5, it's quite fatty 
Harami miso: 5
Pork belly: 5, oily but so good 
Bulgogi bibimbap: 4.5, I like the rice crispy so you have to let it sit for a long while 
Ttebokki: 4, it's spicy ! 
Fried dumplings: 5, I didn't get to try it but the boyfriend said it had good substance inside 

I would recommend this spot for people who like Gyu Kaku and a la carte items... Otherwise stick to ayce because they charge for literally everything.
First time here. Waitresses are really nice. Food is excellent. Definitely will come back
So great . Awesome. I love the galbi and the soondubu. I would recommend trying the platters.
Best food we've had thus far on our trip to vegas! Better than the Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars. Would not recommend the seafood, but I wouldn't recommend it anywhere in Las Vegas. Really satisfied!
You can't believe that good Korean food would be in a strip mall. A bit of a wait but worth it

Found out about this place on yelp. Glad me & my gf stopped by. We ordered the Las Vegas which was priced at $45.95 for 2, for the money you definitely get what you pay for, good portion sizes, tasteful dishes. We even had to take some of the food home!

Food was good. Service was okay. The bulgolgi is the best meat we had with the meat lovers combo. hella food and I'm full! Next time will only order bulgolgi. Also ordered a side of jap chae noodles they forgot until later. it wasn't very flavorful like most places. All the sides were bomb. seaweed salad is fresh and food here. I'd come back.

Coming from an experienced La Korean BBQ vet, it's hard to be compared to anywhere else. Gangnam Asian BBQ is no exception. I ordered the bulgogi bibimbap, and was sadly disappointed with the selection. It was rice and bulgogi....that was it. The waitress came by and she even look as displeased at me. What was surprising was that she didn't do anything about it, which was saddening. I can't say that it was their fault, since that's what I ordered, but if a customer looks dissatisfied it should raise an alarm to do something about it! Learn from this, the restaurant has potential.
Amazing food,  quite the selection.  My second time having Korean bbq, I will definitely return my next trip to Vegas.  Pork belly was the best!!
Good food with good service. Recommended to all Korean BBQ lovers. Plus they open till 1am, so if you arrive late, there is still a place for good food instead of fast food.

Let me first start out with the fact that I love Korean BBQ and this is no exception. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this little off the strip hidden gem when we went to try and go off the strip to get an ear piercing. We didn't get the piercing, but we ended up eating a fantastic dinner.

We got there just in time for happy hour so we definitely had to take advantage of this sweet deal. We ordered the Chicken Karaage, Steamed Chili Dumplings, and then the Spicy Pork, Beef Toro, Pork Belly and Bulgogi for the BBQ aspect of it. Since it was so cheap, we ended up ordering about 3 or 4 of each of the meat items.

They also had beers on happy hour too, so we took advantage of those as well. We got a pitcher of beer and a bottled soju. I mean, we were at a Korean restaurant so we had to go with the soju.

The service here is wonderful and the food was awesome. Whenever I am back in Vegas I will be coming here!
I wish this place was back home in Austin, TX! Best food and service by Back and Jin!! We will be "Back" ;) GET THE BULGOGI!!!!!!!

Came here with a group of 10 on a Saturday mid-afternoon and was promptly seated. 

I immediately noticed the banchan (Korean side dishes placed around our table's 2 grills). They had all my favorites ranging from fish cakes, kimchi, cucumbers, macaroni salad...we ended up requesting another round :) 

My group was starving from our drive into Vegas so naturally our eyes were bigger than our stomachs when we sat down to order. Our plan was to order their prix fix menu enough to feed 10 (2 orders of Gangnam [1 order can serve 2 people for $67]; 3 orders of Meat Lover [1 order can serve 2 for $56/order]). These packages comes with a variety of starter dishes like oysters (by far, my favorite starter), salad, various cuts of meat/BBQ dishes. Our waiter, however, recommended 2 orders of each instead as it is A LOT of food. Good thing we listed because you will NOT leave hungry here. 

Oysters: I'm usually hesitant about oysters at BBQ dining establishments but surprisingly these were sweet, fresh, not too big/not too small, with green onions, ponzu sauce?, and sriracha I believe. 

Cuts of meat: they vary from Kalbi, prime rib, filet, pork belly etc. Some were heavily marinated and a bit salty but the flavor profile was on point. Due to long grilling, some cuts came out particularly dry, however, so be careful not to overcook. 

Overall - I'd definitely come back when I'm back in Vegas. Great for big groups; come hungry and leave happy :)

This place is so cool... I've never been to an Asian BBQ restaurant before. Definitely try the duck ( very flavorful). They also brought out sides to go along with what we ordered (which is awesome), but we weren't told what they were:( on the upside you get a free dessert for writing a review on Yelp :) :) so yay!!
0000000! If I can choose 0 I would definitely choose!!!! Order to go customer is not customer?! What kind of bibimbap no hot sauce but with soy sauce?! Ridiculous!!!!!!!!!! Extremely not recommended!

The quality of their meat is great, you can really taste it. It's deceivingly small  on the outside, but spacious inside. They have combos with appetizers and meats good for multiple people and the portions are perfect. You will seriously get full off of one combo. Overall great place for Korean BBQ, definitely coming back!
Cool place, nice food, comfortable environment but not too many people for lunch, and cute Korean waiters speaking Chinese haha.

Highly  recommend seafood pancake, salmon carpaccio and spicy ramen noodle soup. Oh, fresh oysters are winners also. It's my first time here, but my friend's 2nd time. We enjoyed the experience thoroughly. Will definitely come back!

The food was amazing! I loved the flavor of the meat and the sides were great too. The service was fast and I didn't have to wait forever before I got seated. There's a nice comfortable vibe in this place as well that makes me feel right at home.

Bugolgi here is well marinated. Expect a great meal only limited by your skills at the grill. Rice is extra though. Since its tapas style you can easily mix and match even if you have a small party. As long as you get at least two dishes you get all the tiny dishes with your meal. Wonderful with a bottle of asahi.

Wonderful cozy place! Staff is very friendly and very  attentive as soon as we walked in. Food is amazing. Their pictured menu don't do their food any justice. Servings are bigger than what is pictured. So needless to say, this visit is a night of gluttony. Green apple soju cooler is awesome and so is the beef brisket :)

An absolutely great overall experience. The variety of options and fantastic flavor will definitely bring us back again.  The bulgogi Beef was by consensus the overall favorite. The wait staff provided great recommendations and was very attentive. Not to mention that 6 people walked out stuffed under $170! Can't wait to return in the near future.

I'm visiting my family at the moment, and I thought this would be a great place for my siblings and I to meet since they have tables big enough to seat 10 people. There are so many good reviews on this place that I expected it to blow me away. 

At first glance, the place is very nice, clean, and neat. The table we were seated at was huge with 2 large stove tops. There were so many sides laid out around the stove tops, but I only liked the fish cake, kimchee, and macaroni salad. The rest were pretty bland. 

We ordered 2 Meat Lovers and 2 Las Vegas to share amongst all of us. I honestly thought there would be more of the specialty meats, but there was just enough for all of us to have a little of everything. The meats were not very flavorful so I didn't actually get the names of them except for the Bulgogi which was excellent. 

The servers were okay. Not very attentive. The ambiance of the place was great. Very nice to talk and catchup with my brothers and sisters. Overall, the place itself was awesome, but the food and service were mediocre. Unfortunately, I will not be going back.

The wait was a little long. The wait for food, for service... The food was delicious! I got the korean prime rib and the garlic chicken with cheese fondu and filet mignon and garlic squid. We also got the spicy tuna kimbab which was AMAZING. And some fried calamari. This place was nice but only one girl served us well. The others were very busy, didn't teach us how to grill or put oil in the grill or get us drinks but the one girl did.
Great BBQ in Vegas. Meat Lover! The filet Mignon is fantastic! On my road trip from west coast to east coast, this is the best restaurant thus far

Pleasantly surprised by this little gem. Grabbed lunch to go while working in my hotel room nearby. It was within walking distance and had great yelp your views but I wasn't expecting much. When I went to pick up my food, which was ready in exactly 10 minutes, I was pleasantly surprised by the interior of this restaurant. It's really cute and clean inside you can't really tell driving by. I ordered the kabocha tempura and bulgogi bibimbap both were really tasty. The tempura was crispy and not greasy the sauce was flavorful. The bibimbap had a good amount of meat and a lot of flavor. I will dine in and try the barbecue next time I'm in town.
The server Jay was good! She took care of us when we didn't know what to order. I highly recommend going here if you're eating Korean food for the first time.

This is by far the best kbbq I have been to. The service is excellent and the quality of food is top of the line. Shout out to Beck for the entertainment and keeping our grill fresh. You da man Odell "BECK" Ham. Aka O.D.B. 


Ps. The music is lit.

The reviews are true- best place! Great service, fast, and fantastic quality food.  We did the #1 best seller and the meat was so good. We will come back when we visit again. I will for sure recommend this place to others.  The sides were good- all kinds of flavors for everyone.
Awesome place!  Lots of food for a fair price.  Tastes amazing and the atmosphere is nice.  The service is outstanding and the server Beck is a trip.  10/10 would do it again.
Great food and service. Got the $99 for four menu; portions might be a little small for big appetites.
First time here, awesome meal, thank you. Meat lover is a good choice. Perfect for 2 to 4 people.
Amazing!! Favorite in Vegas so far out of all restaurants went too. Great place to bring your friends and family too. Great staffs! Great food!
Great food, but a little more overpriced compared to other Korean BBQ places. Just doing this review to get free dessert. I'm a college student.

The atmosphere here is very cool. Food is awesome. Their portion sizes were pretty generous. We ordered the Gangnam combo for 4 and it fed our party of 6 very well. The fresh oyster is a must! VERY refreshing. Definitely coming back the next time we're in Vegas.

I love korean bbq, but we don't have a place like Gangnam Asian bbq back in Maryland so it was a pleasant surprise. We got the premium for two. All of the appetizers and complimentary banchan was good except for the oysters. The love oysters and eat them all the time back at home but these oysters did not taste fresh at all. The carpaccio was also amazing. The kobe style beef was the highlight. It literally melted in my mouth. I wanted to keep eating the Kobe all day. The only meat that I didn't enjoy in the set was the galbi and harami miso. I eat galbi regularly but the marinade in both items were too sweet. The shrimp bibimbap was not what i expected at all but it was good. Bibimbap normally has spicy notes to it but this bibimbap was sweet. Overall, it was a great experience. Definitely a good place to try while in Vegas.
This place is delicious! Portions are big, the combos are balanced (soup, salads, appetizers and meat). We got meat lovers combo and we were very full and very satisfied.
Lived in Korea twice for one year each time, first authentic eatery in the US--and i searched in many places!

First time having kbbq in the Vegas area! Definitely impressed by the quality of the meat but ESPECIALLY the seasonings. We ordered the meat lovers special for our party of 3. Even though the special was meant for 2 people, we were all content with the serving sizes.

The price is reasonable for the amount of meat they gave us. The service was exceptional as well, the female worker was very nice and friendly.

Would recommend to all friends who are in Vegas and who need their kbbq fix.

As someone who eats at gyu-kaku pretty often I can say this place is very very good. Only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the happy hour isn't as strong as gyu-kaku , I wasn't offered a grill change and there is no loyalty program.
Love this place. It never disappoints me! I have came here a few times last few years. They always good bbq. Their meat is thin cut and easy to consume. I will come back again soon.
One word "EXCELLENT " the food was good, the service was good, could use a little more personality though. It's a repeat for me

We ordered what felt like an infinite amount of food and were stuffed to the gills by the time our check came.... Which was only around $25! We are vegetarians, so that helped, but the value+quality was very real. I *highly* recommend the egg souffle as a side dish.
Excellent food and great service. Come for happy hour for a great deal!  Looking forward to visiting again next time I'm in Vegas.

Food was great but they need more servers... especially during busy hours.
We ordered the bbq, kimchi chiggae, and bibimbap. The bbq portions were small but they were delicious. Kimchi chiggae was a good size and it was tasty. Bibimbap was also delicious.
Pretty good for Korean BBQ place. Good service (5 stars). Food was good, just wish they offered more side dishes.

Me and my fiance went here for dinner and it was great! They have group meals and you will surely walk out stuffed! I ordered japchae and it was great tasting yet the noodles was too rubbery. I wasn't gonna complain but the server noticed we haven't even touched it and not taking it to go, so I said it's too rubbery and we'll just leave it. She took it back to the kitchen and I guess she tried it herself and offered to take it out off the bill. We will definitely gonna come back again :)
This is the best! Bulgogi, beef toro, and pork belly were delicious, and it i s a fun atmosphere.

Celebrating my friend's birthday and craved Korean bbq. Great quality meat and attentive service. Prices not bad for good quality near. Nice and fun ambiance. Will be back with family and friends for sure. Gotta be here for the reverse happy hour.
Nice style for decoration. Nice serves.  But all source is all sweet. Meets are good flavor.  They need more serves they are too busy for  us.

Although this place isn't all you can eat like a lot of places in town, it has grown to be one of my favorites! I came here twice in a weeks time during their happy hour with my sister. We don't care too much for rice and just go for lettuce. An order of brisket for each of us was enough to suffice on the meat side. We also really enjoyed the mushroom medley and jalape√±o poppers. The servers always checked on our drinks and were all kind.

I've been craving Korean BBQ since I got to the States and this is the first one I found. Their happy hour is awesome, meat is cheaper and alcoholic drinks are all 50% off! Even without the happy hour, they have killer lunch specials and everything is really affordable - much more than other Korean BBQs in the country!

We had our best casual food in LA. Staff was very warm and attentive . Food was amazing. I am not sure that their predefined options are the best. We decided to go custom: all top1,2,3 and bulgogi and spicy chicken. Also we added fried rice and miso. This was a bit more than needed for 2 adults and 2 kids. Free side dishes were insanely tasty.

The food is delicious, restaurant inside is beautiful, the prices are surprisingly friendly, the stuff is very nice, I like the place I'm gonna be back every time I'm in vegas. P.s. macaroons stuffed with ice cream are a must have.

We visited Las Vegas and came in for Christmas Eve dinner, and there are packed of people, this is a really popular place, because they have delicious food! We order the #1 seller for the meal/BBQ combination for two, plus tempura udon and spicy soft tofu soup. The combination meal has decent amount and kids enjoying the grill of variety of marinated-well meats. Fried squid sauce is very good too. Our spicy soft tofu soup is very good, and my kid likes her udon tempura. Overall it was a very good dinner pleasant experience for our Christmas Eve food adventure!

Great selection. Korean BBQ. Was craving meat, needed a good eat. Got so full. Come here! Not AYCE, but you can just order a la carte. Salmon was okay.
Music videos being projected at the corner were aight.

Definitely one of the best kbbqs I've ever been to! From the food up to the service, everything was excellent. Not AYCE tho but their menu offers a plethora of choices that definitely fulfills any craving haha.

Fairly priced menu, great food, outstanding service, and easy parking.

I was surprised to find good Korean food in Vegas

What an amazing place to dine with your fianc√©! Show her some cooking skills on the grill and enjoy some great service at the same time! 

The food was absolutely amazing! They have some great flavors and marinated their meats to perfection! Please come and try this place out!

Great menu selection for the price. Very filling menu items for 2 or 4. The dinner combos makes it easy to select. Comes with rice, appetizers, meat and other veggies. 

We tried thr gangnam combo and it had oyster calamari. The filet was very good as well.

Going to do a more updated review later. This review comes with a dessert
Excellent service and great food. The marinated meats were very tasty.The Harami Miso is a must try!

I was in the mood for Japanese bbq so I randomly yelped this place.  So happy I found it!

I called for reservation for 03.21.16 (Monday) but the lady who answered said "is your party more than 8 people?" I said "no 5.  I wanted to make reservations for tonight at 10". She was like "oh no reservation. Just walk in"

That was weird. Are you not able to make reservations for under 8 people or what??  Any who I got there at 10pm and there was a 30 minute wait. We were able to sit down around 1040ish and by that time the restaurant was half empty.  

TIP:  make sure you talk to a competent hostess who is able to make reservations because I've read the reviews and you're able to.  Or else go after 11pm so there's no wait.

- Kobe style beef
- prime kalbi
- flat iron garlic
- premium tongue
- pork toro

All of the meat was very very good and tender.  I recommend them all!
I ordered Korean chicken tenders and chicken fried rice. For the price of both, it was well worth it. The ambiance is also nice and it gave me a good first impression right as I walked in the door.

A really cool, modern, comfortable BBQ Place!

I would give this place a 5 star, if their banchan selection was more extensive.  However, for the location, the food and the service, I will definitely be coming to this place, again and again...

A.  Location - Harmon, Swenson, Paradise.  There is a small strip mall there that has plenty of food choices and this location is perfect for so many.  Right across from Hard Rock....

B.  The Service - extremely efficient and pleasant. I came here for lunch and while it was not terribly busy, the server was just right in being very efficient, always there when you wanted her, very nice and top notch.

C.  The Menu - Loved the menu.  The cuts here are smaller in size and also more reasonable in portion and pricing. You can order a huge variety of different meats, seafood and veggies all ranging in prices form 3.00 to 12.00 per plate.  I loved the mix and match. IF I brought my glasses and had more time, I would have done this.  Instead, I turned over the menu to the combo page and pre-ordered one of the combos to make it easier for me.

D.  The Food- 

a.  Miso Soup - OK, so we are in a Korean restaurant and they serve Miso soup. I find that odd, and at same time I really cannot complain since it was tasty.  However, when I am eating BBQ, I like the real basic soup that is plain and simple.

b.  The meats - 

Chicken Tender Cheese Fondue -   OK, I am not a huge non traditional foodie, but man, this was really cool and tasty.

Bulgogi - Wow was that really fast and the sauce was PERFECT.

Filet Mignon - So tender and juicy...

Shrimp Garlic - Would have preferred Shrimp PRAWN, but these tiny morsels were okay.

Harami Miso - Man was this steak just right. Never had it before and I really enjoyed it.

Assorted Veggies - Cool. Normal stuff. but those corn on the cob were awesome.

c.The appetizers - Again, miso soup, rice, salad and some kind of cream cheese wonton thing.  Different, okay. I prefer banchan.

E.  Come back factor - This is one cool place, the food is good, the portions are manageable so you can try different things for sure.  For business lunch, hanging out, this is a really nice restaurant and I do plan to come back.  If I am focused only on the bbq, I may try Tofu Hut or other places DJK, but I really enjoyed this Gangnam BBQ.

GK says, check it out.
This is my first time at gangnam. The food was amazing and the server Back gave us the fast service and extrmely nice.
Pretty clean Korean BBQ restaurant.Small portion plates but good for the price.  "You want White Lice" (rice) lol

Holy moly. 

I'm from LA and eaten at a lot of Korean restaurants. This place is sooooooo freaking good. 

The quality of meat is so good. Nothing was chewy. Everything tastes fresh. 

The sides were amazing. I like how they had set menus for people to share and the portions were amazing. 2 people could not finish all that food. 

The service left much to be desired BUT I didn't really need anything so it wasn't a big deal. 

I crave this place now I'm back in LA
Things are very fresh and very tasty. We ordered a lot of food for four people. Next time

I would say this place is one of the best korean bbq I've had! I was super impressed with their beef carpaccio, the beef was full of flavor. You got to order this if you come here!!!! Also, I recommend to order Kobe ssam, which is urchin on top of beef lettuce wrap. It was completely different experience compare to Japanese style urchin. We order the meat lover combo for 4 people. The meat was really fresh, and it should be enough for 4 people. Last thing, don't forget to check-in and redeem your macaroon ice cream. If it's free, why not plus it is delicious

Across from the Hard Rock Casino and open late hours with great quality of meats and veggies make it my favorite place for Korean BBQ.  It's not all you can eat and it's more like tapas aka a la carte style. Very clean place and intimate and fun for all ages

It smells great in here if you like food. You can't help but get hungrier when you walk in. The servers were helpful about recommending what's good. The food was really good too. I had the steamed galbi and the marinated beef on the mist try menu. I would definitely come back here when I'm in Vegas.

Should not give any star. Last night around 9pm I ate at this restaurant. This morning starting 2-3AM, I had very serious diarrheas and vomiting.  Even right now, still having watering diarrhea and yellow vomiting. I  never had such  bad food poison before in my entire life. We ordered some Korean traditional rib and raw osyter. I guess raw osyter probably imported from Japan or bad sources.  US Government already baned importing from Japan because of    a lot of Japanese food contaminated from radiation.

You can really tell that they use quality ingredients. The service is good and they do attend to your very need. I like how everything is catagorized, and you do get what you pay for. This is now our go to place for Korean BBQ fix.

is good for dinner?recommend unmarinate short rib
Open till 1 am? which is good for eating after gambling
may attend here again
The meat was very tasty with yummy marinated sauce and the green tea Mochi ice cream is a must try. It was a good value meal. Go with the combo for 2.
Our first time here. Gangnam have the best BBQ in the house. I recommend this place. All employee are so nice and friendly.

Super friendly waitstaff and hostess but the wait time is the reason for 4 stars and not 5. Always a wait but always good food at fair pricing. A must for Vegas locals and the big Asian community that comes from Irvine, California to this place.

The food was excellent!! The atmosphere is relaxing, fun and casual. A great 'date night' or gathering of friends type of place! Grilling your own food enhances the experience. The Cheese Corn appetizer is so good; and the spicy ribs are the bomb!
Awesome dining experience!  The meats were amazing.  Definitely a fun memory and we will be back.
Came here on vaca for a quick bite but was i in for a surprise! The food is so good and authentic! And have to mention they got some hot guys who works there!

Gangnam Asian BBQ is amazing! It is a little restaurant tucked between two tattoo shops. We visited late at night around 10pm which was the start of happy hour. After ordering a plethora of food, we started with all the sides. The meat finally came and we indulged! Very high quality meat and grrat grills. We ate until our stomachs were full of beer and meat and then we got the check. Because it was happy hour our bill was less than $30!! Almost unheard of! I will definitely come back here!

Left a bit underwhelmed based on hyped expectations from reviews. 

Overall the food was good, but didn't wow me. Perhaps Korean BBQ just isn't my thing, or perhaps I need to try more of it.

Our party ordered items a la carte which came out less expensive than the preselected combo platters and allowed for ordering exactly what we wanted.

We tried three beef and two chicken meat dishes, a few vegetables and some chicken fried rice. Everything was fairly tasty. I didn't love most of the side dishes that came complimentary, but was still grateful to be able to sample a bunch of different Korean tastes. 

One of my favorite things was the ice cream macaroon at the end of the meal. 

The servers were nice but it would have helped to have been given some direction as to what we should do and what sauces and sides would be well paired together since it was the first experience doing Korean BBQ for our entire party.

My husband and I have been looking for a legit Korean BBQ place that we liked in Vegas since we moved here and we finally found one. This is it. We've been pretty picky since we're comparing to LA ktown restuarants, but this place will definitely fill our void. Love the meats. We liked all the marinaded ones and the filet and the pork belly. The chadol (toro) was just ok.
Very good meat. Reasonable price and good service! Very close to the strip too. Definitely coming back :)

Called for same day reservation, found out they do not take same day reservation.
Good layout of the restaurant; prompt service. Food was as good as other Yelp reviews. Good quality meat, ordered more than we could handle. Would return.

Wow. Absolutely amazing. We travel often and have never had such a perfect meal of authentic Korean BBQ. The flavors were all bold and fantastic, service was exceptional. I can wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas.
Awesome food! Oysters were amazing. The beef was tender and all the side dishes kept you busy stuffing your mouth. Fast and friendly service.
Very friendly customer service. Felt like the cute girl at the club. Not like the white guy at the Asian table.

Pro: food is great and price is great
Con: terrible service, took them forever to ask what i wanted to drink and appetizer , then i waited about 20-30mins till they asked if i wanted food. They didnt ask if i want another drink after i finished my first and then i asked for another drink and they also gave me my check andsaid i had to pay cause they were closing or something to get ready for dinner, and i never got my next drink, so i left.  I wouldve gave 2 star if the food hadnt been at least very good

Spiffy place. Staff were helpful and able to accommodate to our request on item changes on the menu. Overall I would come back, I enjoyed the off the strip restaurant and recommend it to all those craving Korean bbq. Get rolling @therollingcrawfish #therollingcrawfish #yummybbq #gangnam

Gangnam is very close to the strip compared to other Korean BBQ spots, so it was a definite must that I visit during a quick weekend trip. I'm so happy I did, because it was worth every minute I waited (only 30) and every penny I spent. We got the special combination for 4, and it fed all 5 girls in my group with leftovers to spare! 

The service was great, but the food here is truly the star. The cuts of meat are excellent and marinated better than any other Korean restaurant I've been to. Each piece literally melted in my mouth. I can't comment much on the side dishes because I filled up on protein!
love this place amazing experience every single time !! So far i havent had one complaint  about this place
Only my second time eating Korean BBQ. Service was excellent and the food was very good.
I am one of the most pickiest eaters and I loved all of the sides and the meal I got! Great food

"Went here with my family of 4. Needless to say we left more than satisfied with a lot of leftovers! The typical Korean self cooking style made it a very fun experience. Our waiter assisted us on every dish. 10/10 will go back when in Vegas." - Ansel Ponce Diama

I was pleasantly surprised with Gangnam KBBQ! The spicy pork and bulgogi was tender and delicious! I came during happy hour and they were $3 and $4 each. I gave this place 4 stars, because I wish there was an all you-can-eat option.
Found this place for lunch; close to aria. Meat looks great and the yelp reviews for desert was great incentive to post. The wait wasn't bad,  to be expected for a place with good ratings.

I wished this place existed when I attended UNLV. This place carries a lot of value with the amount of different (yet satisfying) portions/packages that even a poor college student can afford.

My friend and I got the most basic Las Vegas package since we're hungry but obviously not capable of eating a feast by ourselves. It was $45/person and the amount of food cannot be more fulfilling. You get the tradition side dishes + a house salad, along with rice, sauces and miso soup to go along with your proteins that includes beef, spicy chicken, garlic shrimp and pork.

You are however required to cook things yourself comparing to places like Honey Pig when a server would occasionally stop by and manage your food. The place wasn't busy at the time we were dining so the servers volunteered to rotate our proteins for us as we were engaged in a deep conversation catching up on life- What a nice touch. 

The ambiance of this place is on the smaller size but comfortable at the least. The service was friendly and attentive and most importantly, the food was amazing for the price that you're paying. I wasn't sure if it was Happy Hour when we dined but when we received our tab, it only came out to be $55. A lot less from what I was expected to pay (hey I'm not complaining) but regardless of it being a mistake or not, I'll happily return.

Ate here during happy hour. It was so so so good! Their specials are amazing too. We were staying across the street at hard rock, which was really convenient to just walk over. The meats were all delicious, loved the cream cheese wontons, and the dessert was perfect ending. Will be coming back when we're in Vegas next!
Amazing service. Super quick in getting our meal and orders. Highly recommend it even it is kind of expensive, it's worth it!
Great spot! Happy hour food is great. Cook it yourself or they will prepare it for you. Jeb was so helpful and his recommendations were spot on!! See you tomorrow!!

The best KBBQ in Las Vegas. Highly recommended. The service was so fast. The staff were super nice as well. Don't forget to check in for a free ice cream macaron. We ordered the meat lover and it was amazing!

SUCH A GREAT KBBQ PLACE! It's an amazing deal for how much food you get-- we got the Gangnam combo and it was delicious. The service is great, I def recommend making a reservation since the wait does get pretty long. Will def come back again :)

Expensive/ poor service 
Servers ruin the expensive high quality meat by over cooking them.

Always a good time!!! 

Worth the wait. Always. Service is impeccable. I do not look elsewhere for kbbq and suggest this spot to all the visitors.

Hit it up.

Considering the quality of other restaurants with the same price level in Las Vegas, this one is great! Their BBQ tastes so good. Service is a average. Remember to come this place early to reduce your waiting time.

Wandered into this place because Ferraro's was closed and I was extremely satisfied. Awesome happy hour with a lot to choose from. Everything here tastes fresh and the service is fast and attentive too. We will be back!
This was the best KBBQ I ever had. Beck was the server! He kept it real. I would come back here again

Because of their massive amount of reviews and high rating we wanted to try out on a Sat night. 
Food:
We ordered premium combo and they didn't serve us oysters and scallops. We did a lot of talking during dinner and didn't pay attention if they served the right food. We found out after we left and this is not cool. Can we say they treat on their menu? The Kobe carpaccio didn't look as good as the picture. And their shrimp Bibimbap tasted horrible. 
Service:
I understand Sat is always awfully busy. So we ended up eating without drinks. Finally we got our drinks on the halfway of our dinner. BTW, they use very cheap wine to make Sangria. I can't taste the difference but my friend is a wine expert. :(

This was my first time here. Came with my husband, brother , and his girlfriend. They were very quick to get us seated , take our order, and get our food out. The food was very delicious. We got the meat lovers for four. I also got the egg ramen noodles, but I wasn't too impressed with that. But everything else was quite tastey. The reason that I didn't give this place a five star rating is because once the food was on the table no one came by to check on us. We all needed refills on water and my husband needed another beer. Also, the check was brought before asking if we needed anything else which we were interested in dessert. This is a huge pet peeve of mine. We ordered the honey bread and it took 25 minutes to come out. That's way too long for toasted bread and ice cream in my opinion. However, it was delicious.

One of the best Korean BBQ restaurants I've been too. The servers were all really friendly and accommodating. Such a great atmosphere With friends and family. The food was delicious and the price is is just right.

Best Korean bbq I've been too. First of all it's not an AYCE. But they do have package deals for like party's of 2 or 4. It comes pre picked the course basically depending on which you pick. You can also go the other route and just pick the dishes. My husband and i went that route instead. We got 2 orders of the belly toro (brisket) short ribs marinated beef tongue. For our sides there were some complimentary with a min order of two beef plates. We got on our table the steamed egg and calamari. Some lettuce and bean paste as well that's an upcharge not much though. Everything came out to 50 that's with tips included. Basically what id usually spend on at the AYCE.

The next open reservation on Open Table is 2/1/16 :O

Happy hour items are economical.  Order at most 3 items per person should be enough on top to free dessert for rating them on Yelp :)

We ordered:
- 2 beef toro (too tough to separate the fat from the meat) is missing a piece :(
- Korean chicken cheese fondue is very juicy and tender
- chicken karaage is mediocre
- steamed chili dumplings are good, except thick skin/wrap
Deeeelicious food! Good atmosphere too. Cool decor. Sauces are wonderful!

went here last night after the fiance got in and it was pretty good. I was surprised though that our bill still came out to $50. I thought everything had a lot of taste and the staff was very nice. 

We got the following:

House salad - good size for the price
Squid - about 5 pieces for $6 but it was good
Kalbi - We got hte $8 kalbi meat which was like 6 small pieces so i felt that could have been a bit bigger cuts
Bi Bim Bap - $10 - big portion and bf said it was good
Also got a couple of veggies - mushroom melody and peppers - both were good as well. 

overall not bad if you are not looking for AYCE.

Back is an awesome server!!! Food is always great and always leave satisfied! !!! Free dessert with review. conveniently located next to unlv since I am a student so it's always a great experience with friends!!
I love the atmosphere here. The place looks clean too. I like the food, but I definitely had better meat.

Having been to Seoul, and experienced firsthand The amazingness of cream barbecue, I can see you this place doesn't quite stand up to the authentic Korean standards.

The meat selection is quite extensive, and the "Kobe style" was actually pretty good. The fried calamari, and marinated short ribs and spicy pork, were actually very tasty.

I would call this upscale and twist, as far as the restaurant very nicely laid out with her every single table in the corner was very clean and atmosphere was very mellow for a New York/Las Vegas style restaurant. I would call this fancy, I wouldn't necessarily call it good for kids, but if you've never been to the Korean barbecue place, The authenticity, and the experience of cooking your own meat in the grill in front of you on the table is very very fun. With over 1200 reviews and many more photographs, and I'm feeling like this place is a hit, even being off the strip. A good place for locals, and definitely a place I'd recommend to those traveling.
Good Korean bbq at reasonable price. Fun experience cooking the meat yourself.

The worst experience in Vegas. According to my own experience, the yelp rate of this restaurant is fake.

We waited for one hour to get a table. The room was freezing. The waitress was very rude. It took forever to get the menu and wait for your order. The restaurant is obviously incapable to handle those many guests. The waitress ignored us for several times and when we stopped her, she told us she is so tired and worked for more than 10 hours. Maybe this is another consequence after they faked the rate here.

My 9 year old daughter says every time we come to Vegas we have to come here at least once. Her favorite is the beef toro. My husband likes the bulgogi and I favored the Korean Prime Kalbi. We made it in time for HH. Service is great and the food is delicious. A great change from the over priced strip restaurants.

This is my second time here. First time was for their happy hour korean bbq for a friend's birthday. The happy hour menu is pretty good. However quality is not the best. You pay for what you get. You can get full without busting your wallet... If you're a girl with a normal appetite. 

Next time I went here for lunch.  We called ahead and the person on the phone said there is lunch special available. When we came our waiter said no there isn't and said that person probably didn't know cause he was knew. I was a little annoyed but whatever. I ordered the tofu soup for 10 bucks which is a pretty reasonable deal. However when they brought it out... It was the smallest bowl of soup I've ever seen. I would call this a mug of tofu soup.. It's like the size of a side tofu soup they give you during korean bbq. So disappointed. Flavor wish it's fine.

Although Gangnam isn't AYCE like we're used to, it's definitely a good spot for KBBQ.  We've had dinner here twice, and ordered the Meat Lover's with an order of Japchae and Kabocha Tempura.  The cuts of the meat is superb, and we liked that all the meat was seasoned perfectly and quite tasty.  Japchae was solid as was the tempura.  Although it's not AYCE, we left super stuffed and satisfied.  Service was good, they worked as a team, so our glasses and banchan requests we're always attended to.  Wait times vary as our first time, we went on a Thursday at about 7:30pm and waited 30-minutes, and the last time was on a Saturday at 9pm with no wait.  I just wish they had better seating, than the wooden benches they have which are uncomfortable, then again, it's probably on purpose so people wouldn't linger.

#LVKBBQ

Fantastic lunch! Shared meat lover deal with my girlfriend and we had a badass meal (with filet mignon!) plus a nice leftover meal for later after hittin the tables!

Several servers/busser for help. All friendly and attentive. Will be back next Vegas trip or maybe even again in 2 days on the way out!
The chicken sukiyaki noodles were only $9.95 and they were so good that I'd order it again. The only thing is that it stays incredibly hot for about 5 minutes, so be careful not to burn yourself.
Great food - fun experience.  We'll be back for sure.   Marvin took care of us very well.
yo! Definitely come back for Honey Bread next time! I ordered Bulgogi Bipimpap and that was a bomb! !

The food is good, however, the service can be improved. We ordered the gangnam platter supposedly good for 4 people according to the menu, but we're a group of 5 and the serving was more than enough for us so the servings are quite generous. Further, the quality of meat is good since it is tender and flavorful.
Came with group of my friends. Place has good variety of food. Great to come for happy hour.
Great time enjoying Korean BBQ...my six year old never had it before and loved turning the food while cooking for himself.

The working efficiency is almost zero. We ordered bbq and we don't need them to cook meet in the kitchen, we just need them to give us the fresh meat and we cooked by ourselves. It cost us almost 30 minutes just wait for the fresh meat. The waitress is rude and seems she served Korean people first. I noticed there are two tables who coming behind us, and they almost finished eating and we were still waiting.

Kobe beef carpaccio $10 EXCELLENT HIGHLY RECOMMEND 
Harami miso $9 QUITE GOOD
Korean prime kalbi $9 VERY GOOD
Beef toro $5 pretty dry. Could be dipped in sauce but still. Quality meat but just not as tender or marinated as we'd liked.
Bulgogi $5 VERY FLAVORFUL AND TENDER
Dynamite shrimp $7 good but sauce can be better. Pretty common spicy mayo.
FREE DESSERT WITH YELP REVIEW

It smell delicious even before you enter. You are in for a food ride. The teriyaki chicken and the bulgogi were my favorite proteins. However, you cant go wrong with what you order. The dumplings were perfectly cooked and that cake they have, is a must try. it not, you will regret it. As with all the Korean BBQs, $$ can add up quick but they have reasonable prices. 

Since people seat and order a little at a time and then cook it yourself, you might have to wait once you get to the restaurant. 

Service was efficient and the proteins would come out rather quick.
The meat was so tender, and everything tasted AMAZING. Will come back when we visit NV again.

The food is delicious!! But, the service leaves something to be desired. I know the tip was already included because our group was 8 people, but that doesn't mean they could slack off. We literally were clearing our own plates from the table. And when we asked to have the table cleared before dessert, we just received a confused look. They definitely did not deserve the 18% tip.
Great meat and great combo. Lots of meat selection. The side dishes were plenty and if you get the combo you have more stuff. I came hungry and now I'm satisfy. Free desert with review. Cool!

If you are considering a la carte Korean BBQ, I would believe that this is the best place you can be. Servers are amazing, attentive, and every time  I visit there, they have a great quality of meat compared to the price range that are paying. They are usually around $7 range per meat, if party of 2 is going here, you should expect to pay around $35-40 which I believe that it is reasonable. This place is like the place I come every time I am craving some KBBQ. Yeap, and please make a review about this place by the time you are dining here, they will give you comp macaroon ice cream no matter how you write your review.
So good and great service. Kids loved it, too! Everything was delicious and flavorful!

The food deserves five stars, the service two - I'm averaging.  Gangnam does not take reservations. The average wait time for dinner is 30 min if you come with a group, it might be shorter for a couple. We ordered a variety of meats, drinks and rice. The food came out super fast. All of the meats were beautifully marinated and we enjoyed grilling them to perfection. We would've ordered more food and would've had another round of drinks and would redeem our Yelp desert offer if we weren't given a check while we were still eating. After the food arrived we could not get anyone's attention for more drinks and more rice. Finally, I caught one of the guys that was running by and asked for what we needed. Got the rice, not the drinks... Our experience was short and largely unsatisfactory since we felt rushed watching all the staff constantly running by, but seemingly not stopping anywhere.

Nice ambience once you get inside. Good customer service especially Kristin (server)  who is very accommodating and I feel relax while eating. When it comes to food it's taste good! I like there Kalbi, garlic shrimp and harami miso

Another day, another opportunity for KBBQ. This place is always a must go if you're having the same craving. Located near the strip and the airport, it's a good place for a wide variety of delicious food. Sometimes it can be picked, but for the most part you won't have a long wait. The only downfall compared to other kbbq places is that it's not all you can eat; other than that there's no cons of this place. Always check in on yelp for a free macaroon ice cream of your choice!
Great delicious food with so many items to choose from.  Reasonable prices and the best happy hour from 3-5pm.
Amazing food. Come here it is awesome. Loved every bite. Check in for free ice cream macaroon.

great food, great service, awesome cook.
they have a good atmosphere, with a cooking stove in the middle. I would eat here again.
This Korean BBQ is authentic, and tasty. The service is top-notch, and I highly recommend their food!

This place serves both Korean and Japanese bbq. it does get crowded on the weekends, but the staff works very hard to get everyone seated and service here has always been gret. The food is fantastic (love the unlimited aide diahes)! Overall a Great place, good sized portions, and we love coming here when we're in Vegas

Food was awesome, but some servers' friendliness can be improved. Gangnam set menu was value for money especially for big groups like ours. We ordered for 4 but was enough to feed 5 with some side dishes.

Seriously yummy Korean bbq! Beef toro, calamari & beef carpaccio... Amazing! I have brought my 3 close friends and husband! Within 5 days I came here with 3 of my friends for one on one dinner! Dedication lol
I had a great time at this restaurant, the food was delicious, I had a blast cocking my food, the service was good and fast, should come, specially for dessert.
Awesome Korean BBQ place! The Kalbi is delicious as is the bulgogi. The happy hour is really good value for both food and drink.
This is my first experience with bbq at GangNam Asian bbq.  Foods are good, but portion is kind of small.  However, this is a good one in Las Vegas area.

Definitely an interesting concept! Being from Arizona and a constant Vegas visitor, I wanted something out of the strip that was more consistent. This place was just that! Very fun and delicious. We got the the Las Vegas package and it was more than enough for two people. Had to take about half of it home!

Don't pass this place up. 

TIP: Arrive early or come with time to spare because this place gets early!

We came here by recommendation of our valet on the strip. So we left the strip, saved $200 and had a KILLER experience. Not only is the food amazing, but it's an experience in and of itself. We got the $65 combo for two and had about ten dishes brought out to us and had a blast. Great service. You know it's good when Korean people are serving you and when Korean people are filling most of the tables. Love this place. Can't wait to come back.  Ryan and Jieun were our servers and were so serving and helpful. AND GET THE FREAKING LYCHEE MARTINI!!!  OR TEN!!!!  Wow.

This place is very good with the choice meats that they have. We decided not to get the package deals... not much for the starters each one had. We ended up getting all three of the "must try juicy cuts," which was very flavorful. I ordered a spicy seafood noodle dish, which was amazing. Even though it's NOT an AYCE, I will come back again!

The food was good. The service was horrible. It was as if our waiter had a bad day and took it out on us. Right from the start I felt a bad vibe and then when he leaves my friend says "I don't think he likes us." The food was good. They never changed our grill when needed. The wait sucked but i won't dock it too much for that. It's mainly the bad service that gives me the reason for 3 stars.

This place is the definition of the word chill. It's a nice little locale. Friendly staff and the food is cooked to your liking because well you cooked it! It's fun and very family friendly as well.
