Their Dynamite Shrimp is amazing; I wouldn't say it's a "dynamite" in the spice department but it is delicious!  Their selection of meats are always nice and juicy! For dessert: ice cream macaroons!

The best korean bbq in town hands down. Me and my girlfriend came in got sat down and got fast and excellent service from the staff. The staff was friendly and efficient. The food was excellent and fresh I tell you better than the other places I've been to in vegas. We got the gangnam and the meat were prime cuts and we'll marinated. I tell you come to this place you will enjoy with your significant other or friends and family pretty cool place.

This restaurant never fails me. I returned on my subsequent trip to LV because it is that good! I recommend getting the Gangnam meal option...meats are tender as well as the side dishes. Staff are awesome. This is my favorite Korean restaurant!
This place is really good! The bulgogi and the flat iron garlic lived up to they hype! The staff and the general atmosphere are awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone!

really impressive service. the servers are on it the whole time. the happy hour is really ludicrous. three of us had 2 saporros, broccoli, corn, mushroom, spicy chicken, lemon chicken, calamari & all the panchan you want to ask for for, whaaaaa, 30 bucks?? too good. thanks to these guys.
Bomb dotcom bulgogi. I'm from Cali and this was some good k-bbq. A definite must go for the happy hour

This place is not cheap but they use high quality meat and you get LOTS of food and I mean LOTS. Expect a long wait if you come during dining hours. Their 6 person set dinner can easily feed 8 adults.  The staff here are very friendly and even though it's a fast pace environment yet staff remain professional and very accommodating.   Their Soju was very good too, so good that almost all the adult in our group had one.

Their meat quality is top notch and you get large portions. Oysters were fresh along with their seafood. Their filet cubes was one of the best I've had. If anything the only one that we didn't like was the marinated meat. it wasn't anything spectacular but nonetheless it was still good. The salad was very refreshing and put a good balance with the meat. 

If you come here, go for the set dinner and order less than you need. If you have six order the 4 person set dinner and get a few appetizers. 

Make sure you check in on Yelp as they will give you a free macaroon ice cream sandwich on your way out!

First of all - we were inspired to come to Korean BBQ after setting an ad for another place on a billboard. After Yelping some nearby options, the 1300 reviews and a 4.5 star rating, drew us in. 

At 7pm on a Saturday, we just weren't sure we could get in so we called ahead and a friendly young man answered. While they don't have a call ahead or reservation list we were able to walk right in.. Though apparently it's not uncommon to have a wait. 

After being immediately seated, we were promptly asked for our drink order. And moments after asked if we were ready to order -- through out our meal the service has been efficient,  immediate, and impeccable! 

Let's talk about the meal! 
We selected the meat lovers meal for 2, though you can order piecemeal - this included 6 meats, 7 sides, and 3 appetisers for $60 after tax. So if you aren't familiar with Korean BBQ, the premises is that they provide the food and you cook it at a grill on your table.

Breaking it down: 
APPETISERS
Miso Soup
Green Salad
Steamed Chili Dumplings
Spicy Garlic Edamame 

MEAT
Spicy pork
Bulgogi
Beef Toro
Flat Iron Garlic
Pork Belly
Filet Minion

SIDES - I am guesstimating what each of these items are, we did not get a rundown. 
Bean Sprouts - Good, nice crunch to them, and not particularly strong in flavor.
Kimchi - very flavorful without being off putting (assuming you don't dislike kimchi in general)
Fish Cakes
Jalape√±os, Onion, and Ginger - they were in a mild marinade of some sort, really good when we grilled them too!
Macaroni Salad - noodles were a little soft for my taste and too mayonnaisey but my friend liked it. 
Spicy Squid (I think!) - really delicious (and I don't like seafood, at all), the dressing/marinade was flavorful, almost like the kimchi, and the texture was just right, not too chewy but hardy 
Spicy Baby Cucumbers - may have been pickled, but overall nice crunchy texture with a 
Rice - sticky and white.. Just a vehicle for everything else!
(Forgive me for the constant 'flavorful marinade' comments but I have no idea what it is... Just good! Ha!)

DESSERT
Banana Tempura
Lava Cake

SAUCES - provided in a little side dish per person! 
Spicy soy sauce
Sweet soy sauce
? Mild soy sauce-type

Now, you'll notice the extensive reviews for this restaurant... Because they offer a free dessert per Yelp review. They definitely follow through and not based on the score or content! They only check that you post it! 

A couple thoughts on improvement -- 
Provide some direction for cooking each item (meat and sides). While I was familiar with the process, its always nice to hear tips and tricks to making this a  delicious and easy meal.

I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It is tastefully done inside, the staff was very friendly and the food was very good.  I had a Tina Poki which was excellent, bulgogi and marinated Korean short ribs.  The tuna was excellent, the bulgogi was nearly as good and the short ribs were good.  I would definitely return.  It was about $25 plus tip per person.  Not bad!

tl;dr--Recommended, though maybe without the full throated cheering from some of our fellow Yelpers.

We stopped by while working out way down the Strip due to the high praise from fellow Yelpers. On Christmas Eve, they weren't offering their usual (less expensive lunch menu) but hats off to the hardworking crew for working over the holidays. It's a mile or so east of Planet Hollywood so plan to drive or Lyft over unless you need the exercise.

The restaurant was basically full at 2:30 in the afternoon, which we took as a good omen. The banchan (free appetizers) came out even before we ordered and included a macaroni salad alongside the more typical kim chi, pickled spiced cucumbers, bean sprout salad, pickled radish and fish cake. The bean sprouts could have used a touch more seasoning but were otherwise fine.

The meats were well seasoned, so much so that we didn't much miss the traditional dipping sauces. We ordered a bibimbop that came in the traditional stone bowl but was not hot enough rice to crisp the rice. The bulgogi that came with the bibimbop was excellent but the only other sides were hints of red peppers and onions: order only as a side to accompany your BBQ and not as a meal.

The grill and exhaust hood were carefully maintained: gleaming metal shiny clean. Bathrooms were clean as well.

Service is typical for Asian restaurants: workmanlike but not particularly friendly. A bit slow but chalk that up to the steady stream of diners.

The kids gave it a 4 so we will round up from 3 or 3.5.



Disclosure: we were offered a free dessert for this review. Ice cream macaroons were delicious!
Awesome portions and very good tasting bibimbap. My second visit and willing to come back again.

The cheese chicken was by far the best on the menu.  I think my favorite part of the meal was cooking it on the grill in front of you.

You start with a perfectly clean stainless steel grill in front of you. As you start cooking  the different meats the grill becomes coated with the diffrent juices and flavors.

Shady business practice. They advertise a lunch special on their website but when we came it they said they will not honor it and it's not even a holiday it's a Tuesday at lunch. No mention of any restrictions on their website. 

Beware of supporting this business.

I've dined here with friends for dinner a couple times and we all enjoyed our dining experience. Both times, It wasn't too packed so it was a nice, casual atmosphere. The interior was clean and on the hip side perfect for groups. The service is also friendly and attentive.

The menu has a nice variety options and we ordered a bunch to try. From appetizers, drinks and freshly prepared meats and veggies. Everything was tasty and were of good quality, nothing disappointed our taste buds. 

I highly recommend Gangnam if you're in need to try a new spot off-strip. 

*note: If you give a good yelp review on the spot, you'll get a free dessert. It's not something I'm crazy about giving an instant review for, but if you really like dessert, it's there.
The service is pretty good. The environment is also awesome. I recommend this restaurant in Las Vegas !

My boyfriend and I came here for the first time and ordered the meat lover for two. Seems a little pricey, but SO WORTH IT! My new favorite kbbq place. Nice atmosphere and great food for a reasonable price. Way better than an all you can eat place!

We went in hungry,  got the gangnam set for 2 and it was ag great choice.  The marinated meats were my favorite part of the meal.  The raw oysters was a good start for the meal.  We had enough food to fill us up and take home for a snack later too, Definitely was worth the trip while in vegas!

Husband and I tried the Gangnam set for 2 and it was more than enough food. All the cuts of meat were delicious!! I really like the ambience and decor as well. Service was pretty good when we finally sat down (we waited a half hour, not too bad). As our meal went along our server became a little more scarce.
Very clean environment!!! We had a beautiful waitress and the food was seasoned to perfection!
This place is awesome, my favorite happy hour spot and the staff are very approachable and helpful :)
This was the best decision Ive made since coming to Vegas. Everything else is best left for the cops to uncover.

Was here to celebrate friends birthday. Restaurant does not sell authentic Kobe beef. Most servers are incompetent*. Friends asked for soju drinks, they did not mention they were out of Soju and instead gave us a pitcher of beer, hoping we would pay for it. Beer was lukewarm. Only 2 servers were good with service. 
*incompetent meaning no, not their accents or anything as such. Incompetent as in no training whatsoever. Servers asked us to pass dirty dishes down to them to clear out of our way through out the eating experience. Also the same with our glasses of water. "Do me a solid and pass it down will ya?"
Best Korean BBQ in town ! Portions are very generous and side dishes are great . Raw oyster, Kobe beef , and pork belly are must have here .
Great service and food here ! happy hour after 10pm ! Don't forget to review on yelp for free desserts ! I would definitely come back again!

I've been there a couple of times and I am truly amazed by the fast service and the quality of the meat.

Atmosphere: I love the decor! The big projector screen is perfect for entertainment. I can eat my food while watching and singing along to music videos. The restaurant  looks very clean.

Service: the staffs are friendly and courteous. They make sure to constantly refill my glass. My server was Kristin and she was amazing! I didn't know how the menu work the first time I was there and she took the time to explain everything.

Food: OHHH MYYY GAWD. no words to describe those succulent  pieces of meat. 


The only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is solely because it's not an AYCE BBQ :p

We loved this place! The food and experience was so great! I would totally come back here anytime I am in vegas! They have options to share food and the value was great plus we had so much we had to pack some to go!

Exceptional food and service!  I passed on the 20-30 minute wait time for a table (Monday night) and opted to sit at the bar for dinner (limited to non-bbq items only).  As busy at the wait staff were, they managed to always be a step ahead of me when it came to refilling beverages and replenishing side dishes.  I was so impressed.  I ordered the braised gal bi and beef jap chae.  Portions were reasonable and the braised dish was so tender and flavorful.  This will have to be a tradition whenever I visit Las Vegas.  I checked in for a complimentary macaroon ice cream for a sweet finish, which they seemed happy to honor.  This place fully lived up to their ratings.
Not ayce, but probably best KBBQ I've been to.

First time trying Korean & I'm glad this was the spot. UFC 194 and bomb Korean bbq! It was a lot of food for a good price. The people were very friendly and came by often to ask if everything was okay. It was my first time so I wasn't sure what to do. The guy was nice enough to help me out and explain how the food is eaten here.

The place is really nice and warm and the food is great! Love their spicy pork, pork belly and kimchi fried rice. The only thing is that they don't have a lot of staff which makes the service kinda slow. But the rest is great. Would recommend for friends to come at a not too busy time.
Delicious!!!!!The meat is fresh. We tried the meat lover combo. I love it!!! I would recommend it to my friends. The best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas!

Server told us to hurry up just as we were finish eating because there was a reservation. That's not our problem. That's very rude whether you are a server or not. Never coming here again and telling everyone about this bad service

We came here because of the great yelp reviews....the reviews don't lie!  The food is excellent and the staff are extremely nice.  The marinated meats are absolutely the best options...they're delicious.  That's saying a lot for someone that very rarely eats animals.  We will 10000% be back really soon.
Loved the bulgogi! First time getting the bulgogi bibimbop and really enjoyed it. Great service too! Definitely coming back.

Such a great find! If you are in Vegas this place is a must to visit! We had the Gang nam dinner for 2 that included miso soup, salad, bimibap, 5 choices of meat and all the apps/side dishes w oysters!

Service is fast and friendly!

The food is great but for the price, it's not. I've been to Gangnam a lot of times since it's the nearest one to where I live. It's a great place to try out! The bad thing is that sometimes, the line is just too long. The last time I went there, they told us it was a 30 minute wait but we ended up waiting an hour because they entertained the reservations first. So make sure to put in your reservation or else you're gonna end up hungry and grumpy!
First time here and loved it! Good amount of food and the quality was superb. Definitely recommend this place!!

Really nice place, food was pretty good. Bolgogi had really good flavor. The grill-it-yourself concept is pretty cool as well. Although I do wish they'd give a guide on how long to cook the meats. The appetizers were good as well, and the complimentary side dishes were a nice touch.
Great food and service. Had the Las Vegas for 2 - enough food for 4. Recommend the spicy tuna. We ended up taking half of our meal home. Looking forward to enjoying it for lunch tomorrow.
The service is amazing and the beef is perfectly marinated. The music playing is also on point
Price is very reasonable. They give small side dishes if order 2 bbq items per person. Also, give out free dessert if you write a review. Worth to try.
Nice Korean food! Great beef, and sauces taste super authentic too! Will come back when I'm next in Vegas
We got the Bimbibop and it was great! First time having one and I think this was as authentic as it gets. Great prices for where it was located in relation to the strip.
Always good food! We got the premium. The meat is awesome! Even our kids love it here. The macaroon ice cream is delish as well! We always come back here
This place got me like a happy girl with a satisfied stomach, and I'd like to come back again. Love the service, love the food and drinks here. Highly recommended!

I was surprised how many excellent reviews this place got. It wasn't horrible, but it's far from a 4/5 star restaurant. The parking was not ideal, service was not good (they weren't even really busy), we didn't get any extra banchan when we finished our first set, and the kimchi wasn't really good. I think a lot of people who have never had Korean food are impressed, but this place was nothing to write home about.

Definitely coming back to this KBBQ spot!   The food was amazing.  Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is cause the service was just OK...

We got the 'Meat Lovers' package and substituted the spicy pork for Kalbi instead.   So BOMB.

Great taste and good value! My parents visited Korea before and said the food there, especially the cold noodle is authentic and delicious. We waited for 40 minutes for dinner and went again for a late lunch the very next day (that's how much my parents love this place)!  Service is good; they also have a good variety of food and drinks. The only downside is that it doesn't have any two tops, which I believe causes some extra wait time... Changing the table mix (if possible) might help both the customers and the restaurant.

Off the strip but if you have an inkling for BBQ and some Japanese appetizers, this is a solid place!
The meat was great, side dishes plenty and the appetizers (One with meat, Uni, shiso on seaweed) were great!
Good job!
Staff are very welcoming. Food came out on time and was simply delicious! No problem recommending to other people. Definitely worth the money. Happy Hour is best!

4 of us decided to eat off the strip during our weekend in LV. We're super happy we ate here! The portions were generous and the price is very, very reasonable. Instead of ordering a set meal, we picked-and-chose about 11 dishes to share: 1 seafood salad - 5 stars (it has papaya it in); 3 marinated premium beef - 5 stars; 1 spicy chicken with lemon dipping sauce - 3 stars; 2 pork belly - 4 stars; 1 steamed corn - 5 stars; 1 bacon wrapped asparagus - 4 stars; 2 unmarinated premium beef - 4 stars; 2 big bowls of white rice. 1 large bottle of hi-te (beer) and 1 bottle of sake. Our order came with side dishes at no additional cost (kim chi, pickled cucumber, fish cake, etc...). One thing we didn't order that I wish we did, was the glass noodles (japchae). 

You grill all the meat/veggies yourself. Be sure to ask them to change the grill tray (they didn't offer for us). The Yelp check-in deal gave us a free macaron ice cream sandwich (from Brick) - I chose the green tea flavor and it was delicious! The macaron was light, not too sweet, with nice texture (soft/lightly chewy, but not hard). My verdict: go here for a delicious & filling meal off the strip (but it's not too far)!

The service here was a bit slow. We came here during EDC weekend. It took quite a few minutes for the waiter to come take our order, but I guess the business was very busy then. We arrived during about the afternoon. What was really impressive about this place is that the food definitely is good. We ordered a meat meal combo set that was supposed to serve just 2 people but coming in with 3 people, we still couldn't finish all we ordered. The seafood pancake was crispy as the way I liked it, and the waiter was great for helping us cook the meats.

Good quality meat. Service was great. Would have been great if the lettuce and sesame oil was included.  But loved the sides they provided.  Binomial was great except too much hard rice from the grill pan. I would come again.
Good food with good variety to choose from!  Definitely would come back here again! We ordered the meat lovers and definitely try the Korean chicken with the cheese sauce!
Good service and environment. Food is great and price is reliable. Must try!!! It's a must bombed the GangNam combination is the best choices . # 1 BBQ korean so far

First a disclosure: they have a sign on the table to rate them here on Yelp to get a free dessert.  

We actually waited to finish our food before I wrote this review and we were not disappointed.  It's not AYCE but the items that you get are more than enough to fill you up.  We got the Gangnam combo and everything was delicious. This place is definitely better than the Korean BBQ joint in the Galleria mall. Each item we had was full of flavor and enjoyed each and everyone of them.

Service is excellent and they are there when you need them. Didn't have to flag them down for more water or something

If you've ever been to Gen-Wa in Los Angeles, this place definitely is up to par with them.
Awesome food better than Los Angeles  and Sacramento combined.  Service was excellent.

I have eaten here every time I come to Las Vegas for work.  The food is the highest quality and the service is really amazing.  I usuuly get to-go food but everytime I come the servers are pleasant, my order is always correct, and the food is definitely worth coming back.
So much meat! We got the Gangnam for 6 (combo meal) and were stuffed. Quite a good deal for the quality meats we got. Everything was delicious!! My brother who is a carnivore, was actually satiated.
1st timer with friends. This place is hella bomb! Best KBBQ in town hands down. Must try.

A little off of the beaten path but well worth the short Uber ride from our hotel, the atmosphere, food and experience were all great here! 
I've only had K BBQ once before and happened upon this place via Yelp, it most certainly did not disappoint! 
We ordered the wings (the only think affecting a 5 star review) for starters and the short ribs and rare beef for our entr√©e. The meal came with rice and plenty of sides to make this a nice sized meal for two to share. We also asked for jalapenos and grilled them up too, if you like spicy as much as we do I highly recommend it!
Got the Gangnam grill mix. It was very good. The gulgogi was on point. The two grill was a nice set up for the size of our group.
Flavorful food! Plenty of options and good service. I have tasted better Korean food, but the prices and location of the restaurant cannot be beat.
Great bbq with lots of flavor!! Great service and awesome kimchi best ive ever had!!! Will be coming when i stop in vegas again!

Pretty good Korean BBQ joint right by UNLV, but not AYCE. They do have a lot of good combo options for 2, and 4 people and higher. They also have a nice selection of appetizers. Chili dumplings were good, chili garlic wings were not good at all - do not order them. On the bright side the server took them off the menu for us, we tried one and it was just not good. (wings were also tiny). For meats the korean prime kalbi had great flavor and texture. The beef tongue could've definitely been sliced thinner to avoid it being so chewy. Brisket and spicy pork were good, pork was pretty spicy. Overall pretty good for Korean BBQ, solid 4 star experience. 4/5

This was my first korean bbq. I really enjoyed it. the food was delicious and it was fun to cook ourselves. They are more pricey compared to other korean bbq. We took the gangnam package for 2, which is all preselected. I really loved the bulgogi rice.
Loved it. Get to cook your own food. Will visit next time in Vegas. Got free ice cream with a review posted.

We had a craving for Korean BBQ and was very happy with our dishes... Keep in mind it's for two people...we killed our food! We ordered bacon scallops, pork belly, garlic beef, spicy pork, tofu soup. Awesome find in Vegas!

Wow! I should be eating here once a week!
The hubster and I just had a BIG dinner with a large bottle of sake to boot and our bill was only $25.91! Can't be at that!
We got there at 5:30pm, so it was HAPPY HOUR. We got corn, broccoli, dumplings, wontons, bulgogi, rice, spicy garlic edamame and all the kimchi sides.
It was all good. Was it the best I've ever had? No. But we really enjoyed it anyways.
The wontons are all cream cheese and the sweet and sour sauce is watery. That's my only complaint about the food.
The service was friendly and quick.
Next time we will try a dessert, for sure!

Edited to add: we still love coming here for happy hour, but I was disappointed by the portions tonight. Our macaroni salad was dry and very small. We ordered and paid for two orders of bulgogi and only got one. When we mentioned it, the server said, "our bulgogi portions are small. Hmmm... we have been here at least ten times over the past three years and never got that little. It left a bad taste in my mouth.

Came here with my bf on a Thursday nite... It wasnt crowded but the service was kinda slow. Our waitress brought out all the meat before the banchans even came. Matter of fact, I had to ask for the banchans which should have already been at our table before our meats came out. We ordered the prime kalbi and it was sooooo chewy. i never had kalbi like that before .. Maybe becuz im from LA. We also ordered the steamed egg.. But it was like a souffle..  They must have used some kinda leavening agent to make it puff up ... But sadly to say.. It was super BLAND.
Don't know if I'll come back.. But if i do... Only for happy hour.

Gangnam is the bomb, soo good! Awesome happy hour prices! Most deff recommend it! I reserved the room for my birthday with friends, all my friends who were newbies loved it! Spicy ramen is my favorite!

Great cuts of meat, clean, great ambience and music, service is pretty quick once you order they pretty much bring everything out fairly quickly. Definitely go with the Korean Prime Kalbi! I wish they had japchae as part of the appetizers. GRILLED PEPPERS WERE THE BEST!!!! Also do yourself a favor and order a Lychee Calpico Soda, it's the nectar of the gods....or at least the Korean ...pagan gods. The service could be attentive though. Had to wait until the end of the meal to get my first water refill and it wasn't even busy. Come here for the food not the service.
Best korean food in Las Vegas. Our family come to Las Vegas about 3 times a week. We always stop by here to get some korean food. Our favorite is bibimbab and galbi stew. Great food.
Service was excellent. We got the gangnan package for 2 and it was more than enough for 3 people.  I'd come back again!
The place is clean and food quality is great.. I recommend the cream cheese wontons and Dynamite Shrimp

Yum!!! We have tons of great KBBQ places in Southern California and although this one isn't AYCE, it matches up!! So tasty and such a nice break from the hectic strip. Great service and great food! ~10 min wait for a group of 5 on a Sunday night!
Great place. Great atmosphere Great food. I would definitely come again. I enjoy the marinated short ribs the best.

Big portions at reasonable prices.
If you miss steam white rice, highly recommend this place!

I never really liked bibimbap, I find it basic, just rice, meat, veggies all mixed together, I can totally make this at home, however the uni bibimbap stood out to me. I ordered it. I loved it. I liked the flavors and how the rice at the bottom was crisp. 

We split the fancy Kobe beef, worth every bite, so juicy and soft. 

Ice-cream Macron was very delicious and great price for the size 

If the service was better I would give them 5 stars. They were just slow to take our order and didn't pay attention to details.

So good! Best Asian Bbq ever! The sauce is sooooo good. Beef sashimi is the best!

Kobe beef is not good, but others are so good, hot sake is amazing btw.
Great food great service great selection.. Will definitely come back.   Gets very busy make sure to call in advance for wait time

I order Vegas set for four people that so biggggg very tasty I really like them food!
 Don't missed! 
they staff very kindness too.
Meat quality was good. Good soju cocktail choices. Happy hour from 3pm to 6pm lately. Great place for special occasion.
The food was delicious, service was speedy, restrooms were clean. I'm definitely recommending this place to everyone.
Kalbi is on point! Perfectly cooked and flavor is amazing! Would highly recommend this!!

Felt like Korean BBQ tonight for belated valentines dinner instead of steak. Saw all the reviews on Yelp and the stars this place got so decided to try it out.
We order the Las Vegas for 2 and they do let you substitute, you just have to pay the difference! So that's a plus.
Overall it's good but I think I still prefer the all you can eat Korean BBQ places.

We saw the yelp reviews and decided to go there. The restaurant is run by Korean people they have a good selection on the menu, the food items were good, Service was good and friendly. Four star for Authenticity and since we are from Vancouver we have lots of Korean barbecue restaurants too, so this restaurant was not outstanding for us. But if you are in Vegas and want to try some good Korean barbecue this is the place.

At our trip to Las Vegas me and my family wanted to eat some korean food.

The meal at Gangnam BBQ was one of the best quality for price meals I have had at a korean restaurants in the states. Not only was the food very good quality but the price was more than reasonable. We had 5 ppl in our party and ordered a meal for 4 which was more than enough food for everyone. I didn't eat any rice and was completely full by the end of the meal. Also for reference I eat A LOT. The service was also very satisfactory with them changing out our bbq plate every few minutes and also serving us as quickly as possible. We also ordered a (Kimchi soup) which was more than tasty. The order included filet mignon, bulgogi, samgyupsal and other types of meat. It also came with dumplings Miso soup and salad. All of them were nice. The side dishes or  were honestly very mediocre except for the Kimchi however it was fine seeing as the main part of the meal was so delicious.

I really enjoyed the meal and I will definitely be back for more!!! 

PEACE!!

The Toro beef was amazing. It was so good! The waiter was very nice. My friend got the ramen noodles and it looked really good. I would highly recommend the lunch special for someone looking for food in vegas. Side dishes are amazing! Washrooms are nice.
High quality meats.  Get as much variety as you can.  Not many banchan, but ok.  Can pass on the fried stuff.

Nice ambiance, nice presentation.

Food is good! It's always warm because of the hot stone. You can even have them cook the meat for you which is convenient. Love the environment. Server was super nice! The food on the menu may look small, but it's shareable. I'd come back.

This was one of the best Korean BBQ places I have ever enjoyed. Our server was very accommodating and funny. He also helped us understand the menu because it does look intimating and confusing. Our server was very helpful in helping us pick items off of the happy hour to cut costs and still get a good amount of food. My group of 5 came in at about 10pm and were seated in about 10 minutes just in time for happy hour! We were excited to eat after a whole few days of traveling on sandwiches and road trip food.. We came hungry! I can't exactly tell you what we ordered after enjoying several bottles of happy hour soju.. but our bill was very, very affordable for a group of 5. So, I highly suggest happy hour if you can. I also recommend the flavored soju. :)
Fresh meat, nicely cut, good marination, and very reasonable price. I recommend ordering meats separately instead of opting for combos. Service was on point and the environment is cool.

Korean BBQ spot with premium meats. Definitely get what you paid for. You can order A La Carte or they also have set packages if you don't know what to get. I ordered A La Carte and the price was good. They have packages for 2 people and up to 6 people. A must try in Vegas

Really good food and best Korean bbq in Las Vegas. Quality of the meat is really really good. Me and family really enjoyed it. It's so good pick J  as your server she is really awesome and pretty. Daebak!
The food is delicious. Especially meat is very fresh. We really enjoy it. Will be back any time. Also the waiter service excellent

First time here! What an awesome place!We got a really nice spacious private room in the back!!perfect for our occasion, since there were 8 of us!
 Decor was really nice and clean,service was excellent and the food was delicious! Our Server, Jin,was very attentive and polite! We were impressed! 
 We brought our daughter here for her birthday  and we all enjoyed it,especially  the bday girl! Lol
 Totally will tell everyone about this place whose wanting quality korean bbq!We will definitely come back!

Ambiance and service were phenomenal.  I will definenatly be back. Now for the bad.  They don't carry side dishes which is my favorite part of a Korean meal.  So I will still make a 20 minute drive out to Soyo because of their high quality kimchi side dishes and complimentary barley tea.
The service was great! The vegas deal was so delicious and everything came out perfectly timed. Definitely a great place to eat asian barbecue for the first time.

While attending Cisco Live, one of my instructors recommended this place, so I decided to give a try. I brought my family as well, and we all enjoyed eating here! We came during late night Happy Hour, which I would recommend so you can grab some deals. We ordered the bulgogi bibimbap and some bbq meats, which we all enjoyed. It's off the strip, but would totally recommend anyone to come and try it and it was worth the trip.

What an abundance of delicious food for the discriminating palate!  There was Filet Mignon,  Flat Iron Garlic Rib Eye, Brisket,  Spicy Pork, you name it!! An incredible assortment.  Not to mention a very tasty Chicken Fried Rice to balance out the meats. Definitely come with a hearty appetite and even then, you won't be able to finish.  Great food, great speedy service, and even some great happy hour drink deals.  5 stars without a doubt!

The restaurant was great and the waiter was very attentive. The food was great. My family and I had a nice time and I recommend the Korean Prime Kalbi and The Flat Iron Garlic. The Bibimbap was not that great so i don't recommend it.
food here is alright, meat is the same as other kbbq, service was a little slow at night and some food was not brought out

If u r a food lover, u must come.
A lot of different types of meat and little dishes to eat w main course.
Satisfaction for meat eater.
Too much to eat.

All of the people that gave this place 5 stars need to check out Hobak. It is a real South Korean restaurant with superb food.

Firstly this place doesn't cook the meat for you like other places, secondly they only have 6 dishes of banchan when their menu shows 8. Thirdly they don't give free desserts with the combo meals.

The place was decent but doesn't deserve 5 stars as the service was slow and I don't like cooking my own meat at Korean BBQ places.

Do not think I will return.

Wow this place was awesome! Found it on yelp and because it had so many reviews I just had to try it for myself. Didn't disappoint At All! We went during a weekday around 3 so it wasn't crowded, the server was very welcoming. 

I think we ordered the whole menu lol we didn't want to miss out on anything. The calamari was great, the sweet corn, everything was great, too many things to mention. I wish we had a place like this in My hometown. Everything we tried was on point, my honey doesn't like the fact that we had to cook our things but I don't mind it all. He was so thankful that I found this place that he didn't mind the cooking at the end of lunch lol. Also, yelp perk! we got free ice cream macaroon . To being free it was Big and good, the strawberry was better than vanilla.

Delicious  food so yummiee, good taste of pork belly , clean place 
I' like it and luv it!!!
Nice place for family's dinner
Love this place. Real surprised at how good Korean bbq could be. This definitely goes down for one of the best meals I've ever experienced. Meat lovers is great! Bibimbap is the best I've ever had!

Been going to different Korean restaurants throughout the Valley and may I say, they have good food, decent amount of meat BUT bad customer service! I was still looking at their menu and our hostess snatched the menu book from my hand, didn't even apologize  also, my sangria drink not even half full when it was served.
The food is great, I love the beef and sauce, and the place is nice and clean, would recommend my friend to come here!

We've only ever gone to the happy hour but it is really really good! It's not all you can eat but the portions for the price are just right. And not to mention drinks are half off. I mean a pitcher of beer for like $8 it's crazy. Sapporo. That's really cheap. The service is really good too. I don't really have any complaints about this place. I haven't tried the items not on the happy hour menu but I'm sure their good too. Another go to place.

A refreshing spin on Las Vegas Korean BBQ.

Environment: The restaurant is located near UNLV and the area itself is in that less-than-impressive area behind the strip but the business of the area does help to detract from the somewhat uninviting surroundings. The inside of the restaurant however is pleasantly hip and reminds me of a cross between Gen and Hobak in that there are some neon lights as well as wooden benches giving the restaurant a trendy yet homey feel. 

Food: As per usual for non-all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ spots, it's typically best to go with one of the pre-made sets, which offer a variety of meats as well as a selection of side-dishes. The one we went with seemed to be the most popular choice, and it was a little out of the ordinary compared to other restaurants. It did come with a variety of meats, along with an interesting salad, the standard Korean side dishes, and my favorites, yuzu shishito peppers and 4 oysters on half shell. Additionally, there was a bibimbap which was surprisingly delicious as well. The meats themselves were mostly marinated which was good, because the sauces we were given were underwhelming and blended into each other or did not have enough impact. They also did have a happy hour when we went in which was nice because it was a Friday night and half off any soju and beer is always a great thing.

Service: Service was appropriate and was prompt. Additionally, one of our servers was especially helpful and was helpful in changing the grill anytime we required it.

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant after hearing a lot about it and not really knowing what exactly to expect, and I will most likely be coming back again soon!

Decided to try this place because of all the reviews on here. I love Korean bqq a lot and normally go to Sura but wanted a change. Came here, and instantly liked the atmosphere. Experience was not good at all. 

The food is good. We got their number one seller Gangnam combo. Which would've been perfect but we never got our sides that came out with it. It says you get complimentary sides, and they just never came. We also ordered an extra side of rice, again never came. Basically when ever we ordered things, it either came out super late or not at all. Service is also slow and not attentive at all. I guess we made it inbetween shifts because near the end, we didn't see our waitress at all and a new server took the rest of our order. It wouldn't have been bad, but it would've been considerate to just let us know. We waited way too long for everything. 

I will not be coming back purely because of the experience. Food was decent, but nothing to make me want to come back.
Second time here loved it and the food is delicious!
Food was great, and there was a ton of it. Went with a picky eater and three foodies, everyone left happy! Great meats, beef carpaccio was a huge hit - will totally go again.

We saw this place and yelp and wanted to give it a try seeing all the great reviews!

We ordered the Gangnam special for 2 people but easily can feed four.

It came with calamari, fresh oysters, bibimbop, salad, miso. Kalbi, pork belly, and a bunch of other dishes I forgot. 

Everything was perfectly seasoned and well executed I would definitely recommend and come back again!

The food was tasty and excellent. The kim chee was fresh and tasty, and the green salad was exceptional. The restaurant was hip and there's a cool vibe happening while dining. The meats were fresh and high grade. The marinated meats were succulent. I'd recommend this place to my family and friends.

Great experience and super friendly service. Came in about an hour before close and got some of the HH specials. Tried the Bibimbap, Poki and fried calamari. Highly recommended a fix of normal Korean cuisine.
Everything fresh! The bibimbap is awesome, with a lot of beef in! Oyster is nice too!

My family had to wait for more than an hour to be seated but it was well worth it. The food was awesome & well priced. The wait staff was patient, accommodating & welcoming. We will definitely visit if we are in Vegas again.
Best Korean BBQ ever! Good food and good service!!! Will be back next time for sure!Highly recommended!!!!!!

Best korean bbq in Vegas! There's a reason this restaurant is highly rated. The price is decent. The food is perfectly seasoned! Great side dishes and menu selection. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! It was a 30min walk from our hotel and it's off the strip but it's TOTALLY worth it!! I will definitely come here again when I visit Vegas again.
I come here first time so nice atmosphere around restaurant. Food delicious staff was nice. And good happy hours 3pm to 6pm and more.

Overall, the meat is good, but I got to say it's kind of pricey. I would've prefer to go to a all-you-can-eat Korean bbq place where you would pretty much pay the same amount. I pay about 32 bucks tax and tip included for a meat lover meal shared between 4 people for 99 dollars. Overall, brisket was good.

I came to Gangnam during happy hour and ordered a la carte. At first I thought I was kinda sucky that this was a Korean BBQ place that wasn't AYCE and I thought our bill was gonna end up being really pricey for all the things we ordered (spicy seafood soup w/ tofu, cream cheese wontons, salmon carpaccio, toro beef, and pork belly), and I also thought that I wouldn't leave feeling full. 

But I was SO wrong. The quality of the meat blows Tofu Hut, Sura, and all those other KBBQ joints out of the water. Yeah, it's a bit pricier, but the quality definitely makes it worth it. 

The soup was delicious. It came with rice on the side, which I used to eat my meat with. THAT SALMON CARPACCIO THOUGH!! That was probably my favorite thing we ordered that night. I highly recommend giving it a try. Even the cream cheese wontons were really good!

The layout and decor of the restaurant has a modern feel to it. They have big booths along the side walls and tables in the middle. They also play American and Korean music videos on the wall. 

Not to mention the service/servers are beyond excellent. My waitress was attentive, informative, and very friendly.

Yummy! Such a fun atmosphere and great food. Came with the wife and ordered the Las Vegas for two and there was PLENTY of food. Service was great.  Make sure to get the special rice, I think it's called the biboi. It is way good.
Best kbbq spot in Las Vegas  letsCook!!! Great service  great waiter   They fixed us a nice table for our party of 7
I love their happy hour food deals and they offer quality choices of protein for cooking!

On a $7 Uber drive from strip " 15 min " and the quality of the food and services goes way up and the price go way down . The meat lovers for two was so good and much more meat then we could finish , the macaron ice cream sandwich I will dream about

Excellent food, creative presentations and combinations and good for dates and families.  

Great photographic menu provides generous combination meals for two to six people and a la carte choices.  Very high food quality all around (meats, seafood and vegetables). Lots of variety for any palate.  

First day serving mul nang myun (cold soup with buckwheat noodles).  Absolutely fantastic and I eat it everywhere Korean I dine (which is often).  

Definitely recommend.
Korean diners will be a bit disappointed with the food and banchan.  The steamed egg was good.  The rest not so.  Tasted old.  Meats were ok...a bit chewy.

This place was amazing. Great food and good service. The thing that made this experience a lot better was our server "Donkey" he said we wouldn't be able to pronounce his name right so he said call him donkey. Best server in the whole place.

oh so Ono!  tried many korean BBQ places and this one is by far the best.  it's new, clean, and not on spring mountain, bc traffic can be a pain. I love that they have specials that serve seafood with the meat combos and also incorporate dol sot bibimbap with the combos.  
only downfall... they don't serve bachan...  to me that's the first thing I crave when I think korean food?

came on Christmas Day for dinner with the fam. i knew it was going to be a bit of a wait because of their "no reservations" policy, so we were prepared for the hour-long wait time ahead of us. we hunkered down at the bar for some soju & appetizers (dumplings, chili-garlic chicken wings, both great) and patiently waited for our table to be ready. *highly* recommend the apple soju, it was like boozy apple juice, not too sweet and dangerously delicious. 

when we finally sat down we were STARVING; luckily our free sides were already at the table waiting for us and the plates of food started flowing immediately. we ordered the Meat Lover's package for 4 people and it was so much deliciousness that we had to tap out before we could crush it all. 

highlights for me were the bulgogi, the spicy BBQ pork, the macaroni salad, the spicy cucumber, and the chili-garlic dumplings. we also checked in on Yelp for the free macaron ice-cream sandwich. (i got the coffee flavor and it was RIDIC.) 

service was great; very attentive but barely noticeable throughout the meal. (ie: whenever we wanted a refill of something it was brought very quickly, our empty plates were quietly whisked away, when we asked for a fresh grill-top it was brought over immediately, etc.) considering it was a *very* busy Christmas Day service i'd say the staff ran like a well-oiled machine. 

our total bill for the Meat Lover's package for 4 (with extra sides of asparagus & zucchini), plus chicken wings/dumplings/edamame at the bar, plus 1 beer, 2 bottles of soju, and 2 glasses of wine all came to $175 which is a pretty sweet deal imo. ($43/person + tip for a fully loaded Xmas dinner + enough booze that some of us had to Uber home? lol yes plz.) 

my family had never been to a KBBQ before so i was very excited to introduce them to a new experience and Gangnam definitely delivered! everyone left fat and happy. :)

Great food. Mod interior. Off the strip yumminess. All the Korean BBQ fixings. Fast service. Hot grill ( for newbies, you grill your own fixing at your table). Delicious bulgogi. The squash was okay, but the broccoli was great! Will go again during the next convention. It was so refreshing to eat in a spot where food was spicy, traditional and fun.Great for groups of 7.

This Korean bbq is a hidden gem. Who knew that an amazing restaurant was in the plaza. We ordered the Gangnam lunch special which was around ~$70 and it was delicious. This wasn't only a Korean, but a Korean Japanese bbq. I don't think it makes a difference but this bbq was the best I've ever had. The meat and side dishes were marinated and seasoned to perfection. The interior was beautiful and had a night time vibe. The service welcomed us with a hug. I'm telling you guys if you go to Vegas, come here and try their bbq

Came here for Happy Hour on Tuesday and I loved it! Although you might have to wait, the food was delicious and the service was fabulous. The sides were very fresh and well flavored. Sides only are available for those who order two BBQ items per person but it was so worth it. The meat was tasty and fresh. We particularly liked the Bulgolgi and the brisket was not fat and very yummy. The sauces they give can compliment the meat as well! However for the Spicy Pork, it wasn't needed. The Spicy Pork was marinated with a lot of sauce and wasn't too spicy.  Perfect! Also, draft beers were Half Off!!! I ordered a Sapporo beer for $2.50! That was a treat! Almost forgot to mention that you can get a free ice cream macaroon when you check in on Yelp. It was perfectly sweet for our salted pallet. You only get one but it's nicely sized. When I come back to Vegas, I will definitely be returning to this hidden gem. I would even go during regular priced hours.

One of the best Korean BBQ places here in Vegas. The service is always great and really fast. Happy hour has some really good deals that will save you a few bucks. 

My girlfriend and I always order a variety of meats and sides.
Bulgogi, spicy pork, tongue, brisket, steamed egg and cheesy corn. 
Bulgogi has the perfect marinate of sweetness to it, spicy pork is deliciously spicy. Tongue is my favorite, super thinly sliced and the brisket is great too. Steamed egg is always cooked to perfection and my girlfriend is obsessed with the cheesy corn. They also bring out a few sides on the house (kimchi, mac salad, dipping sauces and other veggies). 

This is not all you can eat, but for the price and quality I would choose this over any AYCE Korean bbq place.

This place is Awesome! I live in San Diego and we have good Korean barbecue but this place is way better, probably the best! We had the Gangnam combo, tender meat, fresh oysters, good everything all the way around. lol. We waited a while  but definitely worth it!
My first but last time here.  I went there because it stayed open late.  Terrible food, very friend staff.  Price not acceptable for what you get.

I've been to a lot of K-BBQ places in So Cal.  This place is near Hard Rock Cafe.  The food is average and the service is ok but it seems understaffed.  The atmosphere is nice and comfortable.  They play music videos on a large projection screen for a bit of entertainment.  We would stop on again if it was convenient but not make a special trip.
Excellent korean BBQ for a great price. It was a long wait, aside from that it was amazing.

AMAZING RESTAURANT. I came here during my first night in Vegas based on Yelp reviews. This place got really good ratings, and apparently many other people realized this also. My family and I were starving, so it was a little disappointing when we found out there was a 40 minute wait. But it smelled so good, so we decided to sit it out and look at the menu (best decision ever). I enjoyed every part of my meal, especially the Original Bibimbap, the Spicy Seafood Noodle, and the Miso Beef. Plus, we checked in and got a free macaroon ice cream (which was also delicious)!!! We liked this place so much that before we went to the airport on our last day, we came back again for lunch! The waiters were really friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend. I'm glad we got to start and end our Vegas trip with this place :)

Everything was delicious! I have Korean BBQ a lot in China, and I have been told it's very authentic. This place is much better, great flavors and excellent quality. All the meats and seafood were very fresh

Worst service ever took longer than average. Rice was over cooked as well. Good was subpar. Not going back there again. . Parking and location was fine. Very disorganized crew. Needs to attend better care with customers.

My advice, make sure you ask for the happy hour menu. If not, you'll be looking at the regular menu only. Maybe the guy forgot? I don't think so. The side dishes were ok... I've had better. But my family and I were itching for some Korean BBQ and we planted ourselves. My daughters got free macarons which was a nice treat...if you ask for it.

The only setback for this place is that its not an all-you-can-eat place, however the quality of meat is good. Service is prompt. Wait time varies...I have had to wait for this place before for an hour and this visit it was only 15 mins.
Last time I was in Vega$, I stopped at Gangnam Asian BBQ with co-workers!  It was SO delicious, we visited twice during the same visit!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Best KOREAN BBQ in Las Vegas. 
It's nice and clean and good service. 
I would come back again.

Wow! This place really lives up to all its great reviews. Fun concept of grilling all your own goodies. We got the meat lovers. Everything tasted great. HUGE portions! The two of us definitely could not finish it all. Also feel free so swap out and meats or appetizers. They are so flexible and all the staff was very friendly. Also, if you write a review you get a free dessert ;)
Great food. Ordered the meat lover for 2, end3d up having too much food but the quality is great.

everything is perfect!
meat is tender
I love the mushrooms! all the marinated meat are so good!
Very pleasant find in las Vegas close to MGM Grand & Hard Rock Cafe. Delicious food and great service. Will definitely be back!

After a 14 hour drive from Oregon we were starving and got there around 10p to find out it was Happy Hour, Score!! The happy hour portions were just right. The meat was soft and flavorful. We had the bulgogi, pork belly and Spicy Chicken with lemon sauce. Mushroom medley was simple, but paired well with the meats. The macaron ice cream sandwiches topped off the evening. Staff was kind. Will definitely visit this place the next time we are in town. Aloha!

Lives up to all the hype and then some! The very best dishes were the prime rib; the macaroni salad bonchon; and the filet. 

We stayed at the hard rock hotel, and this was a very quick walk across the street - less than 3 minutes' walk, and probably just under 20 minutes or a 5-min cab from the strip. The price was exceptional for the quality as well. Can't recommend enough. I just wish I had a location like thos at home.
Great date place. Me and my gf ordered a la carte and the servings were plentiful. Very tasty and fresh. Slight mistake on our drink but we were refunded. Very happy would return
Great place for great food! Join us! This is a great place to meet friends too! The meat lovers meal for two is a great item to order. Fillet mignon is awesome!
I came here the other night with family and really enjoyed their kalbi. So here I am eating here again today.
Food was very good! Service was friendly and attentive, if you're at the area make sure to drop by and give it a try!

We went here last night and it was fantastic!  They play very cool music videos on a large screen and my kids loved it.  On an opposite screen, they played Euro Soccer, it's as if they knew my husband was coming, lol!!
Now, the food..... we ordered kalbi, korean chicken, and filet mignon as our main meat selections. They were all seasoned perfectly and tender.
Our additional items were seafood pancake, veggie potstickers, and japchae.  Seafood pancake was a bit thicker and fluffier than we liked.  We are used to thin and crispy.  Veggie potstickers are more like dim sum dumplings.  Japchae noodles were a tad undercooked.
Banchans(free side dishes) were kim chee,
Squid, cucumbers, fish cakes,bean sprouts,Mac salad were all delish!!
I would definitely go back.  Staff was friendly and very helpful.
Tasty Korean bbq, Food and taste is exactly what I want! Already not enough meat for me lol Definitely would come back next time visiting Vages.

Tried this for the first time due to the high ratings on Yelp, this place did not disappoint! My bf and I got the Gangnam, the variety of meat was amazing! We also fully enjoyed their fried rice! The price point is great for how much food you get!!! A must try when going to Vegas!!

We were at UNLV for the day and wanted to grab something to eat. I haven't had Korean Barbecue in a long time but this was a great re-introduction to Korean cuisine. I had bulgogi and fried dumplings, which were both great. The serving size was perhaps a little small, so just be sure to order enough food. The service was also pretty good as we were well attended through our time here.

Enjoyed the food very much. Reminded me so much of Korea. 

Its just like the traditional korean bbq where you cook on the grill in front of you. Ordered the marinated kalbi, bulgogi, duck, and steam egg. Will definitely come back and bring more friends.
Japanese style BBQ but I enjoyed they serve free Kimchee that taste was great.

Great food! We went in for lunch on a very HOT Saturday escapade. We ended up ordering ala carte from their wide variety of choices on their menu. It came out really cheap. The serving size was decent. The restaurant was almost 80% Full, and surprisingly we waited almost an hour for our order to be served. 

Good thing the food tasted sooooo Great that it made up for the lost appetite and delayed service. Try the Kalbi Steak and the Beef Tongue

Wow! We finally found our new KBBQ spot! My family and I ended up getting the "Gangnam" it came with fresh oysters, soft tofu kimchi, sishito pepper yuzo, green salad, bulgogi bimbimbap/white rice, miso soup, mushroom medly and for the MEATS... Harami miso, prime kalbi, flat iron garlic, filet mignon, bulgogi (All beef). Plus all the banchan. Waaaaaay too much food for us but super yummy. Everything was fresh and everyone was super attentive even though they were very busy. Inside the restaurant is super clean and nicely decorated. Definitely will be coming back!

Very clean and good ambience. We ordered the best seller miso beef, pork belly, spicy calamari, steamed egg and chili dumplings. All with good quality and very enough for two people. The sauce that comes with the meat was really great too, and they also offer complimentary side dishes. The side dishes were all delicious. Among all side dishes, I like the fish cake the most:) such a pity that's not on the menu though. Overall, me and my friend are definitely coming back again!

If you're looking for good real korean bbq with great jjigae ... come here! 
It's very reasonably priced and the service was great! 

They also have macaron ice creams - a must have after a great meal!
Really good kbbq. Enjoyed bringing first timers to kbbq and they really enjoyed this place. The bbq had alot of favor

You can really tell that they use quality ingredients. The service is good and they do attend to your very need. I like how everything is catagorized, and you do get what you pay for. This is now our go to place for Korean BBQ fix.
The food here are great! Great value and big portion. We ordered their tofu soup and original bibimbap. I love the bibimbap here :) it is served in a special pot xD. Worth to try!

Very good! Great atmosphere. Loved the happy hour menu. They even do happy hour on weekends. Service was excellent. Their spicy pork was the perfect level of spicy. Brought friends that have never had Korean barbecue before and they loved it! We'll be back!

This place is mediocre and extremely overhyped, and I strongly suspect that a large number of the glowing reviews were written just to get free dessert. I gotta admit I nearly did this myself--it would be awkward to show the server a two-star review when asking for a free dessert, wouldn't it? That's how they getcha.

We ordered the Meat Lover's BBQ for two, which at ~$56 for a single serving of meat, was obscenely overpriced. In cities with good Korean restaurants and more competition, you can get all-you-can-eat BBQ for $20/person. To top it off, the $56 doesn't even get you lettuce wraps, ssamjang, or sesame oil--you have to pay extra for each. Are you kidding me?

The meat itself was good. I mean, it's hard to mess up raw meat. However, the grill was electric! That was a first for me, and yet another disappointment with this restaurant. The meat obviously came out with no grill flavor whatsoever, and I could have cooked it better at home.

Our waitress was nice, and she was very good at topping up our water. However, not once did she offer to refill any of the banchan, so we ended up paying $56 for a single serving of meat AND sides. Lastly, she dropped off the check before we were even done, and I had to make several attempts to flag her down so that we could order dessert. She didn't clear the table for dessert, and we had to awkwardly share it among a bunch of empty dishes and leftover food, hunched over the giant table.

New to vegas and we were looking for some awesome kbbq, and with the help of yelp we were able to find this treasure, Gangnam kBBQ is delish! you just have to give them a shot! Good ambience, customer service was on point and price range is not bad at all! Give their Harami Miso ( outside skirt steak ) a try you will not be disappointed!

Good place for korean bbq. Portions of meat are big and all the sidedishes are delicious. The macaron ice cream is very good. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in vegas and want korean food. The prices are decent too.

This place is amazing  ! We had to wait about 45 min (weekend) but it was definitely worth it , wife and I had the marinated kalbi and prime kalbi definitely get the marinated version . We also had bacon asparagus and fondue cheese broccoli as well as 2 other meats we forgot the name of but it was thin sliced ... Amazing. Our food took awhile but they served us extra side dishes !!! Amazing !!!!

Great korean bbq restaurant. I recommend the meat lover combo for the meat lover. We ordered 2 more meat dishes and it was enough for 4 people. Very nice service and good complimentary side dishes. I would recommend the radish and the seaweed.

Good food! Service was pretty good. 

Personally, I don't like the marinated meat as much.

Loved the fliet mignon and flat iron steak!

My first experience with Korean BBQ. I was a bit intimidated at first. The place was busy and my rookie flag was flapping wildly. I was able to get through the ordering process with the help of a super friendly waitress that set me at ease from word go.  Happy hour prices made my experience even more palatable.

First time here.... ordered through Gangnam prix fix menu for 2. Excellent quality and value for the price.  Favs were Haram Miso, Prime Kalbi, and Filet Mignon.  Also comes with fresh oysters, fried calimari and all the Korean side fixings. Can't wait to come again to try the Premium package!
Great atmosphere. Got the gangnam special for 2, everything amazing especially the prime steak. Service was excellent. Definitely coming back again!

Awesome. Great selection of meats and very tasty. We ended up ordering a double order because it was so good. Surprisingly, Rice was not included in the meal so we had to ask for it. not that big of a deal.

This restaurant was very good. I enjoyed the customer service even more so portions of the food. I typically get AYCE Korean barbecue so I got satisfied by this. And even more so than worthwhile of a five star review.
I like free desert. It is very nice. The spicy chicken is delicious. I like these tasty food.

This place is worth the visit and especially at lunch time! There is a great lunch combo for about 10-13 dollars depending how many items you get and it comes with meat to grill, rice, choice of an appetizer, and all the korean side dishes.  We decided to order two orders of the kalbi (marinated) and it was worth it! I could just order 2-3 orders of kalbi and eat that all day.

We took an uber from the strip and it was about $7 which isn't bad for some decent korean food.
Very tasty food, service is also good. We chose a #1 Gangnam choice and were very pleased

Got there early for lunch - ordered the popular Gangnam meal for 2 - diff types of protein.

PROS: variety of salads and apps served first, multiple cuts of meat + shishito peppers, crab wontons were delish. favorite salad was the tofu and the pasta salad. 

CONS: not enough servers for lunch on a Sunday, certain requests had to be made twice, low on water refills, staff spread way too thin, bibimbap was not good at all, did not have that crispy layer and there was no fried egg. The NY strip was flavorless.

I love this place! It gets a little pricey if you have a big appetite, but everything was very flavorful and delicious. We weren't sure what to order, so we chose the best sellers or ones that were recommended. My favorite was the chicken with lemon sauce, and either the #1 or #2...can't remember which one was which anymore :(. The salmon carpaccio was really good too! It's pretty much salmon sashimi with ponzu sauce. We also liked the japchae...very flavorful and full of assorted veggies. 

The filet mignon was tough and chewy so we didn't' enjoy it as much. The spicy tuna kimbap was okay...there was too much rice for me. I didn't realize it's just spicy tuna over deep fried rice. We also ordered the yuzu soju, but it tasted watered down. I was kind of skeptical because the menu shows that its yellow...but the one we got was clear (like the lemon soju)

I would definitely come again if I was in Vegas. Our hotel was on the strip, so the cab ride was only about 15 minutes...I think it cost around $13-16.
It's lit. Macaron ice cream sandwiches be poppin. It super lit and they play bomb music.

This place rocks! We're from out of town and come here every time we go to Vegas, sometimes multiple times. Happy hour is great because it's the same meat we already order, only cheaper. The kids love the pork belly and we love the toro and bulgogi. Refillable side dishes are delish. The enoki mushroom is really fresh tasting and healthy so it offsets all the meat you're about to devour. The steamed egg looks just like the picture! My only wish is that they served rice paper with the meat. It would make the meal over the top! The restaurant is really nice and the bathrooms are clean. Overall a great, well-rounded experience!

Great place for Korean BBQ. Meat was flavorful and great side dishes. Best Spicy Tofu Soup ever and you must try the Tteokbokki as an appetizer. The best meat was bulgogi. I would recommend everyone to try this place.
Delicious Korean food and great portions for a good price! The combo deals are the best value!

Whenever I'm in a big enough city, I start craving Korean food.  The GF had heard from some other folks that we should go to Sura, which we had gone to a few weeks earlier.  Sura was fine, but not good/great.

I had flown into Vegas, and per a mutual agreement, had not made any special Valentine's Day plans.  We ended up here for dinner, and there were probably 3 or 4 open tables.  We were quickly seated in the modern looking space.

The menu was interesting - they had the standard combo items, where you get a mix of meat and sides, but apparently when we were there it was happy hour, and they had items that were priced in the $3 to $8 so that you'd order a serving of beef toro, spicy pork, sides, etc  - almost felt like a tapas place, though obviously meat heavy.

Quality of the meat seemed a little better than Sura.  We were a little surprised that the kalbi/short-ribs had the bones removed, but that was fine.  All the meat and sides we had were good, and the gas grill worked fine.  I was also glad to see that they had spicy cucumber as a side, which is one of my favorite forms of kimchi.

The small plate style of ordering probably kept us from over-eating as much as an AYCE joint, but I was feeling nearly as full.

The one miss we had was that we had ordered white rice, but it didn't come out till we were almost done (which had included a second round of ordering).  I had asked about it earlier to one of the staff, and they nodded, and wandered away like they were on it, but didn't bring out any rice.  My guess is that they had gotten slammed at some point, and ran out of rice, so they had to make more, but that's only a guess.  No one said anything, and when they did bring out the rice near the end of the meal.

Overall, our damage with tip was an even $50, which was considerably less than the $72 we had spent at Sura, and I left feeling more satisfied with my meal.

My favorite Korean BBQ here in Vegas! The wait is worth it since everything here is so delicious! The servers were fast and helpful as well, despite only a few waitresses manning the entire restaurant. 

We got the Gangnam set for 2 people ($70). Initially, we weren't sure if it would be enough meat for us but it definitely was. We couldn't even finish everything! The fried calamari was my favorite out of the appetizers. I love that they also included Bulgogi Bibimbap but I wished that they had the usual mixture of vegetables in the dish. The meat was very fresh, had great quality, and tasted amazing. I also got macaron ice cream sandwiches for dessert which was the perfect ending to a great feast! The set is a bit pricey but it's worth it!
Pretty good place. The service was as spectacular as the food. The amount of sides and stuff they bring you to go with your food is awesome. Will be back for sure.
Everything was bomb!! Happy hour has some good items on the menu as well! Holler at the dessert
Good quality meat and good service. Not ayce but it's still worth it. Free macaroons ice cream! That's a win win situation.

I like the food, it was really fresh. The service was also on point and it was a full house. The beef is really good, any of them. The fried rice feeds about 3 ppl. I love this place, I come here often. And always bring ppl here who come to Vegas to visit, they all love it. The price is also very reasonable. For 2 ppl I usually spend about $40 but leave STUFFED.
I wish I could come here everyday! The best  Korean place ever! Definitely worth waiting for an hour today !

Amazing food! There are tons of option, including sushi and ramen bowls. We opted for the 4 people bbq package, and were able to make it one for 5. It came with 5 different kinds of beef, 8 oysters, corn, rice, miso soup, two giant bowls of salad, mushroom medley and unlimited sides. There was so much food we left feeling stuffed. The macaron ice cream sandwich was out of this world. Its a little off strip but definitely worth the visit.

First time here! We went during happy hour and the prices are very cheap, but they only have a few selections. Also take note that at this place, you have to cook the meat yourself!

Overall, everything was delicious. However, the beef toro isn't as tender as I've had before. The beef tongue is really good!

Honestly if you come to Korean bbq, order beef. The other meats aren't as good for the worth, but they are still tasty. Also if you write a Yelp review, you get free desert!
Really good korean bbq. Its been a while since I had some food this good with good quality. Recommend to anyone who wants authentic korean bbq

Outstanding Korean BBQ. Many Koreans eat here. Large menu of various food items or order the Las Vegas set for $45.95 or the Meat Lovers set for $55.95. Both are enough for 3 or 4 people or take the leftovers home.
Excellent food and value for the price!  Service was prompt and courteous.  The meat lovers is a great selection for those who are looking for a wide verity of beef and pork.  Will certainly be back!
Amazing quality cuts and decent prices, bulgogi is to die for. Definitely recommend this spot to friends, and I will be coming back next time I'm in town.

Came across this place when we were looking for a new place for lunch! It didn't dissapoint. Tried the GangNam special and loved every dish! Food was fresh and service excellent. Definitely will be adding it to our regular rotation.

Happy hour is good &' so is desert . A definite go to while in Vegas. Serving is fast and welcoming . The ambiance is clean &' fancy . We did happy hour and got ; 2 beef toro ( $8 )  , garlic chili wings ($4 ), fried calamari!!!!

Omg, omg...this place is so off the charts in every way. We ordered appetizers of firecracker shrimp, squash tempura and the urchin over Kobe beef. We then ordered the meet, which was ribeye, prime rib and beef short ribs. It also comes with lots of little sides. The beer selection is great our service was excellent with Kiki and Jay. We will definitely be back. Btw, Yelp gave them a 4 1/2 out of 5 with over 3000 reviews

Great korean bbq, quality, taste, price are just great. We but together our own order which was great as my wife does not eat meat so she chose veggies and seafood which were both great. 
I ordered pork belly, short rib and bugogi which was the best of the 3. highly recommend this place for a great dining experience.
Best kbbq restaurant I've been to so far. Try all the favorites, they're worth it! - miso harami, spicy tuna kimbap, and prime kalbi. 15+ minute wait on the honey toast so order ahead.

I think this is one of the better kbbq places in town. My first visit was maybe a couple years ago and since then I've tried a handful of places and tonight I realized that this should be my go to spot for Bbq. Service is great the reverse happy hour menu items are reasonable and there is a variety to choose from. 

The set menu options are also great with a variety of meat items and appetizers to choose from. Just seems a little pricey. We ordered the meat lovers for two people and it was more than enough for the three of us. Meat was seasoned perfectly not bland or too salty. And the side dishes are ample. Definitely will be back here more often.

First time here and it was amazing! The service was fast, the food was excellent and the people who worked there were really nice. The meat was so fresh and the sides were so tasty and the macaroon ice cream sandwich was the icing on the cake. Will recommend this place to everyone and bring my family who'll be visiting next week

Delicious food. The staff was extremely polite and very fast! All the meats we ordered were super fresh and flavorful. My family of four ordered the Meat lovers for two and we still had food left over. The restaurant was extremely clean and macaroons were so good, I highly recommend the Green tea ice cream sandwich.

Food was excellent and a good value. We had a party of five. The short rib friend rice was so delicious. Our service was lacking though. We had to flag down the hostess to get our drinks refilled and our check at the end of the meal. Our waitress seemed to be purposely ignoring us.  That being said, the food made up for it!  We'd go again.

This place never fail for big party and meat lover.

Fresh meat and good portion with right price.
above average service
Love this place, food is great, and service is fast and friendly, the coffe macaroon is delicious will def be back soon.
Great!! Food, Great Service!!!  Will definitely come again.  Ordered the Las Vegas for 2.  Got our money's worth.

Loved the place because of it's unique concept and great flavors! We have been to Korean food joints before but this place was way different. Looking for a light lunch, we turned up at this place. It was happy hours and most of their menu was at half price! We ordered some soju to start off which was great - do try sometime! Got the Spicy Chicken Karaage which they give you seasoned and you cook on the grill at the table. It was very good and we ended up ordering it again.  Also do try their dumpling soup which is fantastic! We ordered a lot of those too. It's a real steal during the happy hours as the items are really cheap and it's great if you can go with a group - that way you can try a lot. Also, this place gives you a free smores if you review them there. Sure it's cheating to get those reviews coming but why would you not review just a great place. I would have reviewed anyway! Good place - do check out.

The starters was tasty, but it was gone before we started.. Yum yummy 
Enjoy Friend!!

I will definitely be back here! The food was amazing. The KBBQ places we have back at home are nothing compared to this one. The Macaron Ice Cream we received at the end of our meal was a great dessert to end our lunch with.

First time that I have had Asian BBQ in a long time and I have to say that they do it very well at Gangnam. I love that they have the 4 pre-decided meal combinations to choose from. We got the Gangnam meal and it was just the right amount of food for 2. The meat was perfect, the sides were done just right, and I love the dressing on the salad... A little bit of orange lemon glaze.  I would recommend coming here when you are in town.

Most of the staff were nice, but this one rude waiter just walked away while we were ordering. I guess he got bored with our order??I wasn't funny enough for him?? Epic wait between ordered food delivery to the table.
Lychee martini is amazing! Perfectly sweet. The $65.00 best selling meal is amazing. I suggest you save the filet minon for last as it is melt in your mouth yum! Everything is delicious.

Such an amazing restaurant.  I never write reviews on yelp. But this restaurant is just too amazing.
Foods are great. Servers are great. Plus, atmosphere is great. Highly satisfied with everything. Thanks Gangnam!

My rating is to WARN everyone of thee most disrespectful embarrassing and delinquent establishment I've ever been encountered with ! I use to love this place I loved it so much that Friday I decided to take my cousin and her bf who have never been to Loren BBQ before for their first experience and it ended in something I'd never imagined ! Our dinner was great as we were getting our check the waiter asked if we wanted dessert and of corse my son says yes as he saw the macaroon ice creams in the front by the door  waiter says if you have a yelp just check in and it's free . So of corse I do and down hill goes our night . A couple minutes later as we're eating desert another waiter comes over and says o have a phone call and I look at him confused as to why because he barely knows my name and no I know would know I'm there or have a urgent reason as to why the wouldn't call my phone so I get the phone as the waiter insist it's a emergency (here I'm thinking it's some joke or I won something ) then I answer and it's some random person claiming to be the manager and says that I have Been complained about for showing my tits in public mind you in with my family and have never been the type of person to such a thing I look around to see if someone joking and then the man on the phone proceeds to be disrespectful as I'm looking for the waiter to give him back the phone ask for the manager wich both the man on the phone and waiter claim they are my bf gets on the phone and goes at it with the guy asking him to show his face they e change words and all the while I'm waiting for my debit card and my bf to calm down . We finally walk out my cousin grabs the phone and *69 the phone and looks through the recent call list then the "manger/waiter" who gave me the phone takes it and tries telling her they called from another phone . Well we leave and realize that the call was made from inside thAt place . Idk what kind of sick fuck thought it was funny to ruin our dinner or play some disrespectful joke that way but it wasn't funny I hope they ready this and know that I did involve the police and they will be further involved being as how the next morning I woke up to fraud on my account and many transactions that were never made by me ! I have tried to call them and confront them but I have either been placed on hold or hung up on ! I hope you all read this and know these people are sick and I'd never agian recommend this place as a go too in my life !
I like bulgogi, pork, good service and wonderful food! My family really love soy sauce soup too.
Yummy yummy~ i like the appetizer and the meet here...very good restaurant ...sure next time when I visit Vegas will come back to this GANGNAM BBQ~
