excellent service and food. the price is affordable. i like the mv displayed here. its the place to taste the true korean style bbq.

This is definitely the best Korean bbq my friends and I have had in a long while. We came in to visit a friend and saw the great reviews so decided to try it. This place far exceeded our expectations! We ordered 8 different meats for the 4 of us, 2 appetizers, and some soup and it was just the right amount of food for us. Each person gets their own set of tongs as well so one person doesn't get stuck cooking the whole time. Also, it's cheaper than most of the places we've been in Arizona and California which is a plus.

Food is the best here . Also the service is very friendly. The restaurant is very modern and clean.
We will be back for sure.

AMAZING FOOD! Must come back (when I visit Vegas)! I thought it'd be super busy on a Friday; not too bad. We didn't have to wait long.  TIP: get the sets. It's worth it. Of course, always add the dessert. Haha.
Great meal. We enjoyed cooking on the grill at our table. The bulgogi and filet was phenomenal. As we're the sides and all the meats. The chicken was also super flavorful. Definitely recommend.
Great place to eat with family and friends. A lot of good quality meats with great service. Although it can get pretty pricey, If you leave a yelp review you also get a free dessert!

Took my parents to this place. The restaurant doesn't have very strong smell of bbq which is nice. It's also clean and well-decorated. We ordered the Gangnam combo. The size is perfect for three of us (my mom prefers vegetables so she mostly had appetizers and salad). Will recommend this place to anyone who likes Asian food.

Favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas! FYI - it's not AYCE, but it ends up coming out to ~$30/person anyway (unless you have a huge appetite) so comparable in price. Quality of meat, variety of offerings, and service are all better than what you receive at AYCE joints. Also nice, central location away from all other Spring Mtn spots. Highly recommended!
High quality food. Plenty of food to go around. Great service. The meats were well seasoned and extremely tender. Would recommend for any occasion.

Good quality/quantity of meat with fair pricing. I had 2 ramen noodle in Cosmo cost more than 5 dishes of meat and more or course. Plus free ice cream for check-in and best service!!!  

The server was very helpful and advided us when we ordered too much meat. Very generous portions of side dishes and they were fabulous!

I came here on a Monday for lunch and waited 30 mins for seating. I had the lunch special and tried the bulgogi and Korean chicken for protein, house salad, cream cheese wonton for appetizer, and added beef brisket and rice. I think the meat was marinated a little too sweet (I am a meat lover btw). I really like the cream cheese wonton, but not the sauce that came with it. The restaurant was clean. It only have one restroom stall for each gender. I had a tall, Korean waiter and he was doing a great job even though he forgot to bring the macaroni salad I requested. It's okay though. I saw him running back and forth, so I didn't get upset. Overall, the food here was mediocre. I live in SoCal and I prefer the kbbq in or near my area because it an all-you-can-eat restaurant and/or buffet. The restaurant was clean. It only have one restroom stall for each gender. They also have a little bar area. So, I think this place is ok, not bad of course.
Place is open late which is always nice in Vegas. The food was good and they have so many meat options to try. They offer small portions but are reasonably priced so try and try and try.

Every time we visit Vegas, we make sure to eat at this place. This is the best Korean BBQ restaurant I have been to, and I've been to a lot of them in San Diego and Los Angeles. 

This time, we tried the premium meal for two for $80-$90. Everything was great: the sides, and the variety of dishes from meats (which included Kobe beef) to some seafood. Overall, great value...this order can easily feed 3 hungry people too. 

And service is always really good, no matter how busy this place is. I rarely would give a 5 star review...but this place definitely deserves it.

This was our first meal in Vegas and really, not a bad one. The place is not huge, but does have accomodations for a few large groups. We weren't a large group but still had to wait around 20 minutes for lunch to get seated.

The food itself is more Korean style - not the most authentic Korean BBQ you're ever going to get, but it's not bad at all. The prices aren't terrible (could be cheaper like in other cities sometimes, but still not bad). Nothing stood out at me, but it was all decently solid food. Our main waitress kind of seemed like she didn't want to be bothered though. It wasn't bad service, but she still kind of gave off that vibe for some reason.

Anyway, if you are in the area and need something like Korean BBQ, this is not a bad option at all.
Reverse happy hour was on point! Loved the bulgogi and spicy pork. Check in for a delish ice cream!

Everything about this place lived up to my expectations. My husband and I came for our wedding anniversary. I have been counting the days down until I can indulge into some gangnam style....pause. 

We ordered pork belly, filet mignon, salmon wrapped in bacon, tempura kabocha, oysters, the spicy chicken wings, spicy garlic edamame, and the famous spicy tuna kimbap! First of all, spicy tuna kimbap is mmmmbop good! It's a roll of seaweed with rice in it fried into a tempura with spicy tuna atop. It was deeelish if you are a fan of raw fish, especially the spicy tuna flavor. It is a MUST GET when you come. You failed if you didn't order it to give it a shot. Don't expect the sizes of the meat to be on steroids. The meat are sliced so when you grill it yourself it doesn't take forever to cook. I think the portioning were perfect enough so you could indulge and enjoy whatever other items you ordered; therefore, you weren't meat overload. Unless, you came in with your carnivorous spirit on green.

All the side dishes (banchans) come free with the meal were delicious as well. I don't know if these side dishes are on a daily rotation, but we received 6 different servings of side dishes. These were bean sprouts, kimchi, kimchi like cucumber, Mac salad, radish (daikon) in a pool of some sweet sauce, and cuttlefish. The cuttlefish was so tender. It was my fave out of the banchans. I mean honestly, I don't think I was breathing as I was scarfing my food down. 

We came in on a Tuesday evening. The ambiance was perfect. If you've been following my reviews you'd probably know by now that I come from a family of 6. I'm raising 4 boys and a husband. Lol. So this quiet time, is so much needed! It wasn't overly busy when we walked in. But as the night progressed so did the patrons. On a Tuesday night to have such business tells you something. The servers were great. Checked on us as often enough to not make me start secretly grumbling as a waiter approached. They were very good at clearing your table off of empty dishes so that was great as I dislike clutter. They did seem a little overly eager on certain parts such as the grill being used or not, but hey...I get it. Don't wanna char the grill or waste propane. That'd be equivalent to me telling my kids to turn the light off if no one is in the room. Except, we still had pieces on the grill that still needed grilling. My husband and I did give each other a look after awhile. But no biggy. 

I'd come back over and over until they give me reasons not to. The facility is clean. The colors are very zen like and I love that they have a projector screen of music videos playing. They played a mixture of rap and kpop. 

Good vibe, enjoyable food...definitely recommend! They do have high chairs, but expect it to be busy so I'd keep the stroller in the trunk, though there's space for it.

Enjoy!
Shisito peppers were so good! I had the be bum bap, which was dol sot. Sooo good. Great service, super clean. Yummy!!!

Came here for lunch. Food was amazing and delicious. I would give this a 5 star because of the food but I have a hard time with my water glass sitting empty for awhile. Restaurant wasn't busy just don't like asking for refills. Definitely will come again!

Came here for the first time. I can say this is one of the best Korean restaurants I've ever been. Service is good, and the food is bomb. But, if you don't like to wait for a long time, I don't suggest you to come during dinner time cuz they get really busy. I came around 5pm to avoid the wait. Would def come back here again

first time here and service was extremely poor. I dont know if it was short staffed because only two servers were working the late shift at 11pm. orders were wrong and so was the wait. no refills on water. get the check, no tip.

Everything is just perfect! I've never tried any Korean food as good as these. We almost gave up while waiting. Thankfully we returned and enjoyed our meal. The mix tempura and the prime kalbi taste so good!

I was a little disappointed in their tofu soup here. It was a bit bland and not spicy enough. It tasted more tomato based and it didn't come with an egg. It's one of my "go to" things to order at Korean restaurants, so I was pretty disappointed. 

However, they have great service. And the macaroon ice cream sandwiches are amazing. I don't even like desserts.
The lunch special tastes really pretty authentic, and it is reasonably priced.
great environment and music. service was also good. we ordered a soups and ramen, and they were  good. the ramen i ordered was very korean, just like xin ramen.
Great BBQ here!!! Some of servers looked unhappy but I'll go back to Gangnam Asian BBQ again soon
Really cool concept.  We had a little bit of a wait but had the ice cream cookies which were great during the wait.  Definitely will visit again next time I go to Vegas
We were in town for the weekend and really enjoyed our time here!  Clean, good energy, great attentive staff and best of all, amazing food!

Had to try this place once I saw that it had more than 3000 good reviews. The last time I was here the wait time was more than 2 hours, so I had to pass on it, this time there was no wait time. Score! The food was really good but the service was above and beyond.  The waiter took his time to cook and cut up our meat, which was amazing bc we didn't even ask.  Everyone there was super friendly and attentive.  I would definitely come back again.
Came here with my fam, and we loved the bbq beef and spicy chicken! The food came really fast and we didn't really have to wait for a table.
The  was good and the service was great! Also love the music they play, it's a mix of Korean and American.
Great food and experience. Don't wear nice clothes though, you will smell like food when you leave.

Exceptional service and food!!! Will definitely come back when I am in Vegas again!! Went to happy hour 3-6PM. All the meat tasted great, seaweed salad was yummy( with ponzu), the kimchee jigae was "OK" only... Oysters were delicious!!!! KOBE SSAM was awesome!!!!! Uni and Kobe are both nice combos. Much much love to this place!! Definitely recommend.

Awesome service! the food was far better than expected m for the price and we had the honor of being served by Alex, and want to i've him a quick shoutout for the awesome service! thank you taeyang:):)
The meat quality is good and the service is decent.  The steamed egg is bit overcooked.  Other than that the overall experience is great.

A Korean BBQ first for us and if we get back the LV it won't be our last. Loved the beef and spicy chicken as well as all the little side dishes. 

It must be authentic as every other party there included Asians (guessing Koreans).

One of the best ever.
Koreansk bbq  er bare helt nydelig. Kj√∏rte Las Vegas og det var akkurat passe mat for to sultne nordmenn
We got the #1 two people for $65, they are extremely friendly and helpful and allowed us to change items that would couldn't eat due to dietary restrictions. I would definitely come back!

First time here and it was a great change from the AYCE KBBQ norm here in Vegas! Came in during the happy hour which was from 3pm-6pm and was seated right away! We ordered the cream cheese wonton, fried calamari, (2) beef toro and (2) bulgogi. They also gave us the ban chan (side dishes) when you order a minimum of 2 BBQ dishes. The rice bowl portions are pretty hug so depending on how much meat you get I think one bowl can fit between you and another person. I love how it definitely fills up 2 people with less of a price than all you can eat KBBQ joints here in Vegas (Tofu Hut, Korean Garden BBQ). Overall great experience, will be coming back again soon!
The service here is great. The was good. Especially the bugolgi. Check this place out if you like Korean bbq
Not realistic with waiting times. They run the establishment like it's a club with folks that can pay their way through the waiting list
Three of us split the Gangham for 2 and were absolutely stuffed! Wonderful food, wonderful service, exactly what I wanted. 10/10

Most meat were over marinated, salty and loaded with MSG (except the pork toro and belly).  Meats are small portion and not of great quality as shown in the menu.
At almost $7, they serve you 5 dead fucking shrimp that's not fresh at all.  
$7 can get you a pound of good shrimp!!!!

"How the f they get 2280+ average 4 stars review then?"  they offer free desert if you write an review!

Amazing food, the pork toro and the scallop wrapped bacon here is the best.

It's a great place for late night munchies and the reverse happy hour makes this place more than affordable for the quality of the food you get in return. Most DEFINATELY would recommend 10/10
Delicious!!! Good food and great service!! Lots of sides, decent price.... Family friendly.. no wait...
The good was ok, I thought it was a little spendy  the service was very slow.  I wish they would bring everything out at one time.

I am satisfied. Coming from Chicago, we have a decent amount of Korean food/BBQ. I ordered the beef bibimbap and it was on par with what I've had before. My friend order the original bimbimbap, and it looks awesome as well. The order came with the standard appetizer dishes, which all tasted great. I would recommend this place to anyone with a craving for Korean food.

Really awesome BBQ place with tons and tons of options. The long wait is well worth it (up to 90mins+) It's not just Korean bbq but much more because of the price. Super affordable, which allows you to enjoy more things. But know that those "things" are tiny hehe. Lots of side dishes and small portions. Highly recommend!
Great quality of meats! Service is really good. Hostess and Wait Staff very attentive! Can't wait to go back

Super delicious and would most likely come back again. I would so recommend everyone who's craving korean barbeque to head out here and eat. They are super attentive and even though we had a party of 14, their service continued to be great. Love this place, food, and the people who served us. Would come here everyday if I could.

This place is a hidden gem! The food is top notch. Remember to cook a single piece of meat at a time so that each bite and be fresh off the grill and perfect in taste and texture. 

Try to see if you can get Kristin as your server and ask her about her dessert specials! ;)
Best Korean I've had and it's not even close. Got bulgogi and marinated short ribs. Also you get many complimentary side dishes for free.

Being from Melbourne, kbbq is a staple of anyone's diet. Gangnam really hit the spot. The Kalbi was delectable and tasty, kobe was well marbled and melted in your mouth. I think to take it up another level, you could have them cook it for you, something done in Melbourne, but maybe that's just asking too much!

One of the better meals on my tour around the US. Will let you know how it compares to gyu-kaku in LA.

Maybe we are spoiled by LA K-town selection - but we thought this place was really only ok.  Decent meat quality, but nothing to get excited about.  Too long of a wait for the food to be honest, but perhaps relatively speaking, very good KBBQ place for Vegas?  I suppose if you crave some KBBQ might be worth while, but with the price and no AYCE hmm... yeah, wasn't too memorable or fun.  We completely smelled of meat though, so don't wear anything fancy.

So glad we decided to eat here instead of some overpriced place on the strip lmao. Really good variety of meats for the bbq, awesome side dishes. I couldn't find a single thing I didn't like. There was a bit of a wait, but the staff was friendly and helpful, so that more than make up for it. Do yourself a favor and try this place! I would definitely go again.

I usually cringe at the cost of a restaurant where you cook your own food but Gangnam is surprisingly affordable, especially if you take my advice and order the combos for your group. The menu says they are for 2 people but we had a group of 4 and the combo filled us all.  You can always add one or two items a la carte if you are still hungry.

The meat is surprisingly well marbled and tender and fresh.  The sauces are perfect compliments to the meet.

I thought the salad was a little bit of an afterthought as it was mostly lettuce but we still ate it.
Our favorite was the bulgogi bibambap.

The service felt a little off as they had a difficult time understanding and we were very conscious that they were watching us the whole time.  I understand it is your job to clear our table as we finish a plate but there are ways to be less intrusive about it. Also, they were fixing a light in the restaurant while we were all there.  Still, this place is very enjoyable and reasonably priced.

Date :6/20/17
Day: Tuesday
Time: late evening 

The set up of the restaurant is very much the same as gyukaku BBQ. The way to order food, grill, dishes, and similar atmospheres. The server we had was wonderful and accommodating as we arrived for a late dinner 9:30ish. At that time, the restaurant is very packed for a late evening on a week day. I would call in for a reservation to be safe. Happy hour starts at 10pm, therefore we ask the server for the happy hour menu ahead of the time. We then placed items that was not on the happy hour to get started and later order happy hour when 10pm roll around. They there generous with the side dishes, food portions are decent, and most of all we were surprised at the final bill that came up to approx $176 including tips. The total was half the price we normally pay for gyukaku in NYC for a party of 6. That night we have a party of 8. I would come again for sure!
This is my favorite Korean restaurant in the Las Vegas area. I always tell my friends about it. We got the combo meat lovers plate as well as a bowl of soup. Everything tasted great!

Love this place for my Korean food fix. Very tasty bites weather you are ordering a set meal for the grill or a la carte. I'm always looking for spicy soft tofu soup and this by far is my favorite. The service is always quick and a friendly staff.

Save room for dessert they have a nice selection of ice cream macaroons!
Very good Korean style BBQ. I like the spicy pork and Kobe style beef. Juicy and fresh.

This place does happy hour on food 7 days a week! Til 5pm then 10-2am.  Really yummy, clean and nice. I don't feel uncomfortable for being a white girl at Korean BBQ like I do at other joints in town. Really friendly guy waiter every time I come here late night. Sapporo on draft too!
Everyone was incredibly nice, friendly and helpful. My 16 year old said the music was really good (and she never says that). Lots of options on the menu. Get the bop. So good
Quality cuts of meat and fresh vegetables. We ordered the bulgogi, pork belly, mushrooms, and broccoli all at happy hour prices. It was delicious, and we will be returning again.
Came here for the second time and fell in love with this place again. The staff is nice and friendly and the side dishes are amazing.
Traditional Bibimbap is quite delicious.  Service was great too. If you want something off the strip that is worth checking out, I'd recommend this

In Vegas figuring out what we should have for dinner and started looking through Yelp and found this place. We went In for dinner and this place smelled so good. 

We ordered the meat lovers package and it was AMAZING! Everything was fresh and the presentation was beautiful! The staff was very attentive and friendly. 
We left full and Happy and definitely be back when we are in Vegas.  The best Korean BBQ We've ever had and THUMBS UP from all 10 of us that was there!!

Got the meat lover special today. Soooooooooo goooood! My favorite part was the filet mignon  it was so juicy, tender, and flavorful! I couldn't get enough! The sides are of course important as well! Kimchi, bean sprouts, cucumbers, fish cake, macaroni salad, and squid! One of he best things, the fresh oysterssss!!!! My absolute favorite part of the meal! I would come back here in an instant if I wasn't so full from this amazing food!

Excellent food with great service that's near the strip. Although a Korean BBQ, this place is also great for pescatarian and vegetarians as well.  What's great about this place is that it's not saturated with tourists. I highly recommend!
First time having Korean BBQ, really enjoyed it! Wonderful selection, great service and yummy food. Very highly recommend!!!

I don't know much about Korean food scene in Las Vegas. Coming from SoCal, I'm relatively spoiled. The meats here are just average. Likewise for the side dishes. I like that the restaurant is spacious, grilling tables are probably the largest I've ever seen.
Food was great especially the Bulgogi and the jalape√±o poppers.  Service was good and the 1/2 off Sapporo beer at happy hour was a bargain.  We will be back.

We've been here twice now and both times it's been great. The meat is marinated perfectly and if you get the "Gangnam" choose the bibimbap because that crispy rice is the shit! The grills are clean and cook the meat just to our liking. If you stop by late go for the happy hour for some cheaper appetizers and drinks to go with your meal. Great spot for a group or just a cute date to burn your food while you make out. You decide!

Great food, excellent service, and a very amicable and welcoming environment that makes me want more. I highly advise anyone into Korean/Japanese style cuisine with a modern twist to come here and try it out
Loved this place.  We did have to wait to get in on a Saturday night, but it was well worth it.  We ate so much food and it wasn't too pricey.  It was definitely a good value.

Best KBBQ in town, I'm always so stuffed when I leave. Cow tongue, Bulgolgi, Kalbi...all SO delicious. Great prices and love the amazing service. Always so friendly and swift service.
Recommended!
Good food, good service, clean facility, and no long wait! Meat was very tender. Must try steamed egg!
Food was excellent.  I did not expect korean food of this quality in Las Vegas.  Their appetizers are plentiful and the 7 of us ordered the premium for 6 people

This was our first time at this restaurant, and we were quite pleased.  The food was great and everything was very tasty.  Our waiter was also very nice, helpful, and accommodating.  I would definitely recommend GangNam and we will come here again when we are back in Las Vegas.

I love Korean bbq and decided to give this place a try based on reviews and the fact that it wasn't far from my hotel. 
We had the Gangnam and we replaced the oysters with steamed egg. The steam egg was dry. The extras all come out with no explanation of what was what same with the sauce. When the meat came out there was again no explanation of what meat was what. Our server stopped by once just as we were finishing to drop off our bill and turned the burner on high rather than off... luckily another server noticed within a minute or two. 
Will not be going back! If you're looking for a good Korean BBQ place go to Hobak, it's worth the drive

First meal in Las Vegas!
We ordered beef tongue, Kobe beef, mushroom medley, Korean premium galbi, spicy tofu. Everything is awesome! Even better than bbq in korean!
Good service!
Had the barbecue and soup, it was excellent and worth the wait for a table. Place is  packed on a Sunday night and I see why! Highly recommended......

Service was so slow. We had THREE refills on the complimentary dishes before our meats were even served. Got full on kimchi and radish. This place was greatly understaffed. We asked the server where the oysters were from and she wasn't able to tell us the species and only that they were the "typical ones you  buy in market." They ended up tasting very fishy and not fresh. Disappointed. Filled up on calories but not satisfied.

Just ate here after searched reviews in Yelp. Ordered the Gangnan grill combo, best Korean BBQ we ever had. We also order some noodles, pretty good too.
The service is excellent too. Highly recommended.

Gangnam is a pretty good place to go if your looking for a fusion of Korean and Japanese BBQ. I'm a big fan of the both so when I saw there was a restaurant incorporating the two I had to try it. Plus seeing has 4 1/2 that made me feel sure the food might be good. I ordered the special combo for 2 people. Lots of good choices and the price was good for the amount you get. The miso and sides were yum and the meats well marinated. Definitely would come back!  It was a good place to end an EDC weekend meal:)
Awesome food with great service!   Great pre-concert dinner.  We ordered the Meat Lovers and it plenty for four.   Delicious and a lot of fun cooking with family!

I have to explain first hand why this place gets a one star.  It's not like this place deserves a low rating and that you better stay away at all costs but having relied on yelp ratings for my first two Korean BBQ meals here in Vegas for Magal and Hobak (both with 4.5 stars with hundreds of reviews) I thought for sure this place must be just as good with 4.5 stars with thousands of reviews.  So with the bar being set from my experience at Magal and Hobak, these are the the things that fall short here.

Service - It's not like it was bad.  It was attentive enough but here you have to do all the grilling yourself.  This was the major disappointment for me when I found out I had to do my own cooking.  Heck I would have stayed home if I had to do my own cooking.

Price - I was able to feed my family of four for $100 at Hobak.  Here it started at $120.  Here the steamed egg side dish was extra and so was dessert.  Both of these were included at the other two.  If you checked in Yelp here you were offered a free macaron ice cream sandwich.  We shared this one macaron amongst the four of us each taking a small bite LOL.

Food - Maybe I overcooked the food or something but the food just didn't seem to taste as good and the beef cuts were just not as premium as the other places.  I think you can order more premium cuts but you had to pay more for it which I guess would fall into price and value just not as good as the others.  I really didn't care for the mushroom medley or the jalape√±o peppers that were provided as part of the Gangnam combo.

So with the bar being set with the other two who are at 4.5 stars, Gangnam just doesn't come close so that's why for me it's at the other end of the spectrum.  Maybe I had high expectations going in but we came away very disappointed.
Third visit here. Attentive, wonderful staff and the most mind blowing bulging and tuna kimbap!

We came during happy hour which was a good idea. Everything is fairly cheap and quite delicious. We hd the Beef Toro, Bulgogi, and Korean Chicken Fondue. The dipping sauce is what gave the food so much flavor. Also comes with the sides to include cucumber kimchee, kimchee, macaroni salad and bamboo shoots. Also when you review the restaurant it comes with free dessert! Choices are banana tempura or a macaroon!
Best Korean bbq i have had in vegas. The meat is very flavorful. I highly recommend this place.
Stopped by here for our last meal before leaving Vegas, awesome Korean Bbq with a large variety of meats.

Great, quick service! Nice staff and tasty food! There were 6 of us that ate here and the meat was able to fill us all and also was able to satisfy us. It's close to UNLV, so I'll plan on coming here if I get super hungry again. The food was served nicely and the presentation of the food was amazing, and the ambiance is great. Highly recommended for friends and family :-)

Great food. Came with 3 people and ordered the meat lovers option for 2. Definitely a lot of food. Wasn't able to finish it all. The cuts of meat were pretty good quality. Will definitely be coming back again.
Meat is fresh but not taste special! Big table space, that's pleasant! Ice cream is good
Got the Gangnam combo for two and it filled up the whole family! Food was delicious and service was fast.

This place is a smaller less expensive version of the Gyu-Kaku chain. What really pushed this experience from a four star to a three star was the service...as much as I hate to say it. 

We were greeted and seated fairly quickly. We came around 11 pm. We noticed after we ordered everyone got a small green menu (the happy hour menu) that we did not receive. Their happy hour starts at 10pm. One of our drinks came without a straw. (not a big deal...but just careless). Had to ask twice for a refill for water when our cups were completely empty...not even any ice left. 

We ordered the garlic shrimp (two orders). This item was really delicious! Probably the best thing we tried. The steamed egg is a HUGE portion. It was good but a little bit salty. The spicy lemon chicken was good...didn't taste like lemon at all. In the picture it looked like the lemon sauce was going to come on the side...which we did not get. Seaweed salad was about average. Pork belly was good. Asparagus was really yummy. I would recommend that. 

Never asked us if we want dessert, just silently dropped off the bill. Service wasn't that bad but little things make a big difference. I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend this place. Theres better options in Vegas, but this place is open late and in a good location with tons of parking. The food is decent as well.
Food was amazing!!! More food than we knew what to do with! Lychee cocktail was also very nice!
First place to eat on our first visit to Las Vegas :) Got Gangnam combo for 4 people. Taste so great! Love it! ;)
BEST reverse happy hour for Asian BBQ in Vegas!  We will definitely be returning. I'm already addicted.

First time we have ever eaten Korean bbq.   There were 4 of us so we order3d the Gangnam plate for 4.  OMG the food was a lot and very good.  The service was good and friendly.   After they realized we didn't know what we were doing they came over and helped.  It was a unique dining experience cooking the meat at the table 
.  Experimenting with different sauces and trying new foods. Highly recommend for the adventurous.
Amazing food and a great experience.  We ordered three meat options, a starter and a vegetable. Delicious and top notch.

This place was wonderful and hit the spot just perfectly .  The desert was so good I had the banana tempura . The bacon wrapped asparagus was yummy and would recommend a marinated meat . Visiting from San Diego

Kangnam was recommended highly by one of my friend who is also a chef with exquisite taste buds.  So my expectations were high to begin with, but we were on our way back from Los Angeles dining at best Korean restaurants, so Kangnam could have been at a big disadvantage. 

Nonetheless, hands-down best BBQ as well as other foods!  You can truly expect top quality meats, sauces,  foods as well as exceptional service by best looking staff!  

We went there after 2 weeks long road trip with toddlers.  As soon as we walked in my sons were acting up from being cooped in the car all day.  The staff promptly sat us in a private room so we were able to dine without worrying about interrupting other guests. Huge kudos to them since it was Friday night and place was packed.  

Then one of my sons threw up all over me!  and again the staff immediately came with napkins and made sure we were ok.  Super attentive and kind folks!

During our meal I think staff rotated and quietly checked up on us dozen times.  Just making sure we had everything but without interrupting our meal.  

The night started out rough, chaotic with kids and vomit but we all left the restaurant stuffed and extremely satisfied.  I would give them more than 5 stars if there was an option!  This place triumph the best Los Angeles Korean places we visited by quality of food and service!
Nice service, the interior decoration feels like korean style, the food look very good and fresh.
This place deserves all the accolades they receive. Food was excellent, staff was awesome and friendly. It's a nice and warming atmosphere.
Good food, a lot of food too, the fried rice and miso was amazing! Some of the meat didn't have much flavor. Depends of your preference. Service was great! I recommend trying this place out!!
Would definitely recommend the combo choices. The meat was fresh and well marinated. The service was very friendly.

The best KBBQ in Vegas. Literally my first stop every time I visit Las Vegas. 

The portion size is quite large for kbbq. You really get the most for your money here. The grill isn't sticky like other places I've been and it isn't smokey. 

My favorite dish is the Korean galbi. It's not too salty and has a nice marbling of fat without being fatty. The combination of sweet meats with enoki mushrooms coupled with a sweet onion and perfectly steamed rice keeps me coming back time and time again. 

When you've had enough of the overpriced food from the overhyped restaurants on the strip, hop over to gangnam for a great meal the whole family will enjoy at a price that will keep you at the poker table a little longer.

Great food and service.  

Make sure you don't mind smelling like barbecue when you leave.   You will be Grilling your food.  
They will bring your choice of meat.   All choices are excellent.   
Banana tempurA for desert a no fail choice.

Got the meat lovers combo for 2, and it was A LOT of food. I can eat a ton and it still could've easily fed 3 or 4 people with all the sides and included appetizers. It was all also really good quality -- the toro and steaks being my favorites.

We came to gangnam based on a recommendation, and it was a fairly satisfying experience. 10:00 pm is when happy hour began, so we got here as soon as it started. After being seated instantly, we ordered their bulgogi, pork belly, Korean chicken cheese fondue, spicy pork, and bibimbap, and frankly, everything was as delicious as it was juicy, fresh, and tender. The staff was prompt with their service, and was constantly helping us, but not many people were here at 10, so it may not be the same when they're busy. In terms of value from a kbbq place, the pricing and quantity is decent, but I'd recommend an all you can eat restaurant in case you're a big eater. 
Disclaimer: this review is in no way biased because of the free desert you get for reviewing this place.

Yummy food and great service. Webcam as a group and surprised there is big enough table cooking table for all of us. Very comfortable seating and friendly service. Will definitely come back the next time we visit!

We ordered the galbi, brisket, pork belly, and kobe style beef for kbbq. We enjoyed it all, but the brisket was big pieces where I am accustomed to shorter cut ones. We also ordered the wonton that I would not recommend. They come in decent quantity, but I would try something else. Wings were good and I'd get them again. Lastly, they have an assortment of sauces. I like them, but I still prefer my sesame oil and salt. I also ordered green tea to expect fresh green tea, but got a canned version that wasn't too bad either.
Atmosphere is amazing! Our server was the best! Prices are defiantly reasonable compared to everything else and food was to die for  ... Defiantly will be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.
Beef tongue is awesome. marinated prime beef is really good as well. Spicy tofu soup is one of my favorite as well.

It's hard being from LA and trying a Korean bbq outside of Korea town so Gangnam starts at a disadvantage.  First the good:   Fantastic seaweed salad and a very presentable mixed greens salad.  The spicy chicken wings are fantastic.  The sauces are a nice touch. Also the make waiter is great (female not too friendly).  The place seems clean and inviting.  I like the squid banchan but not as good as my daughter's  We got the 4 person meat lover.  It was the size we are used to for two people.  The brisket was tough and the shoulder was good.  The filet was flavorful but a little tough.  The banchan was generous. The pork belly is the thin type which is fine with me because I like it crispy. Asahi dark is a good compliment.  Dweji bul gogi is nice and tender and just the right spice.  Overall a very nice experience

I really wish it wasn't the holiday season so we could have tried out the lunch specials. Oh well, our loss. On that note: Lunch specials aren't available during the holidays!

Our last meal in Las Vegas was supposed to be Korean bbq. Instead, since we don't eat beef and the bbq options fed 4-6 people, we ordered a-la-cart. No regrets, the food was still delicious! We got an order of the spicy seafood ramen and kimchee bibimbap. I can handle spicy foods really well and enjoy my mouth on fire, but the *spicy* in spicy seafood ramen was no joke! However, the spiciness did not overpower the flavor of the broth. The kimchee bibimbap was amazing! I was happy to see it served in a stone pot to keep the temperatures piping hot. Servings were huge for such a reasonable price. Shout out to the sweetest hostess around too! She gave my mom suggestions on Korean beauty products and tended to us when the waiter was busy with other customers.

Went here for dinner tonight. Since I was alone, they asked me if I would like to sit at the bar and like a fool I said Yes, not realizing that it meant not getting to grill my own meat. Oh Well... You live, you learn.(I wish they had told me that though).

They started me off with a plethora of side dishes and accompaniments which all eventually went really well with the meats and a bowl of white rice; everything except a random macaroni salad that is which I didn't quite understand being there. 
I ordered the Kobe Beef which was the main reason I went here and the Garlic Calamari which they recommended. They serve 6 pieces of beef and some sea salt which you absolutely must sprinkle on. It enhances the flavor exponentially. This was my first time eating Kobe Beef and I now understand what all the hype is about. It was just juicy, so flavorful, so amazingly tender. Without a shadow of a  doubt the best quality beef I've ever had.  They did overcook it a tad and it was medium-well which is maybe how they do it, but for such a cut I would most certainly have preferred a mid-rare. Very highly recommended, even though it's ridiculously pricey.
The Garlic Calamari was a huge fail. They were cooked well and tender but had no flavor at all and I had to douse them in hot sauce and soy to finish them.

Overall this was an awesome meal. I would definitely love to go back here and try some more cuts and also grill them myself this time by getting a table instead of sitting at the bar. It's actually pretty reasonable(except the Kobe obviously) considering how much meat they serve. Definitely recommended.
This place has plenty of food and is a great value. Meats are delicious and aides wonderful. Happy hour is also great and available all week! Definitely coming back.

Wow! If you're ever in Vegas, you must eat here. We just landed and was hungry for some good food. Found them on Yelp-  thanks to all of the great reviews and then we saw the happy hour deal.. We rushed over here. Glad we did. Fast friendly service and cool atmosphere. Food was delish. You can order from the kitchen and cook your own food.

The odds are 100% you will love this fine authentic Korean restaurant. My wife and I have had great Korean in NYC where we live....now we have to come to Vegas to get the BEST! I promise you will not be disappointed!

Our favorite korean bbq restaurant in town! All the servers are very attentive, not once have we ever got bad service! Last time we were here we came in a big group (11 people) and the server even remember us a week after! Would definitely come back and refer to friends!
It is a good place and it has very delicious food there?Bibimbap tastes really good?what I love most is the Beef and pork BBQ?the waiter and waitress are nice and cute
Very good Korean BBQ. Much better service, shorter wait time than restaurants on the strip and more importantly better food. Would definitely come back.
Food was good. They have different bbq set to suit different lovers. Most importantly,  they have excellent service.
This is currently my favorite restaurant IN THE WHOLE WORLD! Haha. And I'm not even joking. I seriously spent 10 minutes contemplating and analyzing to come to this final conclusion.

This place always has good food, and it's a classier place to eat if you're going to be near UNLV. They don't have an AYCE option, but everything is reasonably priced. At a table with four of us in total, we ordered the following:

Steamed chili dumplings
Peach saketini
Fried meat dumplings
Miso soup        
Fried calamari w/spicy sauce
Fresh oysters
Prime kalbi (short rib without bone)
Beef Toro (brisket) 
Kobe style beef
Salmon Basil
Green tea cheesecake

You can also either choose to grill the food yourself or ask your server to have it cooked before bringing it to your table.

The food here is great quality and you get a ton of food for your money.  I recommend the set meals with a group of four or more since it comes with appetizers and entrees.  We shared a meal for two and it fed four people!  Great place for group dining and happy hour!  Staples include the pork belly, brisket and kalbi to name a few must haves.  I like mixing it up when I go to gangnam especially during their happy hour after 10 pm.  Make sure to try the broccoli fondue, sweet corn and mushroom medley.  Only issue is the ventilation as I always leave gangnam with a smokey odor on my clothes.  Desserts are quite delicious so make sure to save some room for the decent variety.  Easy location to reach if you're near the strip as it's located across from the hard rock hotel.  Plenty of parking in the shopping center which has many places to check out.
Food was good! Service my awesome. The jalapeno poppers with salmon was great! Would love to have it again.
Best customer service. Very accommodating and thoughtful. Food is so good! Service is fast

The meats are great and flavorful. The cold noodles and the tofu soup are also really nice. I would recommend it based on the quality of the food. Prices are average but not more expensive than the rest of the city. Maybe lunch specials would be nice as well.

First time doing Asian BBQ and we're definitely not disappointed! Started off with the calimari and wontons which are probably the best wontons I've had. The chicken fried rice has huge chunks of chicken which was nice to see. 

Thanks to the happy hour menu we tried the Bulgogi which was marinated to perfection and the waiter helped us cook it. Also had the garlic shrimp which was good. I've always been nervous about he little side dishes you receive but everything was so good! Minus the pasta salad thing which didn't seem to fit.

Probably the most perfect end to our Vegas vacation!
________________________________________________

After submitting my review we were ignored for a good half hour. Our waiter was too busy being FED by a friend across the restaurant. Really? I get if you're friends come in to eat and you want to say hi or chit chat for a few minutes, but to completely abandon your table? That's rediculous. Actually nobody checked on us during that time, we had to flag a waitress down who really didn't seem to care. Finally a second waitress stopped by and asked how we were doing. They were having a promotion if you wrote a Yelp review your got a free dessert, so we showed our reviews and then waited and waited and waited for dessert. The waitress was very apologetic and even gave us macaroon ice cream for free, on top of our 2 free desserts. The only reason this isn't a 1 star reviews is because the food was amazing and the last waitress to help us was very nice and helpful.
Good foods!  Love kobe beef. The server is great and entertaining.  Definitely will come back for more.

A Vegas staple.  I've been here about 30 times, the galbi is best because they remove it from the bone. This is the best Korean bbq you will find...if you are looking to get a tattoo and your nails done on either side of the location.  I like the constant stream of K-pop and gangsta rap.

Get the Korean galbi and don't forget the enoki mushrooms.
Very delicious. Great guality, really enjoyed the experience. The gentlemen server was very patient and nice. Would definitely come back.
Delicious korean bbq! Recommend the korean prime galbi and bulgogi. Service was good and the restaurant is clean. The ingredients are fresh. Will come again the next time we're in Vegas.
Very pleasant experience . Good customer service, good food and very good price ..if ur in Vegas and in the mood for Korean bbq , check this place out .
We were skeptical about Korean bbq in Vegas.....   we were pleasantly surprised!!  Great food l, great service!!  Would definitely go back again!!

So...i have been here several times over the past few years. I come twice a year during my trade shows.  I love Korean food, and I consider myself a self proclaimed Korean food snob. This place is good, really good. Yes, the food is delicious and the prices are beyond fair. But what makes this place so good is the service. Always quick, very attentive, very courteous and very helpful.  Bravo to the owner who understands that customer service is key the success of any business. Also, I am not Korean and I am usually one of a few Caucasians in the restaurant when I am here. It is usually filled with young Asians...which tells me it is authentic food and reasonably priced, assuming the younger generation doesn't yet have oodles of money to spend on dining out. You won't go wrong here...promise.

Amazing service! 
The happy hour phenomenal!!! $3/$4 meats, 1/2 off drinks and more. Everything on happy hour is $2-4!
The service was perfect and the food was perfect as well. 
Will definitely go back for my next Vegas adventure!
Very good service and food. We recommend the filet mignon and the miso beef. The sukiyaki veggie noodles are delicious as well! Enjoy

We came here for a late lunch on Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised by how quick and efficient the service was. The marinated kalbi was perfect and the portions were decently generous. The only issue was the side dishes, which I didn't think were great. Most of the pickled items seemed a little dry, and the overall selection/variety of the banchan was mediocre. I guess I'm used to Korea, where the side dishes are as important as part of the meal. I was also not impressed with the chicken karaage which they used chicken breast for (made it dry).

Upsold and undercut!!! Came in with a large party and was seated in a private room in the back. Our server told us a family style meal would be a great fit for us and it is "a lot of food" and you get everything included three times. It was not enough food, and we did NOT get three servings. They turned off our grills and we never saw our third round. When we asked where it was they told us "that was three rounds split over two plates." WHAT?! Absolutely not. They didn't even offer or suggest purchasing more plates. I came ready to eat and left HUNGRY. We paid more than what we would have paid for an AYCE place and didn't even get a fraction of the amount of food or service. Our drinks were constantly empty and because of our fancy private room getting the servers attention was a struggle. Nice tasting bulgolgi, but their other meats are too thick and really fatty. Hit up anything on Spring Mountain for quality, quantity, and if you want to have money left over. Will not return. Do not recommend.

This is how Korean BBQ is meant to be. 

Hidden behind the Strip, in the heart of Vegas, is the best Korean BBQ in the area. As soon as you walk through the doors, the wonderful aroma of charred marinated meat will tell you, you're in the right place. 

Me and a friend came here and between the two of us, we went with the "Gangnam" set which includes a soup, rice, side dishes, and a variety of meats. Don't let anyone tell you the filet is the best, or the miso is the best... Hands down, the prime rib galbi is worth a second dish - and that's exactly what we ordered. 

Oh yeah and we're writing this for the free ice cream macaroon :)
Great foods and great service . Drive 5 hours from AZ. This a great foods to help me recover.

Second time eating here and second time ordering the Original Bimbibap. The first time it was great. Second time it wasn't served in the bowl (weird) there was no crunchy rice (no joy) and in fact the rice seemed very wet and tasted watery (I didn't know that was possible). They would have only been given two stars off of this plate but I am factoring my first meal there so I'm averaging it at three. Also I have a food allergy so the waitress was suppose to check if I could eat the side dishes they provide but she "forgot" to come back and tell me if I could eat them or not  which though may be an honest mistake sucks for this customer supporting the two star experience of the night.
Really tasty and fun.  Cook yourself,  very reasonably priced and a bunch of authentic Korean side dishes.
Great expereince, good eats, fast and excellent customer service, friendly staff, all the food was amazing will be back soon
Best Korean barbecue place in Vegas! Bulgogi beef is a must to order, pork belly and Korean chicken cheese fondue is my next best favorite!

The meat was very good! The portions were big enough to fill up to 13 people and the service was great. They always fill up your water which is always nice. Don't forget to check in to receive your free macaron!
Good panchans. Great sauces. Lots of variety. Fresh fish. Clean decor and good ventilation. Non charcoal grill. No ayce option.
So yummy and fresh! Great service and excellent prime meat. Had a great time catching up with family in a kid friendly environment.

I seriously NEVER give 5 stars but I'm giving one today. I'm from out of town and based on the reviews, my family and I decided to eat here for dinner. The food was AMAZING. The service was AMAZING. UGH the best experience ever. 

FOOD:
MEAT: We ordered two types of meats: tenderloin and the galbi. You cook it yourself over the grill korean bbq style. The meat is honestly the best I've ever had. Quality was amazing, so juicy and tender. I'll be dreaming about this places meat forever. Definitely recommend ordering meat. The price was great for the amount given and quality. My brother (who was fairly hungry) was about to finish and feel perfectly satisfied.

SOUPS: my mom ordered the spicy tofu soup. ($9.50 I think). She said it was salty (it kind of was) but the flavor was SO GOOD. Had tons of seafood and a nice smokyish flavor. They give you white rice to eat it with to help with the saltiness. I 

I ordered the Yuke Jang ($9.50) which is a spicy beef soup with clear noodles. It was okay. It was not salty but spicy. I kind of wish there was a more depth in flavor. I would skip this dish. 

RICE: my dad ordered the original bibimbap ($12.50). I didn't get to try this one but this bowl is huge and my dad finished it all and said was good.

SERVICE: so fast and attentive. Usually I have a problem with places not being attentive and being slow to bring the checks and stuff. This was not the case here. 

Make sure to check in on Yelp to get the free macaroon ice cream!
This is the first time we've tried this place. And so far I'm really amazed. The service was awesome. The food was delicious.... And don't can't forget the amazing macaroon ice cream

Ordered set meal for two at $55. Meats were well marinated, tender and good quality. Big portions too! Variety of korean side dishes were excellent as well.  Great food and great service. If/when my family and I visit here again from DC we'll definitely come here again.

We've never trier KBBQ in Las Vegas, so this is a first. The restaurant is in a plaza surrounded with other restaurants as well. Its nice and the staff were friendly. The food is good but can be a bit pricey.
Really don't get why this place has 4.5 rating. i have given it a second chance, but service was terribly slow and meat wasnt even good. Free dessert if you yelp though.

Great lunch special that enabled us to taste several types of meat, appetizers and vegetables at a very reasonable price. Great flavor - - - especially the marinated beef. Very friendly and helpful staff.

This is by far my favorite KBBQ spot. My fianc√© and I came in around dinner time expecting to wait for a table, but we were seated right away. From there we received excellent service and food. The bulgogi was the best I've ever had. It was marinated perfectly! They also had a good variety of banchan. I liked how the servers were quick to change our grills. Always a plus!

Okay, so when you see a 4.5 Star rating with over 3,000 reviews, you can be a bit skeptical.   But I am no longer that!  What a great place!  Great food, excellent service, and a really nice atmosphere.  Quality of the ingredients is very impressive and portions size are thoughtful.

We'll absolutely be back!

Will never go to all you can eat KBBQ again. The meat and even the side dishes are much better quality than any all you can eat joint here in Vegas. Service was very nice and attentive. Plus if you post a review you get a free dessert

This is PERFECT for all of you that do not want AYCE KBBQ. There aren't many of you, but if you're like, who really can't eat all that much in one sitting, it's excellent. Come during happy hour (1130am-5pm and then again after 10pm) and it'll be better bang for your buck.

We didn't eat much and was still really content and full (for me, at least). We only got short ribs, which they do remove the bones for you so it's just all meat. Then, we got beef brisket, which is pretty typical, as well as 2 orders of pork belly. I'm sad no tripe but I'll live. There are a lot of other things on the menu but I'm not a fan of marinated meat at KBBQs.

During my second visit, I got pork cheek, which was my first time eating it so I'm not sure how I feel about it yet... I wouldn't say everything is awesome-tasting but it's not too bad.

They've got a small selection of desserts but we only got ice cream ($1.95). Flavors: vanilla, green tea, and strawberry. It's a good portion size.

I doubt I'll come when it's not happy hour so there you go. But if you're in the area during happy hour, why not?

I recently went here for a birthday dinner. We arrived around 5PM and the restaurant was only maybe 1/3 full.

We decided to order the Gangnam special for 4 people. The meal included salad, raw oysters, shishito peppers, corn, mushrooms, miso soup, several kinds of meat, and bulgogi bibimbop. There was also the standard kimchi and other appetizers you get at almost every Korean restaurant. We were there for Happy Hour so we also got a pitcher of beer for half-off.

Overall, everything tasted fairly standard to me. Nothing really stood out as amazing. I felt the salad lacked much flavor at all and the miso was just standard miso. The bibimbap had no chili paste or veggies and was pre-made when it arrived. It was more like just straight Korea style fried rice with some bulgogi inside.

I guess having been to Korea, nothing ever is quite the same; however, I have had other places that are much better than Gangnam. 

My biggest issue with the place was the speed in which they serve you. It was way too fast! Within minutes of ordering you have everything you ordered on the table. We didn't have time to finish a single appetizer before the next thing came out. At one point our table was so full there was literally zero room for anything else. I really felt like they were just trying to rush us out. 

I have to say that I don't think I will return here next time I am in Vegas.
This is the best restaurant i have gone in Las Vegas. I really like their meats and the service

Very good K-BBQ spot. 

Would order every time:
Unmarinaded Kalbi-so tender and fatty, almost melts in your mouth
Beef Tongue-served with a lemon dipping sauce that really completes the dish 
King Oyster Mushroom-I love mushrooms, so this was a must for me

Would order again:
Marinated Kalbi-seasoned very well, beef is tender (I like the unmarinaded better just because you can the taste of their high quality beef isn't masked by the marinade)
Pork Belly-fairly standard K BBQ pork belly

Would skip:
Filet mignon: meat quality was just not that great
Macaroni banchan: this one we didn't order, just came with a bunch of other side dishes, but it was a really nasty macaroni salad that tasted like it was slathered in butter
Very decent BBQ! Everyone who is visiting Vegas and looking for Korean BBQ should try this place out!
Great Korean BBQ experience! I would definitely recommend the Bulgogi Bibumbap and the Meat Lover combo.

Favorite Korean bbq in our area hands down. Delicious meats and marinades. Love the ala carte option for quick lunches. Bigger group batches available. Gotta try the flat iron steak or anything with garlic. And you simply cannot best the price. Lovely quick service. Let's you eat in peace. I miss this place a heck of a lot.
Good spot for Korean BBQ! There menu is well sorted and affordable prices! Definitely this is going to be the spot!

Really really yummy Korean BBQ that you cook at your table. The side dishes were tasty and plentiful. Meat quality was excellent. Vegetables we ordered (mushrooms and asparagus) were already cooked when they brought it to our table, so that was nice. We went around 3, so not many people. Service was great. It's s little pricey by San Diego standards but probably on point for Vegas. It's right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel.
Awesome dinner. Got so much food for the money!  The dinner combo for 4 people left us stuffed.  Will come back again
THis was my first time having Korean BBQ. I don't like the flavor of garlic and Koreans love garlic. I ended up enjoying the place.
This is a great restaurant. We ordered the Las Vegas for 4 and it was so much food we couldn't finish it all, but it was really good. You really get more what you pay for in my opinion.

Wow!  Absolutely delicious!  All joking aside when people talk about cooking you're own food, but it's more like finding the exact combinations from bite to bite as your pallet changes.  I would equate it to changing colors in a painting to suit the needs of the scenery.  

Don't hesitate, look at the number of reviews, go in yourself, and give them 5 stats yourself.

Amazing sides.  Amazing meat. Grilled!

This place is great.   Two visits in my three day visits to Vegas.

Best KBBQ in town!
Ordered the bulgogi, beef toro, flat iron garlic and prime kalbi. My bf likes the pork belly and broccoli cheese fondue. First time here and didn't get to try any seafood. 
If I'm ever on this side of town again I'll definitely come back to try other things.
This is my gfs go to for KBBQ and I'm glad we came here for lunch!
Free dessert with review!!
Came during happy hour for the food. The portions were good and the food came out very quickly. Love Bulgogi and the seaweed salad. The mushroom medley was awesome too. Will definitely return!

Good food and great prices. Menu is interesting tried the spicy tuna kimbap very good. We had the seafood pancake which was not oily as it usually is. They use gas here and you are left to cook on your own. This is fine sometimes we want to do it ourselves sometimes we are lazy. The annoying thing about this place is the giant screen playing rap videos. I get it its Vegas, but at lunchtime it can be a little much.

So glad we decided to make a stop here for lunch. We were getting really tired of buffers and decided Korean would be a good option. One of the best Korean places ever. I always try finding a good Korean place everywhere I travel to. One of the best! The music is a little off and kind of kills the atmosphere as it is extremely loud and the music ranges from rap to random Christmas music. But will definitely come again.
Great food and service! The bibimbap comes in a hot clay pot and it's flat so it stays hot! They mix the ingredients right there! Talk about customer service!

I was craving Korean Bbq and decided to go off the strip for once while in Vegas to appease my appetite. I was not disappointed as we ordered their #1 seller - Gangnam for 2.  The highlight of the beef was the kalbi but the rest of the other meats were also favorable.  We definitely full with lots of leftovers for a late night snack later tonight.  We will be back next time we are in town!
Ordered the gangnam combo for 2 and it was extremely good! it was a lot better than I expected and I would definitely come back here again.

As far as Korean bbq places, this is probably not the best place. Meat is lacking in flavor and is pricey unless you come during happy hour. Better off going to AYCE at Tofu Hut and deal with the wait. It's also always strange to me when they don't give rice at start and you have to request it as extra.

Really good Asian style BBQ. I've been visiting this place three times in two days! The beef toro and pork toro is absolutely tasty. Also we ordered spicy beef soup and bibimbap are so good! We keep eating those stuff every time.

Went here yesterday for dinner with (6) guys and all had meat lover menu. All the food was excellent. Only thing we didn't like was that we had to cook it ourselves. My friend and I went back there today for lunch and we had the bugogi special for $5 and japchae for $10. Both were excellent. This time we were able to get the kitchen to cook food. Will go back here next time we visit Vegas. 

Here again yesterday for dinner and today for lunch. Still consistently excellent with generous portions. Will come here again with my friend before we depart LV next week.
Went here with some friends. Great service. I love this place. Look forward to coming here again!!!

It was ok food. Not as authentic as I would've liked. Marinades were on a bit sweet side and what's up with charging extra for rice and side dishes? Rice is the main dish and everything else is the sides...

This place is somehow in my bookmarks list. Someone recommended it to me in case I go to Vegas. We were supposed to go to a buffet at the strip (Caesar's), but the line was too long. Luckily we found this place! 

This isn't too far from the strip. It's located in a plaza and there's plenty of parking. We came around 10:40 pm and got seated in less than 10 minutes. We also got our food pretty quick after ordering. It took them 5-10 mins to get the main dishes and a total of  less than 30 mins for everything else. My only complaint is that the booth that we got (located on the right side) was very awkward to sit on for me. I'm a short Asian person. Anyone who's probably 6' and muscular/big build would sit comfortably in this booth. The seat is too far from the table. Other than this, everything is perfect. 

We ordered the Gangnam Combo and substituted the Green Salad and Koshitsu Pepper Yuzu for the Broccoli Cheese Fondue and Squash Tempura. The Broccoli is okay, not really mouthwatering. My favorites are the beef toro, Korean prime kalbi, 4 out of 8 of the banchans, Mushroom Medley, and the Oysters!!! The Oysters are definitely one of the best ones I've had. 

For dessert, we got the Mango Macaron Ice Cream and Tempura with Green Tea Ice Cream. Both free woot!

Overall, this competes with the Korean BBQ places in LA, but cheaper. Awesome!
We arrive after a very late flight and we were hungry.  Server was excellent and answered all questions.  The food was excellent and we left happy and full

Service was nice. Food also had a lot of flavor and good amount for the price. 

Ordered the bulgogi bibimbap and was very flavorful. Would definitely order again. 

Side dishes were also good, not too spicy. Finally, server was nice and got our order ready quickly.

Love this place, I took my friends and family here many times.  The food is amazing and is probably the best Korean bbq I've had in Vegas. The combo deals give you a lot of servings and it's very affordable.  The meats are marinated nicely and are delicious.

My friends and I opted out of the set menus because we wanted meats that weren't included. We ordered the harami miso, Korean prime Kalbi, pork belly, sweet corn, Kobe beef carpaccio, cream cheese wontons. I got the bulgogi bibimbap. Everything was so good!!! Definitely recommend the Korean prime Kalbi and harami miso tho. Sooo buttery. 

$8 for a pitcher of Sapporo during happy hour. Nice.

I came at 11:30, and the restaurant was quickly full at 12. Atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice. Beef carpaccio, spicy tuna bimbap, and harami miso are all very tasty. Definitely worth coming back again.

Overall 3.5 stars

Decor: 5/5
-The booths make the dining experience more private and intimate
-Plenty of seating for parties of almost any size

Service: 4.5/5
-Friendly service though sometimes hard to find someone bc they were so busy

Food: 2/5
-We considered the meal for 2 @ $45 but didn't like the pre-selection of appetizers and protein
-We ended up ordering: Chicken karaage, Fried calamari, Korean prime rib, Filet mignon, Beef toro, Bulgogi, Kimchi chigae
-I didn't really have any favorites to be honest. They all tastes alright. I would not recommend the chicken karaage as the slices of chicken were so thin the ratio of batter to chicken was disappointing
-All our dishes came to around $50 which wasn't too bad for korean bbq
-Check in for the free macaron ice cream sandwich
Absolutely amazing! One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas! The portions are HUGE, so come ready to eat your heart out!
Definitely coming back. Found this place on my family trip. Can't wait to bring my friends on my next trip to Vegas!

Talk about cream of the crop meats! This is my favorite food spot in Vegas aside from Bacchanal. This is pretty close to the strip. Be warned that there will almost be a pretty long wait, I feel like its always understaffed and there's this one younger guy who works his butt off. When we were there he answered phones, rang up customers, grabbed foods, bussed tables, changed out grills, he pretty much did everything. I felt bad for him because he really was working super hard. Anyways, the food here is AMAAZINGGG. I love their Hirami Miso, you must try it. Also their steamed eggs is out of control, like MASSIVE in size, it's an overflowing fluff when they bring it out. And it's not all fluffly and airy like most steamed eggs. This thing is dense and could be shared with 2-3 people even. I don't particularly care to get appetizers or other items aside from the meat here.

Came here because of the amazing yelp reviews and they were right! The portion was generous for 7 people and the food quality was pretty good! Over all, the service was great. Don't forget to yelp them for a free dessert! Love it! Highly recommend!

I tried this for the first time tonight. Food Is excellent and very nice staff. Prices are not bad and I had a great time eating here with my fiancee. Definitely try this place out if you love quality Korean bbq.
I was surprise that food was really good and priced well. The service was awesome! I will come back.

I love this food here! The meat is so good and it is the best place to eat in Las Vegas! The dessert is amazing! The bulgogi and the filet mignon are my favorite... Try the macaroon ice cream.. It is to die for
My son loves this place. Clean and really good food. Friendly, very attentive staff. Will definitely bring family and friends here. Superb
Recently got free side there's the extra star they were missing A+ if you want Loren BBQ Vegas doesn't have any really good ayce options but this is one of the best places to go.

Oh my gosh. This was heaven in my mouth. It's no wonder this place has such great reviews. The service was great, good atmosphere, amazing food and price is crazy cheap. We came here during happy hour but judging from the menu, the price would've still been great even if we didn't. The meat paired with the sauce was perfect. You also get a free macaroon ice cream if you check in on yelp and the ice cream was SO good! My boyfriend devoured it in seconds.
Bbq is great!!! Very fulfilling and nice ambience. Staff are friendly and the food is delicious

Trying a new Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas.  We've gone to Ginseng in the past, but it's gotten quite expensive, so we decided to try Gangnam off the strip.  The decor is modern and well laid out, esp. if your group is larger than 6-7.  Ginseng can be tight for bigger groups.  We ordered the "Meat Lover"s" for 6 people and added a couple of additional appetizers and dishes for our group of 7, and there was plenty of food.  Service was fast, friendly, and all of the dishes tasted excellent.  Well worth the trip off strip if you're in the mood for tasty Korean!
It was really good. Very reasonable price!! Side dishes are good. We ordered several plates and I recommend Korean pime Kalbi. It was very tender!
Great food, fun atmosphere, excellent value! Meat is excellent quality and sides are endless
We were able to modify our order with the dishes we wanted. Free macaron ice cream for checking in on Yelp. Friendly and patient staff with a first timer like me.
Awesome! So good. They were happy to work around my seafood allergy. The food is excellent and the staff is even better!
Lots of food...good for price. Way better than ayce places. 4 people and we shared a dinner for 2. If you write a review you get a free dessert. :-) we will be back.

I have tried many Korean BBQ places and I have to say this restaurant stands out the most! I have heard so many good things about Gangnam Asian BBQ and finally gave it a try tonight. The ambiance of the interior was really intimate and it was very clean. It really sets the mood for dates or whenever you're in the mood for binge eating KBBQ with your friends, which is what I did. 

The food was delicious! The meats were served fresh and presented nicely. What came to my surprise was that they served Thai Tea, which made my visit even more satisfying. We ordered the miso soup, pork belly, prime kalbi, bugolgi, the bacon wrapped enoki just to name a few and Yuuum! Belly was satisfied! What adds variety of flavor to your meat is the three different sauces they present you with. There is a vinegar like sauce, a sweet sauce, and a spicy sauce, which really gives you multiple choice on flavorings for your food.Of course trying their desserts was a must so I went for the banana tempura. This was so goood. The banana tempura was served hot off the frying pan and what helped balanced that out was the vanilla ice cream. It was a great ending to my meal. The prices overall are perfect for what they serve you.

All in all I have to say my visit was great! The owner even came out and checked on us. He was so friendly and he looked happy to see his customers. I will be coming back for more!
This is the best restaurant I Have eaten at in Las Vegas. I will be back!!!!! Get the premium cut it is worth it!

Food was delicious. Fuhhhhhh
They were really busy but they tried their best for better customer service
Service was exceptional. The menu is easy to discern to suit your individual taste. While I enjoyed the the food, atmosphere, and experience I wasn't as excited as other Yelpers.

Came here on a sunday at 12:30.  The staff got our food out quickly.  All the cuts were very good  (especially both prime kalbi dishes) as well as the sides, which you get complimentary when ordering at least two bbq dishes per person.  The precooked dishes and veggies were tasty also.

I do recommend coming as early as possible, as the restaurant gets filled quickly and the staff gets very busy servicing everyone.

Would come again!

We ordered the Meat Lover for 2 and it was filling and delicious. This was the first time we went to this restaurant and we will definitely be back when we are in the area. The atmosphere is amazing and the prices are reasonable

Actually the food was good but the service was very unfriendly. Especially female servers in the morning. It was really difficult to ask for something. I don't think I will go there again because of service.

Excellent!!! That would be the simplest way to describe this restaurant, passed it up because it was so busy at night but came back the next day for lunch and extremely happy that we came back to try it. Food comes quickly and each dish is delicious, staff works so fast and is very helpful. Do yourself the favor and try this place out.
Came during the happy hour and it was thebomb.com.  hella  cheap. We got close to 20 items.

We ordered Gangnam set. The chicken is really juicy and tender, but other items are actually too sweet that you hardly taste the meat and get sick of the sweetness really quickly. The soup and hot tea are not hot at all. Portion size is ample and can easily be for double the amount of guests they recomend. Among all the staff, only one of them is attentive and friendly. We ordered the honey toast which we waited for over 15 minutes and thought it would never be served. We also got the free deep fried banana for making this rate. I believe this is how they got all the reviews and good ratings because you have to show them the rate to get the free dessert!
In conclusion, Gangnam is an up coming trendy restaurant with modern/urban feeling if that is what you are into, but as far as Korean food, I would rather spend my money at many other great selections around the city.

I was recommended to check this place out by a Korean friend, and am glad I did.

A large selection of things to BBQ at your table and for the newbie, they had set meals with suggestions.
Recommended that you get a reservation, it was quite busy while I was there.

 Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas!
Great food and they have macaroons if you check in. It's a bit pricey but definitely worth the money.

Got the meat lovers for 4 people which was more than enough to feed the 5 of us. Food was great. Especially the marinated meats. Service was on point as well. My only complaint is that I wish they didn't server such small portions of side dishes at a time for a table of 5, which made it annoying constantly having to ask for more.
Amazing place for Korean bbq! Everything is fresh, great service, and fun experience. Will definitely be coming back.

This place was awesome! Very nice and clean, I like music and videos playing on the wall. The employees were super friendly and welcoming! The food was delicious, my husband and I ordered the Meat Lover dish for 2. It was a good amount of food. Will definitely be returning

PRO: trendy, clean, excellent quality, bulgogi, bibimbap, udon.
CON: no appetizer with meal (typical for Korean)

This place is really close to the airport. Customer service is amazing the food was tasty and the meat was of a fine cut. I will definitely come back again. If you order the four-person combo that's good enough for six people if not a little bit more.

My girlfreind and I came in here after searching on google for korean bbq place near the strip and we found this place. We are from la and we have gyu-kaku which is very similar to this place. The parking is very convinient and easy to fins. The food was delicious. We ordered chicken karrage which was actually better than gyu-kaku so thats a huge plus! The harami miso melts in the mouth so that's another plus! The service was quick and everyone here has a smile on their face. 5 stars hands down. Definitely a place to check out if your craving korean/japaneese style food. 

Tip to the owner: advertise on the strip and you will get way more customers, because this place is awesome!! 

Food: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars

Good food! Great happy hour. Glad we decided to try something new in Vegas. Awesome food! That is very unique and delicious. They offer tasty Korean side dishes that will definitely fill you up. Have there green apple soju ... Sooooo 1207 E Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89104

Food was okay, service was okay. I asked for happy hour menu 15mins before it starts and ordered items on happy hour 10 mins before happy hour. They didn't told me to wait until it's happy hour so I was charged regular prices. I mean it's my fault but server could told me to wait as she saw I'm reading the happy hour menu not the regular one.
food is not the best taste hence the 2 stars. service is nice and a place is nice. good luck

This restaurant has a chill ambiance with good music. They have a nice happy hour prices. Affordable cheese wontons, mmmmm.  I think the meat could be more flavorful but the additional sauces complemented them well enough. Sides were good but the kimchee was a little too strong for me. Spicy tuna kimbap was booomb, though, get it.

The Las Vegas combo dinner menu was great.  They allowed to switch shrimp iyem to Kalbi, so we tasted the kalbi which is supposed to be on more expensive Kangnam dinner combo.  The presentation of food was very unique compare to other Korean BBQ house, but i could see they were well thought of. Thr service was great and waitress always come by whenever i needed something.

Would definitely recommend to others! The service was good and the price was so reasonable for the amount of food we received. When in Vegas, I'm definitely coming back again. (We had and would recommend the Meat Lovers Set)
Bibimbap is the BOMB! It's a must to try it. For desert you should try their mango macaron ice cream. Love this place
Great food, fresh meat and the marinades were great. Orders the Gangnam feast and the appetizers were well balanced. Friendly and fast service.

Fun atmosphere. Break from the norm. Excellent service, and good happy hour specials. The food was great. Salmon Jalape√±o poppers were the best. Toward the end of the meal our server disappeared. Seemed like they were prepping for dinner. Had to go search for someone to get service, so I dropped it to a 4 star review. Otherwise it was great.

I can see why this place has so many good reviews! Food was great, service was great! You get to cook your own meat with the grill. We got the pork belly, basil chicken and a variety of other meats and veggies. The steamed egg was huge! And so good! I would definitely come back here again.

We order the premium cut and
Food is great ,meat is excellent 
And bibinbom is excellent 
I will come again.

Second time returns
Even Better than last time !!!

Meat are top grade and tasty !!!
