The service is really great! Great for late night groups to have a few drinks and good Asian BBQ.  The price is very reasonable. You can come dressed up on a date or totally casual. I recommend this place for people that wanna have a nice chill spot to eat good Asian BBQ.
The best KBBQ in Vegas~~~!!! Most def a must come when in the need for some Korean food~~~! Will def come again!!!
Food was quite good, about as good as you're likely to get in Vegas (we're still behind L.A. by a long shot)  Prices were fair for the quality served.  Would return if in the area.
Great food.  Got meat lover dinner for 2 and it was more than enough.  Service was great.  Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.
My girlfriend and I tried this place for the first time and it was great! Prices were not so bad and a lot to choose from. Good quality kbbq. Highly recommended!

Everything was delicious! I had the Korean Prime and it was soooo tender and flavorful! I also had the prime Kalbi and it was also yummy. For dessert, I went with the green tea mochi and it was simple perfection. I would totally come back to this place again!

Came in with no reservation but still got sitted down right away on a Saturday night. The athmosphere is great. Really clean, there's music, but not too loud, just right.

The menu is extensive and it's a la carte  style. The prices are worth it. The meat is very high quality compared to some of the all you can eat kbbq  places.
There's also a drink and spirits menu.

I recommend the marinated kalbi  steak, it's very tender and juicy. Also, try the bacon  wrapped sparagus, it's crunchy and crispy at the same time.

Very appropriate place for a date or a group gathering. Not recommended if you're single haha

The service was great, atleast 5 people came by multiple times to make sure that we were properly serviced. The staff was also friendly and easy to talk to and they explain the menu.

Visiting Las Vegas from Philly. Delightfully surprised to find an awesome korean bbq place. We had the kalbi, bulgolgi, spicy pork and filet. All of which was excellent. Decor and staff are 5 star worthy as well. Will definitely be back next time we come to vegas.
This place is pricey but amazing. I was blown away by the food and the service is fast. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas.
The service was great and the food was incredible! Our favorite was the filet mignon and the Galbi and they were both very tender and flavorful :)
We got the combo for 4, it was a lot of variety and everything was well flavoured. Definitely worth a visit :)
First time really enjoyed it. The waiter was really helpful. All the food we tired was very tasty.

dont go here , the server literally chased us down for a tip!!! mind you that the service was so bad, we literally had to raise our hand to get the servers attention and it took so long to get our change back. when we got our change and left one of the server came out and ask if  their service was great i replied with a no then he says if it was bad let us know bc i did not see any tip on the table how fucking rude then he goes back in and gives me a side eye. im so livid!!!

Their lunch set is an absolute steal.

For about 10 bucks you get a whole bunch of side dishes and high quality food. They'll even grill the meat for you in the kitchen! Which is nice when I don't want to go back to work smelling like grilled fat (lovely though that smell is).

Unlike other set lunches, every dish has a lot of attention paid to it. Even the little salad they give you is well constructed and tasty. Super recommended.

So 4th time here and still coming back :)


Okay yelpers here's my review. We ordered the following:

1. Harami miso
2. Korean prime Kalbi 
3. Prime Kalbi
4. Kobe Ssam (Uni dish)
5. Uni Bibimbap
6. Spicy soft tofu soup
7. Side of white rice 

Total bill came out to $78.52 for 2 of us before tax  so $90ish after 15% tip. 

I would say the food was 3/4 Korean and 1/4 Japanese style bbq. Korean sides are free and unlimited and if u "volunteer" writing a yelp review u get a free dessert  not the reason I am writing one but hey free is free...

Overall value & price I would say 4.5 out of 5 but with the good customer service it bumps to a 5! Would come back here next time I'm in town! :)


Update:
Came back a 2nd time in 3 days and got the bulgolgi beef bowl to go! :)
best after E.D.C place to go 2 , to get all the energys back.  infinite P.L.U.R.,.,,..,.,.,   good service.  Friendly enviroment.  Most of all GREAT FOOD.  .
Awesome place. Friendly and quick service. Felt like a romantic setting, cooking with my date. Would come in any night, if I lived close by. All food is fresh .
Really nice place in Vegas! Love their food! Best Korean BBQ in Vegas! Waiting time is not too long for Sunday night . It's about 20min! It's about 8 min away from the Main Street!
The service is nice.   Food is average.  A bit surprised with the amazing reviews. We ordered all 3 recommended meats but only 1 out of 3 were tender.

This is such an addicting place. 

I looooove going here, especially for lunch. They have really good deals! I'm one of those girls who can't really eat A LOT so this is the place to go. It's pretty cheap for a la carte especially since I don't eat that much. Their meat is really good quality. Comparing it to other AYCE bbq places is definitely not even close. 

The week that I found out about this place, I went like 4 times again after that. I wanted to bring everyone to it and show them how good it is! I feel like it's definitely hidden, but it's right next to UNLV so it's convenient when I don't know what to eat, I usually suggest here for a quick lunch.

Meat I always order: Bulgolgi, Beef toro, Brisket, and Bacon wrapped Salmon.
I always get their steamed egg too. BEST steamed egg I've ever had in my life!

Their three different sauces are to die for and they're great! They also give you lemon for your beef tongue! Really tasty!

The lunch special comes with rice, miso soup, and salad. The salad is huge! And it's reasonably priced at lunch, so do try to come in for lunch!

Their desserts are SO good too! We've had the green tea and vanilla ice cream. Their sundae's come with little pocky sticks too! MM What a great idea!!!

I definitely recommend this place if you're trying to find some prime meat!

Service is AMAZING. The staff are so friendly and accommodating. 
Most definitely a 5 star place.

One of my greatest experience in Las Vegas. Everyone from the waiter to the guy bringing out the food was friendly. The food was awesome. I also got a free macron ice cream for checking in so that was a plus.
The meats are really tender, great sides. Overall great experience. Nice, clean place

Great food and very pleasant ambience. Top notch service and tasty food. If you are looking for delicious food and nice place to hangout, gagnams is your bet. And they have this offer of free desserts. Cool.
Great Korean BBQ place! Got one Gangnam special and it was awesome! Definitely hit the spot.

Great place for KBBQ, I get hungry thinking about it. I don't even live in Vegas and I have a ton of checkins here. That's got to say something! Every time I travel to LV, I come to this place. Happy hour rocks! 50% off! I had Bulgogi, Beef Toro, pork belly, and chicken karaage. The bacon wrapped asparagus is excellent too. It was accompanied by the kimchi apps. I also had a ginger soju cocktail for $3.75. Love it. They are very busy so be patient and kind, you'll get the best service. 

Great place to have what your heart desires, Gangnam brings the best of Japanese soups, pork Toro, and sausages with Korean BBQ, bibimbap, and Chigae. If you don't know those words, you have to try it. Order 4 BBQ items and get the complimentary side dishes. Also, to complete the fabulous fare, order soju with lemon or yuzu chum charum. Free dessert if you rate them on Yelp. :)

Seating is super hard, bring a cushion. They played too much hip hop and not enough KPop.
great quality. awesome service. only downside is not all you can eat but good enough.

This is the go-to KBBQ place when you're in Vegas. We came in the afternoon around 2pm and didn't have to wait at all, there wasn't a lunch rush or anything on a Saturday! And we had a group of 9. The sides were all really good. I liked how the kimchi was fermented and the bean sprouts, fish cake, potato salad were all nicely seasoned and tasted good! The meats came out fairly quick, and were great. I do think they should've changed the grill throughout cause both of our grills were pretty charred halfway through eating. We asked for some rice and sauces, here and there but didn't get some stuff. I think the servers might've been too busy or forgot. They also have a check-in deal on yelp for a free ice cream macaroon.

So Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining has been opened for awhile, but I only just noticed it very recently.  It is a Japanese and Korean DIY BBQ restaurant, where you can order items a la carte or from one of their many preset combinations.  It is a similar concept to Yagu (on the West side) and many other J or KBBQ restaurants in California.

Based on reading the past reviews (very helpful in convincing me to drive to this side of town for just a meal and go then back) and the photos posted for this business and comparing it to my first hand experience here, I can deduced that the restaurant has experimented with various promotions before settling on their current all day Happy Hour promotion.  Gone are their lunch special menu or previous versions of their HH menu.  Now you get 1/2 off selected beverage items and discounted menu items.

The food I was served was good and tasted even better when cooked properly and to the exact doneness that I want.  And since it was not AYCE, I did not felt subconsciously compelled to overindulge during the meal with the final destination dangerously close to meat coma station.  Price was reasonable, not cheap when you add everything up, but you get good quality for the price.

The server was very friendly and helpful, as was the owner or the restaurant manager/model (yeah, she definitely exudes the essence of Gangnam style). The restaurant itself looks very nice (posh with well executed design and decoration).

Suggested party size for dining here is up to 4 per table, as you have to share the grill built into the table.  Don't wear anything that you don't want smelling like it was generously sprayed with the delicious smell of sweet BBQ smoke after you leave or have a change of cloth for going back to work. Best time to come is after work so you can take advantage of their HH drink specials without having to feel like an alcoholic for the 2nd part of your work day.

Bulgogi, Korean Prime Short Rib and the Kurobuta (Japanese Pork) Sausage was what I ordered to be grilled and is what I would recommend to others trying out this restaurant.  No free banchan here, but you can order their Kimchee and Pickles (both are $0.00) to compliment your meal.

Solid 4 stars experience based on the service, food, atmosphere and price to value.

Cool spot to hit up when you're feenin' for some asian BBQ. Trendy and inviting local restaurant in a strip mall. Beware of parking as it always seems jam packed. 

The food was reasonably priced. We got the gangnam special for $65 for two people. Well worth the money if you're going to eat everything. I do mean everything. Otherwise I would have ordered a la carte. All the meat was seasoned and marinated very well that you didn't really need the additional bbq sauce that they offered. We also ordered the steamed chili dumplings..... Don't get those. It's a big dose of spicy sauce with otherwise bland flavors. 

We'd definitely come back only if we felt like splurging. After dessert, drinks and taxes, $90+ is a bit more than we'd like for a quick casual meal.

Really enjoyed the experience here. This was my first time at an establishment like this and it was a blast! We got to choose our meats to cook on the grill. Everything has its own flavor and tasted good! We also had garlic edamame and fried rice which were both outstanding. The service was on point! Everyone was very helpful and checked on us often.
Tremendous VFM amazing food and friendly staff along with your favorite K Pop videos.

wonderful dining experience. if you like Korean BBQ you will really be impressed by this place. The four of us ordered the Gangnam special for four and it was enough food for 6 people. the meat was fresh and a the marinade delicious. the side salads were very good especially the cucumber and cabage kimchis. bulgogi rice rocked!

We came in around 7pm on a Friday night and was told the wait would be 40 minutes or so. It's too late to go to another place anyways so we decided to wait. They have a nice waiting area with big screen playing music videos so it's not too bad. 
After 40 minutes or maybe a little longer we were seated and offered menu. However it took them a really long time to come back to take our order. People who were seated after us got their orders taken way before ours. That was strike #1. 
Finally the server came take our order and we opted for the Gangnam set thinking it probably has the most popular items. Since we had more than two people we ordered a chicken fried rice thinking it should be enough food. It took the server a long time to bring us the banchan and water. Nothing special about the banchan and it was a little disappointing from a non-ayce place.

Chicken fried rice arrived first before any other starter items. Which was okay because I was really hungry so any food that came to the table was welcomed. Fried rice was hot with huge chunks of chicken and nice separated grains.

The starters all tasted quite decent. Oyster was fresh and sweet. HOWEVER! Now that I went back to look at menu writing this review I realized they didn't give us the fried calamari! (I was going to give this place 2 stars but now it's down to 1) 

We chose bulgogi bibimbap instead of white rice and Korean prime kalbi instead of the kalbi. The bibimbap was nice and hot. We started to grill our first item which was the filet mignon. Right when I was about to dip that into the sauce I found out the server didn't give us any sauce. At first I thought this place doesn't offer sauce but then it's kind of impossible because all kbbq places I've been to have some kind of sauce or at least salt? Then we looked around and saw sauce plates on every single table but ours. Then we had to track down the busy waiter before we could proceed to eat our meal. Strike #2. 

Halfway through the meal the server came to take away some empty meat plates and my sister's bowl that she was eating her fried rice and bibimbap with. I looked at the server in disbelief because she was still eating her meal. Not only was the service slow the entire night but when they chose to be attentive they did it the wrong way. Since the server's too hard to track down now my sister had to eat her meal with no bowl. Strike #3. 

The nice thing about this place is that we can do yelp check-in and get free macaroon ice cream sandwich for dessert. We got coffee, strawberry, and mango and they just tasted like any macaroon ice cream sandwich at most ayce kbbq places.
The quality of the meat here is not better than other ayce places and that's a big disappointment from the great reviews they have. 

I think this place is really lacking in service here. I felt that the kitchen was working very hard and able to provide nice fried rice in a timely manner so they're doing their job right. If they can better train their server I believe they can reduce the wait time significantly.

My boyfriend and I always look for Korean BBQ when we go out of town since we don't have many options back home. This popped up on my radar with all the many good reviews so we decided to check it out. We decided to get the premium menu for two which included all of the higher cuts of meats and side dishes. Let me just say the food was never ending it seemed! It was delicious and we managed to finish a good portion of all the food we got (which was A LOT!) Service was fast and friendly. Definitely would come back next time we are in the area!

We weren't sure what to expect coming in here as we had never been here before or to a restaurant like it. We ordered the meat lovers for two of us and the amount of food was absolutely unbelievable! The quality of the food was excellent! Also, the service was excellent never letting our drinks get hi also, the service was exceptional, never letting our drinks get empty.  We will definitely be back!
A bit expensive, but will come back. The meat is fresh, and theres is a lot of choices
One of the best Korean BBQ places I've ever been to, with great customer services! All the workers are extremely friendly, and the food is bomb!

Great Korean food, fast service and friendly staff. Excellent value, but no reservations accepted. 

The spicy tuna roll, tteokbokki and bugogi were my favorite.

good service?nice smell.We came on Wednesday night, it was not too busy so we got our table right away. The service is good, food is awesome. We ordered comb for two but it's good enough for 3 people actually. Anyway, highly recommend !

$45.95 for 2people BBQ.  Las Vegas 
Not worth the money.    
Better go buffet in Vegas next time

Once again, Yelp! provided an awesome assist in finding somewhere to eat that would satisfy our cravings. Las Vegas is ever changing; the Korean eatery we used to patronize seemed to lose its luster in service & food quality. Having confidence in our Yelp!ers, I went with this place.

Food = yum! Portions = great! Service = on point.  Restrooms = clean. Parking = free.

Only concern? Our grill kept flaring up & scaring not only is, but the neighboring patrons as well. We laughed it off--nervously--and the wait staff quickly came to our aid. They had to change/fix our grill three times! 

In the end, we would come back again. We know we just experienced a glitch and was glad no one was hurt.

Awesome Korean BBQ! Service was great and the food was delicious! Nice atmosphere, and over all a great place! They give a free dessert if you write a review! 
Only down side is the wait was quite long on a Thursday night at 7pm, but that's cause it's so good I guess! Come early...!

Love this place.  It's great for a group of 4 to 6 people.  You get to cook your own food over a grill on your table.  Its a great part of the conversation.  Also, the food is very reasonably priced.  Few places in Vegas can match the overall value.

I am a picky eater, so a lot of the stuff isn't for me, but luckily they give you so much I can find a lot to fill me up.

Let me start by saying that I don't like Korean barbecue. In fact, I don't like Korean food, other than the occasional tofu house--and by occasional, I mean once a year. But this place swept me off my feet. 

We, a party of six, arrived before the restaurant opened at 11:30 a.m. and waited outside for the doors to open. As we stepped in, someone started to set our table with all the side dishes; as soon as we were seated, we started nibbling. These were high-quality side dishes, from the fishcake slices to the kimchi. There was also macaroni salad, pickled cucumbers, etc. All of these items are "refillable" upon request.

While the menu includes weekday lunch specials and meal sets (four different options for parties of 2 or 6), we opted to order a la carte so we could get each item we wanted:
-Kobe beef carpaccio ($9.95): So good! Thin slices of meat heaven, really. There was enough for each of us to have 2-3 pieces, too, so definitely a generous serving.
-Spicy tuna kimbap ($6.95): Kind of like a spicy tuna with crispy rice roll that you'd find at some Izakayas, but the rice is rolled up in seaweed, and the tuna is poke-style. You get the soft fish and the crunchy rice with a light sriracha mayo flavor--comes together very nicely. It's four rolls, but we managed to share between six of us. 
-Tteokbokki ($4.95): Consisting of soft rice cake, fishcake (same as the side dish), and hot sauce, this dish took me by surprise. It looks like a simple bowl of rice cakes, but is full of flavor, not awfully spicy. Make sure that you get a fishcake slice with the rice roll to get all the flavors together. A good, cheaper option for something that's a bit more filling.
-Spicy ramen egg ($6.95): I was skeptical, but boy was I proved wrong! This was one of the most enjoyable bowls of ramen I've had, even though it really was just ramen, egg, some greens, and spice. Like the tteokbokki, it's simple, but so good for the soul and for the tummy. You can opt for the Japanese sausage/ seafood options for additional cost.
-Bibim nangmyun ($11.95): Spicy cold thin noodles. This was my least preferred of all the dishes, but even then, I'd give it a 4/5. Nothing bad about it, just that it's not as savory as it looks, though you can add whatever sauces you want. I'd recommend mixing in some of the spicy fishcake side dish for additional flavor. 
-Original bibimbap ($12.95): Our server helped us mix everything together and even dished it out to each of us. Best bibimbap I've had, hands down. Flavorful, filling, and "healthy" (because of all the veggies in it, of course).
-Beef toro ( 2x$4.95), beef tongue (2x$8.95), flat iron garlic ($8.95), Korean prime kalbi ($8.95): I couldn't really tell the difference between any of them, but it doesn't matter, because they were all so delicious. For the meats that aren't already marinated, definitely use the three sauces provided to you--in fact, I recommend dipping the same piece of meat into all three sauces to get a slightly sweet/ tangy, and definitely spicy kick to your otherwise unflavored meat. 

All of this cost only $125--including tax and gratuity! All six of us were extremely stuffed and very happy. Oh, AND with Yelp check-in, we each got a free macaron for dessert... Maybe not the best life choice, but who can turn down a free dessert?
Fast service!! Friendly staff! We had a really great time and will be back. We got the meat lovers for two which was more than enough food for 4 with a few extra sides
Yummy! Las Vegas plenty for 2. Meat and sides were delish! Free mochi when you check in on yelp.

We went here to celebrate a friend's bday. There was 8 people(4 couples) and they definitely accommodated us from corner dining, food options and table settings. Food was great and worth the group package deal. The service was fast as well. It was definitely a great experience.
Best I've had in town. Been to two other places in the Vegas Valley and this is the best one. I've eaten Korean BBQ in Korea and Yakiniku in Japan so I might know a little
Awesome BBQ place. The food is amazing. We tried the Gangnam combo plate, with nice variety of plates including oysters. When you come to LV must try this place.

I'm really sad I haven't been to this place before! After years of going to UNLV, I've always been going to west side to satisfy my cravings for Asian cuisine.
My group of friends usually like to go to AYCE KBBQ so this was definitely a nice place that gave more quality than quantity.
I'll definitely be back to try their other choices of meats.

My stomach and soul could not be more satisfied after eating here. These guys are friendly, helpful in explaining the menu and fast! You are getting amazing value for the quality and quantity of food you're getting here.

After a long day at the pool, day club, and shopping, we were hungry. Gangnam Asian BBQ has amazing Yelp reviews and it seemed like a safe choice for dinner. We arrived ~5pm, still in time to enjoy the Happy Hour specials.

We got:
-2 orders of Beef Toro $4x2
-Pork Belly: $4
-Cream Cheese Wonton: $3
-Sweet Corn: $2
-Chicken Karaage: $4
-Jalapeno Poppers: $4
-Prime Kalbi: $8.95
-Strawberry Macaron Ice cream sandwich: Free with Yelp Check in

The entire feast for two was only ~$40 and it was very good.

If I were to go again, I would skip the Chicken Karaage and the Cream Cheese Wonton and it would still be plenty of food for us. The set-up is more Korean than Japanese but the sauces were more yakiniku style. If you're looking for authenticity, this is not the place. However, if you're looking for good food at a great price point, head on over.

Visited here while we were in Las Vegas from Boston , was really impressed with food and service! The bbq is Gyu-gaku style but more korean flavored.  The portion is huge and side dishes keep on coming!  Service was prompt and friendly. Really glad we got to find a great bbq place in vegas!

This place offers a good lunch special for Korean BBQ at a fair price for what you pay for (9.95 or 12.95). They come with the traditional side dishes and 3 dipping sauces. It is well ventilated, not as smokey as other places. It is located close to the UNLV campus next to Undefeated and a sushi place. The service was prompt, since no one was here at this place on a Tuesday around 1.

Awesome place! Super friendly staff and very fair happy hour price! Come before 6 pm. A great difference from all the fatty food around. Food was delicious and in big portions. I used the happy hour menu and was even able to take some home for lunch tomorrow. When I'm back in the area I'll come again.

Been coming to gangnam for a few months now. Have had a great experience every time so I thought id leave a review. The meats are amazing and the vegetables are tasty too. It doesn't take a lot of money to get filled up so don't worry that's its not a all you can eat restaurant. My favorite is mixing the white rice with the egg custard and putting a little kimchi on top before I add my meat on yop. Also don't forget to check in so you get your free ice cream. The best flavor is vanilla. Trust me

Definitely not as good as Korean BBQ in LA....... But in Las Vegas this will have to do. 

It's A La Carte as opposed to AYCE but the meats are quite yummy. 

Get their spicy pork and Pork Belly. You'll thank me. 


JY
Best Asian bbq in Las Vegas.we been here many time.our family is very happy with the food and service

As usual I discovered this place on the go. Didn't read any reviews but I was looking for some ethnic food and saw the sign. 
When I pulled up it wasn't quite open for lunch but the people waiting outside said it was well worth the few minute wait for the doors to open.  
Once inside, the decor was traditional for Asian cuisine. There was also a projection screen playing a combination of Asian and American pop videos which was pretty amusing.  
There was a variety of menus options which was typical for Korean BBQ.  So if you've ever been to one of these places, the food is as good as you cook it.  I was surprised by the edamame...a buttery garlic delight. The green tea cheese cake was much better than expected. 
The bottom line is that this place is pretty good and I would definitely come here again when in the mood for #cookedbyme cuisine.
Omgggg you get a free dessert if you review on Yelp! I came with my family for my dad's birthday because of the thousands of reviews. This free dessert promotion is probably why they have so many lol
Best place to eat korean bbq. Price is reasonable, servers r reallly nice. I am very happy that i had lunch here. Good place to bring girl,family.

Long wait but worth it, good food!

Not very big place so make sure you make reservations or be prepared to wait a bit.

We contemplated between going a la carte vs one of the preset combos, ultimately combos are much better value.

You won't be disappointed!

This place has 4.5 stars from 700+ reviews and it doesn't disappoint! The service is friendly and fast. The restaurant is clean and inviting with fun pop music playing in the background but most importantly the food is SO GOOD!

I highly recommend the Korean Kalbi - for $9 you get a generous portion of high quality, thickly sliced and deliciously seasoned meat. It was so good my girlfriend and I immediately ordered a second plate once we were done. The shishito peppers and mushroom medley were also amazing. Hell, everything we ordered was fresh and delicious and tasted amazing off the grill. Heck even the rice was really good and I'm
Picky about rice so that's saying something.

We also ordered a bottle of soju to share (Jinro Chamisul) and it was the perfect drink to go with the meal.

My only complaint is that they do charge you for the sesame oil which is usually free in most korean BBQ places. But for the amazing prize, potions and quality of food who is complaining?

I would fly back to Vegas just to eat here ;) this place definitely was a huge highlight of my Vegas trip.
A bit pricy for what you get. The quality of food is only average. The service is great. Definitely far from authentic korean BBQ though. Overall I was disappointed.

First time there (about a week ago). It was sooooo good! There was 7 of us. Bf and I got the Meat Lovers, 2 other friends got the Las Vegas, 2 others got the Gangnam, and 1 friend just ordered apps. I loved the Meat Lovers! Seems pricey but you get sooo much meat! The Las Vegas has chicken if you're not so much into meat. And the Gangnam has fresh oysters, although our friends opted to exchange the oysters for something else. Either option you choose, you get a lot of food. It's super fun to cook and eat while chatting. Everyone was full and happy at the end. The macaroon ice cream is delicious! I recommend it. It's the perfect size dessert after stuffing your face lol If they still have it, check in  and you get one free! (the macaroon).
Great food, great service! We came to Vegas tonight and this was our first stop. We'd definitely recommend this in the future! Tip: the bacon wrapped salmon is amazing!
Clean. I admit they got the best kimchi soup. But the quality of the meat wasn't all that best.

Great Korean and Japanese style BBQ!! Meat and tofu soup are awesome!! :) We ordered Gangnam course, calamari, beef tongue, zucchini, onions, all good! Must try in Las Vegas!!



?????????:)

This Korean spot is average. Their banchan is okay. Only liked half of them. Other half was bland. This place is cheap for what they give you. The meats are really good. We got the Gangnam set and you are able to substitute dishes that you don't want so that's a plus. For the amount of food we got, $65 isn't much. If we ordered them al carte, then it probably would've been even cheaper but we were really lazy and hungry. 

The service was attentive. 5/5

The reason why I'm deducting a star is because the seats is far from the table making it uncomfortable while eating. Also it's super hot! Been to maybe Korean bbq spots were it was cool and refreshing to eat. Also maybe the music. I like the music but not what you really want to listen to while eating.

Probably won't come back. Nice spot to get full though.
Really nice restaurant. Outstanding food for a really good price. Good size portions. Great presentation, and great service! Will definitely add to our list of spots to hit while in Vegas.
Love this place... Big portions and the food was amazing!
My very first meal in Vegas. We got a table full of dishes and all was very tasty and authentic. Worth the money!

as a korean, i hold very high standards for what authentic korean bbq tastes like. i typically complain any place i go but by far one of the only restaurants that i feel came close to what mom's bbq tastes like. got a macaron ice cream that was a perfect finish to our meal.
Best Korean bbq on Vegas!! I've had the other places in Vegas, but this place has the best quality meat.

First time dining here thanks to awesome Yelp reviews! Service was amazing and so was the food. My picky 3 years old ate everything I gave her and more. We ordered the Gangnam and everything came out super fast and the meat tasted tender and juicy. Will definitely be back!
Good food. Nice restaurant. Delicious spicy pork. I personally don't like Gimchi shigai but everything else is good
